review_body: Room 304. I'll get right to the issue I had: the water in the shower and the sink (both Hot and Cold) became scaldingly Hot. I was taking a shower and everything was fine but then the water became too hot. I tried to adjust it but it didn't become cool or cold. Just very hot. And I mean dangerously hot. Ok. Not great but I was able to sponge off the soap and figured I could wash my hair in the sink. Nope. The water coming out of the faucet was also only Hot. No cold. I called Front Desk from the hotel phone. Got connected to an operator named "Maria". She said an engineer would be up shortly. Called at 8AM and by 8:30AM, no one had come. So I dressed and went to check out. Front Desk person really didn't seem to take me seriously. Offered zero compensation. But he did say "Have a nice day." Very frustrating.

This hotel was a perfect fit for our recent visit. It was within walking distance to Times Square and Subway/Metro stations that allowed us to maximize our sightseeing. Hotel staff were always willing to assist with any questions/concerns. Breakfast offered a nice variety but I would advise going early as there isn't a large seating area for the number of guests staying in the hotel.

Great location, you can walk to time square in 5 mins, MSG in 10 mins and there is a subway nearby for anything else.Down side is that sheets were grubby and tatty and curtains wouldn't shut due to air con being in the way.

Cons- Lifts were slow. Breakfast choices were minimal. Rooms are not sound proof so you easily get woken up to the sounds of traffic. Pros- Good location for the hotel and fair price for the stay. Lovely rooms. Comfortable beds. I would consider staying here again in the future.

Pros - Location location location - Clean Rooms- Friendly staff Cons- 2 lifts 1 which wasn’t working, there were really long wait time for lifts - fine if on lower floors can use the stairs - Breakfast was so busy and overcrowded, mediocre food. - Average sleep, first night our alarm went off at 6am (i’m sure this was an accident) second night some random guy banging on our door for 10 minutes at 4am (again not hotels fault) Overall great location would be the main reason to stay here!

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights late February for our honeymoon. The location of the hotel is ideal. 9th Avenue next to it can look pretty run down but the places to eat around there are great! We ate in the Westway and also Hudson's Bar and Grill. Would recommend both of these, especially Hudsons. We also had take away from the Lincoln Deli on the corner and it was amazing. Just disappointed we chose this on our last afternoon. The breakfast is not extensive but is good enough to get you set up for the day. I had bagels with Philadelphia or peanut butter and jam most days. My husband opted for the eggs and sausages. I was really disappointed that there was no bacon available the whole time we were there. The coffee is really nice too and is available all day which is perfect for when you get back from a long day. It is actually nicer than Starbucks!We had issues with our room due to water coming into the bathroom from the room above. Also on check in they asked us if we wanted our room cleaned every day or would we prefer a late checkout instead. We opted for the late check out and just had to ask at Reception to get our bins emptied and towels changed. We had to chase things up with Reception a few times and it looks like they either don't communicate with maintenance and housekeeping or maintenance and housekeeping don't listen. The room we had was absolutely fine and while it was small it was still ideal for what we needed. A bath would have been a bonus after a long day out walking. We had paid for a city view but the view we got was looking at the building across the road. No city view at all. I will take this up separately with hotel.com. Also the noise from outside can be quite bad especially with fire engines and police cars. I asked at reception for ear plugs and they were able to provide me with them. Not the hotels fault at all, just the area it is in.All in all if you are looking for a place to crash while you visit NY and don't want to spend a lot of money I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Highly Recommend! Lobby personnel greeted us every time we arrived and left. Very friendly and helpful. Issues were IMMEDIATELY addressed. Would stay again! The 24 hour coffee was very much appreciated since it was very cold in February. It was fresh and well kept!

Great location, ridiculously friendly staff, amazing breakfast, big room for NYC (small for elsewhere but perfect in NYC). Compared to some "4 star or 5 star" hotels I've stayed in while in NYC this one has my vote. I will stay again for sure. Oh... and the cookies... mmmmmm

By chance I received a handicap-accessible room, one of the largest I've had in years in New York. It was clean and very quiet. The front desk staff seemed especially friendly. I had business at the Javits Center and this location made it a mere 10-minute walk.

My stay at this hotel was outstanding.The staff were very accommodating and obviously worked very hard.The location is excellent no matter where in Manhattan you want to go.Very Central. Couldn't recommend this hotel more!

This hotel is located within a six block radius of Times Square, Penn Station and the Port Authority and many restaurants. It is clean, well maintained and by NYC standards, the rooms are large. The staff is very helpful and available 24 hrs. The breakfast is a typical Hampton Inn breakfast (complete) and is well serviced. From our perspective, the hotel was a great bargain at a prime location.

We were able to see soo much on the city by staying here and doing some walking. Personnel very helpful in regards to places we wanted to see. Many sites were within walking distane for our family. We were dropped off at hotel and picked up as needed,

Had 5 rooms booked for my daughters 18th birthday. We traveled up from florida. We arrived at 11am rooms werent ready til 9pm. Staff was so rude. Wasted a whole day waiting for our rooms and all they say is....I understand that your upset but it's out of our hands. do your job and get people in their rooms. I will never stay here again

There was a little bit problem but total service and room condition were nice! Smell from a heater was bad and the elevators came so late... but all staffs are so kind and super nice!! The location was pretty good.

I used about every single amenity and benefit on this stay....fitness center, business center, Internet, fridge, microwave, free breakfast, apple from fruit bowl, 24/7 coffee and tea, lobby restrooms, room service delivery, free snacks/water (Diamond member benefit), electrical outlets, free tube of toothpaste (forgot to bring), along with all the other usual things. Everything was clean and THERE when I needed it. Everything worked. ALL staff encountered were nice and proactively helpful. From entrance to exit, no detail was missed, and all was perfectly smooth. Having worked 8 years in hotels, I know this kind of smooth perfection doesn’t happen by accident. Kudos to the management and staff of the hotel for creating the perfect HAMPTON INN experience. You nailed it!

Had an amazing stay! Gave it 4 only because the size of the rooms was a little small. Everything else was perfect about my stay. Location was within walking distance of most times square attractions and subway station to get outside of time square.

Great price, great location, great staff, free hot drinks 24hrs a day. The room we was fine with little noise, which we were grateful for being in times square. AMAZING SHOWER. Comfy beds. Room was a little small for two people, but it's fine as you don't spend much time in your room when you're in NY. The hotel is massive and with only 2 lifts which was a little annoying but being in NY you don't spend too much time at the hotel so wasnt an issue. The big issue for me was after agreeing to the go green policy at check in, (no housekeeping for duration of stay and you get a late check out as a reward, which I thought was great, as I'm all for the environment and late check outs) I was gobsmacked when it was evident that there was no go green policy whatsoever at breakfast. Paper plates which are not reusable, single use plastic knives and folks, single use coffee cups, is it too much to ask when I'm paying for breakfast to have a normal plate, knife and folk so I can cut my waffle? The breakfast itself was poor to say the least, but giving the cost of our stay I honestly cant complain, I simply grabbed a coffee and bagel and left. If you're looking for a cheap stay in NY, if you need somewhere simply to sleep as you will be out all day and night, and don't mind going elsewhere for breakfast, Hampton inn is your hotel. But if you're environmentally conscious, maybe don't stay here.

The stay was nice. I felt welcome. The room was nice. The only problem was the breakfast room. There was no seating for all guests and they did not have all foods available. No meats Saturday morning. Icemaker on the 25th floor did not work.

Rm 3204 Clean and in good repair. Above the traffic noises. Great view-Empire State Building and cityscape. Professional, friendly, very helpful staff. Concierge service arranged my airport transportation. Front desk recommendations for restaurants were spot on. Will stay again.

I stayed at this hotel to celebrate my mother’s birthday. At first, I was very pleased with this hotel and the staff, until i checked out. The day of check out I had 4 pending charges on my credit card: $60.00, $172.12, $126.88, and $126.88. When I went to check out I asked the front desk about these charges and she stated they will all be removed and I will only be charged for the night of $126.88. Days later I check my statement and I have been charged $126.88 PLUS $172.12. I called numerous times to the hotel and left voice messages until I finally got ahold of someone. They said that they will check and contact me back. I received an email stating that the safe (which i NEVER used or touched) was “broken” and that is why I am being charged the extra $172. I had to follow up multiple times before getting an answer. Both managers Wilmer and David were extremely dismissive, told me there was nothing they could do, will not return my money and to contact another hotline. I was extremely upset and frustrated that a reputable hotel can have the audacity to LIE, CHEAT, and steal (my money).STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!

Went in January with my family. 3 thumbs up & 3 thumbs down:GOOD:1) Location, Location, Location. The hotel is just 4 blocks from Times square. The location is perfect (close enough to be there in just 2 minutes but far enough of the excesive noice)2) The hotel employees (specially at the front desk and at the breakfast room) were extremly polite all the time. I want to specially highlight "Vina" at the reception desk. She was extremly helpfull, always polite, smiling all the time and willing to help for every little detail. Fantastic!.3) The breakfast was very good (not great, but good enough). You can find anything you want (muffins, bagles, cream cheese, apple or orange juice, coffe or tea, eggs, waffles, etc... very good breakfast if you compate to the medium range price of the hotelNot good:1) The elevators are horrible. It´s a 32 stories building with just 2 elevators There is always a long long line to use them and sometimies you need to wait extremly long time to go down to the lobby when leaving your room2) Breakfast Room; Although the breakfast is good (the food) the Room to have it is extremly small for such a big building. Every morning you need to wait in line to get your coffe. Extremly small room for 32 stories and 5 rooms per floor3) Rooms: This is a classic in all New York, but still Rooms are extremly small. They are good for 1 person, maximum 2. If you go with kids you will have to be very skinny, the room is very very small.All in All is a good hotel, I do recomend it, and if I go back to New York I´ll definitely book it again!

The front desk personnel were super friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and adequately sized for a NYC hotel; the bed was very comfortable. The only negative is the breakfast area was very crowded and the staff struggled to clean off the tables as the patrons left.

Clean, updated hotel with a friendly staff right in the heart of Manhattan. We were able to walk to Times Square, Herald Square, Central Park and the Theatre District. We had a wonderful weekend stay.

I wasn’t expecting a spacious place but this place wasn’t just tiny, it was awkwardly designed. The staff will not be remembered for friendliness or smiling. The elevator situation is ridiculous. Two small elevators for the entire hotel. This includes what the staff use. The entrance to the elevators is a narrow hallway. The only hallway. Thankful I didn’t visit during peak season. During breakfast rush, the elevator stopped at almost every floor. The door to my hotel room was previously compromised. I included a photo in this review. It looks like someone took a crowbar to it to get it open. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

The hotel is a good location although not in the nicest of areas. What drives me mad, and I never saw this in Queens, is that people randomly shout on the street. It's so annoying! The hotel receptionists exacerbate this problem by screaming "HAVE A NICE DAY" when you leave the hotel or "WELCOME BACK" when you return. It's annoying!The hotel is 30 floors only served by two lifts. Utter madness and yes I had to wait long periods of time.Breakfast was ok but too busy, assumes we know how to cook waffles ourselves, and the staff are frequently opening the door in the dining area to throw out the trash making the whole room FREEZING.The cleaners are very nice. If any of them want to come back to England with me they are welcome! - #tripadvisorprivatemessage

The room was small, as was the bathroom but the location was great for accessing NYC destinations. We had a few problems and inconveniences while there, but the staff were very helpful and worked to resolve them in a timely manner. Breakfast was crowded at times but there are many restaurants and other options nearby. It was good value for the price paid.

Mixed feelings about this property. Stayed here recently for 4 nights. Location is so convenient. On a block with other properties, in fact there are 3 together 1 after another. All 3 are currently under refurbishment with scaffolding in front covering so a little difficult at first to see the correct entrance. Lobby is small(ish) but has a couple sitting areas. Check in desk is split by a large column, so creates a break in line of sight in case. Initial check in was rough, not the warmest welcome and actually a little standoffish. Follow up with all other staff was better. Welcomed back each time upon entering, hello from everyone! Breakfast was traditional HI offerings. Staff worked extra hard to keep it all clean and stocked in this smaller breakfast area and did a good job. As others have stated, seating is at a premium in the breakfast area. King room was fine for 1 but would be tight for 2 people to stash belongs and maneuver around the room. Closet contained ironing board and iron as well as the safe. Bureau had a couple sliding drawers on as well as concealed the fridge. Desk was appreciated. Loads of outlets all over, included wifi was fast and appreciated. Bathroom is small. Small. If the stall shower wasn't narrow enough, there is a grab bar smack in the middle of the wall. There was no way to not touch it constantly when showering. There are 2 elevators for this building. Arrival day, 1 was down and there was an operator working the 2nd. To come down, you had to call the front desk and they would come fetch you as no buttons were working. This was corrected during my stay and both seemed to be working properly. That said, I requested and received a room on a low floor (4th) and took the stairs most of the time to avoid the waits. That worked well until I noticed the handle from the stairwell to the 4th floor was off and laying on the ground. I let them know at the front desk and was told an engineer would be sent to remedy. Returned late that evening after walking the entire city to climb the stairs...to find no handle at all. Trudged back down and got in line for an elevator. Property has an excellent location just need to pay attention to the workings. That said, there was constant sawing and hammering all day everyday (thankfully not at night). Not sure if it was from this property or from next door.

On our weekend birthday trip to NYC, we found this location to be ideal. The usual value and quality we expect from Hampton Inn were there. As far as the negative reviews are concerned, remember that this is located in the busiest spot in one of the world’s largest cities. There is construction, prices will be higher, there are poor people, hotel rooms in mid-priced hotels are smaller, and you may have to walk half a block to hail a cab. If you’re not a total rube, you’ll be fine. The staff was very friendly and helpful and there were ample vending machines, ice, free coffee/tea/hot chocolate 24/7. One of the elevators was out, but stuff happens. You squeeze yourself into the next available and have a good laugh. The rooms are clean and have coffee makers, a safe, a closet, a huge tv, free Wifi, an iron and board, outlets near the bed, a desk and chair, a refrigerator and an ice bucket. The bathroom was well-stocked. The rooms are smaller than other Hampton rooms we’ve stayed in, but keep in mind that we’ve stayed at another boutique hotel where the door barely cleared the bed when opened! Again, space is precious in this metropolis. Breakfast is free, but the eating area is small and cramped and the food is standard meh. On a busy day you can just take your food back to your room to eat or visit one of the various diners within walking distance. The only negative about the stay is that the staff could warn customers ahead of time that one of the elevators was out and to plan for an extra wait. Otherwise, this location was a good value for a nice experience.

Stayed here for a conference at the Javits. Awful stay. Brutal. Elevator broken the entire stay - waited 15-30 minutes per ride. Hotel room was cramped at best, bathroom a shoebox and shower built for a child. I’ll never stay here again and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

For couples seeking a quality hotel at a reasonable rate, this is the perfect selection. Restaurants, theatre, shopping, and public transportation are just steps from this boutique hotel. The staff treat you as if they have known you forever. Every time we have visited New York, this is our “go to” hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast holds a large variety of choices before heading out into the city each day.

Staff was able to check me early which exceeded my expectations. Room snd hotel were extremely clean! Internet did not connect in the fitness room. Breakfast was hot and ready by 6am which fit perfect in my schedule.

This was my second stay at this hotel. I received a very kind note of appreciation. I think the hotel is the best value for the area. That is why I returned. It was easy to walk to our activities. The staff is very friendly and helpful! The rooms are small but I expected it. Very clean. I’d stay again in the future.

The rooms were very clean and comfortable, staff was very nice. The only improvement could be the breakfast. It was raining one day and the front desk person offered us umbrellas to borrow for the day. So nice!

I am a longtime Diamond and we were coming in by train to Penn Station on a Friday late morning with Theater tickets for Saturday afternoon. Perfect location to walk to both. Easy access to the Subway and good suggestions from the front desk. We will stay here again. Standard room was smaller than we are used to but sufficient. Breakfast was OK - many options but seating was a premium.

First review of anything, feel the need to tell anyone to stay away and stay anywhere else. Elevator is broken and has been for over a week. It takes a half hour to leave or more. Confirmed Legionaries....we have 2 children a 5 and 6 year old who had pneumonia a month ago. This dangerous and awful. Had I known this before, we never would have come. We stayed 1 night which was too long!

The worst hotel experience ever.Check in- My daughter checked in around 3 & was told the elevators weren't working, given a key to our room on the 5th floor and told to use the stairs. No help offered, drag your bags up 5 floors.I arrived 2 hrs. later & was able to get onto the one working elevator after waiting over 30 min. Then we had to rush to leave to get to a show after waiting another 20 min. to get back downstairs.Breakfast- I am physically unable to walk up or down stairs unless I hold onto a rail,taking one step at a time. I tried to get an elevator for breakfast,called the front desk, waited in the hall 15 min., called again reminding them I can't do stairs, waited 15 min.more, called again & was told "we're very busy"! No apology even! Gave up on breakfast.Maid service- Returned to room each day/night-no service,no new towels, no garbage emptied,no linens changed or beds made,no note?? When I inquired at check out, I was told they have a "green program" and (although I was unaware of it) we "signed up for it"! From reading other reviews,so did everyone else staying there that wknd.--certainly NOT by choice.Never once, did any employee apologize to me or my daughter for ANY of the many inconveniences we endured at this hotel that wknd. In fact, we were treated like we were imposing on them, trying to get an elevator,wanting to get to breakfast, questioning the lack of housekeeping services.I'm in my 70's and I've never seen such poor management. Usually hotel staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and are apologetic when things go wrong. Not here. We paid $900. for our 3 night wknd in this hotel hell

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights and used it as a base for all the sight seeing we needed to do. It was comfortable, small like all New York hotels but bigger than other New York hotels I’ve stayed in. Modern and clean. Staff were very helpful especially as we got in early before check-in. Great location for sight seeing. Being an ordinary Hilton Honours member didn’t qualify for any perks like water. I think free bottled water should be a basic perk for any hotel stay and perhaps cookies if you’re traveling with kids.

The hotel has 2 lifts and upon my arrival, only one was in order and it was being run Manually. My key did not work a few times, I was lates for prayer, meets and transportation because I had I call for

Only a few blocks from Times Square this is still the best deal in Manhattan. Your state comes with free Internet and breakfast service coffee 24 hours a day it’s a great place to take the family and it’s in a safe neighborhood

This hotel is bad in so many ways. We choose our room and paid for a city view. We look directly into the rooms in the next hotel. No city view at all. There are two elevators. One has been out of order for over a week. The other one is so busy that they have someone manning it and you have to call downstairs to request it. The waits can be as long as 30 minutes. Not acceptable at all! After a long day sightseeing, we returned to our room to find a pillow missing from our bed, we were left with one bath towel and no toilet paper. In order to get these things, we have called housekeeping and over an hour later there is no response. Our disappointment in this hotel is just huge and we paid NYC prices to stay here. We are Hilton Vacation members and this place makes us feel we made a bad choice!

This is our 5th Year staying at this property in NYC for a girlfriend shopping trip for the holidays. The staff is great, very accommodating and are always so nice. There is an excellent pub just up the block, they don't mind storing luggage for late checkout and they are happy to make suggestions for restaurants. It's also very easy to get an Uber from there. We'll be back next year. Shout out to Jim from his TN friends!!

The rooms at this hotel are the smallest rooms that we've ever experienced, be prepared. I wished now I would have read reviews before booking. The elevators were broke down 3 out of the 6 nights we stayed there. The construction noise coming from across the street along with noise coming from the hallway was bad, and lots of Pot smokers outside the front door, scary.

Once we found the entrance (behind the skips), we had to wait four and a half hours for our room to be prepared. For the wait we were given $4 of water. This should have prepared us for what was coming. Our luxury ($1000 / week) room had mistakenly been changed to a disabled person room. We were unable to change this. Upon arrival $300 was additionally charged to my card. A month later this is still not reimbursed. The elevator near our room was noisy all night. You could not put the aircon on if you wanted any sleep. There are no blackout curtains. There is no double glazing. The view is non-existent. The king size bed, I initially thought it was a single (very cozy). The room would have been good for a disabled person (on their own). Breakfast was included but paper plates? Mostly make your own waffles. It appears that anyone can go into breakfast, even vagrants off the street. And we saw meat on one day out of seven. In an entire week we saw room services once, our linen and towels needed changing but nobody came even when asked for. This is not the Hilton, but it is central and Carlos is just around the corner

Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South was not a good choice. The rooms are TOOOOOOOOOOO small; not much space to move around with just another person in the room. The only good thing is the location.

I booked this hotel because I’m a loyal Hilton customer and have always found Hampton Inn’s to be a name that has less frills than other hotels in the Hilton Brand but still maintains the friendliness and cleanliness that I value. This was definitely not the case with this hotel. I arrived around noon on a Friday. I expected my room to not be ready as check in time was 3pm. As expected my room wasn’t ready however I was met with the rudest employee I have ever dealt with at a hotel (and I travel a lot). Eye rolls, loud sighs when asking to store bags and more really didn’t make me feel welcome. Upon arrival back at the hotel at 4pm my room was still not ready. I had pre-selected my room using the Hilton honours app so the staff switched me to another room within the same category. The room was on a lower floor and there really is no view to speak of so I didn’t object. It did bother me that I was not recognized for my Hilton gold status and that the staff charged the wrong credit card even though I made it clear which card I wanted processed. The elevator waits at the hotel are horrendous. At check in times the line stretches nearly out the building as only two small elevators service 32 floors of rooms. The rooms are small as is expected with NYC but adequate however the room was far from clean upon arrival. Stains on the carpet and mirrors, a dirty bathroom and a filthy air conditioner/heating unit makes one feel uncomfortable with staying in the room. The room has a small fridge and although I was assured it was stocked with water (another Hilton Honors perk) it was not. Upon checking out the room, I found all fixtures (towel racks, toilet paper dispenser etc) were loose and nearly falling off the walls, the TV did not work, nor did the ice machine on our floor. The location of the hotel and proximity to main tourist attractions such as Times Square is decent and is a short walk. I did not partake in the hotel breakfast mainly due to the extremely limited space in the dining area. The area holds about 12 - 15 guests comfortably and the hotel obviously holds far more even when at partial occupancy so it was just easier to walk to nearby offerings. All in all I was very disappointed in this Hilton experience. I spent a good deal of money and substantial honors points for a 2 night stay that did not live up to the Hilton brand. I will consider using another brand the next time I return to NYC.

Location, mediocre (nearish to Times Square). Maintenance, mediocre (our sink didn’t drain). Breakfast, mediocre (but the bagels were pretty darn good!). Rooms very small for three people. The staff was very friendly and helpful that make the stay tolerable. Breakfast staff was awesome.

On the negative side:When checking out I asked about a $6 charge on my credit card. I was told that it was because we consumed two $3 waters in our room. When I told the woman we did not touch them, she said the maid said it was marked down that two were consumed. She then proceeded to get the maid's log to show me that the number 2 was written down for my room. I had to tell her calmly TWO more times that we did not drink the water before she decided to remove the charge. Why was it so difficult to believe I was telling the truth?On the positive side:It's not a fancy hotel (it's VERY narrow...but it's NYC!), but it is reasonably-priced, in a good location, and easy to get to from the Lincoln Tunnel. They also have valet parking, which is best to get as a package deal.

Pros: The hotel room was as expected. Clean and small. Staff was friendly and helpful. Welcoming snacks (I'm a gold member) were cute.Cons: Gym was terrible. It's ok it was small, but they should have up-to date machines. They don't even have to buy so many because the room is so small. Each machine should have its own monitor instead of one TV in the middle of the room which isn't particularly accessible from any of the machines. Breakfast was OK, but they had tons of people. Staff was short. They worked hard but couldn't keep up with the tables. We cleaned our own table with paper towels and water. Lines were very long. I had to wait 10 minutes to use waffle maker because one broke down in the middle and the staff was too busy to attend to it. The hotel knows the number of people. They should staff accordingly.

A great stay, hotel is in a great place close to the subway and central to all the major attractions, the staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great, overall I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough thank you for a wonderful holiday.

Loved this hotel from start to finish, check in was great. we booked a king bedded room and asked to change to twin and it was done for us, no problem. Staff all so friendly, always smiling and greeting guests. Breakfast was a great bonus as was the free wifi and no resort feeHighly recommend a stay here

We only stayed for one night but we were totally satisfied. Good room, good service, perfect location. The breakfast, which was included was good and with a variety of choices. We could absolutely choose this hotel when we return to NY next time!

Conveniently located for central Manhattan but the property is very tired and in serious need of refurbishment.The bathroom in our room whilst serviceable was in very poor condition and the air conditioner whilst very effective both in heat and cooling requires a good service as it threw out loads of black soot like substance which covered the adjacent bed. The staff were very pleasant but also the approach on 39th street is not very encouraging as a large portion of the street currently is covered in scaffolding and appears slightly down at heel.We won’t be returning

Everything was excellent! the staff was super accommodating for such a large group. The only problem was the elevators, the hallway to get in was always crowded and one of our guests had to wait 15 min before the elevator showed up. (I only had to wait around 8min). But it’s New York I expect cramped spaces and waiting for elevators for many floors of people. The breakfast was lovely. I’m vegan and had a lot of help from the staff telling me the ingredients in certain items. Overall great stay!

Location is close Times Square, walking distance. Rooms are clean. Waiting for lift in the morning could be frustrating as only two lifts are available . The staff were friendly and helpful. Airport shuttle does not arrive on time. There was forty five minutes delay in our case.

Staff is the only positive thing about this hotel. Rooms are big,but beds are so uncomfortable, that my back was killing me after one night sleep. Luckly I have stayed here only one night. And breakfast ... disgrace. You can wrote a book with so many bad words about „food“ served in that „restaurant“. My fault that I choose this place, but still this is a Hilton property and is located in the centre of the world. :O Another Hilton hotel in Midtown Manhattan that needs to be refurbish.

Great location and considerable quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful.Breakfast was included and lovely. Set us up for the day. Coffee available 24 hours. Only negatives no shower gel and the lifts could take a while but not surprising as there was 32 floors and only 2 lifts.

Great location, small but clean rooms. Had a great stay until we took the airport shuttle. Driver doesn't speak English, didn't know where he was going once at the airport. Use Uber or Lift for the same price and less frustration!

After reading some of the reviews I didn’t know what to expect, I was pleasantly surprised as this is a great hotel, we booked a family room but they gave us 2 doubles which was a great start, the breakfast is great with a lot of choices, my children are fussy but they always found something they liked, the lifts can be an issue in the morning sometimes but that is the thing I can fault , the staff are friendly and very helpful and always had a smile on there faces , for a 3 star hotel I don’t know what people are expecting, if you are thinking of stay here then don’t worry about the reviews you will have a great time

If you like terrible service, rude staff and bad food then this is the place for you. Having stayed at Hilton Hotels in both Dubai and London I’m honestly shocked they let their name be associated with this dump. I understand this is not a Hilton, but if you’re going to charge Hilton prices then you don’t expect student hostel facilities or service. I visited here as part of a group and don’t remember any one of my travel companions having anything positive to say about this place. Upon arrival the check in process was long and unnecessarily difficult. How can it take 30 minutes to check into a room? What they call a twin room here most people would call it a large wardrobe. To say the rooms are small is doing them an injustice. A toddler would find the room claustrophobic. The service staff were rude, but then I guess that was my fault for taking the only working elevator in the building to the 17th floor and interrupting there chat. That is when I could use it! Most of the time it seemed as if it was being used as a service elevator for god knows what. But I guess I owe them thanks as I walked up and down the stairs from the 17th floor I now have the legs of a rugby player. Just to clarify the other elevator was constantly out of order during our stay. Breakfast was a joke! I walked in on the first morning and picked up what I thought was a plastic decoration. To my amazement I was told it was an egg. It didn’t get any better when I was told the warm brown tasteless water was actually coffee. But what they don’t tell you about this hotel is when you stay here you will feel like an extra from Breaking Bad. The availability of drugs on the street just outside the door is unbelievable. In all honesty you’ve more chance of getting meth just outside the lobby than you have of getting a smile or friendly word from staff of this venue. Upon reflection knowing what I do now, I would have booked a room in the Holiday Inn just around the corner.

This hotel has a great location. For Times Square and general amenities. The Tit na N’og bar next door is its best asset BUTWhere do I start? Poor breakfast Poor servicePoor liftsPoor receptionPoor information Poor roomsPoor outsideSmellyCrackheads on street outsideI stayed here a few weeks ago with a large group. On arrival I handed my card in to receptionist and was told that I could split with my room mate at theend of stay, this did not happen and in fact they debited my card 24hrs before departure.The food was akin to shawshank redemption without the marvellous acting of Morgan Freeman. At least there is a very nice sandwich shop next door that also had plentiful supplies of tablets in case you had the misfortune of eating a Hampton Inn sausage.We were supplied with a double bed despite being too straight males, one of whom has severe IBS so not an ideal sharing partner in same bed. We had clearly stated that two single beds were required. Upon asking for this be resolved, we were threatened with expulsion from hotel if we didn’t conform. Not being the agreeable type, my insistence was eventually rewarded with a room with two beds. If one was less resilient than I then they may have had to sleep on the large scaffolding outside.The lift scenario is un real, I now know how a hungover sardine feels. Two lifts for 30 plus floors, which staff can manipulate at will if they for example needed to bring a bin to floor 29 from 5. This isn’t a great situation. Thankfully my IBS prone room mate and I were moved to 7th floor so at least the stairs was an option,Receptionist was very pleasant although the whole credit card scenario above wasn’t mentioned on arrival so gets a negative in my book for this!! Poor information regarding reduced beer/food next door.The rooms were poor but very expensive even though I know NYC is expensive . Small wardrobe, lived from case so enough said.The outside of hotel was a scaffolding site. We were treated to burly builders holding large pillars in place whilst we walked under The smell of cannabis and crack outside of hotel is overwhelming so if you like Breaking Bad then this hotel for you.I love NYC but HAMPTON INN should be ashamed of this place. Very helpful cleaning lady on 7th floor though

DO NOT STAY HERE The hotel it’s self was dingy the lifts/elevator were out of order and being on the sixteenth floor that was a massive issue, on speaking to the manager about this, he was a very rude and passive aggressive man, he should consider his career in the service industry... I may as well have tried to speak with the fire hydrant. The rooms were small and the housekeeping did NOT service the room every day, and the days they did it was a very poor effort.The breakfast, well describing it as food could just about have passed the legal definition of food; however it was disgusting, cheap rubbish.In short, this hotel is massively overpriced and I would not recommend it to my enemy’s

This is a hotel to be avoided at all costs.i have no option to give a lower rating otherwise I would score this zero. I stay in hotels regularly for work and pleasure and this is the worst of them all. I had the misfortune to stay here for 5 days with a group of friends.32 floors and 2 lifts. These lifts are also used by the staff. You therefore have to wait long periods of time for a lift, assuming they are working at all. I regularly had to take the stairs to and from 24th floor as the lifts were broken. Prior to arrival I did consider the option of an upgrade, I am so glad I didn't as it would have been on a higher floor.Having got to our room, it was incredibly small for two beds. No chance to unpack as nowhere to put anything. Within 10 minutes two other people walked in to our room. They had also been allocated our room. It also meant that our room keys had been deactivated. I went to speak to the manager David Ruas. I calmly explained what had happened and my concern about my safety and security if they keep giving out room keys. He was not interested. He told me he didn't like my tone, and that I could always leave and find another hotel. I would have left but I was part of a large group and this would have caused further issues. To be fair to David he did apologise to me the next day and admitted it hadn't been his best day. The breakfast is a joke. Complete chaos for food which is very basic all in paper cups and plates and no space. I therefore had breakfast in nearby cafe. While in general the staff were pleasant there was a lack of information to guests as well as misinformation. They didn't tell anyone that they were giving out vouchers for drinks in a nearby bar as compensation for the lift problems. It was only when you complained that a voucher was provided. As we were two guys sharing, I had secured the room on my credit card. The day before we left we spoke to reception about splitting the bill. She said that would be fine and even worked out how much we would each pay. However when we checked out the next day we were told it had already all been charged on to my card. I again asked to speak to the manager and David spoke to me. Again no service recovery offered and a request from me for a reduction for all of these issues was firmly refused. He then however gave me his business card and assured me he would look after me next time I was in New York. I somehow dont expect I will be returning to this hotel.In summary very poor quality, no customer service ethos and not a nice location even if it is close to Times Square. There is nothing going for this hotel and it not even good value. There are plenty more hotels in New York and I would urge people to avoid this.The manager did little to resolve customers genuine grievances, however to be fair to him and his team you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear.As for Hilton, if this is a reflection of your standards I wont be staying in your hotels again.

This hotel could be so much better. The rooms were on the small side but it is a three star so not unexpected. There were issues with reception at both ends of our stay and what ought to have been simple issues proved difficult to resolve. I am unsure whether this a because of a general malaise in the management of the hotel or inexperience of the particular staff involved.These were however minor irritants compared to the absolutely abysmal breakfast experience. Coffee from machines in paper cups, paper plates and plastic cutlery which I admittedly didn’t have to use much due to the spectacularly unpalatable food. I have never experienced worse breakfast anywhere in the world!We ended up one floor up in this multi story hotel despite having requested a high room and that having been acknowledged by the hotel in the booking receipts. In the event, when the room key was issued we walked into the room to find it already occupied. After a lot of heated negotiations with reception staff we eventually managed to secure a twin room as booked despite being repeatedly told they only had doubles left when we repeatedly explained the unsuitability of that for two straight male friends. The low floor transpired to be a blessing in disguise as there were continual lift problems during our stay resulting in some of our colleagues having to walk up and down over 20 floors.My conclusion will probably mean little to Americans but Basil Fawlty running this hotel would be a vast improvement!

Broken lifts in a 30 floor building, with no compensation. Occupancy of several hundred people with breakfast area for about 20. Awful breakfast choices. Dirty streets outside. Scaffolding being put up outside from 6am

Worst hotel I’ve stayed in. Elevators not working, staff not helpful and unable to rectify complaints. Information not freely given. Rooms really small. This has put me off staying at any more Hilton’s

This is without doubt the worst hotel experience of my life. Staff at front desk were rude, elevators not working for duration of stay, bedrooms you couldn’t swing a cat in, breakfast was awful - I have no words for how bad this place is - avoid at all costs

Stayed overnight and I can’t say enough good things about it. Firstly, the location on 39th was accessible to everything we did. The rooms are compact, but clean and had what we needed. The free breakfast was lovely; had a huge variety of breakfast food and drinks and was very good.Most importantly, the staff was outstanding. From the front desk, workers handling the luggage, the help in breakfast room, maids cleaning rooms, they were all so friendly, courteous and accommodating. Would definitely stay there again.

Ok I didn't expect this hotel to be great but it was worse then I imagined. First off we stayed for 3 days and the entire time only ONE elevator was barely working for 32 floors. Ok things happen but they didn't not appear to be fixing the problem. We were on the 24th floor and after waiting many times over 20 minutes for an elevator had to take the narrow stairway down 24 flights. The rooms were VERY small... like the room was designed for one bed but they stuck 2 in. No counter space in the bathroom to even put a toiletry bag on. The room cleaning occurred only once during our stay and they threw away things we had set aside like bottled beverages and programs. They were set aside next to our belongings. Why would they do that? There was also a note on the desk from the hotel manager stating that the Health dept is allowing them to be open even though 2 people got very sick from staying there (from some kind of mold). They are doing massive construction across the street so no taxi come the road to avoid it and you have to walk down the block to find one. And don't get me started on the noise this makes.... one word... Jackhammers!!

We are Hampton Inn fans - we've stayed in almost every city. Never been disappointed, particularly by the staff who always go out of their way. Not only are the rooms really small - we couldn't walk past each other in our room - the elevators were slow - 6 rooms on each floor, 32 floors, 2 small elevators, but the staff was rude at the front desk from the moment we checked in, as well as the breakfast staff (who could not keep up with the crowds, no matter what time we came downstairs). We won't be back- and we are in New York all the time.

This is one of the worst places that we stayed at in the last few years of traveling. While riding the elevator it stopped and dropped a floor no one seemed to care, the cleaning of the room was simply not done. No complimentary coffee filling, no toilet paper filling, a broken hair dryer, not enough towels (we were 4 in the room and they kept leaving only 3 towels). Even after speaking to the reception and the housekeeping manager nothing changed.It seems that since we complained housekeeping told the reception that we smoked in the room and we are not a family of smokers. We were charged without our knowledge 300 dollars and now are fighting for a refund. The whole building has 2 elevator s that serve 32 floors of guest rooms and the cleaning crew so that you can wait for an elevator for at least 20 minutes at a stone. The complimentary breakfast is a sham ten tables for 180 guest rooms (do the math) it felt like a zoo. You had to push your way through the guests for food/coffee/table /chair etc.After the shock the first morning we just ate out everyday even though breakfast was paid for in advance . We cannot believe and/or understand how Hilton can take under her wing this kind of establishment!!

We paid almost $1,100 for a three night stay and we opted for the "green" plan which meant we didn't have a housekeeping visit during the stay. That's a lot of money with no special benefits. On top of it all, the first night we waited almost 20 minutes for an elevator (there are only two) due to some malfunctions.The breakfast was unremarkable but the service staff were terrific. The front desk staff were also excellent. The location is pretty central to many of the things we wanted to do and only a couple blocks from an MTA station.Due to the ease of navigating the MTA (we didn't know going in) we would have secured a location in a more economical location and traveled to midtown. We also noticed the crazy presence of garbage on the adjacent sidewalks in that block (no fault of the hotel) each morning. Never seen anything like it in the many major cities we've visited throughout the world.

This motel is very overpriced. We had to walk through people smoking and sleeping on the sidewalk. We had a bag of garbage in front of our door when we arrived and was there when we returned from downtown. The elevators were not working. The room smelled musty and no one showed up to clean our room the first night. Don't stay her.

The staff here will make your experience amazing! Very friendly and welcoming and there for whatever you need! The breakfast had a great variety and great team supporting that area. The room was comfortable and worked for us. It is smaller but manageable.

Great location. Easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio city. Employees cheerful and helpful. Free breakfast was decent. Room was small,bed was comfortable. Concierge on duty in the lobby. Complimentary beverages was great to grab and go all day. Would return.

The hotel was convenient for Times Square and just round the corner to Port Bus station. Quiet location on a side street away from hustle and bustle of Times Square. The room was clean and fine for the price paid. The aircon was a bit noisy however. We had free breakfast which was fine and we always found a table and good choice. Breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. We had problem with lost luggage on flight to JFK. Vina the hotel receptionist was exceptional. She helped me ring up about lost baggage and went well beyond expectations. The hotel staff were so friendly, helpful and welcoming. Whilst it is not the most glitzy or luxurious hotel such a great welcome and helpful attitude made our stay.

We stayed at this property for New York Comic Con this past weekend. We are three women over 50 years of age each and we had a blast; staying at this hotel made the weekend that much more enjoyable. Perfect location for our needs, and the lobby staff, and truly every single staff member were warm, friendly, and welcoming. The property is clean, the towels are nice, and the glass-enclosed shower seemed brand new. 24 hour coffee, tea, and hot chocolate was a plus, and the breakfast had many choices. Honestly, it’s the super-friendly staff that really made this hotel a great choice.

On a long weekend trip to celebrate a birthday. Location was good, just a few blocks from Times Square and walkable to several places. We walked to not only Times Square but also to the Empire State Building and the "Vessel". Only problem we had was that the breakfast area was not big enough..... when we went down, it was difficult to find an open seat and the food was somewhat picked over.

Location is walkable from Central Station. Rooms are super clean. Breakfast was good, coffee was good. However the doorman will not hail cabs for you and this can create travel issues when needing this service.

Ok...so, we booked two rooms, for two couples, my wife and I and two friends. The check in time was 3:00 pm, Saturday, September 28. We had dinner reservations and were looking forward to using the facilities in the rooms, and changing prior to dinner. 3 p.m came and went...so did 4...at around 4:40 I received a text that the rooms were now ready. Unfortunately this would entail us rushing back to the hotel and even had we done so we would not have made a 5:30 reservation on time. I complained to the front desk. They did the right thing for our friends by refunding half the room rate. I paid in points. The front desk personnel assured me that they would be returning half the 70000 points, or 35000 to my Hilton Honors card. I asked for a receipt and they gave me one for the cash but said they could not give me anything for the points. 24 hours later I received an email from the hotel advising me that they would not be crediting the points to my account and the refund for our friend's room was all they would do. I complained to Hilton Honors and was told they would circumvent the hotel and credit the points back to the card themselves. I have another 24 hours to go to see if that was done. Well, let me tell you a few more things about Hampton Inn Times Square South: The breakfast was lame. The eggs were powdered, the fruit ran out and was never replenished, the only breakfast "meat" was a sausage gravy to go with the biscuits...no bacon, no sausage, nothing else.And there were not enough tables to accommodate the throngs of guests who showed up to eat. After a very dissatisfying breakfast, we went to our rooms, packed up, and stood in front of the elevator (one of only two) for at least 20 minutes, during which time the elevator stopped on our floor (19th) twice. The first time the cab was packed and there was no room. The 2nd time, it was just slightly less packed so we sent our wives down and my friend and I walked the 19 floors down to the lobby. I would suggest staying at any other Hilton property except Hampton Inn, Times Square South, 337 39th St. The area is a little seedy too, as it is located near the Port Authority Bus Terminal.

First.. Hold on to David who made my experience (as i am sure he made everyone he meets with) five star. He needs to train all hotel personnel in NYC. The rooms are small for 4 people.. I think 2 can fit comfortably but a family of 4 getting around is a bit tight. With that being said.. If you are coming to NY as a tourist you will never be in the room except to sleep which makes this hotel perfect. It says city view but expect to see another building if you are high up..we were on the 29th floor but again.. Who cares you are never there. Breakfast everyday was fresh. It isn't the best but it is ok to get you ready for the city. Also.. From la guardia to the hotel is almost 50 dollars by taxi or uber despite the hotel saying they offer shuttle service. You have to pay for the shuttle so its the same thing. The staff is super nice.. They welcome you when you come in and wish you a nice day when you leave. It was a great experience.

This hotel was ok. Very small rooms. Only two elevators and the staff uses them all the time for work, so you can get stuck waiting to go up to your room or down to the lobby. The staff was very nice but not always overly helpful. When we asked about places or things around them some of them would give one word answers. Most of the staff was great always greeting you when you arrived.

Love the hotel. The rooms are clean, staff are super friendly, polite, and cheerful. Every time we stayed there, felt very welcomed. And I would like to say special thanks to manager David Ruas, and Crystal, Janina who helped me solved my difficult refund issue ( booked through third party). We greatly appreciate all your kindness, understanding, and help. Thanks again!

Traveled for business. Affordable, clean hotel within a few blocks of Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Lots of shopping and restaurants closeby. Hot breakfast included in your stay saves a couple bucks looking for something on the street.

Area well located but a little seedy. Vagrants sleeping on the street and garbage around. Rooms updated and small but quite comfortable. Rooms not serviced consistently. Not serviced until contacted after 5 pm twice during our stay. Nice hot and cold breakfast provided in comfortable area.

Stayed for 7 nights. Not a bad hotel, close to Times Square & Broadway, it easy walking distance for all even a walk to 5th AVE.Subway is just a short walk away to reach different lines.A saver for this hotel is the free Breakfast, most foods for all & including hot & cold food. Depending on the time you eat depends also if you get a table, but we only waited at weekends.Rooms are small, but most rooms in New York are.My only serious side I did not like is the lack of wardrobes, we had 1 small wardrobe for 3 of us so the hanging garments were squashed+ creased, so not good, I brought this to the attention of the staff.Staff were very courteous & helpful.Freshly baked cookies were free in lobby with tea and coffee so very good.

We stayed at your hotel in August 2019 and have still not received our deposit back that we paid you! This is theft! I have sent numerous emails but get absolutely no reply from anyone at your hotel nor head office!

As a fan of the Hampton Inn chain, this one did not live up to expectations. Location is convenient for walking to shows and the subway. However, West 39th Street is a very congested narrow street, even by Midtown Manhattan standards. DO NOT stay here if you have a car. It was heck just getting there and when I did, the spot to pull over for the valet parking was taken. No one was stationed outside. I had to pull over, run in to the desk and then someone came out. Note that the hotel - for $65 per night with no in/out privileges - does NOT park the car. Instead they use a third party contractor. They told me that when I checked out to call for the car 45 minutes to an hour before needing it. That's how long it takes to retrieve. The hotel staff is pleasant. The small room had a mini-fridge, a safe, and a small closet, all very convenient. Lighting was good. However, the room, and I have to be frank here, smelled like sweaty socks! I would notice it each time I walked over a 3-day stay. The included breakfast was a bit below par for a Hampton, and the small breakfast area was very tight and very crowded. One of the 3 days I came down and they were temporarily out of coffee, out of half and half, out of fruit, and out of plastic forks. However, the breakfast staff were all pleasant and helpful and replenished the items after I pointed out the need. Another matter of concern were the very slow elevators. There were always people waiting for the two small elevators serving the 30-story building. On checking out, I waited 15 minutes with my suitcase just to get on an elevator.

I have taken a pledge to close this hotel permanently. It’s horror to stay over here. I want this message to spread to as many people as possible. David Ruas ( General Manager) is an evil in all ways not only was he a terror to talk to but the way he told me to “LEAVE THE HOTEL RIGHT NOW” on my face was enough to prove that he is the most cheap, disgusting and a loser to talk to. David also humiliated my sister and that too on her birthday and told her that “ HE DOESN’T CARE IF IT’S SOMEONE’S BIRTHDAY “. Forget about making it special he got really pissed off when we asked him if the hotel can arrange a complimentary cake or something for her to make her feel special. I swear to GOD I saw my sister go to her room and cry for hours she was totally disheartened after hearing this. David Ruas there is a thing called KARMA what goes around comes around. I swear to God you will pay for whatever you did to me and to both of my sisters. There are two more girls at the front desk one of whose name is CAMILLE and the other one’s name we don’t know. Both the girls were creepy, disrespectful, manner less, fake and impossible to deal with. I have told so many of my friends and family people and we all have started a movement by the name of # DEMOLISH HAMPTON INN MANHATTAN TIMES SQUARE SOUTH AND DESTROY DAVID RUAS PERMANENTLY. We want more people to come forward to join our campaign as we want these people to suffer and ROTT IN HELL FOR THAT IS THE PLACE THEY DESERVE TO BE.

If you come to NYC sightseeing and then to sleep, this would be a good hotel. Not really meant for hanging out in the room as they are small. It was perfectly situated near the Jacob Javits Center where I had my event - this was the plus. The hotel staff was friendly / attentive made you feel welcomed. Plan ahead, elevator wait time is long. Other than that it was a good experience.

Very small rooms.....please check your rates because you might be paying more....not many options for breakfast....only two elevators so dont make a mistake like me and be on a high floor.make sure they get the approval from from NYC Health department before you go because some people were sick after ataying there just a heads up because i didnt find out until i got there

My wife and I celebrated our 45th weding anniversary with a weekend in New York.We stayed at the Hampton Inn on 39th Street in Manhattan.The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.We would definitely stay there again.

Sometimes I feel bad about leaving a bad review of an establishment. I mean, people work there and they have feelings. However...Last week I was walking to visit Hudson Yards for the first time and I inadvertently walked past this place and all the bad memories came back. I was in town for a convention then and it was as close to the convention center as I could get a room.Unless you have been living on the street you're not going to be happy you're staying there. The rooms are tiny. It's like they bought an old building with small rooms and decided to subdivide them. Narrow corridors - wouldn't want to be there in a fire. Elevators were small and slow. Trying to get out of there in the morning when everyone was trying to leave resulted in being passed numerous times by full elevators. Every single thing about this place says low end. However, the person at the front desk was very nice. There is no excuse for a national hotel operator to operate a place like this in NY. I was embarrassed that I had recommended a place like this to a colleague. He and his wife are still mad at me.Regarding food service there - seriously, you think I would have eaten there? Really?

The room was small but that was fine. We don’t spend a lot of time in the room on vacation anyhow. The only thing that I didn’t like was how the carpet felt. It felt dirty and sticky. I do realize that this is NYC and the outside isn’t the cleanest.

Bed comfortable, and having a small refrigerator in the room a plus.Choices at breakfast very good. Staff very helpful, and pleasant,and approachable. The hotel clean, and fresh smelling. Next trip I'll sign up for the rewards program.

Good value for a good hotel in Manhattan. Good location; theater district and 5th Avenue nearby. Hotel facilities overwhelmed by number of customers. Only two elevators for 32 stories of rooms, and breakfast area too small for number of guests.

Close to Times Square, MSG, and all subway lines. Friendly and helpful staff (esp. Will!). Complimentary breakfast area gets extremely busy - food runs low, lack of seating, but many places to eat nearby. Rooms are small, but clean; ‘city view’ limited. Elevators (2) run extremely slow. Be aware at night - the area does attract some interesting folks, but no troubles for us.

Very clean rooms, extremely helpful staff. Great location, right off of the Lincoln tunnel and just a few blocks from Time Square. Breakfast is a bit busy so make sure to get there early. Would stay here again!

Staff was really friendly & helpful! But paid extra for a “city view” on Booking.com & was notified that there weren’t any rooms with a “city view”. I would’ve booked the cheaper room & saved some money had I known.

Sadly I decided to stay at this hotel to save $50. The comforter was stained. I called the front desk. They didn’t apologize. They just offered to change the comforter. They moved me to a different room. Same dirty issues. I left to call my booking agent for a refund. This hotel refused. What I didn’t know was they went to my room to check out my concerns. They left my door ajar. When I called the manager, Henry, he asked, “What do you want me to do about it?” He told me to call Hilton if I had a problem. He then hung up on me. I took the money loss and went to another hotel that I always stay at in NYC. I don’t know if I can post the name, but Staybridge Suites is 100x better than this hotel. This month I was charged $400 on my credit card from Hampton Inn. I have spent time disputing the charge that is fraudulent.

The staff is very friendly at this location which makes up for everything else. I typically stay here when in nyc for business. The location is convenient and rooms are decent. Elevators are always slow and some of the rooms have bathrooms that were not remodeled well. The outlets in some of the bathrooms are covered up by the mirrors and doors hit vanity top when closing. Staff makes up for everything with their friendly attitude.

Stayed Sun-Wed on 27th floor (no view). Location was good. Staff was great. Breakfast was good, except one morning it upset our stomachs. We believe it was the potato-meat-thing. We would stay there again. Our stay came with a free all-day water taxi from Pier 83 to south end of Manhattan. Apparently, not many guests use it. DO IT!!! It is worth the money, but doesn’t start until 10am.

This is a nice hotel in a great location for sightseeing in NYC. The staff is all very friendly and professional. The rooms are small (to be expected in NYC) but modern and clean.My two issues are breakfast and valet. The only parking is valet andit takes over an hour to retrieve your car. The breakfast food is standard for a Hampton BUT the organization is bad. There are a lot of guests who are not familiar with an American style continental breakfast so the line is very long with people waiting for toast or who don’t know how to use the waffle maker. It was quite busy when we ate there (around 9 am on a Wednesday) so many things (fresh fruit, yogurt, toast) were out. I think the hotel would benefit from moving the toaster out of the way to some corner so people could move through the main line faster. I also think they should have more staff present to refill and to help direct traffic.

The staff is friendly and helpful. It is clean. Breakfast is good. I like the smoothie. However the space is squishy. Very often the elevator is too full to fit in people. Expect 5 to 10 minute wait for elevator during those peak times.

Booked what I thought was a king room, when I got my confirmation it was a double. CHECK YOUR CONFIRMATION. Found out the hotel had an issue with Legionaire's Disease and that I was at high risk - there was a notice in our room. I told them at the front desk that I was high risk and they assured me the water system had been flushed and they have been inspected and all was ok but if I was uncomfortable I could check out the next day. I asked if they would help me move to another Hampton and the answer was no, this hotel is a franchise. I purchased masks to use while showering to try to help. Then after reading the reviews I found out the notes were only in rooms where they found the issue and they didn't even move us to another room!! If I get sick, this will be a major court battle! Also, I would not use the concierge - she sent us totally in the wrong direction that we wanted to go and we had to figure it out ourselves - we lost at least an hour on what should have been an hour round trip. Otherwise we typically didn't have an issue with the elevators, breakfast was ok (really crowded - hard to find a seat) but really didn't live up to other Hilton properties I've stayed in which is alot (international business and national pleasure travel).

this hotel has a good location and near times square. staff is awesome and friendly. prepare to wait in line for breakfast and elevators. i never walked up and down so much at a hotel using the stairs.

What a fantastic find this NYC hotel was. Staff were so welcoming in both the reception and dining room. Free breakfast was a bonus with quite and array of choices including eggs, fruit, cereals, toast, waffles and fresh smoothies.Rooms were spotless and we were offered either extra points or a late check out if we didn’t need beds made up and towel changes.Free tea and coffee all day.The only drawback was the amount of waste... plastic cups knifes spoons paper plates aghhh!!! Were these recycled, probably not as they were all soiled.

We were on our way home from Europe and our last leg of our flight got cancelled so we ended up having to spend the night in New York City. Initially, we were very tired and frustrated. However, it ended up being a wonderful little side trip, beginning with the Hampton Inn Times Square South. General Manager, David Ruas, runs an excellent hotel!!! His entire staff was extremely welcoming, courteous, and very helpful. David himself, was very friendly and went out of his way to make us comfortable. While we generally stay at Hampton Inns, they are not all "created equal" and under David's management, this particular one is outstanding!

Great location for the Javis conference centre. Walking distance.Breakfast area can get very busy and it can take ages to the elevator but because I got a great nice sleep every night the hotel was perfect for me needs.

Our top comfortable was dirty and had not been changed from a previous checkout bad body ordor spoke to someone at the front desk and when we went back up to our room we saw the house keeper and she told us she would change it

Super friendly front desk staff! Able to hold bags before and after check in. Rooms updated and clean!Breakfast was good (but didnt care for the eggs, too processed).Great location. 5-10 min walk to train station, times square and broadway. Great restaraunts nearby!

This Hampton Inn is in a great location and just steps away from Broadway venues, Times Square and Midtown attractions. The staff is absolutely the friendliest! Janina at the front desk had such a great smile and was so helpful. Walter helped us with our car and luggage. The breakfast staff worked quickly to keep the food stocked and hot. It was great for my girls and I. We stayed for one night and it was perfect. We were only in our room to sleep because we wanted to take in as much of the city as possible! They certainly made the most out of the space in the room - and for NYC it was very affordable! Thank you Hampton Inn - Times Square South for making our stay so comfortable! Hope to see you soon!

The hotel only has 2 elevators, We waited 25 minutes one morning for it to stop on our floor. We called down and said there is a problem and the girl said that she would send it up to us. When it FINALLY stopped only 2 of us were able to get on it. Me & my niece ended up walking down the 11 flights of stairs to the lobby. So be prepared to wait or walk the stairs, no matter what floor you are on. The elevators are also used for the staff, luggage carriers, housekeeping cards. When they refurbished the hotel, they should have put in a freight elevator! The free breakfast was good, but make sure to get there early for a seat and hot food. They run out of both FAST!! The food is served in the same space as you are supposed to sit an eat in and it is EXTREMELY CROWDED!!!

We dealt with concierge service upon arrival and told her what we were looking to do, we were only there for less than 24 hours and she pressured us to buy a 48 hour tour package as we would miss out on things with the 24 hour package, saying the boat tour was not included. Later finding that the boat tour was included with the 24 hour package and if we purchased with the company at the stop or online it was cheaper too. I was thinking the Hampton would have our best interest in mine.I was shocked upon arrival there was a letter in the room stating 2 people have become sick with Legionnaires' disease and your water system has tested positive in over 6 room but not stating which rooms. I wish this was previously communicated on the site or when booking. I have a child, 4yrs old, that has a critical autoimmune illness. I would have reconsidered or checked with his medical team before traveling to this hotel. I didn't like that I had NO option to make informed choice about the health of my family or myself. Elevators were also an issue. I would not recommend this hotel to others due to the wait time for elevators. At times, the wait could be 20 min. or longer.

Vacationed here with family. The rooms were small with only 1 chair in a room with double beds to sleep 4. Walking distance to Times Square and Broadway. Nice breakfast, but get there early if you have a group that wants to sit together.

The rooms are small but comfortable but was just what we needed for a 4 day visit. This hotel is in walking distance of port authority and subways. One of the things I thought about when going to NY would be the noise at night.... well is slept like a baby.Staff where all pleasant and helpful... we would have a good banter with the breakfast ladies! Hot Breakfast was varied from day to day but could always get fruit and cereal, toast etc.. loved the orange juice! Unfortunately being a true Brit when it came to the tea bags they were a good make but I liked a good strong cuppa .

The rooms are small, as expected at this price range in NYC, but the hotel was clean and the check-in process was seamless. The staff was very friendly, and the breakfast was better than expected. We especially appreciated the staff who were running the breakfast, who went out of their way to be friendly to guests while making sure that tables were cleared quickly, and food / plates were replenished. Good location for activities, including Broadway shows and the Hudson Yards/High Line.

Overall great service and clean rooms. Complimentary breakfast was ok. Wifi great. Elevators are fast but are really busy during breakfast hours. Took us 20 minutes waiting for the elevator to go down from the 9th floor.

Nice location, walkable distance to most attractions and Port Authority. Very good breakfast options, warm and cold. Nice rooms/beds, great water pressure/temp in shower. Very good for the price considering you are right around Times Square. Rooms are smaller, no room for queen beds, only full size, but that is New York City (space is at a premium) so price is right. Staff very helpful. Elevators can get busy during prime guest hours.

As stated before, everything was OK, except for the two previously mentioned things. Service, appearance, cleanliness, all were satisfactory. Good location, price was good for where we were. Overall, a fairly good experience.

The hotel has excellent breakfast. The check in counter cookies were scrumptious. The beds are comfortable. Walking distance to Port Authority bus station and Times Square. All kinds of eating options nearby

The location of the hotel was excellent. Very easy to get around. The staff was very curteous, pleasant and seemed to really enjoy their job. Breakfast was very good. Always had plenty of food even when the breakfast serving times were about to end. Will definitely stay here again.

Great location. Quiet. Hotel is very clean and staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very bad, the food is terrible (waffles are different, not sure what they did here). Waffle makers are old and hard to work, burn hazard. Breakfast area is way too small to accommodate all the guests. Only two elevators so be prepared to wait for a long time to get a ride.

This hotel is conveniently located close to Times Square, as well as Penn Station. Super-accommodating morning breakfast room staff. I knew I'd missed the breakfast timing but went down to get some coffee. The breakfast room was still open, and the staff allowed me to get breakfast! GREAT customer service.

I will stay here again. Clean room. I had one king bed and space was more than enough. Complete breakfast. Excellent staff. A lot of homless people near by but I felt safe all the time. Good stay for the money

I stayed here for a week during a leisure trip to NYC with family. At just a 4-minute walk to the nearest subway station and a10-minute walk away from Times Square and the theater district, its location was excellent for tourists wanting to discover what the city has to offer by foot or subway.The entire staff (front desk, housekeeping, maintenance, kitchen) was among the friendliest I've ever encountered at a major hotel chain. They allowed us to store our luggage securely and free of charge for several hours when we arrived at 11 AM that morning and often inquired if we were pleased with our stay.The seating capacity of the breakfast room was very limited for the total number of guests at the hotel, but the breakfast crew works hard to keep the buffet replenished constantly so, while the queue to serve yourself can take a while, the items don't run out during breakfast hours.The elevator can take a while to reach your floor in the morning when you're waiting to go downstairs for breakfast. It was often faster for us to take the stairs up and down, even though we were on the 19th floor. It was good exercise, if anything.I get the impression that the hotel has too many rooms and fits in too many guests for the capacity of its elevators, lobby, and breakfast room, so it feels like a very busy hotel at all hours, but even so, I would stay here again if I were in the area.

Great free breakfast and friendly staff.The location was good, rooms are small, elevators are slow.I travelled with 2 teens and just found the hotel itself ok.again the staff was amazing though I cannot say enough about them.

We stayed her with our two older teenagers. The rooms were a bit small, but not uncomfortably so. It was very clean. They have a green policy where you can have a late checkout if you don’t get your sheets changed everyday. We didn’t need the late checkout, but took them up on the offer anyways.Breakfast was different everyday, which was nice. Turkey sausages was a treat!!!! The kids really liked the cookies available at the fri t desk.It is close to Times Square and Madison Square Gardens. Staff were always friendly and welcoming whenever we came and went. Would definitely stay there again.

It was a great experience. The staff are wonderful and very friendly. The location was great for my friends and I. The place is very clean and comfy. The breakfast was delicious. I highly recommend the Hampton Inn Hotel.

Chose this location based on our family plan to visit some of the main attractions of the city and the free breakfast. I am an early riser so it was so nice to go have coffee and a bite while the rest could sleep a bit longer. Wonderful staff and very friendly!

I picked this hotel as it was 2 blocks from Port Authority, and we were comng in to see a Broadway Show. The staff was outstanding! They held our bags prior to checking in and after checking out the next day. Room was clean and an average size. Bathroom had a small shower, but it was clean and renovated. We were on the 19th floor, and you could hear outside noise (sirens), but it did not hinder sleeping. We were in the middle of a blackout, but the hotel only seemed to be afftected ni terms of the elevator. They ran 1 elevator manually, and there were no issues with people lining up to get to their floor. The staff kept their cool. It was my birthday, and they gave me a balloon with a small gift bag (with extra water and snacks)! Breakfast was a good selection (eggs, cereal, waffles, juice, muffins, smoothies, no breakfast meats). I would definitely stay again, mainly due to the excellent staff. Though location and room were outstanding as well. Price was competitive for the area (I paid $215 for a Saturday night). I believe parking is $65 a night.
