Good quality hotel near the subway, location was a tiny bit rundown but the hotel itself doesn’t suffer for it. Close enough to points of interestStaff. Was very friendly and went above and beyond during checkin

If you are looking for the Ritz, or the Standard, don't stay here. If you are seeking lodging that is reasonable, well located, clean with a great staff, this is the place. Easy walk from either Port Authority or Penn station. Adequate breakfast included enables you to get moving and go explore the city.

We were there for a Broadway play and the hotel was in a great location for walking. The staff were responsive to our needs and very friendly. The outside of hotel was a little run down. Inside was nice.

Even my 7 year old enjoyed the stay and commented how everyone in NYC was so nice (he meant the staffs at this hotel :-)). I was a lil unhappy with the breakfast choices that didn’t quite accommodate guests with dietary restrictions but kitchen staff was kind enough to offer us specially made omelettes for us. So that took care of it! :-)

It’s very good hotel with wonderful staff, very polite and respectful. Room was small but comfortable and very clean. Complementary breakfast was good, coffee and tea was all day for the public. Internet is good quality.

The rooms were way too small for my comfort and I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels in New York. The lobby area is very dumpy. I only used the stairs since the elevator looked run down. There were only 6 rooms to a floor and the hallway had very low ceilings and run down. The breakfast buffet was ok but was so crowded it was hard to enjoy your food. Normally I feel safe walking around NYC by myself at night but didn’t feel safe in this hotels location. The only good thing about the hotel was the staff went out of their way to be helpful. Next time I will stay in a 4 star or above only!!

The staff made the experience. Everyone was super cheerful and made you feel right at home. The room was adequate and the beds were comfortable. It's close to Time Square so getting around is pretty easy. Elevators are a tad slow and the rooms were not done up until later in the day. On the other negative experience was having to step over some individuals with drug problems that were sleeping in doorways. Would not hesitate to come back here again. Breakfast room got pretty busy and catching an elevator became a challenge.

Really liked this location. All staff were cheerful, nice and helpful!Some work going on in the garment district but it is not noisy or intrusive in any way. Location was perfectly located and we had access to all kinds of food and metro locations.

I stay at a lot of hotels from 5 stars to two. In my many years, I’m somewhat of an expert where quality is concerned. I can honestly say this Hampton was simply amazing. The staff was very professional and kind. They even remembered my name. All the staff couldn’t be friendlier. And the cleaning staff was polishing areas most 5 star hotels don’t even clean. This place gave 5 star treatment and I recommend their hotel. Great location as well.

Location was great, staff was friendly, hotel was clean. There are only two elevators to service 30+ floors which get very busy while the hotel has cleaning staff on site, so expect lengthy waits when trying to get to your room or leave your room. All of the staff was exceptionally friendly no matter how busy they were or what time, my friends and I came back to the room after 4am every day. One person really stood out as being very sincere and truly genuine with his conversation, James or Jim at the front desk (he goes by both) was always a bright spot when my group was greeted by him. Congrats to the staff at this hotel for being a star with hospitality and bravo to Jim for standing out as our favorite employee of our trip.

The room was small, bathroom door hit the sink, the corridors on the floors are narrow and the elevators cannot accommodate the amount of guests. All and all, not worth the price and did meet expectations for a Hampton Inn.

I chose this property for its location. It is a great location only moments away from the heart of Times Square. Even though the room was small, it was clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast is typical of what you would expect and provides enough to get your day started.

The staff have been very kind and supportive from the moment we stepped in to the moment we left. Very friendly and helpful people. Rooms are a good size and the air-conditioning, though a little loud, is very efficient. Perfect for a hot June.

Breakfast was horrible. The only that we could eat was what was in containers like the yogurt. Anything that was made was too gross to eat. We were also overcharged for our stay. We are in the process of getting that corrected.

This is a decent hotel for the price in NYC. The place is clean. They offer a nice breakfast with different items every day. The rooms are very small. There are only two elevators and with 32 floors that sometimes equals a little wait for the elevator. The staff was very cordial and helpful.

My husband and I went to NY for a mini-vacation before work gets busy. I looked around and this hotel had fairly good reviews in a good location, so I decided to book. Because of location (Times Square), I had my doubts and low expectations. When we arrived, we were able to check in early. We also chose to do valet parking for ease of mind, esp in NY. FYI, you have to pay extra including tax. The room was small but it's what we expected and it was just the two of us anyways. The bathroom was very clean. Warning, for those of you who are big and tall, the shower may be small for you. Free wifi was a plus. Complimentary breakfast could be better, but wasn't bad. It's complimentary so who can complain. Overall, the staff was all very nice and welcoming. I would definitely come here again and recommend to others.

The good: The staff was nice and helpful. They had cookies in the lobby, and the fathers day board in the lobby where you could write something nice about your dad was a nice touch. The bad: Where do I start?* The rooms were tiny. We were constantly walking into each other and there was no where to put our luggage. * The elevators were awful. There are two, and they are not sufficient to deal with the traffic at the hotel. We had waits of 30-40 minutes to use the elevators in the morning. This is unacceptable when you are trying to get somewhere on time. * The kids like the breakfasts. The adults found the coffee to be insipid and the food mediocre. * The area needs to be cleaned up. There were homeless with kids hanging out downstairs hassling our family every time we walked by. One day there were dirty pads all over the sidewalk. We crossed to the other side of the street to walk as it was much cleaner and felt safer just across the street. * They tried to charge us an upgrade fee for being on a high floor. We did not ask for a high floor. There is no view, and the elevator takes so long that we would have much preferred a low floor where we could have taken the stairs. Instead of charging an upgrade, they should have given us a discount to pay us for the time we wasted waiting for the elevator.

Spent the weekend with my sisters and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location walking distance to subway and other attractions. The complimentary buffet was excellent and one of my sister's was worried she would have to go to Starbucks everyday for her coffee, but was pleasantly surprised with the coffee at Hampton Inn. Amanda who worked the breakfast buffet was absolutely charming, welcoming and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Manhattan in the near future.

Great place to stay. We stayed 4 nights. Everyone at the hotel we're so helpful from the front desk, to the servers of the breakfast, to the maintenance people. They were all so kind. Rooms were clean and plenty of room for 3 people. Close to the Subway entrance and just a few blocks from main area of Time Square.

This is a good standard of hotel. The room was small but of a good standard. The double bed was comfortable and very big, the flat screen TV was decent, the bathroom was a good standard. There was air conditioning in the room. A huge bonus was the fridge inside the room, which we used to store fruit, sparkling water and other drinks. There was also an iron and an ironing board, which we used and a hair dryer. The location of the hotel is good. It is located on a back street, which meant there was little street noise. So we were able to sleep well. The hotel is also located near the metro (42nd Street Times Square), about a 5-10 minute walk away. We were able to get from the JFK airport to the hotel easily, using the Air Train followed by the metro.The hotel has about 30 floors, and only has two lifts for the whole hotel which is not enough. This means you can be waiting some time for a lift to become available, especially if you are on the ground floor and the lifts are on the top floors. Our room was on the 4th floor, so we were able to use the stairs no problem if a lift wasn’t readily available. But if our room was much higher than that, we obviously would not be able to do that. TOP TIP: Ask for a room on as low a floor as possible.The breakfast room is not very big, and it gets very crowded. We stayed at the hotel for one week. We had trouble finding seats on the Sunday, but had no problem on the other days. The breakfast selection was ok, and included scrambled eggs or an omelette (there is one option each day), sausages or Canadian ham (one option each day), bagels, breads rolls, toast, sweet muffins, bananas, yoghurts, cereal, boiled eggs. There is tea, coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice, apple juice. There is also a waffle machine, where guests can easily make fresh waffles together with syrup, chocolate and cream. What really shocked us, was that the breakfast only provides paper plates and plastic cutlery. This is a Hilton hotel, so we couldn’t believe it. It wasn’t a big problem, but we thought it was strange.Guests can help themselves to free hot drinks 24 hours a day. This can be found next to the breakfast area on the same floor of the reception. We had a few hours to use on our last day, so after checking out, the hotel kept our bags for us at the hotel which was appreciated. Another tip is the Upside Pizza takeaway near the hotel, which served really excellent pizza. When exiting the hotel, turn left and you will find it at the next crossroads.All in all, a pleasant stay. But be sure to ask for a room on as low a floor as possible because of the lift problem.

The rooms are closet-sized and feels very cramped for a family of four in a two double bed room. Also, the two elevators are slow and crowded. During the last breakfast hour and near checkout, expect to pass an elevator after 10 minutes of waiting because it’s completely full. Then wait another 10 mins before another arrives. Otherwise the location is convenient near Times Square and breakfast and all-day coffee and tea are awesome amenities. Hotel staff are customer- focused and extremely friendly.

If your traveling for business this hotel will work well. It had a great location but no views and rooms are tiny. It’s central to everything and easily accessible. Keep in mind parking is $67, no in an out service. However there is 24 hour parking across the street for $50, no in and out access. This hotel works with for a couple going to see a broadway show. Plan to walk most places or take a subway. Uber or Lyft is avail but will take twice the amount of time to walk most places. All in all it’s adequate considering the location.

I spent a total of 5 nights at this hotel, one night on my own and the others with a tour group. This is my recap: Two elevators for 32 floors just doesn't work during the busy times. One morning around 9:00 one of the elevators was not working, and the other was overwhelmed with use, as a result I had to walk up 32 flights of stairs to get tickets we needed for a tour. Once I retrieved them from my room I saw the manager in the broken elevator and asked if I could take it back down. He said I could not, so I walked back down 32 flights of stairs. However, at the bottom I see the manager had taken the elevator down. The breakfast staff was overwhelmed every morning and could not keep up with the customers coming in. One morning all I could get was one scoop of eggs and a glass of water. Twice we were not provided wash cloths, and once we had to go to the front desk to get hand and bath towels.The staff was friendly and the AC worked very well, the bed was very comfortable. Overall the experience was not what I have come to expect from a Hilton property.

Great experience at this hotel! Efficient and accommodating. Knew how to take care of a large group, plenty of friendly staff and efficient check in/out! Well oiled machine with great customer service, clean rooms and amenities!

My family and I had a great time staying in this hotel. All the staff we met were very courteous and friendly, especially those front desk staff - Vina, Jena and Camille. The person who assisted us with our luggages and the staff from the dining were also really nice. They made our stay memorable. The location is very convenient, it’s only less than 5 mins from the subway/times square/port authority. Our room was very clean, normal size and beds were soft and comfortable. They have free buffet and 24 hours coffee/tea service. This hotel is highly recommended. We will surely stay here again when we come back.

Excellent experience all the way around. We highly recommend this property. It was very clean & the staff was fantastic. Our room was much larger than expected. If we visit New York City in the future we will definitely stay with them again.

I am writing this on behalf of my wife and daughter who had a short "girls" holiday in NYC. They chose the Hampton Inn because of its proximity to Broadway- seeing a show was one of their highlights.They were able to navigate past US passport control at JFK without any delay (unlike last year when long queues meant that it took more than a hour) so checked in far earlier then planned, but their room was ready. The room was a typical size for an city centre hotel, so not over spacious, but big enough, was clean and had everything that they needed. The included buffet breakfast was good enough and set them up for the day, although seating was limited. The only issue that they encountered was that the hotel has only 2 lifts, which are also used by cleaning staff, so on occasions getting to and from their room on the 26th floor was a hassle The hotel is within easy walking distance of restaurants and the 42nd Street subway, so they were able to get round and about easily. They had an enjoyable stay and would be happy to book again.

We spent a week in New York and stayed at the Hampton Inn in the Times Square area of Manhattan. From our arrival to our sad departure we received nothing but courtesy and friendliness from all the staff. Our room was ample big enough and the price included breakfast which was varied and very filling. This is an ideal location for a tour of the sights of New York. I would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here over Memorial weekend. We arrived early, 10:30 AM, knowing our room wouldn’t be ready, we just wanted to drop off our bags so we could start exploring New York City. This was our first time to NYC . David greeted me and my wife and told us he would take care of our bags. We told him we were going to Battery Park to see Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. We wanted to take the subway. He told us which train to take and we were off. All of the staff were amazing from housekeeping, breakfast staff, to the front desk. We averaged 10 miles walking every day and when we returned every evening, we were always greeted with smiling faces. The rooms were quite and the breakfast had plenty of choices. We were completely satisfied with our stay here and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

The hotel staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and appreciated. The room is smaller than the usual hotel room, perhaps because it's Manhattan. Only 3 small drawers, so unpacking for a 9-day stay was challenging. Shower felt cramped. Breakfast was mostly good--lots of variety. But the OJ wasn't cold. Cookies every evening in the lobby, but no variety--always oatmeal raisin. Good location, about a block from a subway entrance that led to many Manhattan routes.

This hotel was conveniently located a few blocks from Times Square. It was amazing cozy and the service was outstanding. The breakfast was wonderful and well staffed. It was a short walking distance to everything my family went to NYC for.

This Hampton is within an easy walking distance of the Javits Center. Traveling alone to attend an event there, this Hampton works. It's a good value for a quick stay. I chose the Park & Stay option. They Valet park the car when you arrive and return it when its time to leave. Very easy if you don't intend to use your car in the city. There are no in and out privileges, and it's parked a ways away. My stay was everything I expected from Hampton right down to the folded cheese omelet and selection of bagels at breakfast. Rooms are clean and renovated. Euro-style small but its NYC after all. Bed and pillows very comfortable as always. The front desk staff were helpful friendly and attentive. I'll be back next time I attend an event at the Javits center. Recommend if you're traveling and the location works for you. Not the place I'd bring my wife to visit time square though. Too basic. Good Value in NYC.

Everything was perfect. The staff was so accommodating and friendly--very helpful giving directions. Breakfast buffet had an extremely large selection. Rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here in February 2019 with my family (4 adults). Upon arrival we were greeted at reception and told our rooms weren’t ready yet, so we were told to wait for 20/25 minutes. Which we did. 55 minutes later we were still sat in reception waiting, upon approaching staff we were then informed that one room was ready and that we could go into that until the other was ready, which would be 17 floors apart. My parents were furious as me and my sister would be 17 floors away on a family trip after we requested to be close especially being in a new place for the first time. Somehow they then managed to get a room on the floor below somehow and we took them. We were on the 11th and 12th floor of the hotel. There were 2 lifts which were super slow and often resulted in us taking the stairs (all 12 flights of them). Later that night we discovered that our room was freezing cold even with the heating on, it was the middle of winter which was understandable but it was freezing to the point we were close to tears it was so uncomfortable. The bulky heater was blowing out cold air so we rang reception and they sent an engineer up. He said nothing was wrong with it and provided us with a tiny portable heater which was really noisy and just not the best. The next morning after a very uncomfortable sleep and just wanted to enjoy our holiday, we complained again and somehow it got fixed that day. The room was still cold but more bearable and we just got on with it as we were in New York and Just wanted to enjoy it!! The room wasn’t brilliant and in the pictures provided you can see that. It felt rather dirty and not well kept. The bed was comfortable and clean thankfully. Our toilet was also really noisy and meant we couldn’t flush it during the night without waking each other up ‍♀️ Breakfast was good, and I couldn’t get over how small the dining area was, and bins were constantly full and overflowing. For the size of the hotel there was always queues just to sit down. We often took our breakfast back to our rooms. It was a buffet style and there was loads on offer including cereal, hot food, a waffle machine, a toaster and selection of fruit. It was paper cups and paper plates so did feel a little like a school canteen lol. But overall the food was yummy and it was enough to set you up for the day. Overall I wouldn’t stay here again, but the hotel is a short walk from the Empire State Building, madison square gardens and Times Square so it is very central. Also the daily fresh cookies was a lovely extra and they were yummy, and on Valentine’s Day they gave out free chocolates. The reception staff were brilliant and always greeted you each day with a smile no matter how busy and hectic reception was. Which was nice :) just a shame some things let the place down.

This location was perfect for the Times Square and Garment District in NYCStaff were amazing.. friendly,efficient and welcomingOur Handicap Accessible room had some serious concerns so nut sure this is a good location if those are your needs.

Great location, close to everything but quiet and relaxing. Breakfast was a great start to our day. Clean rooms and I liked how environmentally conscious they are. Would highly recommend for any traveler.

This was just what we expected for a relatively inexpensive hotel in the centre of Manhattan. Room rather dark because of tall buildings all around and only a coffeemaker -no tea (and we Brits DO like our tea!). But the beds! SO comfortable -even more so than the Queen Mary 2 that we’d travelled to NY aboard. So two wonderfully comfortable nights’ sleep which we very much appreciated. Breakfast again was ok - fairly basic self-serve but perfectly adequate, and friendly, helpful, smiley staff even at 6am. Very happy with our two night stay.

Great value for money. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. Bedroom very clean and beds comfortable giving us a good nights sleep. The complimentary breakfast had a good variety of hot and cold food each morning. Hot drinks available at anytime during your stay was lovely to come back to each day for a quick sit down and chill and talk to other quests to share ideas. Overall could not fault this hotel. We would definitely return. Great location too.

4 night stay in NYC and I was allocated a king room on floor 24. The room was small but clean and bed was comfy. Shower pressure was good despite the high floor room.Each floor only has 6 rooms so noise from lifts and other guests was minimal. The issue however is the windows offer poor sound proofing and the noise of vehicle horns, trucks all night and construction going on until at least 2am was very intrusive. Ear plugs did help but not ideal for a $250 per night stay. A room on the opposite side of the hotel may be better than those on the street side. The hotel only has 2 lifts servicing over 30 floors so at busy times you could be waiting a while or annoyingly stopping on what seems like every floor on the way up / down. Due the type of building there is not a lot can be done about this but worth bearing in mind. It's location is ideal for central nyc with most places walkable, and the staff are pleasant and friendly.Happy to recommend this hotel.

When we were planning our most recent trip to NYC, it was very difficult to find an available hotel for our dates that was also within our budget & offered the amenities we prefer (microwave & refrigerator). Our initial choice (the Element Times Square West) was a complete and utter disaster, as on the night we arrived, we discovered that despite a confirmation e-mail from them a few days before arrival, they had no room for us (which they attributed to "a computer glitch.") The end result was us being sent to a hotel in Queens, which we didn't get into until almost 2 AM.We had NO confidence whatsoever in that hotel following this incident & did not want to return there for the remaining nights we were in town.Thankfully, after checking my Hilton Honors app, I discovered this hotel was available at a good AAA rate for the rest of our visit to the city. So after telling Element we would not be returning, we made a reservation here--and I'm SO glad we did! When we arrived the next morning between 11 and 12, we were greeted by GM David & his awesome staff, who, after sympathizing with us about our unfortunate events of the previous night said, "We have a room ready for you; you can go on up and get settled." Totally unexpected and most definitely appreciated!We had a very nice, clean King room (1806) which was next to the elevator & offered a view of West 39th Street. Our bed was very comfortable! (I don't always sleep well when traveling, but definitely enjoyed some zzz's here.) Room size wasn't an issue for us & we didn't feel cramped in by it at all. While we missed having a microwave to warm up leftovers, it was great to have a mini-fridge for storing soft drinks, bottled water (and slices of Junior's cheesecake). Water pressure was good, although we did have to wait just a little bit for the warm/hot water in the shower. No issues with the complimentary wi-fi, either. We did experience some street noise due to construction on West 39th (Really? Who thinks it's a bright idea to fire up a jackhammer at 8AM on a Saturday?), but if you bring some earplugs/earbuds, you shouldn't have any problems. Most of all, it was wonderful to encounter such friendly staff members! Every time we went out and came back in, we received a genuinely warm & friendly greeting from those on duty. So thank you, thank you, THANK YOU Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South for coming to our rescue! We look forward to visiting you again in the future.

We were welcomed by the friendly reception staff. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is perfectly positioned for exploring New York sights and sounds and shopping. With a complimentary breakfast included it was a good way to start the day.. We had many conversations with the staff looking after breakfast who directed us to a shopping mall in Jersey. That was an experience to be recommended.

The main interest of this hotel is its location.Otherwise, beds are comfortable, full amenities are available on demand, rather quiet, free breakfast...Don't expect too much from the basic breakfast buffet, but, hey, it's free !Tea and coffee are available 24hrs in the dining room as well. Cookies are also offered in the lobby around tea time.Great lobby and room service staff ! They will be reactive, meet your needs and give you plenty of advice if you need...Downsides :Extremely tiny rooms (won't accomodate for a flat opened large suitcase), without fridges, with very little storage space : packed New York style ! You can walk and turn around in the bathroom... that looks abnormally big in such a context, yet it is not particularly roomy either.Don't expect either much natural light through the tiny windows and adjacent buildings. No windows in the dining room either.The fitness room offers a very minimal equipment, it is in the basement, close to the unwelcoming service area.Note that breakfast cutlery is 100% disposable plastic or cardboard, which does not show much environment care.

Many NYC hotels now routinely tack on an extra (often undisclosed or poorly communicated resort fee of $30-$40 PER DAY on top of the ridiculously high room charges and NY and NYC taxes (and Javits Convention Center fee). Not this property! Great service. Nice rooms, Handy location (in the Garmet District). Walk to Times Square AND the new Hudson Yards! Breakfast good but room too small. 2 elevators not enough for the property so a bit of a wait. Nice business center. Highly recommended. Tell NYC hotels you will NOT pay a resort fee. Midtown Manhattan is not a resort.

fun NYC trip, great hotel, wonderful staff and excellent location, good breakfast, easy parking, friendly and helpful staff, easy to walk to empire state, time square, central park, lots to see and do, thank you!

I happened to find this hotel one morning for a great price so I immediately booked it. The location was great being only a few blocks from Penn station, Time Square, the Theater district and so many dining options. Well worth it & the Staff was kind and helpful

We like how close this hotel is to the Port Authority. The check-in was very easy and fast- thanks Henry for being so welcoming and recommending the Irish Pub down the street for dinner - a nice place to eat after a long day of traveling. Our room had a king size bed, but the room was not that big (hey, you are in NYC), still, there was plenty of room for our luggage. The bathroom was very clean. Overall, a nice and safe place to stay in NYC.

My second stay at this hotel. Courteous friendly staff which will hold your luggage if you arrive before check in. Breakfast is more than adequate for your needs before a long day exploring the city. Times Square, The Port Authority, Madison Square Garden, Radio Music City Hall, the 24 hour subway system are all within walking distance. Overall, I would definitely stay here again when visiting New York. Prices vary greatly according to season and which day of the week you are staying.

I enjoyed my stay from beginning to end. Check in was easy and quick. Everyone on staff was pleasant and courteous. The room was set up very efficiently with a good shower and comfortable bed. Breakfast had a nice variety of choices.

3日間滞在。部屋は綺麗ですがホテルの前で建設工事中のためうるさくて眠れず。（2019/4)朝食はワッフルなどがある。コーヒーは24時間無料。ジムも併設されているが、機器は余りない。マンハッタンのホテル価格を考えると、このホテルは良心的。Staying 3 nights this hotel.Room is clean. Street is noisy, so it was difficult to sleep. Since construction is ongoing in Apr. 2019, in front of this hotel.Fine breakfast, waffle, breads, muffins, beagles, ham, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, yogurt, and some fruits. Coffee is free 24/7 at 1st floor.Small gym is also available. But equipments are poor.Thinking about hotel price in Manhattans, this hotel is quite honest and reasonable.I recommend it.

Checked in at around 7pm room was ready. The staff on check in were friendly and asked did I prefer a lower or higher room. I had no preference so I said give me the best you have available, you got it she says. Room 2306. 2 small double beds, a wardrobe, small desk and chair great, new clean bathroom, window curtain ill fitting and very draughty window which we didn't notice till bed time as air con was on when we arrived. The room was a good size for us, a couple and a 7 year old. Returned from dinner after travelling 12 hours we just wanted to sleep but that window was soooo noisy it was louder than being on the 747! I put ear plugs in, no better. I thought maybe this is the way it is as it's very busy outside so I just got on with it. By day 2 I was sleep deprived. The constant low hum was driving me crazy. I reported it at 6am, nothing. Again at 8am, then a nice maintenance guy arrived and said he'd fix it when we were out if that was OK. If he couldn't fix he'd request a move for the next 3 nights. Perfect. Come back later on and there is a ridiculous effort of some grey insulation tape around the window which did nothing! I rang down again, they will send someone up... Nothing. I got fed up in the end and blocked the bottom with towels. How ridiculous but I didnt want it to spoil our stay so I just got on with it. At check out they didn't even ask about our stay just took keys! Positives-Geraldine the breakfast ambassador is fantastic. Lovely, friendly, helpful with tips and looked after us-thank you! Breakfast was really good, fresh, varied, and well stocked. Around 8am it gets crazy but we were awake early so had lovely breakfasts. Took fruit out with us and also little lunch bags in foyer with water, snack etc in. Elevators were OK for us longest wait was 5 mins. The complimentary tea and coffee were fine and a nice touch. The bell boy was very helpful too. The lobby was often frequented by odd people not staying at the hotel, one lady was definitely homeless using the computers, she had all sorts of bandages on her really didn't give a good impression and then moved to the seats, getting all her belongings out of her bags and Irish receptionist did nothing to remove her... Not good enough really. Housekeeping was fine, clean towels, beds made, toiletries replaced each day. But I Would not stay again. Felt let down by the duty manager, reception staff who have limited customer service skills. Booked with virgin as a package and it wasn't cheap so I'll be feeding back to virgin ASAP.

Stayed one night after a broadway show. Hotel was super clean. Beds were so comfy and free breakfast in the morning was well stocked100% would stay here again. Staff even set up a balloon and card for my sisters birthday.

Accommodations at this hotel are excellent. The staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms, although small, are very clean and the beds are so comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is great.

We stayed at this Hampton Inn during spring break 2019. The room was rather compact but for 2 people it was fine. The location was in easy walking distance to Times Square and other attractions. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. We only ate breakfast a couple of mornings but the choices were good. We stayed on the second floor so although we didn't have a view, it was convenient to walk up and down to our room and not have to use the elevator. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

We liked our stay at this hotel. We were greeted warmly, check-in was easy. Rooms are small but that was expected. Room was clean, comfortable beds. Location was great. Easy to walk to the things we wanted to do. Quiet street. We liked the 24 hr coffee/tea, cookies in evening, breakfast in the morning. Perfect NYC hotel.

NYC springbreak/college visits. Stayed at this location 3 yrs ago. Room was clean, breakfast was ok, enough items to chose from to get enough to start the day. Elevators slow. Good location and value. Would stay again.

The hotel is very clean, friendly staff and a great location in Manhattan. I recommend using alternative parking across the street for much less than hotel parking. My family and I will stay in this hotel on our next trip in November 2019.

We stayed at the Hampton in February. We were given room 501. We first noticed how little room there was to get around. The bathroom had enough room to get around and I was able to transfer to the shower seat. The water was hot which was a welcome from the cold days seeing the sights. The breakfast choice was limited but a good start to the day. The hotel is in a great position just a short walk to the centre of Times Square. The front desk staff were welcoming and offered good advice on getting around. Hot drinks are available all day long and there were cookies in the reception in the afternoon. There were previous comments about the lifts which was a concern but we didn't have problem. There were comments about the breakfast room being too small but we always managed to get a table without waiting. If you want a good location and an accessible toom I would recommend this hotel.

Hampton Inn, Times Square met all our expectations. Price was reasonable, the staff was tremendous, the accommodations were perfect and the hotel is in a great location - quiet. We truly appreciated the attitude of hospitality by the entire staff. Well done team!

I always stay here. It’s very convenient and reasonably priced. Rooms are small, but I don’t go to NYC to sit in my room. Breakfast room is always crowded when tours come through, but there is always a good selection.

3rd time staying here and another lovely stay. The staff from front of house to breakfast staff are very friendly and welcoming. Even though some people have said about the elevators being slow at peak times and 1 elevator not working for a short period of time on one of the days I stayed I never had any problems with them. Tea and coffee 24 hrs a day just past reception is great, breakfast is good, room is good, clean, the bed is lovely and comfortable, and added bonus of having fridge in there also. No complaints here. Will keep continuing to book this hotel when I visit New York.

I stayed here for three night in early March 2019. The staff were professional and very helpful, always cheerful and keen to help and offer advice.The hotel is ideally positioned close to Times Square and a three minute walk from 42nd Street Port Authority Bus Terminal/Subway station, everything is close at hand. My room was on the 31st floor and of good size (I had been told all hotel rooms were small in NYC so maybe I just got lucky). All facilities were good and I will definitely stay here again when I return to New York.Thank you all.

Great spot within walking distance to the Theater District, Times Square, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden among many others. Reasonable price and great breakfast. Rooms are small but not uncommon in the area. They even held our luggage since they could not accommodate an early check-in. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Myself and my new husband stayed in this hotel in the last week of February and we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other guests.The location is great, a block from the port authority bus terminal so very central to Times Square and less than a 5 minute walk to Macy’s. Despite its central location, it was very quiet and we got a peaceful night’s sleep. The room was small but that’s to be expected in any central nyc hotel. The bed was comfortable, the a/c worked perfectly, good sized tv with all the satellite channels, and a plentiful supply of toiletries and towels. One of best things by far about this hotel in my opinion is the breakfast. They provide a great and varied range of hot and cold food, from bacon to waffles and cereals to fresh muffins and donuts. It was a busy spot in the mornings but the staff was constantly topping up the food to ensure there was enough for all. It really set us up for our day of exploring. Another massive bonus was the complimentary tea and coffee available in the lobby throughout the whole day, which was most welcome after a long day sightseeing in freezing cold temperatures.Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and hope to see you again some day soon!

Easy access to all subway lines and walking distance to many of the places we wanted to go in Manhattan area. The staff at all hours was very friendly and helpful. Good vibe all the way around. Would stay again.

We chose this hotel for our first trip to NYC due to its location and mostly very good reviews. The hotel did not disappoint. All the staff were friendly and professional. The room on the 30th floor was small, though clean and comfortable with a large bed. The bathroom had a large shower with everything you might need. Breakfast is included in this hotel. There is a good selection of hot fresh food and enough for the largest appetite. It does get very busy in the dining area at times.The location of this hotel is ideal for a first time visit with a subway close by to access the attractions and some local bars and restaurants within walking distance. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would certainly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

I really liked the way the staff kept in touch with me to make sure all was well throughout my stay. Crystal is the staff member who really made my Birthday Getaway the most memorable! Thanks Crystal!

Busy week and elevator issues for 2 days, but staff was over the top considerate, trying to make everything good and just plain great. From the Breakfast room staff and front desk to maintenance, all very positive and professional!

Nice hotel with a great room and comfy beds. Super close to the theater district and made walking to our show super easy. Nice staff and free breakfast in the morning. I would come back and stay here in a New York minute :-) loved our stay!

For NY, the city where a hotel breakfast is $22.00, this is a great deal. The rooms are modern, clean, nice. Maybe a bit on the smaller side but not by NY standards. A lot of amenities are packed into the room. Breakfast buffet is very good and the help attentive. Nice people at the desk. Grab an apple and cup of coffee on the way out.

Room was a bit small but other then that it was excellent.Breakfast is OK but a bit poor. Location is great and the service was very good.Highly recommended, especially when I consider the good money value.

I’m here at the moment. My 6th trip to New York and by far the worse hotel I’ve stayed in. Arrived yesterday, was 4pm by the time we got to the hotel and our room still wasn’t ready, to be fair I would rather they didn’t have a room for us! We have a room with 2 beds, there are 3 of us. There is nowhere to store your clothes - fine we can live out of the suitcase, great when there’s somewhere to actually put them! Currently they live by the door when we are in the room - god forbid we need to get out in an emergency! As soon as we wake we move them onto the bed so we can try and get ready. Nowhere to hang coats - basically no storage at all! I spoke to reception and they advised that all the rooms are the same size except floor 9 which has slightly larger rooms. They said they would hold a room on there for us to come back to tonight to move - got back and they had put someone else in there! I know NYC rooms are notoriously small but this is ridiculous Reception looks tired. The breakfast room and food are ok but it’s a free for all. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and if I hadn’t already paid I would be looking for somewhere else

Over all a Good inn to stay at in central New York With free breakfast and wi-fi . The beds were comfortable and no noise from the street. Nothing special just somewhere central to sleep, shower, and have a free coffee.

Literally a 5 minute walk from Times Square. Surrounded by restaurants. Sits in the heart of Manhattan with subway access , tour bus stops, and easy access to taxis within one block!The staff is AWESOME!!!!Nice breakfast selections each morning- and if you don’t like it, you have twoStarbucks and a couple other well known coffee shops within a 1-minute walk!!

1 block from Port Authority Bus Terminal. Very close to Broadway. 10-15mins to Madison Sq.Two lifts, 32 floors, so it can be quite a wait.Free beverages, brew coffee, teas, hot choc near the lobby. Sitting area for you to hang around.Room size is good. Walkway to room was small. Good wifi. Small coffee maker in the room.Shower is ok, but the sink tap took a while to get warm.Checkin staff can be improve to be more attentive to Customer who are checking inWaffles available for breakfast.

Great location. Rooms if a bit small are spotless and very well presented. Free left luggage facility is brilliant. Only criticism is the small breakfast area do the amount of rooms and guests sometimes had to wait for a seat
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: Amazing hotel great friendly staff perfect location to time square and you get breakfast to start your day off fantastic all round whilst we were there highly recommend very helpful when we asked for directions

Great staff. Great room, large comfy bed. Very good breakfast with lovely waffles, bagels, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, omelettes, sausage patties to die for! Hope to come back one day! Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend!

The hotel was always clean and the service was fantastic from all staff!It was in an ideal location for transport links and for walking to major sights such as Times Square and Empire State Building.The main downsides to the hotel were small room sizes (2 queen beds) and the wait for the elevators. Queues are very long for the elevators especially at breakfast times and waits can be up to 30 minutes which is quite ridiculous.The shower door in our bathroom was coming off the hinges as well but overall the room was comfortable and clean.Would consider this hotel in the future but would try alternatives for maybe a slightly higher price.

Stayed for 4 nights. Excellent location, short walk from Penn Station (took the LIRR to there from JFK).Short walk to Times Square.Staff were really friendly and helpful. Complimentary breakfast was ample, my daughter loved making her own waffles. It does get busy during peak times but we were up and out early so it didn’t bother us. Loved being able to help yourself to coffee at any time of day down in the lobby as well as the hot cookies which were served at reception daily. Special thanks to Jim who went in search of the cookies which hadn’t quite made it out to front desk when my daughter went down looking for them and he kindly supplied her with 3. Rooms are small as per the norm in New York but they are clean and the staff were brilliant. Always a friendly welcome back or a have a nice day when you were leaving. Would definitely return.

The front desk staff were extra-friendly and helpful. The hotel room was small (expected in NYC) but comfortable. I had no isues with the room size; the armoire and drawers held all of my belongings. The breakfast in the mornings was great; lots of food available, plenty of options, and I never had an issue with finding a place to sit. I wish the 'concierge' would have been a bit more knowledgeable. Both times I had questions about places to eat, the young girls had no idea what was around and had to use Google, which I could have done myself. The location was great, smack dab in Hell's Kitchen and bordering the Theatre district. I would definitely stay again.

This hotel was great! It’s conventiently located around Times Square and all thing fun in NYC. The checkin process was efficient and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was good, and having something hot to drink during the cold NYC days was amazing!

Easy and pleasant check in. My son and I allocated decent twin room on 17th floor with two good sized, brilliantly comfortable beds. Breakfast included in the price, but to be honest not the most inventive selection on offer, although it filled a gap. Hotel is located in a fairly quiet side street only 7 minutes walk from the brilliant madness of Times Square or Madison Square Garden. By the way, we found no problems with both elevators at any time during our 3 night stay.

The hotel is located in a great location . While during my stay the elevator broke down leaving only 1 lift working to serve staff and guest I was staying on the 28th floor , I waited in he lobby for over 6 mins and did not see the lift come down so I decided to walk up the stairs and took the stairs back down . When I came back to the lobby I saw the same people there waiting . All of my question I had about the area or every out of the area Kay Kay could answer , she was so helpful and always willing to help you out . My check out process was not the best the agent on and the duty manager that day where not helpful and they were very rude . It's because of the service I got from Kay Kay I will give this hotel another chance .

Stayed in room 1706, checked in good. Although I don’t agree with having to have $60 per day taken out of my account and only refunded 7 days after checkout. Got up to our room after a struggle at lift (area is far too small and too many congregate here) and settled down ok. Room was clean and functional. At night we heard an horrendous noise and found out it was the lift. This continued each night all night. On check out we were asked about our stay and explained it was very noisy. And the man replied well it is New York what was you expecting? He didn’t understand that internal noise was. Our issue and even after repeating to him he didn’t care. He dismissed it. Breakfast is included. But as the room is so small you can’t even get a seat. Tht is of course if there’s anything left. As they don’t replenish quick enough

When we first checked in, police were in the hotel talking to staff. Trash was in the front entrance of the hotel. We had cockroach issues. I have never seen a cockroach before until this stay. The refrigerator had one trapped, and a couple more that ran out from under the refrigerator. I have pictures and a videos of the cockroaches. I smashed one and it is stuck on the side of the refrigerator. The other ones kept hiding when we would try to smash them. The worst part is when I found a cockroach in my luggage. I put all of my clothes in bags, until I could disinfect everything when I got home.The shower door leaked so bad. When you got out of the shower the floor towel was damp. The sheets the first night were stained. My fiancé and I we’re extremely surprised in the condition of things. When we told the staff member in the hall way, he said “it is New York”, they are in every hotel. I call BS! I have been in New York 4 times and have stayed in hotels that don’t have these issues. I have stayed in about 85-90 hotel stays combined between Hilton, Marriott, and hotels.com bookings, and haven’t had a response like this when expressing a concern. I am a gold member of the Hilton program, and have never had service like this. I think if he would have handled it better, i would have been a bit less frustrated with Hilton. When we asked to change rooms the staff members told us it was New Years and everything was sold out, unless I we agreed to pay the new rate then they could see if there was another room. Our friends booked a hotel in the marriott, and invited us to stay with them after we told them about how gross our rooms were. The hotel would not refund us our stay so we can go book at another hotel. I have 6 documented emails to Benedicta the manager, and several documented phone calls, but they will never respond to me, and will not get me to the right people to talk to. The service at this hotel is terrible. I would strongly suggest inspecting your room before agreeing to stay in it.I could have stayed at just about any hotel with the $356 dollars a night that we paid. We definitely did not get our moneys worth.

This hotel's staff is by far the friendliest I have experienced! They were terrific! I enjoyed the free continental breakfast each morning. It was a great way to start the day!The location of this hotel is perfect. I really enjoyed my visit to the Big Apple!

The employees at this Hampton Inn went above and beyond their necessary task to make sure everything was taken care of not only for me but other guests as well Tim was the nicest person from early morning greetings to late night good night wishes. The ladies in the breakfast area went out of their way to make sure everyone's waffles were made perfectly as well as cooking more sausage just before closing time to satisfy guests request. I am looking forward to returning to New York and staying at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square South. I can't forget to mention the employees surprised me with a birthday balloon and New York teddy bear that I will cherish the rest of my life.

Great stay , good price , friendly staff . Hilton Honors member welcomes with a snack which was good. Breakfast was good, kids loved the waffles . Rooms small but in this location i assume most are. 10 minutes walk to times square . Good tv , clean bathroom , Coffee and Hot Chocolate etc available all day. Minor issue was my flight was cancelled and i rang reception to be given an offer $100 more than other Hamptons in the area.i was a bit disappointed to have to move hotel after spending 4 nights there.

Easy to reach either by cab or train/bus. Welcomed really warmly by two reception staff,David was super friendly and acknowledged us on a daily basis during our stay. We were on the 19th floor,our room was clean,the bed large and really comfortable. We always appreciate a fridge in the room,heating was easily regulated. Complimentary hot drinks are available downstairs and breakfast is part of your room rate which is hot and cold again the staff were really friendly. This is our first stay at a Hampton and definitely won’t be our last. Definitely recommend.

Good location, friendly staff, really huge comfy bed. Exactly what we were looking for. Ask for a high floor as it was so quiet, not what you would expect in New York. Yes the lifts can be a bit of a wait but hey, we are on holiday so not an issue. Loved the cookies, so yummy and so nice when coming in from the cold to take a hot chocolate up to the room. Husband also popped down every morning for coffee, such a treat. Breakfast very much appreciated too.

Shortly before departure my wife broke a bone. We needed to cancel the reservation three days before arrival. We called and asked if we could have an additional 12 hours to decide so that my wife could see a doctor first. The request was refused. We cancled the first night of the stay keeping the other three nights. We stayed in another hotel for one night. We felt that they could have extended the cancellation time for 12 hours in light of the broken bone. My wife had surgery and we were able to enjoy the trip with the inconvenience of having to book another hotel. Otherwise once we got at the hotel, the stay was pleasant and reasonable for the price. Breakfast was ok, but crowded. Staff were friendly.

Hotel was really nice and staff were very welcoming. All staff acknowledge us and took time to speak which was nice. Check-in was quick and the room was big enough for the 2 of us. We had a fridge in the room too. I think we had a accessible room as the bathroom was a wet room and the shower kept flooding the bathroom. There was a quite a few towels we could use. The breakfast area was cold some mornings. Limited selection of food, but nice. It did change slightly daily. Could have done with having baked beans. They have tea/coffee/hot chocolate all day, but no milk only cream. Cookies available at some point during the day but we were never around to try them unfortunately.We used the business room to check-in for our return flight. Check out was very easy and quick. They stow luggage too which is good.We used the subway to get to this hotel from JFK. We got the air train and then used the blue A,C,E line to 42st street and walked to the hotel. It took about 5-10mins

I booked the Hampton Inn because I have stayed at plenty Hamptons with no issues. Plus, they offer breakfast and that's hard to find hotels that offer breakfast these days. When we first arrived, we were unable to get into our room because it wasn't ready. We left our luggage and explored the city. It is just about 10 minutes walking from Times Square which was nice. After 5 pm, we came back and our room was ready. The room is small which is expected in New York. We took a nap and went back out. Returned to the hotel about 10 pm. The shower head was broke. Water was spraying everywhere. It took 3 phone calls and over 2 hours for someone to come and fix it. It's late, we were rained on and had traveled that day so just wanted a hot shower. That was annoying. Then the shower itself is super small. There was a huge handicap bar that you can hold onto in the middle of the shower on the wall so you couldn't move around good. The water pressure was almost non-existent. The next day, we went to breakfast and the room was just so small. They need a bigger area for people to enjoy their meals. We went out for the day, came back and asked concierge for some decent pizza places to order from. She was useless. A concierge should have a good idea of some decent take out. She had no clue. She just looked on her computer and did what I could have done, I would have done it better. So we ended up going out. Got back to the room and NO toilet paper! Sooooo, an hour later, we had toilet paper. Shouldn't housekeeping have checked that?Overall, the experience was fine. I was irritated because simple things like a shower working and having toilet paper shouldn't be an issue when staying at a hotel. Those are the main necessities.The location was good. The front desk help was good. Concierge is worthless. If you want a cab, walk down to the main streets because you won't get one in front of the hotel and there is no one there to help get one for you. Overall, it's decent for a place to sleep. The bed was comfy.

Would have rated this hotel as excellent if it were refurbished to a more modern standard.However you certainly get value for money.Check in/out experience was seamless.We found no problems with the wait time for lifts like some other reviews stated.The rooms are quite large, very comfortable and very clean.We had no problems at all with the complimentary internet speed.Breakfast was varied and certainly good enough to set you up for the day. Breakfast staff were particularly great, very friendly and helpful.Shower was lovely, hot and powerful.Overall I have no complaints, as I said, the hotel could do with refurbishment throughout. But if you need a well located comfortable base in NYC I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I took a group of 12 College students with me to NYC- and the Hampton was phenomenal in meeting everyone's needs. The staff at the front desk was fabulous. Also enjoyed the efficiency and friendliness of the breakfast staff.

Centrally located - short walk to MTA or any entertainment venues. Lots of places to eat. Its a very nice walk on 8th to Central Park, and a little more to Lincoln Center. The nearest MTA is 42th/PABS - catch the A or E line and you will be at the Airtrain. Cant get any simpler coming and going from JFK.

I did a lot of research on this hotel before staying here and read so much about the "bad elevators". It was barely a problem at all. Sure, there were only 2 elevators but it's not really a big hotel. The longest we ever waited was a few minutes, maybe 5 at the most and that didn't occur often. Sometimes we waited only seconds. Don't let this feature turn you off staying at this hotel. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. When we first checked in I could smell vomit on the carpet in our room near the aircon so the smell was being blown around the room. I mentioned it the next morning and that night we were moved into a new room and given a Macy's gift voucher for the trouble. We had free use of the laundry facilities in the hotel next door which was extremely handy. The rooms were a bit cramped but that's common in New York apparently and we got a good price as we booked 10 months in advance. The price of our room 1-2 months was almost double what we paid. The location was great, just a five minute walk to 42nd St subway and to Times Square. The staff would make fresh cookies each evening to grab on the way back through the lobby and they'd always say hello. The only disappointing thing I would say was the breakfast but I found this at a lot of the hotels we stayed at on our trip around America. It may have just been the budget we were sticking to also. There wasn't a lot of variety in the breakfast and it wasn't all that healthy. Maybe it's just the difference in cuisine. At least it was something to fill our bellies with before setting out each day. Depending on the time you went to breakfast, it could be busy but we never had nowhere to sit. There was 24 hr free coffee/tea/hot chocolate which was good at night. The rooms were clean too. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The breakfast is the only reason I've given it 4/5. There was a bit of construction noise too that occurred at weird hours. The floor you stay on doesn't really matter as I think you could hear traffic and other noise so matter what floor you stay on.

I generally stay at Hamptons since I am a Hilton Club member, and it's nice to expect and always get a well maintained room, great customer service and good breakfast. New York is the annoying limited space thing going on and this hotel's lobby and rooms are a result of that, but it still had the wonderful attributes of larger Hampton's in Texas!

The hotel is located a short walk from Time Square. The majority of places we visited were all within walking distance. The staff are very friendly and are happy to help if required. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel is close to Penn Station, Subway on 35th or Times Square. A nice selection of eating establishments on the street hotel is located on, really adorable Irish pub, unusual, Included breakfast was a nice extra.

Nice hotel with good service and excellent location. We had a family room for 4 people so was very tight. Breakfast was very busy and challenging to get a table. There are 32 floors with 5 rooms per floor and only two lifts so there is a long wait for the lift in the morning - up to 15 minutes.

Really nice homely hotel 5 mins fromTimes Square . Rooms a bit small , however in NYC it’s really only a bed for the night you need . Kids loved the 24hour hot chocolate that was free of charge . Breakfast included was great , it meant we could hit the ground running with the attractions we had booked and didn’t have to look around for breakfast venue . Reception staff were really friendly . Bathroom was a bit dated but what it lacks in modern decor it makes up for in location and the free breakfast .

Good location within easy walking distance to Tines Square, Empire State Building, the metro and most of the main tourist attractions in the city. Even Central Park was only a 30 - 40 minute walk away. The rooms were comfy but on the small side, not an issue for us as we spend no time in our room , it’s only to sleep!Breakfast is included and there is coffee and hot chocolate in the foyer all day which is awesome!

All the staff has excellent costumer service, so clean and good location, close to Subway, Time Square, Broadway Street and Fifth Avenue. You can go walking everywhere, restaurants and bar are so close too.

New Year’s Eve trip. This hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely accommodating and very friendly. The location was great. The price was a little high however we did stay there over the New Year’s eve holiday season. My only complaint would be the quality of the breakfast. But that certainly want to hinder me from staying here again.

I was being cook all the night, because the air condition doesn’t looks like work the time. I called the reciption, they find it next day. But still a little bit cook for me. Because the temperature can not justify. But people working at front desk is good. So l think this is good recommendation. Recommended.

You don't expect in NYC to get friendly, courteous service, but at this hotel it is their goal to provide that, and they certainly do. Neat and clean, easy access to the theatre district, a helpful staff that gives you a smile all the time, what more could you ask for.

Our third stay at this hotel. Great location and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and the breakfast is good. Can easily walk to Times Square, theater district, Macy’s, 5th Avenue shops, etc. Highly recommend!

Great staff, location and clean hotel. We were very pleased with our stay. Everyone in the family enjoyed it. Great breakfast. We love the Hilton brand. Both of our rooms were very nice. Slept well. When you come to NYC bring your walking shoes.

Just stayed here in December. Nice hotel and very close to everything without being kept awake by all the outside noise. Nice free breakfast if you want every morning and also had free cookies throughout the day.

I had a great experience with the friendly staff and the cleanliness of the room. I would go back to this hotel. There was a varied selection of breakfast and the eggs were delicious. Again, a wonderful experience.

Two people who had stayed in the hotel in the last year had come down with Legionnaire's disease. The health department investigated and found traces of the bacteria in the water in 6 of the rooms, so warnings were placed in rooms that if you have certain conditions, don't take a shower, etc... Why didn't they shut the place down until they were 100% in the clear?

We visited this hotel as 2 adults and 2 daughters aged 17 and 12 at the time of visit. I'd read mainly good reviews with the odd negative review. Yes, the rooms are a tad on the smaller side but if you're from the UK or Europe they are equivalent to a London, Paris or Rome hotel on a similar budget. I personally thought the rooms were very good. If you're in New York staying here then the room is a base. It's a really good base. The lifts can take a few minutes but just have some patience. I emailed prior with a couple of minor concerns and got prompt and very reassuring replies. We arrived at midnight local time and the staff are brilliant. The reception was busy but we felt like we were the only guests. I got up at 5am the next morning, got hot coffee from reception and wandered into Times Square at 530 on a Sunday Morning. Safer than walking in Central London at a similar time. If you complain about breakfast at this hotel then you aren't on the right budget. The food is fresh, loads of it, and the staff are really friendly. You may have to wait a few minutes for a table but so what. It's New York and won't take long. My wife emailed ahead saying out visit was for my 50th. I want to say a belated thank you to all the team at Hampton Inn for your fantastic gift it meant a great deal. I'd you want a good hotel, friendly staff, great food, Times Square about 7 minutes walk, subway 4 minutes and have a budget then this hotel fits the bill. My only criticism is the lovely biscuits available at reception Great stay and great Hotel. Thank you to all the team.

Excellent staff, very friendly and accommodating. Coffee and breakfast bars were very well stocked. Bed was nice and comfy, came equipped with a refrigerator which was nice and the bathroom had a nice and relaxing shower. Would definitely visit again.

My christmas eve stay with my Family. Was everything... My son got to spend his 16th bday there.It was a great feelin spendin time at the hamptons Inn hotel.... Would like to go again with the Family.. Thank you

Just returned from family trip and didn’t know what to expect. However this changed on arrival with the very friendly staff. Hotel and room very clean. Breakfast was good as eating out can be expensive. Location tucked away down 39th street was nice to get away from the main avenue. Would definitely recommend. Thank you

Stains on sheets, curtains and pills on duvets. Room seemed old. Maintenance entered without asking or letting us know they had been there. $60 hold per day for “incidentals.” Crap shower head. Found an old note in the room about people having legionaries disease and that they were replacing the shower heads. While we were out they entered the room with a Do Not Dusturb sign on the door and removed the shower head and left it. Maintenance using the same elevator as guests with mop buckets full of nasty water. Elevators are tiny and slow. Location is good if you like to eat. Staff was decently friendly but unforgiving concerning the $60 hold per night they put in your card for incidentals aka the snack bar in the lobby. Heat worked but smelled, tv good, internet good, beds comfortable, not a bug in sight. Check in was easy, no reservation issues. Location is great for Hell’s Kitchen and theatre district.

Stayed Friday night to catch an early morning flight Saturday , close to Penn Sration, took me about 35 min from hotel to AirTrain by LIRR. Convenient location to bars / restaurants, walkable to Times Square /Penn Station and subways

Terrible elevators, had to BEG for the cleaning service to come make the room most of the days, they shut down the hot water for THREE days, the room’s phone wasn’t working properly, slow internet and the list goes on and on and on. Avoid at all costs!!!!!!

We were treated incredibly well from check in, to breakfast, to check out. I would definitely stay here again. It felt like the staff went out of there way to be friendly. Loved it! The location is excellent and within 2 blocks of two subway stops. We walked and ride the subway everyday. Also a quick walk to Broadway shows and Times Square.

When we checked in we request a different room type but FD says its not available. When we looked at HH App they are still selling the room. Plus, breakfast say we can have it untill 11AM but when I arrive like 10:30AM they are not refilling meat anymore.

If you want somewhere away from the bustle of Times Square this is the place to stay. A very short walk from Times Square which is great for getting a good nights sleep. We cannot praise this hotel enough ! Every single member of staff should be proud of themselves. They are so welcoming and friendly and nothing is too much bother for them. We stayed there for 4 nights for our honeymoon. The staff left a lovely gesture in our room which was much appreciated. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with a fridge, coffee maker and good sized tv. The breakfast is great with a good choice whether you want hot or cold and you can fill up with as much as you want before venturing out for the day.Can’t fault anything apart from sometimes having to wait a while for the lifts !! The staff are what make this hotel the perfect place to stay in New York. We loved the free cookies every afternoon on return to the hotel and you can access free tea and coffee anytime in the lobby. Friday afternoon whilst waiting for our airport transfer was made more bearable by the friendly staff who provided free hot chocolate, brownies and Xmas biscuits.All in all an excellent place to stay in New York!! Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so comfortable and welcoming

Always great smiles when you check in and great breakfast.. Never disappointed me .. Has coffee tea stations along with large rooms with bathtub! Beautiful clean rooms!! Friendly stuff and great locations!

Just 2 blocks from 2 subway stops and the Port Authority terminal. Only 2 elevators so that was kind of a pain when a bus load of people arrived to check in. Breakfast is included. Be sure to ask for a room with a city view on a high floor. I was with my sister and the room is a little tight for 2 double beds (which were very comfortable.) Small refrigerator in the room.

New York hotels can be tricky but this stay was affordable and convenient. Room was a bit dated but if you manage your expectations and get a room that serves the purpose while being in the heart of the action then you are all set! Free appies on Wednesday night in the main floor lounge was a treat and staff were very nice.

The room and staff here were amazing. Location was great! Bed was comfy! Elevator was a little slow but really if that is the worse thing I can say about this hotel... I will be staying here again. It was a great recommendation from a friend of mine!

Stayed 4 day for the Macy's parade . Its 2 block from the parade route. This hotel is very well located in manhattan, we had a double room that was clean, well appointed and very comfortable. I can not say enough good things about the staff they bent over backwards to see that all the guest were happy. The complimentary breakfast was very good, also available 24/7 is coffee, tea and hot chocolate and in the afternoon warm cookies are in the lobby . This is a Great Hotel with a Great Staff it is a DEFINITE Stay Here

A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights recently and we had a great stay. While the room was smaller than some other hotels, we found it to be perfectly acceptable by NYC standards. Our double room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed. As mentioned in other reviews, the elevators can be a bit slow first thing in the morning but it was never really an issue. While the space did get busy, breakfast was always decent and hot and the staff did a great job keeping things clean and stocked so it wasn't an issue. All the staff were very friendly and helpful - lots of "hello!" " have a great day!" and "Welcome back!" as we would pass through the lobby or run into a staff member in the hall. We were walking distance to the subway and to most midtown attractions so the location was excellent. I would not hesitate to stay here again on a future visit to New York. Thanks for the great stay!

Very well run hotel, perfect location for a conference at the Javits Centre. Very friendly and helpful staff.Good complimentary breakfast, small but adequate fitness room, guest room was clean, very comfortable bed. Highly recommended.

We picked this hotel given the proximity to the theater we saw a play at. I have never stayed in New York, and had my kiddos with me, so was nervous not knowing what to expect. But we were very happy with the hotel! It was relatively quiet, even though we were near the elevator. It was so conveniently located, within walking distance of Times Square, our theater, and some great restaurants. We felt safe the entire stay. And the people there were wonderful - very friendly and welcoming. The icing on the cake was a hot chocolate and brownie bar after a long day walking in the cold and rain. The rooms are a bit small, but considering it's New York, and given the price, it was all good.

Staying for 3 nights with my son, left today. Came to see a play in Broadway and we are very glad that we found this hotel. Clean rooms, excellent customer service and the best complimentary breakfast in NYC. Shout out to Camila in the breakfast room who is very kind and was always trying to help everyone! We had no problem with the waiting time for elevators. Was a perfect NY weekend!

Pleasant staff, very helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and clean good choice of food for breakfast. Walking distance of most attractions and open top bus agents on the corner so it was easy to get around.

If you are going sightseeing, this is your hotel, excellent location, extremely clean rooms, and friendly helpful staff. Breakfast was included and was fabulous, thanks to the wonderful Yvette I can now make a mean waffle, with Amanda also there helping when needed. You could come in at any time and make yourself a cup of coffee, which was so welcome after a long day in New York. The only small thing our room was a tight squeeze for 4 of us, but as this same size would be used for one bed instead of two, then there would have been plenty of room. Having said that, I’d highly recommend this hotel, maybe just take two rooms next time.

I travel and stay at many hampton inn properties. This one provided me with exceptional service, ALL of their employees were very friendly and provided exceptional attention to my needs. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Good breakfast to set you up for the long days sight seeing.... rooms small but as we only slept in them at night as out all day fitted what we needed.... good shower... fridge...safe and TV.... usb charging points etc . . ... room 205 faced the flat roof and noisy air con / generator which was annoying if you woke in the night bit our other higher floor rooms not an issue ....would use this hotel again

Every aspect of my stay was truly amazing. Henry and the front desk staff welcomed me with open arms, my room was impeccably clean, and Amanda and the breakfast staff took the time to chat and make me feel at home. I should also mention that the breakfast was delicious! I stay at many hotels with my work, and this was a breakfast that had something for everyone, and had nutritious and delicious food.

Myself & friend recently stayed here for 4 night & we had a brilliant time. The hotel is in a good location only a few minutes walk to Times Square, bars & restaurants. Our room was on the 32nd floor & had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. The room itself was lovely, very clean & comfortable. We had 2 double beds which were really comfy. The only downside was there wasn’t enough wardrobe space which wasn’t a problem for the 2 of us but I can imagine if there is 4 people in the room it would be. The breakfast was really good. A selection of hot food, cereals, fruit & a waffle maker. There was also hot drinks available all day. The staff were all very polite & friendly, thank you for making our trip to New York amazing!!

The night shift clerk was fabulous! Very attentive and great at her job. The only thing I can complain about is the fact that Hilton honors didn’t give me points for my other nights I spent here. I love it otherwise!

Stayed here for one night post cruise in late October. The hotel is a few blocks from Times Square on a quiet side street close to the Cruise Port and about a 35 minute cab ride from LaGuardia in normal traffic. Make sure you have the exact address as there are several Hampton Inns in NY. Staff are friendly and very helpful. The lady at the Concierge was pretty useless and not nice. Considering that as a traveler new to the area they would staff the Concierge with a better person. Rooms are small, typical for New York, a very compressed area, however comfortable. The beds firm with lots of pillows. Storage is in a small cabinet with little space. This is a tall thin high rise building and unless you request a top floor room there is little to no view of the city. The bathroom was adequate for our needs and the room very clean with plenty of towels. Due to the size of the building the rooms are very close to the elevators and are noisy at times. Elevators are a joke. We were on a higher floor and sometimes it took 15 minutes to go up or down with the foyer space being a tight squeeze to wait. Breakfast is included and offers a good selection of hot and cold foods. Suggest getting there before peak times as seating is limited although tables turn over frequently. Considering the price and location The Hampton Inn Times Square is an excellent value. We would stay there again.

I traveled with 14 college students for an overnight in NYC. Henry and his staff went above and beyond to make our stay special - assisted with directions when needed, stored our luggage before and after check-in and check-out, easy and seamless check-in.. Hotel is clean, modern and up-to-date. Delicious breakfast choices.

Just back from a 3 night stay and I can't praise this hotel enough. Location is excellent, which was one of the primary reasons we picked it, along with price and the fact it doesn't charge an extra resort fee like some other hotels. On arrival we were greeted by such helpful and friendly staff, checking in was a pleasure and our room was delightful,clean and modern with everything you could need. We took advantage of the hot breakfast every morning, food was lovely and set us up for the day. Being from the UK the time difference meant we were early risers so pretty much had the breakfast area to ourselves, although we did notice it got busier later. We can't fault this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Thanks to all the staff for making this a great place to stay.

Very clean hotel; loved my small NYC room; and definitely look forward to returning again. Henry, Robinson, and Steven made our stay a smooth transition from check-in to valet parking to storing our luggage to checking-out.

Although the hotel was central to everything, extremely clean and most of the staff helpful we did find the room a little small for 3 adults. Nowhere to put your clothes except a single wardrobe, no drawers so we had to live out of our cases all week. We asked twice for extra large towels but never got them. The lift was a nightmare sometimes having to wait up to 10 minutes to get back to your room after breakfast.

Henry was excellent! I had a great experience working with him. He was professional and extremely accommodating. Will definitely visit this location again! Looking forward to next year's BDNY group trip!
