I really can't say enough about how great the staff was for my stay. Handled a noise issue immediately, helped me map out the area for some work supplies I needed ... greeted me with a smile and really left me feeling like I had a whole support structure for my stay! Location-wise it's near all the Midtown transportation hubs - Port Authority is a block or two away and Penn Station is about 10 mins with luggage. 9th Ave has great quality ethnic shops that are much better price points than the chains on Times Square or any of the hotel restaurants. Small business center is adjacent to the lobby and in my case, perfect for when I had a question. Rooms are normal for the area and had nice side tables. Really this is a place to stay for the staff and location. Breakfast hours are LONG so that was great to be able to grab a yogurt on my way out after having eggs and sausage a few hours earlier. Stay here for a hassle-free experience in MidTown.

I was in town with a group from Baltimore for a design conference that took place at the Javits center. The location was perfect and the staff was friendly. The room was spotless and breakfast was delicious. I was greeted anytime I came and went from the hotel. They even held our bags, free of charge, so that we can get them out of our way before check-in. Once we checked in, all our bags were provided to us and the stay was very pleasant. They also have valet parking which was very convenient.

We had a wonderful trip to NYC. Loved that this hotel was within walking distance of Penn Station, Broadway and Times Square! The staff was extremely nice and breakfast was above average! The room was comfortable and very clean.

I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights to see a show. The location is great, it's outside of Times Square so a little less busy but close enough to easily walk to lots of different areas. There are great restaurants nearby and also close to Penn Station. The rooms were definitely the smallest of any Hampton Inn I stayed in, but this is probably a city thing. The breakfast was typical, there was a gym and standard amenities in the rooms, along with a fridge. I would definitely stay here again when staying in New York City, I liked the area and the staff was friendly.

Located very close to Times Square, Hampton Inn by Hilton is an excellent property on various fronts - very warm & helpful staff members, nice spread at breakfast, freebies (tea / coffee / fruits) throughout the day et al. However, the one area where the hotel can do better is the size of the rooms & storage space. Overall, a very good experience.

Very friendly, helpful front desk. Room was clean and design updated. If on an upper floor, elevator can b slow as only 2 and housekeeping uses them all day as well. Otherwise a good place to stay. Standard fare for free breakfast.

Just returned from a great trip to New York with our grown up kids. The hotel was really good value. Location is pretty good, close to Times Square. Rooms are fairly small and there is very little wardrobe space, however the room was fine, linen changed a couple of times during our stay and always lots of clean towels every day. Bathroom was fine and always stocked with toiletries. There’s a fridge and safety box which is handy. Check in and check out was veru quick and efficient.The staff were helpful and very friendly. Lifts were a bit of a problem during busy periods and if you’re on a high floor you often have to wait a while. We didn’t bother with breakfast as the room was always crowded and not much left.Would definitely recommend this hotel as a great base. Good value and lovely staff. Would use this hotel again.

Very close to Times Square, walking distance. Rooms were not large but very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and lady in charge was friendly and interesting to talk to. When in the Lobby the consiere was very helpful, had lots of suggestions and found good deals for Broadway shows. Also the Hampton was only a few blocks from Madison Square Gsardens, we walked there to see basketball.

We enjoyed our stay so much. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and bright. Complimentary breakfast offers several hot and cold food choices, It’s a 10 minute walk from Times Square, Broadway and 20 minute walk to Central Park.

Courteous staff, very attentive to a guests needs, extremely welcoming staff, great place to stay when visiting the city. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable, highly recommend, wouldn’t hesitate to book again.

The most appropriate place to stay as is convenient to many place of interest; esp Times Square. Also near Empire State Building and Amazon book store is also opposite the Empire State Building. Good location

(we are French) Really pleased by our 4 night stay (included Halloween) in this newly renovated hotel. Room & bathroom extremely nice CLEAN COMFORTABLE (thanks++ room staff). But (my star off) Room quite small (difficult w/ big suitcases) and 24th floor = long waiting for the lift. GREAT continental Breakfast w/ waffles, eggs, bread, dairies, hot drinks every day. Staff very kind. Ideal location. Deco, make-up candies for Halloween so funny My only star off is also the price, but central location worth !

We stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased. The staff were what made the hotel- so friendly! There was a great range of food at breakfast- bagels, toast, sausages, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, cereals, cakes and a waffle maker! There was a 24 hour drinks station open which also supplied fruit to eat. Complementary cookies on reception at 5pm each day too! Our room had two double beds which were good size and comfortable but didn’t leave a lot of room for our cases. We had a tv and WiFi was free too. Very happy with our stay and would visit again.

Nice hotel in a strategic location. You can eat in Hell's Kitchen and see a play near Time's Square. The location on 39th street is quiet. Nice rooms and relaxing bedding.The reasonable price and central location make this a great hotel for visiting Manhattan.The E train is very close.

Stuff are amazing at this hotel. Room was very nice with two queen beds which very rare find near Time Square or Manhattan in general. Complimentary breakfast was good with some fresh New York bagels.

Our stay at the Hampton inn/times square was very pleasant from the moment we walked in and were greated by Farrell. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was beyond efficient. The location was very convenient for our plans.We would definitely stay here again.

The Hampton Inn is located just off Times Square South tucked away on a quiet street but close to all the action. It is a tiny hotel but has all the amenities of a larger establishment. The complimentary breakfast is exceptional with tons of choices to satisfy the hungriest of morning people to those who prefer a lighter meal. The rooms are small but adequately works for a couple or 2 friends needing separate beds. The beds are very nice as in the linen and towels provided. Lastly it is the staff who really make the difference with everyone at the ready to help answer all your questions with a smile. Would highly recommend this hotel if looking for a good deal in midtown Manhattan.

I have stayed in a number of top hotels around the world (I tend to stay mostly in 5 star properties - the last time I was in NYC my wife and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria).This visit was with the kids (aged 16 years and 13 years) so we needed a reasonably priced hotel in a good location.After much researching we settled on the Hampton Inn Times Square South.We arrived on a Saturday around 3.20pm and we very quickly checked in - all the staff were friendly and very customer friendly.We booked a room with two double beds - the room was clean and the bathroom was also well presented - the size of rooms in big cities such as NYC and London are small so you have to factor that in. The Neutragena toiletries are a nice touch as is the compliments wi-if.We stayed 4 nights and the location was excellent - off 8th Avenue and a short 10-15 minute walk to Times Square.The complementary breakfast is a good addition as this saves money and it is plentiful as are the complimentary all day tea and coffee in the lobby.The free sweets at Halloween was a nice addition .The staff are generally very friendly and helpful - so why is one star knocked off? Well we had a blocked sink and despite twice bringing this to the hotel’s attention it remained blocked.However despite this we really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

Rooms are to small for more than one person. There is no where to put a suitcase. The room was not cleaned when we returned to the room. Elevators are a problem as they are frequently full and you end up waiting for awhile.

The hotel is in a convenient location - walking distance from Penn Station and close to many subway lines. Also, there are many great restaurants right near the hotel. The staff was very friendly, proactive, and helpful. There is a free breakfast and coffee in the hotel. The business center is also very convenient.

We recently spent 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Times Sq South and cannot recommend it highly enough! We travelled to NYC to celebrate my daughter’s 21st Birthday and could not fault any part of the stay here. The front desk and management team are super friendly and welcomed us brilliantly! They had laid on a lovely surprise in the room for my daughter and we were all blown away! The room was spotless, beds super comfy, enough room for 3 ladies and luggage (& additional shopping!) Fridge and safe in room were much appreciated and daily housekeeping faultless! The location was excellent for us and we felt safe coming to and from hotel at all times. The breakfast room is a fantastic bonus and really well stocked, yes it does get busy but we never had to wait very long! Ok...we are British so really don’t mind a little queue...we were expecting issues with the lifts but once again...had none! The hotel even loaned us umbrellas on our last day when the weather turned from Sunny to torrential! Thanks so much to David, Harry & all the staff for such a fantastic stay! We will be back!

We stayed 6 nights here and found everything comfortable, smallish room although to be expected in NYC. Great location, close to Times Square, right next to Port authority bus terminal, breakfast was nice but gets really busy most mornings we were there (8-9am). The kitchen and breakfast staff did a fantastic job in keeping everything topped up. The only negative is the noise from the building site opposite, woke us up 5am! Thanks to all the staff for being friendly.

Checked in very late (1AM) and was given the last available room. Not sure if it was bad luck, or a front desk strategy to wait as long as possible to assign this room, but it smelled. Badly. Had a very musty odor. Like if you leave you clothes in the washing machine too long and don't dry them, kind of smell. I went to the front desk to ask about moving rooms, and they were 100% full. To their credit they offered me a refund if I wanted to change to a different hotel, but it was 130AM by this time and we were tired.Not sure how this one gets the 'Hampton' name on it. Relatively old, barely adequate cleanliness (besides the smell), elevators were HORRIBLE (as others have pointed out). I understand that my expectations need to be different in a hotel in a major urban center, but I still have a basic expectation of a hotel that carries the Hampton brand.

Staff were friendly. Rooms were smallLifts were a nightmare, waiting ages to a lift to come.Breakfast was nice although not enough room to suit 32 floors worth of people. The noise from outside was ridiculous. We were on level 5 and each night/morning we were woken up by construction workers outside at 4:30am.

I cannot say enough about the management and staff at the Hampton Inn Times Square South! They were extremely kind to me on my recent visit to New York City. Due to hurricane Florence I was stuck in New York for three extra days due to my travel arrangements home being cancelled. I was already booked there for two days and had to hastily add 3 more. Henry, the manager on duty, was more than helpful by allowing me to keep my room, instead of having to check out and wait for the new reservation to take effect. He showed genuine concern for my situation and could not have been nicer! The same can be said for the other manager David, and the entire front desk staff. Whether it was a friendly hello or wave as I came and went, or a bag with an apple, water, and granola bar when I missed breakfast, they truly could not have been nicer! Aside from their kindnesses, the hotel was neat, clean and the room was well appointed, up to date, and very comfortable! So again, a BIG thank you to Henry, David and the entire staff for all their help and kindness to me!

Needed a hotel with easy access to MSG and Broadway - this fit the bill perfectly! Overall, staff was pleasant and helpful (concierge needed some help). Rooms were clean and quiet. Breakfast was easy. We would definitely stay here again.

This Hampton Inn consistently provides friendly, helpful staff, comfortable, updated accommodations and a convenient location within walking distance of Times Square, theaters and many NYC attractions.

We are a family of 3 our daughter is 15yrs & we stayed at this hotel for 8 nights & would stay again!All the staff are amazing & friendly, the hotel is spotless & a great variety of breakfast choices every morning!.Also free hot chocolate or tea/ coffee every day in the lobby & early afternoon free cookies,there is also a microwave!Our room was fab the size was ok for NYC & we had a fridge, safe & free Wi-fi!I would pick this area anytime over staying in Times Square which is so busy day & night with some really annoying characters bothering you at every available minute! Also right around the corner from the hotel there is loads of restaurants & food places & you are close to the bus station!.We felt very safe here we went early & late at night!

Very nice hotel in great central location. We stayed for over a week. Rooms were nice, clean, thoughtfully equipped and well laid out. The breakfast buffet is excellent and the continuous complimentary hot drinks available behind reception, plus the warm fresh cookies daily on reception, were a very welcome bonus. However, the star of our stay was the extremely warm and friendly staff. ALL the staff, porters, cleaners, maids, reception, caterers, made us feel welcome each and every day. They weren't just polite and helpful, they were genuinely warm and welcoming. It made our stay really special. Thank you.

Stayed there with my family this past weekend. Our room was on the 29th floor. Well equipped with Micro-Fridge, Room Safe and a Coffee Maker! Within walking distance to Times Square and many restaurants. Guest room was on the smaller size but well designed! The complementary Breakfast Buffet was well stocked and replenished! Staff are professional and friendly! Will stay there again.. Thanks a lot!

I booked this hotel through a website set by my company. It said one rate, but I was charged a higher rate. I called and they tried to tell me it was taxes and fees. It wasn't. I only added up room rates and came up over charged over $100 more. When I called again, I was told that they would look into it and i would receive a refund on my card. When that didn't happen within the expected 5 business days, I called again. They didn't even have the refund recorded.I will say I had an extremely pleasant stay here. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room, while expectedly small since it's NYC, had plenty of outlets and amenities. I even used their business center while there and was pleasantly impressed. The breakfast was varied enough that I didn't get bored with the food. The 24/7 coffee bar had tea, hot cocoa, and a microwave, which I was able to use for my delicious Italian leftovers. The hotel itself does not have room service on site, but there is an outside room service available (be prepared for about an hour wait) which was convenient and reasonably priced.If it wasn't for being overcharged and then being given the run around about refunding, it would have gotten 5 stars for me, but I feel as if I've been cheated.

Very nice hotel, not far from Times Square. The rooms are a little small but clean with nice beds and shower. Clean and neat, everyone on staff smiles, friendly and helpful should you have questions. Continental breakfast is good and, although the room can get crowded, the staff is quick to clean tables and help you get seated. A little expensive, but what isn't in NYC.

Stayed for two nights to attend a Broadway show and visit the 911 memorial site. Staff was so helpful giving directions and assisting us with any questions. Room was small but typical Hampton - comfortable and clean Complimentary breakfast was good!

I had a work dinner for my husband in Times Square, and this hotel offered a great location. It was a quick walk into Times Square. I've stayed at other hotels in the city, and this was comprable. The rooms are not overly large, but offered a nice amount of space. Bathroom was tiny, and had a stall shower. Overall, the hotel seemed to be pretty well kept up, and we did not have any issues.

We liked the location of the hotel in proximity to the theaters and Times Square. The hotel was overall well kept. We did find mold in our shower though and a cockroach joined us for breakfast. Wouldn’t stay again based on those things and nothing taken off the bill for it. Management never contacted us after reporting

Great location within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Bryant Park, NYC Public Library, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Right around the corner from Port Authority Bus Terminal. Hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They let us check-in 3 hours early, and held our bags for 6 hours after check-out! Room was small but very clean and comfortable. Good breakfast. The breakfast staff was extremely friendly and accommodating! Wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.

The location is NOT great for those who are walking or riding the subway. It's not really even in Times Square, but it is only half a mile away, so that's not the main problem. The problem is that 39th street, between 8th Ave and this hotel, is really sketchy. 39th is your walking route to get to the subway or Times Square. Once you get to 8th, it's less sketchy, but you first have to walk past homeless people sleeping on the street at all hours of the day, others openly smoking pot, and various other R-rated situations. Not our first trip to NYC and we know what to expect, but this area was definitely worse than expected. The closest subway stop is 2/10 mile away, the 42 St - Port Authority Bus Terminal and subway station. Unfortunately, this station only serves the A-C-E trains, which are not the main trains for tourists. We found ourselves mostly walking 1/2 mile to the Times Sq - 42 St station, which services the N-Q-R-S-W-1-2-3-7 trains, which will take you virtually anywhere, and this station is actually linked underground by a VERY LONG passageway to the Port Authority station, which can be extremely HOT, but can be very convenient, especially if it is raining -- duck underground at the nearby Port Authority station and walk to this station. The subway is expansive and you can purchase a 7-day unlimited pass for $33, which is a bargain. Regarding the hotel ... there's only 6 rooms on each floor, but it is 30+ floors tall. Our 2-double bed room was extremely small, even by NYC standards, based on our experience. The staff were very nice and accommodating, especially the staff serving breakfast. Breakfast was nice each day. One day Housekeeping did not service our room at all and another day had not serviced it by 5 pm, but the front desk sent towels when requested. In retrospect, I wish we would have stayed elsewhere -- location of the Hampton Inn Times Square Central appears MUCH better and worth a few $ more.

Great location. Friendly staff. Small rooms but the friendliness of the staff made up for it. Breakfast was ok but could definitely use some upgrading.Bedroom and bathroom were very clean. Cleaning staff were very helpful and friendly.

We enjoyed a clean room, friendly helpful staff, and good complimentary breakfast. This location was within a reasonable walk to Times Square, The Highline, The Circle Tour at Pier 83, and the Theater District. Plenty of good restaurants close by too.

Took my niece (13) and her mom for girls weekend. Location was so easy to get to the many places we explored. Front desk staff was very accommodating and friendly. Breakfast on par with other Hampton Inns. Nice to have that included. Our room was away from elevator. If you're sensitive to noise I'd suggest that because halls are small and some rooms seem like the open onto the elevator. Beds comfy. Rooms smallish but in good shape.

Basic hotel with small rooms but hey its NYC. Rooms are clean and functional but we had a family room and it was literally a double room but with two double beds squeezed in, we had to sit on the bed so the other person could stand up - didn't bother us as we were hardly in there and just a base for us. Fab location on 39th , 5 min walk into Times Square. For the price could not complain , but please remember it is a base and not a luxury hotel. Breakfast was awesome as came FOC with the booking.

Our stay here was great! The rooms were kept clean. It is centrally located. We walked to everything. The service was exceptional! Very friendly and helpful staff. Always greeted coming and going. They went out of their way to help you.

our stay here was good..great location..central for all the sights..fab staff will do anything to help you...good breakfast.good variety hot or cold.good clean rooms.free beverages on 24 hours .we recommend this hotel.. 26.09..2018..

We were only in the city for a night and this was the place to stay! It’s right off main Times Square so you’re not hearing the noise from the street but being so close it’s an easy walk! Concierge was great (wish I could remember her name) she was very helpful though with our one day of “touring” the city. Breakfast was good, go early though, it get CROWDED

The hotel itself is in a good location - pretty easy to get around and close to Time Square. The facility is clean and well kept and the rooms are standard NY size - comfortable beds. What made this property stand out for me was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. My one night stay and experience was awesome.

Good location on a quiet street near Port Authority. Only a few mins from the heart of Times Square and a few mins walk from the Herald Square/Macys area. Staff were friendly. Beds were very comfy. However I do think the carpet could have been cleaned better. Free tea/coffee in the breakfast area which is a nice touch.

Last minute booking, we were able to get a room which was great! Upon arrival we were able to leave our luggage as we were too early for check in . Location is outstanding very convenient! Staff was friendly.

Very quiet. Staff personable. Super clean. Nice quality furniture, sheets, towels, carpet, and fixtures. Food was outstanding with hot food selections different each day such as omelet, eggs, fried potatoes, baked French toast sticks. Always fresh. One day there were even Boston cream donuts even! What I like best about the hotel was the staff was professional and helpful, the hotel everywhere I went was clean and that is important to me. Not only that the hotel is close to everything.

We were driving down the east coast and had two nights in New York. This is walking distance to many restaurants and stores. Remember this is New York, so real estate is more expensive. This hotel was not up to what we normally expect from Hampton Inn. That said for the area and experience, this is probably a good option. Valet parking was good, ample breakfast area and good location. Remember this is downtown NY so you would probably take Uber or taxi to get around. One night we watched people walk faster down the street than our taxi cab during rush hour. Areas not to miss: World Trade Center, Chelsea Market, Times Square.

We stayed at the hotel over the Labor Day holiday. From our arrival to departure, the experience was excellent all round. This is a very “compact” Hampton Inn with all it’s hallmark features in a small footprint. 6 rooms per floor and 32 floors makes it a good sized hotel that uses all available space very efficiently. Staff are very friendly and helpful, were very welcoming of all guest and helped everyone move right along. The location is optimal for a visit to NY city. Less than 15 minutes walk from Penn station and Times Square right close to great food in Hell’s Kitchen this property is in a perfect location. A lot has been said about the elevators in other reviews, patience gets everyone to their destination floor without too much delay. A slightly cramped lobby area and room size is the only drawback but remember it’s the center of NY city. The friendliness and efficiency of the staff and familiar Hampton features overcome any concerns. Great value for the price. Highly recommended.

We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn. The room and bathroom was a good size, the bed was huge and there was a very good air conditioning unit much to our relief. The staff were friendly and helpful too.Location is great! Between 8-9 Ave. so 10 mins walk from Time Square, 10 mins from Macy’s, 20 mins walk from Central Park, close to Penn station and the tourist bus rides. Having Hell’s Kitchen on 9th Ave with a huge range of bars and restaurants was a big plus. The walk along 9th between 40-54 street is lively in the evening and should have something for everyone.Some people have complained about the renovations happening; to be honest we didn’t get affected and they were painting through the night in reception to try to avoid disruption. The only downside to the hotel is you can wait a little while for the lifts particularly after breakfast. Also be prepared for a possible wait for the breakfast buffet if you get up the same time as everyone else - there is a nice / tasty range of food and the waffle maker was fun to use!

Let me preface this by saying I still in Hilton Hotels roughly 30 nights a year. In my opinion this hotel does not meet Hilton Standards. I was a late check in on Friday evening, I called the hotel at 9pm to let them know I would be arriving late. Upon my arrival the front door was locked, and the front desk refused to let me in without a room key, so tell me, how was I supposed to check in? I had to actually CALL the front desk from the door to have her let me in. I utilized my E-Check in service from my application to speed up my check in time, NOPE. I spent 35 minutes standing in the lobby waiting for the person on the desk to HAND ME KEYS. That is all they needed to, my credit card had already been authorized, and I had already verified my information. The point of E-Check in is to expedite the check in process, and this certainly did not happen. The person on the front desk did NOT follow E-check in protocol at all. The hotel advertises itself as recently renovated, while this may be true for some the furniture, the carpet in my room was stained, and looked dirty, and the bathroom mirror was chipped and scratched. The hotel is also crammed into a very tight building, elevators are hard to access, they are in a weird spot, and they move extremely slow, if I was not on the 23rd floor, I would've used the stairs. The neighborhood isn't very nice either, I have stayed all over Manhattan, and this was one of the few hotels I did not feel comfortable walking to late at night.As a loyal Hilton Honors Gold member, I would not stay at this hotel again.

Good locationProperty is under construction, which is an inconvenientRooms aren’t good: too smallAppearance on the hallways aren’t pleasantBreakfast was OKStaff were somehow helpful My room was facing the street and the curtain didn’t cover the glass window at all.

This was a great place for our vacation in NYC. Great location. Family enjoyed the breakfast. The buffet was busy but overall well managed. The room was a bit tired looking. Wall paper coming off in the bathroom and the doorframe starting to rust. Tiny flatscreen TV that was acting up repetitively. Room cleaning ok, but again not great. Bottom line: great location, friendly staff but needs some TLC

I researched hotels in Manhattan for several hours before selecting the Hampton Inn Times Square South and I was not disappointed with my selection. I wanted a nice, modern hotel at a reasonable price that was centrally located and included breakfast. I got the room at a price that was better than any of the 3rd party websites by going to Hilton.com and requesting the AAA rate. Also, Unlike many of the larger hotels in the area, there is NO Resort Fee, which would have been a dealbreaker! This place was just what we wanted and it was topped off by the most amazing staff! We were welcomed by Jim when we arrived. Jim’s humor and smiles were refreshing after our long trip. Next morning at breakfast we were greeted by a pair of magicians, Junior and Amanda. I call them magicians because a swarm of guests would wipe out the food and in a few minutes the buffet would be restored ! The always smiling Leticia would help out at times while still supporting the front as well! After things calmed down, supervisor Mabel stopped by our table as she helped the other staff to recover from the breakfast crowd. Because this guests at this hotel were mostly tourists, most of us would sleep in a bit later than the business guests, there would always be a swarm of guests between 8 and 10 am that would overwhelm the elevators and breakfast area. The staff handled this amazingly well! I would also like to thank the management for continued breakfast service after the 10 am posted closing time. So many other properties that I have visited will start dismantling the buffet 30 minutes before closing time so that everything is gone at closing. Not at the Hampton Inn! And this is one of the many reasons that I will stay here the next time I visit NYC! I almost forgot a few other things. The hotel has a fairly small footprint with only 6 rooms on each of the 32 floors and the rooms are smaller than I have experienced at Hampton Inns elsewhere, but the rooms are great! It had at least 9 USB charging ports and a dozen 110v outlets all within easy reach. There is storage behind the mirror in the bathroom AND the cabinet has a mirror on both sides of the door! It’s a great affordable hotel that is convenient and centrally located in Manhattan. Can’t ask for much more!

This was a surprise getaway from my bae. Though we always try to get out NY, he decided to try something different. Never thought I/we would have enjoyed the city so much. Minutes or should I say a short walk to Times Square and also 34th Street Herald Square. This location is close to shopping, food etc. The hotel is very clean and staff is friendly. For those who want to visit NYC I would suggest this location. There is so much to do in the city but when you live and work there you just don't want to be bothered - we were actually very relaxed. Looking forward to the next city getaway.

The location is good with a quick walk to Times Square. Great to launch your New York adventures. Room were clean. Shower was great.Bed was comfortable Wi Fi was great and the rooms had usb Potts which help of you do not have a USA plug or adapter.Breakfast perfect to start the day off with. Cereals, oatmeal, egg, sausages, juices, etc.Great friendly staff.

That is the biggest thing - the staff, they are kind, friendly, just plain lovely people. They made the experience fantastic. The location is also good - close to Times Square and transit of various sorts. The gym is small and hasn't any windows, but never was busy (had it to myself). The room wasn't big, but there was nice space downstairs int he breakfast area where I could sit (no windows there though).The breakfast has a variety of options, and they even had almond milk for me!The TV was difficult to figure out - we couldn't find any TV listings, so just had to flip through (the front desk didn't know anything either).

Although the room was very small, it was clean and had everything we needed. I was on vacation from California with my 13 year old granddaughter and the location was perfect for what we wanted to do. The breakfast was good and well-stocked and enough to get us going for the day. Typical continental breakfast but clean and fresh. Front desk staff were always attentive, friendly and available.

Too crowded. Breakfast doesn't even have basic scrambled eggs for kosher or halal food. Eggs with ham only? What the hell. Theres only 1 washroom in the basement. Rooms are tiny and very small. Never again I will come back to this hotel.

We stayed here for 8 nights while my daughter attended a Broadway workshop. The staff was always smiling, asked often if everything was ok with our stay. Hotel was very quiet. Rooms were very adequate. Had a fridge for leftovers, drinks, snacks. Not every room had a microwave though. The only thing that was troublesome was the elevators. They are slow, and only one was running most of our stay. We started on a higher floor, but spent most of our time on the second floor, so used the stairs. Others in our party who were on upper floors waited sometimes 15+ minutes for the elevator depending on the time of day. Otherwise, it’s a great place to stay. Close to Times Square and all the theaters. We only needed transportation to go to the World Trade Center.

We found the hotel to be a good central location (in The Garment District) to all the activities (close to subway as well) we wanted to do, especially at night as we went to plays nearby. Breakfast wa good and changed each day—scrambled eggs one day; omelets another—-toasted potatoes, sausage; waffles, bagels muffins and cereal everyday. The free breakfast wAs a nice way to start each day—and wait for the rest of the people in my room to wake up. Some days the elevators were quite challenging (4 out of 5 day days only one was running). Expect a wait at peak times. The staff was friendly and quick to respond to requests though!

Don’t expect customer service to know what they’re saying. I was given mixed information from the beginning and had to call back several times to clarify. Each time, different information. Called and left voicemail for manager and no one ever called back. Booking this reservation and understanding the policy was difficult and no one was helpful. But overall, stay was ok. The hotel room was clean. The elevator was broken when we were there thank God we were only on level 2, my other family was on level 18 and had to walk up 18 flights of steps. Breakfast was good. FYI: there IS a security deposit, when I called to make the reservation they told me no security deposit required

As others have mentioned, the elevators seem to be a huge issue at this location. For most of our stay, only one elevator was working for 32 floors, and on the last day, none were working and we had to haul our luggage down 27 floors of an extremely narrow stairwell. Bathroom shower did not drain and issue was not addressed after three requests. Although the location was very convenient to subway and Times Square, I would neither recommend this location nor stay there again.

I'm never staying here again. The room was small and the high floor city view is a complete rip off as the only sights is another tall building next to it. To make things worse they only have two elevators in a 30 floor hotel and when I was there one of the elevators was working and the other was not functioning. There was long lines for the elevator and always crammed. To top it all off, on my last night there, there was flies in my shower. This hotel is hot garbage and if you are appealed by how cheap it is, it is cheap for a reason. It is the literal the worst Hilton I've stayed in my life and I use to travel and stay in Hilton's so I have been to at least 10+ different Hilton's. Stay away.

The good highlights, good value, clean room, nice and friendly staff, good complimentary breakfast. The downside the rooms are small, an elevator was out of service, the bathroom especially the shower was tiny - can’t turn around in shower, FYI I’m a normal size man.

Clean and comfortable. Very professional and friendly staff. It's classic New York real estate: small, compact spaces but 32 floors high! Good breakfast, not much of an exercise room but it's there if you need it. The best part is the location, comfy beds, mini fridge and microwave, and the staff are attentive.

I can't even select the number of issues we had. Our stay was not horrible, but it was not as described and expected. Breakfast was great each morning, although items were not refilled in a timely manner with a hotel so filled with guests. Staff was not visible or helpful. When we arrived on Sunday, having been delayed over 8 hours by our flight, we were told our originally booked room was not an option. 2 floors had apparently flooded? We were exhausted as it was 1 in the morning. When we arrived in our room, it smelled HORRIBLY of must and mold. The carpets were dirty, a few pillows had stained or dirty pillow cases, and the bathroom repairs had been sloppily done with hot glue. No sooner had we climbed into bed, than we began smelling smoking. Someone on one side of our room was heavily smoking cigarettes (non-smoking hotel). We did report this in the morning. Additionally, the hotel had only 1 elevator working and it was almost never available. We used the stairs, climbing 16 floors nearly every time we had to go up or down (though we tried to remain out so as to avoid the trouble). The second night, as the AC came on, we noticed again the horrible musty/moldy smell. We were more than happy to check out the next day and move to another Hilton property.

Location was very accessible, walking distance to subway stations, and about 20 mins walk to Macy's and Koreatown (where my wife and I had great Korean food for dinner). Room was comfortable and warm for winter time. I liked it that even after breakfast hours we still had coffee and hot chocolate available to us (lifesaver for winter time outings). Only concern I had was the lift: only one functioning and very small lift, and it gets full easily and we gotta wait for the next trip. Overall, a very pleasant trip and will come again despite the single lift.

This is a pleasant hotel near to everything. The rooms are small, but clean and functional. My issue is with the manager. I have sent him two emails, one while a guest there and one a week later. I have yet to hear directly from him. I checked in and then realized the room rate had been changed on line. There was a decrease of almost two hundred dollars. I was told, by the person who checked me in, that after checking in, the rate could not be changed. I asked to speak to the manager, but was advised to email him. I emailed him. Then I was told he was off for the week and to contact the front desk manager. I did and she said that she could not adjust the rate. I then waited a week and resent the email to manager. I find it rude to not answer an email. So, I am giving the hotel a five for my stay and a zero to the manger.

32 story hotel with 1 working elevator.. be prepared to wait 15-20 minutes to get an elevator. don't call uber or lyft until you're in the lobby.. seriously.. room was good, shower very small. views were awesome! we were on 30th floor.. so if elevators are still an issue, look for a lower floor.

Fantastic location a couple of blocks away from Times Square. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small, as is normal for city centre hotels, but larger enough for our short stay, with all the amenities required. Breakfast was a little chaotic, but we have experienced this in other city hotels too. Good offer and really attentive breakfast staff who kept all the food levels topped up, the hotel was really clean and in good decorative order. I would stay at this hotel again.

Great value. Excellent breakfast and amazing customer service. Valet is expensive but its NYC. Rooms are neat. Friendly staff. Close to Times Square and the Piers. Perfect for a family getaway. Great!

This location had the same quality we expect from hampton with perfect for access to theatre and all the west side offers. Yes the rooms were small, reminded me a lot of Europe. The room and workout room were exceptionally clean. The staff were hardworking, very nice and helpful. There was a large pitcher with fruit water at the front desk which was wonderful as we returned from walking in humid warm weather. I was very impressed with the variety of breakfast offered. Fresh bagels! The only negative was the elevators which seemed slow and crowded at peak times. I would return to this location.

Not great. Elevators are slow and the hotel is small. Not easily seen from the street. Staff was fine no one talks much. Rooms are very small. I would not go back based on my stat at other Hilton properties.

The rooms were very very small. I had a room with two double beds. There was hardly any room for your luggage. I must however say it was very clean and that's the biggest concern that I have and they passed the test.

Summer in NYC was great with quality and location of hotel adding to the experience. Nice to have breakfast before busy day & walking distance to the public transit areas. Hotel was quiet and staff was very friendly.

The room are small but I think that’s every hotel in Manhattan, the hotel was clean, breakfast good, great customer service, convenient location close to Times Square, we had a view to Empire State, elevators are fast.

First of all, I would like to say that the location of this hotel is very good. While it may not be at the center of all the stores, it most certainly is convenient that many of the stores and theaters are just of walking distance.Next, let us break down what I think of the hotel. 1. Rooms - are of a decent size and with confortable beds. In my case, the aircon was not functioning as well as I thought it should as I needed to remove the controller to move it nearer to the airconditioner.2. Amenities - great business center, small fitness center. I experienced the elevator breaking down on our way up to our rooms. This was bad for me because we went up at around 1 to 2 am already so the elevator traffic isn't as bad and shouldn't be breaking down as much during those times. On the one hand, I liked that the response time to our problem was quick and efficient.3. Staff - the staff are friendly and helped us through our time in the hotel.

Great hotel for the money; convenient location to everything. Front desk staff were very helpful. Complementary breakfast was excellent. The room was a little small. I think that the Hampton UN was a larger room.

This room is only suitable for one person. The door was stuck so we could not enter. The toilet paper holder fell off of the wall three times. The cleaning crew failed to leave enough washcloths for two people, and the breakfast was so bad that we did not bother to eat breakfast at the hotel, and decided to pay for breakfast at a restaurant.Although I used 95,000 Hilton Reward Points, I would have gladly bypassed this hotel in order to use my points wisely on a more plush establishment.

Clean hotel... not so nice location. Staff very nice but not that knowledgeable. Breakfast was okey. Food was limited. More cereal choices would be nice. A/c unit a bit loud. Room was very clean and the bed was fine.

Polite, helpful staff. Yummy breakfast with many options. Breakfast staff was always present and attentive. Room was clean and housekeeping was polite and cheerful. Located near the subway so easy access to the city. Sometimes we waited for the elevator but find me one in nyc you don’t have to wait for. Concierge was helpful booking travel back to airport. If I hadn’t taken her advice I’m convinced we’d have missed our plane.

Great location easy walking distance to office and resturants and time square. Shopping is nearby as well. Valet service and luggage hold is great on check out day. Fruit infused water in the lobby tasted refreshing at end of day.

The hotel staff was the best thing about this hotel. Very nice and helpful. The location is further away from all the places we wanted to visit. We’ve stayed right in the heart of Times Square and that would be our preference in the future. Our room was on the 6th floor right next to the elevators and we had the elevator noise throughout our stay along with the noise of some obnoxiously loud guests in the middle of one night. Rooms are clean but dated and no views to speak of. Breakfast was mediocre but free and appreciated and everyone is correct in saying the elevators take forever and having been right next to them we could hear the other guests frustrations in waiting for them! Will pass on this property next time.

We used this hotel to stay overnight for three nights during an event at the Javits Center. While it was well located, if you ended up at high tide for the elevator, you would wait for a long time to use one of the two that supply this hotel.We spent the time there in March, which was a big student visit time, and the place was quite crowded. While the rooms were quiet and comfortable, like you would expect in a Hampton Inn, the time to get to your room if coming back when everyone else was, would mean a long line to wait to get into the elevator.The room was clean and small but worked for two busy people who did not spend much time in the room.If you need a place to sleep, not much more, than this is a fine hotel, with Hilton Points, was the only reason I booked it. Location is in the middle of the block between 8th and 9th Ave. a walk to anything you might want to do.

Hotel is nice. Free tea ,Coffee and water at front desk . Elevators are slow but we were there on 4 th of July week . Rooms are a bit small but heard this is normal for NewYork . Room was clean , bathroom was clean . Free breakfast was good . No fridge or microwave in rooms and no room service that I could see . Overall a good hotel though . Would stay here again .

My husband and I recently took an anniversary trip to New York City and stayed here. Everyone was so kind and courteous and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The rooms were a little small, but I think that’s on par with the city- not much room anywhere! We had a king sized bed (also hard to find in NYC) and they even brought us extra pillows. There was a refrigerator and a microwave in our room- not something I had expected to find there. It saved us money because we were able to save leftovers from some of the wonderful restaurants in the area. It is a couple of blocks from the actual Times Square and close to subways. The only criticism and why I didn’t give 5 stars was the housekeeping staff. Our housekeeper wouldn’t leave 2 full sets of towels every day and we had to call downstairs to have someone bring them up. We were almost out of toilet paper, and she didn’t leave another roll, once again, causing us having to bother the front office staff for it. But the front office staff was always very apologetic and took care of things as quickly as they could. I just wish we didn’t have to do that in the first place. But we will certainly stay here in the future!

Very good overall. Nice breakfast. Clean room. Comfortable bed Good location Would stay againLots of good things to do relatively close by. It took a bit of a long time for the cold water to come up to the floor for a late afternoon shower

This is an excellent hotel to stay while in NYC! Free hot breakfast was great way to start each day. Location is nice... close to subway and Times Square. A/C worked great especially for how hot it was outside.

I booked a king size room, however, when I checked in, I was told and nothing but assigned a double room. When I called to ask what's happening, I was told that I booked a double room. Then I checked the Hilton app, I saw that what they say is right. Interesting, when I check the email booking confirmation, it says I booked a king size room successfully. I don't understand why. And I didn't receive any further explanation.

The hotel location is walkable to both the convention center (Jacob Javits) and Times Square for shopping. The staffs are nice and the hotel is always clean. The breakfast and drink is always ready for the guest.

Hotel is small - 6 rooms per floor with 2 elevators and 31 floors. Elevators are fast but will make a lot of stops at peak times (mid to late morning). Breakfast was decent variety and good. The eating area was always full but only found people having difficulty finding a seat when a large group was eating at once (like a 20-person tour group). Concierge was helpful; desk employees were helpful and efficient. It is less than 2 blocks from the blue line, which is at the edge of Time Square.We found 3 negatives: 1. Room air conditioner did not remove humidity well - keep fan on in bathroom when showering and open window of nice (and door if bad enough for cross breeze). 2. Hall noise was very loud, but room to room noise was very quiet and there were only 6 rooms on floor (so rarely had to put up with noise). 3. Elevator noise was noticeable (at least in room next to elevator) - we got used to the travel up and down, thought it was loud car on the street at first.I would have no qualms about staying here again if the price were good.

Hotel is on West 39th Street and is in a great location close to Times square, Penn Station (trains) and Port Authority (buses). It was easy to get everyone just by walking down to 8th Ave and using the Metro, Hop-on,Hop off Bus Tour or simply walk. The hotel was clean although the rooms were small. We had a family room where the beds almost filled the room. Bathroom was clean with a good shower. It was serviced each day and cleaners did a good job. The size of the room meant we mostly lived out of our suitcases. However you are in New York and large rooms are not to be expected.We had breakfast each morning. Breakfast is a buffet of cereal, yogurts, breads, muffins, juices, some fruit and waffles (make them yourself) and some hot food (eggs, bacon, potatoes as an example). It is a functional breakfast, not as formal as some other hotels but certainly worth the extra you pay for it. Breakfast is served between 6am and 10am.Negative point was the lifts - only 2 lifts service the hotel and a 15 minute wait in the morning wasn't uncommon. We got stuck in the lift on our first morning when more people crammed in and so the lift jammed for an uncomfortable 15 minutes. Worse still, the engineer complained to my family when we were the first on!

Excellent but room was to small for price nice location excellent service nice employees excellent customer service but for the price the room was extremely to small I checked out the same night and went to a family member house too too small

Rooms are a bit smelly, but if you’re out and about, I guess it’s not too bad. Everything else was ok, besides the elevator taking forever during morning hours. You could wait up to 15min on the elevator.

We stayed at this property which is on 39 th street. The only advantage of the hotel is that it's closer to times square. The location is crowded most time of the day. I would recommend people to stay in uptown area near Central park, which is a better area. Hotel is in an old building with old elevator. Many times we had to wait for 15 minutes to get an elevator to come down. A very small reception area with very tiny dining area for breakfast considering the number of rooms it had. One has to wait for atleast 20 minutes to get a seat in the breakfast area. With not many vegetarian options other then fruits and cereals, the breakfast was very ordinary. Also the breakfast was offered in paper plates and cups which is not expected from brand like Hampton by Hilton. I have stayed at Hampton even in central London where the breakfast was very nice comparatively with baked beans, cheese, breads, hash browns for vegetarian guests. Also the plates were not of paper. However the staff helped us in re heating our own food items carried with us. The rooms were very small with no place to move around with luggage. Bathrooms were also very small. Overall our stay was not very comfortable.

We stayed here 1 night pre-cruise. The hotel is in a great location just a couple of blocks away from the theaters and Times Square. The staff were so friendly and helpful, always had smiles on their faces and provided advice for our night on the town.The hotel is very tall but narrow, so there were only 6 rooms on each floor, with 2 elevators in between. The hallways were tight especially with a lot of luggage. There could sometimes be a long wait for the elevators especially during breakfast and at hotel check out time.The rooms were nicely appointed, clean and everything was in good working condition. The beds were comfortable and they provided extra pillows upon our request.The bathroom is very tiny, they even had to carve out the door to get it to shut and not hit the sink. The shower stall is long but it's width is narrow, we kept hitting our elbows on the shower door and wall handlebar. The gym is small, if you use it, go during off hours so there won't be a wait. Overall, we enjoyed our time there and would stay there again.

I stayed here for one night after wrapping up a business trip to NYC, and was pleasantly surprised by how quiet this property was, considering how centrally it's located. I had a room on the 22nd floor and maybe heard one siren during the whole night. I had a 2 block walk to my theater, which was perfect as it started to rain during my short walk back. The room itself was quite small (two people would have been a squeeze) but it was perfect for a solo, one night stay. If you are just looking for a base to do some sightseeing and take in a show, this is a great place to pick.

This hotel is in NYC so I wasn’t expecting an inexpensive room and I was not expecting a large room. So paying a bit and the room size was not an issue.The hotel is SMALL in size. The bedroom, the shower is EXTREMELY tight. The biggest issue aside from the wet carpet and leaking shower were the elevators. YOU NEED MORE ELEVATORS IN THIS HOTEL. The place was packed and there were TWO elevators servicing 31 floors. That’s crazy. You wait so long for an elevator, sometimes Having to wait for another one due to them being full. I wouldn’t stay here again because of how small/tight the hotel is and the elevator situation. Breakfast was ok...but again, not a lot of room to move around bc they hardly even have space for the tables which do not accommodate nearly enough people. It just feels crammed in the all the time. The staff was fine. I had no issues with them and found them to be quite nice. I didn’t complain about these issues bc there is really nothing they can do about it, it’s mostly due to location.

Spent 3 nights here. Lovely hotel in a great location. Housekeeping could have been a little more on top of their game. They left dirty sheets on the bed which should have been changed. That was the only bad experience but it was enough to color my opinion.

Very nice & helpful staff! Very comfortable beds. Room & bathroom small but both very clean. Fantastic location, near all main attractions. Just 25 minutes from JFK airport. Quiet street. Good choice of restaurants. Overall a good experience!

I was in New York few days ago and stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South because of its proximity to everything, its good price (compared to many other hotels in that area) and also because it is way quieter at nightThe Hotels is about 10 minutes walk from Time Square and close the Lincoln Tunnel and easy access to most of the subway line in NYC.I really like to have a breakfast in the morning. To my surprise, the eggs were very good and the coffee was ok.The staff is great and very polite. I would totally go back there.

We chose this hotel because it was in walking distance of Times Square, Broadway and even to Rockefeller Center--and it offered free breakfast! The room was clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Would stay again! We've always had good experiences at Hampton hotels.

Just returned from a stay here June 7th-13th. Nice welcome at check in and was given a room on the 26th floor. Room cost almost $2000 for total stay. A $50 a night charge was held on my credit card. The room itself was average size with 2 double beds squeezed in to it. There was only 1 single wardrobe which was ok for us 2 but if 4 people shared this room they would struggle to put their clothes away and there wasn't much floor space either, but as I understand it, it is common for New York hotels to be not so big. Room had a fridge, safe and a good air conditioning unit. View out of window was the back of another hotel. The one thing that hankered our stay was there was a smell in the room that we couldn't fathom where it was coming from. The smell would hit you as you walked in the room but after blasting the air-con for 10 minutes it would go away. I can only describe the smell as being like smelly feet but we packed all our footwear away one day and the smell would still be there when we got back from being out. Breakfast was on the ground floor at the back of the hotel. It wasn't a very big breakfast area and was busiest between 9-10am. There was hot and cold options as well as a crepe and waffle maker. I was disappointed to see that there was paper plates and plastic knife, fork and spoons. I didn't expect that for a Hilton branded hotel. The most annoying thing about our stay here was the lifts. There are only 2 lifts in this hotel for 32 floors which are also used by housekeeping. Some mornings when everyone is going down for breakfast we would wait in excess of 10 minutes for the lift to arrive on our floor.Despite our frustrations the hotel was in a good location just off 8th Avenue and a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and Penn Station.Hotel also provided tea and coffee at eh back 24/7.Its difficult to judge whether this hotel is value for money as this was my first time in New York and don't know what else to compare it with but I would probably try another hotel if I ever return to New York.

We stayed here for Memorial weekend this year and when checking in they insisted they take $60 per night for the 4 days we stayed there. This they said would be returned once we had checked out with no extras to pay for. We have been home in the UK for over 2 weeks and the $240 has still not been returned to my card???This is very unsettling and more than annoying

I had a great experience in Hampton. Hotel was really nice and clean, and Staff was friendly and welcoming their guests. Only thing I did not like was the air freshener which was little strong for me (I do not like scents).

My sister, daughter and I spent 5 days here recently in order to explore New York. Great location close to subway, Times Square and Theatre District. We had a room on the 20th floor with 2 double beds. Rooms slightly too small for 2 double beds, so we were glad there was only 3 of us. No where to store cases and not a lot of space between each bed. However, beds comfortable and room clean. Breakfast was excellent every morning with a large variety of food and friendly and helpful staff around to replenish. Didn't have to wait too long for lifts as previously mentioned in reviews but there are only 2 lifts for a small hotel with 32 floors with 6 rooms on each floor.

My friends and i stayed here for memorial day weekend. It's a great location for times square and you are close to 42nd street train station. The front desk was very helpful with info on how to ride the train to different areas especially Clarence. I definitely will stay again. Thxs again for the hospitality

The location is good, but the rooms are small, though the value is still good for NYC. Staff was friendly and helpful. If there is one downside to this hotel, it is that there are only 2 elevators for a 30 story hotel. This is a problem if you are on a mid-level floor during peak morning hours.

very friendly and helpful staff, they changed our room due to the smell and unclean bedcovers. In the 2nd room the smell was not so strong. The room was next to an ice mashine and was very loud. Room was too small, the photos do not reflect the reality. Breakfast was the unhealfiest and worst I ever had in a hotel. breakfast room too small.

Great location coming out of the Lincoln Tunnel. Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway Shows and Johns Pizza!! Super staff, comfortable beds, good complimentary breakfast! Great choice with easy access to just about everything.

The room was very nice. The elevator however is a nightmare!! There are only two. It takes about 20 minutes to get on it. I would use the stairs but they don’t go down to the main level so that is kind of scary!! What would you do in case of a fire??? The breakfast area is too small and there is not enough seating at all. Most days we just had to go out for breakfast which was an added expense but the amount of people in the tiny breakfast area is just too much. I realize it’s New York and overall the room was perfect for what we needed to sleep and shower. I have yet to be able to eat breakfast in the hotel due to the massive crowd no matter how late or early you go. You get 3 stars because safety is a #1 priority and stairs should absolutely go to the main level. This would be a better way to get to your room too instead of waiting for a very slow elevator and don’t forget we all know emergencies happen!!

This hotel is great for the visitors to New York who wants a good location but wants to save a little on the bill. Great breakfast buffet. Within 10 minutes walk to times square and 5 minute walk to the nearest subway. I would pick this hotel again for my next visit. Great all around service form all employees that i dealt with. The beds are narrow and most rooms do not offer much floor space. There are only 2 lifts and 32 floors so you can expect some waiting, especially if you run in to a group checking in. Just be patient and you will get to your room. The longest i waited were 5 minutes.I can only recommend this hotel to any one looking for a great hotel at affordable prices in a fine location

My friend and I visited for a short break last week. The first thing I must say that prior to our trip we had issues with our booking as our flights were cancelled however Henry the front office manager sorted out new dates for us free of charge very quickly. So firstly a bug thank you to Henry. Hotel was spotlessly clean and the beds were probably the most comfortable I had ever stayed in. Breakfast was very good especially the scrambled egg which was cooked to perfection. Location was the best you could hope for and staff very friendly and helpful. Had a great trip

Clean room, nice staff, decent breakfast, walkable to Times Square & Theater District. Elevator a bit slow, but will definitely come back. Enjoyed our stay, a good place for families and a good deal for NYC.

Hotel is extremely tired. There is a constant musty damp humid smell in the rooms that never goes away but I guess you eventually get used to. Rooms are typical NYC small but the furnishings leave a lot to be desired with scratches on the frame of the mirror and a stained desk chair. In addition, I left one day at 930 and housekeeping hadn’t made up my room at 330, I called the front desk, left again and came back and they were cleaning so I stood in the hallway as there was no way I was going back down to the lobby, which brings me to my final point. How a hotel with 32 floors and 6 rooms per floor can only have 2 elevators. Be prepared to wait A LOT for an elevator, I was on the 27th floor, I recommend a lower floor. Staff was fine but there are too many other hotels to stay in a place like this again. Although it maybe cheaper than others, the aggravation with the elevators and condition of the rooms makes spending more money on a better hotel worth it. I mentioned my housekeeping problem when I checked out and the front desk person claimed that they didn’t start cleaning until 10...if that was the case then it should’ve been taken care of and she made it sound like my request was unreasonable...

No greeting upon arrival and only one person to help check in. Room was humid and had smell of mildew or mold. AC didn't help. Bathroom was infested with gnats not overwhelming in number but there should not be insects in the room. Breakfast food was subpar. Runny eatery eggs and old fruit.

After making reservation for one night, several weeks before our stay, we called to add a second night to our original one night stay. On the phone, the clerk fully understood that we were now staying two nights. Morning after first night, on our way out the door at 10am, they informed us we must switch rooms and second room was not available. Again, this was THEIR mistake. They told us another family had just shown up and paid for 3 nights and wanted our specific room. Instead of inconveniencing the second family (many hours before their check-in) they made us go back to our room and pack up our stuff. This fiasco caused us loss of at least an hour of our sight-seeing and a lot of unnecessary stress. I left my number for Henry, the front desk manager, who never called me. The compensation we got for this inconvenience - three $1 ponchos and three bottles of water. The only advantage we got to moving to the much smaller room was that the flying gray gnats, stained carpet, and bad smell of the first room were not present in the second room and we were more comfortable in a king bed than the two doubles. Both rooms had comforters that were pilling (showing you how old they were). We couldn’t use the queen pull out in Room 209 because the furniture blocked it from opening and, after we moved the heavy couch, they never brought us the sheets for it after we called the front desk and they said they’d be right up with them. We had far superior experiences at Marriott’s Fairfield Inns.Stay here at your own risk of ruining your trip.

There were 6 rooms on each floor which took a while for me to get used to. My room on the 30th floor had a great view and was quiet. The premium internet wasn't the greatest but I was still able to use my Roku in my room. The breakfast was standard and I love the fact Hampton Inn has waffles. The staff was great and very much on top of things and it was nice to see staff deep cleaning the carpet in the hallway. The room was expensive in general especially when compared with other parts of the country, but when focused to Manhattan it was actually a little less expensive than similar sized rooms in the same part of Manhattan.

Really looking forward to staying but please beware folks..if you get a problem with your date they won't help at all. Flight company cancelled our flight and changed our dates. We now have to spend our last day in the airport cos we can't afford the extra night - even though we won't be there for the first night...... Very upset.

We stayed at the Hampton TS South a few weeks ago for a long weekend of "touristing". Upon checking out early Monday morning, I realized that I left my nicest, newest sport coat at a bar down the street the previous night. Problem: the bar didn't open until much later in the day, and we had to be at the airport at 7am to catch our flight back home. (I guess I'll just have to write it off, right?) We had a couple of hours to kill during a layover, so I called the bar to see if they even had the coat . . . and when someone finally answered the phone, they confirmed that they did, but they would only hold it for someone to pick up.I called the hotel and spoke with Henry Lattarulo, the front office manager. He told me that if I emailed him a prepaid FedEx shipping label, he would personally retrieve it from the bar and ship it to me. Well, Henry made good on his word, and I received my sportcoat last week in perfect condition. How's THAT for outstanding customer service?!?

This Motel was awesome. The rooms were clean and neat. The staff was the best I have ever experienced. We were concerned since this was our first trip to NYC but they made the trip memorable. They were there for all our needs and so accommodating. We would definitely recommend this motel to anyone going to NYC. It is within walking distance of times square. Broadway Shows and anything else NYC you want.

We moved to this hotel having been originally booked in an awful one on 7th Avenue. The difference was amazing. We were welcomed to the hotel with smiles. Our bags were taken (free of charge) to hold until it was time to check in and we were invited to breakfast even though we were not yet residents. We stayed for 4 nights. The room was clean, very comfortable beds with good heater/air conditioning unit. Bathroom was clean with plenty of towels, etc. The staff were all very helpful and the concierge was great booking shows, etc. for us. Tea/coffee/hot chocolate and fruit available 24/7. Just a 5 minute walk from Times Square this was a great location as only a 10 minute walk to the river also. Hells Kitchen about 10 minutes away also with lots of restaurants. I cannot speak too highly of this hotel

Don't be scared off by the location a block south of the Port Authority bus terminal, if you'd like to get a better deal on a hotel room. Just keep in mind that this tall, skinny building means that the higher your room, the longer your elevator wait.

I booked 4 rooms in Sept. of 2017 for a stay in April of 2018. When I arrived at 1PM in the afternoon for my one double and three single bed rooms, only one was ready so we put all of our luggage in the one room which was a double and said we were going out and wouldn't be back till late for the other three rooms. When we got back at around 10 PM the night person said all we have left is two single and one double because we were the last ones to check in that night when clearly we were there just after lunch. He was very rude and said I don't have the rooms you wanted nothing I can do. I showed him the reservation from months ago and he said you shouldn't have checked in so late, are you kidding. We had the breakfast one morning and then the whole place was shut down for renovations, no one warned us of this. You had to walk down the street to a pub for breakfast with sometimes 30 min wait in line.

It was in a great location. Just a few minutes from Times Square. But the room was very very small. There was a small cabinet. Room was ok for 2 people for a few days may be. We were in the front side and in 26 th floor. It was fun. We had an Empirestate view from the edge. There were only 2 elevators; we have waited long to go up or down.

We stayed at the Hampton/Times Square South on our trip to see Hamilton. We chose it for convenience, as it is midway between Penn Station and the Richard Rogers Theatre. It was about a seven block walk from Penn Station. Though this may seem like a trek to some, especially carrying a bag, it was probably faster to walk than taking a cab, Uber, or Lyft, given traffic. Likewise, it was faster to walk to the theatre.The room itself was small, and the only available option for the rate we booked was a room with two beds, which made it seem a bit more cramped, but for a night it was fine. Compared to the Hampton/Times Square North, where we have stayed previously, the South building is taller (39 floors versus 11 or so), but narrower (6 or 7 rooms per floor). Also, we were on the second floor, but had to wait for the elevator as the stairway does not have an exit on the first floor.The breakfast area is nice, and the breakfast was up to Hampton standards. The staff were uniformly cordial and helpful, in the breakfast area as well as the front desk.

I had booked a room for three nights at this hotel. There was not requirement for a minimum stay and the confirmation I got said I could cancel or change the reservation up until May 2nd at no costs. My travel plans changed and I need to check in a day later than original planned, so I only needed 2 or the 3 nights. I called to modify the reservation yesterday (4/17/18), and they refused. They said that the hotel was full and that I could not modify my reservation because they would lose money for a night. I spoke to customer service and they said the same thing. Note, I was not asking for any night I had not originally booked, I just wanted one less night. The confirmation policy I received said nothing about this and had no minimum staff critiria, and it is clear violation of their statement that said the following: Rate Rules and Cancellation Policy:• Your reservation is guaranteed for late arrival.• If your plans change please let us know – it’s free to cancel or update your reservation by 11:59 PM local hotel time on May 02, 2018.I ended up having to cancel my reservation and book at another hotel for 2 nights. It is the WORST customer service I have ever experience, and I am a Hilton Honors member. If this is how they treat their frequent customers, I can only imagine how they treat less frequent customers.

This particular Hampton is not the normal Hampton standard. Carpet squares lifting posing a tripping hazard, room extremely small, hallways very narrow, 2 elevators that are very slow. Oh, and my city view was of the side of the next hotel.

This hotel is located not far from Times Square (maybe 5-6 blocks) so was very convenient to that, subways and the Convention Center which was a focal point of our visit. While it was very full during our stay with several groups there, I must commend the staff at this hotel for their consistent effort to minimize any issues with accessing the elevator upon check-in, accommodating requests at the front desk, clean rooms, nice dining facilities with fresh, hot and good food (breakfast is what I ate daily). Also, the complimentary coffee was greatly appreciated particularly because it was quite cold there last week so it was nice to have that available. For the value of this hotel chain in comparison to what can be seen as very pricey at other establishments, this property definitely met and exceeded my expectations and I would stay here again. Very accessible to restaurants and bars too.

Room are overcrowded, hallway was to small, elevator too slow, overcrowded all the time. Brand new but None functioning ice/water machine. Ask for room with a view but in stead view of construction and garbage piled street

I was disappointed with the overall service. The elevator system was a nightmare. Large high school group dominated the spaces such as the breakfast room and the lobby. One day, housekeeping skipped my room and were notified with no attention to correct the matter.

We stay frequently at Hampton Inns and the Times Sq. South does not meet the usual standard. It’s an older hotel and while it does appear to have been renovated, the “updated” look cannot disguise its overall below average quality. The walls are paper thin. Despite being on a higher floor, it sounded like the traffic was outside my window all night long. I was glad to be away from the elevator, but each floor has only 6 rooms and we were cursed with a noisy ice machine in the hallway. The heating unit was also noisy, as was the fridge. The room itself was extremely small, although it was clean with most of the usual amenities,i.e. fridge, coffee maker, nice TV, toiletries, etc. They only provide paper coffee cups in the room, not glass or plastic, which is not optimal for drinking wine.The two elevators cannot efficiently handle all the guests. Several times we waited 10 minutes to board. The breakfast area also can not accommodate the number of guests, so hit it early or you may not find a table.On the plus side, the staff was friendly and helpful and the location was very good, walking distance to the theaters and many fantastic restaurants.We come to NYC several times a year and this was our first stay at this hotel. It will likely be our last.

Excellent location, OK complimentary breakfast. Great internet service. Construction site across the street made it impossible to sleep. Mixed up our reservation and we had to wait for almost 2 hours to go to our room.

The hotel is located in the garment district adjacent to Times Square. The staff was excellent and made my family and I feel appreciated for staying at the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was good and the Wi-Fi worked well. The rooms were small but clean and had a refrigerator which came in handy (bought some cheesecake from Junior's and was able to save some to bring home). Overall, an exceptional experience at this hotel with staff that truly seemed to care about the guests.

We were greeted promptly and even though we were a bit early, our room was ready. We were on the 2nd floor and easily walked up and down to access our room. No waiting for the elevator. The rooms are small by Hampton Inn standards but not for the location near Times Square. In fact, the location is great for accessing the sites we wanted to visit and it is very near the subway. The room was clean and tidy. The breakfast is very Hampton Inn and that's what you expect. It was fine and plentiful.All in all, a fine place to stay and we recommend it.

Nice reasonable room near Times Square. The staff is responsive and helpful. They assisted us with directions to the areas we wanted to visit. Check out time is noon. Parking is $80. They do serve a hot breakfast.

One must keep in mind that most hotels in NYC offer smaller rooms than usual. This hotel offers clean and very quiet rooms with standard NYC sized rooms. What's interesting is that this property has 32 floors and only 6 rooms per floor! Surprising to come out of the elevator and have 3 rooms to the right and 3 to the left! Lot's of power outlets to charge laptops, phones, etc. There are 2 parking garages across the street - $70 for overnight parking if no special rate. Walking distance to restaurants, Times Square, etc.

I am a regular Hampton visitor because of the Hilton Honors program. This hotel is in a good location and the price is fairly good for the location. It states the hotel was recently renovated which is true. The rooms are comfortable and clean and up to the normal standard. However, please be aware that the entire time we were there, only one elevator was working. We were on the 30th floor and had to wait up to 10 minutes for an elevator. It was also really frustrating when people staying on the 2nd floor would use the elevator. Everyone else would give them dirty looks when they got on or off. There were large groups of kids staying there and the line to get on the elevator went out the front door at one point! As for the digital key, I used it once and then it stopped working so we had to wait 10 minutes to go back down, get a regular key, and then wait 10 minutes to go back up.
