The front desk was very nice and asked if I was 3-5 feet away from the door when I tried to use the key. Um yeah, there are only 5 rooms on each floor so as soon as you get off the elevator, you are 3-5 away. Also, all the rooms will hear the elevator all night long. It is LOUD! We didn't hear anyone from any other rooms though.The breakfast was actually pretty good for Hampton standards and the staff was attentive which is usually the case wherever we stay. I just think the elevator issue would be a serious deal breaker for most people.

Room was very small, like we couldn’t even use my daughters pack n play crib in the room. She had to sleep in bed with us. And they are double beds... Concierge had no idea about any thing, I was wondering if he actually worked for the hotel.

I came to NYC recently with a group of high school kids, many of whom had never been to NYC. The hotel was perfect for our stay. It is conveniently located and we were able to walk to so many places - Times Square, Broadway, the subway, shopping, street vendors (food and merchandise), the garment district, etc. It is on somewhat of a side street and a bit quieter, but there is still some noise - part of the NYC experience! The staff was always very friendly and always asking if we needed anything. There was a concierge to give us suggestions on places to visit and restaurants. You could buy snacks and drinks at the hotel, but so many street vendors and restaurants were within two blocks of the hotel so that you had a variety of food available. The hotel breakfast was wonderful - eggs, sausage, waffles (make your own), cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries and breads, juices - there was something for everyone and is included in the price of the room. There is a coffee/tea/hot chocolate station 24/7. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The two elevators are very fast, but you can have a bit of a wait if a group is using them to come or go. Another thing I really loved is that they have more than enough outlets and chargers in the rooms for phones, computers, etc. I definitely will stay there on my next visit to NYC.

Spent 3 nights there and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. The breakafast was good with plenty to choose from. The room was on the smaller side but adequate with all amenities necessary for a great stay. If definitely stay there again.

Rooms are small, but average for NYC. But the HVAC was the quietest I’ve had in a long time. WiFi was easy to connect and the night light was a nice touch. Breakfast was typical Hampton, well stocked, nothing elaborate. Overall very good value.

Very pleased to find this hotel in the heart of the garment district. We had a good sized room for Manhattan. The breakfast was varied over the five days we were there and the staff was very friendly. We like to stay at Hampton Inns and this one was totally as expected - will be back!

This is a great location. Super easy to get around from this location. Great friendly staff! Clarence was so helpful with everything we asked of him. He is a great source here and friendly as well. All the staff was very friendly. Breakfast can be crowded at times and not a lot of choices but still good

The service by Eliana was amazing. She went above and beyond to help us with a reservation issue the was not the fault of the hotel. Words can not describe the magic she performed but we are deeply thankful. 5 stars!!!!!

Fantastic location, excellent customer service and wonderful breakfast! I highly recommend this hotel. The room was decent sized for NYC and the bedding was exceptional. The helpful staff made it an awesome stay.

We stayed there in Hampton Inn for 3 days(02th-06th March).Our room no was-1101.Though the location of the hotel was very good but the rooms are very small.They have only two elevators and it was a great problem for us during the busy hours. Breakfast was ok. One thing I want to share that I have lost my wrist watch in that room. One lady of housekeeping(fair and fat) had cleaned our room and after that I lost it.So it was bad experienced for us in Hampton Inn.

I arrived with friends several days before a conference and we stayed two nights at this hotel. It is a lovely hotel and have great service and very polite and professional employees. The service was very good. I will definitely recommend it to my friends. The hotel is near the subway and has restaurants nearby.

My trip to New York was extended for a night due to a snowstorm. I couldn't stay at my original location so I booked a night at this hotel. I made the trek (about 10 blocks) in the rain/snow and arrived halfway soaked well before check in. Upon arrival, the staff were super helpful about checking in my luggage while my room was being prepared. Alex, who took my luggage, even went out of his way to get me a towel and made sure I knew where the hot beverages were. All my other interactions with the staff were great. The room was extremely clean, the bed was comfortable, and everything was up to date. Moreover, the location is excellent; it's within walking distance to Times Square but the street is relatively quiet. I'm so glad I ended up there (there weren't many options left). Would definitely stay at this location again.

Despite MAJOR reservations, I stayed here for what was supposed to be 4 nights for a conference. Our parent company put everyone up in this hotel, and I suspected it would be bad but didn't want to be that diva who insisted no staying somewhere else .... so I convinced myself it wouldn't be that bad.IT WAS WORSE.First of all, I have NO idea where the photos you see on TripAdviser came from (at least, those provided by the property). Even though they aren't much to look at, they're a lot better than what I got. I checked out a night early and went to The Andaz because I just couldn't handle this anymore. This was my experience:1. You could LITERALLY TOUCH THE DOOR TO MY ROOM when standing INSIDE the elevator. No.2. The drapes were a shiny dark purple. The carpet was purple. The weird, stained decorative blanket thing on my bed was purple. No, no, no.3. There were weird stains and marks on everything. I wouldn't exactly call it dirty, but it was worn and just felt ... not good.4. No mini fridge or beverages or room service. Not that I would have gotten room service at a place like this, but still. 5. The front desk staff isn't rude, but they aren't exactly helpful. It's like...they'll put up with you if they have to.6. I got a call to my room late at night from someone claiming to be the front desk, saying that there was an error with my credit card and they needed a new number. I almost gave it to them since they called my room directly, and last I checked, you can't dial a hotel room direct (don't you have to go through the front desk)? At the last second I thought better of it, hung up, and called the front desk to tell them what happened. Their response was: "Oh, yeah, that's been happening...." then just kind of trailed off. What?!?! It seems like this must be some sort of scam among employees since the phones are supposedly closed-circuit. COME ON!Ugh yuck no thanks. I don't care who is paying for this room in the future or how much other hotels are - I won't stay here.

As other have noted, this hotel is very close to the subway, theaters, and all the action of Times Square but on a quiet block. It is also close to the less touristy restaurants on 9th ave and not far from Madison Square Garden and 34th street shopping. The rooms have been renovated and look great with lots of outlets although I found the beds a bit too firm. Walk in showers only. Included breakfast was convenient and decent but a little stressful with so many people in such a small area. Staff does a good job keeping up with it though. Overall staff was excellant as was the general manager who clearly takes pride in leading such a friendly and helpful staff. Elevators were generally okay but we did have a 10+ minute wait for elevators one day and the location of the elevators on the first floor is terrible - lots of flow issues due to how the building had to be built in that space.

I had never been to New York, so I booked this Hotel taking a chance. What a nice surprise. The hotel has been recently remodeled. It is nice and clean. The Hotel staff are great. There is a breakfast included and it is a nice way to start your day. The supplies are constantly replenished with the people looking after this very friendly and helpful. It is located mid-street so I don't believe it is as noisy as some hotels might be closer to the "action". We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to visit. There are hotels closer but we really enjoyed ourselves here. Also, a special thank-you to Yariela - the check-in person. She was great! (I hope I have the right spelling) A fantastic stay. There are no tubs - but the beds we found were very comfortable.

This is a brand new hotel with they typical Hampton quality. Rooms were of modest size which is expected in New York. It was very clean and well cared for and the staff was excellent. Wifi worked well but you have to log in at least daily which is a pain. Breakfast was the typical crowded affair with very average food. I wouldn't bother with it when there are so many other options nearby.The location was great, a few blocks from Penn Station, Times Square and Herald Square. Close by the subway and bus terminal. Many food options within an easy walk. Overall a good place to stay.

Yes, the rooms have recently been renovated, wide screen TV's, refitted bathroom, carpet, etc., etc., with a high rate for cleanliness. The standouts of this King Room were the excellent heating/air conditioning system, the bed, and the bed linens/pillows. Hampton spent some money on the first rate comforter, sheets and pillows in this room. A very welcome addition and very much appreciated The only downside was it seemed to take forever to get hot water in both the sink and shower early in the morning.

This was my mum & I 1st time in New York, and this hotel was excellent in all aspects, 2 double bed room was very comfortable, only fault is no bath which would be useful to have a nice long soak in, in the evenings after all day walking, breakfast was excellent with varied hot choice changed daily. Within walking distance to times square, esb and totr. Also nearby is Port Authority and subway connections. Staff were wonderful, especially one of the breakfast staff (not sure of his name but he has dark hair and wears glasses?), it was lovely to see a very friendly, cheerful smiley worker who always greets guests with a "good morning" and always asked my mum and me if we were ok, and to have a good day. I would recommend staying here and I wouldn't hesitate in booking this hotel again. Thanks Hampton Inn Times Square South for part of a wonderful 1st stay in New York!!

Would definitely stay here again! The staff were very helpful, the breakfast was amazing, the rooms were comfortable and the location was perfect distance to time square. Special check out accommodatations were made for us.

I had to go to New York City for work. First time there. The hotel was fantastic! Yes, the rooms aren't as large as in other places across the country, but it's Manhattan! Room was large enough for king bed and wide aisles on three sides. Plenty big. Staff was great & so was food!

Hotel is in a great location to see Time Square and any other tourist destinations in the area. Close proximity to Subway connections if looking to travel by subway. Rooms were very clean, staff was friendly, and the hot breakfast in the morning was always great each time we went - they provide various options and change it daily.Using the amp to check in was great and they have a good check out time too (noon). Only thing is there beds were more on the FIRM side for sure and took adjustment.I work in Hospitality and have high expectations, this hitel met them!

Great location and felt completely safe in the neighborhood, amazing how an area can change in 20 years. Front desk staff was very pleasant. Rooms were larger than I expected and it was clean. As mentioned in other reviews, be aware that the elevator wait time can be significant during busy times. Breakfast room was a bit small at the times we chose to eat. Food was standard Hampton breakfast. The real issue was hallway noise through the door sweeps. I have had a e-mail discussion with the general manager about the fact that air gaps exist in the door sweeps and it seemed to let in a lot of hallway noise. We had almost no noise from adjoining rooms so wall insulation was pretty good. 7/11 store nearby for snacks including by the bottle of craft beer. Very good value in January.

This was a great little find, from the complimentary breakfast to 24h tea/coffee we really couldn’t fault it.The room were fresh, clean and tidy (not at all dated like some hotels). They are quite small but nicely compact as oppose to squashed. Space is well utilised.Breakfast was great, as was the complimentary tea/coffee station.The staff all seemed lovely but we didn’t really have to speak to them as everything was great.Location is great, well located for Times Square but also great for the lovely, cheaper and more authentic eateries on 9th Avenue.Would definitely stay here again.

good location, price range and overall very good hotel.rooms were very clean, vending and ice on accesisble floors. complimentary breakfast, coffee and hot chocolate 24 hrs. Definately will come back.

This hotel is very close too times square and the subways staff are very friendly and helpfull breakfast and the free drinks though out the day are very nice beds very comfortable but we stayed in a family room and they are too small for 2 beds in them nice views from our room tho 9nky thing is don't think the room was cleaned well before we came as there was a dirty pair of lady's pants down the side of one of the beds

Recently stayed here for a four night break. Very good safe location with a few bars & restaurants nearby, 7/11 store on corner close to hotel,short walk to Times Square. Room was big enough for two adults, very clean and light. Toiletries in bathroom too. I like the Hampton inn hotels because of the little extras they give you like free breakfast buffet in the mornings, which was very good, free coffee in the lobby, newspapers & apples. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again, I did find New York very expensive this time compared to my last few visits. But still had a great time.

This hotel makes an ideal base for getting around. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great. We found both the bedroom and bathroom to be of adequate size and to be well equipped. We enjoyed our stay so much that we will definitely choose to stay here next time we visit New York.

2nd time here. Would stay again. Great location for shows or Convention Center, bus or train. Staff is great. Breakfast is decent and plentiful. Love the coffee. Rooms are small but Still very comfortable.

Our room was a decent size and clean. We arrived early and were allowed early check in. Complimentary breakfast was decent. Staff was friendly and attentive. Used our AARP discount. Would defiantly stay here again.

I can’t say enough about the staff. The staff at this hotel are so sweet and friendly. They are working with what they’ve got. They are the only reason I’m not giving it a lower rating because I don’t want to bring them down. Also, the breakfast was really great so that compensated a bit also for my disappointment in the room. The staff at breakfast, Jessica and company, and the front desk, Clarence (who was always working, every shift it seemed!) really made this stay more enjoyable than it would otherwise have been. Also on the plus side, there was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. Instead of drawers, there are nice wire baskets. Nice touch. The problem is That this building was not meant to hold this many rooms! The rooms are the smallest I have ever stayed at in my life. Even smaller than some European cities. You can’t even move in the bathroom. No counter. Your items go on a shelf over the toilet and you hope they don’t fall in. It was clean, though. The beds are full, not queen. Too small for a couple to share. As a Hilton gold member, I used many points (I think 70k) for this two night stay. I just don’t think it was worth all those points since I saw online they were only charging something like $92 per night on travel websites. Also, as a gold member, I was pretty disappointed that we had a view of a wall. I asked the woman when I checked in if it was at least a nice room and she said it would be. I knew it would be small, I just didn’t know how small. Location was good, but one last thing I wish I heeded...I read all the reviews about the elevator and for some reason I thought they were exaggerated. Well, they weren’t. You can wait up to 10 minutes, then when it comes it’s full so you have to wait for the next one. God forbid you forget something in your room like my son did....he ran back up 25 flights to get his convention tag because we waited 12min for the elevator. If you get a good price and you just need somewhere to sleep and have breakfast, this is fine. I know I spelled out a lot here, but the basic problem was the size of the room and slow elevator.

Super close to time square, we walked almost everywhere. We could walk to Time Square, Bryant Park, our Broadway show and multiple dinner and bar locations. Warning he showers are tiny! We could barely turn around without hitting the walls.

Great service! Great location! Lovely rooms with views ! The staff was very helpful! Breakfast was quick and easy! No rush no hassle. In the city elevators are slow. These ones were super! Overall great experience front desk staff. Fantastic

small rooms but clean and comfortable beds, decent hot breakfast included - easy walking district to broadway shows and times square. lots of construction going on across street made it a bit noisy at times.

CONVENIENT LOCATION in midtown. Walk to Times Sq. Minutes from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and Metro. We used the subway quite a lot so this was real convenient to walk only a couple hundred yards. Hotel is nice, clean and some of the rooms have an amazing view of NY. I'd stay here again.

Close to central park, Broadway shows, and Times square. Breakfast is typical for Hampton Inn. The room is a small since it is NYC. The staff was friendly. The elevator took a long time. We would love to stay here again.

I usually find Hampton Inns to be comfortable and convenient. This hotel is old, crowded, with a mess of noisy construction in front of it, inadequate small elevators used by both guests and full laundry carts. Don't get a room at the front or on lower floors--noise is awful from construction.

Great location. top notch. The room was clean, the breakfast was ok, The staff was very helpful. Being close to times square was perfect. If we come to NYC again I would definitely stay here again.An enjoyable couple of days.

Our room was clean and well appointed. The breakfast was typical Hampton Inn and very appreciated as a money saver! We had a problem with the hot water in our room and the manager was very responsive to our needs. They truly want to please their guests and they care.If you want to be near the Broadway theaters and Times Square, this is a wonderful location. The train is also two city blocks from the hotel and Port Authority is one block from the hotel.

Stayed here Jan 1-5, 2018. 2 teens and 2 adults. Convenient location-was able to walk to Times Square and to the metro. Safe area. Free breakfast was great but hotel was very busy so it was crowded. It is a tall building so elevators take some time. Overall service was great and the rooms were kept well.

A good and easy check in , rooms good size. Breakfast was very good but the room itself was very cold. Always a hot drink available day and night. Lifts , had to sometimes wait a while for one but understandable due to size of hotel. Would like to say a huge thanks to the two lads that tried to get us a taxi to the airport on the day of the snow storm, they tried for quite sometime but apologised when they failed.We returned to the hotel after not being able to get home for a few days , my only grumble was when we were finally going home we asked the concierge if he could organise a taxi for us his reply was to go and get a yellow cab ! After a few chaotic days of coming backwards and forwards his attitude was the last thing we wanted to hear !

I used to be a front desk agent a few years ago. Here's everything I found unacceptable here: When you get into your room, there is a heater with knobs ripped off, leaving you to think your heater doesn't work. My boyfriend was immediately stressed and I called the front desk. I was told there are buttons for the heater on the other wall! Cool thanks! Hard for a new guest to spot though. "There's supposed to be signs" I was told on the phone. Huh ok. I could tell I wasn't the first person to call and ask about this.There is NO MICROWAVE to use whatsoever. I even looked in the breakfast room. Nada. How hard is it to get a microwave? We are in NYC and I would like to heat up my leftovers. I ended up eating a lot of stuff cold in my room. Ugh. Never again. My boyfriend and I even walked past a microwave on the street and we joked about bringing it back to our room.I also noticed there was only 1 front desk agent around the desk a lot of the time, during busy check in and check out times? Long lines whenever I wanted to ask a quick question? What a drag.This is where things started to go downhill fast. The hot water in the lobby was empty 2 nights in a row when I attempted to make hot chocolate. Really guys??? Thanks for the tease. I guess I'll just go up to my room. I was excited to see there was oatmeal at breakfast, but then I put it in my bowl and it was so runny and watery and gross! Threw the rest away.There was also a night I asked the front desk for a comb. The lady said something like "No I'll have to get that sent up to your room." My boyfriend and I watched hours go by in our room and I never got a comb. The next day I go to the front desk to once again ask for a comb. Jim pulls one out effortlessly. Thanks! I wish the girl did that for me. My boyfriend asked housekeeping for another roll of toilet paper. We never got it. Ended up using napkins on our last day there. The housekeepers do not service rooms until way later in the day. Basically by the time we wanted to go back to the room and relax from walking around all day. A good tip is to ask for earlier service while you're out of the room.The housekeepers also have to share the elevator with the guests :) what a nightmare. You will be waiting for the elevator a very long time. Then get cramped inside with 10 other people and cleaning supplies. The icing on the cake. On check out day I wanted to print my boarding passes in the business center. Everything's going fine until my passes print blank with no ink. Just another problem I wanted. I went up to my room for a minute to wait for the ink to be fixed, then came back down to see maintenance working at the door and they just said "sorry out of business". I was boiling at this point to say the least. Pretty unacceptable to put the business center out of business during check out time when I need my passes the most???? You could of at least gave me a warning???? I never got my passes there. Thank god I got them at the airport. At this point I could not wait to leave this place. My boyfriend had to talk me out of it and calm me down on our last day in NYC. It seemed like every small thing was a hassle. We finally checked out and I couldn't even understand the girl helping me because her voice was too soft and quiet. Boyfriend turned and said to me, "What did she say?" "I don't know." The girls seemed clueless and unhappy. Super monotone with no personality. Seemed like they didn't want to be there. But you gotta fake it til you make it!!! Peter and Jim were way more helpful and friendly though even when I saw them in high stress situations. On the upside! The bed was very comfy and I enjoyed the view! The 19th floor was very quiet and I loved it, despite being close to the elevator.

Difficult to review either as totally positive or negative.On the plus side the beds were really comfortable,the shower was really good and the free wifi excellent.There was tea and coffee available in a small seating area 24hrs or you could take it to your room.The down side of the room was there was no living space and it was too small for three adults and two double beds.We have never lived in a hotel room that has absolutely no drawer space anywhere.Living out of a suitcase can be normal but there is usually a few drawers for everyday items.The free breakfast would have been ok but the area was too small and the constant line simply offputting.There was never any seats if you were willing to wait for food so it was easier just to get coffee and take it to the room.A major negative was only two lifts to service 32 floors each with 6 rooms and no service elevator so quite often cleaning trolleys and maintenance staff dictated the time spent waiting.We were on the 26th floor but if you can take a low floor so the stairs can be used.Location was good but we would not stay there again and honestly would not recommend it.

The hotel was pricey but I think it was just due to New Years' holiday. The location is fantastic, 10 mins walk from great shopping and Times Square. Staff very friendly, clean hotel and comfy bed. Would definitely recommend!

Check in was great. Housekeeping lacks in customer service and follow through. Breakfast was great, but if its cold out, bring your parka. There is not a good source of heat in the dining area. Given the size and location of the hotel - noise is a big issue.

very nice hotel, clean new rooms, friendly staff, very nice breakfast offerings. Plenty of food options, great location, right in the heart of the main Times Square tourist area. I would definitly recommend for families

This hotel was a great place to spend Christmas. The location was convenient to many attractions and the subway. The room with 2 beds was comfortable, not too crowded. Santa showed up for breakfast and the lobby cookies were the only Christmas cookies we had this year. Thanks for a great time.

Hotel location was great, room was tiny but clean. Heater was loud, woke us up a couple times a night. We would rate our stay as average. Was not as pare as the our Hampton inns we stayed at in the past in other states.

Booked this hotel for a week´s stay over the New Year. The location is very good. Close to Times Square and the Subway. Good location also for most tourist places on Manhattan. Plus for the complimentary breakfast and free faultless wifi service. Coffee and tea available all the time. Quiet and newly refurbished room. I stayed at 26th floor.

The hotel service and location was amazing!! Close to times square, Broadway, and lots of other attractions. Beware of a few nuisances. First, this hotel has 32 floors and only 2 elevators. Second, the room we stayed in had two double beds and no extra room to move. It was tiny!! Lastly, the breakfast are was small and overcrowded. Not a big selection.

picked this hotel based on its price and location to times square. check in was easy polite and helpful... room was huge! I think they upgraded us to a junior suite. breakfast was the normal bagels etc.. tea and coffee in the reception 24 hours was good... the only negative was that the room was quite cold especially the bathroom. I had to use my shoe as a door stop to keep the bathroom door open to warm it up. apart from that everything else was perfect... 5 minute walk to 42 street and the famous times square!

The rooms are clean, but very small. You’ll wait a long time to use an elevator most of the day. The staff is friendly and attentive.  My only real complaint is that the rooms are very loud. We could hear the room above us opening their squeaky door day and night. Also, lots of construction during the weekdays directly across the street which is pretty loud ( understanding the hotel can’t control that)  The location is good only a few minute walk to Times Square, and major subway accesses.

It was a great trip to Manhattan and the Hampton Inn was a perfect place for me to stay. I really enjoyed being there. The only complaint I truly have is that they charged my credit card $60 per day of my 3 day stay for incidentals that had not even occurred yet. It was a shock! No bad reflection on the hotel per se; all hotels do it. It's just I didn't expect $60 (that much) per day to be charged for something that hadn't happened yet. They charged my credit card $180 immediately. What's up with that? I think that is truly a very bad practice by all hotels and car rental companies. The charges were dropped from my card within 2 days though. So that was good.

Hampton Inn on 39th Street in NYC was a great place to spend the weekend. Convenient to the Bolt Bus stop & easy walk to Times Square, theaters, restaurants, & Macys. Free breakfast was excellent and had warm drinks available 24/7. The hotel room was clean & the staff was very helpful & friendly.

Long waits for the elevators at prime times. At least 10 min and the same for breakfast lines. The elevators are really loud at night and with only six rooms to a floor, you hear them even furthest away from the elevator. I used ear plugs and was fine, though. Know there is tax on parking and SUV parking is more. So the expected $60/night ended up at $82/night. Rooms are small but clean and beds are comfy.

I book this hotel and I'm so happy. The location is close to everything, subway , times square,empire state etc .. the staff very friendly , breakfast was good. i would recommend this hotel for sure. and i will coming back to book this hotel again. the staff of this hotel is very friendly and helpful.

Must go to New York amazing.So much to see and such an experience.Hotel situated near Times Square restaurants and shops.Hotel good but would have been nice to have a restaurant so at night be able to have a drink and relax.It was help yourself continental but was sufficient as restaurants such big portionswemostly shared a meal.Christmas at Maceys is a must and Central Park.

Location was great, we ordered Uber from location. Staff is very helpful and super efficient. Can't wait to go back again soon! I'm aiming for the top floor one of these days. Free USA Today paper was a bonus!

I won a trip to NYC for my husband and I, all expenses paid. They booked us in to the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square South for the accommodation and we were not disappointed. Front desk staff were super friendly and incredibly helpful. The room (1103) was spacious, had everything we needed, with an incredibly comfortable bed and good shower. We weren’t disturbed at all by street noise or other guests (the room is tucked into a corner at the end of a corridor). We found breakfast a little hectic but that’s to be expected at this time of year (16th to 19th December), so even when we didn’t get a chance to enjoy it, made good use of the 24 hour coffee facilities. The location of the hotel is excellent for Times Square and also Empire State Building, with two very close subway stations (Port Authority and Times Square) within easy distance offering trains to get to virtually anywhere you’d want to go. We honestly couldn’t fault the hotel, they could just do with a bigger breakfast room to accommodate the number of guests. Would definitely return and recommend to friends.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was ready when we got there. The room was clean and the bed oh so comfortable. The location was perfect and allowed us to walk to most everything we wanted to do. A wonderful value for the quality of the room and the employees.

Hamptom is always a good and this one is really well located. The 39th street (between the 7th and 8th Avenues) is a good location. Close to everything in Manhattan but in a relativey quiet street (if there is anything quiet in NEY city :-). The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is smaller than most Hamptons but it is NY. Breakfast is Hampton-style with everything you need.

Hampton Quality all the way, hotel located in great location with in walking distance of a lot of good stuff, hotel staff did a great job and were very attentive, yes I would recommend , nice stay, only disappointment was room size, 4 large folks a little tight,

Great location to time square an 42nd street. We could walk to everything we had planned. Being on 39th street between 8th an 9th got us out of the big crowds on the sidewalk. There was also a great Irish pub two door down from the hotel that has very good food.

Hotel is walking distance to pretty much anywhere you will want to visit in the Times Square Area. It is a large hotel (32 floors) so housekeeping is very slow and may appear very late in the day to get to cleaning the room. Hot water is evasive.

We would definitely stay here again! Great hotel & good location to most everything. The staff was so courteous & helpful from the time we checked in to arranging a car to take us to the airport when we checked out. The room was clean & the beds were comfortable. The breakfast bar had a big selection & we were satisfied every day. The concierge was helpful in directions & places of interest. We enjoyed our stay in New York & the Hampton Inn was a big part of making it so great! Overall I give this hotel a 10!!!!

I have already outlined my complaint that myb room was not cleaned, and that it appears to me the staff simply lied about trying to gt it cleaned. If they had said it could not be done I would have been upset, but shrugged it off...the lying is what really bothers me

Clean, comfortable rooms for business travelers need a well-located lower priced hotel in mid-town NYC. Free breakfast and good WiFi connections. Fitness center, easy access to mid-town restaurants, theaters, and business facilities. Friendly, helpful hotel staff.

I always stay here because I can walk to Port Authority and theater district easily. Usually it’s a good deal for the price but watch out when they jack up the prices for holidays or events. Not worth $400 for a tiny room. Also the elevators are bad so dont stay on a high floor.

I stayed there for 4 nights and thought it was great. The location is perfect for Manhattan, walking distance from Times Square and everything else. The staff were friendly and the room, although one the smalll side but normal for NYC, was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet choice was a bit limited but still do a good job of filling us up before starting each day. I would highly recommend it.

I stayed 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Manhattan - Times Square South. Checking in was easy. The front desk employees were very nice and professional throughout our stay. The hotel provides free breakfast and there is always coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available throughout the day. The bagels at breakfast were not the best NY type bagels, but tasted like Panera instead. The breakfast potatoes were amazing! Whole and skim milk with choices of cereal were available as well as yogurt. Juice was available - orange, cranberry, and apple. The hotel was clean and our room was kept clean daily by the maid service with towels replaced daily. Plenty of towels, comfortable bed and pillows! Loved having a refrigerator. Air and heat ran well in our room. Plenty of wall plugs to charge electronics as well as USB port charging areas. The hotel is set in the Garmet District which isn't the nicest area. Lots of homeless and fake homeless around and a run down area, but it's close enough to the subway and central enough to be a good location for travel. It's next to Hell's Kitchen and near many restaurants and several good pizza places to get a slice or two. Things to improve on: The walk way that runs in front of the elevators is much too narrow for the amount of traffic the area sees, especially during breakfast and check in and check out times. 9/10 times at least one of the elevators did not work. The wait for an elevator was always long as there were so many people using the 1 working elevator. (Don't tell me it has been fixed like previous replied to other reviews - it's not fixed and even your staff knows this.) When both elevators were working, they were always full and we had to wait several passes before there was room to get on. The maid service staff uses the same elevators as the guests which is unprofessional and uncomfortable. Dresser Drawers of some sort would benefit guests that stay longer than a weekend. The bathroom shower was quite narrow, the bathroom very small, and no counter space other than the counter that goes immediately around the sink. All of these things an be lived with and worked around. However, the concierge on Monday morning was frazzled and unprofessional. She didn't appear to know what she was doing at all. We were scheduled to take the shuttle to the airport and we had been told the night before to arrive 10 minutes early for the shuttle. We did. We saw no one else waiting for the shuttle, so we asked her what we should be doing. She said our shuttle was around the corner, but we needed to wait on others. We did not want to wait. We wanted to go on to the shuttle to wait there and to get settled. She rudely told us that we must wait for her and that we could not go to the shuttle and we must wait on others. As we walked outside anyway, she continued to insist that we stay inside the hotel and remain with her. We continued to go outside. Another concierge from the next door sister hotel was outside and asked us if he needed help and we told her we were just looking for our shuttle. We walked us down to the shuttle where we found that everyone was already on the shuttle and was ready to go!! Had we wanted for our concierge, we may have missed the shuttle. The shuttle should have picked us up in front of the hotel like the other shuttles were doing, but instead it was practically parked in traffic and we had to maneuver around on coming traffic to get on the shuttle. Other guests on the shuttle commented about the disorganization and unprofessional behavior at the hotel from this shuttle arrangement and the unprofessionalism of the concierge on Monday morning. She seemed stressed and maybe things were out of her control, but more organization for the morning shuttle routine would help. Other than these things, it was a wonderful few days in New York!

Hotel was short walk to most locations we wanted to see. Close to subway for our other jaunts around the city. Staff was very accommodating and informative about things to see and do and how to get around.

I arrived at the hotel much earlier than expected and knew the chances of an early check-in was unlikely. However, a large group of people had checked out (9am) prior to my arrival which I found had the same room types as I. Anyone would assume that a room could have been cleaned prior to the 1pm timeframe which she gave me as being the earliest....ESPECIALLY since I had already told her of my travel issues and illness. I even offered to upgrade if needed. I asked the young lady at the desk to call me when my room was ready....NEVER HAPPENED! EXTREMELY disappointed! We took showers upon check in after walking around town and traveling. The shower did not drain correctly and we stood in our own bathing water. I totally understand that this is not something that might have been known. However, we notified the staff of this issue prior to leaving for the evening and when we took showers the following morning....still the same. After the shower drained the first day, it left a nasty film and I just assumed they did not clean that up after fixing it....I was wrong. It was so disgusting by the time we were done showering that I took a picture. I called the front desk after we arrived back to our room around 11pm about extra towels and the fact that our remote was not working. Maximo came with towels quickly and then maintenance followed shortly after with several remotes to ensure they could correct the problem which was great. The breakfast staff was GREAT and friendly even with so many people in and out! I really appreciated this. All the gentlemen that assisted with storing our bags were great! I PAID OVER $400 TO STAY AT THIS LOCATION AND TO SEE THE STAFF WEARING HANDWRITTEN NAMETAGS IS REDICULOUS. I COULD NOT EVEN MAKE OUT SEVERAL OF THE NAMES. HAMPTON INN IS PART OF THE HILTON BRAND AND I KNOW WE ALL HAVE BUDGETS TO KEEP IN LINE BUT COME ON PEOPLE HANDWRITTEN....EXTREMELY TACKY!!!!!!

More than happy with the hotel, particularly the price for the location. Very close to most of the action, but far enough away to not be hassled. A small hotel with a basic breakfast included in the price, but enough to start the day. 24 hour tea and coffee available which is nice instead of having to have your hand in your pocket all the time. Found staff to be friendly and helpful. Room size was quite reasonable and very clean. Bathroom was very clean. Would definitely stay here again as we were able to walk to Times Square, Broadway even to Central Park (a bit of a walk, but good exercise). Could walk down to catch the ferry only about 10-15 minutes. A number of bars and restaurants nearby.

Horrible service did not even help with finding adequate parking. Will not be staying there again and recommend others to find a better place. Front desk was rude and not helpful at all. Parking is overpriced

I stayed at this property over the Thanksgiving weekend and I had a very enjoyable stay. The location was great, rooms were clean and staff was extremely helpful...especially Anthony at the concierge desk who went above and beyond to get us a cab.

Nice Hotel and centrally located. Walk to every place. Good breakfast, friendly personnel. Only drawback is the elevators. You have to use stairs at pick times, or you will be late for everything . We were in floor 13, so if wasn’t bad going down, If one is down, you have to wait over 30 minutes. Stay in lower floors and you are Okay

We were pleasantly surprised with the comfort, location, and overall accommodations at this hotel. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, the bathroom a little small but it was clean. We were not disappointed with the free breakfast- it's NYC nothing is free or cheap. The service at the front desk was top-notch! I will definitely come back to this hotel.

Stayed here with my partner whilst on a long weekend break in New York City. I’ve stayed at Hampton’s before & am a Hilton Honours card holder so got a small discount. Location is very close to central Times Square & ideal for exploring NYC. When you stay at a Hampton you know what you’re getting & this one is no different. Not luxurious but well appointed, clean & very comfortable. WiFi signal was strong. All staff were very friendly & helpful. Recommended.

This hotel was great, it was clean, everybody was very nice, everybody responded positively to any discussion or questions that we had. The rooms are a bit on the small side but it is New York and that is to be expected. This hotel is so close to so many subway lines just a short walk up the street. It was also a great location to be able to walk to off-Broadway shows. I have to give kudos to the breakfast kitchen staff they were so good and helped us anytime we needed anything for our trip - we traveled with a large group of high school students and parents. They helped us organize a simple rotation to make sure that every student had an opportunity to eat a hearty breakfast.

Location is excellent! Everyone on the staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are comfortable and plenty of room. The hotel was very quiet for the most part...doors close loudly. I️ would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times a year since 2015. The cleanliness, location and staff are among the reasons we return. We stayed for two nights last week and would like to thank three staff members who went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. They were Henry, Yariela and Jessica. Manager Henry and Yariela were at the front desk to facilitate a special request which greatly helped our stay and Jessica prepares and serves the breakfast with friendliness and professionalism. Each of them should be chosen to provide customer service training to other staff members as they are a credit to the Hilton brand.

the Staff was friendly and the room was clean. Looks like the hotel had been updated recently. Close to restaurants and Time’s Square. The breakfast was an added bonus. Easy to get an elevator also. A positive experience!

The location of this hotel is great, very close to subway etc and in a relatively safe part of town (in all honesty, all of NYC felt safe while we were there). Room was a bit small, but, this is to be expected with such a central location. Room was tidy, lobby was tidy and staff very helpful. I'd recommend this hotel.

This hotel is average, but the location is good. The room was clean. The breakfast was okay, but not so tasty. Do not expect a nice view, but that doesn't matter because you will be exploring the near surrounding than the room view, right ;) Special thanks to the friendly staff!

The location of this hotel is great for the NYC Marathon. Not far from expo, NYRR center and finish line. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only 2-3 blocks to bus stop for airport transport. Plenty of options for restaurants and a couple of smaller groceries stores nearby. All hotels are expensive in NY so no deal there but location and cleanliness helps make up for the price.

We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Times Square South. The location was especially good because it was convenient but also relatively quiet in comparison to busier streets. The staff was excellent and helpful. The breakfast workers were efficient and friendly and always brought plenty of food out. The housekeepers were great and the room was very clean.

We stayed here on a recent weekend trip to NYC, and overall, it was great. Staff were friendly, the room was clean and quiet, and we had fast and free wifi. The included breakfast was a bonus - fresh and tasty. Recommended.

Stayed at the Hampton Inn pre-cruise leaving 10/16/17.They kindly stored our luggage so that we were able to catch a Broadway show that afternoon.In fact my Kindle was just placed with my luggage and returned to me without any problems.Nice honest staff!Room was great,quiet,great view,interesting neighborhood.Able to take a healthy walk to and from the Eugene O'Neill Theatre and enjoy the city at night.

A bit off the beaten path, it is worth the walk to have some privacy and comfort. In a row of hotels and a cluster of nice restaurants, this Hampton Inn has all the usual amenities and a very accommodating staff. Peter was particularly helpful on two occasions, especially when I checked in and my company's credit card had been hacked/did not clear such that my reservation was cancelled. He coolly and quickly made a new reservation and reassured me that my stay was secure. I only took the elevators to move in and out, as they warned that they could be slow, but the stairs were just fine for my 8th floor room. Typically Manhattan-small, the room was everything I needed with adequate lighting and outlets. I particularly liked that the TV goes right to channels rather than trying to sell movies. The bathroom had been upgraded with a zero-entry style often found in Europe. I think the room was meant to be wheelchair accessible. A/c and heat worked well. Breakfast buffet was above average, and one of the servers even went to every table to hand out Andes chocolates, just because she liked doing it. Loved the 24/7 coffee.

I was initially surprised at how small the rooms were but the price, location, and friendliness of the staff made it worth it. There was an issue with one of our double rooms prior to checkin, so they accommodated us with 2 king rooms.

This property was in close proximity to almost everything. The staff was awesome and the property was clean and kept. All of these great things added with a reasonable price makes this property an awesome choice.

Poor service, double bed instead of queen that I paid for. Loud AC that was never fixed. Employees didn’t care about issues, just offered to relocate to another hotel. Only 6 rooms per floor with 32 floors, so elevator was slow.

Family Vacation - PROs: great value, friendly and accomodating staff, awesome breakfast included, convenient location, street traffic quieter than usual, nonexistent on a higher floor. CONs: one of two elevators almost always broken causing long wait times. If you don't mind the marginal street noise, get a room on a lower floor.

If you stay here make sure you stay on the lowest floors as they can't seem to keep both elevators working at the same time, and on a 32 floor hotel, expect to wait 20 minutes for an elevator. The best is the staff is so use to it they just joke about it "building character". And I got to pay $400 a night for non working elevators!And I use to be a Hilton Diamond member. Marriott here I come!!!!

I really loved this hotel, it has great location in center of Manhattan(pretty close to time square). the rooms are nice and clean(from mine room at 27th floor I could see empire state building).the breakfast was pretty good, it's included waffles, fruits, cereals, good coffee and more stuff. on weekend elevetor ride for having breakfast can be busy, on Sunday we waited almost 20 mins for elevator to 27 floor.Also wanted to add the near by the hotel, on 39th and 9th st there were some homeless people living and going through there want not so pleasant experience(guess hotel cant do anything about it anyway)

Decent hotel with nice efficient staff. Many foreign tourists and student groups - lobby often crowded with people and luggage. There is a concierge in the morning. Hotel room was clean with large flat screen TV, refrigerator and free wifi. Mattress was not very supportive and had a polyester duvet (I am picky about bedding). Decent size bathroom could use more counter space. Shower cramped but had lots of hot water. Only 2 thin bath towels. Could be a wait for elevators as there are 29 floors and one behaved erratically during our stay. On the plus side: Walk to theaters and many restaurants. Good free breakfast with crispy bacon, waffles, tasty muffins. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate offered all day. Room at back of hotel very quiet with view of back of new condos. Even though check-out time was very crowded, I only waited a couple minutes. Overall, I'd say Hampton Inn is a bit below quality compared to HGI or Doubletree but still has some nice amenities. Great for a couple nights stay!

This a good hotel that we stayed at for one night. Most reviewers have stated that there are only six rooms on a floor and the rooms are compact. I have been in smaller rooms in NYC and these are not even close to the smallest.The staff was very friendly, I had a short wait at check-in and the front desk clerk was very apologetic. The rooms were clean and the bed was fine. Remember in a Hampton Inn you will have paper cups and less amenities than other Hilton properties.The elevators are a drawback to this hotel, not enough not to stay here, but be forewarned. Only one of the elevators was working during our stay and on Sunday morning the wait for the elevator was a little taxing. On the plus side you meet a lot of nice people when you need to cram into a small NYC elevator and ride 29 floors. For the one night we were there it was fine, but if I was staying a week, it would be a challenge.Overall a convenient, affordable hotel.

Wonderful helpful staff, cleanliness of hotel and location was great! Enjoyed the breakfast every morning. Lots of variety to choose from. Great experience with a big group of us traveling together. Highly recommend this hotel.

Great stay. Small rooms. But it’s NYC. so I expected it. Great location. Front desk was friendly. Free breakfast and when you’re traveling with kids it’s nice to have one less meal to pay for. Great location. Near subways.

This is our go to hotel in NYC. Super clean rooms combined with a terrific hotel staff and easy location make this our favorite NYC hotel. Larger than average rooms that are very well maintained. We love the staff- they know their neighborhood, restaurants and subway maps! Breakfast is a typical Hampton Inn but they have good NYC bagels. The location is terrific - close to subway lines, Port Authority and Times Square but far enough away to provide a break from the madness! We love this hotel!

Tiny little rooms but clean. Don’t be in a hurry and plan ahead because elevators are slow/busy. Location is great, within walking distance of broadway shows, good restaurants, Times Square and public transportation.

First trip to New York chose this hotel based on price and location. Great choice. Hotel was close to Times Square, Broadway shows, Empire State and MSG. But far enough away that it was quiet at night. We stayed on 29th floor and could see Empire State Building from our window. King bed Room was not huge but well thought out. Comfy bed and great AC. Plenty of outlets and USB ports. Wi-fi was fast. Breakfast had eggs and waffles as well as fresh fruits and danish. Staff was really friendly. Everyone that we came in contact with was awesome. Had a few issues at check in with keys and some items not in room. Staff took care of them quickly and credited our bill for the trouble. Only six rooms per floor so elevators can be a bit slow during peak times but not that big of a deal. Would definitely stay here again!

Hotel is in a great location close to lots of attractions. My room is ok but the bathroom left a lot to be desired. When I turned on the lights I immediately noticed the bathroom was infested with dozens of little flying bugs that looked like fruit flies. Gross.

From the moment I arrived I was catered to as if I were the only guest that night. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were all very friendly and eager to help. My room was clean and well appointed.Great place to stay , I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great value and amazingly helpful staff.

Overall the place was ok, some issues with key card access in older door hardware, however there were lots of outlets and USB ports throughout the room which was awesome. Especially near the beds. Only criticism was that it was tremendously expensive for the type of room and quality of the hotel. The staff however were great.

Positives: Clean, good locationNegatives: This hotel is a small area hotel (6 rooms on each of the 35+ floors) with two elevators with a long waiting period. Some of the staff not friendly. Front desk cramped and very busy at most hours with visitors checking in and out. Breakfast OK but food not that great. Our room was not cleaned during the mornings, twice during our stay. Some of the small and thin towels were unpleasantly spotted. While we rested in the afternoon the cleaning staff was noisy and door slamming. The air conditioning worked only on a single fixed temperature. The free WIFI was very weak and was off during the night hours.Overall: For a fun NY holiday choose elsewhere

I stayed at this hotel for families. The Staff was very nice.The room was cozy and comfortable. I had 2 queen beds in my room. The beds were really comfortable. There were 2 pillows which was good for me, but if you need more I recommend that you ask for them at the time of booking. The bathroom was cramped but had all the necessities. Although, it did have plenty of towels and wash cloths for a family of 5. The breakfast was good, but it ran out fast, but food came out quickly. Overall, I recommend this hotel and it was above average for something at this price.

They could not be more accommodating. Cozy nice room, very clean, best breakfast! Incredible coffee and I’m a native New Yorker very fussy about coffee and food. I would come back just for the breakfast! Very comfortable beds pillows!

Perfectly located hotel with VERY clean rooms and a staff that could not be nicer if they tried. Everyone was friendly, helpful and clearly were there to make my short stay enjoyable. The morning breakfast was superb. Lots of fresh variety and the hot food was hot and the cold food cold. But there needed to be more people at check-in. One person cannot check in a hotel's worth of guests. The wait was too long.The room was VERY clean and well laid out. A little small for me but fine for most. I would absolutely stay again.

My wife, mother-in-law, and I stayed for 2 nights in NYC at this hotel and the experience was just so-so. Sure the breakfast is free, but it is so crowded during that time and the food & service is below average compared to other Hampton Inns I've stayed at around the country. The location is very close to all of the tourist attractions, so if that's your deal you'll be set. We've had better experiences staying at Hamptons and Hiltons outside of this general area of NYC.

Nice location, convenient to everything I needed, friendly staff. This is the second time I've stayed at this location and I'll be back. Rooms were extremely clean, bed was very comfortable. I was able to check in a little early and was greeted with a friendly smile. Great experience.

I love this location. It is so close to the broadway shows. I also love the breakfast in the morning. The waffle maker is divine and everyday the breakfast is different. The staff at the front dest is always friendly and helpful. I have been staying at the Hampton in for years. I'm a Gold Member Hilton Honors Member and I enjoy the benefits that it gives.

good location, efficient staff and friendly. Hotel is near many restaurants as well as penn station is within walking distance. look forward to staying there again on my next trip to new york. wifi was good as well

I have stayed in many hotels in the Midtown Manhattan and this one has much to recommend it above others in its price range (about $300 per night with taxes included). 1. It’s location couldn’t be better. Walkable to everything in Times Square area. And subway. 2. Staff at front desk and lobby area were polite, responsive and well-trained. 3. The rooms (at least the one I stayed in) were much larger than just about all of the comparably priced rooms in the area. King Study, AAA rate. It was clean and well-kept. And I did not hear any traffic noise (floor 10). For price, location, room size and service, you’re not likely to find better!

Just spent three nights at the Hampton. This was our first time at this hotel and we were quite satisfied. By New York standards, the room was quite large. Two Queen beds, comfortable chair, refrigerator, closet and safe. Though we were on the back of the building, the windows were large and there was plenty of light. Staff was helpful and friendly. And while the breakfast wasn't lavish, it was fine. For us, location was perfect. Close enough to Times Square and the theaters. But enough away to be out of the craziness. And there were literally hundreds of restaurants within a stone's throw of the hotel. We walked everywhere; totally safe no matter time of day or night.

Great location and easy to walk to many places. Lots of food outlets nearby. We arrived by train at Penn Station and it was an easy 10-minute walk from there. Although our booking had been confirmed by a large booking agency, when we arrived there was no record of the booking (still sorting this out!), which resulted in an inferior tiny room with no view and no space to even open our cases properly. Clean room though. Breakfast was very basic with disposable plates and cutlery but a reasonable variety. Only two elevators servicing 32 floors and almost 200 rooms which led to bottlenecks in the very narrow foyer (not helped when one of the elevators broke down!). This hotel was not up to the usual Hilton chain standards.

Typical NYC Hampton Inn. Smallish rooms, cramped bathroom with small sink and 2/3 shower. Only two small elevators for over 26 floors so always a wait. Location is good though. Breakfast was typical but crowded. It's NY I guess.

Clean, comfortable room with excellent staff. Great breakfast options. Walking distance from many fun attractions. Great price for weekend vacation. Close easy walking distance to many attractions. We will be back :D

The wife and I decided to get away for the weekend. Beautiful, clean, comfortable rooms & beds. Great staff, concierge was amazing & very helpful. We were able to walk down a few streets to Time Square.

This past weekend my daughter and I traveled to NYC and stayed at this Hampton. I am a Hilton's Honor client and except good service since I generally only stay at Hilton Hotels. I have a problem with fragrances and request nothing with a harsh odor be used in the room. I also have a problem with sleeping so I request a room high and not near an elevator. Lucky for me all was fulfilled. The breakfast served was very good. All staff was extremely helpful.

I like the hotel because it was so close to everything but the room is small. The rate is decent though so I can't complain. They don't have an in and out parking privilege and had to pay $65 everytime we take the car out.

A great location for tourists as it is close to transport and Times Square is a short walk. A number of cheaper restaurants nearby as well as beer and wine shops. The room was small but clean with a good bathroom. Breakfast which was included in our tariff was a real hit and miss affair. On our first morning there were more people in the small dining area than it could cope with. The choice of food was limited and of only average quality. The other mornings had better numbers but the same food. Things are obviously done to keep prices down e.g. paper plates and plastic cutlery. There are signs warning about the lifts being slow but it was never a real issue for us. Overall if you don’t set your goals too high, it is a reasonable place to stay.

I was told that this was a nice hotel, but it turned out to be very disappointing. I do not think this should be part of a Hilton brand, as it seemed disorganized, impersonal and not well maintained. It seemed like a low-cost hotel for tourists from other countries with kids who were on a budget, yet it cost me as much as a fancy hotel.

Our main problem was the staff- they were not friendly. The room size (3_03) worked for a group of four. No view even though it was the top floor. The elevator was a challenge but it was fun to bet how. Any times we would stop on our way up or down. A cleaning cart was left or stored outside of our room. Which made it difficult to get in and out due to the small hall a the closet door did stay closed we would have to squeeze in. Called the front desk but was still there 2 mornings. Had to turn and lift our luggage to get by. Avoid using 9th ave especially at night lot of people "hanging out" on the corners.

The hotel is conveniently located in lower Times Square area. It's attractive and modern. Rooms are on the small side but have great bathrooms (big glass shower) and decent closet space. The entire staff was friendly and professional. We had a very pleasant weekend stay. A great breakfast is included with the room. There was hot and cold food available.

I was booked at the Hampton through booking.com the Hotel offer first class quality services ranging from staff, cleanliness of rooms and room service, ease of travel round NY, etc; it was a excellent 10 days and would recommend this hotel for people on a business trip or holiday who was an experience of a good quality hotel at the heart of Manhattan

Enjoyed my New York experience and stay in this hotel. Htel well located near TImes Square but not so near that it was noisy. Our room was moslty very quiet. Staff were excellent and very courteous and willing to assist. I would recommend the hotle for a vist to the city.

unlike some equally star rated hotels this one didn't have noisy air-con and poor soundproofing. They did replace the towels and cleaned up, though the beds and sheets could be better quality, on the cheaper side

The location is central to most everything. The rooms are clean, decorated modernly and roomy for the price. My room had a decent view of the city, street side. The staff was very friendly and aimed to please. I will definitely be back on my next visit!

Rightly placed in the town, Bit expensive but if the price is not a problem definitely a nice place with good food, banks and Penn and Grand central stations around. One of the accommodations to people visiting time square and shop around

Not sure if this is a fair review as this is only the second time that I stayed at a hotel in NY. Guest rooms are small but maybe it's just very typical in NY. The hotel does serve breakfast which is not bad You can hear street noise when you try to get some sleep but again, maybe that's just what it is in the Manhattan area. Compared to other Hampton Inns in other states, I am not totally impressed. I think you will just have to spend some serious money to get something much better.

Came for a three day trip to New York for the US open tennis tournament. The hotel has great value for its location. The rooms are a little tight but of course this is Manhattan. The breakfast was appreciated. There's a lot of construction on the block so going in and out in taxis or Uber took a long time.Would stay again for the right price.

This was a last minute business trip for three prople. Market prices in NYC were very high and this property offered great value. The hotel was Clean with friendly staff, Decent centric location, but small rooms/shower spaces.

Really liked this hotel. It is in a bank of hotels. Staff friendly, accommodating and the breakfast was very good. Hot and plentiful. Have to admit the corners of 8th and 9th Av made me feel unsafe. 9th Av near Port Authority so the neighborhood is a bit seedy. There were drunks on both corners of the street. I would choose another Hilton not in that area if I could. Because it was a holiday weekend, the price for the room was high.

I stayed 2 nights , vending machine did not work, breakfast area small, staff did not give soft drink until I insisted, one staff lies to me about tape being on fridge because it didn't work, she told me to go to holiday inn next door to buy drink, another staff member told me drinks are only for gold members, but it is not clear how he determined I was not gold member. They did not supply new soap the second day. They were disorganized and did not follow through valet parking. I always stay at Hampton Inn but this one I am not happy with.

There are about 31 floors with only 6 rooms on each floor. The elevators get busy especially at breakfast time which is from 6-10am. The room was spacious and well appointed, with an alarm clock, iron, phone, desk and a large tv. It is very close to the theater district and the bus terminal.

Bad experience with this location. Found rotten cake in my refrigerator upon arrival. Booked 2 rooms one room keys did not work till 1030pm that night waste of that room. They finally figured that the problem was with the battery on the lock for the key meantime I am locked outside. Manager Jim and engineer who finally showed up at 10pm was very rude. Would not recommend

Good location for theatre district. We stayed on second floor to avoid using elevator which was busy during peak times. Good breakfast with make your own waffles and excellent banana bread. Room was small but perfect for our stay. Looked like it had recently been renovated.

OK hotell and service Did not care for paper plates and plastic knifes and forks in the breakfast hall. Breakfast room was way to small and sometimes we had to take the breakfast with us to the room because there was no space left to sit...and we where not the only once - defently a room the should expand

I felt very cramped in room. I weight 209 lbs and I touched the shower wallk. I didn't not like that feeling f touching the shower walls. I didn't like the idea, the room attendant knock on my door prior to I checking out of the room at Noon.

I need to be up front about the fact that I really wanted in a booked-full Doubletree on 36th and in a phone call earlier in the week I thought I made this clear but when a room opened up and I tried on a Thursday to change my Saturday reservation from this Hampton to that Doubletree I was informed that I would be charged the full amount if I changed. It's 2017, Hilton, and that's what's so great about technology: a few keystrokes and the change could have been made. I would have been happy instead of still stewing about all this. So here we go. The lobby here is TINY and the room attenuates in front of the elevators then widens for the coffee and tea station then further widens for the breakfast room. The girl at the check in desk was polite and capable, took our bag and tagged it and assured me she'd text me when our room was ready. Never happened. We arrived back after dinner and took our room on the 22nd floor. Nice enough, clean but I probably would not have sprung for the "upgrade" which brought our little sojourn on 39th to over $300 for a decidedly average stay. The vibe at this hotel is reserved, even a little cold. Compared with other NYC Hilton properties, it is my least favorite. I did enjoy the Canadian bacon and bagel I had at breakfast and the apple was very good. Just nothing memorable about the experience and I would not return.

Lovely stay at Hampton. Between 34th street (Empire State Building) and 42nd (Time square), close to shops (Macy and others). Truly centrally located. Pleasant staff and good cleaning crew. Nice breakfast and tea and coffee available 24hrs

This is a great hotel for the price. A good location, close enough to Times Square but not noisy. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Our only issue was the elevators sometimes take a long time, which can be frustrating. That said, I'd still recommend.

This Hampton Inn is within a reasonable walking distance to Times Square and a subway station. The hotel and rooms were clean. They also provide hot/cold breakfast options which was good to have. When we arrived the front desk staff warned us that after 8:30 am the breakfast room would be very busy. During our first morning we learned that he was absolutely right. Not a lot of room to sit and eat at that time. This is NYC so yes the rooms are small compared hotels in other parts of the country. We had a room with two double beds and it was pretty tight. The room did have a small closet and the bathroom has a single sink, a toilet and a shower. There is a medicine cabinet so you can store toiletries there as well. There's only two elevators which are small so be prepared to wait during busy times such as breakfast or check out. We had a room on the 31st floor so noise wasn't an issue for us. Although the room was small, we knew that this is mostly the case in NYC, plus we were spending our time walking in the city so this was not a big issue for us. Finally, we did learn that the street this is in is the only one that leads to a major tunnel in the city, so it gets very busy with traffic. If you're trying to catch a taxi or an Uber it is best to walk to one of the streets perpendicular to 39th Street.

This Hampton Inn is in a great location, convenient to Times Square. Rooms were clean, Internet worked, and the staff was very helpful in many ways. The only issue was the two elevators which were very busy during the mornings, so we simply walked down the 16 flights of stairs. Not a really big deal, but the wait time was long. But during the day time, it was not a big deal.

The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. They provided recommendations and tips for navigating NYC. The kept our bags after checkout so we could continue to explore the city before our departure. The location was amazing; we were within walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do. The rooms were very clean and because it's on a side street, it was quiet.

You would think this is a typical Hampton Inn, it isn't. The rooms are cramped (double bed room we stayed in), the bathrooms shower stall is unthinkably narrow, hallways are tiny and narrow. The rooms aren't soundproof with any one talking in hallway could be heard as clear as a person in the room and thinking vice versa. Hotel staff isn't caring for even HHonors members. In short, not worth for the money you pay. I would rather pay a little extra and stay at other hotels in the chain or outside Hilton chain.

Good trip A little culture shock Rooms are very compact Not good for family with children No exact space for nothing. Two elevator working on the same circuit as Only one elevator Breakfast was good Employees were very helpful.

This hotel was brilliant! A stones throw from Times Square, it offered complimentary breakfast each morning and whilst it is busy and hard to get a seat in due to its business, I can't fault the staff for their customer service!We had a lovely guy called John help us with our stay, giving us advice on the bus tours and his great personality was really lifting in a strange city we had never been to before.A great hotel room with all the amenities you could ask for and a wide range of TVs channels not that you need them in the big apple!Loved our stay and would happily go back again if given the chance in the future!!

I won't rehash prior reviews, but in short this is a nice Hampton Inn, safe and workable for someone needing to be in Midtown. Right in the garment district, the neighborhood is safe but not as sanitized as the areas right by Times Square. Lobby is tight (it's weird how tiny the waiting area for the elevator is), and the breakfast area gets packed, but that's can be the case with any Hampton property. My advice is to stay on low floors - there's no great views to be had, and the elevators are small and you end up waiting 5-10 minutes on the upper floors. Would be nice to be able to bail out to the stairwell if you're in a hurry.Also, there's an AMAZING pub just a few doors down with a great menu and fantastic atmosphere. I'd stay here again just to eat at Tir na Nog - the best!

I must say that we were very surprised and impressed with the Hampton Inn. The room was the right size and it was very clean. The early morning breakfast was excellent (they added different items every morning, not the same basics). It is close to everything, we parked and walked everywhere. I will stay every time.

I was give one towel, there was no internet, and when I tried to use the business center, I would constantly get kicked off after 5 minutes of use. What takes the cake is that I had lost my ATM card and was paying for it with my temp card and the front desk agent didn't want to accept it because my name wasn't on the card.

Cramped room with no space for our suitcase. A/C was extremely noisy, sink did not drain, toilet paper holder pops off the wall. We were only provided with 2 bath towels for family of 4 despite requests for extra. Inadequate space in breakfast area, had to bring food up and eat on our bed. Problems were not dealt with when brought up to staff.

The location is an easy walk just a few blocks to Time Square. The room was small but nice, modern, comfy king bed, fridge; we were in 2304 so didn't hear road noise and its just out from time square so not all the lights and sounds; Small bath but functional. Mostly we were out in the city so the room size was fine. The hotel was recently renovated. The breakfast was popular so the selection was limited the later we arrived; saran wrapped apples were nice to take with us for the day; waffle maker is good. It's all what you would expect from Hampton Inn. The only issue was that the elevator was slow and the hallway from lobby to elevator is very narrow so there can be a back up of people waiting with luggage. We paid with points and cash so it was a good rate compared to most NYC hotels in the area so we were happy with our choice for this trip.

This hotel was in a great location - on a road I would consider a side street - you couldn't hear the road traffic (29th floor). Easy walking distance (a few miles maybe) to the museums, Central Park, Times Squar, and other Manhattan highlights. Close to the subway and the port authority. The rooms were small and cramped, which we fully expected for NYC so not an issue. I normally do not like staying near the elevator but our room was very quiet. The staff was very friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping staff and the concierge. Would definitely stay again.

Found this hotel to exactly what in says on the tin. It's very close to Times Square and all that has to offer. We had a very nice weekend with 4 persons staying in a twin bedded room. It was cosy but for Manhattan I expect nothing different. The breakfast was typical "free hotel fayre" bagels, waffles, toast, cereals, fruit, yoghurt and a couple of hot options (bacon and 'ready to eat' omelettes one day and sausages and scrambled egg the next). Staff on the front desk were efficient and pleasant. Only six rooms per floor so the two lifts were adequate for the 32 floors - sometime there as a wait but it was never very long. It wasn't cheap but it was ok value for a weekend in August in New York.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. It was conveniently located in the heart of Time Square and very close to the subway. A short walk would get you to Broadway. Restaurants were close as well. We felt very safe. The rooms were nice with all the amenities we needed. We loved it.

long wait for a room at check in, poor staff attentiveness, long wait for elevators, overcrowded lobby, overcrowded breakfast room, small rooms, found items in the room broken, staff slow to respond. Check out was the only thing that was normal. Staff not real helpful in helping to arrange a taxi.

This hotel was extremely clean, very well appointed and apparently recently remodeled. Couldn't have asked for a nicer experience. The icemaker on the floor also provided water and ice for our water bottles everyday! Very small hotel (6 rooms per floor) but convenient to Times Square. They kept our luggage upon checkout, which was a great relief to us, and they were ready when we checked in earlier than expected! Rooms are very small, as expected for NYC, but the bath cabinet was a great addition to solve the storage and space problem!

Very good location. Not quite near times square, but within a short walking distance. Excellent service. Courteous staff. Nice room and amenities. Breakfast was good with nice selection. Reasonable price for peak season. Will definitely visit again.

This was a nice typical Hampton. We picked this location to be in the heart of Times Square, but Times Square was a few blocks away. The breakfast was good with a variety of options. This is a tall hotel with only 6 rooms on 32 floors with only 2 elevators, so be prepared to wait. Peter at the front desk was very helpful.
