We were pretty disappointed with the Concierge located in the hotel. We assumed the concierge was employed by the Hilton and the hotel and there to help the guests. It turns out they are just there to make a sale and not employed by Hilton.

This Hampton is centrally located and close to many NYC sites. The rooms were clean yet small. The staff was helpful and welcoming. The food was basic and what you may expect from a Hampton. The street could be loud but not unmanageable.

As a previous Road Warrior averaging 100-150 night's on the road a year for nearly 30 years, I thought I had found the worst of everything. WRONG! The heating / cooling unit in the room never stopped cycling on and off every 10-30 seconds for 2 days and especially night's! Impossible to get a good night's rest. I have stayed in this hotel before and unfortunately I keep forgetting why I did not make this place my first choice. I have experienced this same issue in this same hotel, nut nit neccesarily the same room more than a couple if times. Have complained about it at least once before. This time I will not forget it. These two hot noisy nights will stick in my mind forever. Great location. Great staff. Horrible sleepless nights!

Hilton booked the wrong type of room in the wrong hotel! Horrible Costumer Service! No one could take ownership of the mistakes they made! Ruined our vacation! This is a whole in the wall - should not be approved with Hilton/ Hampton Inn Standards which are not elegant but you always get good service and cleanness! The room was horrible did not have a closet and was named "Suite"

The service at the front was rude and they all had bad attitudes. They all were not helpful. The hotel has a very small area for the breakfast area. It was about 50 people in one area. They only had 2 waffle machine.

Hotel was very nice and very clean. This hotel is in a great location. Times square and broadway is a short(5 to 10 minutes) walk away and subway is even closer. Room is small but that's to be expected in N.Y.C. Breakfast was good. Especially the light and fluffy waffles. No real complaints here. Would definitely return.

Staying in the Garment District was fun but still super close to Penn Station, Times Square and easy access to the subway. The only complaint was they don't sell stamps or offer to mail your postcards. Thankfully the biggest, prettiest Post Office is across from Penn Station! The rooms were efficient and clean and we had a great city view.

Had a good time at the hotel. Stayed there for 3 nights from 7/4-7/7. Staff is helpful, rooms are clean and the location is great. Few things that they can work on include fixing the elevator. The wait is long as there are only two elevators. The breakfast is great. Would surely go back

Spent five nights at this Hampton. Clean, comfortable, nice staff and good breakfast selection. Rooms are small by most standards, but fairly typical for the mid-level chains in NYC. Hotel is a quick 5 min walk to the Port Authority Bus Terminal, Times Square and multiple subway stops. Easy 5 block walk to Penn Station. Close to Javits Center.Will definitely consider staying here again on my next trip into NYC.

Small hotel, it is clean , but tje rooms are very small . Very hard to walk around . Very difficult for a family of three.Shower is so small it is,hard to fit in.Had to shower sideways .Wouldnt recommend for families

Good location for Times Square, great staff and rooms, lots of extras - free hot/cold drinks in reception, fresh cookies daily, breakfast bags etc. Would return to this hotel and recommend to friends.

I arrived about 2:10 and while my king room was not ready, the reception staffer helpfully offered to put me in a different room with two beds. Unfortunately, the room had a very bad smell -- something like wet carpet and/or mold and/or sweat. The room appeared clean -- except for something left behind in the safe -- but the smell was just not pleasant and did not go away, even with the window open. WiFi was okay, but not really fast enough for serious work -- complimentary WiFi only got up to about 3 mbps, and didn't work quite as well on the side of the room furthest from the door. The shower's water pressure was OK, but not great. Bed was comfortable and linens were very clean. TV worked fine. Room had tons of outlets and USB ports, which was nice.One REALLY annoying thing was that I was awoken at 5:50 AM in the morning by the room's alarm. It should be on the housekeeping department's check list to turn off the alarm when a room is turned over, so other guests aren't "treated" to a former guest's early wake-up time. This was really annoying and I couldn't fall back asleep.Another problem was that, when I arrived, I thought to take advantage of the free coffee/tea service, but when I went to grab a cup off coffee, I saw that fruit flies were all over the coffee containers. I could have still drank the coffee, of course, but it was disgusting and I'm sure the health department wouldn't approve either. In the morning, the hotel was fixing an elevator, so there was only one elevator for the 30-story hotel. The hotel put the elevator on manual operation, though, and staffed it with an assistant, so it wasn't actually that bad. Breakfast was a normal Hampton Inn breakfast -- eggs, pork sausage, bread, yogurt, etc.I specifically chose the hotel for the location close to the Port Authority, but I wouldn't encourage visitors to NYC to choose this location. Times Square is increasingly terrible with the sidewalks full of "artists" and the streets full of filth. Tourists would be better suited to choose a hotel in Chelsea or Union Square or the Lower East Side. Times Square is the worst of New York, unless, as in my case, I just needed a hotel between the Port Authority and Penn Station. I suppose I wouldn't be upset about returning to this hotel, but if I did, I would hope that I would receive a pleasant smelling room.

This hotel is in a great location to Times Square. There is a new hotel going in across the street so there was some confusion at check-in, but they were good to make up for it.Breakfast was the same as other Hamptons but they did keep there breakfast area very clean and stocked considering the busy times

This hotel, as you can tell from the name has a great Manhattan location and was so easy to get to after a delayed flight and problems on NJ Transit which I was very grateful for.As I arrived I was a little put out by the fact that there were no staff at the front desk to check me in. Then I looked at my watch and realised it was, surprisingly past 11pm and I was immediately more understanding. The gentleman who checked me in was lovely and professional and this can be said for all staff I encountered during my short stay. The room was spotlessly clean and had everything I needed. A comfortable shower, clean, soft towels and a lovely large bed. I was very happy with the room and as it was on the 32nd floor even had a nice view, although nothing spectacular. Breakfast in the morning was basic however it was absolutely all I needed. Nice, cute little omelettes, potatoes with pepper and a bakery selection. I believe there were also waffles and pancakes. There were juices and hot drinks on offer also. For me this was a great start to the day and my time in the big apple. Overall I really liked this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend or stay again. This hotel offers genuinely good value for money and ticks all the boxes.

The location is great because it is on a quiet street. The staff is super, super nice and accommodating. Paola and Peter at the front desk were really great. Francisco was too and a super thumbs up to the staff working the breakfast area. It gets really busy in the mornings and they are working non-stop and very nice. The breakfast is delicious and has a lot of variety. The only bad thing (which I knew when I made the reservation) is that the rooms and hallways are super small and narrow. The elevators are kind of slow especially in the mornings with everyone going down for breakfast. Housekeeping never got it right and they didn't leave the right amount of towels any of the days, not sure why. The a/c in the room was kind of crazy, it was either super cold at 68-69 but if we put it on 70-71, heat started to come out. I never bothered to call front desk about it so we just kept it really cold. Overall very good, especially if you aren't a big family or have a lot of luggage!

We stayed 3 nights! We were greeted with a friendly welcome and 2 bottles of water, which was refreshing considering it was quite warm. The lobby was clean, employees were well dressed. They have warm coffee, and chilled water in a water dispenser with fresh oranges to cover the chlorine taste of NY water. Our room was clean and of nice size! There were 2 double beds for my wife and I and our 2 upper teenage son's. Bed's were comfortable. I am not a fan of passive air movement in bathrooms which this has. (I just wish hotels would have bathroom fan's for showering.)Breakfast is provided at no extra charge. There was your normal fare of fruit, yogurt, pastries, waffle maker, cereal, as well as eggs and sausage. There is a fitness center with 4 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, a recumbent bike and an upright bike. Dumbbell weights in 5# increments from 5 to 50!Across the street is an entrance to the metro system and there is a shuttle service bus to Newark airport 1 block away! We walked easily to time square and our broadway show!There is also a washer and drier in the basement for laundry.

Although the location is a few blocks out of the action, the service and value are excellent! Get the parking package if you are driving your own vehicle onto the island. If you can get a high floor on the south side for a great view.

Had a good experience in my stay. The room was comfortable, the toilets clean and the staff were friendly. The quality of service was good and the speed was also commendable. My only recommendation would be that the staff should promote the HH membership more by ensuring that every customer that comes check in is asked if they have the HH membership.

This hotel is just a few minute walk from Times Square, Penn Station, and many other points of interest. I stayed for business, and despite being in NYC for less than 24 hours, the location allowed me to spend a little down time enjoying the sites. I'll likely return for a personal stay.

I've stayed her 4 maybe 5 times for work trips in the last 2 months. Nothing bad to say about it. It's not the Ritz but they do their thing well. Rooms are clean. Staff is surprisingly friendly. Definitely my go to place.

The rooms are so very small, even by NYC standards. My husband and I really had to coordinate getting dressed or moving about the room in general as there was no room for anything except the bed. I think my college dorm room was bigger than this one. The room was clean, but the two towels in the bathroom would have ended up in the maid's bin if we were at home. I asked for more towels and was told I needed to call, but we never received them. I'm guessing my husband must have air-dried after his shower since I must have two because my hair is long. Never made it to the free breakfast, so no comment there. Buyer beware - you get what you pay for...very loud neighbors with young children. The AC unit was very strange: unless the temp was adjusted to 66 degrees or below, the heat came on. Consequently, the room was either way too cold or way too hot, but at least I got to practice the two extremes of my Goldilocks imitation. That part was fun.

Very convenient location only a few blocks from 42nd St. Subway. Extremely efficient and helpful staff both at front desk checkin, for storing bags and valet parking, Simple but plentiful breakfast and very helpful staff.

The location of the hotel was good because I had a show to do at Javits Center. Staff was helpful, rooms though small were very clean, good restaurants with in walking distance. The breakfast was excellent and the staff kept if filled and they were very helpful.

This is a Hilton/Hampton so it meets their standards. It is clean, modern, and the breakfast is OK. The 4.95 upcharge for hi-speed internet is fair and Hilton generally does a better job with internet than Marriott. Speed was around 5mbps which is OK for a hotel. Price was reasonable relative to other choices. It is about a ¾ mile walk to Javits.However, the area south and east of the bus terminal is pretty gritty; would not be the most attractive for casual travelers or families visiting New York. The rooms are small with limited storage (drawers/closet space). Vanity is tiny—not much room to place anything. Very nice large TV but does not swivel. 6 rooms per floor. Not much sound insulation. Ice machines on 4, 7, 10, 13, 16, and 31. Can be noisy; across from rooms numbered 1 and 2.

Only stayed for one night at this location for a birthday get away and I would definitely stay again! I loved the location, close but not too close to Times Square, sights and tons of delicious restaurants. We came in on the Amtrak from Penn Station which was an easy 10 minute walk away. The room was a really nice size for NYC - we had 4 friends over before dinner and it was not overly crowded. We were able to drop off our bags easily before check in (since we arrived well before the room was ready) and after check out. The room was clean, bathroom was also clean. I can never go wrong with Hampton Inn & Suites!

10 year+ Diamond member, love Hilton for the most part but this place is the worst ever. The front desk team is the best.....outgoing, friendly and helpful but there s a major dsconnect with housekeeping. First day they did not show up to service telling room. Second day after contacting housekeeping and the front desk it was completed after 5:00 but they were not happy and left no towels in the room. A/C is louder than a Harley motorcycle. Avoid this hotel ....

The hotel was very clean. The rooms are small but are probably standard NYC size for this class of hotel. My friend and I had to step aside to let each other pass to the bathroom. The hallway in the lobby is tiny and doesn't leave room for people to pass by while other are waiting for the elevator. That said, the rooms were very clean, the breakfasts were decent, and there was always enough seating to eat on the 3 days we stayed. There is coffee available near the elevators. The hotel in near Times Square and the 42 Street Subway and 6 or 7 blocks from Penn Station. I was traveling with a group so I felt safe enough but the street gets dark at night and some homeless people camp at the corner of 39 st and 9th ave.

Trying to find a good quality , good value hotel in manhattan is a headache .There are no bargains and rates fluctuate dramatically according to the season .This Hampton inn is no a bad option . The rooms are reasonably modern and practical .The lobby is small and you'll have to wait for a lift at peak hours typical for a hotel built on a small lot .The location just off Times Square is good .Unless you're a multi millionaire there are no perfect choices but thus hotel offers reasonable quality and a reasonable price taking into account this is manhattan .I think I would stay here again .

Our family traveled to NYC for the first time. Jim the gentleman at the front desk assisted us from check in to check out with all our needs. He is truly an assest to the hotel and made our trip a wonderful experience.

A convenient place to stay, if you want access to Times Square. That is one benefit. However the rooms are small considering we were a family of four and needed a room for four. The rates are exorbitant and I have still not understood the fact why the hotel rates change everyday, even if I do a booking for 4-5 days. I guess that is the way America works.

we were booked with twins as stated in our booking email and then we were refused entry with them, we were stuck in manhattan with no where else to go, so we had to drive to Brooklyn to find an available hotel. poor service. ruined trip.

This is small narrow hotel with a very tiny lobby. While it is 32 floors, there are only 6 rooms per floor. Waiting for the elevator is an ordeal, especially in the morning. That wait pales in comparison to the wait to get your car out of the valet parking. We waited over an hour and we were told that was typical. The rooms are so tiny that you have to coordinate your movements. The bathroom has almost no room in it. I will concede that the room was clean, but right outside the hotel are a row of homeless people bedded down for the night. This hotel is a pretty far walk from the theater district. The neighborhood immediately surrounding the hotel does not feel very safe. There was no security when we came back from a late show. Someone was banging on our door at 4 AM. We didn't answer because the person would not announce who they were. While the breakfast is good, be prepared to come for battle. Getting to the food and getting a table for breakfast at this very small hotel is difficult. The Hampton Times Square, North, where I have stayed three times blows this hotel away. My recommendation is to find something else.

First room smelled like wet dogs. Second room's A/C went out. Manager on Duty told me to check out if I couldn't wait for maintenance. I did. Went around the corner to The Doubletree. Had a MUCH better experience.

On business trip and booked here. Brand new so all amenities were great. Rooms were small but that is normal in New York. Room was always clean when I arrived back. Only issue was I thought the hallways were very narrow so it made me a little uncomfortable. Secure elevators but Lobby is accessible to any riff raff and that they had one one occasion. Gym was great and machines were clean. Breakfast bar had more then enough choices. The location was perfect off the main drag close to the fashion district. We have booked again for another stat. Cookies were amazing!

This was our first time in NYC. The location of the Hampton was super close to everything like the subway and all of Times Square!!! The property and rooms were beautiful and cleanliness! I will definitely stay here again

Very clean hotel! Staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Breakfast was awesome. Location could not have Been closer to any attractions. We will definetly be back for our next visit to NYC! Thank you Hampton Inn!

The hotel is at a very good location about two short blocks from time square. This is not a fancy hotel and the street it is on is kind of run down but it is very inexpensive for the area. They have a great free breakfast. The rooms are very small so it is good if all you plan to do there is sleep. The staff was courteous and helpful

The hotel accommodations are average and the price is a bit high. The rooms are extremely small and the breakfast is pretty bad. I would suggest the street vendors for breakfast. One positive was that the hotel (and rooms) were very clean for the age of the property.

The location of this property is in a rundown, dirty area full of trash, homeless people and rundown properties in general. The hotel itself is certainly adequate, but, considering the general area, overpriced.

The location is good for out of town visitors. Close to public trains (subway). An ideal place to call home for a couple of days when exploring New York City. Clean, tho the rooms are a little small.The bathroom is also a bit on the small side (our shower drained Very slowly). Breakfast (included with your stay) is good...regular breakfast entrees. The daily rates vary greatly depending which day of the week you are staying. Overall, a good stay. Never heard any noise from the street...we were on the 15th floor.

Good service, nice enough rooms, walking distance to all you need. Small breakfast room - limited selection - and appalled at the amount of single use cutlery etc. Big plus that coffee is available at all times :-)

Stayed two nights here. Very happy with the choice. Rooms are not large but still comfortable, clean and a good value in an expensive city. Breakfast is included with many options. The welcoming staff is very helpful. The hotel is near Times Square, accessible to subway system within 1 block and many restaurants within walking distance. Even on 29th floor there was a bit of street noise but sirens on emergency vehicles are designed to get your attention. Not a big problem, however. Go for it!

The Staff at the Hampton by Hilton on 39th St Times Square South were excellent! They were friendly and always had a solution. They made it easy to walk up to them and ask them questions about the hotel, hotel services, or even questions about the city itself. Front desk personnel and staff handling the "complimentary" pre and post luggage storage, down to the valet parking staff. Even when there was a rush of guests trying to check in and out - the calm and friendly composure that was kept was excellent. The Hampton staff at this particular location embody what it is to provide customer service like it should be.

We planned this trip spir of the moment and I was very pleased I could get a last minute 2 day reservation. Everyone was friendly and helpful. If i did a little more research I could have requested a room with a bigger tub and shower combo lol. There also was an old bar of soap stuck to our sheets which grossed me out but that was the worst overall, everything was clean and fresh. The breakfast was good and there was more options than we were expecting which was nice. I also wish that room service had champagne on the menu: we wanted to do a wedding toast.

Great stay , room quite small , but fine for the time spent in the room as so much to do in New York . Great location , short walk to Carlo's bakery and Time Square . Be sure to be at breakfast early as it does get busy . Different hot options every day . Would definitely use again .

Hey, you too can stay in a noisy hotel, with rude staffers and noisy drunk tourists. Be sure to ask them for a quiet room where you can hear every street noise through un-soundproofed windows! When they finally move you, that room will have sheets that do not fit and an ice machine right outside your room. Oh, and the shower doesn't heat up. And the staff is completely obnoxious. Sound too good to be true? Sadly, it's not.

This was our second trip to New York and booked as part of a package. I had read a few other reviews after booking so wasn't sure what to expect.We arrived a little after 1pm and our room was already ready for us. The guy on reception was very polite and offered advice on places to go etc.We didn't have to wait for a lift and every time we needed one there was no more than a 30s wait.I'm sure that if you are looking to use them at popular times then with 32 floors you can expect to wait for one, but they are not slow going up and down otherwise.Our room was 3005 with 2 double beds and a city view.Very clean, good sized bathroom and comfortable beds.It's a bit of a small room for 2 beds but perfectly adequate for the amount of time we spent in it.As early riser we had breakfast at 6am the first morning and it was very quiet.Helpful and polite staff and we got a few top tips on making awesome waffles.Bacon, eggs, toast, cereal, pastries, fruit and yoghurts with waffles and plenty of tea and coffee which they even have lids and holders for, so you can take drinks with you as you head out.It felt like a good location.Close enough to Times Square but set off the main avenues enough that it was quiet at night.I would be happy to stay here again and to recommend it to others thinking of visiting New York.

Just had a lovely time there with my daughter. Whilst it may not be the most exclusive hotel in New York there is nothing you will want for. The staff are lovely and always friendly. The location is great, close to Times Square yet far enough away to be quiet. Rooms were serviced every day free wifi breakfast was plentiful and a different variety every day. Seriously this is a gem in an amazing city

Overall the hotel is just what we expected. Breakfast has tons of different types of food. The staff is very friendly. It is not loud in this hotel. Our favorite thing is that it was close to everything. They block the HDMI input on tv if you are planning on streaming your computer/iPad, etc. Pillows could use upgrade. No support

Great location. Easy to get to everything. Long drive fro LGA. Staff was great. Breakfast was good. Easy check in and out. Staff was very helpful with directions, recommendations for travel and events.

Clean hotel - it was obvious that hotel had been thru a remodel recently. Staff was helpful and pleasant, both prior to trip and during stay. Times Square South was a good location for my meeting at Jacob Davits Center. Lots to walk to in the area. Would definitely stay here again.

The Hampton Inn on west 39th is fine for a brief stay. The area has a lot of construction so transportation in the area can be a challenge. There is good access to the HighLine, if you are able to walk.

Nice hotel in good location for Broadway shows. Small rooms but well appointed and comfortable.Shower is only 2 feet wide so be warned. I have never seen so many USB charging points in a room. Included breakfast was good. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The was a sense of welcome and generosity at this hotel the was terrific. Located close to the Times Square madness but walk the other way and you find local restaurants and a laundry. I went to 3 broadway shows and could walk there in less than 15 minutes.

I really enjoyed this hotel, I booked it very last minute and did not know what to expect. It was really nice, very clean, the staff extremely helpful and hospitable. Overall I really had a nice time there and I would definitely return. it was good for everyone families singles and couples.

Location is ideal for Times Square and the Theater district -- easy walk. Hot breakfast is great. Staff really tries to please. Only problem is with the elevators --- With 32 floors and only 2 elevators, at prime time wait can be excessive -- but it's worth it.

I stayed here for one night in May 2017. When I checked in, I received recognition as Diamond member. The hotel staffs have made the stay much more pleasant.The room was small (NYC's standard). The only two things that I would complain about is the breakfast and elevator. Breakfast was extremely crowded. It was really hard to find a place to sit and the food was poor.One of the two elevators was broken during my stay so we usually have to wait around 10 mins to get to our floor.

This Hampton Inn, like most city hotels, has conservative space, but they fit all the necessary items into it. The bathroom was very compact. A very large person would have difficulty getting in and out of the shower. We had a king size bed and a view west toward the Hudson River, which was a four and a half block walk from the ferry landing. We had taken the ferry over from Weehawken because parking in the garage at the Imperial Ferry site is 1/2 the cost of any 24 hour place in the city, and the ferry ride was a much more enjoyable way to get into the city than via tunnel or bridge. The staff at the Hampton Inn was very friendly, rooms clean, breakfast the typical buffet fare of a Hampton Inn, and it was wonderful to have a home base right in the middle of so much we wanted to see and do: Theater, Times Square, Restaurants, St. Patrick's Cathedral, NY Public Library, Rockefeller Center, UN, Hillsong Church, close to Metro.

We went to this hotel on Feb 25, 2017 as part of the celebration of my wife's 69th birthday.The lobby is small and the area for the free breakfast is also quite small. The front desk staff were excellent. We were able to check into our room early as we are Hilton Honors members. Our plan was to go to a play, dinner, stay overnight and then return home. When we left the room to go to the show the elevator no longer worked!We were on the 29th floor, but because we wanted to go to the show we decided to walk down 29 flights to the lobby.. By the time we arrived on the ground floor, we had already missed our play and we were exhausted!After a bit we went home.The hotel refunded the cost of the room, but as of today will not refund the price we paid for the show that we missed due to the elevator malfunction. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Good location- very close to times square, but 39 street a bit noisy and full of homeless. The room a little small, very clean and nice sheets..Basic breakfast with cereals, jams,fruits, bagels, cheese and waffels.Free WIFI Helpfull staffNice service - free print We took room with city view- wasn't attractive

Room was not very comfortable. Noisy. Breakfast was average and not very appetizing , Front desk very rude. Very slow elevators. will never stay here again. Just location is good. Did not have the feel of staying in the regular Hilton Chain property.

Although I knew this hotel was very close to Times Square I was unaware it was in the heart of the garment district. For anyone who sews or who has watched Project Runway with the designers buying their materials at Mood would LOVE being here. The staff are fantastic, friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great and there is always hot coffee and apples available.

The hotel is convenient to Times Square and the Javits Center. I had issues with the toilet not flushing. Also, apparently due to tight space, the workout room is very spare and the breakfast room is so crowded that it's hard to find a place to sit.

Staff gave great recs on running, exercising and places to eat that locals go to - not the usual hotel concierge referral sending you to his friends restaurant. Breakfast and Fitness center were good also. Room was nice and clean, quiet (on traffic side) and easy walking distance to transportation options or the highline. Def recommend if you are in area for place to stay.

I found the hotel very responsive and accommodating. The pricing was very reasonable for a NYC hotel. I was there on emergency stay due to plane cancelled. I would stay there on next trip. I forgot a pair of shoes in the room due to very departure. they took care of this immediately for me.

This was my first trip to New York and my first skinny tall hotel. Past reviews have complained about the elevators (2) being slow at certain times. There is a sign at the base of the elevator which mentions busy and slow times during the free breakfast which corresponds to the backed up elevator situation. Heed it. We were on the 30th floor which does make it easier to get an emptier elevator going down.Bed was good. We had cooler weather so we just cracked the window.It was an easy walk to the subway, times square, top of the rock, and other sites. I wouldn't drive in that town if you paid me and I'm from Chicago.

My fiance and I stayed here the weekend of 4/30/17. It is in a great location just a couple blocks from the main Times Square area. We also attended a show at Gershwin Theater. We took the bus into Port Authority on Greyhound. Everything is within a 10-15 minute walk. This hotel is a good value, and includes complimentary breakfast. The room was small (it's new york...), but was well kept and adequate for our needs. Staff was fantastic. Would definitely recommend.

The room and bathroom are small, but the beds are a dream to sleep in. Also surprised by the nice variety offered at breakfast. Good location, especially if you're looking to stay near Port Authority and/or Times Square. Close proximity to tons of restaurants along 9th Avenue. No problems with noise (we were on a high floor).The best part of staying here is the service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We got a great last-minute rate on the room and feel we got good value for our money.Thanks for the very enjoyable stay!

My big complaint with this hotel is only two elevators. Fortunately I was on the fourth floor so besides checking in and out when I had luggage, I was able to take the stairs. Lots of street noise. Breakfast is only served until 10 (most other Hilton properties in Midtown serve until 11 a.m.) Typicall Hamtpon breakfast and small breakfast room but never a problem finding a seat.No extra love was given for being a diamond above the stated benefits but was able to check in at 11 a.m. Convenient location. Great staff.Would return here again for the right price but only if I could have a low level floor and not have to depend on the elevators.

The room was very good for NY city standards. Check-in and check-out was very efficient. Based upon other reviews regarding wait times for the elevator, we chose a room on the 13th floor which was quiet from street noise. Selection of this Hampton Inn was based upon the included breakfast. However, Breakfast was just 'ok' compared to other Hampton Inn locations. The small serving area for breakfast was too crowded at times and very difficult to easily move through due to lines and lack of seating. Overall, a great value for NY

This hotel is located very close to center of everything, making it very convenient. The rooms are TINY, but are clean and comfortable, especially since we spent very little time there. The breakfast was very good for a complimentary breakfast and saved us money buying breakfast every day.

The price is right. But you get what you pay for. Lack of hot water. Also AC didn't function properly. So I guess I get what you pay for? Wouldn't stay here again better options in midtown. Staff was slow to respond to requests at best.

There is air in the pipes on the 15th floor. DO NOT STAY IN THESE ROOMS. Unless you like to be awoken at 6:30 AM by screeching pipes that sound like an air raid alarm or a fire alarm. The staff said that they knew it was a problem.

I like the location of this hotel; convenient to the client office I visit. The best part of this hotel? The Staff! They let me do my thing but they find small ways ensure I am well cared for on each visit. Great service; always pleased when I depart!

This hotel is in the heart of everything, but just far enough removed to be a little quieter at night. One way in a few steps in Time Square, other way to Hells Kitchen and easily accessible to all the things you would like to see. My family had a great experience and enjoyed our stay!

Great trip and a chance to visit with family & friends. Close proximity to Times Square made it easy to go to shows on broadway. The Breakfast area was a bit crowded at times as the area is not large enough to accomodate the occupancy.

Unfortunately not great. I guess for the price you get what you pay for. I got a handicapped room which I hate and I wasn't told it was handicapped when I checked in. Had already unpacked and waited 20 minutes for elevator so couldn't be bothered going back down. Room smeeled like fabreeze and when lesving next day waited more than 20 minutes for elevator gave up and had to walk down 8 flights. Wouldn't stay again.

Excellent facility...helpful, knowledgeable staff!!! Great location...can walk just about anywhere pretty quickly!!! Elevators took forever to get to the 30th floor, and we'd stop to pick up people wanting to go down when we were going up. Made getting to and from the room a little bit of a challenge at times. But if that's my biggest complaint, we are doing good!!! :)

I stay for 5nights here after arrive new york from DC by train amtrak.I walk from Pen. which not far ,very easy.Location is the best I can walk to TimeSquare and to subway and visit new york using hotels like a base camp.I loved breakfast ,waffle is very good. and I like coffee station with available 24hr.staff is also good, Peter,help me a lot to add more arrangement.King room type is small ,space from bed to TV is small but it's ok for me,Im' not a big one. :)

This was the best hotel staff I think I have ever encountered. That says a lot, considering it's in NYC. The hotel was full, but other than a little bit of a wait for the elevators during peak times, you would never have known it. The location is awesome, the room was clean and updated, and we received free internet, in-room. Breakfast was good (the seating area is a bit small, but we never had to wait long for a table) and was kept stocked. Front desk found us a room right away, even though we arrived 3 hours early. Our room was near the elevator and the ice machine, but we were never disturbed.

Hotel was a great location to walk to Times Square, subway stations and had a nice variety of restaurants with in walking distance. Staff was friendly and hotel clean. Breakfast was busy and some food products ran out quickly, but staff was attentive and refilled as quickly as possible.

First time to New York. I would highly recommend this hotel. Friendly Staff, especially Nicole. Rooms remodeled. Very nice rooms. Close to the Metro, Time Square. Go to The Irish Pub a few steps down. Great food, great guacamole and chips. !!!

Nice friendly front desk staff, small rooms, slow and smelly elevators, no security, good location around times square, free basic breakfast-dont expect anything fancy but is very convenient. Good hotel if your on a budget.

We were placed at this hotel when the Doubletree West in Tomes Square overbooked our room. We loved the friendliness of the Hampton staff and the cleanliness of the rooms. The free wi-fi and complimentary breakfast were an added bonus. We will recommend the Hampton Inn to our friends.

Great hotel in great location for exploring New York City. Very Clean hotel with friendly staff. Nice complimentary breakfast that changes daily. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends!

I always choose the Hilton brand hotels on vacation, especially the Hampton Inns that come with a complimentary breakfast. This hotel is in a great location close to major Broadway theaters and walking distance to subways and the Port Authority. The room size is good with a smaller than usual bathroom and shower. Recommended for families with young adults or children.

Everyone involved made the trip great. I would highly recommend this Hampton Inn. The front desk personnel was outstanding. Nicole and Liz went out of their way several times to assist me. The room and food were good as well.

My kids wanted to see real NY manors - well they were really nice here so they were bummed. Great location 5 minute walk from Times Square. Rooms small but nice. Breakfast good - fruit and coffee always out. The staff - top rate. I'lll be back when in NYC.

Space is small but used well. Staff very friendly and helpful. I'd stay here again. Breakfast was good and nice variety. We also tried the Butler room service and it was surprisingly good. The people really make this hotel a pleasant experience.

Pros: location to time square was convenient; rooms were "mostly" clean; staff was friendlyCons: there was one area in the bathroom that should have been cleaned better; very small rooms; one elevator seemed like it needed to be fixed yet they did not address it my entire stay. Also as far as the elevators go.. there are only two elevators -- not nearly enough for the size of this hotel- especially in the morning. Very thin walls.

Just three blocks south of Times Square this hotel is in a great location. Jim was friendly during the check-in process and our room was updated and clean with USB ports, fridge, combination safe, hair dryer and all the things you'd expect of a modern hotel room. The rooms are a bit small and the street is a little 'rough' but the new carpets, shower and furniture made up for it. Breakfast was included and is ok, but not great... overall an acceptable experience.

We attended in December and the rooms were a bit small but everything you needed was there. Breakfast was a bit busy but was fine. Location was perfect for walking about times square and exploring NY. Central to all the attractions and busses tours just round the corner.

If you are traveling off-season, wait to book your room. I booked in advance and paid $175 more than if I'd waited to book that day. This was extremely frustrating as a loyal customer! I expect some price fluctuations but not so large of a drop.

The suit in Hampton is very comfortable, cleaned, modern appearance and facilities provided. It has a courtesy breakfast which follow a continental menu. The space reserved for breakfast is not so big, so for a good experience, be there early in the morning. The staff members were gentle and helpfull. I had a good experience in this hotel.

Location was good. Breakfast was good and coffee/hot chocolate was available all day. Water pressure was very low on 18h floor and construction across the street was noisy. Staff was excellent and room was nice. Great value for the area.

Lied during reservation process promising early check-in and a top floor with a great city view. None of this occured! I was basically called a liar when we got there saying that none of this was told to me and none of this is available. I chose this hotel based on these things and got nothing! Dirty blankets, no eggs or syrup a breakfast and manager would not even speak to me!

Snowstorm and the hotel and Hilton would not assist me. I had to cancel less than 48 hours before and I would have thought that the hotel or Hilton would have at least tried to work with me and no one even tried.

Good hotel to stay in, breakfast option is OK. Housekeeping staff are nice & restaurant staff. Walking distance to main sites. Street is one way but close to everything. Dnt forget to check out carlo cake shop which is a 5 min walk from the hotel.

The hotel staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and the breakfast bar was great! We had a group of 12 teenagers with us and there was plenty of food for them to choose from. If you want to be close to Times Square, this is a great place to stay.

We checked in on Sunday for a 3 night stay. The front staff were top notch. Very friendly,helpful and smiling all the time. The valet guy ( i think his name was Chris?) super friendly as helpful as well. Breakfast was decent and included in your stay. Good options to choose from. Yes the elevators were a little slow and yes the rooms were a little small..... so what ? comfy beds good breakfast and super friendly staff in a good location to Times Square. What more can you ask for? Loved it thanks Hampton Inn!

2 lifts only, 15 minute wait in the mornings for the lift. We had to complain about noise 3 times but no resolution. Location ok & breakfast team do a good job. My worst Hilton experience. If you have a choice recommend to look elsewhere.

This property is narrow but very tall. Having only two elevators and apparently no service elevator for the staff presents a very serious challenge to customers. The ait time for the elevator was beyond belief.

Clean, comfortable, and great location. If I had any complaint at all, the rooms are postage stamp size as is the bathroom and shower. Also, 2 elevators can make the wait time intolerable. The staff was friendly and efficient.

The staff here went out of their way to make our check in, directions, and check out super easy. We had a car to park overnight and dropping it off and retrieving it was all handled beautifully by the staff there.

The Hampton Inn is wee-maintained and centrally located. The staff was especially cordial. Its location was perfect, one block from the Port Authority Bus Station. While the rooms are small, they are more than adequate and the breakfast was also adequate.

This is a high rise hotel with only 6 rooms per floor. It's a nice clean Hampton in a very central location. We valet parked and had a bad experience. The manager took our number abd said he'd get back to us and never did, So, stay here but don't park and don't expect a follow up to problems.I'd have given a 4 or 5 for the property only.

Great location between Penn Station and Port Authority. Small room and bathroom, but more than adequate. Decent breakfast and amenities. I didn't spend much time in my room, but wouldn't hesitate to rebook here in the future.

My and my partner seldom use them because the new team here are so narrow minded. Starting January when we noticed that they are too much. Knowing we are at the highest Tier as well for the Groups Rewards Program. One time we were checked in a room that leaks water in the bathroom. Second time we noticed that the carpet(square types) are sticking out. I took a picture and I showed it to them. My concern is we may not notice it and fall because of even it is just a small rift and it is like bulging at the end of the other square tiled to it. So I went down and showed it to the front desk. The head of the House keeping they said was the one who address my issue. I just said its good that we see it so we can avoid stepping or tripping on that particular tile of carpet. As you know this is a very small hotel and not much space for you to walk so it is somewhat un avoidable for you not to hit and fall from it. The worst is you might hit your head on the furnitures around example your head, you will bleed to death there- because the elevator is only 2 and it is so busy for the employees as well. One time I was standing and waiting for one of the elevator to come down from the 30+ floor and the other elevator was utility with hose inside. Now after I arrive there are like 2 more couple arrive waiting for that 1 elevator. And you know how slow it is when the other one is being held by the staff. We (other guest) are already talking about the single elevator we are looking atop for the number floors as it go down slowly. The guy on the other never even offered to take us up. We just shook our heads and said what a ride like a rush hour at the subways of NY.Back to the carpet with the head lady, just said I will send the engineering dept to take a look and see. So here's the engineer. I personally address the guy and told him, Excuse me if you don't mind may i ask how are you gonna fix this problem. HE said he will tape it. My blood just rose to my head and told the guy. I am sorry but are you an engineer ? Because I am. I exclaimed even a common ordinary common sense you don't tape it. There is a glue or paste to use there and not tape. It will be bulging again and give it not even an hour it will budge. My point here is - you don't repair or fix something with a very obviously not applicable for he floor. Who puts a tape on the floor for it not to budge and to have it stick there plainly and smoothly for a while? This is a building. A hotel building for god sake. You are taping it for our temporary stay because if you use the actual material to fix the problem, it will smell in the room and it will take a while. They don't choose to transfer you rot another room and because this room will be stagnant no sale. or they loose one sale. That being said, it doesn't matter if it is accident prone or what. They don't think. We are AARP and Seniors but lucky to have made sure that we do right things for our body and health. That is why we look younger than our age, But when you are old we really do deteriorate. eye site becomes poor which can lead to stepping and tripping to that accident prone piece of carpet because it is in the passage way of us to and from the door. I just let it go since we decided to cancel the next reservation and looked for another hotel. Besides the attitude of the lady that we spoke with. As if she knows what she's doing. They don't take criticism positively. The concern there is safety. We understand that there is a natural way of materials used in a bldg that needs to be maintained and it should be included as normal wear and tear maintenance. They prioritize sales before safety of guest. I am thinking, aren't you thankful for us for letting you know that instead of ignoring it and just leave it the same way anyways the supervisor or manager who inspect the room ( i just don't know what is the methodology of inspection of the rooms after it is cleaned after a guest check- out) this should be on their check list or do they really inspect rooms. I am assuming because New York is the Highest rate for rooms in hotel. To makes you moneys worth, please do your job. hampton Inn is know for family market. Even kids plays around andcan be prone to accident if they don't se it especially.Sorry but as I learned the probability of the other room with this negligence give it like 10 % is a possibility caused by negligence is a low number so meaning around 20-25 rooms has this possibility. Meaning 20 - 25 individual is prone to have an accident in any of the 25 rooms in this particular hotel. I never came back since then. I am always traveling to NY for business. But i avoid them already. It is not worth the save for the prone.

This is one of the best experience I had. The staff were very helpful and friendly, they went above and beyond to make my stay as comfortable and convenient as possible. The hotel was clean, perfect location and good food

Clean, friendly staff, great location. Easy in/out from the Lincoln Tunnel. Easy walk to Times Square and access to all subway lines. The Port Authority is only two blocks away, so cabs are also plentiful and easy to find. Note: The rooms are small, even for NYC.

Even though the rooms are small, they are furnished to provide what you need when traveling. For NYC, the room size is typical, but close to half the size of other Hampton Inns outside of NYC. Multiple outlets and USB ports on or near table tops, so you don't need to hunt for some place to charge your phone. Bathroom has medicine cabinet, so you have plenty of room for toiletries, without a lot of counter space. Night stands have extra extenders, for that extra space when you need it. Staff is friendly and keeps breakfast area clean and well stocked.

Lovely clean hotel in a great location, 10 minutes from Times Square and within walking distance of lots of attractions.The staff were friendly and very helpful. Nice size room with aircon and a fridge.

Hotel location was great. Rooms were very clean and recently remodeled. Parking was the only issue because of all of the construction on the street where the Hotel is located. There is a parking garage located on the same street which that made it convenient for the stay.

As Hilton Honors members we seek out hotels within their chain. We stayed at this Hampton Inn because it was near an event we were attending for business. The rate was super reasonable considering it was New York City (under $150/night). This was a very busy hotel, but the front desk clerk was super friendly, welcoming and took the time to give us a map and highlight some great restaurants within walking distance. We felt safe at night walking around to restaurants. The hotel has 20 plus floors but only 6 rooms per floor so each floor was a bit tight and our room shared a wall with the elevator and with 20 plus floors we heard the elevator constantly but we grew accustomed to it and eventually it became just a background hum. Not the hotel's fault, but our first night we experienced a bunch of drunks fighting in our hallway at 3am and we called the front desk to have them send up security. Not sure if security arrived or not and I'm sure other rooms complained because it was so loud, but the hotel gave us that night for free without us asking and luckily the drunks checked out the next morning. The breakfast area was tight but manageable serving the typical Hampton breakfast and the clerk passed out Andy's mints candies which was a thoughtful touch. Strangely, this Hampton did not serve any fresh fruit any of the mornings we stayed. Hotel guests received a 10% discount at the Irish pub next door which was a nice bonus, especially since the food was good. We liked this Hampton Inn and would definitely recommend,

Building was under renovation- wish I knew before I booked. Had I known I would of booked some where else. They cleaning staff was rude, clerk did not verify my ID upon arrival. It was a last minute booking which I will never do again

This hotel is ideal, both in location (so close to main attractions but also on a street that isn't loud at night), and amenities. Everything is clean and looked after, shower was great and there's a lot of choice at breakfast. I don't really get the complaints about room size - it's a standard double room, and how much time are people spending in it? Surely you'd be out doing things? Anyway, we had a great king size bed which was super comfy! Staff are very friendly and helpful, would definitely stay here again!

Amazing hotel, super friendly staff, great rooms, very clean! Amazing view, wonderful breakfast!! A must for a visit to NY! 24 hours free hot chocolate and coffee. Staff was helpful in planning things to do! Excellent hotel!

Me and my girlfriend visited New York for 3 nights this February and stayed here and it was everything we needed it to be. Checking in was easy and the lady on the front desk was very friendly. We had a great room on the 12th floor. The rooms are quite small but it was more than large enough for our short stay. The bed is extremely comfortable and the bathroom and shower were great. The location was also perfect, literally a 5 minute walk to times square and even less than that to the nearest subway station. We got the subway straight from the airport it was so easy, one direct line and it only cost $7.75; a huge saving on getting a taxi. The food for breakfast each morning was great too. The only thing about the whole hotel I was unsure of was that breakfast was served with a plastic knife and fork and plastic throwaway plates. I'm not at a 6 year old's birthday party, give me a real plate and cutlery. Apart from that everything was excellent and I highly recommend.

The room was smaller than any Hampton and I've ever stayed in before. They were doing some construction on the floor of starting about 9 AM in the morning. They never had fresh cookies in the afternoon they said they did not have any cookie dough they were waiting for a shipment ...definitely that was missed

First, let me acknowledge we had a phenomenal room rate. Even at 2x the price I would rate this a 10 for a budget experience in Manhattan. Room was top notch. Staff was friendly. Room was exceptionally quiet. Great locatuon

Just returned from a 5 night stay with my 17 year old son. The hotel is excellent, great location, we had a room on the 31 th floor with excellent views of the Empire State. Our room had 2 double beds and big enough for what we needed. We had a 42 inch tv with plenty of movie channels, a mini fridge, coffee maker and iron and ironing board. The cleanliness of the room was great, quality bed linen, fresh towels and even face clothes were changed every day, The hotel staff are very friendly and most helpful. The breakfast was good, always found something nice to eat., I would recommend going down early as can get busy at times. There is also tea, coffee and hot chocolate available in the lobby 24 hrs. I will most certainly be staying here again when I next visit. Go on give it a try and ignore any negative reviwes as there is nothing to complain about.

Totally obsessed with your customer service, everyone is phenomenal, however, Nicole (front desk) is amazing and so friendly and has been spot on with every suggestion for us! She made our stay even more enjoyable! Peter impressed me with remember that my sister was joining me at a later time and let me know she made it in safe when I returned to the hotel. Honestly couldn't have asked for a better stay! Thanks guys!

We stay here for business 4 times a year. The hotel staff is always welcoming and great you each time you enter. The location is very safe and close to good places to eat and shop. It has recently gone under renovations which are now complete and came out very nice. No complaints here, we will continue to stay here when we come into the city!!!

Stayed here on a 2 day trip to NYC. Great location. We took a Martz bus from PA. Took us about 5 min to walk to hotel from Port Authority & 10 min to Times Square. Breakfast was very good. Ladies kept it filled & cleaned. Hotel had more than enough tables & seats in the breakfast area too. The staff were all very nice and helpful. I'd definitely stay at this Hampton again.

Hotel staff was very nice. Bed comfortable. Location convenient to Times square and Subway. Pillows kind of flat and cheap but mattress was comfortable. Trash not emptied prior to arrival but room seemed very clean. Overall good hotel for price.

Great hotel for the price , location and free breakfast. Recently remodeled. I paid $7 for am upgraded and we were on the top floor with a view of the Empire state building. Friendly and helpful staff. I would recommend this hotel it is close to the theater and restaurants.

I was off to the Javitis Center for the weekend and the Times Square South location was a 10-12 minute walk. The theater district would have been the same distance if I headed west. Besides the excellent location the hotel was clean, the room comfortable, and the full breakfast was an added bonus. I would definitely stay there again.

Chose this location due to it's close proximity to my job. Spent a night there to avoid driving in a snow storm. The Hotel is very small and the rooms are not spacious. The shower is so tiny I couldn't extend both of my arms to the wall. That's how tight it is. Kept bumping into the chair and bed in the room because all of the furniture is very close together. Supply of toiletries were bare minimum. I'm sure they would've replenished them if I'd ask. Thing is I shouldn't have to ask for more toilet paper and facial tissue after 2hrs of being there. Free wifi and breakfast is included and I earned points for my stay. It served it's purpose for a one night stay but it wasn't luxurious at all. I'll stay somewhere else next time.

As the title says, it's nothing special, but it's a Hampton. I don't expect special, I expect clean and quiet, with decent bed linens, decent towels, and a comfortable bed. And that's what you get. Location is a bit out of the way, but only a couple of blocks farther than other Hilton chain hotels that are significantly pricier.

Had a very nice stay. I arrived into the city early (around 10am) and was able to check in right away which was a plus. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Room with two beds was a bit small but comfortable. Also, I was happy that it contained a mini fridge. It's conveniently located just a few blocks from the Port Authority station and within walking distance to Times Square, Penn Station and Bryant Park, so you can easily access many subways lines. If you're like me, and take the subway from JFK, Port Authority Station has a handicap ramp up and escalator to street level after you exit the subway (no trying to carry luggage of flights of stairs is required. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel for a future trip.

My husband and I recently visited the Hampton Inn Times Square South for our first NYC trip and we couldn't have been more happy with our choice. When we got to NYC we arrived at the hotel before the normal check in time and so asked at the reception if we could leave our bags with them until later. This was no problem at all. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and as it was still breakfast time they even offered us a free breakfast to start our day with and that was even before we checked in. In such an expensive place this was a very nice gesture. The breakfasts were simple but there was still lots of choice and it was always fresh. You could have cereals, fresh fruit and yoghurts, bagels/toast, eggs/omelettes fresh waffles and juices. Tea and coffee was available 24hrs in the hotel lobby which was a great money saver and nice to come back to after a long day. We stayed in a city view king room on the 27th floor, we could see the Empire State Building from our window! The room was extremely comfortable and clean. Lovely big comfy bed, modern furniture and lovely shower, it had tea/coffee facilities and a hairdryer in the room. The size of the room was moderate but housed us comfortably and was plenty big enough for the amount of time we spent in there. The location of the hotel was pretty central. Just in the garment district on 39th street and 8th avenue so just a few blocks from Times Square. It did feel like a pretty long walk some nights but that was just because we were so tired from exploring. The staff at the Hampton Inn were fantastic, always there to help with a friendly smile. I didn't get the managers name but he was also very friendly and seemed to really enjoy his role, engaging with the staff and customers. I think I overheard that he was newly appointed so I think with him in charge it can only get better. We really hope to return to NYC in the future and won't hesitate to book the Hampton Inn for our next visit so thank you for giving us a home from home!

Nice hotel only fault is staff on front desk we're not very friendly and they hold $60 a night for incidentals which I was told would be refunded on checkout. To only be told it's refunded in 5 working days. This information was not given by British airways or by the receptionist I had to ask what they where holding. On the plus side breakfast was good always got a seat and hot drinks available in lobby all day for free. Lifts were slow but was working at all times and rooms were clean and tidy, cleaned daily by the maid, who liked a tip!! Free toiletries daily. Hotel was close to Times Square and was close to pier 79 ideal for city stay.

I had an excellent stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South. As soon s I walked in, I was warmly greeted by Nicole. Her attentiveness and exceptional customer service made me happy that I chose this location for my time in NYC. Her knowledge about the area and hotel amenities made my stay excellent! Additionally, the rooms were great. I would highly recommend Nicole and the property.

Very close to time square and the subway. Breakfast was very good. Room were small. The WiFi was a little slow. Very nice employees . Would stay there again ...... l love new York city its a train ride away

Very helpful staff in a good location. Issue with flys in the shower drain staff very helpful to rectify the issue. Location is just off main avenues and subways nearby which allow access to all of the New York area

Location perfect. Close to everything you need in terms of transport . Located on a street where people get fined I'd they beep their car horns which is great for any families. I visited with my wife and we loved it all . Complimentary breakfast for guests, great help. Staff are amazing , they are first place above other hotels and the entire experience was amazing !!!

Fantastic staff, very friendly and chatty. Our room was very comfortable with great views, breakfast was great and loved the free tea and coffee throughout the day. Location was perfect, a 10 min leisurely walk from Times Square, and 5 min walk to 42 St Port Authority subway station. Overall, we had a perfect stay and would definitely return, thank you!

Went to the city for my birthday! Turned out to be a great weekend. We drove in and I was worried about getting to the location. Google maps took us right to the location. Ended up being close to EVERYTHING! I will always stay here. Great staff, clean, affordable and great location.

This hotel is in a good location within walking distance to most of the tourist attractions. If you don't want to walk too far there is a subway station just 5 minutes away.Reception was extremely friendly and helpful. In fact all the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 29th floor wax bright and spacious however no view apart from another hotel. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean and well supplied with soap and shampoo. There was tea and coffee making facilities in the room but also free in the lobby throughout the day. There was a safe, an iron and board and s fridge.Breakfast is complimentary and is great. There are 2 cooked items each day along with waffles, porridge, breads and fruit etc.I would highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel was great had a lot of, it was quite and not so much street noise. Was able to visit my family and spend time with them. I was able to go into Manhattan and keep smile on my face that im back at home.

This place is a gem in the City! Staff excellent, friendly, welcoming. Check-in and out process effortless. The hotel itself is clean, welcoming, cozy. Since it is fairly new (2009), everything is fresh and still feels new. So many hotels in NYC feel and smell ancient. Not here. Also, no wait for hot water. Loved that. Slept late and still got a hot shower.Staff is exceptional. Fildys (front desk) was fantastic w/ check-in and tips on getting and having a great taxi experience. Azuree (breakfast) raised breakfast from a quickie meal to a awesome start to the day. Her quiet presence and beautiful smile filled the room with good energy. Angel's (baggage check) delightful smile and personality made me feel very safe leaving my bags as I left to explore the City.Loved the complimentary breakfast. Great food. Wide selection. Didn't use wi-fi. Believe it is free, or at least for Honors members. Bathroom small, but beautiful. Beds clean and very comfortable. Overall, this place is fabulous. Beautiful, well-kept, clean, attentive staff. And - the price is great. Exceeded my expectations.

We've stayed at this Hampton location 8 out of our last 10visits to Manhattan. The rates are typically reasonable and it's walking distance to broadway. The room are always past the Clorox wipe test, clean.

First the good part: location, location, location. The hotel is just a short walk from the Empire State Building, Times Square, 42nd Street, Broadway theaters and Restaurant Row. It's a short block from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and within walking distance of Penn Station and Grand Central Termina. You can also walk to Madison Square Garden, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Central Park and many other landmarks.The price is very good for the area. We paid $200 per night including all taxes and fees. The staff is friendly and helpful and although the breakfast area is crowded things move quickly.We were on the 29th floor (the hotel has 32), and the view was great looking south across 39th Street. If we craned our necks a little we could see the Empire State.Two drawbacks: The upper floor rooms, at least, are tiny, more like a stateroom on a cruise than a hotel room. The shower in particular was minuscule -- I've seen larger telephone booths. The other (minor) drawback is the noise. We were there on a Saturday night and there was a constant drumbeat of muffled noise from a 24x7 construction site nearby. This didn't bother us at all, but if you're the type who needs absolute silence in order to sleep, this may not be the place for you. Of course, if you're the type who needs absolute silence, perhaps midtown Manhattan isn't the place for you.Overall we had a good stay, and appreciated how close we were to our theater and so many good dining choices.

I stayed at this hotel two years ago and now rebooked due to best price in walking distance to Javitts center. Hotel has been redone and is nice modern, and supper clean. Linens and pillows are so soft. Lots of outlets by bed for all the electronics. Bathroom nicely decorated. shower is kinda small but no big deal. Good lighting in room. Comfortable beds. Free breakfast in am with fruit, yogurt, bagels etc. Free can't be beat. Very quite. I didn't hear any noise from other rooms. Coffee maker in room. pleasant staff.

I do not know if the problem is with Hilton or the hotel management but could have been better. We have Hilton gold and spend many nights in hotels, mostly in Hilton properties to accumulate points and use perks. This was not quite what we expected in regard to reservation accuracy and when the room was not made up on night three it took something away from what could have been an excellent experience as the room was quiet, clean and well fixtures. the location was perfect for our needs.

A very simple review...Room was clean and my wife is picky on that... :)Room is not huge, like if you stay outside the city, but hey... it's New York...Bed for our liking was comfortable and as well clean!Breakfast is limited but for a small starter sufficient enough...Biggest issue is the Elevator on our last day it started to get a bit fuzzy...First one Elevator was gone (out of Service) and then later the Second one as well...A bit of a Nuisance but they got a Engineer running one Manually, so it worked, not the greatest way but everything else was satisfactory which was more importantStaff was very professional as well apologizing for the Elevator issue and accommodating

Staff was friendly, very helpful and attentive. Room was nice. Same quality as most Hamptons. Location was good. Rooms were unique same as hotel. Everyone was friendly, asking what they can help you with.

Hotel's price were reasonable and location was excellent base to explore Time Square area. There were lots of nice little restaurants with excellent food and fair price around the hotel. However, this is the hotel for a quiet romantic getaway. The surrounding area was sketchy at best and was in renovation mode. Construction noise started at 7 AM and would not let up until the early evening. Room was small with a very tiny shower area, think of cruise ships cabin small, so make sure you don't have large bulky suitcases. The large king size bed was comfortable and there was flat screen tv in room with HD channels. Breakfast was included but we didn't try it since there were lots of much better options for food just around the corner. Over all, it was a average stay, not too bad but offer value for the area.

Stayed at this hotel recently. Staff is excellent at the front desk, in the breakfast room, and house keeping! The rooms are clean, modern, and good size-I take a King room and it is great for a business trip.

We literally booked this hotel about 2 hours prior to our arrival. We live in Long Island but were coming into the city for a party and didn't want to drive back home. We booked directly through Hilton and got a great rate. The lobby was clean and the employees were friendly. I didn't receive my free beverages and snack as a Hilton Gold member so I was a little upset about that but other than this it was the perfect stay. The room was super clean but it didn't have a tub and the shower doors were kind of old school. Nothing that would keep me from recommending or re-booking but something to mention. The walls are really thin and you can hear everything in the hallway in the morning when housekeeping is around. Feel free to contact me if you have any additional questions.

This is a Hampton Inn that offers a really great value - it exceeded my expectations considering it is a basic hotel. I appreciate a clean room, friendly and attentive staff! I highly recommend for tourists or those wanting to stay close enough to Times Square without the noise or the bustle. Hot breakfast was really busy but always stocked and staff was around to keep things tidy, even up to 10am on a Saturday. Workout room has the basics and is clean. Be prepared to wait for the elevator during peak times at night and mornings. Tip: There are ice and vending machines on certain floors, if you are sensitive to noise, I would recommend you ask hotel staff for a quiet room and floor. Also staff came knocking at 9am, so put the quiet sign on if you plan to sleep in.

The location is a very short walk to Times Square, but off the beaten path enough that it is quiet. Rooms are small and basic, but immaculately clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is a huge perk in a pricey city.

Good hotel with comfortable beds. We found our room to be in a quiet location. Good location for us to walk to shows as well as Madison Square Gardens. Also close to 9th for good restaurant options. We found the value to be very good for New York.

The hotel is located in a great place in order to get to wherever you are going with the taxi, bus and subway systems very close. The price was more than reasonable for the location and amenities offered.

Hampton Inn was great. Only issue was elevator was too busy. Had to wait to catch the elevator with luggage which was too much to take stairs. Breakfast was excellent. Room was neat and clean. Cleaning was late in the day.

When a snow storm grounded us for an extra 2 days our other Hampton Inn Thestre District was full. We moved here as our only option. It is a small sized, older hotel. Only six small rooms per floor with about a 3' wide hallway. Cramped feeling as soon as you step off the elevator makes an awkward lobby. Narrow hallway into the common breakfast area. Rooms appeared clean although smalll. Breakfast was very good. The neighborhood is on the edge of Hells Kitchen and Garment District. We didn't feel as close to as many things here but easily walked to Bryant Park and Grand Central Station. It was an $8-10 cab ride to the theatre district and about $15 from TriBeCa. There is no Grab and Go market in the lobby for a late snack. You have to go next door to the Candlewood Suites. One of the 2 elevators was broken on and off during our stay. We were actually stuck in it for a few minutes. Made it a long wait for all 36 floors using just one. The front desk staff and other workers were all very pleasant.

Great hotel. Great value for the star rating. Although still in Time Square it is a bit a ways from the "hot" spots. We enjoyed our stay there. Complementary breakfast was a nice amenity. Plus all day complementary coffee, hot chocolate and hot tea which was greatly appreciated! They also offer luggage storage which we were able to benefit from after checkout. Very nice staff. Clean hotel. Private RRs. High rise, small hotel.

Location and breakfast are great. We were unfortunate to be charged by both the hotel and Agoda. Receiving the refund drags on and on. Hotel claims that Agoda did not communicate properly, so they just charge the credit card... I find this totally unprofessional. Successive calls to get the reservation off the card lead to delays and procrastination. Very dissatisfied!

Located about a 5 minute walk from Times Square and only about 2 minutes from the subway which was very convenient. Breakfast tasted good but was extremely crowded unless we were down there before 7am. The room was small but this is NYC after all. Unfortunately the room was not the cleanest by Hampton Inn standards. Soiled carpet and mildew in the shower. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay as enjoyable as possible.

Stay was fair could have been much better if time was spent getting to know customer. No matter time front desk always seemed rushed and unorganized. Called for extra towels and took absorbant amount of time

The elevator was non-functional at this hotel for several days. We were not compensated at all for the delays. The problem was not fixed by the time we departed. Management kept telling us the elevator was fixed when it was not. We were told we could not move to another hotel because we prepaid. We were only released after clarifying the hotel was entirely non-functional without a functional elevator. We were forced to reserve another hotel at the last minute during the Christmas holidays at a much higher rate.

Little sympathy from hotel staff for the sleepless nights that we had because our room was next to the noisy lift. On our first night we complained that we were up due to the noise lify only to be told that we were the only people that complained. in the lift on the 27yh 3 other families complained. The hotel staff tried to play it down rather that acknowledge the problem. On the 3rd day surprise surprise the offending lift was under repair and left us family of 4 walking up 7 floors. What a nightmare of a stay, never again

Stayed here 3 nights before Christmas. Rooms are tiny but well appointed. No bathtubs - only shower. This was fine for us but could be an issue for people with small kids. Elevators were sooooo slow and overcrowded. Only one of the two elevators worked consistently during our stay. Recommend you stay on a low floor so you can use the stairs. The views on this street are not great anyway. Looking out at lots of construction. We picked a room on a high floor hoping for a good view. Wish we had just taken a 2ND or 3Rd floor room. We couldve saved ourselves 20 minutes each morning waiting for the elevator! Location is good for the price, though, and the rooms were nice with very comfortable beds. Three minute walk to the subway and about 10 minute walk to times square. Rooms were clean, staff were courteous and helpful. Breakfast area was crowded and very very dirty. Food was stale and nasty. I would definitely skip the breakfast. Only valet parking was offered, and it was $70 a day. Although, in hindsight, there was a self parking garage about 2 short blocks away for only $52 a day. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget, but would probably not stay here again.

Good location to walk around in midtown, only a block from 42th st. subway station. Staff were excellent, when we arrived our assigned room was not ready, I asked for a higher floor room and the staff was happily arrange that for us. The bed was comfortable. They offer enough varieties of breakfast and the best thing was they offer hot coffee all day which is good when you came back at the end of the day from the cold weather outside. Only drawback was there were only 2 elevators which were crowed during breakfast time.

Only 2 Elevators. Long waits @ 10 minutes.. On last day one broke down. Needed to walk up 8 flights. Other guests had to climb more flights. Free breakfast, but OK . You get what you pay for. Coffee decent. Room was clean and friendly staff.

Easy to walk to Times Square and also to Chelsea. Also, two subway stops 1 block away so you can easily get anywhere with minimal transfers. Loved Scallywags Irish Pub around the corner for a quick bite and drink. Close to everything but a little off the main drag for quiet.

No complaints except you have to eat breakfast very early due to the space being very small. There were 2 elevators and every morning it was packed we had to wait at least 15 to 20 min. The food was ok kind of cold but acceptable.

I was very impressed with the room we selected, clean and neat and comfortable. Great location to get to Time Squares and all around the city. Great restaurant with good food, close by. Recommended to good friends.

Good location, walking distance to Times Sq, Penn Station, Empire State Building etc. Rooms are small as expected for New York hotels. Breakfast place is really small and we couldn't find seats at around 9am. Had to bring breakfast back to the room. Elevator is a huge issue as we were there during peak season. Only 2 elevators to serve 32 floors of rooms, had to wait for a long time. Elevator seems old too and one broke down when we were there. Suggest asking for a low level if you don't mind taking the stairs. Your usual decent breakfast choice.
