Good location , very close to Times Square, Bryant Park etc. very clean and the staff was friendly. We felt safe and secure. I think the only downside was the price of parking , but I realize this is NYC!

Hotel is located to many attractions. It is walking distance to Empire State Building, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, the theater district and Times Square. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are updated and clean. The complimentary breakfast had a good variety and saved time. Overall a pleasant stay.

Very nice hotel, staff was great , room was. Very clean and well appointed, breakfast was delicious would definitely stay here again right in the center of New York with easy access to all sites and activities

The room is a decent size for NYC, but the shower is way too small. I could barely move around in the shower and I kept hitting my elbows on the door and wall. The comforter is scratchy, but the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was good, and they warn you that it gets busy later in the morning. The last day, we went late, and there was not anywhere to sit. The elevator broke down, so we had to walk down 25 flights of stairs. That was probably not a normal situation, but it was frustrating.The desk staff was friendly when a manager was with them, but they didn't speak to us otherwise. We enjoyed the Hampton Inn in San Francisco this last summer, but we would not stay at the one in NYC again.

This hotel is in a great location not far from Times Square. The price is a lot better here than other Hilton properties with only a few extra blocks to walk (like 3) and you get free breakfast. Rooms are just fine for two girls and very clean. Really enjoyed our stay at Jim at the front desk was awesome! We'll be back!!

The hotel is located between 8th and 9th Av, there is a subway station on 8th and 40th street.The rooms are very small, good shower, although the rooms face the street it is well insulated and there is little noise from the outside.The staff is very friendly.There is a slight problem with the elevators. there are only 2 elevators for 30 floor so the wait can be tedious specially at busy times.Breakfast is just OK

Convenient and within walking distance to Times Square. Clean and quiet. Front desk was friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was good and they did a good job considering how busy it was each morning. Irish Pub next door is entertaining. Would stay again.

Overall fine, but the rooms are extremely small, for the cost. Ditto with lobby/breakfast space. Service was helpful, free breakfast. Good location. OK for business travel, hard to fit many people in the room .

Close to Times Square and close to great Deli's and Irish Pubs that are right next door . The Hotel was clean and quiet and the staff was GREAT . This hotel was a great value for being so close to Times Square , a ten minute walk away .

Stayed here for the weekend with my wife after a business trip to Manhattan. The location was good--a little farther from Times Square than I thought (and I know enough about Manhattan to know where it was and how close/far, but experiencing it was a little different). It is only a block and a half from the Port Authority and a Subway entrance, so getting around was easy. We had a small room, but that was to be expected. Wifi worked great, and always appreciate a Hampton breakfast which is a nice money saver. Friendly staff. Overall a good experience.

We stayed in New York for a short trip. This hotel is few blocks from almost anything you can want to do. It's very clean and staff is very attentive . It's a very good value for New York City!!!!!I would definitely recommend to anyone who wants a clean hotel, great location and don't want to spend $$$$$$$$

This hotel was a great option for our weekend of 'tourism' in the Big Apple. Was close to Times Square and a quick cab or Subway ride to other areas in Manhattan. Front desk was very helpful in checking in our bags/car even though our room wasn't ready and also helpful upon check out to store our luggage until we were ready to depart (well after check out time). The hotel was super clean and breakfast was great. The rooms/hallways are tiny, but that is typical of ANY hotel room in NYC. So, I was expecting that upon arrival.

This Hampton Inn is one of those narrow and tall economy hotels that have popped up in Manhattan in recent years. The rooms are small. But the hotel is very clean and the staff is excellent. In a busy area on 39th Street, the noise in the hotel was surprisingly low. I was pleasantly surprised on a recent stay. And unlike larger hotels where there can be an element of hassle with the crowds, security and other issues, the stay here was simple.

Great staff. Great location for theater district, we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Close to St Pats, restaurants, Rockefeller Center, American Girl Store and Penn Station. Couldn't have been better.

Great place to stay and convenient to most everything! The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but clean and larger than some I have stayed in there in NY. I will stay at this Hampton when I return to NY in the future!

Close enough to be convenient to attractions and theater but away from the times square madness! Room is clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful! We would definitely stay here again!

Yes, the rooms are small, the showers tight and the hallways narrow but the attentiveness to detail and excellence in customer service from the front desk completely overshadows room size. Nicole at the front desk was always pleasant and eager to help with guest needs. Realistically you are in NY City how much time are you spending in your room! Completely adequate for two people and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves in the City and slept soundly and comfortably in the updated albeit small rooms. Would absolutely stay here again!

Having stayed at this hotel in last few days I would highly recommend it. Staff very professional rooms compact but serves its purpose. Breakfast was lovely. Stayed with baby and hotel was very accommodating. Would I stay here again.. definitely!

The picture at the top of this posting is not typical. The rooms were so small that you had to walk sideways to get between the beds and the "closet". The shower was the narrowest I ever been in... a solid person would not fit. No fridge in the rooms.The rooms are clean. The beds are comfortable. Breakfast is included. The location works if you are walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City ...We will chose another hotel next time we come to the City.

I always choose Hilton brand hotels when I travel because normally my experience is great with superb room quality.. this hotel on the other hand lacks the qualities I've come to expect from Hilton branded hotels. The pictures shown online are deceiving. The rooms are actually very small as is the bathroom and shower. I'm 5'2" and when I was washing my hair in the shower I was hitting my elbow off the glass door also being 5'2" I could sit on the edge of the bed and put my feet on the walls. I had a king size bed room so I can't imagine two beds fitting in one room. We were on the sixteenth floor and could hear the elevator all night as well as the vending ice machine and the city noise below. Never heard street noise when staying at the Hilton Times Square and Times Square is certainly busier than this location. I didn't feel safe as the room key was not required to operate the elevators even in the evening. Elevators are also extremely slow and the lights blink during operation and they're loud and small, not to mention there's only two of them for all staff and guests. One morning before leaving to head out we waited ten minutes for the elevator to arrive. This hotel is around a five minute walk to Macy's and a five minute walk to Times Square so the location is decent. If you plan on using public transportation such as the subway there is no station nearby. On the other hand the staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were updated and clean. For the price paid for this hotel I would not stay here again nor recommend it, there are many other slightly more expensive options that are worth the extra cost due to size, location and noise.

The best experience possible, excellent location, excellent room, excellent service, excellent reception, anyway, everything was great. Was my honeymoon and everything was perfect for us. Off course we will come back any time.

For the price I really cannot complain. My room was small, which is what you expect in NY but it was clean, nicely decorated. The only negative comment I would make is that it is not that close to a subway station. But I don't mind walking so it worked out for me.

Our room was small but had everything a regular size room gives you. We had a coffee pot. The bathroom had plenty of room. The stairs were steep and lead out to the street which we found a little unusual.

Room very nice, central location, and nice basic breakfast. What to expect from a Hampton Inn, but overpriced. Why would a room rate double the week after a holiday? Other than the price good stay. A block from Port Authority, lots of stores and restaurants walking distance, all in all good choice.

Picked this hotel as the ones we have stayed at previously were either fully booked for thanksgiving or were too expensive . Got a great deal on Expedia for this hotel after reading previous reviews . I have to say my reasons for not liking it are personal to me and my family and I'm aware that others would not be too bothered by what I didn't like . On arriving reception staff were efficient but not over friendly or welcoming despite us being the only ones checking in , our rooms weren't ready as it was only 2pm so we left our bags in the bag check . 1 man doing this while attending to 2 large groups leaving who wanted him to take their bags out to their transport so we waited quite a while to check our bags . When we got into our rooms they seemed ok a bit shabby I would say for a Hampton , spotlessly clean comfortable and equipped with everything we needed . Beds and pillows were excellent . Beds and towels changed every day , not necessary but lovely to come back to . Coffee machine in room with real coffee but awful powdered creamer . Coffee was very weak and bland and we seemed to get nearly all decaf each day , I guess though if I liked it they would of provided more of regular if I asked . Our room was right next to lift and was extremely noisy nearly all day and night with the exception of hours between 1am and 4 am when it was silent . Our daughters room looked out on to 8th avenue and was constant horns and sirens, we have stayed in Times Square before and heard nothing so maybe the windows aren't doing their job ? Breakfast room was a joke most mornings we were there , it's tiny so fills very quickly even at quieter times . 8-10am is extremely busy . 2 waffle machines with constant queues and 2 toasters in the middle of the buffet so created a bottleneck each morning . Standard basic buffet plenty of fruit and yoghurt to give you something in your tummy , decent mini omelettes every morning varied flavours. Free tea coffee hot chocolate and water in lobby 24/7 . Not an awful hotel at all just not one we will re visit next year for our own personal reasons stated . If your looking for a reasonable basic hotel central to all attractions and good transport links then this could be for you .

My sisters and I decided that we wanted to take a last minuted trip to NYC. I got on my Hilton App to check prices and was happy to be able to find a hotel for this price. My husband was also glad for a cheaper city hotel price. So off we went. We arrived around 11pm. This hotel is VERY close to Times Square and Macy's 34th St store, however, you do have to go down an alley like street to get to it. It was filled with trash (day after Macy's parade), but there are other hotels around it, and it is totally walkable and gives the typical city feel. We were able to get a good night of rest, rooms are small, but it is set in TS and the hotels are packed in - so the perfect little NYC room size. Breakfast is your standard waffle, cereal, hot food items, and toast selection, like any Hampton. Within walking distance of many Subway lines (blue, purple, red, orange) which can take you to airports and any place in Manhattan and other boroughs.

Would definitely stay here again! Just finished a 5-night stay. Great place to use as a home-base. Subway nearby (2 blocks). Quick walk to Times Square and other midtown sites. Vacationed with my 14 year-old daughter. Most nights we were returning to the hotel after midnight. Felt safe leaving the busyness of 8th Ave and walking the short way on 39th to the hotel. Room was always cleaned nicely. Breakfast was convenient. We usually stuck to beverages, cereal and pastries. Coffee/tea/hot chocolate was available 24/7. Front desk was helpful and efficient. We were able to check our bags after our flight. Check in & check out were very straightforward. The bill was exactly the amount in my reservation -no surprises. The room was pretty much what we expected. Everything we needed, just in a small space. Beds were comfy. Enough room to unpack our bags into cabinets and closet. Ample storage in bathroom for toiletries, etc. Two elevators. We were on the 30th floor. The longest we had to wait for an elevator was 4 minutes. We just made sure we budgeted a few extra minutes when departing, in case the elevators were busy. We were one room away from the elevator. Elevator noise was not an issue. We really had a great stay!

We stayed there for 2 days for me and my wife. Location is ok, room is comfortable though quite small, good side is that we had breakfast and unlimited coffee. generally satisfied with the experience but I fee it's quite expensive

Staff was friendly and attentive, the room was clean and quiet. Free wifi and complementary breakfast was fully stocked and good quality. Great location only a few blocks from port authority and Times Square.

Great hotel, walking distance from tons activities and places to visit. Tons of places to eat nearby. Really enjoyed walking the near by high line. Will probably stay at this hotel again next time I'm in NYC

We wanted nice hotel which would be conveniently located withing walking distance to everywhere. Price was good, clean hotel, great free hot breakfast. And we walked everywhere. And it was quiet so we got really good rest.

Location was fabulous. Staff helpful and efficient. Room ok. Would come again. Happy with stay. would have liked bar/room service. But close to good restaurants. would recommend to others. Bed comfortable. Minimum noise from other rooms.

Just returned from a five night stay in the Hampton Inn Times Square South. The staff are outstanding and incredibly friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient. The room was comfortable and clean. I stayed on a lower floor, so the street noise was quite annoying. It's a cozy hotel, only six rooms per floor, with some pretty tight spaces. I'm not a large person and I found the shower stall to be cramped. Earlier this year, I stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square North, which I thoroughly enjoyed. I will stay at the South location again, but only if the North Hampton is booked up like it was this week. The advantage of the South location is fewer guest capacity, so breakfast is not a mob scene.

I'm afraid I found the rooms two small shower only is not acceptable I prefer a bathtub the noise level from street was an acceptable in the breakfast was poor at best. The food quality was less than the cafeteria in the high school.

Always reliable- nice location - access to shopping, Time Square, Madison Square Garden. Clean rooms and friendly staff - good value. The location near the Javitz Center is convenient - within walking distance.

We stayed at a couple of hotels while competing in the New York marathon. This was the best located and best value for money. The room was clean and comfortable with free wifi.It is located close to Times Square and the theatres and a subway station.The free breakfast was ok providing a range of different selections but I wouldn't classify it as a great breakfast but considering it was included in the price it was satisfactory.I would definitely stay here again if I get back to NYC.

Hotels in the city can be hit or miss. We've stayed at this Hampton Inn a few times and it has always been a very good experience. Definitely recommend for walking distance to Penn Station and Times Square and Theater District

The staff at this Hampton Inn were ALL polite and helpful. The employees at the check in counter were friendly and accommodating. For this reason alone, I would stay there again. They helped with directions and suggestions on where to go. The rooms were so-so, but the views were breathtaking (we overlooked the Empire State Building). Breakfast was convenient and had decent options. The location was convenient - we mostly walked everywhere (Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway).

Good location that's about it. Not what you expect for what you pay. Room was clean - hotel service was good. Had free Wi-Fi and an okay breakfast. Room was very small but customary for New York standards.

three nights at the hotel. the front end staff was great. Fildys Diaz and his shift were especially nice to two tired travelers. the elevators were really packed in the morning. give yourself some extra time. room was very clean and made up on time.

After having to deal with accidentally reserving the wrong date our stay at this hotel was well appreciated staff was great. Room was clean not until we notice the mattress having a stain under the sheets but it was the morning after so we just went with it. We were glad to find the room was available. Overall it was a good stay.

The elevators were not working properly. We were at the 28th floor. We stayed fir 6 days, the situation did not change during our stay. Even worst we were trapped for more than 20 minutes in the elevator one day.

I have travelled all over the world. Chosen for its great central location, this hotel was a decidedly mixed experience. A very comfortable room (but with a reluctant hot water supply) was let down by repeated elevator delays, below average breakfast, and problems with the internet connection.

Great find for a girls long weekend for the Marathon. Rooms were small (esp c/ three ladies suitcases) but clean, safe, updated & quiet. It's NYC- so we weren't in our rooms but to sleep. WIFI was easily accessible and enough outlets for all of us to charge all our phones/chargers. The staff was very friendly & helpful in answering questions and keeping our luggage when we arrived early. The daily breakfast was so convenient and plentiful. Jessica, who worked in the breakfast area each day was very pleasant and sweet! Her smile was a warm greeting each morning. She was truly a delight! Even though there was a little problem with the elevator one day the staff was quick to have it serviced. Would definitely stay here again.

My husband & I stayed here for an anniversary trip. My husband 1st time NYC. The hotel was conveniently located. The service was excellent. The rooms were small but as expected for NYC. My husband is a broad shouldered man who had to turn sideways in the shower. The outlets in the bathroom were not accessible. The bathrooms were extremely small. That is probably the only negative. Elevators were fine and not slow as I had read on some other reviews.

Pleasantly surprised at the high quality service, amenities and room for a small Manhattan hotel. Cost was high ($300) but it was NYC Marathon weekend and breakfast was included. In a pinch an excellent choice.

Good Cleanliness of the room, good hospitality and service by all Staff. Wonderful Complimentary breakfast and service staff and the Wifi. Updated rooms . No complains here. Plan to stay there again. The lobby is small but very homely. The staff very helpful. Just a few minutes walk from Time Square NY, the Sub Stations and buses. Great Value. Would recommended to all. Its a hidden little gem in NY

Smaller rooms but still the same charm as the more expensive Hilton hotels. No room service. The staff was exceptionally friendly and happy to help. Had a great discussion with the manager on shift while we were checking in and we never felt like we couldn't ask for even small things we forgot to pack. The rooms are smaller but we'll decorated and the TV is large. 2.4A USB charging ports are everywhere which is a welcomed touch.

Located in Midtown- close to everything just a short walk or subway ride. Rooms were clean albeit small but it is NYC after all. Booked online- very easy- helpful staff- hot breakfast every am. Overall would return if ever back in the area

Really good location for this pretty standard Hampton Inn. What made this memorable was the approach and attitude of the staff who were excellent. They couldn't do enough for us and were incredibly helpful and polite. It's pretty expensive (but there again most hotels in New York are) but if you want a stay in a standard hotel made all the more pleasant by excellent staff, this is the place.

We stayed at this property for a mother-daughter weekend trip to NYC. On the itinerary were theater, shopping, and Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. We had previously stayed at the Times Square Hilton, but that property did not have rooms with two beds available so we opted for the Hampton.Location: Convenient to the theater district, and I have no problem recommending this location. Very walkable location a couple blocks from the craziness of Times Square, so you don't have the lights and noise of that area. Also, the location on the south side of Times Square makes it a short walk to the shopping area on 34th-36th streets. Therefore this location is quite attractive and positive. Transportation options nearby and only 1-2 blocks to bus or metro.Facility: The entrance to the hotel is unremarkable so easy to walk by. This is a smaller hotel property, only about 4-5 rooms on each floor. Floors were laid out in a U shape, with the two elevators at the bottom of the U and a couple rooms on each leg of the U. Higher rooms will help avoid street noise and provide better views. Our view was facing 39th street. The rooms are small (compared to the Hilton), but the furniture design helps with functionality (e.g. the nightstand between the beds had a pull out table top which was handy for coffee). Bathroom was efficient - shower only (no tub) and very little vanity space. There are shelves holding towels that we used as vanity space, and door hooks on the back of the bathroom door for hanging toiletry bags, so that ended up working fine. Room was clean and tastefully decorated. Coffee maker provided, no minifridge. Compact ironing board and iron available.Staff: Staff was welcoming and pleasant.Breakfast: Typical Hampton breakfast with hot and cold items. Quality of items was good and the area was well-kept and stocked during the busy breakfast rush. The only negative is the seating in the breakfast area is quite limited. Fortunately people did not tend to linger and tables turned over quickly. Both mornings were very crowded in the eating area, but we had no problem getting breakfast.Overall: I would not hesitate to book this hotel again for a quick trip. If I were staying longer in the city I might choose a property with larger rooms. The room was comfortable for 2 people, would be tight for 4 (especially when taking into account luggage storage and bathroom space).

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Great location for first timers in New York. Reception staff very friendly. Rooms big and clean. Stayed as a couple for a week. Breakfast complimentary and was very nice. Breakfast room a bit chaotic though so we would take what we wanted on trays back to room. Would stay again.

Got an email (not a call), when we were about to board our flight to NYC, that our reservation was gonna be canceled due to a credit card issue. Although our credit card was valid, I was able to call & give them another card, after sitting on hold for 15 minutes. Thankfully we checked in OK. But I've had friends who've had similar reservation "issues" recently. Our stay was nice, staff very helpful, & room was adequate/kept clean. However, the day we checked out, I got quite an astonishing surprise. The breakfast area was normally crowded. But not this day. While preparing my food, a RAT ran right by my feet & retreated back to the room with all the food! I notified the staff & they were very apologetic. The front desk offered a cursory, 10K HH point bonus for my "inconvenience". After getting home, I talked with the manager. And they said they had pest control eliminate the rodent. I expected to hear that. Although I'm not sure the cause has been resolved. I contacted Hilton directly, discussed the incident, & reminded them of the "Hampton 100% Guarantee". Their response, in short, was the 10K bonus was sufficient. So beware of the breakfast situation. I'm not sure it's 100% sanitary.

Lovely ladies at the front desk after 10 Pm on Tuesday evening 10/25, Nicole and ?. Very nice, very helpful, extremely professional. Really great brand ambassadors for Hampton Inn. Easy check-in. Got the room type exactly like I requested when I made the reservation online. Compact room, but newly furnished and very clean. Those beds and the bed lines are top drawer.

Perfect stay in a perfect location. Clean rooms and fantastic bed sheets. Dfinitely going back. Bathrooms clean as a whistle. Noise at a minimum from inside and outside the hotel. Give it a try. Won't regret.

Great place to stay for MSG events. Close to both Penn station and port authority. Nice room and great breakfast. The staff was very friendly. We walked here from Grand Central, through Time Square and the garment district, very fun walk.

I wasn't wowed, but it wasn't bad. We took the train to NYC and arrived at Penn Station arounf 12:30. The walk to the hotel was about 15 mins, so not bad at all. Upon check in, we had 14 people, so we literally took up most of the lobby with ourselves and our luggage. I requested early check in, but it was not granted. We were told they could hold our luggage, but we would have to come back after 3. Unfortunately we had an early lunch/dinner to make before seeing a show that evening, so that meant all of us taking turns in the restroom downstairs to freshen up and change. We had some time after dinner to come back to the hotel, and when we did, our rooms were ready. The elevator is small....the lights flicker...and the door sounds like its squeezing itself extra tight. A little scary, but thankfully it never broke down. When we entered our room- just standard room w/ king bed- WOW was it tight. The bathroom is small with very limited storage (3 small floating shelves above the toilet), and the desk, drawers, and free standing closet were within a foot of the end of the bed. But for what we needed it for- a home base for travel around Manhattan- it was fine. Location was great. very close to the subway and Times Square- and there were a few bistros and pubs very close by to catch a game and a drink. The price was right, and the location was good- so the negatives wouldn't deter me from staying here again.

The check in process did not go smoothly. I was not greeted as a Hilton Honor member. The hallways are very tight making it difficult to move with large suitcases. They have a concierge person that does not start till 8:00 am. So if you need a cab early in the morning they are not there to assist.

This is a great location and price - wonderful king size bed, probably the most comfortable of any hotel stay, very clean, space was tight but to be expected in NYC. Good shower and nice freeby toiletries. There are only 6 rooms per floor with two lifts, so a couple of times there was a wait, but nothing to worry about. Free Wi-Fi and a great breakfast were a real bonus. The staff were friendly and helpful. Definitely recommended.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Hampton Inn. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed quiet hallways no noise from our neighbors. The free breakfast was very good as well as all day coffee and tea service. I was happy with the location of the hotel close to all the places I wanted to see. I would stay there again when I visit in the future.

Well located hotel; surrounded by Broadway theaters and is in walking distance to attractions such as Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Central Park, Restaurant Row, Rockefeller Center, The Museum of Modern Art and Manhattan’s best shopping; close to public transportation, restaurants, theaters. The staff were extremely hospitable.

The staff was great. Upon arrival everyday we were welcomed back. The concierge provided us with a map of city and helped us plan our way around. Breakfast was good and breakfast staff was very pleasant.

Good location, great staff, great breakfast (omelettes, bacon, muffins, fresh fruits etc.), free coffee all day, and clean room with great beds and view. Even better than expected. Will return if price stays the same.

For being in NY, where friendly isn't always a guarantee, this staff did a phenomenal job. They were there to serve and made us feel great about staying at the Hampton Inn. We could easily go back to this hotel.

Convenient location is the key here, in a quieter location in Manhattan. It has all that you need/expect from an Hampton, rooms are clean, modern and have all the basics. The rooms, like all room sin Manhattan are small, but perfectly adequate. Small bathroom with shower. They do have the room safe and coffee making, with large TV and desk. The gym is well equipped, but small. The breakfast room is adequate and breakfast is the usual Hampton Inn. If you want a quieter room one facing the back of the hotel. There are not many rooms on each floor and there are only 2 elevators, so it can take a while when it is busy if on a high floor, especially in the morning. So if you want quick access ask for a lower floor.

The hotel was nice, clean, comfortable, convenient and had a friendly staff. The room is a little cramped and the shower is small. Nice breakfast options. Watch the pricing, it changes even if your midstream in booking. My only complaint.

Hotel was convenient to Times Square and transportation. The hotel was small, but was situated in an area that you can get to the theater, activity and subway. Staff was extremely gracious and helpful. Should probably have more staff during high check in and check out time.

A friend and I stayed here for four nights from Oct 3 to 7. Our stay was pretty much perfect. Our room was on the 4th floor and had a king bed. The room was small, but this is what we expected for NYC. The room was very clean and comfortable. The space is well used and we had no trouble finding space for our things. The hotel was quiet, our room was across from the ice machine, but this really did not pose any problem. Staff were friendly and pleasant. The breakfast was very good....choices include: omlets, ham, sausage patties, scrambled and boiled eggs, oatmeal, cold cereal, fruit, waffles, potatoes, a variety of breads etc. Jessica who works in the breakfast area is excellent. She is very helpful with tips about the area and the subway. She seems to truly enjoy people. Tea and coffee are a liable all he time. We had no complaints about the elevator, never waited more than a couple of minutes. We felt safe in this area and in the hotel. This was definitely a 5+ experience for us.

Great location, quiet side street easy acres to subway, Times Square hella kitchen. Quiet room, never heard street noise or other guests. Staff was wonderful and helpful. Shower was tight but we made it work

Rooms are small, bathroom smaller. There were four of us in the room and there was barely enough room for our luggage. If you don't like close quarters this hotel is not for you. There were 6 rooms to a floor and only two elevators. One morning, we had to wait for the third elevator to squeeze into to get to the lobby. We have stayed at other Hampton Inns in NYC but I can't recall ever feeling so cramped.

What does a hotel in a big city need? Clean room, good breakfast and friendly staff. Hampton Inn South has it all 3! Very close to the subway and Times Square... do you need more? We liked it a lot. Love to come back

Good location, a few blocks walk over to attractions. Slow elevators can be a pain, be prepared to wait. Breakfast was a zoo, but its ok with a little patience, but location and staff were great, room was quiet, staff did a bag check for us with no problem and bag retrieval later that night was super fast. We would stay there again without hesitation.

My stay was in general stable, however, staff wasn't as friendly or very enthusiastic to help or listen to our requests. Most of things i needed weren't available when i asked for. However, the porter at the gate was excellent help during departure, but when we arrived we had to carry our luggage by our selves because there was no one available to help, that caused a medical problem for my shoulder.

We had such a great experience at Hampton Inn. It is near Times Square and the personnel were incredible. The room was clean. The internet worked perfectly. The breakfast really good. I really recommend this hotel to stay!

I spent 5 nights here in September. Pros: a quite good location close to metro and Penn Station, reasonable price, small but ok rooms, rapid elevator, 1st class internet, very helpful and rapid staaf. Cons: a quite noisy street (one of the feeders to the Lincoln tunnel, I heard the sounds of 1000 different car horns these days) despite 3-glass windows, added noise from cross-street constructions, breakfast to large extent "canned". Overall a strong 3 out of 5 rating.

We had booked another hotel two doors away. Upon checking the room and being dissatisfied, we went to the Hampton and were pleased to be greeted by very friendly and helpful staff(Fildys Diaz). The rooms were clean, beds comfortable and room quiet. We enjoyed our breakfasts every morning due to a very courteous breakfast team who seemed to enjoy serving the guests. Isaiah is a top notch employee whom strived to make the guests happy.

I booked this hotel for a business stay in Manhattan. My room was extremly clean and I got very good sleeps without any noises and issues! The price was not so bad because IT was very closed to The fashion week and The position is good, IT is very close to Times Sq. and central park is not so far if running is one of your favourite activties!!!

Good hotel centrally located. Nice room. Great bed. No problems with lift. Good breakfast. Friendly staff at reception. Not a great immediate area but close to Penn station. Overall a very satisfactory hotel.

I have stayed at this hotel twice a year for 5 years. It's a great location. They renovated the rooms in 2016, changed the layout in the rooms which made the space smaller than before. Not happy about that

We've stayed here three times now in the last year, and it's been consistently good. Up to date property, rooms are decent sized for New York city, and the location provides easy access to just about everything in mid-town Manhattan. On our past stays, while they were doing renovations, the elevators were admittedly slow, which during busy times could get a bit frustrating (I think only one worked), but on this past visit, both were operational and we never waited for more than a few minutes. Rooms are clean, housekeeping works late into the afternoon -- we often didn't leave our room until after noon, but it was always cleaned by the time we returned. Complementary wi-fi for Hilton Honors members is fast and consistent, which is important for us, because we often work remote on the first day of our stay. The showers are small, and they'd benefit from more and better towels. You also can hear noise from the hallway in the rooms, but isn't an issue that bothers us much. Overall, it's a comfy property, the staff is great, and we won't hesitate to stay again.

I booked this hotel because at the time of booking it was a competitive rate and I always stay within the Hilton family of brands. However when I got there I was disappointed. The lobby feels more like a youth hostel with all of the people coming and going, and the location is on a street that feels almost out of the city. I think it might be because the Lincoln Tunnel is right there but it feel more like something you'd find off the highway than an urban city centre hotel. I decided to leave after one night and the staff just assumed I wanted something cheaper. I was able to stay at the Hampton in Times Square Central which was offering a much better rate at the time of my switching. That hotel is much nicer, newer feeling and cleaner. I like Hampton Inns/Hilton hotels but I would not recommend staying at this one. Oh, they also leave your luggage just sitting in a roped off area of the lobby when you want to leave it for a few hours before/after checkout. When I went back to get my bags I just took mine, no one was there to verify my tickets or anything.

We tend to stay at Hampton Inns when traveling - especially along the highway. Always clean, good service - and beds that are comfortable for all of us. This Hampton was excellent - and our first experience of staying in one in NYC. Room was small for 4 people - but nothing out of the ordinary for the city. Service was excellent. Location perfect.

The hotel itself was perfectly fine. The folks at reception were great. You could tell they enjoyed their jobs and were friendly and welcoming. The room was comfortable and clean, lots of plugs. Nice touch that they handed out breakfast bags to go. Came in handy as I had to run out both mornings and could not enjoy the free breakfast buffet. Also warm cookies in the evening work for me! Now the down side. It it the neighborhood. It is not the hotels fault. It is society's fault. I have been traveling to NYC for 20+ years and I have not seen the homeless population so out of control. I sympathize and do not fear anyone, but it may be a big turn off for some. In the morning the church across the street serves breakfast to the homeless and I am glad they do, but there had to be 300-400 people lined up (very orderly) down 31st and around the corner up 7th. That night as I returned from dinner a bit late, there were at least 40-50 people sleeping on the sidewalk. This is more disturbing to me that we as a society don't have a solution to this issue. The next day is when the police officer was attacked and slashed in the face a block away.

Booked this through Travelocity, and to be honest, I wasn't expecting anything incredible. I was VERY pleasantly surprised by the room...It was immaculate, perfect, freshly updated, and extremely comfortable. I would have stayed a second night, but it would have been almost double the rate of the first. I am shocked this is only considered a 3* hotel..by far the nicest Hampton I have ever stayed in.

This budget friendly hotel was just that, budget friendly it really didn't offer any thing spectacular other than being a five minute walk from time square. The rooms were Too Tight (small) and the lobby was even smaller. There was no where to spread out other than to go out. To sum it all up quickly stay here if you want to be close to Time Square don't stay here if you need a lot of room. Other than that the staff was wonderful and attentive, breakfast was included, the hotel was clean and quite. I stayed in a double room #1302September 8th - 10th.

There was a very strong men's cologne scent, my friend had her baby there and I'm sure she smelled it too. There was no shower gel, as we pulled up to the hotel to take the stroller out we began to have second thoughts, there were at least 8-10 huge blue plastic bins with thousands of towels on the side walk in front of the hotel. It made sense when the smell of the towels in our own room didn't smell fresh at all, one almost made me throw up when I used it after the shower. It smelled like human b.o. After finally parking somewhat near the hotel so that I could take the stroller out safely we realized the towels ended up staying out there for hours, it doesn't advertise very good hygienics. The shower was extremely small, my friend is a little overweight and i know if I felt uncomfortable In there she Definitly was too. The quality of the eggs weren't very good either. Also it was extremely cold when we walked in so we turned it to 75 because it was at 69 and the heat started blasting, the baby started crying and we had to open the room door to cool our room back down.

I stated here 3 nights in September. It is an ok location fairly close to Times Square. The room was small but in NYC it was probably huge. It is updated but small. The halls going to the room are tight and can get crowded. The lobby near elevator can get very crowded. Security needs to be beefed up. Several kids running wild. I tried to use the gym and really couldn't for the kids playing in the gym and on the equipment. The breakfast is ok. They didn't replenish it very well.I would probably stay here again but may try other places as well.

I was there for just 2 nights and what impressed me the most was the cleanliness of this place and the very friendly staff. Everyone was very accommodating. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast and coffee and tea availability was a very welcome perk.

A friend and I attended the Star Trek convention at the Javits Center and wanted a room close to it. The room and shower were very small, there were no movie channels or a refrigerator. Aside from that, the room and hotel were very clean and the staff was very friendly. It is my opinion that the price was a little high, but it is New York after all.

Hotel was clean. The reception staff was very nice The location was close to Times square. Complimentary breakfast was ok but the service staff were a little short and closed the complimentary breakfast area at 10:00am sharp.

This property and location delivers impeccable experience and environment as I have experienced with other Hamptons. The service was gracious and caring, since this was my first visit to NYC, that really was great. We knew we could count on them to help with logistics and make our visit memorable!

the only thing hampton is the name. old old building said newly remodel which is kind of poorly cheaply done bed is not a hampton in bed, no way. room was not as small as I thought it would be, bathroom was ha ha . staff was very, very nice and helpful. I did not like area to much a little sketchy to me, although in its defense I am not use to NYC life. Next time I would stay some where a little more upscale and a little less right near time square. I did like you could open the window a little for air. Tv did not work great (i think the remote) but had good tv stations. It was clean enough and for a good price maybe its ok for many. But only if a good sale price.

I spent several days at the Times Square Manhattan Hampton Inn. Here are the highlights. The staff was very warm and caring. The room was nice, but NYC small with a small closet. You will find enough electric charging ports in the room to satisfy a family. The King size mattress was very comfortable. The housekeeping staff was excellent. The linen always looked absolutely fresh! One of the housekeepers, Mai, left a cute little towel sculpture resembling a swan in the room - normally only seen in very high end hotels. The room air was clean. You will find the staff is very efficient and friendly. Good trip!

You can't go wrong with a Hampton Inn. It delivers a consistent brand experience every time! This Hampton Inn is tucked away on W39th St, close to 9th Avenue. It's not exactly Times Square, but no one should stay in the middle of that mayhem anyway. This hotel looks like it was just renovated. I'm on the 15th floor and can't here a peep from outside. The staff is very friendly and helped me practice Spanish when I checked in. 39th St between 8th and 9th may seem a little dingy and seedy in sections, but I think it's just because some of the buildings are old. There are restaurants on the street and a very reasonably priced hair salon called KolorBar.

This hotel was nothing fancy but adequate. Room and bathroom were very, very small but comfortable and clean. Location seemed fine close to TimesSquare Most of the staff was great but one lady who cleaned seemed to be quite unhelpful. Shower was clogged but fixed promptly when issue reported. Worst thing was a damp dank smell to the room. That really turned me off.

I've stayed here once before last summer, and highly recommend. Positives: convenient location to Penn Station and Times Square, nice modern and light feel to the lobby and breakfast area, hardly any traffic noise from outside, nice modern rooms. Negatives: street itself is on a small one-way that doesn't have a lot of lighting at night, not the nicest restaurants/bars on that street, elevators in morning can be slow, no views to speak of. Overall, I highly recommend.

Had mixed feelings after I booked this but did it anyway. The location is not bad but taxi ride was forever the streets leading to it are jammed with delivery trucks etc. Front desk gal super sweet room was ok size nothing special but clean . We were on back side of hotel which was fine as the street side was noisy with construction. Free wifi and breakfast which is find the usual fruit yogurt pastries eggs etc. It is nutty crowded during peak breakfast time but other than that time no elevator issues as some stated. Not a bad walk to heart of Times Square . Only thing about room I didn't like was no vanity area in bathroom for all my stuff but no real issues with this hotel!

Book this hotel for 2 rooms for 2 nights at $169/night. When we got to the hotel, they only had us for one night. They said to get the other night the rate would be $369 per room. Staff was not overly concerned and kept making us wait while they helped others. Room itself was okay.We were able to go two doors down and get the Holiday Inn $125 cheaper and the hotel was a lot nicer. I recommend staying at Holiday Inn - not only did the staff get us a room for our second night, they kept offering us breakfast even though we werent staying there until the next day. Overall Hampton Inn sucked! Stay at the Holiday Inn two doors down.

I know this is New York City but I don't expect to be the recipient of nasty New York attitudes by the hotel management for no reason. I am sorry if there are too many people complaining about all kinds of things but please don't take it out on me. Yes, twenty minutes is too long to wait for an elevator in the morning. And yes, I get that staff may call out and you don't have enough people to clean and service, etc. But that's not my problem. Yelling at me doesn't fix the problem. And there is no security, anyone can get into the hotel and up the elevators to the guest rooms. I don't know who was knocking on my door in the middle of the night but no one from the front desk was answering. Scary. I could go on and one. But clearly a management overhaul is in order. Sad.

The outstanding customer service along with the free breakfast made the location of the hotel even better. The professionalism of the valet parking option made driving into Manhattan worth it. It was an outstanding value for the price.

Our NYC trip was all about Broadway and this hotel, while good in many ways, was not convenient. Pros: Extremely clean, fast elevators, good room layout, nice staff (particularly the woman who worked the breakfast area - she was amazing!), fairly easy to get a cab, awesome concierge, quiet, very comfortable bedsCons: Location... a long walk to Broadway theaters, hotel itself is located on a not very pleasant street. There are three hotels on the block but even still, there is a dark, unpleasant feel to the location that we really didn't enjoy. Did not need key card to enter building at night. The door to our room (1904) didn't work well - it took 3 or 4 tries to open it and when we looked, the metal strikeplate was damaged - it looked like maybe someone had at one time tried to break in. Not a good feeling. There are so many choices in NYC...we would stay closer the the Broadway theaters next time. I will be more attentive to security issues next time as well.

The hotel is located with 5/10 minute walk of Times Square and with easy reach of Empire State Building, Rockafellas, Central Park and plenty of restaurants. The room was standard but clean. The breakfast was basic but did the job. It was great for three nights

This is a tall hotel like 20 floors with 8 rooms per floor. I must say for a Hampton Inn it has all the features like electric points, USB ports and complimentary breakfast. We had a room with two beds and its very small if you are 4 in a room, the bathroom is small too and compact.There is no parking and I’m not sure if you are on your own or they have some arrangements.Overall it’s a small rooms hotel close to Madison Square Garden or Empire State building.

Tight space near elevator and it is slow. It's NY! Plenty of desk help. Breakfast was typical. Less options toward later part of morning (pastries). Coffee was very good. Many breakfast service help trying to keep up with stocking. Bed was wonderful. Great LG TV and outlets at bed stand. Clean bathroom with shower. Concierge was available. No good views from room window on 8th floor. Other guests on higher floors expressed the same.

The hotel was well maintained and the rooms were obviously updated. Though the rates are rather pricey, the excellent front desk staff, nice room amenities and of course the breakfast was really good. the hotel is located (Garment District) within walking distance of Times Square and many of the NYC attractions. I drove to NYC, but once I arrived at the hotel I stored my car at a parking garage, just adjacently across the street from hotel (42.00 + tax a day). As stated previously things are at a premium rate in NYC. This "off-site" garages day rate was a much better bargain than anyone else, including the hotel. Almost forgot to mention, after complaining to the hotel reservations prior to my arrival concerning the rates, the Hilton corporate provided excellent phone support and help reduce the final bill + upgrade my room... Please note, if you have ANY discount services such as AAA, AARP, Hilton Honors or any Travel Club to mention at the time of booking. Also, compare prices and contact the Hilton reservations and they will match the price.

Room and bathroom are very clean. Free breakfast and internet. Well located. Blocks from Times Square. Secure. Courteous and attentive staff. I did not expect staff to be so nice. Lots of nice restaurants nearby. In the middle of the Garment District.

On arrival I was told that a new 24 hour fee is charged every time the vehicle is removed from the garage to which I agreed. However on check-out an extra night fee was charged as an "in and out fee". Hampton front desk staff were unwilling to consider my position.

Shared a room with a friend for a weekend and it was small but clean. No coffee maker in room or fridge but it was fine without. I am pretty picky and I was completely satisfied with the hotel, staff, cleanliness. The free breakfast was also pretty good! The location is SO close to Times Square and we walked all over so I recommend the location, which is Hell's Kitchen. Very safe. Our bellman was very helpful getting us a cab for 5 to the airport. The elevators were just fine when I visited. I read other reviews stating they are slow. There are just two elevators and each floor only has a few rooms. The building is tall and narrow.

Polite and helpful staff. The food was continually replenished. Very small rooms plus hallway on 16th floor very very small. Extremely noisey with guest on floor running back and worth at midnight slamming the doors and speaking extremely loud. Pillows are terrible in all Hamptons. We had a security problem of someone opening our doorn trying to get into the bathroom where my daughter was holding it shout. He said the door was opened and he came in. He was pushing the bathroom door open when my daughter started yelling. We did report the issue.

This hotel is in a great location! We drove in from Wisconsin and it was easy access to get to and get out of ... very near the Lincoln Tunnel. Their valet takes very good care of your car. They staff is very friendly, Angel was very helpful to giving us advice on getting around Manhattan... thank you! We did not have water in the A M the first day but they were on it ASAP and it was back in a short time, small set back. We would stay there again if we get back there. NYC is WOW!!

Clean, Friendly staff, great location in Times Square. Like the double occupancy and breakfast is very good. Great Value. Staff are prompt and efficient. Late check out on day of departure was great. Able to quickly check our bags in and out.

Friendly staff, VERY slow lift but would DEFINTELY stay here again!!! The kitchen was closed due to storm damage during our stay but the arrangements for breakfast at the nearby Irish pub just added to the overall charm of the place!The business centre is just a little bigger than a cupboard but the gym in the basement is a revelation.This hotel equates to a Travelodge or Premier Inn in the UK but I paid a much higher price for it than I would have done at one of these, then again I wouldn't have gotten as good a breakfast every morning or the daily room service

Location and service were great. Lots to see within walking distance and subways were not far. The complimentary breakfast was a bonus with a large variety of choices. Beds very comfortable. There was no view but that wasn't important for us.

Nice, clean,comfortable hotel with great staff. It was my son & husband's 1st trip to NYC. I'm a native New Yorker, but 1st time as a tourist now from FL. Great access to everything. Hotel located just around the corner from a very high paced area. We took the trains, rode the yellow taxi's, took a pedicab & had access to all of the NYC attrractions, history, Times Square!!!

Although rooms were on the smaller side, they are well-kept and clean. We still managed to find space for three large luggages, two kids luggages, and car seats. The beds are comfy and the staff is superb. We were able to walk to Times Square and the New Amsterdam theater for a show. Another plus is that there is a laundromat across the street, in case you need it. There are tons of places to eat all around. We were satisfied with our stay.

It is a narrow building with about six rooms on each floor. The rooms are very compact and may well be typical of hotel sin NYC. At breakfast time there is long wait for elevators even when both are working. I stayed on the 21st floor and internet was a bit of a problem, but staff were extremely helpful and tried to address the problem. Breakfast had good choice of items and hope that the hotel with think a bit more about its vegetarian guests.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn on W. 39th St., NYC,NY. The staff was genuinely kind, helpful and warm. The concierge got us the best seats in the house for Fiddler On The Roof on the day of the performance. They held our bags for us after we checked out giving us an extra day to enjoy the city. The hotel is close to Times Square and the subway station on 42nd St. We stayed on the 27th floor and the sounds of the city never bothered us. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel staff are nice, breakfast is decent, elevator took too long. Breakfast area wasn't terribly crowded and they have apples to eat at anytime which is a nice touch because you do a lot of walking. This is why I give it an average rating, nothing great. The location is the best. You are close to everything.

The staff was nice and the continental breakfast is decent. The rooms were beautiful and modern. However, my room was super small. The space between the foot of the bed and the TV was bout 2 feet, at most! Maybe the picture they display was a suite or something but definitely not the standard room with King size bed. Very close to Time Square. In my opinion over priced BUT I know the price is secondary to the location.

Pleasant stay, great location. I give an average review because that's what this hotel is. Average. It was clean, friendly staff...request housekeeping early because your room may be the last. It is busy, so although tempting to be on a high floor I would pick the 2nd floor just so I could use the stairs as the elevator can become crowded and the wait is long. I had read reviews about a busy breakfast, but it wasn't too bad. Overall...the location is the best. I would stay here again.

The rooms were very small. Its Newyork. But still expected little bigger rooms. The staff was nice & friendly. Specially Alex,also their is a problem with the wifi it has a weak signal and it kept disconnecting and reconnecting on all of our phones and electronic devices

As a Hilton Honours member I trusted the Hilton brand but what a let down this hotel was. Forget about the name as it is a full ten minutes walk from Times Square!! This is at best a two star hotel in a poor area of Manhattan. No bar. No room service. Very uncomfortable beds. We will not be back and will check more thoroughly before relying on the hotel name and actual location for any future booking!!

My wife and I visited New York City with another couple. We are Marriott members but they had already booked at this hotel so we decided to stay in the same place for convenience. I was happy we stayed at this Hampton Inn. The location is convenient to Times Square, Hells Kitchen, Madison Square Garden/Penn Station the Metro and several places to grab a bite to eat. The hotel rooms are rather small but clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 12th floor and did not hear hardly any street noise. The breakfast in the morning was average but no complaints from me since it was included in price of the hotel. It was rather crowded during my stay because of peak tourist season in July. The elevators seemed always full and waiting for one was sometimes longer than one is expecting. Overall the staff at the Hampton Inn was excellent. Very attentive and working hard to please its guest. Finally, the value for this hotel is hard to beat in Manhattan. It has a great location. Even though the rooms were small it didn't matter since we spent all of our time wondering around NYC. I was glad we stayed here.

Check in and check out were seamless. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The Location was perfect for my job. Staff was friendly and Accomadating. Great restaurant across the street called mercato definitely recommend eating there is you stay here.

This is a clean, efficient, no-frills hotel in midtown Manhattan. The guest rooms are quite small which I am guessing is normal for Manhattan. For one or two guests it would have been just fine but for a larger family it was quite cramped. There are only two elevators but they are speedy and we did not experience long delays. Complimentary breakfast is great - several selections of hot items along with yogurt, cold cereal, and a selection of juices. Business center worked for printing boarding passes and wi-fi was not speedy but worked. Hotel location is very good - relatively quiet street but close to Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller Center, bus terminal and subway stations.

Overall, this location provided a good value (in the context of ridiculous NYC pricing), fresh and stylish rooms, clean facility, good location and friendly staff. A hearty complimentary breakfast is big plus, too. We booked this last minute due to cancelled flights, and were very pleased with the selection, though neither I or my partner are HHonors loyalists. I might have to reconsider that!

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this past week. Normally we stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square North, but that was booked, so we opted for this hotel. Overall, it was a good choice: nice location, easy enough to walk to Times Square area as well as other spots; very nice staff, everyone was pleasant & helpful, really outstanding in this regard; as others have reported, it is a tall hotel (something like 32 floors) with only 6 rooms to a floor, but we did not find a problem with waiting for the elevator.... maybe a couple of minutes, and the elevator was there for us; rooms were clean & bedding very nice, however the rooms are VERY small.... we had 2 double beds and there was no place for luggage at all, you can't unpack so it was crowded and inconvenient to have to spend 3+ days for 3 of us to be working out of suitcases in the entryway. The bathroom was small but clean, and the housekeeping people kept us supplied with plenty of extra towels, shampoo, etc. Breakfast downstairs was fine - ordinary fare, but staff kept it supplied with plenty of food. I had no problem finding a spot to sit down and eat as others complained about, but I generally got downstairs between 6:30 and 7.... it probably gets more congested after 8 or so. The fitness center worked out fine for my 15 year old grandson. I would have no issue with staying here again except for the small crowded rooms. And there's not much they can do to remedy this, so as long as you know it's going to be that way, you will likely have a nice experience staying here.

One of the main things about staying in NYC (especially Manhattan) is getting a good night sleep. I can say that you will 100% get a good night sleep here. It's QUIET! Rooms are not huge by any means, but they are a decent size. Very, very nicely appointed rooms. Great color scheme, plenty of storage space for clothes and super clean all around, including the bathrooms.Staff is super friendly. We checked in pretty late and the front workers were energetic and smiling with us, which was appreciated. Location is pretty good. It's about 3 blocks to Times Square, but the location between 8th and 9th makes it a lot more quiet than your average Times Square hotel. Within 1 block in any direction you can pretty much have your choice of food.If you can get a "city view" room (higher floors) for a good price, it is probably worth it, but not really for the view...it's more that the higher floors are quieter in NYC. The "city view" isn't all that great on it's on own and is not really worth the extra $ as you will look out to the southwest over the Hudson Yards complex.

My daughter and I stayed here for a few nights. It is hard to find rooms that have two beds in NYC for a reasonable amount of money, so we decided to go with this hotel. The lobby is very modern with nice decor. Everyone who works here was very nice and helpful. There is a gym downstairs but we didn't have time to use it because we walked 9-10 miles a day around the city. This hotel is convenient to a lot of things - right in Times Square and easily accessible to the subway and buses. Room was really large especially considering it is in NYC. Breakfast is included in your room rate but gets super crowded unless you go down really early.

This hotel is convenient to Times Square and much of what New York has to offer though a good bit of walking is required. The room is very small but comfy with wonderful bedding. It meets the Hampton Inn standard.

I stayed at the Hampton for a business conference at the Jacob Javitz Center. The hotel location was an easy walk from the J.J. Center, with plenty of good restaurants within walking distance, Times Square not too far away and subway access also close by. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, somewhat small, but functional, even when my wife came in later in the week! I had free coffee and muffins every morning for breakfast (but there were many other choices including omelets, oatmeal, cereal, toast, bagels, etc, etc) and the coffee was provided all day long. Overall, a great base of operations for a busy week in NYC!

Great staff and clean and efficient hotel. Also popular and great location, so unfortunately that also makes it busy. Long waits for elevators and limited seating in breakfast area, but overall great stay.

Stayed here on holiday visit. Quite central. Tall hotel with only 6 rooms on each floor. Very friendly staff in all areas. Room was spacious enough with all we needed. Free breakfast every morning which had plenty of choice. Free coffee, tea and hot chocolate available all day. No bar but plenty of places nearby. We would stay here again.

Very nice hotel! Great stuff! Nice, clean, and confortable room! In a great location of NYC! For sure will return when I'm back in NY. Love the little gym , cortesie Breakfast and hotel amenities! Stuff were very helpfull as well:)

Rooms are so small, there is no place to put luggage. Chair barely rolls out from under desk. Bathrooms are very small. Elevator is always packed at the beginning or end of the day, often taking two tries to get on. Breakfast area is too small for this hotel. Hard to get in to eat. For someone who has stayed in most of the Hilton properties in NYC, I will not come back here. I have hovered from Gold to Diamond and try to stay hilton. Just Not worth it here. Much more like a Comfort inn or quality inn. Ice machine 2 3 feet from hotel door and very noisy all night.

It is New York City...be ready for VERY small rooms, bathrooms and hallways. Room for one suitcase. The room was clean. Breakfast was fine. The hotel is close to times square and subway. Staff was helpful. I would stay here again.

We would definitely stay at this hotel again! We drove into the city and this hotel was very close to the Lincoln tunnel which minimized NYC driving. It is within walking distance to Times Square, theaters and Rockefeller Center. Easy access to subway. Nice breakfast and very clean rooms.

I had requested a room with a city view. All of your images online show a nice view from the rooms. My view however was of a brick wall. The photos online show nice big rooms. I called the front desk and spoke to someone about the size of the room and the view and I was told this was all that was available. The room was free with points. Had I known the room was going to be this small I would have never booked or wasted my points. With a family of 4 we had no space to do anything. It was possibly the most uncomfortable trip I have ever had. We were supposed to have family meeting with us and we had to cancel that plan because there was absolutely no space for them to even come in and sit. The photos online are deceiving and led me to believe I would be getting something better. I am beyond disappointed in this experience.

Rooms are too small. Small shower area as well. Lack of different room types. Expensive rate for a small room. No luggage stands or racks in rooms. Good location near subway,times square and broadway .

We stayed at the Hampton Inn while exhibiting at the Fancy Food Show. Since our flight arrived before Noon, we went directly to the hotel assuming our room would not be ready, which it wasn't so we just left our bags and went on to the convention center. When we returned, the check in was quick and painless. We had to wait for our bags and took them to our room ourselves as the bellman will not deliver them.As with many of the NY hotels, the room was incredibly small but it was clean. Our room was at the end of a hallway. With the exception of one evening during our five night stay, a housekeeping cart was parked right outside of our door. Given the narrow hallways, we had to maneuver around it just to leave our room. On one occasion, the cart was replaced by a large bag of trash, which was left all night.We were only given two bath towels and two facecloths. We are sometimes prone to taking a couple of showers a day so we left a note asking for more of each. When we returned around 6pm that evening, the maid was in the room cleaning at it looked like she had just started. Way too late in the day to still be cleaning rooms. It took her about 15 minutes and when she was ready to leave, she asked if there was anything else and I asked if she left additional towels and facecloths. The way she looked at me told me she didn't understand English but she thought for a minute and said yes. No extra towels had been left. We left our note asking for more every day and on the final day when we returned to our room, there was an animal sculpture of towels left on our bed. Well, that's one way to get extra towels... The elevators, of which there were two, were very slow. Between guests and housekeeping, it took forever to get anywhere unless you were using them very early in the morning or very late at night.The A/C in the room was extremely loud and it was either feast or famine with the temperature. It woke us up in the middle of the night almost every night.Breakfast was available but we never took advantage of it. I do know that when we left each morning, the breakfast area was jammed with people. Way too crowded.Overall, I wouldn't stay in this hotel again nor would I recommend it. There are other similarly priced hotels in the area that offer better service.

Great value in a safe, convenient area. Times Square, Broadway and Rockefeller center were all in walking distance of the hotel. The rooms are a good size by New York standards. Everything was clean and comfortable.

Other than the room itself being a little small. Our stay was excellent!! The breakfast was good and had a good variety! The bed was so comfy, I want to know wha brand it is to buy one for home! Only 4 blocks from Time Square!

Nice, clean hotel near Times Square. Service was excellent. Staff very friendly.I have stayed at a lot if Hampton inns and this was probably the least comfortable and the elevator service was sub-par. 2 elevators for 36 floors. I don't think I will stay here again unless I have too.

We arrived as a group of 39 on the 5th of July 2016 at 8am, and we were received well. The Hotel went out of there way to check us in early, we didn't expect that and even offered us breakfast.Our stay was lovely the rooms were quite clean and the staff very friendly.Good job and keep it up

This hotel was very clean. It was in a great location right near Times Square, very central to NYC activities. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. It was a great time for everyone! It was really fun to experience big city life for the kiddos.

This small hotel offers you an honest product. Rooms nice and clean, service personal and smiling (here you almost feel at home), breakfast buffet quite okay - but the wait at the elevators far far too long. In fact all you see is what you get and we recommend this place if you need a quiet place to sleep when in N.Y.

We look for Hampton when we travel. We like the quality and value. Not so for this hotel. Problems with housekeeping, breakfast and general overall condition of hotel. Find another Hampton in the area.

The elevator is super small only 1 elevator working for all hundreds of guest. We had to wait at least 15 minutes just for the elevator. The breakfast served needs improvements. perhaps better selections.

New York vacation over 4th of July. Admittedly a very busy time to visit. The staff was all over the place- but in general the front desk was amazing (friendly, helpful, engaging) and the housekeeping was - well - bad. We had several needs to call housekeeping (ran out of tissues in the middle of a nasty cold, overnight accident requiring new sheets) and were promised speedy service. In both cases- did not get speedy service or service at all (went and bought tissues out, and after the maid just remade a wet bet and sprayed with febreze - gross - we called until the supervisor came and changed it). We prechecked in- and got a room down 8 floors from where we reserved, and Breakfast could not keep up with the people. Granted- there is a sign that explains how hectic it can get- but the one day there was nothing- warm OJ, no yogurt, no waffles, no bread/muffins, only burnt bacon. The materials to restock were in the back room- no idea why they didn't restock what they could. Again the staff was nice- but sometimes nice doesn't cut it. We complained and they removed parking (thank you- more than compensated for the breakfast we had to purchase). The rooms are tiny which is to be expected for NYC. The elevators are not programmed correctly (stop on the way up for all down calls - so you wait a LONG time for elevators at peak times and they are often full). but the location and value more than make up for the hassles. Just come with that mindset.

My flight was cancelled and the airline booked me a hotel, however when I arrived there were no rooms available! So I urgently tried other hotels nearby and found a room at Hampton. It was expensive though, but I expected that without a reservation. Personnel was very friendly and the room was very confortable, good wifi. However I was not allowed to a late check out as I wanted, wich frustrated me a lot.

wasn't expecting much after some of the reviews however not sure what people are complaining about. the hotel is in a great location a short walk from Times square. Our family had x 2 rooms with 2 double beds in each, yes they were small but they were immaculately clean, with crisp white bedding and comfortable beds. The bathroom was clean and we were were given fresh towels each day. The breakfast was a bonus and included some hot items such as scrambled egg and bacon and cold items, cereals, waffles and bagels. the staff at breakfast were friendly and helpful. there was a free drinks station on the ground floor offering hot drinks all day. if we came to new York again we would definitely stay here again .

My husband and I were in NYC on business fir a show at the Javits Center and were also celebrating my birthday by seeing a show on Broadway. The Hampton was convenient to both locations as well as being only a three minute walk from the Port Authority. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and helpful. When the front desk ladies found out it was my birthday, they delivered my hhonors snacks in a birthday bag with baloons and cute towel decorations. I was surprised and such thoughtfulness. I've always had a good experience at Hamptons but they made this one extra special.

The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were "New York small", but that was expected. Location was ideal to visit Times Square and other places of interest. Close to subway stations.

Good value. Great location. Walking distance to train station. Two blocks from subway stop and two blocks from bus station. Easy 4 block walk to Time Square. Out the door and turn right you run into 9th street. Several great local restaurants and coffee shops. Hotel staff very helpful.

Rooms were very tiny. There was no place to keep your luggage. Bathroom wasn't very clean. shower was extremely small. There was too much light coming from outside as the curtains couldn't be drawn. Check in and out process was slow. They could have provided some water in the room. These rooms are good for a single person only.

First class staff. (Especially Nicole)!!! Breakfast was perfect way to start our day. Small rooms, but comfortable beds. Elevator slow. I had strep throat for 2 days and was treated like royalty by the staff. They were so sweet and caring. We had 17 rooms rented and had a wonderful trip to New York!

A great location, convenient to subways and Times Square, This hotel makes the most of it's space. There was nothing we wanted for, the free breakfast was complete with eggs, bacon, waffles, cold cereals, pastries, coffee, etc. There was even a balloon artist on Sunday making animals for the kids.

Given the high NYC prices for this particular time of the year, we were fortunate to find the Hampton Inn Times Square South for such a comparable price. With a great variety breakfast and wifi included this was a tough price to beat for the value. The bonus was the central location close to Time Square, Penn and 42 st subway stations. In addition, the staff were superbly and genuinely friendly which made our home away from home a great experience (3 nights). Taxi from La Guardia to the front doors on 39 st west was $50 at morning rush hour and $35 early morning (5:30am)....not including gratuity. The two Elevators were actually fast given the high Floors (32 floors)...small but efficient lobby, made passage at check in times a bit of a challenge to maneuver around everyone's luggage...but really not a big issue, but had to mention because it was rather evident. All in all, a great hotel in the centre of Manhattan for a very competitive price compared to some of the adjacent locations. You will be very satisfied if you can secure a room here.

For the pricing and location it was good. However, squeezing 4 people with two beds, was a tight accommodation. I guess I am not use to NY hotels with 2 beds in a room. Family vacation I might have picked a better place but for those on a budget and need parking, this will get the job done.

Rooms are a bit more roomy for a NY hotel. The area I front of elevator is bad as narrow hall to get to restaurant and is bad for congestion. Only 6 rooms per floor. Great location to Times Square and Javits center. Also walking distance to Penn Station about .4 miles.

It was expensive for a Hampton Inn, but given NYC, it was about as reasonable as I could find. Room was as expected for a Hampton Inn. Best thing is that it is conveniently located to most attractions and was perfect for a short stay in the City.

Given that I didn't book this hotel until a week before I left, I got a really good deal given it is in Manhattan only blocks from Times Square. The room was nice and staff did their job. The free hot breakfast was the dealmaker for me, and can definitely save you some money in a relatively expensive city.

1. Called 4 times to have things brought to the room. Pillows and towels. Not ONCE did the items actually make it to the room. I had to go down for the pillows after two calls and over 4 hours of waiting the first day we arrived. Little did I know this was a normal thing. Finally went down and got them myself. Called for extra towels the next morning. Again told they would be right up. Well, and hour later nothing. Again, I went to the desk to get them in person. 2. Spoiled milk in the breakfast area. Like REALLY spoiled, not kind of spoiled. 3. Room not cleaned one day. I called down to complain about this and the towels not being delivered (since our room had not been cleaned). This time they did bring towels up after about an hour and another call, but I told the clerk we were going to be taking a nap so not to have anyone come up to clean. Sure enough, about 30 minutes later we had someone try to enter our room to clean (at 5 PM) interrupting our nap. I almost knew they would ignore this request and expected this by this time in our stay. 4. Since the room had not been cleaned, we ran out of toilet paper, and by this time I had totally given up on any hope of good customer service and timely delivery, so I took the elevator to the cellar to use that bathroom. 5.
