Bed was comfortable, so that was good. Overall the worst stay in a hotel of any star level in my life (I'm 45). I've never had this experience in any hotel, especially not a Hampton Inn.

Room: Clean, average tiny NY hotel room but had everything we needed. Great value for the price we paid. TV went on the fritz but the staff were quick to remedy the problem.Breakfast: lots of variety during the week we stayed. Arrive early as it tends to get busy.Location: perfect. We were able to walk to most attractions. Take the subway to further destinations like central park, Highline, financial district etc.

This hotel is really well situated - easy walking distance to the Jacob Javits center, Times Square lots of restaurants and bars. The staff are all very welcoming and helpful and the breakfast is quite good. The rooms are small but nicely updated and very clean.

Helpful staff, Central location close to Penn station and Port Authority Bus Terminal. Included breakfast with room package.Cons- cramped small room, no bathtub, very different from other Hampton Inns

My brother and I arrived in New York City to an unfortunate situation. The front desk and manager were so understanding and so willing to help us out. The room and views were fantastic, breakfast was the best I've ever been too and the staff topped it all with the friendliness and willingness to help. Can't recommend and thank this hotel and their wonderful staff for all their help, and made our last few days of a nightmare trip enjoyable. Thankyou so much.

From arriving to departing staff were pleasant, helpful and friendly at all times. Rooms were fine as expected for New York and very clean. There had been some concerns with waiting times for lifts but we were on the 32nd floor and only on a couple of occasions did we have to wait. I had e-mailed prior to going as it was my daughters 21st and they kindly put balloons, cards, cake and a drink in the room. Breakfast was nice and staff were always pleasant and constantly restocking. Would definetly return and recommend to others. Well done you all.

Our reservations were at Tony Dinapoli's on 43rd and BB Kings Motown review. This location was absolutely perfect! Spent the first day walking the high line from 30th to 13th, stopped at Chelsea Market. Next day checked out and drove down to Soho-Sunday is free parking. Had bad brunch at Philip Marie - do not miss this brunch!

Location is very convenient to midtown Manhattan. Staff is extremely friendly and free breakfast in NYC is a major plus. Only complaint is that the acoustics on room floors are not good - every time a door opens or closes you are not sure whether it is your own room door.

Thus Hampton inn was very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms maintained and cleaned to the max every day. Just a couple blocks south of Times Square. With this location it was a block from subway and buses; two three blocks from theaters. On the fringe of the garment district which makes for interesting shopping. 15-20 minute subway trek to Metropolitan Museum of Art and Central Park. 10 minute walk to 9th Street heading north where there are some great restaurants. Hotel very quiet so easy to sleep. A bit more value for price paid for the room keeping the expense of a visit to NYC in perspective

This being my second trip to New York, I knew what to expect when it comes to hotel rooms in the city. First off, space is at a premium there as you can imagine. So, this hotel has 30+ floors with just 6 rooms on each floor. The rooms are adequately-sized, but not spacious. While sparsely decorated, I liked the simple aspect of the room given it's size. Everything was very clean and well-organized.The staff was friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. The girl at the front desk helped me a couple of times in finding spots to grab a quick, healthy, and inexpensive meals.The complimentary breakfast was fantastic. I was expecting something on the order of a continental breakfast, but the breakfast room here was supplied with hot eggs, make-your-own waffles, bagels/muffins, and fruit. And, of course, the coffee was great as usual!Although I didn't go out much, I hear that the location is convenient to a lot of hot spots like Times Square, etc.I would definitely stay here again if visiting New York City.

Stayed 4 nights in June. Great location, most of the NYC sights are within walking distance. Tumes square 15 min... subway 5 min. Breakfast was good but limited choice for the price and waiting time on line and for food to get refilled. One day it was just too much to wait for the hot food, so we had just serials, juice and coffee. You may wait 10-15 to get into the elevator, some bathroom flies in the room.

The hotel is tight, meaning all the public areas, breakfast, elevator and room. But they handle it well. The front desk is very professional and nice. The breakfast people are great especially Jessica. She is a great ambassador for the hotel. Their are only about 6 rooms per floor and things are tight, but housekeeping does a very good job in keeping things clean and picked up. The location is good but there are a couple blocks that you need to be aware of your surroundings But overall, yes, a very good place to stay with a good location.

Hotel was a great location near Times Square but still quiet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast had plenty of options and staff was very nice. Lobby is not large but proportional to New York high rises. I would recommend this hotel.

Location was great for Times Square. Walking to Empire State Building was a bit further. Accessible room is as spacious as expected including the shower. Double beds were comfortable. Breakfast was good. Valet was great. Check in and check out services were quick and easy.

The hotel is located by Time Square on 39th st. I liked that we could walk to the subway, Penn station and Empire State Building. The staff were very helpful but the rooms were a little cramped. All the rooms were clean and nice.

We picked this based on price and a high rating. It was a strange hotel in that it is a tall (32 floors) but very thin with only 6 rooms on each floor! It was clean, the staff were friendly, the rooms quite big for New York and the beds very comfy indeed. The location was good as you can walk to Times Square in 10 minutes and the Rockefeller Center and The Empire State were just a bit further. Several good restaurants close by and of course the Broadway theatres were also not far away. If you want to see and do those things then it's a good choice.However it really is only a place to sleep as there is no pool, gym, bar or restaurant. If you want a hotel to relax in you will need a bigger (and more expensive hotel). We didn't have time to relax in our base hotel so it didn't matter. There is a complimentary breakfast which is ok but limited. The sign on the wall advertise says they offer "the best breakfast in New York" but don't believe that......it is, as you might suspect, nonsense.Go to Juniors for a really good breakfast.

very convenient location, but be aware of the room, there are quite a few gnats in the room , and if the hotel is busy, it may take you more than 10 mins just go to up to your room depends which floor you stay, since there were only two elevators , the hell way was enclosed, so you can hear pretty much everything at the night.,

Great location, extremely friendly staff and great price for staying in times square. Completely satisfied with all the hotel's amenities and its cleanliness. I really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the digital check in option which made my arrival at midnight after a 5 hour drive super easy, literally just picking up my keys. I would definitely recommend this location on 39th street

The hotel is very small. only 6 room per floor. small hallways, just enough room to walk between beds. but very clean, well maintained and room service was great. Breakfast greeter was especially nice, cheerful, helpful with directions and very friendly. Naturally, she was from the mid-west. She helped us with maps, directions, and info in the subways which we are not use to. She deserves a raise. It's a good thing because the concierges was worthless to us. 3 different times I ask for directions or information. He spoke broken English and could not answer any of my questions or give us helpful information.Even with 2 groups of school kids there, it seemed quiet and we heard no street noise.My overall experience was very good, good breakfast, clean rooms and convenient location. 5 easy blocks to Times Square, 2 blocks to subway. I would sure stay here again.This is by no means a negative review. just being from the Midwest we're use to larger rooms and queen size beds. The quality was very typical "Hampton Inn" which we consider good.

I enjoyed our stay here. However, the night was cool and beautiful and I really wanted fresh air in the room and our windows only opened about an inch or two. So that was a little disappointing but besides that great place to stay. If I were them I would add a little more variety to the complimentary breakfast as well.

Been staying here 3 or 4 times a yer since opening day and it had been superb. Last week was terrible. 13th floor guests playing their boom boxes in the hallway. Reported it to reception staff, they offered a refund... True story.

Stayed at this hotel in August 2013 and August 2015. This hotel is perfectly located to everything New York City has to offer but far enough from the noise. We always had restful sleeps. The hotel is narrow, only 6 rooms per floor, but many floors. Both times we stayed on lower floors so we could use the stairs. We heard complaints about waiting for the elevator. Our view was not great but we did not come to New York to sit in the hotel room.The breakfast was a nice way to start off our day. We like Hampton Inns for that reason.We were able to walk to Times Square in around 15 minutes. We stayed for 4 days so bought the 7 day transit pass and took the subway/bus when it was too far or too hot to walk anywhere.The hotel rate is reasonable for New York City. We booked online over a month before. They have a good cancellation policy as well.We love New York! When we return, we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

I do not really like to go to NY and pick a hotel but after a lot of hesitation we picked this hotel. We had a wonderful experience from the time we stepped into the lobby until we left. The front desk was so nice to us. We checked our bags and were able to go off to our appointment with out worry. We arrived at the city early. The hotel is near Penn Station, walking distance. The hotel looks like it just underwent a makeover. The breakfast room is very clean and bright looking and looks brand new. Plenty of seating. The breakfast is served until 10 everyday which was a plus in my book. We did not have to rush to get to breakfast. They had apples out all of the time to grab and go. Also at the front desk was a grab and go package with water and a couple of packaged goods, a granola bar and a little cake. On the day we ate breakfast they offered a cheese omelet that was sort of in the shape of a taco with the egg being the shell and the cheese inside, and they also had a bagel with cheese. I like to eat a little healthier with plain scrambled eggs which they did not have that day but I found the breakfast to be tasty and I love to go off a healthy diet occasionally. They had waffles which I did not try.. The grapefruit mixed fruit salad was the frozen or jarred type. It was good. They had bananas too. They also had Yogurt and muffins and cereal choices, one of the choices was cheerios. I enjoyed the breakfast and could sit down and make plans for the day without feeling rushed. The women in charge always asked if we needed anything and gave out chocolate candy mints. She was sooo nice and did a wonderful job replenishing everything. Thank You, I could have stayed there all day. Our room also looked like it was brand new. Of course it was NY small size. The King bed took up the whole room but it was a great bed and King size. Very comfortable, one of the best beds I have slept in. We did not want to get up in the morning. The room had all of the amenities your would need. Plenty of outlets to charge phones, with two different type plugs. They had a chair and two ottomans that could be used as a desk or what ever you needed them to be. Very efficient room design. Great TV. The bathroom sink area was small but the mirror turned out to be a very large medicine cabinet so I could just put my stuff in there. The shower pressure was good, very small shower only about 2x 3 with a safety bar on the side that made it hard to turn around, so if you are a very wide person it might be a tight fit. It was just right for us. Everything was brand new. The shampoo, soap and skin lotion were of good quality. Glad to see they gave out lotion. Our housekeeper was great, she was outside and I asked for an extra towel and got it with no problem. She was very nice. I could not believe I was in NY city, everyone at the hotel was sooo great and made us feel welcome. We had a room on a lower floor and found that there was no noise problem. There was construction going on across the street and in the morning it did not even bother me it sounded like the ocean and was very soothing. I usually complain about noise but not so with this. I actually liked it. In the middle of the night our niegbors came home but I only heard a little good night and then everyone went to sleep, so no noise from neighbors only maybe an occasional door slamming in the morning. I had ear plugs which do not do much and was exhausted from the day of walking in New York so with the most comfortable bed in the world we had no trouble sleeping. The floors are small, only about 6 rooms per floor, made it easy to walk to. We got a floor with out the vending machines so it was quiet and we only had to walk down a floor if we wanted anything. Elevators ran fine. Yes there was crowding in the hallway if the carts were getting on but we managed. All of NY is crowded, get used to it. Everyone was polite and we took our time. We would definitely go back to this hotel. It felt like our overnight stay was a bigger vacation then it was. Thank you.

I stayed here for a week and cost over $3500. Great view of the streets below and close to Times square. As walking is the best way to get around NY, this motel seemed to be quite central to what we wanted to see. I stayed there May 2015

Very clean upgraded hotel with a really good continental breakfast. Rooms may be too small for some., at least the double bedded ones were. The hotel only has six or eight rooms per floor and it is a 30 story hotel.

Couldn't t do better in NYC. The location, price and staff are excellent...breakfast and 24 hour coffee bar are even available. The rooms are very small but adequate and the bed and linens are always wonderful at Hamptons.

This was a last minute booking due to unforeseen circumstance, but it could not have been any easier from the moment I got to the hotel to the moment we left. The young lady at the front desk (who's name I don't remember) could not have made check in much easier. She could obviously see I was a bit stressed and reassured me that everything was in order and our room was ready. She handed us two bottles of water and off to the room we went. The room was spotless. Plenty of light and enough plugs for all of your devices. There's not as much counter space in the bathroom as I would have liked, but that's a minor thing. Breakfast is always hit or miss at hotel in my opinion. It was a hit here. All the standards that I expect, milk and cereal, fruit, muffins, eggs, sausage, bacon and the requisite waffle makers. There were plenty of tables so sitting down to eat was not a problem. Very good overall in my book.The location of the hotel is very good as well. You're about 5 blocks from the heart of Times Square. There is an Irish bar a few doors down that offers a 10% discount for hotel patrons, but we didn't take advantage of that. Overall, this was a wonderful stay at a reasonable price for the area.

Hotel is good and provided digital checkin through HHonors app. It has complete info and very helpful. Most of the NY attractions are near by to this hotel. Offers only valet parking. Rooms are little congested

This is a typical small hotel in Manhattan. The standard room I had was about 300 square feet with a view of another building about 30 feet away. The nice thing is that they have rooms with two beds, albeit Full instead of Queens. The room had a small desk and comfortable chair on wheels w/ottoman(also wheeled), 42" TV, small closet w/safe, nice charging stations between the beds with USB connectors. Breakfast was your typical Hampton Inn stuff, cheese omelette, sausage, Belgian waffle station etc. At 9am on a weekend it's crowded and there's a sign right there telling you how crazy it gets at certain times. The only really down side I found was the bottleneck between the breakfast room in the back, the elevators in the middle and the lobby in the front. There are only 2 elevators and a very narrow hallway. For the price range I would stay here again but I wouldn't mind spending a few dollars more for a little more elbow room.

Would rate this hotel pretty highly... Staff very helpful and eager to please, rooms clean and modern, good self help breakfast, tea & coffee always available in the lobby, and above all handy to Times Square, Broadway etcThe only (very) minor frustration would be length of time the lifts take to get you where you want to go... Because they have to stop so many times... Would definitely recommend it... Although it certainly isn't cheap

Location:This hotel is in the perfect location. It's located in Midtown Manhattan and close to everything. We were able to walk to The Highline, Empire State Building, Times Square and Grand Central Station from there. We were surrounded by restaurants of all kinds and everything we needed was just around the corner.Hotel:The hotel service was absolutely great. We arrived early but were able to checkin to a ready room.The employees are very helpful and friendly and the complimentary breakfast was really good. Housekeeping does a great job. Everything was nice and clean and always in place. The rooms are tiny but worked great for just 2 of us. There are no microwaves or refrigerators in the rooms, but there are all the other small expected conveniences (hairdryer, iron, coffee maker etc.). There is coffee, tea, water and apples located in the lobby at all times and cookies between 4pm and 6pm at the front desk :)Transportation:We used the Carmel car service company from Laguardia Airport. We called from the service phone by baggage claim and was given a coupon to get $6 off. The cost was $32 with the discount and bridge fee added. I don't recommend using them to return to the airport though, the cost is higher. Try Uber or another prearranged service. Concierge at the hotel can assist you in arranging something. Getting Around:Walk, walk, walk. You can walk to everything around you or take the subway. It the cheapest and fastest way around the city. A cab, uber or rental car isn't worth the hassle because of the traffic.

Easy to walk to Broadway theaters and restaurants! Located centrally. Challenge was in getting a cab or other transportation to or from during peak hours. But overall a great place to stay. Clean and friendly staff.

This Hampton Inn is conveniently located near subway, Penn Station, Times Square, etc. The staff is courteous and helpful. There are nice restaurants within walking distance. Try the Italian restaurant, Tavola. It is a cozy neighborhood spot that serves delicious dishes.

As the title covers, the rooms are way too small for two beds. No room to walk around the beds to get in. Fortunately we are active people and can get around by walking over the bed, but anyone with health issues would find impossible.

I've stayed at this hotel about 4 times. This hotel has a nice free breakfast in the morning and is in a fantastic location. If it didn't have a great location and wasn't usually reasonably priced for Manhattan, I wouldn't keep coming back.I'd give this hotel a 5 star review, but the one major problem it has is few rooms on each floor. This causes a MAJOR elevator jam up regularly. If you're patient it's not a big deal, but if you're able to secure a room on a lower floor, do it. Even if you had to walk 4 or 5 flights of stairs, it'd be a shorter than waiting for the elevators at times (especially during check in and check out times).

They valet' my truck!!!! That's huge for me as I was in NYC on business with lots of equipment. Cans and ubers after that. The staff was incredibly friendly! The room was very clean and felt updated and ready for business. Loved the USB ports built into the front of the night stands as I forgot my plug but not the cable. I will stay here again.

I really was very pleasantly surprised at the size of the room for this Hampton Inn as I had been repeatedly told most NY hotel rooms are very small in size. My stay was for 3 nights. The beds were comfortable, the elevators were fast enough, the breakfast was decent and the breakfast staff was super nice and welcoming; really enjoyed chatting with them each morning. The front desk and bell staff were very friendly and helpful. The lobby area is small but that is something I'd expect anyway. If and when I visit NYC again, I definitely stay here again.

If going to the theater--this is a great hotel -- a little less pricey than some just one or two blocks closer and nicer beds and room size than some. We were able to walk everywhere, to several theaters and restaurants, and never needed a taxi or subway. The room was spacious, by Manahattan standards, and we were able to have a king size bed versus a double offered at a more expensive hotel down the street. We'll stay here again!

On first impression, the Hotel lobby was small, but in New York City that is to be expected. Overall, the hotel was a tight squeeze. The rooms were very nice, although small. Breakfast was pretty bad. Breakfast quality varied greatly every day. I wouldn't touch the eggs on my first morning, the second morning they looked a little bit better, but not much. I was mainly disappointed with the breakfast. Location was great.

Stayed 2 nights on a weekend about $300 per night. 32 floors, 2 elevators, small lobby. Good service helpful staff. Typical Hampton free breakfast. Room was very clean, comfortable bed, tight shower. Walking distance to subway, Times Square, Theater District. No complaints.

I stay at the Hampton Inn at Times Square South about once per month for business and was very happy with all of the renovations and upgrades.The carpets are all new throughout and the rooms look great.The staff has always been terrific and I love their complimentary breakfast.

Amazing & helpful staff. If you are looking to stay near Times Square, this hotel is in the perfect location! If I ever go back to NYC, I would definitely choose this hotel!! Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Clean room about the size I would expect in NYC. Definitely not big, but bigger than some I have been in. Comfortable bed, good TV. The only thing the room was missing was the mini-fridge. (maybe I could have gotten one if I asked for one, but I did not. I did the old Ice in the sink to keep drinks cold.) The location was good for work as well as the close proximity to Times Square. No complaints, would stay here again. I am normally a Marriott person, but the price of this Hampton Inn could not be beaten.

We had issues with the phone not working...and complained. The next day no phone still....we were then informed that the phone was not fixable. This would be fine if we didn't have to trek 19 floors to front desk to complain about three other things!!!

Stayed here overnight as we were going to see a play and it is within easy walking distance of the Theater District, as is Times Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral, the United Nations, several different subway stations and the Port Authority Bus Terminal.Accessibility: The hotel has several ADA-compliant accessible rooms. The corridor in front of the elevators is a little narrow; turning a large power w/c coming out of the elevator may take a try or two. Other than that, no problems noted. If using a walker, consider asking for an ADA room as the walking space in the regular rooms is somewhat tight and may present a challenge for someone with a walker. The breakfast room has amble space to accommodate mobility devices.The hotel is in the Garment District. During the day it is a bustle of men pushing garment racks and flat beds of fabric. Every other storefront is a restaurant, offering everything imaginable (Chinese, Korean, Pizza, bakeries, sandwich shops, coffee shops, you name it it is within a block or two, not to mention all of the restaurants in Times Square). What is not restaurants are stores selling primarily bridal and formal wear material, as well as men's suit and shirt material. The fashion schools are close, so during the day you will see students going from one fabric store to another seeking out the perfect material for their newest creations. Check in was fast and efficient. As requested we were given a room on a higher floor (farther away from the noise of the street when we wanted to sleep. ) We were given the password for the WiFi. Parking: As we drove to the city, we paid the $55 plus tax to valet park our car (there is very little other option.) There is no in-out allowed (or they charge you another $55) but with the subway so close and so many things within walking distance this was not a problem.The room: While small by most cities' standards, this room is about average for NYC hotels. The room was immaculately clean. There is no luggage rack, and the "closet" is so tiny (includes a safe, ironing board and iron) that the suitcases must sit on the limited floor space or on one of the pull out hassocks. There is just a little over three feet from the end of the bed to the dresser/TV stand/coffee bar combo so that may be a problem for larger individuals. There is a desk and chair, with 4 outlets and 4 USB ports. There are also outlets and USB ports on each bedside shelf so plenty of places to plug in all of those electronics we all carry these days. WiFi was complimentary with my HHonors membership, as was a bottle of water. Temperature control was accomplished by a panel on the wall. There was a smoke detector, and lighting was average. We did appreciate the black out curtains on the windows. The bathroom: was also immaculately clean. Amenities included hand and bath soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and a hair dryer. There was no tub, just a small shower stall which was fine with us. There were nice hand and bath towels, but only one wash cloth, an oversight I am sure as they knew the room was reserved for two.Breakfast was included in our rate. The breakfast room is neat and clean. In addition to the usual suspects (juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, pastries, toast, yogurt) there is a hot choice (this morning it was scrambled eggs and bacon) as well as a waffle maker for make-your-own waffles which were actually quite good. Bananas, apples, and cut up pineapple, oranges and grapefruit were also offered. In all a very nice breakfast in a pleasant setting. We felt safe walking to and from the theater in the evening, as well as exploring the area during the day (of course taking the usual sensible precautions). Staff are pleasant and polite. We will definitely consider staying here again the next time we are in the City for either business or pleasure.

Excellent Service and perfect location. Staff friendly and helpful. Subway Connections very close. Breakfast staff excellent and varied choices of food selection. Coffee and Tea available all day. Fresh apples available throughout the day. Will definitely stay at this location again........

Don't do it. Save yourself the hassle. If you like to have your bill incorrectly presented (not in your favor) and would like to spend a lot of time trying to fix it, you will love staying here. Even people from corporate customer service were apologizing. My billing error still has not been fixed. Bleibe hier auf keinen Fall! Was die Mitarbeitern falsch machen koennen, wird falsch gemacht. Die so genannte HHmapton Guarantee ist ein Witz.

Very close to everything and anything you arent close to can be reached from port authority bus station a 2 min walk from hotel.We stayed in room 1706, very big comfy bed and lots of room for cases and shopping. Staff lovely and friendly, very welcoming.Very clean and well maintained.Well worth every penny. Breakfast was great, very varied and lots of it available.

I was hesitant about staying at this Hampton Inn after reading comments that the rooms were small, not enough drawer space, street noise, etc. My experience was the opposite. This is a fairly new hotel. The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. My room was on the 23rd floor (I asked for a high floor) with a partial view of Times Square and the city skyline. The only street noise was an occasional horn. This isn't the Ritz, it's a Hampton Inn so the rooms aren't spacious. The size of the room is adequate for 1 or 2 people. There are 3 large, long drawers and 1 small drawer in each of the end tables. The armoire has space enough for a few days for 2 people to a week's worth of clothes for 1 person if you pack light. There's an in-room safe at the bottom of the armoire. You have to bend down to use it, which is not good for someone with knee problems. The bathroom isn't roomy but it's adequate for the room. There's not a lot of counter space. It has a large mirror, lighting around the mirror for applying makeup and a night light. There's plenty of lighting in the room. The desk has 3 outlets and 2 USB ports. There are charging ports on either side of the bed. Unfortunately, there's no radio in the room. The TV remote is VERY SLOW. I had them change the batteries but it didn't help. There's no station ID on the screen so there's no way to tell which channel you're on if you land on a commercial. Only cold air came out of the heater even when set on heat so I had to turn it off. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate are available all day in the lobby and delicious cookies in the afternoon and evening. I went down to the breakfast room at around 7:15 and avoided the crowd that starts around 8:00. I would give this hotel 3.5 stars if that rating was available because of the in-room issues; I will give it a 4 but leaning toward 3.5.

Stayed here three prior times due to close proximity to Javits Center. The elevator issue can be a slight pain since they use the passenger elevators for housekeeping. You need to try to time your usage. Breakfast time can be bad. Refurbed the rooms and the new lighting is a bit dim in the bathrooms. Also, why are there still analog tv stations on the darn tv. WIFI in room is a bit clunky and slow.

My family spent 2 nights at the hotel and we love to stay here. Though the room is small, but clean and cozy with 2 double beds which is very convenient for 4 persons. Breakfast is good, tea,coffee and hot chocolate is served for the whole day. The hotel is close to Times square, if you want to enjoy street food of different styles, just walk for few minutes. Good hotel and highly recommended.

This hotel has a great location and price. The rooms were up to date but the walls were pretty thin. We could hear a lot from hallway and elevator shaft. The rooms are small but if you're barely in there what does it matter! A lot of food choices in the area and in walking distance. Parking with the hotel is $55...you can park on the street but be careful because they clean the streets at night and you have to make sure you are on the right side of the street. One other thing about the room. We woke up to a lot of ants in the room. Overall great weekend!

We were very happy at this time, beautiful days learning about the city of New York. Sad to have only three days , hope we pass more time in New York next time. The weather was good so. Next time we wilñl be going a theaters and museums because we didn{t have much time and we really wanted to visit most of these places.

Always a good nights sleep at the Hampton Inn. The staff was super nice and great with directions and restaurant recomendations. They always have a good hot breakfast that is well stocked. The coffee was surprisingly good and the hot chocolate was loved by my two kids. We had a chance to meet the maid staff and they were extremely friendly. We were happy to have our beds made for us every day when we returned to the room and having clean towels was the best for my two girls that like to shower all the time.

Hotel was a little small but comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was just ok. The hot water for tea or hot chocolate was not hot. The oatmeal was not hot. The eggs and french toast were just warm, but that's expected at at a buffet. Hotel was in good location/walking distance for Times Square, Empire State Building, Intrepid and Madison Square Garden. I recommend leaving the air conditioning on while sleeping because of the noise from the elevator and ice machine.

This hotel was in such a great location Times Square just blocks away. Central Park walk there a great walk so much to see while walking we were there for two days and the only time we took cab was to go to battery park great time

This is a nice hotel in a great location. Close to all of the theaters, Times Square, Central Park, Madison Square Garden, Hell's Kitchen and public transportation. Very nice staff. Room we had was very clean, well furnished and a really good size for a building that is very small overall. BTW - This hotel is one of a three building combo built in the space of one, so the layout is very narrow with not much public space. The complimentary breakfast was about the same as most other competitors in this price range, which consisted of a good selection of items in mediocre quality.The only downside about this hotel is that there are only 2 elevators for a building that has 36+ floors, so plan ahead for anything you have scheduled or for checking out on-time. Also; There was a bit of a wining sound that we heard during the day, so don't plan on getting any sleep if you want to take a "disco nap" or want to realign your sleeping pattern for international travel during the daytime hours. In addition, we had to wait over an hour after check-in for our room, because it was still not ready at check-in time even though we booked a specific room on-line in advance.If we could score a good rate for a room here, we would stay for the next trip to NYC, but will be consider looking elsewhere first.

We had a great time, location was great for all of the things that we were planning on seeing and close to work related items too. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but laid out very well. Would suggest and stay at again!!

The hotel is nice, well located, the staff was attentive and took care of any requests quickly. The free breakfast is nice. The big issue I had is that the kitchen staff goes every morning at 5:30 am to the ice machine on the 4th floor to get a large amount of ice for breakfast. It is so loud that no matter what you do they will wake you up. Hotel manager/supervisor - get an ice machine in the kitchen, please! You are going to lose customers due to the noise level. Please be considerate. I am sure your staff gets a lot of complaints from customers. I think it is worth the cost of at least moving the ice machine! If this is not resolved I would not consider going back to this hotel and risk not sleeping well.

Will definitely use again. Booked a room quickly and not too expensive in a very popular location (Manhattan, Times Square) at last minute. Again, wasn't prepared to stay in city but reservation desk, room attendants and staff in dinning area made the emergency stay very comfortable and took the fear and anxiety out of the entire trip. Again, will use again and refer to others

Not far from time square yet not in the middle of all of it. Small rooms but clean. Good breakfast. Breakfast staff very nice and helpful. Concierge did not go out of his way to give us information but did provide us with maps.

Loved the pre check in - room was ready early - great price value for quality of room and great location. Stayed high enough to get a quiet nights sleep...17th...close to theatre district. Expected small room but was bigger than expected.

My husband and I traveled to NYC April 15th for his 62nd birthday. We'd never stayed at this location before and was glad that we finally did. The excitement of being so close to 42nd St just added to our enjoyment. Scipio, breakfast hostess, really topped off our stay. He personally prepared a waffle for my husband(my husband's favorite breakfast).I also observed how attentive he was to restocking the items on the breakfast bar.

I would stay at this hotel again. My daughter and I stayed here for two days while visiting NYU. The room was very clean and nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was a little bit small but efficient, updated, and clean. The room was updated and nice. The thermostat and heat/air worked extremely well! The complimentary breakfast was very convenient and had a fine selection of cold and warm offerings. We were surprised by the tiny hallways, though we shouldn't have been--it's NYC! Also there is a wait of the elevator, but not horrible--maybe 4-5 mins. The location is great during the day. The short walk on 39th from 8th is a little bit dark and not overly populated at night. It's safe, but it's not the same as being in a busy street. During the day it was busier and we were completely comfortable walking to and from the subway which was a 5 min walk-- very close . The room was bigger than I'd expected. The staff was very, very freindly. I would stay there again.

This Hotel has excellent location. Everything is within the walking distance.We were there for 5 days and took the subway only twice because my wife got tired as we are Seniors. Plus we wanted to experience it.The complimentary breakfast is wholesome and good. The team serving in the small cafeteria is good and very helpful.The staff at the front desk Ms Lissette, who checked us in, is very pleasant and helpful. Wellington, the bell hop is another good fellow and with Ms Lissette they both are makes valuable members of the Hilton team.We really had a very comfortable stay. Thank you Team Hilton.However, our experience with the coach to the Airport, was not good at all. I think is best avoided. When we booked a trip for 2pm on 19Apr16, we specially requested that we need to be dropped at Hikton JFK as we are joining a Tour from there. We were told that while boarding we should let the driver know about it.However when the coach came, 1) he was parked far away from the Hotel and me and my wife had to drag our luggage to the coach which we didn't appreciate and 2) the Driver dropped us at the Aiport and drove off. Later we figured that the Hilton coach does not come at that spot. After some trouble we found out that we need to take the Airtrain and go to a spot from where the Hotel coach picked up. As Seniors we were put to a lot of hardship. I am extremely disappointed with the coach service. Would never recommend this to anybody. It is better to pay an extra dollar and take a cab. Hope Hilton Team does something about it.

I needed to be in Midtown West for business, needed an affordable room, and especially needed to be near the Lincoln Tunnel for a quick getaway the next morning. This hotel met all three needs completely.

I was looking for something between Times Square and the Javits Convention Center, and this location was perfect. Although the hotel rooms are not very spacious, they are very clean and it good condition. For the price, this was a good value. The staff were all friendly and anxious to help. Love the continental breakfast!

This hotel is in a great location, centrally located for our plans. Very close to the action of Times Square and equally close the neighborhood of Hell's Kitchen. Room were of moderate size, clean and well apportioned. Breakfast is good as Hampton Inn seems to always be. There staff is very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here recently for two nights to see Broadway shows, Jazz at Lincoln Center, and tour the 9.11 Memorial and Museum. We were able to walk to all shows, TKTS booth in Times Square, jump on the subway to see the 9.11 museum and enjoy some great meals nearby thanks to the advice of the concierge. Our room was very comfortable and quiet on the 12th floor. Free breakfast was a plus. Hotel staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

This was my second time staying at this property. Pricing is reasonable for NYC and the location is handy to Port Authority and Times/42 subway stops. Of course, it's also easy to walk everywhere if your feet are up for it. The rooms are small (but that's expected for the city in my opinion) but clean and adequate. During my stay, the breakfast area was being renovated but we were provided with vouchers to Tir Na Nog up the street which provided a hearty buffet. I'm a loyal HHonors member and this hotel meets my expectations of the brand. I'd stay here again.

The hotel was excellent small but clean very good value. Renovated room very cozy and the breakfast and staff excellent. They have coffee and snacks at the lobby 24 hours a day. Very nice, the hotel is at the heart of Times Square walking distance from all the NYC main attractions.

The room was small but it was doable! Breakfast and Internet was complimentary. Bathroom was well stocked with amenities and everything was spotless and clean. The sound proofing of this hotel was horrible. We could hear the room next door talking in the hallway at midnight. For breakfast the next morning we had to go to a restaurant a few doors down since the breakfast area was being worked on. Front desk was great at checked out but she looked a little overwhelmed! I would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone. Real convenient location and just minutes away from Times Square.

Was in town for work chose to stay here due to a great experience last time. Check-in was great and easy. Room was clean no couch, no stuffed chair, no coffee table, but it did have a bed and one that provided a restful night’s sleep. Plenty of plugs for business travelers, good Wi-Fi. Standard amenities. Great location with restaurants within walking distance is a plus. Currently the breakfast area is being renovated and breakfast is being served at the Irish pub down the street. My only complaint is that during the renovation the breakfast is not served until 7:30am, this is a little bit late for a business traveler.

Going by NY hotel prices, this hotel is considered to be cheap. It comes with free hot and cold breakfast. Rare for NY hotels. Location is great, 8 mins walk to crazy, buzzing Times Square. Subways nearby, lots of restaurants around. There is a parking garage right across the hotel but it is cheaper to park further away if you won't be needing the car for the duration of the stay in NYC. Use subway, it will save time and parking fees. Hotel pros: Fast check-in and out. Breakfast nook is very convenient to grab an apple, banana or coffee if you are in a hurry. Room is small, clean and comfortable. Bathroom is very clean and water pressure is good. I stayed on the 28th floor. Room is well insulated, couldn't hear noises from the corridor or next room. Tiny closet, good for 6 hangers. Mini Neutrogena toiletries, not enough for more than 2 persons daily. No construction going on. Overall, I will stay again. Good, decent hotal.

The shower is so small I had to stand sideways to the shower head. This should have been disclosed on the website. There was a shrieking in the water pipes at 6 am. The complementary breakfast was served at an off-site location.

There appeared to be some maintenance going on at night lots of banging and drilling sounds. During the day only one elevator was in use because the other was being used to carry construction materials. That elevator appeared to be down the entire day. This should not be the case during time that during breakfast hours. It took 20 minutes to get an elevator down. 20 minutes to get an elevator up. Elevator stopped on every floor and every floor had people waiting. We were on the 30th floor and I was not walking the steps. Upon check out we had the valet hold our bags. When we came back to get them he was gone forever, apparently waiting on the elevator and he ended up carrying our 5 bags up the stairs. The kitchen area was under construction and we had to walk down the street to get breakfast. All of this should have been taken into consideration when the price of the room was posted for these dates. Definitely one of my worst experiences with a hotel stay.

My family of 4 stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It exceeded my expectations! Close to Port Authority, subway, Times Square, and dining. The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable and the staff was fabulous! If you are looking for a great hotel at a great price, don't pass this one up.

I really enjoyed my stay at Hampton Inn. The hotel is located in a very good location near Bolt bus, Mega bus and train. It's near anything you want. Part of the hotel is newly decorated. The price of your stay included a free breakfast.

If you're looking for a nice hotel with basic accomodations close to time square, then this hotel is for you. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles but being close to Time Square and the Port Authority I don't see a need for it.

This has a small lobby but the crew made up for any down side. Outstanding service and a tremendous breakfast buffet. Within walking distance of Penn Station & Times Square. Only has 6 rooms per floor, so the footprint is rather small. We were on the 20th floor and the room was recently redecorated.

Hotel staff was extremely helpful. The hotel was under construction which caused a few minor inconveniences relative to complimentary breakfast, otherwise a very pleasant stay. Room was very clean and hotel was located close to popular attractions.

The hotel has a small reception which isn't an issue. It is located one block from the metro which is very convenient especially if using the metro to get to JFK. The room was smaller than other Hampton Inns in NYC. There is construction but most of the noise is during the day. The breakfast room was closed but we had coupons to use in a restaurant next door which probably worked out for the best as the hotel breakfast room looked small.The room was clean and beds comfortable. I had to request a hair dryer which came quick. The lifts do take a long time as there are only two. During rush hour expect a wait of fifteen minutes assuming you can even board it. Great location in summary. However I preferred their property at Times Square North. Larger rooms and even better location.

I can't say enough about the staff at the Hampton by Hilton on 39th street. Friendly, authentic, caring, and helpful, they really made us feel welcome. The room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. We had a great view of the Empire State Building, too! Definitely recommend!

Overall, we were quite pleased with this hotel. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The front desk staff was always smiling and the valet was very helpful upon arrival making sure we had a place to park and unload. We expected the room to be small, which it was, but it was clean and worked just fine for our family of 4. With only 6 rooms to a floor, there is no getting away from the elevator and you can hear it humming away all day long. The location was good as we were able to walk to most of our destinations

My teenage daughter and I were looking for a spot near Times Square to stay overnight during a school break. This location was ideal, just a few blocks of Times Square and right in the Garment District. The room had just recently been renovated and was beautiful - nice bathroom, modern furnishings. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I had asked before we arrived if they could store our bag since we were arriving early morning. When we got there, they actually had a room ready and so we were able to check in to the room hours before the formal check in time. This was so helpful since we ended our day pretty late in the evening. On check out day they also held our bag until we returned late afternoon to get it before heading out. Would definitely stay here again - clean, friendly, ideal location!

Pauline at the front desk was the only good thing that happened in my experience. I ended up going to the Hilton Garden Inn due to the manager NOT having a good customer service attitude! We asked for a roll out bed for our child. It was on our reservation. The manager told me to go to KMart and buy a air mattress! Very unprofessional. I will never go back to this hotel or recommend it.

The staff, internet speed, location, breakfast are excellent. The included breakfast was a great start to the day. 3 minutes walk to Times Square and within 6-7 minutes of most theatres. High quality bedding and towels. One of the top hotels we have stayed at in NYC.

Small rooms for three or four people. No room for storage of items if stay is more that a few days. Easy walk to Times Square and all attractions of New York City. Clean, nice shower without tub which we preferred. Very good breakfast.

The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and accomodating even in uncomfortable situations. The breakfast was adequate except there wasn't any meat. Everyone was friendly from the front desk to maintenance..I would have liked a larger bathroom but for the time that we stayed, it was survivable. I would stay again

really good location within walking distance of times square felt safe walking back at night with a 13 year old.hotel nice and clean however rooms were very small but we didnt have time to let that bother us in new york we wanted to see everything not the hotel room and only 2 lifts which were very busy in a morning.breakfast was very good loads of food my husband loved the waffle making machine.free tea coffee an hot choc all day so we popped back on our way up town which was nice.staff helpful and friendly.cant wait to visit again and just recomended to friends.

I have been coming to this hotel 4 times per year since it opened about 6 or so years ago. The location is excellent, not in the middle of the noisy Broadway rush. Staff greets us by name. Good to see the same people working there. Says good things about the company.

The hotel was clean, comfy and a good price. Close to Times Sq, however away from the noise. The breakfast was adequate-standard Hamptom fare, but fresh and plentiful (I would have liked a big NY bagel).

We were lucky to get a newly renovated rooms,hardly in room to move. The new bedding and pellow the worse I ever seen in any Hilton property hotel. I woke up with bad backech and stiff neck from the pellows.Renovation Company could've done better job on there finishes, the never caulk around wall paper and tiles, they did not use stanlesssteel on shower doors. they did not install shower stall correctly water stay away from drain . Clean room .Amazing staff, front desk, Housekeeping, bell staff all great and friendly .

One of the nicest chain hotels in the area. a bit pricey but still cheaper than some others for what you get. The rooms are VERY small but MOST hotel rooms are in NYC. Very clean. no view but again, most of them right in this area don't. Breakfast was one of the best Hampton Inn BF's we've had. They were very accommodating to our group. held our luggage on our last day and put my Aunt's insulin in their fridge while we explored for a bit. Then they got us 2 taxis for our large group to get back to the train. Very nice. Would love to stay here again.

You get all the standard Hampton Inn expected perks. Good, free breakfast and pleasant customer service. Rooms are recently updated and clean, though on the small side. If you are looking to do a Broadway experience, it isn't the best location. 20+ min walk to most theatres. Limited on-street space for drop-off, check-in process. Valet parking available at an expected price but takes a little time.

Expensive to stay in NY so its hard to rate value. Complimentary Wifi, breakfast, and toiletries were nice to have. Need more elevators. Overall, a pleasant stay with parking across the street and a decent pub down the block.

This hotel was clean, comfortable and located right near Times Square. The breakfast was wonderful and we loved that the coffee, hot chocolate and tea was available all day. The staff was accomodating with answers to our questions, directions and parking the car. I highly recommend this hotel. I chose it because is was quite reasonable for the city, it did not disappoint.

The hotel is currently undergoing renovations. My room was already renovated and smelled like paint. When I checked in late in the evening, there was a moving truck outside of the hotel, and the elevators were being used by movers and construction workers. Judging from the noises in the hallway outside of my room, it seems they were moving furniture until midnight. Once the renovations are done this hotel could be a good value for the neighborhood, assuming there aren't any more noise issues.

This hotel should not be connected with the HILTON name. it is the worst. After waiting until after the scheduled check in time, we walked up a nasty staircase to our room as the elevator was not working. When we opened the door we were treated to a terrible odor, a tiny room with a tiny bathroom and a view of a staircase through a small window. We left our bags in the room and did not dare to touch a thing, called the Hilton Diamond honors desk, and eventually were moved to the Hilton time square which was great. The nasty desk manager charged us $100 for storing our bags while we made the switch (about an hour). We never used the room.

The title is negative but the overall experience was fine. And the location really is great--schlepping distance from Penn Sta, Megabus drop off and Megabus pick up. There is a Schwartzes luggage storage place two blocks away on W 37th. The 8th Ave line is right there with stops within a few blocks both north and south. And we actually walked the High Line all the way from the Whitney Museum of American Art to W 30th and then to the hotel. There are also many excellent eateries within a short walk as well as Times Square and the theaters. So that part is terrific.The building itself is old and tired. It is vertical (25 floors_ but only has 6 bedrooms on each floor. The icemaker was near 1003 and both worked poorly and chugged loudly. This mean people getting ice in the middle of the night had to keep whacking on the handle. Woke us up a couple of times. The walls are thin and any conversation in the halls is fully audible in the rooms. In our room anyway. Finally the hallways by the elevators are EXTREMELY narrow. People waiting for elevators have no where to stand really--and it gets to be a huge problem around breakfast because the elevators are in the passageway between the lobby and the breakfast room. The fact that several floors are being refurbished exacerbated the problem because the workmen tended to commandeer one elevator.Speaking of breakfast. Now I find the free breakfast a big draw, and clearly so do lots of others. It was a MADHOUSE by 8:00. The breakfast area has nowhere enough seats/tables for the hotel capacity. The buffet/food tables are just a traffic jam of people trying to cook waffles, make toast, and dish out oatmeal.But I think a lot of this comes with the territory: NYC. The rooms are decent and decently clean. Not large but adequate if borderline tiny. The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. The cost is modest, particularly for the City. And, again, the location is perfect. For us.

Call and ask if construction is still going on during your visit. If so avoid it like the plague!!! This hotel is tall and narrow (there are only about 7 or 8 rooms per floor) so obviously elevators are super important. Especially in the morning during breakfast and checkout. That is obvious to everyone but management. They allow construction to hold one elevator during 9am-1pm. The busiest time of the day!!! You'll never get breakfast and it will take 30 mins to get an elevator. If you're lucky. The day of our checkout it took 20 mins and we were in the top floor. We stopped at every other floor on the way down where others with luggage were trying to go downstairs. From floor 28 to the bottom, NO ONE could get on the elevator. I felt so bad every time the doors would open and they'd see a full elevator. No telling how much time these people wasted trying to get an elevator. That's not how anyone wants to spend their time in NYC!

we were visiting NYC all the way from South Miami. and I must say that this hotel was a great experience!! The staff was courteous and kind (especially Nicole at the front desk). Even though there was construction going on at the time of the visit, we were not affected by it all. Everything ran really smooth. It was pleasant and great! The staff was also wonderful. We really enjoyed our stay.

Arrived early and checked in but the room wasn't ready so the staff held our bags for us until late night. They do hand you a ticket for holding your bags so make sure you don't lose that. Checkout- we checked out early but the staff was kind enough to hold our bags again until late afternoon. Breakfast: cereal, waffles, fruit, omelette Rooms: NYC style space Curtains: don't close all the way so people can see in Construction: They are doing construction (hammering and drilling) so it was a bit noisy around 2 am. Which stopped the second night. Train station: 5 blocks from Penn stationStaff was helpful and awesome! Everything was super great the only thing we didn't like was the construction.

Just below Times Square. Close to everything but not crazy loud and chaotic like staying in Times Square. Hotel is being renovated, no noise, clean, modern. Be aware that 1 elevator is down for this update to the property. Plan for a longer than normal wait during this process. Would stay again!

Only after I switched hotels had ai wished we stayed. In a quiet (relative) location, comp coffee available 24/7 helpful staff, continental breakfast, and prox to the convention center was very helpful. We switched rooms one last night thinking we would save money because we found a cheaper rate, but they had some hidden fees and no breakfast so we should have just stayed.

The location of this hotel is great. Free breakfast and free wifi is also a positive. The rooms are very small as there was 4 of us but we got what we paid for. Paula on Reception was extremely helpful and very friendly. We had some MAC make up which we just purchased stolen from our room which was a bit of a downer for us but sadly the hotel has not resolved it for us. The maid changed her story twice!!! The managment were unhelpful. Because of this i would not stay at this hotel again.

This hotel is in a great location for the theater district and Times Square. They offer a free breakfast which is helpful. The rooms are small but to be expected in NY. They are renovating so there is dust and construction people around at all times. We had a few issues with this but nothing that took away from our trip. We were hardly ever in our room.

My family and I were only here for one night so there's not much we did at the hotel but what I have witnessed is this. The staff was very helpful at all times as it was never non stop busy. Kudos to the front desk staff they were always very polite and helpful! They remembered me when I forgot my room key in my room! I'm very attentive to detail and am big on customer service! The valet parking was a big annoying but being in the city it was expected but $55. That's a bit much. The hotel was small and the rooms were super small to really fit about two people in the King suite. No fridge or micro. And I wanted more than a stand up shower as it had no tub. Be aware of prices at restaurants I would never recommend sombreros, that was just horrible!

Fantastic location close to subway and transit routes...near Times Square and restaurants... We had good service from transport and front end staff. Eating area was busy and clean with good service and food.Vince at front desk was helpful and went over and above dealing with my lost coat as we lost coat on boat tour (ended up getting my coat back!)Saw Mets and Rangers at Citi Field and MSG *(though only pre-season)Loved the Big Apple.

Being a Hilton HHonors member and commuting into the city to work, there are times where I must find overnight accommodations. With the many different Hilton brand options in NYC, I chose this one to give a try (due to its close proximity to Port Authority and Subway). Although it's under construction (floors 8 - 15), I barely noticed since I had a warm and friendly greeting upon checking in. The agent even gave me notice that before I leave my room to dial down so they can send up the elevator to avoid a long wait......what great hospitality! The room was excellent! Cozy and comfortable bed which made me feel as if I was on cloud 9. Excellent amenities inside the room as well. Although not a view hotel, it was the least of my concerns. If you want view, go to top of the rock or one world observatory. The location is spot on! I had to run out in the early morning (missing that signature Hampton Breakfast) but will return again! Thank you all for a pleasant stay and I look forward to seeing your new renovated rooms upon completion!

The hotel is being renovated. Several floors were off limits because of the construction effort. No problems were experienced on our floor or in the rest of the hotel as a result of the construction. The rooms were clean and quiet as we expect from a Hilton hotel. The staff were typically friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Location is great. We would be pleased to stay at this Hampton Inn again.

This hotel is located within walking distance to Times Square! Friendly staff, clean rooms, and complimentary hot breakfast. They are doing construction right now...they have two elevators and they are very slow while construction is going on.

Although the hotel was undergoing renovations, the staff and contractors went out of their way to please us. They have 2 small elevators to service a 32 floor hotel. However, the wait was not too bad. The included breakfasts were different each day of my 2-day stay. The business center had 2 PCs and a printer which helped. It was a good location as far as access from Penn Station and the theater district. I would recommend this hotel to all.

This hotel location was FANTASTIC! I enjoyed how close we were to everything! The staff was very, very helpful and nice. We're from Tennessee so we got lost easily and had lots of questions, they were very accommodating! Our room was tiny BUT the view made up for the lack of space for sure! A couple things that could definitely be improved- 1. The elevators were a real issue! They're doing remodels and the workers are using them as well as the guests... It was hectic to say the least. We stayed on floor 32 and getting down was a nightmare. We walked the 32 flights a couple of times after waiting 15-20 minutes for the elevator. 2. Every morning there was staff of some sort on our floor who woke us up from the hall way. We were out late each night so it wasn't very pleasant to be so abruptly woken every morning :( but overall our experience was nice! And we will stay here again-- it will just be AFTER construction is over!

While hotel is currently under renovation, the room we had was completed and everything worked fine. The construction crews seemed to use all reasonable care not to inconvenience the customers. The staff were cordial and most attentive to our needs at all times. The only possible criticism I might make is that the TV guide did not match the actual channels but this is minor since we were not in town to watch TV. I would certainly recommend this Hampton Inn and will stay there again when the need arises.

Our most recent stay at the Hilton Inn, 337 W. 42nd Street we were a assigned a newly redecorated room (3103) which upon our review and a conversation with Cesar a hotel manager prior to check out. He was very apologetic and took notes along with giving us a small token ($ 10.00 Amazon gift card) for the inconvenient. Listed below are recommendations: Bathroom • No lighting around and/or above the mirror over sink • No electric outlets for the supplied hair dryer and or electric shaver • No full length mirror for dressing Guest room • Extremely small closet (6-hangers) • No luggage rack • No work station chair • Electrical wall sockets not operational • Bed side tables very small with a large based light including plugs that most computer or cell phone plugs that will not fit. • Refrigerator not install in cabinet Also, the microwave oven in the lobby was quote (broken) we had to request the use of the neighboring hotel’s microwave oven! Please note this to appear to be an ongoing issue. One very positive issue is the front desk receptionist named Nicole, this young lady is corporate material! I personally witnessed her deescalate issues with guests, having and maintained a very positive attitude along with go well beyond the norm. Nicole should be recommended and certainly be afforded any opportunity of advancement. Please note, that I’m not asking for any compensation, I only recommend the issues be addressed to prevent other guests from being inconvenience and that the remaining rooms being redecorated should be reviewed. Also, I would recommend a lower floor as the wait for the elevators can be lenghty due to the construction. Great lcoation to both Times Square and the convention center.

The hotel its self would have been lovely if not a bit small were it not for the construction that was taking place on almost every floor and going the entire duration of our trip. The construction staff was rude and pushy and in a rush. The elevators literally stopped on every floor regardless of if you were going up or down and the hotel staff ignored all comments made by patrons.

As a Hilton Diamond member, I have stayed at numerous Hampton Inns across the country. I've never experienced the poor service that I did here. I booked this hotel without being aware of the ongoing renovations. That being said, I have stayed at many other hotels undergoing renovations without the poor service I experienced here. There are only two elevators in this hotel, and my room was on the 29th floor. Upon my arrival on Friday afternoon, one elevator was dedicated solely to the contractors moving out old mirrors and furniture. Since only one elevator remained for guests of the hotel, you would think that the contractors and staff would try to steer clear. Not the case. The contractors (with strong body odor after a day of moving) pushed ahead of guests to get on the elevator. Their conversations (in mixed Spanish and English) were vulgar and consisted mostly of their evening plans. When the details became too tawdry, they switched to Spanish. They would also use the one passenger elevator to go up or down one floor instead of taking the stairs. I was hopeful that the weekend would be better as the contractors would be gone. Unfortunately, the staff of the Hampton Inn were not much better. We would often wait 5-7 minutes for an elevator, and the staff would push in front of us. They made us uncomfortable every time we had to wait or ride the elevator. All of their conversations (which were clearly personal) were held in Spanish. It gave the distinct impression that they were talking about the other guests on the elevator. I also find it impossible to believe that there was not another freight or service elevator for the staff. The room was acceptable despite being very small, even by Manhattan standards. I had to go to several floors (by taking the stairs of course as the elevator was tied up) to find an ice machine that worked. I understand the difficulties created by renovations; however, the staff are what made this stay miserable. Despite the location, I would not stay here again.

The hotel has a good location and is a good value, however the room was small. One expects small rooms in NYC but on a previous visit, in another Hilton property, the room was larger. Luckily, when in NYC one doesn't spend much time in the room.

This was a great hotel. Fairly new I believe. Great location, free hot breakfast in the morning and easy access to train and metro stops. Plus right off main street so easy cab/uber pickup. Nice rooms and beds.

This hotel was a secret find. A great price, near many restaurants, shops, transportation and Times Square. The hotel is currently being renovated but the staff was accommodating and very helpful. As with most NYC hotels, the rooms are small but my room was clean, well stocked and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was free and had a variety of choices. I will remember this property when I need to stay in this part of the city.

Room was nice for business trip, large bathroom for nyc. Clean, quick check-in, good breakfast and to-go bag if needed. Centrally located to times square and many restaurants. Easy to grab cab/car service from.

As a frequent traveler, both domestic and international, I stay in a lot of hotels. I tend to gravitate toward the Hilton brand to maintain high elite status. The main thing about brand loyalty is consistency, and the Hampton Inn on West 39th street is generally not consistent with other Hampton Inns (I have more than 100 nights in Hampton Inn properties over the past few years). Arrival experience was bad. Surly valet who was clearly annoyed at having to park my car. At the front desk, I was told the room I'd checked into via the app was not available because they "sold out the night before", so I was downgraded without a reduction in rate. Only one elevator was operating much of the time because of construction, and construction workers used it throughout the day so wait times were extensive. Small rooms, which is typical for hotels in this category. Breakfast was the usual Hampton Inn schlop. Lots of tourists and families. Ice machines not on every floor. Tons of food options nearby and easy access to transportation. It's a block from the Port Authority, so the neighborhood is a little seedy at night.

The rooms are so small at this hotel that it was impossible for two people to get ready in the morning! The bathroom was also tiny and there was no place to put anything. The breakfast room was so cold in the morning that my breakfast was cold before I sat down to eat it. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Great place to stay, convenient location, easy walk to Times Square, subway and other attractions. The staff was very friendly and personable. Rooms were small, but that is to be expected in Manhattan. Great value for the price of room. Included breakfast and 24/7 coffee and hot chocolate. Would definitely stay there again. Hotel was also kind to extend the check out time until 1pm.

Was lucky enough to stay on 32nd floor. Room was immaculate and view was stunning. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Room was too dry and heater was loud. Couldn't find the right temperature setting.

The hotel was easy to locate and only about a 5 minute speed walk to Times Square. The staff was extremely helpful. We requested a wine opener and the manager on duty went next door to their "sister" hotel to find us one since a guest had not previously returned theirs- How lovely! Very clean.

I have stayed at this hotel before and really loved it. Our stay this time was terrific. Although the hotel is undergoing renovations, we were never inconvenienced nor did we hear any noise. In fact, it is extremely quiet at this hotel. The room we had was a decent size by NY standards. The bathroom was spacious with a terrific shower. The bed was clean and comfortable. The hotel features complimentary breakfast--both hot and cold. That is a nice feature when you are in New York City. There is free Wi-Fi which was easy to access. This hotel is close to the theater district and the subway is right around the corner.

We stayed here for 6 days and it was a very convenient locations. We had one of the new rooms that was plenty large and very clean. The bathroom was re-done and it was a great shower with a really high shower head which is nice for tall people. Front desk staff was awesome! Breakfast was nice. Location was nice. The things that were a bit annoying:ELEVATORS, as they are doing construction and the elevators are held up often. My son walked down 32 flights of stairs after waiting for the elevator that never came! Lighting in the bathroom is poor and there is no mirror, but those are minor and will probably be fixed. Because the front desk staff is very accommodating, the price was great for New York and the new rooms are very comfortable, I would still highly recommend this location. I am Hilton Gold and will always stay in Hilton hotels.

Excellent quality / price ratio, very well located. In terms of services, there is absolutely nothing wrong, the breakfast is varied, unlimited coffee all day, very clean hotel and team working in a good atmosphere. It was a real pleasure talking with Judell and Nicole, real sunlight. We return to this hotel and recommend it to everyone. Joannick, room 2902

Good price for its location. Hotel room compact but clean, elevators tend to be slow at peak hours; great service from staff. Heater/ac unit a bit noisy; very acceptable Internet service and Hilton Honors benefit of unlimited number of devices for Internet access was great

Rooms are small. But location is great and free internet and breakfast is a great addition. I booked this hotel at a very reasonable price. I wanted to extend my stay by few days but price increased drastically. i am not sure why price was higher as hotel was not fully occupied. Also these hotels should provide complementary water bottles. overall it is a good place to stay.

booked this hotel based on location and price. Have to say that offered great value for money and good location for sightseeing. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel was in the process of being refurbished and our room on the 7th floor was obviously recently completed. Very nice facilities. The rooms offer free Wiifii and unusually there are coffee making facilities. There is a safe, ironing board, iron and hairdryer. The included breakfast was plentiful buffet style which was readily replenished by the staff. There was coffee available in the lobby area all day

Great location for the price of the hotel. We stayed in a newly renovated room on the 30th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. Rooms are very small, but we spent most of our time exploring the city. About a 15 minute walk to Times Square, and close to subway. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hot breakfast was a great addition--one less meal we had to go out and find. Will definitely stay here again.

The hotel was great and we enjoyed the breakfast selection. The hotel was well located to Times Square place to walk to and from. It is located in the garment district. The staff was helpful and arranged transportation to the airport.

I stood at this Hampton Last month with my sister, the week of the snow storm. Its a very short walk to Times Square. As soon as I checked in the front desk was very nice. Eian the bellman was so helpful through out my stay. The rooms were kinda small but I didn't feel it was a big deal. Nice View. The hotel only has 2 elevators and had construction going on during my stay, so the elevators were always occupied. That was a bit annoying. I did enjoy that there was coffee and hot chocolate available in the lobby 24hours. Breakfast was great they served 2 hot items, you could make your own waffle (which I took full advantage of) also had fruit and cereal. The associate Silhouette was so sweet (Love her name!) Besides the construction going on I would recommend this hotel. Good Location, Clean rooms, and Complimentary breakfast.

Reciptionist is just ok. she asked too many questions and most of them are in the file as diamond member. Hotwater run out wihtin 2 minutes morning and night Whinning noise from faucet in the 7am and last for ever until I left

I choose to stay at this particular location primarily due ot its location near Times Square and only a short walk to Penn Station. Every time I stay the staff is courteous and helpful and very attentive to my needs. I have never had an issue with any of my stays here an look forward to staying with them again in October for my next visit

Internet down, chaotic construction crew that guests had to accommodate in lobby, elevators, public areas. Staff is nice, and tried to help with Internet, but skip this place until renovations are done and Internet is reliable.

Rooms in NYC are typically smaller than in other parts of the country and so was the case with this one. However it was very nice, comfy and roomy enough. Staff was great and accommodating. Breakfast was very good as is customary staying at Hampton Inn. Great location to walk to anywhere in midtown Manhattan.

I am a Hilton cold member, this is very disappointing experience overall. The Hotel is very dirty under construction , the price doesn't reflect the inconvenience. The rooms are tiny and the air-condition not working. The carpets are old and smell bad. We were offered snack pack,as members ,never received it.Asked to talk to manager but was told she is out of hotel for the next 7 hours.... although it was during day time (9 am). worth experience ever.

Convenient location with extremely low rates (booked on Hilton website). There is some construction/renovation going on, which may account for the reduced rates. For Manhattan, the room size was average. The room was clean and beds comfortable. I never noticed or heard the construction so not a problem. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. I arrived early, and when the room was ready, they called me to let me know it was ready. Definitely will stay here again!

We stayed during the blizzard of 2016 and it was a fantastic experience. The staff was excellent, and handled the weather very well. It was a fun experience! Rooms are small, but that is to be expected in midtown Manhattan. We stay at a number of hotels through our travels to Manhattan, and this is by far the most convenient. Right by the main subway lines for easy accessibility.

The rooms (we had a room with 2 double beds), was very very small. Only one person at a time could walk between the bed & TV/Dresser console. Upon entering our room, we noticed what appeared to be either dried blood or dried ketchup on the night table. We also found items in the dresser that were left over from the previous room guest.
