On our way out to lunch, we informed the front desk about the dirty condition of the room and they assured us that they would take care of it. However, when we returned back to the room the blood/ketchup stain we still present. We finally went out and bought our own cleaning liquids and cleaned it up on our own.On our 2nd night, the toilet malfunctioned (overflowed -- not due to any excess solid waste on our part if you know what I mean!) The toilet would not stop running and water quickly filled the bathroom and part of the common living area. We informed the front desk and finally after several minutes a maintenance person arrive and turned off the water. He informed us not to use the toilet as it was broken, he also did not offer to clean up the water on the floor but instead told us he would inform housekeeping to come to clean up the water, Again, after several minutes, someone from housecleaning came to provide us with extra towels -- for us to clean up the mess! When we insisted that he or someone from the hotel needs to clean it, he finally called his supervisor who came and cleaned up the water with towels and a small mop. We requested that they use some type of disinfectant on the floor he claimed he did not have any available. We again went out and had to purchase our own disinfectant.Since we were told to not use the toilet, we requested a new room, but were informed that the hotel was completely full and there were no other rooms available. We were finally able to convince them to get the maintenance staff to repair the broken toilet....which they did.The hotel manger, was sympathetic and helpful, but we were very disappointed in this hotel. We checked out the next morning and moved to a different hotel.Location is fine. Free Breakfast was fine.

Business trip to NYC, staff was not helpful and neglected to inform me when packages and deliveries arrived. Be prepared to consistently wait for elevators. The highlight of the stay there as a cockroach in the bathroom room 1903.

Me and my partner stayed here for 4 nights in December and it was ideal. The staff were very helpful, the rooms, although on the small side are clean and the beds were wonderfully comfy! The breakfast is basic but good enough to get you started before a busy day. Location wise it's great, we don't mind walking and would choose to do this over using public transport but even so, it's still only about a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and Central Park is about a 15-20 minute walk. All in all this hotel is great and personally everything we needed for our stay - would recommend this to anyone who wants to spend most their time exploring NYC but come back to a comfy bed! We'd stay again.

The hotel was a pleasant surprise given the fact that some reviews where not so complimentary. I found the staff very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. My room was a good size and clean and the complimentary breakfast was a bonus

The location is why I picked this property. It is walking distance to the Javits Center. The hotel staff is very unprofessional and unhelpful. I am a Diamond Member and expect more from Hilton than the service I received at the Time Square South location. The hotel is being remodeled and it needs it. The pipes upstairs we so loud they woke me up two mornings in a row.

The hotel was a great base to get around the city, very close to the centre of Times Square, close walking distance to the subway. Great places to eat around the hotel and friendly staff always on hand to help out with any questions or recommendations. We walked from the hotel to the Empire State Building and rocks fellas, we also walked to Central Park from here although this was a bit further. Rooms always nice and clean and even though the hotel is under renovation it did not affect our stay. Breakfast good and unlimited tea, coffee and hot chocolate is great to warm you up from the cold! As it is near Times Square you do get a bit of noise but nothing that bothered us after a long day sightseeing would defiantly go back

A great location for my first trip to NYC. Staff is attentive and friendly.The walls are very thin. There are also only two elevators and the building is over 30 stories. During busy times you may be waiting 10 mins for an elevator. Also there is no separate staff elevator so it may be a tight fit if you are riding when a housekeeper comes in. Also during my stay the hotel was undergoing renovations. I wasn't informed of this at time of booking but front desk advised me during check in and assured me that they would make my stay very comfortable so if I had any issues with the noise to let them know. Rooms are very clean and comfortable.

Not a five-star hotel by any means, but to be able to say you stayed at a Hampton in the heart of NYC and paid barely $100 after taxes is incredible. Staff was overwhelmingly pleasant. Hotel lobby was undergoing a facelift and is very crowded from entrance to elevator to dining area. The room... is just a room, nothing extravagent. But I knew what I was getting when I booked it, so in that regard I was very pleased with what I got (especially the location) for what I paid. Highly recommend for the budget traveler.

Hampton Inn Times Sq. South is under renovations and about 5 blocks from Times Sq. The rooms are very clean, they have a free continental breakfast and work out room. They do not have good views of NYC so not worth paying extra for that type of room. On line checkin 24 hours ahead was great, you knew what room you were assigned.

Went with my family to NYC recently in December. We go there a few times a year so we know the ropes, however it was perfect being at this location. Just a few blocks away in any direction was everywhere we intended to go. Not only that, but the complimentary coffee was amazing! On the cold winter day it was nice to have something to keep us warm. Definitely will be staying here again, no doubt!

We were met with a friendly smile and kindness. Our room was neat, clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. It was our second stay at the location and we will return. It's convenient to the Javit Center which is a huge plus for us.

hotel staff where pleasant and helpfull. only down side was breakfast was included but you had a long time queing for food .also as it was self service you had paper plates and plastic knives and forks and paper cups .

It's a good thing to have a renovation. The hotel needs it, and I am glad they are undertaking this project. Here's my complaint. I have stayed at this property several times. I like the hotel and the location. My objection was that I was never informed it was under renovation at the time of my booking. Nor was I told when I checked in. I was notified when I saw the notice posted on the elevator. It wasn't all bad. The people at the hotel are very friendly. The rooms are clean, and, as I said, the location is good.However, the first morning of my stay, I went down for the breakfast (opens at 6am). Doors did not open until 6:20am, the hot food was not ready until 6:35am........juice was empty. No coffee ready. In other words, they were not nearly ready. Not so bad, except I had to be at my convention at 7am, so cold breakfast, no coffee........I bought some at the Javitz Center. Second, only one elevator available to guests during the day. One time I had to wait 20 minutes for an elevator. Unacceptable.Like I said, the employees are great............not their fault at all. And, the room is nice and clean (although on day #2, I came back at 4pm and the room wasn't cleaned yet. I called, and they had someone up there shortly.So, kindly inform your guests about the renovation, and possible inconveniences, so that we can make an informed decision about whether to stay there or not.

Everything you would expect from Hampton, near Times Square. Very close to public transportation and the Port Authority bus terminal. Hotel staff was very helpful, friendly and the breakfast was excellent.

I booked this hotel as part of a package holiday to New York for my Fiancé's 30th Birthday.I was a little disappointed when we pulled up. It looked nicer in the pictures on the website to be honest. I was expecting something a little bit more special.The location of the hotel was very good we were very close to Times Square and other main tourist spots.The staff were friendly and helpful when checking in and out.The room was quite small but very clean. The breakfast was pleasant but nothing special.The decor through the hotel needs a bit of updating and the air-con unit in our room was ancient and very noisy!It did the job for somewhere clean and comfortable to stay for a weekend in NYC, but I wouldn't stay here again for a special occasion, or if we visit NYC again.

Stayed for 1 night 1/1/2016 to 2/1/2016. Location was walkable to times square and rocker feller centre. Friendly greeting by staff, 1 lift was broken but staff was very apologetic and referred us to wait in the cafe area with complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Room was small but to be expected in NYC. The best part of staying in this hotel was the complimentary breakfast with waffles and maple sausages etc. which resembled a buffet. Internet connection was fantastic too. Would recommend staying here to other people.

Excellently placed hotel, 3 min walk from Times Square. Lovely clean rooms, the room for breakfast was a little small but we knew this from reading previous reviews.Would definitely stay here again with the family

We stayed for 6 nights in mid Dec. We have never been to NY before and were expecting small rooms but not that small we are a family of 4 and being we were on holidays from Australia had 5 large suitcases so once you added that to the room there was no room to move around. Only double beds however they were comfortable and the room was clean, no fridge though! The complementary breakfast downstairs was good just the basics but good start to the day at no cost. Location was a little scary as in at night felt a little unsafe and a few blocks from times square. We managed to walk to times square, empire state and Rockefeller and a subway stop only a block away. The BEST part of this hotel was the use of the free laundry room from the next door hotel. We were able to clean and dry our clothes at no cost. You just had to show our room key and you were given access to their guest laundry. There were around 6 washers and 6 dryers. The front desk people were helpful but one male concierge was hopeless when asked about closest laundry he didn't know and was telling us to use a subway thankfully the front counter man said you have use of the one next door!!!! Probably wouldn't stay again but it was ok for our stay.

My honey opted to stay at this hotel because it said it was in Times Square. It actually isn't in the actual busy part of Time Square, but rather in the Garment District. The plus was it was around the corner from the Hells Kitchen section of Time Square where you can find several choices for dinner. There was an Irish Pub 1 block away. The minus was that at night there were some homeless people hanging around and smoking pot as we walked by, had I been alone or with another woman I wouldn't have felt safe. The rooms were small, but ALL rooms in NYC are small! It was very clean and the bed was comfy. For the price it's a good value. It's several blocks from the busy section of Time Square, it's also a few blocks away from the Empire State Building. The staff was always very helpful and friendly! They greeted us every time we came back into the hotel. We only had juice from the complimentary breakfast, so I can't really comment on that, but it seemed to be standard Hampton breakfast foods. I don't know if we would stay here again just because of the location, but the staff was wonderful!

The size of the room was very small-and the size of the overall property is small as well. A total disappointment. The location is not great. Area is dirty and very loud, especially at night. The staff could not keep up with the number of guest that were staying at the hotel. In comparison to other Hampton Inns that I have stayed, it did not meet the quality that the Hilton Chain is normally renoued for promoting.

This is a segment of the letter written to Hampton Inn Corporate which reads as follows:  During my brief stay at the hotel, I was a victim of a Theft by your employees. On the day before check out (December 24 ), I discovered 400 US Dollars that were missing. We immediately informed your Security personnel and the New York City Police Department of what had transpired. I am in extreme shock to find out that my family were being targeted by your personnel. This information was provided by the police that several of your employees saw and gossiped about our large store purchases that were brought into the hotel and into the room. On the day of discovering the money missing from our Locked Safe, it was revealed to me by your Security and Technician personnel (+++ and +++) that the master key that unlocks the room safes was checked out by an employee earlier that day. The police indicated that they were told by Employee +++ that I had requested a room with a safe which was completely untrue. I believed that safes were standard issue in a Hotel Room. Knowing and seeing large purchases brought into the room and believing that I had requested a room with a safe, gave your dishonest employees a reason to target my family by entering my room in search of valuables and opening my locked Safe to Steal my money from my Family and I, thus ruining our Vacation and Christmas for our two small children. My and my Family's trust and privacy were violated to learn that the Hampton Inn employs Thieves for employees. I spoke with Ms. +++ ++++, on site manager, the next day ( December 25) in giving her the opportunity to correct or mitigate the situation. Upon much dissatisfaction, nothing was resolved. She only informed that the investigation will be conducted by a third party and our stay will be charge regardless. When I booked the room for my family, I expected to be provided a safe and secure environment for my persons and belongings during my stay. The Hampton Inn had breached their end of the contract in providing a safe environment by Personnel hired and employed by Hampton Inn stealing money from our issued Hotel Locked Safe furnished by Hampton Inn...IN SHORT: EMPLOYEES ARE WATCHING STORE PURCHASES BROUGHT INTO THE HOTEL BY GUESTS AND WILL ENTER YOUR ROOM IN SEARCH FOR VALUABLES AND HAVE ACCESS TO THE SAFE TO TAKE ADDITIONAL PERSONAL PROPERTY. WATCH OUT.

great location, cleansmall, elevators overwhelmed during check in / out times and room clean times., no staff elevatorrooms and breakfast area small, but great service and great location, good value make this propertya winner

Great hotel, Excellent service esp Sharon and Darius so helpful. I will recommend it to my friends and familiy to go there. It was clean and tidy great breakfast. And most of all you are near to the main shopping area . Great value for money . thank you to all the staff. Maxine Daniels Janet Turnbull and Anne-marie .

loved the location close to Bolt Bus Javits Center & S of Time Square & in a quieter area. Request the top floor to get away from the street noise. Nice comforable bed. Plenty of closet x2 spaces. Small step in shower with glass sliding doors so if on the larger size, just be aware of elbows hitting door or wall. Miss small refrig in room. Great free breakfast buffet with changing breakfast food items, ie egg offerings. Like the different waffle offerings, ie kiwi or lemon topping than just syrup, nice touch. Friendly staff. Wished lemon water dispenser available in the AM too to refill traveling water bottles, hint/hint! :-) And great hold baggage to keep bags before/after check in or check out!

I work in NYC and often frequent this hotel and keep coming back. I'm always greeted by a friendly and smiling staff member who welcomes me and makes me feel happy to be there. The rooms are great and so are the rates, and of course, the complimentary breakfast is awesome! I usually go for business, but have brought my family there several times over the past years. It is within walking distance to Penn Station, Times Square, Herald Square, and lots of restaurants and shopping.Great value!

Came in for an overnight stay to soak up the holiday sights of the city. We first went to the Hampton North on 8th ave and 51st to find out we are at the Hampton South, luckily not too bad of a walk. Nice, small room but fit what we were looking for. Everyone was nice and the breakfast alone is great and will save you some money. Good location.

This was an excellent Hotel for our family vacation. Very clean and the staff was very helpful and polite. It was in the heart of NY City and everything was in walking distance. We were all over the city and walked the whole vacation, we got to see Central Park, Statue of Library, Rocker fellow center, The Rocketts every thing there was in the city to see. We did take the train to the 911 museum which is a must see and easy to access. Lots of fun!! The Walls family!!

Good hotel for a New York city trip. The rooms are not too big but modern and renovated.Breakfast is simple buffet but good and included ;-)Close to Penn station and you can easily walk to Time square.

I have to give Hampton Inn a 10 on their breakfasts. Room were small as it appears most are in NY. We had a room on the 8th floor street side but, noise was never a problem. Always hear reports of slow or full elevators which, during a 5 night stay, were not a real problem. Although hotel was just 3 blocks from subway station, after a long day of touring, it seemed like a mile. Next time we would find a hotel closer to a station.

This was a 3 day stopover for our 31st Anniversary road trip up North, had not been to NYC since 1975 when I was stationed here during the Coast Guard at Governors island, I was a little nervous about driving into NYC, but knew this Hotel was not to far into the city, so once in I located the Hotel OK with my GPS, and knew I had valet parking, so I was looking for a nice half circle drive into the Hotel, but found out I had to park on the curb and get the Valet parking attendant to clear out the curb of utility vehicles and what not, but it finally all worked out, I never new where they took my vehicle but found out later it was down some other street and kept my fingers crossed. Once I checked in all was well we were greeted by Chris the desk clerk who became my go through guy for any questions I had and seemed to know the area well, any other desk clerk only helped with general info. I also found our baggage porter Wellington to be great at settling us in, the elevators and room was great, and found my research of this hotel paid off, not to mention future visitors to always go back in and check for price changes if reserving way ahead of time because I was able to go through 3 rate changes in my favor before we arrived maybe it had to do with Hurricane Joaquin ? Otherwise everything was fine except when we checked out, but we did a late morning checkout because of some last minute places to go to, but we gave the desk clerk a 30 minute announcement that we were going to check out and after 45minutes decided to haul our baggage down ourselves, but at least are car was out at the curb, and I am sure I will get the standard generic reply back from Management about making our trip better next time, but this probably a once in a lifetime stop over, but I think this was our best choice at the time, and don't have to many regrets, it was nice to walk to Times Square which was close, and enjoyed the Big Bus tour.

Great place to stay, right in the centre of everything....easy to walk to all attractions.We were on floor 31....great view and quiet.Staff very very obliging, polite and went the extra mile.The breakfast was really good.....girls in there very friendly and chatty...brightened my morning!Clean....we'll run very comfy beds! We would stay there without hesitation if we visit again!

Ian, the porter, was able to help us with our transport back to the Newark airport. Elizabeth helped with directions, where to eat, etc and we really enjoyed just talking with her. Overall the room was great and the staff wonderful.

Comfortable stay. Nice room. Good beds. Very clean. Nice view. Breakfast was included. 2 waffle stations, omelets, pancakes, sausage, lots of cereal, oatmeal and fruit. Pastries also. Location is good. Walking distance to Bryant park, Times Square. Near subways. Taxis are always available. Uber was 4 minutes. Yellow cabs on 9th Ave.

I was very impressed with this hotel, me and my mam have just returned from a 4 night stay, we are from the UK and couldnt fault the hotel one bit, with a coffee machine and TV in your room, wardrobe with iron & ironing board (Although we didnt need to use that)Also we had a king-size city view room on the 32nd floor where the view was phenominal.. The room was also cleaned daily which I wasnt expecting being there for only 4 days! So clean towels were placed out dailyIts pretty central too, Times square a 5 minute walk, Madison square garden 10 minute walk. Just wish that we explored abit more as we didnt fit everything in we intended to and once returned to the UK we sussed that there were a lot other things in walking distance from our hotel.We got lost one night so I reccommend that you take in which street, surroundings the hotel is at..The reception couldnt help us enough when we were asking for directions to various places.. We were also given a tourist map on arrival.. Breakfast was basic but really set you up for the day. Bagels, waffles, cereal, various cooked foods, tea, coffee and hot chocolate (Hot drinks were available all day)The only downfall was the hairdryer not working (as the one we brought with us had broke) and not been informed on the snack vending machine on the cellar floor or the gym, but we were informed of complimentary wifi, business centre (free printing and use of computers)I also read a couple of reviews about noise and the lifts been slow. The lifts were fine, quicker than normal speed I would say and the noise was fine also, some sirens and other noises but what do you expect in a city that never sleeps?

From the time I walked in the door from the time I left I enjoyed every minute of being in this hotel great staff great hospitality. I specially like a friendly of the staff was. Great customer satisfaction

Me and my children stayed at this hotel for 6 days/5 nights. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast in the morning was plentiful and had a lot of variety. A nice benefit was having the coffee/tea/cocoa available 24/7.

I researched hotels extensively in NYC before booking with West 39th. What a wonderful experience my friend and I had there. The staff was exceptional (especially Chris and Nicole at the front desk), and cleanliness was #1. The rooms were a little small, but that is routine in NYC. Ours was quiet and accommodated us very well. Staff were attentive to the cleanliness in the lobby as leaves, etc. were tracked in through the front doors. Someone was right there sweeping and mopping right away. The breakfast was outstanding--varied, hot, fresh. This HI has it all.

I’m probably to blame for expecting more out of the Hampton than I found in New York last week. After all, I’ve stayed at some rather impressive Hamptons over the years, including one I reviewed in 2014 based in Wheeling, West Virginia that had a full spa and water slide complex indoors. Of course, New York doesn’t afford the same type of real estate options, so it wouldn’t be fair to compare this Hampton with one in the mid-west. On the other hand, compared to other hotels I’ve visited in New York City, this probably isn’t among those I would put on my return list.Don’t get me wrong. The hotel is perfectly ‘correct’ from the point of view of a clean sleeping quarters with a fully functioning bathroom in a location that isn’t too shady. But as the title says, I'm forced to invoke the awful phrase, "it is what it is". This hotel offers very little pizzazz or glamour beyond that. It’s in a so-so location a bit off the beaten path that has a few more homeless people than elsewhere. The building, itself, is about 30 floors high and very narrow, such that on each floor, there are only about three rooms per side of the two elevators which worked without a hitch. I was on the 28th floor, so I didn’t hear any street noise. In contrast, my bathroom ceiling fan rattled so much that engineering had to come upstairs to dismantle it.Size-wise, we’re talking postage stamp, which, I’ve heard (but not experienced in my other NYC hotel stays), is typical for Manhattan. My room was about 10x15, with two rather generic queen beds, a desk and oversized chair, a small armoire to hang up clothes, dresser with obligatory bible, TV, and a encapsulated bathroom with toilet, single sink, and shower stall. Quite frankly, it was too crowded. The chair was too big to fit under the desk, so it blocked the already narrow path to the armoire. The armoire was encumbered with an iron and ironing board which took up half the space and prevented anything long from hanging straight, so I removed them and placed between one of the two beds and the wall. Speaking of which, I couldn't figure out why there were two queen beds in that room. There was no possible way to fit four people in that amount of space, so what would be the rationale for not limiting the choices to either one king or two doubles? As for the view, there wasn't any, unless you consider the facade of an apartment building a view. Complimentary breakfast downstairs was acceptable but barely so. The eggs were industrialized, the sausages felt old and chewy, and the oatmeal was runny BUT the coffee was decent, and there were yogurts, make-your-own waffles, and fruit. Plus, the staff on site truly aimed to please -- (too bad a woman offered little courtesy by phone when I called a few days before arrival). All in all, the Hampton is a good hotel, one that I wouldn’t have minded when I was a lot younger. In fact, I saw a number of college kids who were probably quite pleased to find such “affordable” lodging in the city. But for seasoned travelers and especially those on business, I wouldn’t recommend this Hampton unless price were paramount.

This hotel has 6 rooms per floor and I forget how many floors but the elevator took forever. The lobby was small and crowded, but the eating area was adequate. The room was so small I could not turn around without bumping into something.

My wife and I spent the weekend in New York for a brief getaway. The Hampton Inn was a great place to stay. Very clean and everything in working order. Bedding was incredibly comfortable, as we've come to expect from Hampton Inn. Breakfast is the typical for a Hampton Inn. The hotel is conveniently located in mid-town 6-7 blocks from Times Square and Broadway theaters. A little further for Empire State bldg, Rockefeller Center, Macy's etc. Subway stations just a few blocks to take you all over the city. A special shout out to Chris and Nelson at the front desk. They define hospitality!! Thank you both. Hotel will store your bags if you arrive before check in and will also hold them if you want to see the city after checking out!

Traveled to New York for a conference in October 2015. Stayed at this Hotel for 5 nights. Good Location very close to Times Square. We arrived early morning but booked from the night before we arrived but for some reason our booking for that night was cancelled by the hotel due to some misunderstanding with our booking agent and we had to wait till 3pm to check in. After a long 17 hrs of flight that was a bit irritating, but the staff was good, cordial and friendly. Chris, Paula & Nicole at the front desk are good, friendly and helpful. the concierge was friendly and helpful as well. Once rooms were ready our check in was a breeze. Wifi and breakfast was complimentary. Wifi complimentary is very good. Breakfast is functional & limited. This can be better and many of the days we were there we had breakfast outside .Overall rooms were clean and quiet. Room size is not bad in comparison to what you would get in this city.

We traveled to New York for the weekend. The hotel was very nice and clean. The room was small with four people but we expected this. Most of our friends had said all the hotels in New York had small rooms because of space. The people were very friendly in helping us get around. The free wi-fi was great. The free buffet was limited but considering it was free with the room, I had no complaints. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I just went to NYC for our 15th Anniversary. We stayed here for 4 nights. The location is more in the "Garment District" but not too far from the Times Square area. You would think it would be noisy, but it was actually pretty quiet inside. Do not expect great views, our view was of another building. The breakfast was a nice bonus. It was a nice way to start the day and you didn't have to pay a fortune or hope to find a seat anywhere. The conceriege was friendly, and helped with us finding the best routes to take. They also helped reserve a shuttle to the airport for us.

This hotel is located within a ten minute walk of 42nd Street subway train station. Hampton Inn is part of the Hilton Group of hotels.I was warmly greeted by a very cheery front office manager Elizabeth Liriano. Check in by Chris was quick and efficient.My room was adequate for a short business trip although the bedroom and bathroom were on the small side. It would be a challenge to a large person. The bed was very comfortable.My room rate included breakfast. Hot items were eggs (scrambled, or omelette style with cheese filling) and sausages. There were cereals, fruit and porridge too. But I enjoyed the waffles - both making them and eating them. That was a highlight for me.Within walking distance are various restaurants and cafes. I had a a snack at Wasabi - the sushi place.Once you get used to the very confusing Metro system, you can go travelling to different parts of New York city. I went to Chinatown and Little Italy. I had a Chinese meal in Chinatown. If you are on a tight budget, you should take the train from JFK airport to Manhattan. It is convenient and cheap. Wi Fi was available and free. I would stay at this hotel again as it is economical and serves the purpose.

The rooms are small but have everything you need including a chair to watch tv that was actually comfortable. The rooms have coffee pots-another plus. None of the rooms have a bathtub which I would've liked. Showers only. My room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. It is very close to the bus terminal and pretty close to Penn Station. It was crowded in the lobby but the staff was always friendly. Breakfast was ok and included in price.

This hotel is clean, centrally located (2 blocks from bus terminal), rooms are a bit small , but livable. Breakfast is included and it's a plus. Personnel is helpful and corteous. Try to get the higher floors , so you don't hear street noises. I was on the 15th floor and didn't hear anything, but other guests complained about noise.

I have stayed there 2 times for business. Free wifi and sub $300 prices with a free breakfast are what sells me. Like all Manhattan hotels, rooms are small. The only issue I had was that the closet smelled very musty. Breakfast is mediocre, but hey its free. Staff is very nice. Location is good as you don't get too much traffic and you don't get all the city sounds like in some locations. Although it is ok, I will probably try the Holiday Inn Express next door for my next trip just to compare.

Hotel is ok. Rooms are pretty large and comfy.Staff is not attentive at all and even a little rude.Location is perfect if you want to be in the buzz of NYC. If you don't like Laos and tourists, try to avoid it!Breakfast is average, not quality at all, but having it is pretty useful.

We received a warm greeting by desk clerk (Paula) who provided us Outstanding service by answering all our questions and giving us an Awesome restaurant within walking distance to hotel. The room was very clean but was a little small but was very up to date. At each encounter the staff was very warm and friendly but Paula went over and above by recognizing us each time.

We stayed 3 nights over the weekend I was running the NYC Marathon. Our great experience started at check-in with Chris and Paula! What a nice NY welcome! I was hoping to get the e upgrade I submitted and was excited to not only get the upgrade to a King City View, but ended up on the 30th floor which was incredible! I read reviews about the elevator being slow, but we had no problems at all during our visit! Rooms are not big, but are typical of what we have seen in the city. The room was clean, linens were fresh and the bed was comfortable! Everyone greeted us as we came and left the hotel throughout the day. It was very nice to get a "to go" breakfast the morning of the marathon, but I didn't really care for what was in it. A bagel, banana and water would have perfect! The muffin, apple and sweet breakfast bar had a lot of sugar, which is something many runners try to avoid before a race. I did appreciate the effort though. I was able to present Chris with a Trip Advisor Excellence Pin and gave him a second to give to Paula since she was not there when we checked out. I have had these pins for a year now and I just felt their service was the first to exceed my expectations since I received them to give out!

The hotel and service was excellent. I was very pleased with the my stay, well worth the trip. I found that the hotel was perfectly situated to the type of trip I had to take. The staff was very friendly, helpful and pleasant.

We stayed here for 2 nights. Our experience was excellent.Pros:Clean!!Breakfast!!! ( lots of options )Quiet on the upper floorsNice staffClose to subway and Times SquareCons:Small rooms (very NYC)Small breakfast areaThis hotel is an excellent option. When visitin NYC, you just need a clean and quiet place to sleep. Very pleased!

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights prior to our New England/Canada cruise and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was small but very clean and the bed was comfortable. Great location! We walked everywhere: Gershwin Theatre, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue - as much as we could cram into 2 days. Hotel; staff was exceptionally friendly and very helpful.

A very well located hotel with easy access to the subway and in walking distance of Time Square and the theaters. Clean but modest rooms yet comfortable for NYC. A good map is essential to know where to go when walking. Hotel staff a most helpful.

Hampton Inn Times Square South is a hotel you'd be more then satisfied staying at. The rooms here are always fresh and clean. From the time you walk in, you're greeted by an amazing staff. Christopher, Nicole, and Alton are friendly, professional, and very attentive. Whenever I come to NYC, and I travel here often; These particular staff members always make sure my stay here is always flawless. The hotel is perfectly located, because you're in a 5 block radius of Times Square, Penn Station, and Port Authority Bus Terminal. There are also shopping, food, and other amenities around the area. You'll not regret staying here at Hampton Inn Times Square South

Front desk staff was very nice. Lobby was very welcoming. Room was a bit small, but I expected that especially in NYC. Hotel is not very far from Times Square. What I wasn't thrilled about was the breakfast. On both mornings that I was there, they were out of many items. Nobody seemed to be on top of it either. On the second morning though, they had potatoes and sausage patties, but no eggs which I thought was a little odd. The breakfast area is a little small and not the most well designed/laid out area either.

We spent 5 nights at the hotel, and loved it. Great rooms, great location in walking distance from Times square and Madison square garden. The staff are exeptionally helpful and nice, and I highly recommnd Hamptons Inn

Now Hampton Inns are fine, and once I got inside the hotel, it was. It was the neighborhood that is not. I know NYC pretty well and I know this area is a little rough and I was fine, but I would not recommend for families visiting NYC. During the day is not as bad as after the sun goes down. I sort of like the grittier side of Manhattan, but some may not.The staff was very welcoming and friendly, with a lot of unsolicited hello, how are you's? The room was fine except the very limited selection of TV channels. Breakfast is included and was the typical Hampton Inn spread. Not bad, not good, but does the trick.

Perfect review, From the time you walk in till the time you leave the staff is helpful and smiling :-) Want to give a Big shoutout to Chris the night time clerk. He is outstanding !!! Paula was also very sweet, always gave me a treat when we got back to the hotel. Nicole and Nelson also very nice and helpful. A big shoutout to Darrell in charge of housekeeping. A cheerful warm guy that you might see throughout your stay. Staff outstanding

I never leave reviews like this, but my husband (who rarely cares about where we stay) was so bothered by this hotel that he really encouraged me to. We often stay in Hamptons, and we've traveled to NYC before, so we knew going in that the hotel would be smaller than a normal Hampton, but we never dreamed the service would be so poor. The last NYC hotel we stayed at (six months ago) was so friendly and the staff was fantastic...we wished we stayed there again, but its location was not ideal for this trip. We intentionally booked a junior suite at this Hampton because we were traveling with our two preteen sons and wanted a decent amount of space. We loved the size of the room. However, service was just terrible. We arrived at 2:15pm and were told we had a guaranteed 3pm check in, so we'd have to wait. That was fine. However, our room wasn't ready until nearly 4pm. One of our kids had gotten car sick on the drive in from JFK, so we didn't want to just check our luggage in and go, we wanted to get settled and cleaned up (from the "fun"). We had no clue we'd have to wait that long. When we finally got to the room, there were only two bath towels (in a suite, for a family of four). We also realized there were no sheets on the pull out sofa where one of our kids would sleep. And the toilet was clogged from the previous guest (um, gross). We called for all of these items immediately. An hour later, we still hadn't received any and we called again...and the plunger arrived (solo). We unclogged the toilet (nice) and just went on our way. We had asked the man who dropped off the plunger about the sheets and towels and he didn't have a clue. He told us they'd leave them in the room while we were gone. We left. When we returned six hours later, nothing was left for us. We called again. An hour later...nothing. So we called a FOURTH time and finally, they sent someone up with sheets and towels. It was RIDICULOUS. The staff was also only half friendly...as in, some smiled and greeted you, some avoided you at all cost. The sweet gal who was always mopping the lobby floor was always friendly. The two men who often worked the front desk were, too. The concierge was never friendly. We waited to ask her something at one point and then gave up and asked the front desk...which was so much better. The location of the hotel was fine. The room was fine...the service was just really, really awful.

I really enjoyed staying at this Hampton Inn.The location is great - on 39 st and 8 avenue, few minutes walk to times square, right next to port authority, subway stations near by.The room size is pretty decent comparing to NYC as well- we stayed in the king bedroom, located at the 16 floor. the room was clean and comfort. the breakfast is OK - can become a bit boring after eating it for several days, but hey - this is free of additional charge.Staff was extremely helpful and kind. try the Japanese restaurant next to the hotel. it was surprisingly good.

The front desk staff at check in and check out were very nice: Chris and Nicole. I love the room and the bed was ultra comfortable. Great location. And super service. I would recommend it to any traveler to NYC.

We picked this hotel for its perfect proximity to the Javits for NYCC. The hotel was convenient, quiet, and comfortable. As other reviewers have said, the breakfast was very good with a variety of items each day. The lobby poster about what type of breakfast atmosphere to expect at certain times was funny! Special nod to front desk agent, Nelson for his professionalism and overall great attitude. The staff in general was very helpful and accommodating.

Thirteen of us traveled to NYC for five days for a family vacation. I suggested this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and its proximity to Times Square. The rest of the group booked through Expedia, but I am a Hilton Honors member so I booked through the mobile app. With my AAA discount, this hotel was the best deal on its class.Because I booked through the app and am a Hilton Honors member, I was able to check-in online before even arriving in NY. I even got to select my room. When I arrived, all I had to do was stop by the front desk and pick up my keys.The staff at this hotel are outstanding! They were all so friendly and helpful. A couple of times I requested extra towels in the evening and they were delivered right away. The staff take great care in the appearance of the hotel. A beautiful fall display was put out front on our second day. It was very welcoming.Real estate is at a premium in NYC. This hotel really tries to maximize its space. Our room was smaller than other Hamptons I've stayed in, but it was big enough. Plus, the point of going to NYC is to see NYC! The room was nicely appointed and very clean. We stayed on the 31st floor. We rarely heard street noise and only heard our neighbors when we were in the hall waiting for the elevator. The free breakfast was always great. They serve some items I've not seen at other Hamptons (smoked maple sausage, and I loved the cheese on he scrambled eggs). The staff always made sure things were replenished and went out of their way to help guests. Also, breakfast bags to go were available at the front desk if guests are heading out early or are in a hurry. We took advantage of that one day.I love that the Hampton always has free coffee 24/7. They made sure it was stocked, offered tea and hot cocoa, and a variety of creamers. I enjoyed coffee at night while relaxing in the room.If you have an early flight arriving or a late flight departing, you can valet your luggage.They have a concierge available to assist guests.We walked an average of 6 miles a day. The area was very safe, even at night. The hotel is also just three blocks from the subway, and a block from a taxi stand.I highly recommend the Hampton Inn Times Square South and will definitely return when I am in NYC.

The bedroom on the 13th floor with 2 queen beds was clean and comfortable. The room was not overly large, but had a closet. We requested a refrigerator and got a small one for water, & drinks. The breakfasts had hot and cold items and was very complete: cereal, oatmeal, waffles, eggs (scrambled, omelets), bacon, fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, muffins, variety of juices and coffees. The location is excellent too; 39th between 8th and 9th, near the theater district. We walked to Times Square and two theaters, and Rockefeller Center. The staff was friendly and helpful. They let us keep our bags there after checkout since our flight was later in the day. I'd highly recommend this hotel!

I was in town for a quick over night work trip. This was a great hotel with a friendly staff. I would recommend staying here. Good location close to attractions and restaurants. Clean rooms and all the comforts you would expect from a Hampton Inn.

Service was great. Every employee we had contact with was pleasant and helpful.We had a double room on the 26th floor for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The room was a little small,but had everything we needed. It was clean ,the bed was comfortable,and I liked that all linen is changed between guests,including the bedspread. Free breakfast in the morning was good. The public areas were well maintained. We were there for NY Comic Con at Jacob Javits center which was a short walk. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

I travel a great deal and this is my first review. The breakfast is fine, the beds are comfy, but what makes this place stand out are the employees.If you ever have a problem while checking in, such as I had lost my card. So, Paula was very gracious. The most impressive part was when she had to talk to my card company to get me checked in. I was sweaty, wiped off my phone on my pants and handed it to her. She didn't glare at me, she smiled and talked. That was beyond what I expected and she was fantastic. If you are looking for a place to eat ask Chris at the front desk. He is two for two. Great choices my stomach is happy I listenedSo, if you like great employees this is a wonderful choice.

The facility is new and clean. Great location as its close to the subway and within walking distance a number of good restaurants (Hells Kitchen). The staff are the reason I continue to use this property. The reception and maintenance staff go the extra mile. Thank you Chris.

Having stayed at the Hotel Edison our last trip, where Times Square is a stroll away from the door, I was a big disappointed with the Hampton Times Square South. The room was completely fine, the breakfast was good, the location was - well, not so much. It was a hike to make it to Times Square, comparatively speaking, and the route there was not the finest neighborhood in the city. The staff was more than friendly and the accommodations were nice, but it wasn't on the Square - I'll think Hotel Edison next time.

This hotel was a good value. It was within walking distance of the theather and Time Square. The room was small but clean. Breakfast was a limited selection of bagels, muffins, along with microwaved eggs and potatos and make your own waffles.

Stayed here on business. From the moment I arrived I was greeted warmly and quickly checked in. The room was not the typical postage stamp sized as you see in NYC, but actually had room to move around and settle in.This was a busy time for me in NYC so access to the subway was key. One block and I could get anywhere I needed to go! Very convenient and even though it's right around the corner from Times Square it was still quiet once I returned.I would highly recommend this girl for your next trip to NYC.

We were very impressed with the hotel, staff, room and free breakfast until my iPad was stolen from the hotel room sometime within the first few days of our week long stay. I checked into the hotel with my iPad tucked away in my carry-on bag and I had slid the bag under the small bench in the room. When I got into my carry-on a few days later, the iPad was gone. We reported it immediately and the hotel staff and manager did not act shocked or surprised. The read from our keylock indicated 17 entrances into our room and we found out that the hiusekeeping staff are contractors and not employees of the hotel. We opened a police report -- and the police did follow up with us -- but we never heard a word of concern or received a follow up from hotel management. Sadly, we felt they really didn't care. So, patrons BEWARE of this hotel for this reason. I can tell you we travel frequently and this is the only place where we have had a problem.

Great hotel, great service, helpful staff. The breakfast was much more than a continental style breakfast. Central location made major attractions easy to access by walking, even though there was plenty of public transit available.

This hotel is reasonably priced in the western part of mid Manhattan. It is close to the theater district and many restaurants. The room is very small but clean. The breakfast is included. There are a small business center and a gym with 2 treadmills and dumbbells.

Nice enjoyable weekend in NY. Only one problem was I picked the same weekend as the Pope and the UN meetings with the Presidents. Very busy and higher prices. We were very lucky to have had great cab and limo drivers and the porter Alex at the Hotel was 100%. With all said NY is always a fun place to visit.

This hotel is a much better Hampton than the Times Sq North one that I stayed at last week. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are contemporary and clean. When I checked into the hotel, I was given my room key, and when I entered the room there was another guest already in the room! Could have been a disaster. We sorted it out, and the hotel comp'd me one night free, which was good since the rooms at this period were over 500$ per night, all in. The only reason I would give it an average review is that it is a bit out of the way for me, and it was very expensive for the value. I would stay here again, however.

The hotel was very clean and inviting. I loved the chalk board in the lobby where you can write notes! Chris was very professional when he checked us in and provided recommendations for dinner. Alton was also very helpful. Hotel room was clean and surprisingly, not too small for NYC. It would've been nice for a little bit bigger shower. Bed was very comfortable!! The location was very convenient to everything in the city. I thought being off the main drag was nice because it was quieter.

This Hampton Inn is several blocks southwest of Times Square and is near many theaters. The hotel is well-maintained, but the rooms are smaller than those at most Hampton Inns, an attribute of many New York City hotels. Even so, the beds were comfortable and equivalent to those in other Hampton Inns. Reasonable range of choices for the free breakfast. The staff were friendly and helpful. It has the attributes of a mid to high end 3-star. Prices were high during the Pope's visit.

Staff was great in my opinion. Hotel was smallish, but we were still comfortable. The hotel offered an EXCELLENT and included breakfast for such a small hotel. The location was fantastic. Everything you could want to see was within walking distance (Empire State Building, Times Square, Madison Square Garden and PA Station). There are also many very fine restaurants and many small restaurants and pubs. Just know that even though this is a Holiday Inn Express, the price per night can be very high depending on events going on. Other than that we had a great stay.

Small (by typical Hampton Inn standards), but adequate rooms. We had 2 double beds. Just enough room in between the beds to walk by – none on the other side - but it suited. There are only 6 rooms to a floor so you can’t get too far from the elevator. Staff was courteous and helpful. Wi-fi was decent. The bathroom is small (again, by typical Hampton standards). We were only minutes away (walking) from Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State building, and Broadway so a very convenient location. Breakfast was good. Usually two hot items (sausage, omelets, etc.) and then oatmeal, cereal, rolls, etc. The elevator can be slow at times as others stated but we walked the stairs (we were on floor 17) and it wasn’t bad at all.

This place is like a really low quality Red roof Inn. The bed sheets are polyester, and all the rooms smell very heavily of some artificial fragrance. So if you have any allergies and want to avoid headaches and a sleepless night, stay away from this place.

It's hard to find a quiet, affordable, and easily accessible hotel in the Time Square area. And remember affordable being the most important. The service at the hotel was great. The room is small but NYC hotel isn't small when the rate is under $900 a night? Seriously folks let's get real.My room and hotel was very clean. I would stay here again only if the rate was right

Absolutely the worst experience I have ever encountered with a hotel. I have Elite HHonors Gold status and I am employed by a major US airline as a Flight Crew member for the last 24 years. I've come across my fare share of horrible customer service and absolute disregard for me as a customer but this Hilton property hit an all time low. The reservation with this property was booked in August 2015 for 3 nights in September. The reservation was booked using AAA discount of $203 a night. We had a family friend who was going to be in New York at the same we were so we decided to add an extra day at a slightly higher AAA rate of $356 for the fourth night. Room rate and NYC hotel taxes the entire bill SHOULD have been no more than $1119.85. Unbeknownst to us when the fourth night was added we "modified" our entire room rate for all four nights, negating our AAA discount and changed the room rate for ALL four nights. The hotel modified our room rate increasing the rate per night exponentially increasing to our room rate to a total of $1940.42. At no point did Hilton nor the Hampton Inn make contact with us about the change in the rate change. After complaining ad nauseum about this bait and switch. The front office begrudgingly honored our original AAA room rate for the one night only. We made the decision that we would stay the one night and cancel the remaining reservation. The hotel said that they would allow us to cancel the remaining nights without penalty but would still require a credit card for the 1 night. The Front Desk personnel were provide with a Visa debit card with the EXPLICIT instructions that she was to run the card for the one night plus $150 for incidentals. After the payment was processed we checked our bank account and the Front Desk ran the card for original modified room rate for ALL four nights at a grand total of $1940.42. This ended up overdrawing the checking account and drained everything from our saving account which was used as overdraft protection. The hotel literally bankrupted us. When we spoke to the Front Desk Agent who ran the card authorization she attempted to explain that the hotel was protecting their interest in case we did stay for the original four nights. She assured us that when we checked out the following morning the funds that were on hold would be IMMEDIATELY released which was a bold faced lie. In reality, the hotel would hold all funds for 72hrs. Leaving us with no money for 3 days. We finally contacted Hilton customer service and they were able to get the Hampton to release the hold on the funds upon check out. Throughout this ordeal not once were we allowed to speak with either the General Manager nor the Front Office Manager. All conversation with the hotel was routed through the Front Desk Agent. I hold a status with Hilton's reward program of Elite Gold and not one person on property from the General Manager down to the Front Desk staff bothered to even offer up the simplest of apologies. We were treated with complete contempt and disrespect. I will NEVER recommend this hotel to friends, family or co-workers who are looking for a place to stay in Manhattan. I would have rather stayed at a Motel 6 than to have endured the hell from the Hampton Inn Time Square South. I will sleep on a Manhattan sidewalk before ever STEPPING FOOT inside this establishment ever again!

The hotel is tucked between two others and can easily be missedReception staff were very helpful and I found the checking in went really smoothlyRooms are compact as expected for Ny could not fault the cleanliness of the room and the bed was very comfyIn room wifi was ok and being a Hilton Honours member means it's free but resets every day to log in again.Lifts are small and a bit slow and exit into a very narrow corridor that connects the reception with the breakfast dining area. The breakfast area is small and gets crowded around 8amBreakfast food selection is limited to two hot cooked items egg based and a meat along with the usual cereals and fruit so don't expect a fried breakfastOverall functional but nothing to specialThe rooms are a bit on the small side but expected in NU

We stayed here one night and the room is really clean and modern, average size for a New York hotel where the rooms usually run a little smaller anyways. The staff is really friendly and helpful. Walking distance to great eats (just yelp it) and walkable to Penn station if you're catching the amtrak. And bed bug free!!! We usually check the bed bug registry before we book any hotels and it showed no issues (usually if a year with no problems, you're good). I also check the beds myself before we dock our bodies on it and the coast is cleared! Depending on when you come and book the price can be high so best of luck! Oh yea and free breakfast, yay! :)

We stayed there this week and it was a blessing. Staff was wonderful and helpful. The location is convenient. It was our first trip back to the city in a while, we will be returning after the great experience. Thank you !

This will be my 2nd time visiting the city and I decided to stay at the hampton this time.My overall experience was good. Front desk was very helpful. The rooms were pretty clean. They serve complimentary breakfast I must say the two young ladies in the breakfast area were so welcoming and nice. The only Con I would give this hotel is there is only 2 elevators in the morning there is a long wait to come down stairs or to get back to your room. Otherwise everything else was good.

Excellent in terms of hospitality, very clean and comfortable, good parking service,The fitness center is fully equipped, a good business center with print, fax, express mail, and copy services and good concierge service

With SO many hotel options in Manhattan, it's always hard to know if you're selecting the right one for your needs! We selected this hotel primarily based on its' location! Because there are so many options to stay in the city, a hotel must do everything they can in order for them to stand out from all the rest! I insist on cleanliness first and foremost, and once I feel comfortable that my standard is met, them I judge the rest on the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff! Let's face it, if ANY member of the staff is rude or dismissive, I'm done! You're automatically on my 'list' and I'll let everyone I can know all about it...because I have a big mouth! With all that said, this property has three mentionable 'stars'! From the moment of check in, to interaction with staff at night after being out on the town, to check out...Chris, Jonathan & Paula all made our stay outstanding! So when looking for clean accommodations in a good central location, stay here and let Chris, Jonathan & Paula remind you what 'customer service' is all about...it seems to sadly be a dying art!

This hotel has great basics. It's clean. The rooms are large enough to be functional. It's close to Times Square. It has a small gym with the very basics. They follow the Hampton Inn, free breakfast model and they've used all of the space for breakfast/dining.The common areas are very small. The lobby is really small, but functional. The elevator area is so small you have to back into a wall to let people pass if you're getting onto the elevator. One of the great features Hampton/Hilton has is the electronic check in so that you simply have to pick up your key and they really don't need the front desk area except for key pick up.Hope this helps.C.

Excellent location,just a few minutes from Times Square.The staff was helpful and friendly.Always went above and beyond.We arrived on an early flight and they looked after our luggage so we could enjoy our day.Breakfast was great-good variety and very tasty.Will definitely be back !!

This location is not in the heart of town but it is about 15-20 minutes walk to Times Square, Broadway and less than 10 minutes to the closest subway station. The room is clean but the air-conditioner is so closed to the bed. The front desk staff is friendly. They provide hot breakfast in the morning and it is surprised me good that I think it is a winning point for planning a trip in New York City since I don't see other hotels have complimentary breakfast included. I might go back next time in town.

I usually try to stay at Hilton hotels for both my work and personal trips. I did the same for this NY trip. We arrived prior to check-in time, and the front desk personnel helped to hold our luggage, which was nice. They were also nice last day when we did an early-check out but had to store our luggage to do additional sight-seeing. However, besides the luggage storage, we were pretty disappointed. I have stayed in many Hampton Inns and this wasn't the service I was accustomed to as a Hilton Honors Silver guest. Second day, after we arrived the hotel after a long hot day (5:45pm), the room was not made, dirty towels were not picked up and shower needs were not replenished. We could not take shower to go to the location where we planned our evening. We had to call both House-keeping and Front desk. During breakfast times in the morning you have to wait a long time to be able to get down to the first floor due to elevator constraints. Breakfast area was very small you almost have to elbow your way around and find a seat. Rooms were very small and you need to get the second person out-of-the way to be able to move in the room. 2 people cannot move around comfortably, let alone 2 parents and a kid. I usually understand space constraints in the big cities but I am not sure if I can over-look basic house-keeping services, such as refreshing towels and bath needs, etc. I guess I was expecting a better room and service being a frequent Hilton guest.

Spotless room. Clean linens in excellent condition including white matalese (sp?) coverlet and several pillow types. Very clean and seemed new/good condition carpet. HVAC worked well. Nice clean bathroom of adequate size. Single-serve coffee maker and small in-room safe. Staff consistently helpful and smiling. Fun times in the Fashion District.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden is much nicer and has been refurbed recently. This has not and is starting to feel a bit aged. Location of this hotel is not great, it's pretty far from the action way past port authority. My room is pretty spacious however for Manhattan and the king bed generous. Good shower. I had a good nights sleep, the hotel seemed quiet and the bed comfy. Only two elevators means a sometimes long wait and a very crowded trip to the first floor. Breakfast was rammed, there isn't enough space and it was generally very chaotic. They didn't have any muffins (standard Hampton inn issue) and the oatmeal wasn't really cooked through. Haven't used the gym but will tonight. All in all an OK hotel and I would return.

Probably 3.5 stars in reality. I've stayed here twice for work in the last month and at first I did not appreciate this hotel but it has grown on me. It's well located near the big 42nd street subway hub and Penn Station, but the immediate neighborhood is kind of yucky. The staff are friendly but not very knowledgeable or professional. Breakfast is sub-par but passable (at least to compared to other Hamptons I have visited around the country). The rooms are quite compact and have very limited closet space - actually there's no closet at all but a small armoire in a corner of the room. Each floor is amusingly compact with only a handful of rooms, but many floors make this a midsize hotel. Only 2 elevators for all these floors can cause a wait at busy times. Complementary Wifi is slow but usable, though you must mind the device count limit per room.Still, it's clean and comfortable and I enjoyed returning here after work and dinner out in the city. There are many great food and drinking options in the area, enough to keep you busy trying them for a long time ;) The hotel is reasonably quiet and you can get a nice night's sleep, which is probably the most important thing. And it's often the most reasonably priced 'brand' option in the area. I'm certain I will be returning many more times.

Our stay here was really great. The location was fairly central and close to the subway. Only drawback was the long lines for the free breakfast....totally understandable as it was free and excellent. Staff were helpfula dn friendly and we would stay here again.

This hotel is very close to Times Square, Park Avenue, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen, etc. We can board daily sight seeing buses easily. Lots and lots of tourist attractions are in a walkable distance. Taxis and trains are available close by. The rooms are little narrow, but tolerable. We need to take breakfast early to avoid crowd.

Hotel's location is very convenient - 10 min walking to Times Square. Rooms are clean, although a bit small. Breakfast is decent, with changing menu each day. Personnel are the best. always smiling and helpful. Definitely recommend.

At first I was going to give this hotel a good review. Its in a pretty good location, has free WiFi, breakfast, and the room was a good size for being in NYC. The staff was really nice. However, I woke up with bites on my upper thigh after the first night there. My first thought wasn't bug bites. This is a new hotel after all, it couldn't be. I basically dismissed it. A couple of days later after checking out more bites appeared. This time I researched "bug bites", bites are usually in 3's and clustered near each other. That's exactly how they were on me. They also can take days to appear which explains why more appeared once I wasn't at the hotel any longer. Fortunately I only had a few clusters and they didn't take super long to disappear. So stay at another hotel not this one.

On whim I decided to stay in NYC for the night with my 6 year old son. We had a great time checking out some of the sites NYC had to off. Within walking distance to time square. This hostel is very close to the Javits Center and the bus terminal port authority. Not an overly kid friendly area but close enough to Time Square to make it worth the stay. Plus they have fresh baked chocolate chip cookies in the lobby and lemonade which my son loved. The bed was a bit lumpy but we were still able to fall asleep. If there is nose in the call you can hear it through the door but we couldn't hear any noise in surrounding rooms.

This is a great location for theater trips. It is only a 6 minute walk to theaters and 10 minutes to Time Square. It is located right off 8th Ave. and is really centrally located to Penn Station and other attractions. It is a small hotel but really great breakfast area and really nice staff. I was there with a huge group of students. One of the rooms from our group was kept awake all night because the toilette flooded. They said they couldn't get them another room...it was awful and a lost night of sleep for these ladies. It was a great stay for everyone else but horrible because they didn't get this stuff taken care of for these ladies.

We stayed here for the weekend and can't say enough about the great location and a good price ( for New York City). Room is somewhat petite, but well planned and appointed. Breakfast is a typical fix it yourself hotel fare. Staff were very enthusiastic with us when we checked in. One negative, it is $53.00 to park your car. Each time you go in and out it is another $53.00. Needless to say we have left it in the garage and used other transport.

no complain with our stay but was just shocked with their charges to my credit card 4 days after we left. I've prepaid our first 2 nights stay, extended one more night booked directly thru Hampton's site but was charged for almost $750 just for the one night. They gotta be kidding me!

Pro: Good price for the time you are actually in the room. Staff is very courteous and rooms and overall hotel are very clean. Breakfast is free and OK but gets VERY crowded around 9am so go early to avoid the lines.Cons: There's 30 floors and only two elevators so the wait for an elevator can be long. It's within walking distance to time square but its a walk. If you have trouble walking I wouldn't recommend this hotel. It's also not easy to get a cab or uber there. Traffic is insane on 39th because everyone is trying to get on the Lincoln tunnel. At night there's interesting and at times shady characters in the neighborhoods around the hotel. I would not recommend walking home alone late at night. We stayed on the 10th floor and faced another building. Some people in the reviews said they had views but perhaps that's several floors above. At night you can hear the elevator going up and down.

Compact clean room with comfortable beds. Great breakfast, free hot drinks all day. Free wifi.Central location around the corner from the Port Authority Bus Station, close to Times Square and walking distance to Empire State Building. Only negatives; 2 lifts and a very long wait each morning/noisy air conditioning right next to bed.

Overall I had a great stay at this hotel. Everything was very clean and organized. The check in and check out staff were great. I was a little disappointed that my room was not ready even though I asked for early check in and I am a Hilton Honors member. But I sat in the lounge area and did some work on the laptop using the hotel's wifi. Also if you are on an upper floor you have to sometimes wait for an extended period of time for an elevator. They only have two and housekeeping also uses them. I would suggest asking for a room on 3-7 floors and if the wait is too long for an elevator then take the stairs.

I will always look for Hampton Inns where I go. I know what to expect and the staff is always friendly and helpful. This Hampton Inn met my expectations. The value for the money is also exceptional for NYC.

My husband and I stayed here for a couple nights and had a fabulous time.The staff were young, energetic and extremely helpful. Breakfast was great; fresh juice, waffles, eggs, muffins, fruit, yoghurts etc and we were always welcomed with a 'good morning miss/sir ' despite the kitchen staff being very busy. The room was clean and well equipped.  Complimentary wifi. We had a great view of the city/Hudson river.The location is fantastic. We walked most places.If I had to choose a fault it would be the slow elevator.Thanks for an overall great stay.

My family and I weren't expecting much space for our hotel room, but we were pleasantly surprised. We had a room on the top floor. Breakfast was packed and getting an elevator wasn't always easy, but considering our proximity to the Subway and Times Square, we were happy. The polite and helpful front desk staff and the size of the room were extra bonuses. I would definitely stay here again!

I had a seven night stay in NYC and chose this property based on price and proximity to the Javits Center. I left after five nights without getting a good night of sleep. The room was small and dark, the lighting poor, and the old wall-mounted air conditioner droned on 24/7. I would not recommend this hotel for any extended period of stay.The staff was excellent and friendly/accommodating, the breakfast was great and the workout room is acceptable.

Everyone very friendly and helpful, couldn't do enough for us always asking if we needed anything. Staff very happy. Quiet rooms, very clean and kept that way. Would stay here again, no problem. Breakfast had excellent choice of food.

I typically choose hotels on groupon or kayak.com when I travel for business and bought four nights at this property on groupon. The facilities were what I would expect, but the staff were phenomenal! I had brought two girlfriends with me who'd never been to NYC and the front desk staff recognized us every time we came and went. The location is excellent and close to everything and the complimentary breakfast was over and above all of our expectations. Made it easy to save on meals - not always an easy feat in the city! The room was average but clean, comfortable and quiet. I'll be booking direct with this property again - no more need for groupon in NYC.

Near Times Square with all the amenities nearby. The hotel offers very good breakfast but the lines are long between after 8.30 a.m. So, go early. Hotel staff are very friendly. We stayed in 3205 and the view of the Empire State Building was good. Though many warned about elevator noise, we did not feel any trouble.

This Hampton Inn is in a great location near the theatre district and the Javits Center and a variety of restaurants. Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the desk clerk. Due to a mix-up the room hadn't been cleaned but after I reported it 2x, the problem was solved. They were very apologetic and gave me a good will goody bag. I've stayed at this location several times and this was the first time there was a mix up. The staff is unbeatable. Every one I met was friendly, welcoming and helpful. They seem happy that you are there and want to make your visit a good one. They have a complimentary breakfast buffet that was great. I had an english muffin, scrambled eggs, bacon, fresh cut fruit and coffee. There was a lot to choose from. All in all it was a good place to stay and I will stay there again.

Staff is a bunch of kids, dirty looking kids. Housekeeping doesn't understand privacy signs. Wifi is too weak to work, even with one device only logged on. Rooms are cramped and the entire hotel smells. Due to poor management at front desk it takes forever to do anything and people are sitting on top of each other in the lobby.

The room was very small but clean. TV didn't work, it took 24 hours to fix it. Breakfast was very disappointing and the staff was indifferent about replenishing items. Housekeeping was cooperative. I would not go back. Very disappointing for a Hilton property.

Once I got over the sticker shock of paying abut $220.00 per night, I found that even this price involved the delivery of excellent service. The location was great, and we were able to walk to both theatres where we saw plays. Access to subway system was also helpful. The breakfast was good enough to allow me to discount the price by $30.00 per day based on the quality of the food served for breakfast. Room service, cleanliness and workable systems in bathroom and room were excellent. Rooms were small, but who needs a large room while going to theatre, museums, ect.?

From the moment we arrived the staff was very accommodating, considering we arrived 3 hours before check-in. Our luggage's was kept for us while we walked around Time-square. The only issue was the room was very small, but that is expected it is New York city, but the staff was very friendly and nice

we stayed there earlier this month. Great hotel for families visiting NYC with children. small rooms but comfortable and nicely decorated. surprisingly luxurious quality sheets on the beds. Very convenient location near Times Square while still away from the noise and the crowds. Few blocks 5 minute walk to hop on hop off.

Family of 5 (3 kids ages 13, 10, and 4) with 2 double beds in a micro-suite can be challenging, but you're in NYC! Front desk & support staff were very polite and helpful. Breakfast was pretty good with hot & cold options (just go earlier than later). Rooms were small (as expected), but clean. Just a few blocks from the center of Time Square and close to subway/bus stations made it very easy to get around. Our big truck was valeted with no issues! Cons:**Everything is just smaller/more compact (hallways, rooms, elevators) - can take some getting used to**2 small elevators which will test your patienceNo fridge Tiny bathroomsPricey due to summer seasonOverall a nice place. I think if you have more than 5 people (due to only 2 double beds), consider at least 2 rooms or 2 queens beds.

Very clean hotel. Rooms were very small. The issue with this hotel is there are only two elevators. It took forever to try and get one. Stairs would have been done, however, when you are on the 26th floor, that is a hike. Lobby and breakfast area were very small too.

Clean, very friendly and helpful staff, only 2 blocks from Times Square area. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Good access to mid-town places of interest. Don't let the lack of Neon in this area dissuade you!

It was everything I expect of Hampton Inn. Great accommodations. Friendly employees. Super clean. Convenient. My only complaint is the length of time it took for the elevator to arrive on my floor with space for me to get on.

200 chars can't begin to describe - Asked for room away from elevator - Placed next to it. Asked concierge for 4 - 5 star restaurant within 6 blocks of hotel. She hardly spoke English and recommended a food court (we went to Sardi's just around the corner.) 2nd day we left room to go sightseeing and returned to find door wide open. Maid spoke no English and manager (very young girl) couldn't decide what to do and we finally were comp with free night. Sorry excuse for Hampton Staff/location as we have always been loyal patrons but this was a very unpleasant experience. Had just stayed at an Embassy Suites in Newark, DE for 4 nights before and it was a wonderful experience. Night and Day!! Never again in NYC with Hilton. Overpriced and very small rooms.

Great hotel, location and price. Very clean and comfortable. Breakfast and wifi included was nice. Friendly staff and great hospitality. Liquan at breakfast so friendly and helpful with our daughters gluten intolerance. Thanks Liquan!! Also, don't rennet her name but it started with an M-she made little swan shaped towels for the kids, even a baby one. Would definitely return.

We managed to get this hotel at a good rate via Hotel Tonight. The room was very clean and new, however there isn't a fridge. Location is great, very close to the 42nd street station which is a direct E train from JFK. Also, the hotel is 32 stories high but there are only 2 lifts, so it takes a very long time to go up/down.

The location is only a few blocks from Times Square in NYC. I highly recommend this hotel for couples, families and business travellers. Start your day with a smile at the hot breakfast served at the Hampton Inn. The staff will go an extra mile for you. Highly recommended !

By far not the best hotel of the franchise. Rooms are clean but very small, elevators waiting times are very long at peak hours. The breakfast is correct but very badly organized, leading to very long and useless lines. On the positive side, the staff was overall professional and friendly. A special offer including water taxi is worth taking: that was a great experience.

The service in this Hampton Inn was very, very good. They were very helpful in giving us rooms that were right next to each other so our family could be close together. The beds were comfortable and the room we stayed in was quiet and clean. The staff responded quickly to our requests and needs. Having said that, we needed to ask for towels every day as they never left us enough. The breakfast was included in the price of the room which is important when you have three hungry children to feed. Although breakfast was nothing special, everyone could find something that appealed to them and they had fresh fruit available which was very good.
