The concierge was worthless since she didn't seem to understand English very well and didn't know much about NYC. Lucky for us, we knew where we were going. However, I think in NYC it is very important to have someone knowledgeable available to help you. In fact the information she gave me was wrong but I knew enough about NYC to realize it or it would have been a real problem. Please hire people who know the area and understand and speak English.

The room was very convenient to almost everything including the Red Line subway, which we took to the Statue of Liberty and 9 11 Memorial. Things were easy to get to from here for sure. We had a wonderful breakfast ( hot breakfast - omelet etc.) included with our room. But there was a long line- you had to get there early for the best breakfast. The only let down here was, no safe in the room, no coffee makers in the room and no refrigerator. But the place was very clean and lots of assistance for help finding attractions and a couple of good restaurants nearby to walk to for the evening. It is across the corner from the Jersey Boys Theater. A great place to stay. the room was quiet and on a main street just off the square.

We chose this Hampton Inn because of its great location. It was perfect for us. This property though has some real pluses and minuses. On the plus side it is a Hampton Inn. That means clean rooms, clean sheets, competent staff, free internet and a decent if not overly flashy breakfast. On the negative side the best way to describe the atmosphere at this hotel each morning is a complete free for all. The common areas are just overrun with guests. Don't misunderstand, all the guests are polite, but the layout of the downstairs is so tight and small that it forces several dozen people into a tiny space at breakfast. To compound this problem the 2 elevators are embarrassingly slow. We were on the 39th floor and would wait for 10 minutes for an elevator to take us down to breakfast in the morning. Another drawback to be expected in Manhattan is super tiny hotel rooms. The shower is so small that a big man over 6 feet would not easily fit in. I was bumping into the shower on all sides. If you are offered a chance to pay for a room on a higher floor with a view don't waste your money. We were assured a view of the empire state building but laughably could only see it by pressing our cheek to the tiny window pane and craning our necks to the left. As I mentioned Hampton breakfasts are serviceable but good luck with the lineups. Choose to eat earlier in the morning and you will be fine. The coffee is OK and there is real cream but if you like strong coffee there is a starbucks just down the street. The street leading to the hotel on either side is safe if somewhat grungy.Anyway at the height of the season this Hampton was very expensive. Could you do better? Maybe. But you could also do a lot worse. I have fond memories of our New York trip but the hotel does not come up in my thoughts at all. Maybe that is OK.

We had a very early train to catch, so we wanted to stay relatively close to Penn Station and chose Hampton because they've never disappointed us. Our room was fine, staff was great. Only negative was long wait for elevator at peak times.

If we are in Manhattan again, we would definitely stay again and would recommend it to my family and friends. It was very clean and the breakfast was good. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was central to everything.

Everyone we encountered who worked at the hotel – from the young man who took our luggage, the people at the front desk, and people working the breakfast room – were all friendly and wonderful. I thought the service we received was excellent.

This hotel is in a great location to see all NYC attractions. You can easily walk or catch a cab/subway train. The hotel and rooms were very clean. Breakfast was typical for Hampton. Staff was very helpful.

Overall the hotel was clean, well maintained and very helpful when asked. The only thing I can say it is a bit cramped on space. Breakfast was well maintained and a well rounded variety. The view good

Easy check-in, close to sight seeing. Continental breakfast a big plus. Great for families staying in NYC. I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit NYC. Clean rooms, good beds, fresh duvet cover.

The room was great. It was clean and quite and you can enjoy your privacy. They offer free continental breakfast. The hotel is close to the Penn Station and there are dining places close by (nothing fancy though). The only issue I had was waiting for the elevator. The hotel has 30 floors and there are only two elevators. With that many people at the hotel, elevators are always in use and you can expect waiting times up to 15 mins especially during breakfast time. I almost missed my taxi because I had to wait for the elvator for over 10 mins.

This Hampton Inn is in a perfect location. walking distance to subway line and able to get around very easily. Room was nice and made for a very comfortable stay with all the walking. Staff was very accommodating when we arrived. They held our bags while our room was finished.

This gem of a hotel was an oasis for a busy traveler. I was able to park in front of the hotel where a very helpful valet wisked my car away to a safe location. EVERY staff member I encountered greated me with a smile. It was a great stay. Thank you.

Originally only booked for 1 night, but ended up cancelling other hotel and stayed there 3 additional nights. Jon at the front desk was awesome! went out of his way to help in any way possible. Only downside was the elevators, Tall building and only 2 elevators, so dont be in a hurry if you need to leave quickly.

The hotel is fairly new so it was very clean. The staff was great and helpful. Had a room with two double beds on floor 4 and it was very small. VERY small. I guess that's what you get in NYC. The prices was average but you get breakfast included so it allows you to save on the price of one meal. For a large family, that's a good savings.

Location is great. Value for money is questionable! Staff is courteous. Check out time is not flexible. Service in the hotel needs to be increased. Full kitchen service should be made available for the guests.

Everyone was fantastic. The breakfast room is small, so you have to get there early, or you fight for food. It's ine block from a great location. If you turn right out of the hotel at night, it gets a little scary.
very small roomsThe elevator is not capable to serves the quantity of guessts. The waiting time for the elevator is frustrating.Location is very convenient. The Hotel team are very nice and helpfull.

This hotel is in the perfect location! Honestly the center of all your need and attractions! We plan to stay again! Cons: Rooms are very compact, but worked for me and my husband. There are two elevators, but it can take a while since there are 32 floors and NY never sleeps! My least favorite thing was how small the hallway to stand for the elevators In the lobby was and how small the breakfast room is. Very crowded and uncomfortable. On the second day housekeeping came in, but just placed the towels and everything on our bed. We were a little confused, but let it bypass - no big deal. Lastly, the temp in the room wa super hot or cold. 70 degrees and the heat cut on, 67/68 degrees and you cant stay in the room. We were up a few times at night adjusting it to stay comfortable which was very annoying. The pillows are flat, too. We prefer a firm pillow. Pros:The staff at the front desk was super nice! I travel a lot and honestly I've never met such friendly people! We arrived around 10am and check-in Isnt until 3pm, there were no rooms currently available, but they provided me access to the restroom to freshen up and change before hitting the city - they also stored our bags until we came back to check-in later. They provided direction, always asked how my stay was and when I responded "ok" they are probing questions to inquire if there was anything they could do. Although we were in a prime location, noise was not an issue. The hotel is located right after you cross over from the Lincoln tunnel which was excellent because it was super easy to find and depart from. If you plan to do the water taxi, that's in walking distance, too! You can see the Empire State Building from your hotel room.

Would definately stay again! Extremely clean hotel room!! Staff was very friendly and concierge made reservations for us to see a Broadway show, which was very helpful. Awesome little deli a couple of doors down which was convenient. Only downfalls, their elevators were very slow and to order tickets from concierge was very expensive (their delivery charge)..

The room was very small but the view from the window was exciting. The bed was comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. Early the next morning my daughter and I enjoy breakfast. The food was good and satisfying. The desk clerks were very helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. Time square was in walking distant, just a block or two away. We had a memorable walking and water tour. We toured the empire state building and the statue of liberty, . We had dinner at the wonderful Italian restaurant on Ninth St. just around the corner from the hotel. It was an exciting stay in New York.

The hotel has a fantastic location, close to all you need: Times Square, restaurants, subway, bus. And offers free internet. These are the highlights! But the cleanliness leaves to be desired, the staff are rude ( except Jonnathan - front desk) . The breakfast is a horror, part of it 'cause of the guests, most uneducated. The rooms are very small . Escape from the floors where they have ice machine and beverage: during the night, suddently you will wake up with someone picking ice and making noise. That's it: you pay for the bed, shower and internet. Only!

We stayed on a very busy Fourth of July weekend for 3 nights. Rooms are slightly smaller but very clean and everything seemed newer. Only 2 elevators for ~30 floors for staff and guest so you had miss some rides. Breakfast was busy but staff was on top of things. It's against Port Authority bus station so it's only 3 blocks from Times Square. Staff was a little slow getting towels since we took showers in evening & morning. We expected it to be busy at the hotel so we knew what to expect. We would stay again. Excellent value for location and breakfast.

The hotel was in prime location for all downtown sites.Check in was unusually long as only one person checking people in. The room was small which really wasn't bad but the towels in the bathroom for shower were pathetic and the air conditioner was quite noisy. The elevators were extremely slow (had to wait up to 10 minutes at times)The breakfasts were good and well done.

Close to everything, very clean. The front of the hotel is a little hard to find. The beds are luxurious and the breakfast was great! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Manhattan.

The Hampton Times Square South seems just slightly off the beaten path, which means it's away from heavy crowds and noise, but within easy walk, even with a bag, from Penn Station or 42nd St. Station. I was there for business and the hotel obviously caters more to tourists, but it was over-all very accommodating.

The staff was excellent. My special needs son had a melt down and the staff made sure we had everything we needed. They got him cookies, me fresh hot coffee and ice water. They could have not done a better job of making our stay a trip to remember. As a housekeeper myself at a resort, the room was cleaned to perfection.

I read several reviews where people complained about the smaller room size. For the view we had from the 32nd floor, we were perfectly content with a small room -- not that we did much more than slept there (the fireworks display was a pleasant surprise). The staff was incredible and so friendly. We parked our car across the street in a garage when we arrive and had until 4:00 the next day to pick it up. Although checkout was at 11:00 am, the hotel staff offered to keep our bags until we were ready to pick up our car. The night we arrived, we walked from the hotel to 5th Avenue to the other side of Central Park, back down to Times Square and finally back to the hotel. The location couldn't be more perfectThe only negative I can think of is that the breakfast area is quite small, but when the building is less than 50' wide, there isn't much that can be done.We will definitely choose this hotel the next time we visit New York!!

This hotel was very convenient for me as it is only about three blocks away from Port Authority Bus station. I used to spend my summers in NYC and have family in Jersey I could've stayed with but instead of commuting back and forth into the city, I decided to stay here instead since it was so close to where I needed to be. I didn't have to take the subway, I just walked everywhere. It is New York City so the rooms aren't very large compared to other Hampton Inns anywhere else. But the rooms are clean and the bed and pillows are comfy. The breakfast in the morning gets very crowded, I assume a lot of tourists stay here as it is near Times Square.They gym was very small, which I'm not surprised as fitness centers at Hampton Inns are average. I was still able to use it everyday. The elevators take a really long time, sometimes more than 15-20 minutes. I was never in a hurry so I didn't mind the wait. There were times when I took the stairs down which wasn't so bad.The service was excellent. All the staff were very helpful and accommodating. Chris at the front desk is amazing! He's very friendly and I really appreciate all of his help when I was there. I'd definitely recommend this Hampton Inn to anyone who's staying in NYC and I would most likely stay here again too.

My connecting flight was cancelled and I had to stay over in New York until I could book another flight. Fortunately, this Hampton Inn had a vacancy. It was very reasonably priced, clean and within walking distance of everything a girl could want.

We were staying at a chain hotel 2 doors down when 2 of our adult children decided to come into the city for the night and we needed a second room. The Hampton had a room at half the price of the hotel we were in, and it was so much more spacious and far less depressing. The elevator is the worst feature about this hotel though. I waited for 7-10 minutes on three occasions to get down from the 23rd floor. We also encountered several loud and drunk guests in the lobby and elevators, and one who yelled loudly in our hallway at about 3 a.m. The keys each only worked one time, and it took about a half hour round trip to get back and forth to the room and lobby to get those fixed and get into the room. The breakfast was fine, although when one guest decided to tie up both waffle machines to make 10 waffles to take to his room, that was annoying. Still, this hotel room was so much nicer and bigger than the nearby name hotel, and we would choose this one again if staying in this neighborhood.

Nice, clean hotel and the location is good. Room was small but the decor made it pleasant. I would prefer a small refrigerator but not having one worked out fine since we were gone a lot. Hotel staff were happy people. We would stay here again.

I made a last minute reservation at this hotel on a Thursday night due to an unexpected power outage in my apartment building. I was able to find an exceptionally reasonable rate on the Hilton website. I was checked-in and settled within an hour and a half of making the reservation.Like most of New York City, this hotel is built up rather than out. There are only two elevators to cover 32 floors; so expect a wait. I was in room 1606; which was right off the elevator. Thankfully, this did not affect my sleep at all; no noise. The king bed room was very small; but, perfect for just one person or a couple. The complimentary wifi worked just fine and was easy to connect.This hotel definitely suited my needs. I was happy to be able to find such a great rate close to the weekend. The next day, I had to go to work and was traveling later that night, the hotel held my bags until 10pm; so appreciative for this. Also, when I returned to pick up my bags, the woman at the front desk, Nicole, allowed me to sit in the lobby until it was time for me to head out for my trip. I would recommend this hotel for anyone that doesn't plan on being in their room much. Friendly staff and clean accommodations.

Chose this hotel for the close proximity to the Gershwin Theater. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, the free breakfast was appreciated, but the best feature of the hotel was their customer service. It was superb! . The staff was more than pleasant and really went out of their way to see to our comfort. One of our party felt ill the next morning and wanted to rest a bit longer. We were concerned about checking out on time and was told not to worry, asked if there was something they could assist us with. Would definitely stay there again.

Visited back in March! The staff there was unbelievable accommodating! The valet was backed up and I got a parking ticket but the hotel compensated me for my troubles! I would stay there again the next time I go to NY! The other plus was the location - you can walk just about anywhere or hop on a close subway stop!

This hotel had just open like 2-3 weeks before ! We were the first one in the room !!!Very very clean, like all off the accommodation !Friendly staff!Very nice breakfast bar And the location, .... hey ! the greatest ! Had a fabulous vacation!

Our trip involved seeing 2 broadway shows. This hotel was great since we could walk to both shows, and also included breakfast with the room, which can save some cash given NYC is expensive. The hotel wasn't great (small room, slow elevator, etc.) but the staff was excellent, room was clean, and our trip memorable overall.

Just had a horrible experience with the manager. She was soooo rude that I felt compelled to write a review on the spot. I came to check in and a nice guy was at the desk, there was a lady next to him by the name of Nina who sadly was the manager! She already looked pissed about something, she didn't smile or say "I'll be right with you. " I also work in hotels and this is VITAL in customer service. She took my ID and asked if I had my CC. I said no because my friend was paying. She had this horrible attitude and said I can't check you in without a credit card. She looked so irritated like I had just killed her mom. I said ok and she quickly walked off and didn't even apologize or say I'm sorry I can't check you in. I'm pretty sure she expects that type of service from her employees so I expect it even more from a freaking manager. NINAIF you're reading you need to practice what you preach.

Hampton Hotel at Time Square was a wonderful experience. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was small, but clean, modern, and an updated bathroom. The room was very quiet and free breakfast was a bonus.

Other than not providing a protein with breakfast (like ever other Hampton Inn provides) the stay was sufficient. I'm not sure if this is a new trend for Hampton Inn (not serving bacon or sausage with breakfast) but either way I wasn't happy with that. The big reason why I became a Hampton Inn frequenter is the morning breakfast with bacon or sausage every morning. What happened? What is going on?

My husband and I brought our son and our son's two friends here for our son's 16th birthday last weekend, and it was quite nice. The location is great and the staff was VERY friendly and personable. The breakfast was better than average, but very crowded. The elevators weren't so great, however, because there's so many people and there are only two of them, resulting in long waits and cramped rides. Although clean, the room was probably the smallest Ive ever stayed in...and I go away frequently. When I say you can hardly walk in the room with two beds--I MEAN IT LITERALLY. Overall, it was a positive experience.

My adult daughter and I were extremely pleased with the quality of this hotel. Our double bed room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel provides a very nice complimentary breakfast (including make-it-yourself Belgium waffles along with a nice variety/selection of breakfast items). In addition to all the amenities (we didn't use the exercise facility, tho it seemed nice), the STAFF was GREAT! They were extremely accommodating and service-oriented, both at the front desk and in the breakfast area. We would definitely stay here again!

The hotel has 6 rooms on each floor and I believe there are 32 floors. I thought the rooms were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I stayed there 4 nights and found every staff member to very friendly, helpful and courteous. One night we were in a rush to get to a play ate at the Mercato restaurant which is across the street. I wish we had not have had to rush as the food was very reasonable and authentic Italian. I would stay there again.

We enjoyed this hotel. Noticed right away how clean everything was. Very convenient to Time Squre and the subway. Room was very quiet. Loved the complimentary breakfast. Only con would be that the room had slight odor which I think was coming from vent/air conditioning system but not too bad and very small for four people, we had a hard time to find room for 4 suitcases. Also, a refrigerator would have been helpful.

Before reserving a room in New York City, I checked both Yelp and Trip Advisor reviews of the Hampton Inn Manhattan hotel. After spending two nights at this property, I can affirm a 5.0 rating is warranted for both living conditions and staff. First, the Desk CSR made the check-in seamless. The day manager- Elizabeth - was very cool. I forgot some paperwork she help me recover. The food staff did a wonderful job providing breakfast. The breakfast manager, young woman - made every effort to ensure the food was fresh and well presented. Well done.Lastly, the room was clean, comfort, even though a bit small for me. The bed was of good quality. This hotel provided pillows of different softness levels.I did use the workout room. Same as the rest - dumbbells' and stair step machines - no wow factor to report. Considering the location to local food stops, I give this property and overall - 4.5.

The customer service was great. Chris, front desk, provided the best customer service and I was pleasantly surprised considering this is New York. It was appreciated. The hotel room overall was just too confining. Not so much from the inside of the room but the hallway to the room and the elevators were scary in the sense that it just took way too long to get up and down the stairs before check out. There was a bit of an ant problem in the room as well.

One of the worst hotel experiences I have had in my many travels. I paid extra for a city view room, which I did not receive and when I questioned why I was told that nothing could be done and I'd have to call hilton to discuss any kind of refund. The staff were all extremely rude and unhelpful our whole stay.

We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay - room was beautiful, clean and comfortable and we had everything plus without having to ask. Staff was wonderful, price was great! Location just 2 blocks from Times Square.

I was here for a couple of nights and was very pleased. It was my first time at a Hampton Inn hotel. The room was not big (as expected, since it's NY), but it was well taken care of and clean. There was a weird smell in my room when I first got in (as if it was damp), and that got reported to the staff - it went away during my stay. The staff, by the way, are the stars here. Breakfast was busy, but the food was very tasty. My only complaint would be the elevators. The hotel has 32 floors, and only two elevators - guests have to form a line down at the lobby while waiting for an elevator. If you are at your floor, chances are you will wait a good 5 minutes before the elevator arrives, and going down the stairs is not really an option when you are at the 22nd floor. Overall, very pleased.

I know there are bigger and better hotels in NYC, but you will never find a more dedicated and accommodating staff than here. The rooms were a little small, but they were very clean, and provided anything you could need for a visit. Just a few who made this an incredible experience - Nelson, Alex, Wellington, Jefferson, Chris - many more that I can't remember. Breakfast was decent, area clean and well kept. Loved the 24-hour coffee! Would definitely recommend!

We chose this Hampton Inn for its location. We were on a family trip to see a play and sightsee. We were very happy with our choice. While the rooms were cozy, they were very clean. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful. It is a big plus to have breakfast included and that staff really worked hard to keep up with the demand and were pleasant about it. We have stayed in many Hampton Inns and this is one of the best.

I loved my stay in this hotel. Hampton always provides me with comfortable accommodations and a fair price, even for a night in Times Square!! Everything was great and I was very pleased with my stay.

We had a wonderful time visiting NYC as a family and were very comfortable at the Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square South. Every staff member we spoke to was friendly and eager to help!The location is very good, as it's close to all the fun but far enough away to not get caught up in the middle of too much chaos. It's certainly within walking distance of places like Times Square, the subway, theaters, and many restaurants!Valet parking was easy enough, just be sure to remember to grab EVERYTHING you need from your car because you won't see it again until you check out. The valet crew help get your bags in the door to the counter as well. The only negative here was that when we got the car back after check-out, there were hand prints on the outside and every setting on the car had been changed -- seats, rearview mirror, sideview mirrors, navigation system view, radio stations/settings....anything that could be changed was changed. Not a big deal, mind you, but it stuck out because it was the ONLY thing that "bugged" us during the entire stay.Check-in was very easy and quick and the room was much larger than we expected. It was very clean and the accommodations were more than satisfactory, especially for NYC. There was hardly any noise at night and we had no problem sleeping. We came back to a neat clean room every day and it was very well maintained.The free breakfast was good...good selection of healthy food and fresh fruit to go with the usual fare. The space is small and crowded, but if you're patient you'll be fine. The staff worked very hard to keep the food stocked and the room clean.While we were there, my 11yo daughter purchased a bracelet at the Hunger Games Exhibition, which she left behind in the room. I called when we got home and got a call back from Housekeeping Manager Marlene Garcia. She had found the bracelet and put it in the safe for us. She then went out of her way to help get the bracelet returned to us and kept in touch with us via email throughout the process. Her diligence seemed typical of what we experienced with all the staff at the Hampton Inn, but I still wanted to single her out for the great care she showed for a guest's happiness. Thank you, Marlene, for capping off a wonderful stay!

A friend and I took a trip to NYC this weekend. We got a great deal on this hotel on hoteltonight. Our check in was excellent, we were greeted by very friendly staff in an air conditioned lobby. We made our way to our room on the 26th floor. We expected a tiny room in NYC and were pleasantly surprised with a good sized room that was very very clean. After a long day walking around the city, the comfortable bed and well air conditioned room was paradise. It is in a great location close to times square and easy access to the metro. We checked out and they happily kept our luggage until we were ready to leave the city later that day. We will be staying here again. Sending a thank you to the wonderful staff, keep up the good work!

This hotel is so so conveniently located and the staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. They answered all of our questions and provided valuable advice for restaurants and transportation options. The breakfast gave us a great start to our day and the cookies in the afternoon were the best.

Stayed here overnight, close to Port Authority bus terminal and subways and local buses. Also close to times Square and Broadway theaters. Room (9th floor) was very quiet, and there was a good free breakfast including make your own waffles!

Hotel is in a good location and decently priced. Elevators take FOREVER, had to wait 30 min at some times to get on. Breakfast area is over crowded and also takes forever. Called for extra towels and washcloths and they said "they were all out."

Was in a great location, very central , clean and excellent Service.The room was clean and very functional , bathroom and toiletteries were provided. Breakfast was very good. Hotel had lots of facilities and parking was available if needed

The staff was very courteous and helpful. The luggage storage was a valuable service as we arrived early and departed late. Rooms (like most in Manhattan), were on the smallish side but we only used them for sleeping. I would recommend and most likely stay again.

Hotel was a great place to stay. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was good and we loved the breakfast to go bags. Very clean. Close to everything we planned on visiting.

This hotel is great for business or leisure. The staff is friendly and helpful. Check in and check out were easy. The rooms are clean. Great amenities. I do not recommend using the airport transfer company located in the lobby.

This is a great hotel. If you are wanting to stay in the Times Square Area, this hotel provides you great value. For NYC, the Hampton Inn has good sized rooms. Only six rooms to a floor and it's very quiet. The staff is friendly and the breakfast is good. If you go to NYC, you are normally only sleeping in your room, so for my wife and I this will be our hotel of choice moving forward.

Nice services from a nice small hotel near the center of NYC. Convenient location. Like the breakfast. Staff is friendly. Bla bla bla...afdlkjadslfjkdsfldjfsadflkjfds to meet ridiculous min 200-chars requirements ;-)

I'm a Hilton HHonors member.I booked the Hampton inn times square south for a business trip between the 11-17 of July 2015, and up to now it is the worst experience ever.I arrived to the hotel at 06:00am after 12 hours flight, and though I knew I couldn't check-in yet, I asked if it was possible to get a room early. After 7.5 hours of waiting at 1:30pm I asked again if someone can help me, and this time to my surprise an empty room was available. No one called me though I left my number.Entering the room I noticed it was in poor condition, paint pealing off the closets, the night dresser and the table completely scratched. I needed to bend over to get into the bath because a rode is low, and the entrance to the bath is narrow (I have pictures of everything). I talked with the front desk on the condition of the room and suggested to renovate after I will check-out. I compared the room condition to another Hampton inn I usually stay in. To my surprise the front desk staff told me that maybe the other Hampton inn hotel is newer. I don't understand the reasoning behind the answer, if this hotel is older it means the rooms needs to be in a poor condition? Needless to say it appears that the front desk staff are aware of the rooms condition.I went out to the city, and when I got back, I went into bed just to discover that the bed is completely wet. Yes wet, and not a small spot, quarter of the bed. Housekeeping came, verified and suggested to flip over the mattress, to which I said no and that I want another mattress. Housekeeping told me they don't have another mattress, so I asked for another room.The hotel is now moving me to another room, but I decided that I don't want to stay at this hotel, and started looking for another hotel.Hilton customer service helped me cancel my reservation and moved me to another Hampton inn which is very comfortable and clean.If any guest is now staying at room 2706, and is reading this message, I suggest you look at your mattress, it is wet underneath,

Very small rooms! This is an old hotel remodeled nicely, but the spaces are all very small! The front desk gentlemen are as nice as they can be! The rooms are not as clean as I would have liked! It is not located conveniently to the subway either. We probably won't stay here again!

Staff was extremely friendly and was very flexible. Although I couldn't Check in early, I was offered the breakfast.Location is great - 15 minutes walk to towns squareThe only problem was the elevators- only 2 for a hotel with 30 floors + serviceI had a great experience and would go back

Very close to 42 st subway and major attractions like Madam Tussads, Ripley's, Times square, etc . Rooms were small but were very clean. Breakfast was excellent with multiple choices. Staff was courteous and helpful.

This is my fourth stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South hotel. I’ve had some really good stays in the past but on this visit the level of service has gone downhill. The bed sheets and mattress were not very comfortable this time as they felt a little scratchy and lumpy. There were two people (my husband and I) and we were given only one set of towels to use. I requested another set of towels 4 times in one day and we did not receive towels until after 10:00 PM at night. It should not have taken all day to receive new towels. The elevators were very slow and always crowded. Fortunately my husband did not have any plans to go out during the day at the time these requests were made. We finally received our towels and all was well. Overall the hotel is clean, bathroom in room was clean and we were given cookies in the afternoon. The location is simply perfect to Times Square and subway stations! Although this hotel was not a complete disappointment, I think it’s time to explore other hotels on our next visit to New York City.

We arrived early and no rooms were available for early check in. The staff was polite and professional, stored our luggage and promised to call my cell if early check in became available. The call did come at 2pm but not to my cell even though my family back home gave my cell number again to the Hampton employee. The room was very clean and very small with 2 double beds. There are 4 rooms per floor so it was very quiet . The breakfasts were plentiful and good. the lemon aid and cookies turned out to be essence of lemon water and cookie crumbs. We made several trips down but still no cookies. the day before check out we asked if a taxi could be arranged for us for 5:30am, we were told no we would have to go out and find one on the Avenue. The concierge offered to book us a very expensive car service but we declined. The morning we checked out we rolled our luggage a long ways to the Avenue where we immediately found a cab with a very polite driver. We arrived at JFK in plenty of time and still saved $20 after giving a generous tip.

Great inexpensive room. No complaints at all. Great location close to everything. Easy check in. Free wifi. Very nice staff. Would stay here again next visit to New York City. Centrally located to everything

I can't say enough about the cleanliness, the helpful and friendly staff and the fabulous breakfast. My only complaint wd be that the rooms are small. I wd stay here again in a heartbeat! Good location.

This location claims to be wheelchair accessible however if you are in a slightly wide chair it may be difficult to maneuver around in the hallways leading to the elevators and to your room as this building is made oddly with narrow hallways.

very good for us, specially the location and free breakfast.The costs are also good and fare.However, the room is not so wide, relatively narrow for two persons to stay more than two days.Staffs are very welcome.

I booked this hotel after much deliberation ... I was so glad I did!!!I came for my sons special birthday and upon check-in the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and did all they could and gave us a fantastic room.It was on a high floor and had views of the Empire State Building - how amazing!!!I was really pleasantly surprised with the room .. It was perfect... Very cosy, modern and clean with 2 double beds. The bathroom was of a high standard too and it was a pleasure to come back to the room and collapse after a long day sight-seeing. A nice touch was that breakfast was included in the stay which I believe is unusual in New York. We loved it as there was a great selection of everything you could possibly want. Breakfast was served in a slightly cramped section on the ground floor but it was fine, very practical and all food was yummy.The foyer of the hotel was lovely too, relaxing with fab air conditioning.The location of the hotel was great.. We were able to walk a few blocks to Times Square without getting lost, I wouldn't like to be any further out - it was just the perfect distance.I would definitely recommend staying here if your looking for a clean and friendly hotel in a good location - I will definately be returning to this hotel and especially would like to thank the staff for helping make our stay so memorable with such a lovely room.

If you want a practical place to stay within a 5-10 minute walk of a huge number of theaters (and Penn Station), this is a great place to stay. It's a perfect place for people who are practical - a reasonable price for an excellent location.

This hotel is or rfectly located 4 blocks from the Javits Center. Easy walking distance to Times Square and Madison Square Garden. Room was small but very clean. Full breakfast is served every morning. Very convenient. Nice staff.

Just finished a 5 night stay with a family of 4. Very small room with 2 double beds, was difficult to move around the room with 4 people in it but we made it work which I guess can be expected in NY. Although the room was very clean. Location was perfect, a few blocks & easy walk to Times Square near several subway stations but just far enough away to get some peace & quiet at night. Would have given this hotel 4 or 5 stars but the breakfast & elevator situations were crazy. Waited long periods of time everyday for an elevator. It became a game for our kids to guess which elevator would open & have enough space for us to get in. Breakfast area was over crowded & unsafe. Never a place to sit & eat unless you got up at the crack of dawn & who wants to do that on vacation. For some reason they felt it necessary to mop the floors in the breakfast area during the rush every day we were there so trying to carry your plate through a crowd of people on wet floors was quite fun. Breakfast food was ok but not great. Better space planning in the breakfast area would have things flowing much better. If they could figure out the elevator & breakfast situation this would be a much better hotel. If you stay request a room on a lower floor so you can take the stairs & avoid the elevators. Front desk staff was friendly and always greeted us on our way in & out. However the concierge was not very helpful with directions & wasn't even familiar with some popular NY attractions. Luckily the provided map was all we needed to find our way. Also be aware we used the hotels parking garage valet (they contract with) at $55 a night and some cell phone chargers were missing from our car when it was returned to us. I guess we learned our lesson not to leave anything in the car.

Nice little hotel. Clean with decent breakfast and free wifi in good district. The breakfast area is small, so come down early to avoid lines and absence of sitting places. The room is really small. You can only sleep there. No fridge in the room. Water and ice on some floors. Two elevators were not enough during check out hours. The floor in the bathroom is too cold - the air conditioning is just perfect. In general it was ok but rather expensive.

Stayed 4 nights during a busy convention period -- at an extremely high tariff. But the hotel was full of teenagers, often sitting on the floor directly in front of the (inadequate) elevators. Expect a mob scene.

We stayed in a two double bed suite also listed as accessible. Plenty of room for all four of us. The employees we fantastic, room clean and updated and all in a great location! We will for sure be back and highly recommend for families all trying to pack in the same room.

Clean but small rooms in a convenient midtown location. Service is very good and the attendants at the desk were always smiling and helpful....Free breakfast was ok but nothing spectacular....very tight dining tables and limited space to eat so most times we went out to eat breakfast....

The service is excellent, especially at the front desk. Very good location, subway, banks and restaurant are near, . At the check out time, the elevator service is very slow. At the end of the day, I will return

As others said the rooms are small, but they are clean and up-to-date. The location is perfect for seeing a show, visiting Times Square, and dining out. We walked almost everywhere. We stayed on an upper floor and had no issues with noise - not sure about lower floors.

We came to New York from England to celebrate my 21st birthday back in February! We landed into Newark and took a half an hour cab ride to the hotel!The reception staff were very welcoming and kindly upgraded us to a suite, we were very happy about this!It was extremely cold in New York at this time, and we spent most of our week in the room. The breakfast was okay, the dining area is quite small and when it's busy can be quite a bit of bedlam to get around. The cleaning staff were lovely and they even left me a flower shaped towel with one of my birthday cards in and a note saying 'Happy Birthday!' - it was a lovely touch!The staff always helped us when we had questions about where to find things and good places to eat!We will be returning again 100% and we can't wait!

Very convenient location, mainly for those who do enjoy the Times Square area. Very professional, and friendly, staff. Rooms are somehow small, but this is Manhattan..... I always stay in this hotel when on business in Manhattan, except when no rooms are available......

New York hotels are known for being small. But, this hotel is absolutely tiny. That being said, the location is perfect! And, the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Aside from the size of the hotel room, I was a little disappointed that we did not have a fridge or microwave. I have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn previously, and I was hoping to have some of the same perks here. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case. All in all, the property is very clean, the staff is good and the location is great. It's a solid 3.5-4.

Great experience overall. The staff was very accommodating. You could tell they genuinely strived to earn your business. Short walk to Javits Center which is why we were there. Only problem we experienced was Saturday breakfast. Breakfast is from 6-10, we showed up at 9:35 and the food choices left were extremely slim. There was a line of people pretty much waiting for any type of food. I asked the staff what happened, where is the food, they were professional and handled my agitation correctly but said they weren't expecting that many people. I chose this hotel because of breakfast being included and felt shorted by subpar breakfast that morning. Doesn't front desk know how many people are staying so they can properly prepare for breakfast?

The rooms were neat, fresh, and clean... small but that is NYC.Only issues were the concierge was not knowledgeable about NYC info., she had no idea on how to get to Mets stadium (we already had tickets just needed guidance on subway), in fact, she kept asking if we wanted to go to the Yankee stadium, almost like she didn't even know there was another team. We felt that her knowledge of NYC was very limited.The breakfast area was so crowded... not enough room to sit for the number of guests.Other than those issues, it was a wonderful trip and a great place to stay

Our family was staying in NYC for 3 days. The hotel is close to everything yet away from the craziness of times square. From the moment we arrived the staff was awesome. We arrived early so they immediately offered to store our bags so that we could begin sightseeing. Everyone was super helpful from the front desk personnel to the guys storing the bags. Would definitely stay there again.

Convenient location for mid-town, and not surprised by how small the room is, which was very neat and clean and met our needs for the one night. However, trying to go down on the elevator the next morning was a nightmare and it took about 45 minutes to get down. The only way we got down is to take an elevator to the top of the building and stop on every floor on the way down. Given the number of rooms and floors, the elevator system, public areas and especially the breakfast areas are hopelessly inadequate. If there were ever a fire in this hotel, we doubt everyone could get out alive. The breakfast was the most disgusting we ever tried and we threw it out. We've stayed in Hampton Inns in many locations where we will return, but not here. Guess you get what you pay for.

We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, breakfast was good and had a great variety to choose from, and the staff was very nice. A special shout out to a couple of employees who went above and beyond to make our mini vacation enjoyable: Chris who was very helpful and patient with whatever questions we had about food, directions, and entertainment, and a special thank you to Alex who stored our luggage and helped us with last minute details the last day of our vacation. We would definitely stay here again.

Very convenient to everything. If you want to travel north to say Central Park or down south to the Freedom Tower, or to any other borough, just catch the subway around the corner and up about 1-2 blocks. The entire staff we encountered at Hampton Inn Manhattan were very very helpful, nice, and friendly.

I would really give this rating a 3+ or a 4- if I could. Our room was very small but I have been told that many rooms in NYC are small. The bathroom counter wasn't much bigger than the sink and could hardly hold anything. The bed was comfortable, it was very clean, and on the 10th floor wasn't very noisy. The breakfast was slightly better than most motel/hotels. the room was very crowded. The people at the front desk were very friendly. We couldn't get in our room late one afternoon and it took awhile for someone to fix our door. The front dest came us some free water and snacks for our patients. the location is good. Had we known, we would have taken a bus from Laguardia to the Port authority bus terminal and walked to the hotel. The hotel is in the garment district and a little away from the theatre area but certainly close enough to walk. Our main problem is the lack of hep we got from the concierge desk. We asked a young lady with very blonde hair about restaurants in the area and she started looking on Trip Advisor. We can do that ourselves. Then a young fellow from Ecuador was at the desk the next two days and appeared as he he didn't want to be bothered. We asked him what subway to take to the 9/11 memorial. He gave us the wrong information. Then we booked a van to take us to Kennedy airport the next day . When the van didn't show up he got us a cab but told the driver to take us to Laguardia even though we had told him Kennedy. We didn't hear him tell the driver that and so we went to Laguardia. Fortunately everything worked out okay. Maybe these were new people but they were of NO help! If we go to NYC again, we might stay here.

The only "complaint" I would submit is the size of the lobby and breakfast area. The rooms are comfortable, the staff is very nice, especially Chris and the hotel is clean. Location is excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

Accomodations, people, location, amenities, ect. were great. Would definitely stay again. Very close to the things I needed and very convenient. Staff was very helpful, polite and professional. The fitness room wasn't great, but it at least provided something.

The room was clean and quiet. people from the reception were very helpful. I would suggest to improve the food supply in the morning. I waited 15 minutes for scramble eggs. By the way, I really like the complimentary big red apples!

This place was not bad but the rooms were very small. The location was excellent and the staff were very helpful. They tried to accommodate with each request. The location to everything was really great. After a long day of site seeing it was nice to be able to walk back to the hotel.

Wellington and Chris were the best. Friendly welcoming and informative. Room s small but very clean nd comfortable. Hope to get to see these folks again. Having coffee t all hours was a bonus. Breakfast was just ok.

Unfortunately we were only there for one night - but it was such a great stay! Check in with Chris was flawless - he was my go to person with anything I needed throughout the stay and was able to help me with a smile! He had such a wonderful personality and you could truly say that he loves his job from how well he took care of me and the guests around me! Thank You So Much(:

I would want to start my review by saying a big thank you to the fabulous staff this property has. Alex, Nelson , Chris , Alma Tatiana just to name a few. We were staying at Marriot for first 3 days of our trip, where we were just a number. We were at Hampton only for last 2 days, since Marriot was sold out.From the time we walked in Alma approached us with map and offered us all services and gave us idea about the surrounding. The front desk staff checked us in and gave us the room earlier than the regular check in time. Next day we had complimentary breakfast, which was not offered at Marriot. Additionally we booked tickets for Jersey Boys with the concierge only for $ 129, where we were quoted $ 189 at Marriot.When we checked out Alex stored our luggage and also helped us to sort out our transfer, with the concierge team, which arrived on time.In all, this hotel is a hidden Gem just few blocks away from Times Square. Sometimes as a tourist we choose the big name huge hotel, but staying in this small hotel made me feel more special. I will recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

I just stayed here on Sunday night - I have stayed in many hotels in NYC especially in the Times Square area, and let me tell you, I have paid a lot more and been a lot less satisfied with hotels in NYC. The service here is exceptional. I agree with the other reviews that Nelson was great, and even Alexander in the breakfast room was very friendly and concerned with our satisfaction. The rooms are clean and have just what you need in them. We even used the iron and ironing board! People say they are small, but this is NYC, what do they expect? For NYC these rooms are an excellent size for the price. And you can't beat the included breakfast - hot and cold, everything you could want. Also, the valet parking is prompt and excellent. It's worth the price in this neighborhood if you come by car.If I wanted to find a downside it was that our room did not have any view whatsoever, but we didn't choose a room with a view nor pay for one. We didn't need one anyway, so we weren't disappointed at all. The one thing that amazed me is that even though we were right next to the elevator we didn't hear it at all. You could hear it a tiny bit in the bathroom but not in the main room. Next time I want to stay in NYC I will definitely seek out this hotel.

We arrived before check in and the hotel was able to store our luggage for us. We had great service and friendliness from the front desk and staff, but we got a call at 11:05 at night from the front desk, which woke us up. The housekeeping was a little slow when we asked for a blanket in the evening. The concierge needs to be more organized. Special thanks to the lovely girls Amanda and Jasmine in the breakfast area for the wonderful breakfast on Saturday and Sunday when it was very busy. They did an amazing job to try and help everyone while food was being prepared and heated up to be served. I would recommend the hotel and hot breakfast.

My actual stay was awesome!Hotel's direct staff was more than accommodating, starting with Chris with a hassle free check-in, then with Georgia after a late night on the town who was an absolute doll! Ending with Nelson who displayed nothing but professionalism while dealing with an irate customer. Now on to the RUDE,CURT & NOT so friendly CONCIERGE! The (male),who was there on 6/22... I stopped by to obtain additional info on a Broadway Show & the customer service he provided was horrible!!!! This person talked down to me & made me feel as if I was beneath him. His lack of customer service & tact really pissed me off, & I did not appreciate it. RM

We arrived to the Hampton Inn Times Square South mid-morning where we were greeted by Nelson at the front desk. He was very welcoming to us, Southerners coming to the big city. Right away he offered to hold our baggage since our room was not yet ready. David (I think that was his name) took our bags and assured us that he would take great care of them. Nelson proceeded to whip out a NYC map and showed us where to go, and recommended a few places to eat--all of which were EXCELLENT. He told us how to navigate the subway which was also very helpful. Thank you for the warm welcome and helpful hints.The hotel itself was very clean. The breakfast bar had a large variety of items...more than your average continental breakfast. We, unfortunately, did not have a place to sit since it was a little busy but all was well. The rooms and hallways are quite small and narrow..but that comes with the nature of NYC. The views arent all that spetacular since the hotel is located along a side street, but one cannot be too picky when staying in the middle of a concrete jungle. The location of the hotel is not too bad. Its off the beaten path a little bit, but you can still be in Time Square in a matter of minutes. I, personally, enjoyed being off the beaten path a little bit because A) less people traffic B) less car traffic and C) its much quieter. The hotel is just down the street from the famous Carlos Bakery (for you Cake Boss Fans). It is also about a 10 minute walk to get to the Highline--an elevated park/pathway that leads you right into the Chelsea Market (very cool place to see and visit). Overall we had a great experience at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. If you dont mind being off the beaten path by a block or two, then i would recommend this hotel. I have nothing bad to say about it. The service was great, the concierge was kind enough to arrange a car to take us to La Guardia for our flight out, and even had it there early. Thank You Hampton Inn TS/S...we will be back :)

I was pretty sure it was not going to be a good review when I first went in to my room because it was kinda small for my liking. After three days my attitude has changed. Very clean rooms, every one seemed like they were really interested in making our stay the best it could be. A short walk to theatre district and Times Square . I give them a thumbs up.

very nice people, helpfull hotel staff, clean room, great location, tasty breakfast, easy to get to the airport by hotel transport, not expensive stay, we will pick the hotel the next time we arrive, NY is great

The hotel staff was beyond pleasant, especially Nelson! He was so helpful and kind and really took his time with each customer. The complimentary breakfast was spectacular as well! The bellboys were so nice as well. Our only complaints were that we wished there was room service and the rooms were bigger!

I found the staff at this hotel to be outstanding and friendly. I was traveling alone on business, and it was so nice to be greeted when I walked in and made to feel at home! My room was compact but put together very well. The space was very well-utilized. I had everything I needed, free wi-fi, clean room, comfortable bed!!

The hotel is clean, updated, and very close to Javits Center for convenient walking. 5 days we had the same breakfast; fried potatoes, scrambled egg, oatmeal or waffle. The egg did change shape two times to a half moon shape.

The entire hotel staff is courteous and helpful, they go out of their ways to help customers. The rooms are small but very clean, very comfortable beds, a good variety of breakfast options. Free coffee and hot chocolate all day.

Eclectic neighborhood off of Times Square - kind of like before it went Disney. Close to Broadway theaters and subway to Chelsea/West Village. Elevators (2 for 30+ floors) can be hard to come by at times. Breakfast is wall to wall during peak. Very cramped but this is Manhattan after all.

The hotel is located very close to Times Square, Port Authority and A,C,E subway. Makes it convenient to commute. Complimentary breakfast was good too. Free coffee, hot chocolate and apples. One thing where the hotel fell short was the room space. The rooms are a bit cramped.

I'll never stay anywhere else! The staff there are the best there ever was. The breakfast is amazing. The location can't be beat. I highly recommend this hotel at this location. I can't wait to plan another trip!

Nice hotel although the rooms a bit small which isn't all that unusual for NYC. Only 6 rooms on each floor so you are pretty close to the elevator. Staff was great, friendly with excellent service. The breakfast staff, especially Alex, was terrific. They stopped serving fresh fruit at 9AM but Alex offered to go to the kitchen and cut some for me. Hotel a bit of a walk to Times Square. Convenient to subway

Picked this location to be close to points of interest in NYC. The location is really suited well for that. Space is a premium in NYC. We paid $55 per day for parking. That was not bad for an SUV. Most nearby parking garages charge that and then add on a $15 to $20 over sized vehicle charge for SUVs. The Hampton Inn valet parked our vehicle, but be advised there are not in/out priviledges with this parking. We didn't care since we used public transportation when needed. The hotel staff are very attentive, the free breakfast was kept well stocked, and the whole place was very clean inside. Cleanliness outside was another thing, but that's NYC. Room are the smallest I've ever stayed in. Our window looked out into the side of another building. No microwave, no refridgerator. Very limited space for luggage. The location felt safe, the price was right, and ease of access to the offerings of NYC was just what my family needed.

The hotel is very close to most attractions. The room was always clean and all the staff are friendly, polite and very accommodating. However, am not sure if the small counter arranging transportation is part of the hotel because we had a very unpleasant experience with them. The transportation we paid for was not provided for us and we almost got late going to JFK airport. The staff there were very inefficient.

We had a wonderful time in New York The Hampton Inn South was great. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The room was quiet ad the beds were extremely comfortable. Be prepare for small rooms but everything you need is provided in that room. The rooms are clean and comfortable for their size. During peak hours it is sometimes a long wait for the elevator and the room Wi Fi is not great but those would be my only 2 complaints. There are computers on the main floor that are free to use. I enjoyed the location. We could walk to Times Square , the Subway and the Hop on Hop off buss and many other places. Two restaurants that were fabulous were: Nan Kings, an amazing Thai restaurant in the Times Square area ( they have an awesome $16 meal and $2 beer before 6pm) , be sure to try it as well as the Star Dust Diner with the singing waiters/waitresses,( also in the same area). Both have great food at a reasonable price! Get your Broadway show same day at the TKTS in Times Square and save 50% on your tickets. Phantom of the Opera and Jersey Boys were spectacular. Thank you Hampton Inn for a great place to stay and always being so friendly and helpful!

Great location! Close to Times Square, bus Station and Showrooms. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to store our luggage there all day after we checked out. Nice complimentary breakfast! Hotel rooms were a little on the small side but very clean and comfortable. Great air-conditioner!

Had issues here in terms of housekeeping and breakfast variety however the General Manager explained the situation (issues with their oven) and staff training to my satisfaction. Would stay here again. Location very good (relative to Javits Center) and quality of accommodations.

My friend and I took our daughters to New York and stayed at this hotel for one night.It was located few blocks away from Time Square (about 15-20 min. walk).The room was small but clean, modern and well organized.Complimentary breakfast was not remarkable but above average.Front desk personnel was polite and efficient.Over all, I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

We stayed here while attending a conference. After being delayed 6+ hrs getting in we were exhausted and just ready to crash. The front desk lady was rude and unfriendly and unhelpful. The next day we had great interactions with the man at the front desk who fixed the issues we'd had from checking in. Then as we were just leaving the same lady was at the front desk and she was again horribly rude - defiantly not suited for the hospitality industry.Pros: close to convention center & downtown, low priceCons: part of the staff are horribly rude, uncomfortable beds, noisy at night (you can hear your neighbors coming and going)

Not my favorite area of NY,, the street can give a bad impression,, but that is NY.THe hotel was a great surprise. The staff is young and incredibly polite, professional and very helpful. I had a maintenance issue and it was handled very, very well.The rooms are very nice (though they should clean the outside windows!!) and quite.Breakfast is better than most that are included in the price.I will definitely return.

Hotel room smelled like a dirty sneaker. I didn't move because I didn't have time- had a meeting to go to. When I got back, I was exhauste- it was late. In addition they do not have room darkening curtains so at night I could see through the windows of other hotel rooms. I will not stay here again.

I read the reviews and as usual, they were all over the board but overall pretty good. I would give this hotel an outstanding rating - especially for the price. We wanted to be near Broadway & the Theater District. It was a short walk. Part of the walk was through quaint neighborhoods with neighborhood eating places. The breakfast offered a good variety. Sometimes it was congested but there really was a lot of seating area for the size of the hotel and the hotel was almost sold out. Our room was small but it was well designed to utilize space and storage. Our family of three was very comfortable. We did have a bit of trouble keeping the temperature where we needed it. A little too cold but that was preferable to too warm. We could have used another thin blanket as the comforter was heavy and too much but the sheet was not enough. The hot water could have been a little hotter but we never had a cold shower. Our room was in perfect order every time we came back. We usually left a little before lunch and came back in the late afternoon/early evening. We didn't not find it noisy. They had coffee downstairs 24 hours a day. We were there for my daughter's sweet 16 and the staff told her HBD all the time. They took pictures with her. They had warm cookies in the lobby in the late afternoon. The concierge was not much help. That wasn't a big deal for us but might be for someone. We love Hampton Inns and would stay there again.

I travel to NYC on business a few times a month and have stayed at more Hilton properties that I can remember. I tried this property and was pleasantly surprised. Very clean. Closer to 9th Ave so no impact of PABT. Great restaurants within a few blocks (around 43 and 10th).Most impressive is the way the staff greets you. Sincere and genuine. Chris at the front desk recommended a great restaurant and Jamal from maintenance was a huge help my 1st night. Customer service at it's best with each and every encounter. Thanks guys. I will return.

The hotel I was staying in had a fire and I needed to relocate. Since it was 10:30 p.m. I didn't want to go far or spend hours searching for the best deal. After trying about 6 other hotels in the same area, all booked solid, I finally landed at the Hampon inn. I told them the story of the fire and they were sympathetic until it came to the rate (I mean robbery). They charged me $421. Ok I get it, it's nyc, there's no rooms, so they have me over a barrel, fine. But the room I got #706 was the worst smelling room I've ever stayed in. Smelled like a canvas tent put away wet for a season. When I complained they said "sorry about that and we'll look into it" but didn't offer me any compensation. On the positive side it was better then sleeping in a burning hotel.

This was a most disappointing hotel experience. As a Hilton Honors member with nearly 100,000 points and many stays at Hiltons and Hampton Inns, this was the worst. My husband and I had recently (late March/early April) stayed at your nearby Hampton Inn that is near the Ed Sullivan Theater and it was great. I had stayed there before but we could not get a reservation there this time. So we chose this property. You may want to check it out Little comparison between these two Hampton properties! My goodness - nearly $800 for two nights! We expected more and better. Specifics: 1) Concierges - two (both international women) were terrible; barely spoke English; we asked for directions to Carmine's - did not know what "it" was(!) and had to look it up after we spelled it; had no real materials either at the concierge desk (small, cramped) and none in the room! One man at that post was helpful. 2) Breakfast - no meat (others always had have a meat selection), rubbery waffles (what was in the batter?), cold eggs, spicy potatoes; barely mediocre food. 3) Bathroom - dear God. No place to put toiletries except in the bureau drawers and by TV; no shower hats; had to ask for extra towels - only provided two - this is summer - sometimes people take >1 shower or use an extra towel for shampooed hair! The shower was barely 24" deep! 4) TV - what a disaster. Had to constantly click the remote - the "listing" provided in the room did not match the channels that were on the TV! 5) No amenities - no refrigerator or microwave - even a small one. Nothing to get in this hotel, like snacks or anything else except sodas (when machines were working). 6) Ice machine - was broken on our floor (10th) and had to travel to other 9) floors to get ice 7) Business office - could not get email there and was directed to another hotel a few doors away to use theirs! ??? 8) Luggage storage - for $800 we thought the least the hotel could do was to store our luggage and then retrieve it in a timely way. Hmm. It took nearly 15-20 minutes to relocate - we were due to get to our train. 9) Space - cramped halls (2 people could not easily get by each other), room was tiny and cramped as well. Overall, we were so disappointed - would like some kind of refund - this is not Hilton or Hampton quality. Will wait to hear from you. I called the first night to your national headquarters and reported many of these concerns. Was told to expect a call. Have nothing yet.

I like the hotel but the service was is worth mentioning, outstanding service and everyone there is trying to make your stay as comfortable as possible. the rooms are typical NYC size but will defiantly go again.

Good location slightly away from the huddle bustle of busy Times Sq. Great comfortable bed, quiet sleep, clean room, helpful staff breakfast included sufficient and good to grab and go would stay again

This place is definitely a place to stay but what makes it standout is that staff is the best I have ever had at any hotel ANYWHERE in the world. Kudos to all staff!I will recommend to friends and family and anyone who appreciates great service!

Yes the rooms are slightly on the small side but we managed fine (2 adults, 11year old and a 14 year old). Two double beds, bathroom and a view if the Statue of Liberty fantastic! The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Times Square and the subway and Broadway which is ideal for a first trip to NYC. The hotel is clean and has wifi which is a bonus, aswell as the breakfast which was ideal for a day of sightseeing. We got there for 7am the first day and it was quiet the second day we made it for 7.45 and it was on the busy side. The guests are both leisure and business so you'll find going for your breakfast either early or later the best options.If you like a bar and lounge area in your hotel this isn't for you, but if like us you were only there for breakfast and bed it makes the Ideal hotel for your stay.

Very friendly and helpful staff, conveniently located near Times Square (theaters and Shake Shack ☺️) and the subway, and clean, clean, clean! Would highly recommend it - we'll return on our next visit to NYC! A Hampton where the staff clearly takes pride in their work.

Booked as we landed in JFK and was ready by the time we arrived. We were in a bit of a rush and were worried we wouldn't make it to a show in time but the staff was very quick and helpful with checking us in. Took us less than 10 minutes from walking in, checking in, dropping out stuff off in the room and quickly leaving. Made it to our show with 15 minutes to spare. Stayed two nights and we were able to stow our luggage in the hotel after we checked out so we could stay in the city a little longer. The location was a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway, and Penn Station. We never had to take a taxi to anywhere. Clean but small rooms. Free complimentary breakfast too.

The hotel location is convenient from subway and times square. The rooms are small and you can hear the sound of elevator in your room. I am a hilton honors member and styed at hilton through out my trip but I didn't receive any facility (late checkout) execpt a warm welcome.

Very helpful and friendly staff. They are there whenever you needed them. We were extremely pleased to see such friendly and helpful staff in NY where these qualities are hard to find. Breakfast was very good and the staff in the breakfast area was always replenishing the food and helping the quests. Had a great stay.

The hotel rooms and showers are too small that you can't move or wash your body in shower without hitting your arms or elbows on the walls. Also, the hotel seemed a little bit understaffed that guests had to wait in line for quite some time before being checked in. The other major problem which is very common for most hotels in Manhattan is that the hotel has no hallways, as soon as you walk out of the elevators you are in front of the rooms which makes prone to noise. You can hear elevator's beeps and people talking while in and out of the elevators. Last but not least, the breakfast area is so tiny and has very limited choices. Not acceptable compared to other Hampton Inn hotels in the USA.

I have been staying at this location since it first opened back 5 or 6 years ago, 3 of 4 times a year. Excellent location for my line of work. The staff goes the extra mile to make you feel welcome, and constantly is ready to help in any way. I have come to know most of them by name. I specially appreciate Nelson, Chris, Jennifer and Nicole at the front desk. Johnny Proano in housekeeping is Mr Efficiency! But really everybody makes my stay a pleasure. Thank you all for your professional work.

The hotel is in Midtown Manhattan on W39th Street, close to its junction with 9th Avenue. This is a very central and handy location, with all the premier attractions and sites easily accessible by foot and subway (or taxi if you really like sitting in traffic). Each floor has just six rooms - there are, however, 32 floors. I would recommend the higher up the better. The staff are welcoming, friendly and helpful. We suffered a close family bereavement during our stay, which necessitated coming home early and the sympathetic help which we received from the staff was very comforting. Our room was absolutely fine for a big city hotel - compact with a huge, comfortable bed, free WiFi, a coffee maker, desk chair, armchair and bathroom supplies by Neutrogena. Complimentary tea and coffee are also available 24 hours a day to the rear of the ground floor lobby. Breakfast is included within the room tariff. The breakfast room is busy and can best be described as efficient and functional, with disposable plates, cups and cutlery. The range of food on offer provides good value for money: two hot items, porridge, cereals, various breads, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, juices and excellent DIY waffles. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for its convenience, as well as its efficient and helpful service. We would be happy to stay there again.

My sons and I stayed at the hotel for two days while visiting NY. From the moment we arrived, staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel was spotless and you could tell that staff took great pride in their jobs which made it easy to ask questions. They knew you by name and checked in often to see if you needed anything. It was a great experience and I can't wait to go back for another stay!

Clean, clean, clean!! The lobby, our room, the breakfast area were very nice and clean. Our room with two doubles was bigger than I expected. Very fresh and new, nothing felt outdated. Every single employee was super friendly, nice, helpful. I felt like we were staying with friends. Will absolutely stay here again.

As usual Hampton Inn did not disappoint. Rooms were very clean and actually larger than expected. Coffee in the lobby is delicious. That's important when visiting NYC. the only reason it did not get 5 stars is the horrible noise on the 16th floor staring around 5:30 am on a Saturday. Not sure what it was but it was impossible to sleep in, even til 7am.

In all of my travels I have never come across an establishment that had such superlative customer service. The staff was EXCEPTIONAL!!!! The friendliness, helpfulness, pleasantries, and kindness were a welcomed treat in a strange city with young children. Everyone on staff was terrific but there are several names that stand out! Wellington, Nicole, Ian, and Alexander are a true asset to this hotel!!! If for no other reason we would return to see them again! Nicole made it feel like home greeting us as soon as we came in or went out! Alexander was working breakfast like a champ and it was insanely busy and cramped ( he still greeted everyone and always had a smile). Ian and Wellington helped with everything they could even telling me to "relax, we will take care of it, you're on vacation". I can honestly tell you I'm very impressed!!!Naturally the rooms are small, but it's NYC. They were very clean, as was the rest of the hotel. There is a person at the entry way that provides maps, sightseeing attractions, and assistance that I found very helpful as well (loved this, as we didn't have to go seeking information all around the city with kids. The breakfast was great (both hot and cold foods). The door was locked at night and you need to use your room key to get in giving a sense of security in a big city. I cannot say enough about this location! Thank you for a wonderful stay! We will be seeing you again!!!!

My daughter & I stayed here for a business trip, and also saw a couple Broadway shows. The rooms were clean & comfortable. The best thing about our stay was one of the staff at the front desk, Nelson!! From the time we arrived, he was so friendly & helpful! I stay at a lot of Hampton/Hilton properties and his service was excellent! Made us feel at home & welcomed every time we returned! The concierge staff were not good. Asked one of the girls where to go for the TKST discount show ticket kiosk and she said there weren't discounted show tickets. Went back to Nelson & he helped us again.One night he even gave us complimentary snacks & soda. He was a stand-out employee & hopefully gets recognized! :)

Found a Groupon for a one night stay at $110 with fantastic breakfast just like any Hampton Inns around the country. Rooms are a little small compared to other Hampton Inns. Fantastic location within walking distance to Times Sq about 2-3 blocks away. Parking is expensive. Across the hotel is parking. 24 hours costs us $45. Park and use subway to travel around city and attractions. Bring comfortable shoes, lots of walking to do.

1st time visitor to New York. Stayed for 3 nights in April 2015. Two double rooms to accommodate me, my wife & our two teenage sons. Great location, near to Times Square and main attractions but away from lots of traffic noise. Staff very helpful & polite. Gave us good advice for using the local subway to get to Liberty Island ferry (from 42nd Street). Fair enough, the area around the lifts & the breakfast room is quite busy but not a major problem, just wait in line, no need to get up tight!I cannot compare room sizes but get the impression rooms in NY are not large, we were happy with our rooms, very clean, not cramped and beds comfortable. Free ice & water machine in hallway outside our room was handy. The complimentary breakfast was a bonus, quite basic but FREE so it would be unfair to complain about this. We used the Express bus from Newark Airport. This runs every 20 minutes & stops @ the nearby Port Authority building which is a short walk to the hotel. We found this to be the best and most cost effective way to transfer from & to the airport.We were very happy with this hotel and would reccommend as a good base for exploring mid town Manhattan.

I chose to stay here for 3 days while vacationing in NYC. The reason being it was the only one I found affordable and close to times square. I walked up to times square several times from here. I had booked a room for 4 which included 2 double beds. The rooms a very small, but are kept very clean and the bathroom was very well maintained. They offer great selection of complementary breakfast. tea/Coffee fruit juices, yogurts, sausages, boiled eggs, omelette, scrambled eggs, bacon, waffle, fruits! I mean they had everything to fill you up to start you day! The hotel staff were friendly, and always helpful. The only compliant I have is the tiny size of room.
