Went to NYC alone for a trade show and chose this hotel because of it's location, mid-range price and the fact that it is on the Javits Center shuttle route. It was a great choice. Close to the subway (which I used to/from JFK), and despite the shuttle, a comfortable and convenient walk to Javits. I was able to check my bag before I checked in to my room and spend my day at the trade show. The concierge helped me get tickets to see a show for the evening and suggested a couple of great restaurants. The room was clean and updated and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.

Very hospitable from the moment you walk in the lobby. They upgraded my room to a higher floor (30th floor) and stated that I would love the view....boy was he right!! The room was very clean and smelled fresh...I would most definitely stay here again!!

Clean room/ok location...but I saw student groups and asked to be put away from them or a low floor. Put on 20th floor with Loud Quebec kids. Plus 1 of 2 elevators out of service. When I tried to use elevator to leave no service at all!!! I had to call front desk to get elevator sent to me. What a joke. Employees/Housekeeping using/shut down one working elevator! I would not stay here again.

I've stayed here multiple times while in New York and it's always been a perfect option for me. Although the rooms are small this is the norm in midtown Manhattan unless you are looking to pay twice as much for a full-service hotel.Rooms are clean and organized. I usually have a king bed.... incredibly comfortable with crisp white sheets and great pillows. I've always had a great sleep here. Internet is free as is breakfast, both standard at Hampton.Location is great, within walking distance to all major Broadway theatres, and just a short walk to Port Authority on 42nd Street. You can easily access virtually every subway line from midtown so that's also a bonus as well if you're venturing away from the area. Jonathan at the front desk was warm and genuine at check-in, a great way to start my stay. With tens of thousands of hotel rooms in New York you can't ask for more than great staff and this hotel delivers.If you're looking for a mid-scale no-nonsense hotel, Hampton Inn is right for you.

This hotel was charming. Rooms were small but NY size. Clean newly renovated.Complimentary breakfast with waffles, eggs, etc. (Not just pastries) Hotel staff very friendly and accommodating. The location was wonderful. In walking distance but out of the busy traffic. Will go back!

This is very conveniently located. Access to Lincoln tunnel, times square is excellent. Times Square is walking distance. Nothing luxurious about the hotel - very functional. Buffet breakfast is good enough given that it is complimentary. I felt that they could introduce option for a hot breakfast item. even if on chargeable basis. Cleanliness was good. Staff was ok - some more eager to help than others. The big issue we had was room size - we had booked two queen bed room. After fitting two beds, there is hardly any space left in the room. so, I suggest against booking two bed rooms. Other than room size, things are fine. So, keep that in mind.

Very clean and large room for NYC. Friendly staff and nice and balanced breakfast to kick-off your day to an amazing start! Staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean. Hallways were small but the space saving for the rooms was perfect. Each floor has a ice machine that also has water so you can refill your water Bottles

Nice hotel at a very good rate. We thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms were nice and fresh as was the entire hotel. All people working there were very nice and went out of their way to help. We will return.

I was upgraded to a King room upon check-in in the 04 line. My room was totally smelly when I arrived but luckily the windows opened. After a few hours the smell was gone. I woke in the middle of the night and realized I had forgotten to draw the curtains. I dragged myself out of bed to close the blackout drapes and quickly realized that there were none! No way to shut out any light from the room. Forced myself to go back to sleep. Upon waking I went to take a shower. Lukewarm water - not at all pleasant. I went to the front desk where they were very nice. They took me to look at several other rooms. One smelled terrible and the other had no hot water. They've got some work to do at this hotel.

The hotel was very hospitable from the check in to checkuot. The location is perfect, the rooms were small but clean. The breakfast was very good and so was the staff. I love hampton Inns ...they always have the best service for the price

Visited this location for the first time (price was very competitive). Front desk staff was outgoing and genuine, made good conversation and made for a personal experience rather than scripted jabber while keys are pressed.The footprint of the hotel is small but has a large number of floors.Checked into a king room, housekeeping was very good, no sign of dirt, dust, bathroom was very clean, property feels well maintained.Furniture was a little lower end than expected but meets needs for most travelers.Breakfast area again is on the smaller side due to space restrictions. Felt that the offering was slimmer than other Hiltons and the single waffle iron can make for a very long line in the morning; the frustration exasperated by the limited choice of three healthy cereals. That being said, it's a free breakfast with some hot foods and coffee, a Hampton standard that you don't find in many places.Photos added.

Worked out well for us. Close to subway and theatre district. Very nice room with usual Hampton amenities. Excellent choices for breakfast, which was included. Not something you find with a NYC hotels.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and cozy. Rooms could be a bit bigger but it worked well for three of us. After all, this IS NYC. The breakfast every morning was a nice perk, too! Location was perfect for Times Square and Broadway shows!

This is a nice little hotel and a very good location and price for Manhattan. The building is actually 3 hotels which is why there are only 6 rooms to a floor.The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone greets you with a smile and they are eager to help in anyway. The desk clerks, bellmen, dining staff, repair men, concierge and the cleaning staff were all outstanding. Our room was clean but small but this didn’t matter, as we didn’t come to New York to sit in a hotel room anyway. The shower was the smallest I’ve seen since being on a cruise ship, but it was functional. Breakfast was fresh, hot and very good. The eating area is near the elevators so there is a lot of traffic in the narrow hallway in the mornings. Elevators can be a problem on busy mornings. We had to wait for a good while on Sunday morning to ride down and back to our room. All and all a very enjoyable stay.

Two tiny elevators. One not working. The other had to be run by a maintenance man. You had to call from your room to the desk to get the elevator. It took 15 minutes for it to come. Then they would over stuff the elevator. Poor breakfast. Poor room furniture. Smallest shower I've seen in Manhatten. Left a day early and they had the nerve to say"We're sorry you had these difficulties...because of that we won't charge you for the night that you are cancelling". WOW. No offer of reducing my rate or extra points. I stay in over 25 Hamptons a year. Never had a bad experience. Worst ever.

I'm used to regular Hampton's but this one is odd...We walked right past it and had to look at the map and building numbers to find this little hole in the wall. So, 1st tip, it's at 337 W. 39th Street, watch the numbers! It's located close enough to walk to everything, but if I had to walk outside at night with my family I might reconsider this location. The elevators are ok during slow times, but tough during busy times and they are located in a corridor that measures about 4' wide, so access kind of stinks. We had 3 sheets of kleenex in our box which should have been full, or had a new one available. I like Hampton's free breakfasts, and this one was on par with all Hampton's, except...the entire time I was in the dining room, there was an employee in, what I believe is, the kitchen coughing, and coughing, and coughing...Seriously??!?!? Overall, the front desk staff was excellent, the location, though slightly dicey was close to everything and the breakfast itself was fine. New York is so fun!

I have stayed at various Hampton Inn properties several times in the past, and I can usually rely on this brand to deliver good quality for my money. This property, however, was the exception. Shortly after checking into Room 306, we discovered a bed bug crawling on our mattress. I immediately contacted the front desk, and was told by Chris that an Engineer would need to come to our room to verify that there was a bug. . .AS IF WE WOULD LIE ABOUT SUCH A THING!!! After nearly 20 minutes with no appearance by this Engineer, I called the front desk again to inform them that we were in a hurry because we had dinner reservations. I was put on hold, and eventually I hung up after about 5 minutes with no answer. I went downstairs to the front desk, and only THEN did the front desk staff member (NOT Chris) take care of switching our room to the fifth floor. To make matters worse, only one of the two elevators serving the premises was operational, and it didn't appear that any effort was being made to make repairs. As a result, guests were forced to line up into the lobby and overflow breakfast seating area to wait for the only working elevator. The next morning, you could see the frustration in the faces of the housekeeping staff who were forced to wait FOREVER to be able to travel between floors with their carts. Suggestions for Management at HI Times Square South . . .FUMIGATE the ENTIRE 3rd floor (not just Room 306), teach your staff (particularly Chris) how to properly address guests' problems expeditiously and with courtesy, and for Pete's Sake, PUT ELEVATOR REPAIR AT THE TOP OF YOUR LIST OF PRIORITIES (RIGHT AFTER PEST CONTROL)!!!! P.S. --- We won't be returning to this property any time soon, and we will definitely think twice before booking another room at Hampton Inn ANYWHERE!

Location is great! 2 blocks from Penn Station, easy access from JFK and EWR. Free breakfast and wifi gets you up and running. Rooms are small and bathroom is adequate size. All clean and nice. Front desk is ready to help.

I just returned from a school trip and this hotel was everything we needed. The location is fantastic - close to Broadway, Times Square, MSG, and the subway. The staff was fantastic - friendly, helpful and very understanding. Aside from the small footprint of the room, everything was to the standards I've come to expect from a Hampton Inn. The beds are great, the sheets are comfortable, the free breakfast has plenty of choice, and the free WiFi is dependable. Our group appreciated the little touches like fresh fruit, cookies and complimentary coffee and tea all day. The only issues we had were with tight spaces and the wait for the elevator. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to explore Manhattan!

This hotel is great ! Friendly staff , clean and there is complimentary coffee , tea , snacks and games ! They offer continental breakfast with lots to choose from ! The room was on the small side but that's expected the beds were comfy. The location is great walking distance from msg/ penn station like a 1 min walk ! I would def stay here again !

The location is great, it's in the middle of Time Square and close to subway which worked very good for me and my friends. The rooms are small but I think that is the norm for NYC hotels. This was our first visit and the staff was super helpful, they gave us suggestions on places to go and provide good directions this made our trip a lot better than if we didn't have that extra help from the staff.

I stayed at the Hampton Inn from April 17-20 2015. The location is perfect. So close to Times Square, and the rooms are clean and the staff is so friendly and helpful. The two staff members that stick out for me are Chris and Nelson. Thank you so much to both of them for their help and kindness throughout our stay there!

I am pretty easy to please, I don't need much to make me happy- but when I checked into my room- it was barely nicer than a motel 6 room. The carpet was sticky and gross. The furnishings were dated and in bad shape from the years of wear and tear.No doubt this hotel is in need of a refresh. As a Hilton Honors diamond member, I know the good properties from the bad- this one is bad.

Having glanced at the other reviews on here, I'd say they are about right. This is a very small hotel, popular with tourists probably because of the location and breakfast included. That popularity means a long long for the just ok buffet breakfast. The rooms are a bit small, but ok. The staff was very nice. The most annoying part of my trip was waking up and running out of hot water 2 minutes into my shower (and the long breakfast line). I only stayed one night, and I suspect I just timed it poorly, but a hot shower is a must for me.

The location of the hotel is very fine, the service excellent, the breakfast and wi-fi are ncluded, the staff is very nice. Excellent experience, except for 2 things: the queue waiting for the elevator and the high price. But I do think that these two things are more related to New York than to this hotel!

If you're just looking for a bed and 4 walls, this is it. As soon as you walk into the hotel you can tell there is nothing great about the place. Uncomfortable beds, small rooms, NO VIEWS, tiny showers, 2 elevators but 1 always seems to be broken. Complimentary breakfast is nothing great and the hotel is not that close to the Time Square action as they try to make it out to be. Valet parking service is horrible, if you're on a schedule make sure you call the front-desk at least an hour in advance to get your car and follow up to make sure your car is on it's way as they seem to loose track. Staff seems like they want to help but inexperience, they either provide inconsistent info or they are running around trying to find someone else to get you answers....don't ask the same question to 2 different staff, you will most likely get 2 different but friendly answers.

The room was very, very small and so were the beds- compared to Texas- It was clean thought. Takes forever for an elevator during peak times but you could also take the stairs. Nice breakfast and very good location. The staff was very helpful. Just be prepared for the small room but I'd recommend the hotel. This was our first trip to NYC so we can't compare it to anything.

This is a 'sliver' -- 32 floors tall & only 6 rooms per floor. That means very, very quiet. Easy walk to the entire theater district.Subway access at 8th Avenue & 40th Street (hint: walk to the left of the crowd & like a local walk to the subway). FRIENDLY FRONT DESK STAFF.. "01" rooms are special....! Friendly 20-something guests at breakfast. Be prepared for a modest lobby, but you can fall in love with its modest size.

My first trip to the BIG APPLE went extremely well because of the friendliness & helpfulness of the staff at The Hampton Inn on 39th!First trip to New York City so I expected smaller rooms & for it to be a little cramped, but to my surprise booking the two double beds was perfect for what my boyfriend, his brother, & I needed. I booked early & paid in advance allowing me a cheaper rate & building up points for future stays. We were on the thirty-first floor & the view was amazing, especially at night!Check in was not until 4:00pm but the staff gladley took our bags allowing us to explore the city. A map of the city was even offered.On Sunday checkout was at 12:00pm & the staff still offered to take our bags until we left for our flight at JFK that night.The location of this hotel was perfect because there are several good eats around the corner, especially the Irish Pub seemed to be our go to for live music & good beer. Hell's Kitchen is a few blocks & easy access to Time Square. I liked being a few blocks away from the loudness of "touristy" spots.Every time I entered the hallway or elevator or even exited the building someone on the staff team always said hello or have a good day/night! The Hampton even had complimentary cookies & the man at the front desk even held some for us when we returned at 1:00am from the bar. To me, a person who works in hospitality & understands that not everyone can be super duper happy 24/7 these friendly & hospital manners made my stay even more enjoyable.I would recommend this hotel for several of my friends & family. When I return to New York I will be staying at this hotel again because of their wonderful services. Thanks Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square South!

Hotel is not in the best of locations but a quick a walk gets you everywhere you need to go. The hotel is smaller than I expected and the rooms are small compared to many others in Manhattan but the beds are comfortable, the room was clean and the bathroom fine although the shower was a bit on the small size too. The complimentary breakfast is a bit of a bun fight and timing is everything but all very good. Can not praise the staff highly enough all very charming and helpful. We had a problem with the tv and they could not have done more if they had tried. One negative are the elevators there are only two and the cleaning staff have to use them too which causes long waits for everyone. A god value short stop.

We recently returned from a 5 nights stay at the Hampton Inn. When we arrived around 2:45pm the reception staff said there was no room available until after 3, we eventually got given a room around 3:30. Apart from this, check in was very quick and smooth. When we went to the room it was presented nicely but it was a bit cramped with 3 women and our suitcases, nevertheless the beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean and tidy. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day and fresh towels and linen were provided. Breakfast is included in the price, however the queue for it can be quite long and so we tended to eat out for breakfast. There is always coffee and tea available in the lobby, which we took advantage off. The hotel is in a great location, just a few blocks away from Times Square which took around 5-10 minutes to walk to. The good thing about the location of this hotel was that it was close enough to Times Square to walk to but further enough away to enjoy peace and quiet at night. The hotel is located in the Midtown part of Manhattan and so is a great base to explore both uptown and downtown. There are plenty of bars and restaurants just a minutes walk from the hotel, also. The reception staff here were very helpful and friendly and were more than willing to give you information and recommendations on any restaurants or places to visit. The hotel is a pretty good price for what you get and the location. We picked this hotel purely based on location and so were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. I would definitely stay at this hotel and would recommend it for anybody looking for a great, centrally located hotel in New York.

we had a wonderful time in New York. we stayed for 3 nights it was a bit cramped as it was two doubles for 2 adults and 2 teens. but it done its purpose and that was to get a nights sleep. the breakfast was nice but very long queues. great idea for the complimentary tea coffee and hot chocolate, it mad my two children's holiday as they loved the vanilla hot chocolate. This is a hotel that is not in the middle of town and is not noisy but is close enough to times square. the staff were really nice

I was at the hotel the weekend of april 3, 4 and 5 with my family. It was the 1st time of my kids in NewYork was very funny but we forgot one kid bag at the front desk the day of the check out and the mobile phone of my teenager in a Taxi... The manager of house keeping Marlene Garcia was very supportive with us sending back to us the bag and also help me finding the iPhone that the taxi driver founded days after we leave NY. Marlene gave me her cel phone number, she help me a lot!! I never had this type of service in any previous situation in any hotel, and I am very frequent traveller with Hilton and many other chains.. It was outstanding!!!!!!! Thanks Marlene! Alvaro Rocha

My husband and I recently spent a weekend in NY and stayed at the Hampton Inn. It is not luxurious but the room was clean and quiet. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The included breakfast is a nice addition considering Manhattan prices. The location was very convenient for exploring, shopping and seeing a show.

I chose this hotel because of its location (near the 42nd Port Authority stop). It is a great location for touring and traveling around. Walk distance from most of the places I went to. The room was not cheap, yet through the nights I heard the elevator squeaking, which annoyed me. Another thing that annoyed me is that for flushing the toilet I had to hold the handle down for a few seconds (but I had this issue in another hotel I stayed in), and they do not hand out liquid body wash soap (only a bar, which I don't like). The complimentary breakfast was good, and was helpful for me.

This hotel was perfect!! We have a 12 and 14 year old and we absolutely loved the location and the staff at the hotel was magnificent. Room was plenty big for new york and we were 19th floor so no issue with noise- and who needs a view when you're sleeping! Chris G. was incredible- check in took 2 minutes and he greeted us every night and asked about our day as well as recommending great places to eat and things to do. It was a great 5 days!! Even caught a 19 inning yankee/ Red Sox game!! I highly recommend the hotel!!

I loved this property and its location. The rooms were on the small side, but very clean and comfortable. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and very accommodating. I loved the fact that I could walk to a lot of the hot spots. I would stay again.

I've stayed here a few times and the property is fine. But they have lost my business for good. I was traveling and got stuck in Florida. I called and spoke to the Hotel, it was about 30 hours before Check in. They told me I could not cancel because they have a 48 hour cancellation policy. I left a message for the manager, who never called me back. I then called the following day and they would not help me. I asked for the manager, and they put me on perma-hold until I hung up. Sorry, but I'm a long time Hilton Honors member and the way this hotel treated me is unacceptable. Paying for a room in New York that I couldn't use is frustrating enough.

We love Hampton Inns and decided to stay in one in New York City. However, the usual comfortable and reliable experience was somewhat lacking. maybe it was because the place was booked up and seemingly over-crowded with luggage all over a very small and cold lobby. The breakfast room had long lines and was really too small to accommodate a fully booked hotel. So food was cold or they ran out and one morning we actually just left and fond a lovely Irish pub in which to eat a quiet, relaxing breakfast. Also, it took an hour and a half to get our car from the parking lot which was off site in NYC. They did give us a day less of parking fees for the inconvenience but still . . . We wills till stay in Hampton Inns in other cities and towns but not sure we will stay in this one if ever we are back in NYC overnight

This hotel is typical of NYC hotels. Small, cramped and pricey. We had a room with two double beds for two adults and two teenagers. Room was very small and with very little room between the beds and the adjacent walls. Shower is extremely tight, but the room was clean, staff was helpful, and nice place to grab some shut eye. Location is near Times Square and the subway.

The room was pretty and modern, but I would call it a sleeping chamber. (The maid probably bruises her knees trying to clean. ) I would stay again because the room was modern and clean. In addition, the staff were quite nice. They stored my bags for a few hours and didn't charge. Their competitor definitely charges to hold your bags. They accommodated me with both early check in and late checkout.

I had a short stay in the Hampton inn last X-mas. I stayed there for 4 days with my family as it was a family trip. It is a very convenient hotel, place is perfect in the Time square, yet it is very calm inside the rooms. Houskeeping is excellent, everytime we left the room we came back to find super clean sheets. There is free Wi-Fi in the rooms. Breakfast is very nice with a big variety.I simply love it and would definitely go again in my next trip to New York.

We're very loyal Hilton guests, and, though we generally prefer their more polished brands, we've stayed at Hampton Inns all over the country. So I thought I knew what to expect, when we booked this place at the last minute. Despite exceptionally kind and pleasant employees doing their best with what they've been given, this property is not up to the usually pleasant Hampton Inn standard. Rooms are small, even for The City, and the corridor that leads to the elevators is *extremely* narrow and crowded. The location is pretty grim, too. But breakfast was what set this place apart. It was amazing - VERY crowded, and there simply wasn't food. The fruit basket was bare, the bread box was empty, the poor staff would bring out eight cups of yogurt or six muffins at a time, which was grabbed from their hands before having a chance to set it on the buffet. I've honestly never seen anything like it, except on CNN in the wake of a natural disaster. Obviously, the kitchen was completely under-stocked and understaffed. I just felt bad for the poor folks trying to handle the situation. Management owes them, and their guests, better.

Stayed here for two nights with my husband. Room was clean, front desk employees were friendly and courteous. Hotel about a 10 minute walk up 8th Avenue to Times Square, so very good location. Our room (1 king sized bed) was on the small side, but good enough for two people for a short stay in NYC. Hallways are very tight, but I guess this is to be expected in NYC. Breakfast was just okay - they served powdered eggs (yuck), and there was only one waffle maker, but other than that, overall we did have a very nice stay, and I would stay there again.

Second time at this hotel with my 10 yr old daughter for a night in New York and a show. 5 mins walk from bus station, 5 mins from Hells Kitchen, great Irish pub a few doors down for breakfast and dinner. 15 mins walk to Times Square and Broadway. We had a high floor to get best views but the trade off can be elevator wait time at peak times. Breakfast was fresh convenient. Staff very friendly and helpful. Most recommended.

Found a good deal and booked rooms for our group eight months prior to trip. Received a nice pre-welcome email from the front desk manager. About a month before our arrival, emailed the hotel that we wanted to drop two rooms from one of our reservations. No problem they write back. The next think I know, they've cancelled the reservation. It took three emails, two calls, and an email to the general manager for them to un-cancel our reservation. I provided the hotel with the names of those in each room in writing a week before our arrival. But once we checked-in they had it all mixed up with different names in different rooms. When we called downstairs, they would think it was a different person in the room. Towels were not delivered twice as promised. Wake-up calls didn't happen 50% of the time, and the breakfast buffet area (standard Hampton Inn), was far too small for a hotel with 38 floors. Having stayed in many NYC hotels, this one has the poorest service of any. They need to retrain their staff in basic hospitality. Location? It's ok. At the 9th Avenue end of 39th street, so not in the best part of the TS area.

I'd honestly recommend nobody visits here. They don't have enough room for everyone one for their 'fantastic' free breakfast of powdered eggs and they had no hot water for over 24 hours. Worst thing is the staff constantly giving different excuses to why the hot water wasn't working! And then always promising if you run the taps it would be on in 10 minutes!! Ha ha seriously don't stay here.

you get your own bathroom with shower no tub, very small box sized room, make sure you ask for a view or else you'll be staring at a wall. breakfast included very nice and good value. did not see a workout room at this location. Cookies in the evening nice touch

Our room and hotel experience were very good- typical Hampton cleanliness, comfort and breakfast. Our double queen room was pretty small however; fine for two, a bit tight for 3, (as we experienced), and would be ridiculous for 4.

MOD, Bryan Joseph, facilitated do an online booking error and made sure we were placed in the correct room. Dining area is a littler small for the number of guests. Concierges helpful. Easy access to subways. Disappointed that there was no laundry faclity.Would stay here again.

This is a Hampton Inn near Times Square. The room was small, as was the bathroom, and I knew that when I made the reservation, but It was even smaller than expected. I banged my knees on the desk and elbows in the shower. The breakfast buffet was typical for a Hampton Inn. The staff was friendly and helpful; a pleasant surprise in NY. It was tough to get a taxi in front of the hotel. Walking a hundred yards to 9th Ave made it a bit easier.

Very helpful and disciplined staff. This is a busy hotel because of its great location near Time Square but also for the reasonable price, clean rooms and helpful staff. Mere feet from a subway entrance, blocks from Time square and very nice restaurants. Thank you for making our stay such a nice one!

A great hotel to stay in; we stayed 4 nights and were pleased we had picked Hampton Inns. Price included WiFi, breakfast and unlimited coffee, hot chocolate, tea and apples! Breakfast was varied, never the same. Self service and some mornings there was a queue but it was moving and never hindered us. Waffles available to make for those wanted them. I enjoyed the yoghurt and fruit, bagel and Philly cheese! The room was a good size, a super comfortable king sized bed with an ensuite bathroom. I found the body lotion very good quality and loved the feel of it. Just a short walk from the Ports Authority, this hotel was a great location for our onward bus journey. Convenient for Times Square, Broadway shows and Macy's!

Traveled right before Christmas, Dec 20-23. Went with 3 girlfriends and we definitely enjoyed our stay. Good hot breakfast and clean rooms. Rooms were kind of small but that's expected in Manhattan. Location is great, about a 10 minute walk to Times Square, but not in a super noisy spot. They check your luggage if you arrive before check-in but the set up isn't the most secure, it's just piled by the front window. Maybe making room in the back would be safer.

Was our first visit to NYC and this hotel and staff made it great. Nicole(front desk) noticed we were staying a week and went out of her way to find us a better room than the assigned(2nd floor close to elevator). After a brief wait due to a large school group check in, she said we would be on the Top floor(32) with a view of Empire State Bldg. WOW! From then on She & Chris(front desk) greeted us by name when leaving/ returning and offered local info and directions. Jasmine & Amanda (breakfast area) were also very pleasant and tried to assist when items ran short just before 10 am(due to large group). Only negatives were small room size & slightly long wait for elevators (due to older city style hotel (and large group booking). The Concierge staff(not part of the hotel it seemed) was not as helpful/knowledgeable regarding areas outside of their recommendations(contracts ?). eg. Asked them to contact NYC Taxi to airport and was told to hail one in street or walk one block to Taxi line up at transit station.

Great location to Times Square, good restaurants, and the subway. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. The staff were top-notch in every way...especially Johnathan and Nelson at the front desk. The housekeeping supervisor and the breakfast staff made sure we had everything we needed. The entire hotel was spotless. Would highly recommend.

We stayed at the Hampton for a few nights during a March break trip. The hotel is very close to the action, within a 5 minute walk you have:- multiple Broadway theaters across the street- minutes to Times Square- Radio city, NBC, Late show, Rockefeller centerThe hotel is much cheaper than is you go one block over to Broadway, so you can't beat the value.A couple of downsides are the beds were hard making it somewhat difficult to get comfortable. As well it's down the street from a firehall, which tends to be busy.Given the value and location I would likely stay here again

Excellent location if you are attending a convention at the Jacob Javits Center. Tiny lobby and rooms but who cares? Delicious complimentary buffet breakfast - entree changed everyday. Super comfy bed & pillows. Very clean room & bathroom. Good water pressure in the shower. Walking distance from everything. Excellent front desk customer service - especially from Nelson!!!!

We came to shop for a prom dress and to see Ariana Grande in concert! This hotel is in a great location! The staff were very friendly and answered any questions that we had! Great Location for access to Time Square!!

Great hotel with friendly helpful staff.breakfast self service, basic but very satisfactory.rooms spotless with excellent little coffee machine.central location.no complaints.would certainly reccommend.

A no-frills hotel with included breakfast just off Times Square (a 10 minute walk). Helpful and cheerful staff, clean rooms that are typically small for NYC, a city view across the river and comfortable beds to rest in after a full day's exploring!

I was at this hotel during one week with my kid. The hotel is very good, close to the main attractions in NYC. The breakfast is OK, but sometimes there were a lot of people there and no available seats. The shower is tiny - if you are 5'6 or more you will feel a little bit unconfortable. Overall it is a good choice to stay in NYC.

We enjoyed our stay here. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, you could get tea, coffee and hot chocolate 24 hours. Only problem was room was a bit small for 2 adults and 2 kids. Close to subways and lots of restaurants near by & couple of blocks from time square.

This was a bit further from Times Square than we are used to, but no worries - short walk to it all, safe return after 11 PM. Very modern room. All our interactions with staff were pleasant and helpful, including check in and valet parking.

I stayed at this hotel for a convention at the Jacob Javitts center. It could not have been a better location. We were right in between the center and Times Square so it was an easy walk both directions! We also were around the corner from Port Authority so if you are traveling by bus, its only a minute or two walk. The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel itself was very clean. The only bad thing I can say is probably 85% of the staff does not speak English (or won't admit to it). I found that extremely annoying and if you are there visiting, good luck getting help from them. Truthfully, the ones who wouldn't speak English were very rude about it and didn't even pretend to try to help. It astonishes me that Hilton would keep them employed with such horrid people skills. Thankfully, I didn't have to deal with them and was thrilled with the front desk. Breakfast was good and the price point was perfect.

We spent one night at the hotel,chosen mainly for it's affordable price and location. The room was a bit small but enough for 4 people(2 adults,2 teenagers) to spend the night.Beds are comfy. Breakfast is included and very tasty. The location is perfect,right in the middle of Manhattan. Walkable distance to restaurants,stores and subway. It's great place to stay in New York.

Everybody was nice, and the facilities were excellent. Nelson and Jonathon did an excellent job of making us feel welcome. The breakfast was great, and the staff kept it clean and stocked. The room was clean and contemporary, and the internet worked well. All in all a very pleasant experience.

Had a great two night stay. The front desk staff and night auditor were awesome. They always greeted us when coming and going and offered to give suggestions or directions to anything we may have needed. Room was clean and had everything we needed. Location was also good. Walking distance to Times Square, but still in a quiet area. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed overnight, Sunday into Monday.No early check in, (check in 3pm sharp), but able to leave bags with hotel (no fee).Cross streets for hotel: W39th & 8th ave.2 parking garages on 39th street. One being icon. Living social is offering 24 hr vouchers for $34, but icon tacked on an additional $15.50 equaling $50 to park in garage. There is street parking on w39th in front of hotel, but park in garages if staying Monday-Friday. Street parking becomes loading zones on week days, and the valet guys said they will tow your car. Don't risk it.Hotel Pros:Just as it has been said in previous reviews the Location, especially if you're looking for a place to stay in Time Square/Theatre District, strongly consider this place. There is a lot of foot traffic once you get on 8th ave, but the area is easy to walk around. WEAR COMFY SHOES. And some say this hotel is on an alley, no. It's on w39th street, and you don't have to fight foot traffic to get to your hotel once you turn onto w39th from 8th ave. I was with my cousin at the time, but I would feel safe walking solo around the area and to the hotel.The Port Authority Bus Terminal is on 8th ave and w42nd, 2minute walk from hotel.There is also a subway stop on 42nd and 8th ave.Shake shack is a 5-7min walk up 8th Ave, which is delicious! I know there's a lot of hype about this place, but for good reason. The shack burger is seasoned and delicious after walking around all day. And if the line is out the door, you're so nearby, you'll hopefully get good timing to grab a burger and shake.Check out Wok&Walk for convenient noodles on the go. On w39th btw 8th and 7th ave.And Cupcakes by Melissa is on 7th ave between w39th & w38th.Lastly, grab some ribs and chicken from Dallas BBQ on 42nd between 8th and 7th ave. Not to be confused with BBKings, which is right next door.They do provide a free breakfast, which we picked up around 830am, and ate in our comfortable, clean beds. Breakfast is served 6am-10am. Make yourself waffles, limitless bacon, "scrambled eggs", muffins/bagels, yogurt, juice: Apple, cranberry, orange.Now for the room itself: (stayed in 2602)Comfortable clean beds. Fluffy clean comforter.Cozy. Translation: it is a tight fit. I purchased a room with 2 double beds from groupon, and two people could fit in the room comfortably. If you have 4 or more people in your party, get 2 rooms.Comfortable clean beds.We had an issue with the AC/heater unit. At one point in the evening it made this crazy noise, and sounded like a piece dropped to the ground. Called front desk, a technician came up within 5-10mins. He reset the AC/heater, and it worked fine afterwards. AC/heater is digitally controlled. Very impressed how attentive they were.Comfortable clean beds.They do a thorough cleaning job at this hotel. The top sheet does feel overstarched, but just push it to the side, because those beds are COMMMMFORRRTAAABBBLLLE. They're great.Bathroom was clean, well decorated, neutrogena toiletries, and a good amount of space for one person to use at a time. Standing shower only with great pressure, and didn't have to wait long for it to warm up.The space is limited, but the desk chair was comfortable. There is a safe. No fridge. No closet either, but a tall wardrobe cabinet available, which is just enough for 2people staying a few days, or 1person on business for a week. There is drawer space available. No issues with the flat screen tv, and they offer showtime.Had a great stay. The front desk gentlemen are very friendly and personable, especially Nelson who checked us in. Thank you! We had a great time walking and eating our way through the city.

i stayed here for one night in march. I was with my girlfriend and we were visiting new york for the weekend. the hotel location was great as we could walk to and from the bus terminal and it wasn't far to times square or other attractions. the staff is very friendly and always asks you how your day was when you come in. the complimentary breakfast is amazing!!!!!! hot breakfast foods and even a waffle maker! so delicious. check in took a while and they wont let you check in before 3. we arrived early and left our bags at the hotel while we went out for the day and came back 20 mins to 3 and wouldn't check us in. when we finally got our room key our bags took forever to come out to us. the beds are super comfy but we had a room close to the elevator so we heard a lot of noise in the night. everything else was great

Most New York City rooms are small but this one is not only small but loud. The doors & walls are paper thin. When a door closes on the floor, it shakes the whole room. When a person is speaking in the hallway, it may as well be in your room. No bathroom sink space for toiletries. Shower is nice size but horrible pressure. Breakfast was almost non existent. Not a typical Hampton Inn spread. Always empty and not filled up in a timely manner. Coffee is good though. Would not stay here again. Many other choices in midtown.

Construction on adjacent building started at 6AM. I know the hotel has no control over this. We felt we should have been informed about this upon booking, or at least given a room on the other side of hotel. Staff all acted like they did not know about the construction. I can't imagine they haven't received any other complaints. Noise issue aside, experience would have been very good, but the whole construction and noise issue and the way it was handled turned a nice stay into a bad experience. An apology was all I got from the manager upon checkout. In the future I will always ask about construction when booking a hotel.

I had a very nice one night stay at this hotel. The location is good for walking to most activities. I came in to Penn Station and walked to the hotel. It was cold and snowing but the walk was still manageable. Times Square and the theater district is also within walking distance. The room size was a bit small but sufficient. It was clean and had all the amenities needed. Beds were super comfortable. There were plenty of electric sockets conveniently located for charging electronic equipment. There was a safe which was large enough for a laptop. Wifi internet was free and worked well. Room temperature was comfortable and adjustable. As mentioned in other reviews there are only two elevators so you might have a wait if you are coming or going during busy times. Breakfast is included and was better than expected with a variety of choices and replenished often. Would have liked some more healthy options such as fruits or yogurt but for one night what was offered was more than enough. Staff at the front desk were friendly and very helpful. Chris checked me in and went above and beyond to answer questions and offer assistance. Only complaint was my reservation included a late check out of 2 p.m. I had planned to tour around and return early afternoon to warm up and gather my items. However I was told late check out is based on availability and I needed to check out at noon. Since check in time is 3 p.m. it didn't make sense that I was not able to stay. Summary: great location, excellent price, decent breakfast, comfortable beds, rooms small but acceptable, friendly and helpful staff.

We were staying at the Hampton Inn in March 2015 during an extensive USA trip. New York was our last city to visit. We've chosen the Hotel because of a recommendation of a friend. It's located on the 8th Ave near 50th st., around 5 min walking to the TImes Square. A subway station is only 2 min away. The rooms are nice, clean and they serve free breakfast. There is also a tea and coffee station free of charge in the lobby. They have a park house next door the fee is around USD 50 per day. The Hampton Inn was the best Hotel during our entire USA trip (3 weeks), we will definitely come back.

I had a wonderful stay! The room was very comfortable, and flawless in condition and decor. My nights were quiet, and I had a great view to the west. The location is perfect for the gala I attended and the staff were very kind. Food was delicious. Incredible bargain!

Whilst the location of this hotel was spot on for sights I found quality of breakfast poor, the rooms are okay size as is the bathroom, free products are of good quality. All food available seems like preheat stuff, fruit was usually only apples, tea was lacking boiled water, I feel there are plenty others to choose from downtown that offer good healthy quality food with friendly happy staff at similar price, location to train station and underground good, very pricy for airport bus so choose the train only 12 dollars

A typically reliable Hampton Inn. My room was clean, comfortable and smelled fresh. The hotel was located a block from the subway and a few from Times Square. a convenient location for tourists. The free Wi-Fi was a bit slow and the breakfast area was crowded during peak times, but the food was good and there were many choices. I always appreciate the 24 hour hot beverage station. The best feature of this Hampton Inn is Chris at the front desk. Every hotel in NYC needs a Chris to welcome guests and check them in. He was friendly, kind and genuine. Kudos to the person who hired him. I would definitely stay again.

I stayed there on 2015/02/28 and the room was clean and comfortable. We were four and on 2nd floor and had a quiet night sleep. Unfortunately, breakfast was another story: no hot food when we came down, just toasts and yogurt. The milk machine was broken and they only had one jug of milk out of the kitchen. Kitchen staff looked disorganized.

This hotel is close to everything, including a male review which gets busy on the weekend with drunken women... but that's okay it's NY, we just walked around them. My kids are 11 and 13 so they laughed about it as we did. BUT when your daughter finds a used condom when she reaches down to get her shoe which fell under the bed... NOT COOL! The front desk staff was very nice and embarrassed of course and well... came up and got rid of the evidence and offered us a room voucher for a future stay in any Hampton Inn but still... EWWWW NASTY! needless to say we will not be using that free stay at this particular hotel again. It definitely made the trip even that more memorable. That is for sure! Once again the front desk staff was very very nice though! Its housekeeping who needs to do a MUCH BETTER job obviously! YUCK!

Overall if you are looking for a decent place to stay in the Times Square/Port Authority Bus Terminal/Penn Station area, Hampton Inn is the place for you.Things I liked about the place:a) Friendly staff (the guy checking me in informed me about the free wi-fi, the breakfast time, and even complimented on my spectacles, which sounded genuine enough; I appreciated a little kind words like that at times)b) 24-hour business room is available, which I didn't get to use but I am sure one could find this very useful, c) Heater works fine, and there were some nice little touches that can be seen in-room (laptop table for the bed, usb/outlet charging station, etc.), d) Free Showtime and other HD major networks and selected cable channels, e) comfortable bed, f) shower booth, g) Neutrogena shower amenitiesThings I didn't care so much about the place:a) Breakfast service was a hot mess. While the hot food in general was above average and the waffle station was what let me down the most; I just wish there were an waffle attendant or pre-made waffles for someone like myself who don't care about freshly cooked waffles so much. The staff was super nice throughout, so it made it less disappointing. The breakfast area was so small and dirty too, because I guess there aren't enough manpower to keep the tables clean at all tiimes.b) The noisy heater! I wonder if this heater situation is just my room or not. If some of the other guest have suffered from the same problem, I believe the hotel should do something about it.

We checked in on 2/26/15 through 3/1/15. We stayed there February 2014 also. This Hotel is very convenient to everything. I love the people that work there from Nicole at the front desk who is so personable to Chris who remembered us from last year. It includes breakfast which is a big help and the workers there in the morning are so kind. I remember Amanda and Jose who went out of their way to make sure we didn't need anything. I recommend this Hotel for the affordability also.

We stayed there for 4 nights. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, a bit small if you lay out your luggage on the floor. Location was excellent, walking distance from Penn station. Free Wifi and Free breakfast. Overall a Great stay!! =)

I stayed at this Hampton Inn for a few days while I took the bar exam, this past February, instead of trekking in the cold from Long Island to Manhattan and possibly getting stuck on the train. The hotel was about a 20 minute walk from destination all the way on the west side of Manhattan. Apart from the distance (which was not the hotel's fault but rather the bar exam location's), the hotel is perfectly situated right near Times Square, a simple 2 block walk and you are in the middle of the busiest city in the world. It is right next to the Port Authority, 5 blocks from Penn Station, and a 20 - 40 minute cab ride to either LaGuardia or JFK (depending on NYC traffic). The staff are very friendly and welcoming and the hotel is kept very clean. The complimentary breakfast was both hot and cold and they had a variety of options. My room was clean and I was able to adjust the temperature to my liking. I had a small issue connecting to the Internet at first, however, once I logged out and logged back in, I had no problems at all. But don't expect to take a hot bath (as they do no have tubs in the hotel, common in smaller hotels in New York City). All in all, an excellent hotel, at a good rate for Times Square.

I have been at Hampton twice; both for business and around three weeks.The place is more than ok, breakfast included, the room is always clean, the hotel is placed in the heart of Time Square (just 2 mins walking), next to the bus station and pretty close to a metro entry.The room is small but confortable, there is free coffee and internet and occasionally they served cookies in the entry.The staff is really good and pay attention to you; might be a better places but I always ask to my manager to be host in this hotel.Thanks,J

We stayed at this Hampton for a weekend tour of NYC. The location is fantastic. It is centrally located and within walking distance of The theatre district and Times Square. They also have a complimentary breakfast bar. This does get a little packed, but the staff is very accomodating. The front desk is extremely helpful with providing information for dinner selections and tour buses to take. Also they are very quick to assist with getting their guests a cab when needed. No real complaints, and we will stay here again when going to NYC

Stayed at the Hampton Inn in August 2014 with my family for 4 nights, we found the hotel an ideal base for a family visiting NYC with not too high a price to pay, the rooms were a reasonable size, the hotel provided breakfast which had a good choice and start to the day, therre was also coffee available at the end of a day out in the city, there are only 2 lifts at the hotel but while staying at we didnt have to wait more than a couple of minutes for one. The hotel is only about 5 minutes walk from Times Square and lots of other places of interest, the staff at the hotel were very helpful and computer and printer facilities are available for guests along with complimentary Wi-Fi access.

This modern hotel is conveniently located midway between Penn Station and the Theater District and is a good alternative to some of the higher priced hotels in midtown. Although room rates will be going up significantly in just a few weeks with the onset (hopefully) of Spring, they were quite reasonable now, especially considering that the accommodations include a hot breakfast and free wifi. Be prepared for the room to be small -- cruise ship cabin sized -- but that's par for the course in NYC. The TV signal also dropped out most of the time and the otherwise friendly and effective front desk staff seemed pretty clueless about it although it seems clear that others have also complained about it.On balance though, we would stay there again without hesitation.

Very clean, very reasonable price. TV reception didn't work on a number of key channels. Hotel blamed it on the wind. Check in outstanding (Chris). Breakfast had trouble accommodating the crowds....eat early.

Very good experience at this hotel Staff very helpful. Had AC/Heating problem that was immediately fixed. Rooms are typical NYC-small but reasonably priced compared to other options. Room was clean and hotel quiet. Just a few blocks from Penn Station and many subway lines. Comp breakfast could do a little better with health eating options but I would definitely stay again.

Hotel is in an excellent location. Very clean rooms. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was very good. Highly recommend this hotel. Inexpensive ICON parking on 37th street that you can take advantage of if you have a coupon.

This is a great hotel in a good location for subway and near Port Authority, Nearby restaurants and Tir Na Nog Irish Bar a few doors down great for drinks, Close to Times Square and Broadway all the staff are amazing, nothing too much trouble, great self service breakfast with a choice of hot or cold items, sets you up for the day and saves time, unlimited hot drinks available in reception and free cookies after 4 pm, If you want to take your own food and drinks back in the evenings you can use the dinning tables near reception,There is a coffee maker in the room, we took our own teabags so we could make tea.5 of us went, 2 had a King room with city view, and 3 shared a double room with city view, rooms were very clean, comfy bed and pillows, beds changed frequently, bathroom restocked daily with towels and toiletories, if you forget anything reception keep a supply of items. We would happily stay here again.

I was pleasantly surprised by the open, clean and functional lobby area. The staff members were more than friendly and efficient. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet with all amenities needed for a business trip. The complimentary breakfast was adequate.

Called and spoke with Nick in reservations who did not seem to know what he was doing and had no familiarity with the hotel. Tried to make a city view room request and got bounced between the front desk and reservations. I asked for two nights with check in Friday. Nick reviewed the reservation and confirmed for two nights. I made the mistake of not looking over the confirmation email and noticing that Nick only made it for one night. When I checked in the front desk attendant never reviewed the check out date with me. My sister and I discussed check out on Sunday with the attendant and whether the desk would be busy and instructions for leaving keys in room. We both mentioned SUNDAY with her. We were in Brooklyn Saturday afternoon (1:15) and received a phone call from NICOLE (I still have the voice message) telling us that if we didn't get to the hotel now our belongings would be sent to the POLICE STATION. We were in an absolute panic. We had broadway tickets for Saturday night. Nicole advised that the hotel was sold out and we were going to be without a place to stay on a very cold night. This was my first time ever staying overnight in New York City. It was an awful experience!! I will never stay here again! We ended up staying right next to the hotel at CANDLEWOOD SUITES. They were wonderful. The room was huge AND CHEAPER! And our view the same! Don't waste your time here! Go to Candlewood Suites. I have never been involved with the police and never been threatened to have my belongings taken to the station. I used to work for an upscale hotel in Hershey, PA. I have never treated guests this way nor ever been treated this way. Sent an email to Victor Orellan who is the manager and apparently this is their procedure! I feel bad for future guests who may get delayed on the subway or have poor reservation service like I did. Also the Times Square next to the hotel name is misleading. It is about FIVE blocks away AND in an alley

Myself and two daughters booked into this accommodation late due to a last minute change of travel plans. We chose the hotel based on location and cost and stayed just one night. We were extremely happy with our visit and the price (£128 via Late Rooms for party of 3). Hotel was much better than we anticipated based on the cost. Clean, modern bedroom. Super comfy beds, complimentary internet for duration of our stay. Well equipped bathroom with complimentary toiletries and at the time of booking we didn't realise that breakfast was complimentary so that was another added bonus. Location, Times Square South was great and the check in staff (Jennifer?) was most helpful. Breakfast was acceptable by similar hotel standards although the breakfast room was rather small and very packed. We also visited NYC at a time when there were blizzard facilities so sitting in the conservatory part of the restaurant was very, very cold and most people had their coats on - although we all acknowledged the exceptional weather conditions. We were located on the top 32nd floor so there were great views of the city and ESB. Room quiet with super comfy beds - 2 x double beds for the 3 of us. Coffee machine in room. The outside appearance of the hotel and the lobby area does not do the bedrooms justice. I would highly recommend this hotel and have no hesitation in returning. Would highly recommend and have no h

I was a day late because of the snow, but they kept my reservation. The room was small, but cosy and I was able to adjust the temperature. The television lacked many channels the first night, but after speaking the next morning with Elizabeth T, problems were resolved at once. The buffet is about the same as other Hampton properties. Good hotel at good price, near Times Square and the Port Authority Bus Station. I would come here again.

Took the kids for their first trip to NYC, stayed here, excellent location, close to everything. Great service and includes breakfast! Can't beat it. Service was excellent. Great if you're catching a Broadway show or just plan to visit Time Square!!

this hotel has very good access to Time Square and several parking lots around the hotel makes good approach by driving with reasonable parking fee. good to stay for 2~3 family tour to NY downtown, but restaurant is little small and other conditions were very much satisfactory.

I am lucky enough to have my choice of hotels when I stay in NYC, but I consistently choose this one because of the GREAT staff. Jennifer is a life saver and gives 5-star customer service. She's an asset to the hotel and a credit to the HiltonHonors program, making guests feel like she's invited them to spend the night in her own home rather than in a big hotel. Keep up the great work all of you and THANK YOU to Jennifer.

The hotel is good for the price. Good location, next to some subway stations, several good restaurants and the most important Brodway Theaters. The staff is helpful and polite. But the room is small, the elevators (only two) are not enough for the guests if the hotel is full. And the dining room, where the breakfast is served, is very small and there are no enough tables for all the guests. The free WiFi is excellent.

The location is central, the rooms are comfortable, the staff were friendly and helpful... how much more do you need to know?It's a nice, clean hotel within easy walking distance of Times Square, Penn Station, etc. Good rooms and a reasonable price for NYC. I've stayed here a couple of times and can recommend it.

There are 4 hotels next to each other on the 39th. I usually stay at the Holiday Inn next door, but I decided to try this one. The prices are very similar, the rooms are the same (small). This one has a very nice but small gym. If you are not a HHonor member, internet is not free (Holiday Inn express is free). Good choice of cold and hot breakfast included in the price.What I like about this hotel is the bed. Very confortable, mainly the pillows. Location wise, I like this area, it is between Time Square and Penn Station, 10 minutes to each location.I'd say you chose base on your brand loyalty. Candlewood, Holiday Inn Express, Hampton or Element by Westin. Your experience will be similar.

The level of service at this location was FABULOUS! Everyone went above and beyond to help make my stay fun and memorable! The staff remembered my name and made me fell very welcome each time I passed through the lobby.

Great location, short walk to Times Square, subway and Madison Square Garden. Staff were extremely helpful, courteous and friendly. The room is small but well appointed but that is expected in New York with limited Real Estate. The beds are very comfortable.

Hotel is great location with great rates! Staff were super friendly. Breakfast was amazing, even had bacon!! Had a room on the 32nd floor and still had quick travels up and down the elevator. Unfortunately didn't have a city view, but very nice, quiet and very comfortable. Great location just a block away from 42nd St Port Authority subway.

This hotel, tucked away on the western edge of midtown where it meets Hell's Kitchen, is in a convenient location to venture out from and close to loads of transportation options (Port Authority bus station, multiple subway lines, Penn Station, etc). The staff is incredibly courteous and goes above and beyond---who ever said New Yorkers are not helpful or friendly? The complimentary breakfast is basic but varied and having access to tea/coffee 24-7 is a plus. They offer free concierge service at the lobby kiosk, a tiny business center with two computers and a printer, free in-room wifi, and baggage check service should you have a later flight and need to leave your bags while exploring. The elevator wait can be long during peak "movement times", particulary in the morning when folks are checking out and heading to breakfast on the ground floor. Hey, it is NYC and with over 30 floors, that is expected. Rooms are super clean and ample size - a little tight which is typical for NYC, with a shower only (also typical). Great value and checks all the boxes.Lots of food options nearby, including quite a few bodegas to pick up whatever you left behind! Also, right by the fashion district, so there are quite a few shops that sells store samples (clothing) and many interesting fabric stores!

the room was very tiny but WOW the beds were sooooooooo AMAZING!!!! It was like sleeping on a cloud and the breakfast was great hot and cold items!!! the staff was very accommodating...not to mention the price was rignt...

Hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and Subway stops. Only 6 rooms per floor but 32 floors, in keeping with pricey NYC real estate. Room was somewhat small, but well appointed and clean. Wait for elevator not unreasonable, in contrast to some reviews I've read. The staff were friendly and helpful across the board, from the front desk to the breakfast room to the cleaning staff.

This was my 2nd stay at this hotel, I returned here for a meeting that was being held about 2 blocks away. I was worried I would not have time to change as I had arrived just a few hours before the meeting. The service was exactly as I remembered, courteous and efficient. I arrived earlier than the check in time they got me into my room very quickly and I had plenty of time to clean up before my meeting

I gave been here a number of times for both personal and business travel. The staff is very friendly and make it a point to accommodate you - whenever *possible* they allow late checkout. I only see UTMOST professionalism when I come here.The rooms are very clean and housekeeping is great. Only problem is there are a couple of rooms in the hotel that may be a little iffy. Had a room one time that was FILLED with fruitflies. Another time I had a room with a nonfunctioning television. While the staff was very quick to fix these problems they had to be called up more than once during the stay to amend the problem. So be sure to check in EARLY if possible and thoroughly check your room before you settle in. Again the vast majority of the hotel is immaculately clean so you are unlikely to have problems here.Other than that the majority of my stays were perfect. Very clean rooms and - again - very attentive staff: everyone from the concierge, bellman, maintenance, kitchen staff, managers - everyone is very professional and they make you feel like a valued guest!I would definitely stay here again

Stayed here for our second visit to New York. Location excellent. Short walk from Times Square and port authority bus station. Airport express bus stops here. Hotel clean. Beds so comfortable. Took a little while for hot water to come through into shower but when it did, showers great. 2 double beds in rooms so not much space but you don't come to New York to stay in a hotel. Breakfast superb. Excellent value. Staff do a great job in all areas. For the price you pay it is spot on. What more do you need. Plan to return and will certainly come back if available

Beautiful room! I was very impressed. Great heater that allows you to control the temperature. Great overall experience at the Hampton Inn. Absolutely loved it! There's a safe in the room that allows you to pick your own combination numbers and store your valuables. I think this is great and a very nice security feature.

I stayed here with my daughter while in town visiting colleges. I had read the reviews here before I booked. Our room was on the top floor and we had no problems regarding using the elevators. It's a great location at a great value. Very clean. Good service. The entire staff was really nice. We flew in to Newark, took the Air Train in to Penn Station and walked up to the hotel. It was really convenient. And free, reliable wifi!! Very good Italian restaurant across the street, Mercato.

Hotel staff was very accomodating. Mixture of business & pleasure they let us have a 2 o'clock checkout to accommodate our schedule. Walking distance to restaurants & entertainment. Room was clean. Hotel was quiet. Great breakfast.

Walking distance to the convention center and also lots of reasonably prices restaurants within 2-4 blocks from the hotel. Also, next door is the Holiday Inn and one other hotel. The hot breakfast included (as in other Hampton Inns) is very good and lots of different choices every morning. As usual, the king bed is so comfortable. Of course, the bedroom is rather compact which I believe is the standard in this area. Just imagine you are in a cruise ship cabin. In case you miss breakfast service, the hotel has "breakfast to Go" available at the Front Desk.

Easy access from Port Authority Bus Terminal, sufficient and relatively quiet for the area. Decently priced and an absolutely passable sleep-over for business trips etc. Caught check-in staff who obviously had a bad day, but I guess I just wasn't lucky that day.

Close to Times Square, close to the subway....great staff and super location.Will stay here again...hopefully soon.Close to Empire state building. Try the Donut cart at the corner...great choices for breakfast.

We arrived a bit early for our 3 hr check-in an was told that no rooms were available yet. No problem. We came back at 3:30pm and was pleasantly greeted by Chris. Chris hands down was the most pleasant and most unforgettable staff member that we encountered. The Valet that handled my car was also very pleasant and I'm sad I didn't get his name. Chris was pleasant, professional and smiled! He made sure we had everything we needed and more. I was disappointed that he wasn't available for my check-out!Thanks Chris for your hospitality.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square south last week for a short vacation and it was very good. Everything was clean, the bed was very comfortable and in the room we even could make some coffee.Every room had free wi-fi and it worked very well.Every morning there was a free complimentary breakfast, there was enough for everybody and you could choose between warm and cold, the muffins where delicious as everything else. the staff was friendly and helpfull. I want to recommend this hotel to everybody. Price, quality, is this the best hotel you can think about. The metro is not far away so you can see everything from New York.So everything was going very well and we sure want to come back.thanks for everything!!!!Sonja

We stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square South location last spring when we attended a convention at the Javitts Center. The Javitts Center was a short walk from the hotel and we were able to walk to other locations in the city. The room was a decent size and clean. While we were there, we took advantage of the complimentary breakfast each morning. It was well-stocked and there was enough to choose from if you wanted a quick breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful. Since we drove into NYC, we did use the hotel parking garage which is directly behind the hotel on the next block over so you didn't have to go far to park your car. Our friend who stayed at the hotel with us had a short walk to Penn Station from the hotel.

If this was the last Hampton Inn in Midtown I would consider returning. It was clean the bed was comfortable but the rooms are small compared to other Hampton Inns in the immediate area (Madison Sq. Garden, Chelsea, Herald Square) The bathrooms are also not as fancy as the others. It is also not on the greatest block of Manhattan. I would call it a gentrifying area. Not very far is the midtown tunnel and the bus terminal. If you are getting a cab service door to door I am sure you would be fine however I would not want my mother or family walking around this area alone after dark.I found that the staff did not follow the typical Hilton script when I arrived. I was not "welcomed" as a Hilton Silver Rewards member nor was I told about the hours of the breakfast or amenities on property. The lobby was empty and the phone wasn't ringing so I am not sure why that attention to detail was missed. The experience reminded me of going to the cash register at one of the big box pharmacies. As I know Hilton is big on that I am sure they would not be pleased, Following my stay we noticed that they did not charge the credit card that I wanted to have charged. The first time I called my call was disconnected after 5 minutes on hold. The second call I incurred another long hold and was told that to get this switched to a new credit card it would require a form be completed. This is a simple process that other hotels have taken care of for me in 1 minute. I requested a supervisor return my call. A supervisor called me back promptly and advised me of the same requirement of the form being completed. She said that I would have the form yesterday emailed to me and confirmed my email. No form received yet. ...

Hampton Inn hotels are always reliable and clean. This one was no exception. Happy to find an affordable hotel right in the city that was convenient to all the places we were going to be visiting. Rooms were smaller than we are used to compared to other Hampton Inns but that's to be expected in the city. We were only there to sleep so it didn't bother us one bit.

We liked the location of this hotel only 2 blocks from Times Square. There are some good bar/restaurants nearby, my favourites are the Beer Authority and Heartland Brewery on 8th Avenue and the Irish bar Tir Na Nog on west 39th street, all had great atmosphere and reasonable prices. The hotel is small but friendly with less than 10 rooms per floor over 33 floors. Included in the price was a self service breakfast (rare for New York) which was good with a choice of hot and cold food including a waffle maker. The staff are friendly and helpful. We found very few negatives about this hotel except there are only 2 lifts so it can be a long wait for a lift at breakfast and when maid service are using the same lift. The complimentary wifi can be a little slow and cut out but at least it was free. The breakfast uses disposable plates and plastic cutlery. Bar these few minor niggles we would stay here again if we returned to New York.

We traveled to NY to party and stayed at this awesome hotel. Not only were the people that worked there professional - they were also super positive and friendly. The hotel is in a great location and close to several places to eat and go dancing. Escuelita's (great spot to wild out) is just a few doors down. The family loved the hotel, the costs and location. And oh by the way, FREE delicious breakfast is served from 6-10.

The Hampton Inn on 39th Street is only 6 years old. It does not resemble the normal Hampton Inn. It is new and stylish. We were greeted at the desk by Jennifer, a knowledgeable personable and outgoing woman. She set the pace for the entire stay. The room was big, clean, modern, decorated tastefully. The room was quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was included and it was adequate, with good coffee. Coffee and tea are available 24/7. The hotel is located convenient to everything without being right on the busiest streets. Great find in NYC.

You can't beat this hotel in NYC! I've been to NYC for business and leisure several times, but for the past four times I've stayed here. You can't beat the location or price! I love that their free breakfast comes with hot food like eggs and bacon too. Its what keeps me coming back! This time, I had especially great service from Chris at the front desk who even recognized me this time - ha! He has such great energy and was eager to help us out with anything we needed. All the staff was great - I forget the name of the bellman but he was able to arrange us a black car ride at the last minute to LGA and then to JFK. They all think outside the box and go above and beyond. I feel like I'm home when I stay there! My favorite things about this hotel: GREAT staff, hot breakfast, fabulous location (one block from the subway), always very clean and tidy. Least favorite things (because hey, no one's perfect): sometimes the elevator can get busy at "rush-hour", and room doors are very heavy and slam closed which can be disturbing.

I stayed here in May 2014 with 3 friends and found this hotel to be clean and comfortable and a great location and value for money. The rooms are small but we were able to fit 4 of us and large suitcases and all our shopping without a problem. The hotel it close to the theatre district and short walk to many restaurants along 9th ave. Complimentary breakfast included and we took a piece of fruit most days for our morning tea whilst out and about. There was a bit of a wait for lifts in the mornings but we just allowed a few minutes more knowing this when going anywhere. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Awesome hotel and excellent value!!! I've stayed in other hotels in the are that have bigger rooms and nicer facilities, but I've never stayed anywhere with a more friendly and helpful staff. This place is excellent!!!

Spent two nights here while attending a convention at Javits Center. It's a quick, easy walk to the Center and close to theatre district. The hotel is small compared to other Hampton Inns. I stayed on the 7th floor. Should have picked a higher floor as I could hear a fair amount of noise from the street during the night (bring ear plugs, it's New York). The room was on the small side, with a small bathroom. Only a few rooms on each floor, maybe 6 or 8. The rooms were clean and recently updated. Breakfast area was nice, with typical Hampton selection. A portion of the breakfast area is a glass enclosed addition. It was cold when we were there, thus the glass enclosed room was a bit chilly. This was the second time I stayed at this hotel. Price was right and location is great. About 6 blocks to Penn Station.

Very clean and very helpful staff. Rooms were very comfortable and clean! It's not directly on times square but within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again. The rooms are bigger than most rooms in new york.

Jonathan the night staff was the BEST!! his customer service skills are amazing and because of him I would recommend this hotel to others. Left New York with a new friend! Thanks for the hair cut hook up Jonathan we'll keep in touch.

Located close to the depths of New York City hell, aka Port Authority, the Hampton Inn Times Square South is conveniently located for any out of town visitors interested in experiencing the finer parts of the city.I myself live and New Jersey and work every day in the city, but found myself staying here due to long work hours. True to form in New York City, where apartments are typically the size of shoe boxes, this hotel was very...cozy. Certainly one of the smaller rooms I've stayed in. However, it was clean and had been renovated nicely. Overall, my stay was comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was satisfactory. My only really legitimate complaint was the ice machines. They were only located on every few floors and the first two i tried didn't work. Just a minor annoyance though.

I took by daughters to NYC Dec 19-22 to enjoy the city at Christmas. Checked into the Hamptone Inn late at night with Jonathon helping us. I had several requests and questions and he was all over it. What a great guy with a great attitude! I was jokingly giving him a hard time and he gave it right back - jokingly of course. Over the course of our stay, I spent time in the lobby waiting for my daughters to get come down - and witnessed Jonathon treating every guest with a great attitude and a smile. Clone him!Breakfast was great too! Food was great and I had a nice time chatting with the cook/prep Indhira (sp?)! Like Jonathon, all smiles and wonderful attitude. Could really tell she took pride in puttin out a great morning spread for the hotel guests. Clone her too!Gotta give credit to the leadership at the Hampton Inn for hiring such great people. I'll be back for sure!
