I have stayed at this hotel many times for both business and personal reasons. It in centrally located in Times Square and as a Hampton Inn has a great (free) breakfast, great service and is clean and modern. Everything you can hope for with a reasonably price in NYC!

Highly recommended. Great position, walk to Broadway. We had 2 double beds. Made the room seem smaller but was great to have the children in the same room. Good breakfast ( included). Great staff. We had a great time and would stay there again.

Just returned from 6 days in New York . This hotel is in a great location. We were 4 adults and we all felt we would recommend this hotel and return there ourselves. The included breakfast was wonderful with many healthy choices...hot and cold. Coffee, tea available free of charge 24 hours, also hot chocolate. Cookies andfruit avaliable too. Rooms were very clean, beddingreally comfortable.Front desk staff cheerul and helpful.Bath products Neutragena ...nice touch!

Our stay at the Hampton Inn was really great rooms were very clean and the beds so comfortable everything was spotless. We could not fault this hotel staff very friendly and helpful yes there were lots of people for breakfast but we never had to wait more than 5 minutes .food was very good and coffee tea and hot chocolate 24 hrs very welcome after a lot of sightseeing the hotel is close to everything .Well done Hampton we will be back

3 Great things about this hotel...Location, staff, and rate! You are close to many attractions, restaurants, and shopping. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were welcomed by staff. They had hot cider and citrus water available. Coffee and hot chocolate available 24/7 by the elevators. We had a clean room with a comfortable bed. When in NY, you must remember that rooms maybe more luxurious, but not larger. These rooms are compact. Fine for 2, but a little tight for more. There are two elevators. We used the steps when needed. Breakfast was good, but you need to be there by 8:15! It gets crowded about 9. Staff...They were some of the best! Chris and Jonathan were awesome! They went out of their way to help us with whatever we asked for.

My daughter, grand daughter and myself stayed here for two nights after News Years Day. Close to Times Square - only a couple of blocks and only a couple of blocks from The Port Authority Bus Station. We walked to everything and had a great time. Coffee, Tea and Hot Chocolate available 24 hours. Free Wi Fi and really good breakfast. Hotel was a little busy so it's better to go to breakfast earlier than late - but everything was well stocked. Two elevators - not too much of wait. Check-in was fast. We were on the 29th floor - so there was no street noise. Super Clean - Very Impressive! Staff also very friendly!!! Would definitely stay again!!

Being an employee of the brand, I understand the time and dedication necessary for a hotel to be on top of things 24 hours a day. The staff here is amazing. I would like to personally give a shout out to Jennifer. Being in her position I totally understand the stress one receives with people attempting to check in early etc. She was amazing.Now for tourists,This place is perfect if you are into the Time Square entertainment. You are literally a 5 min walk (if that) from all the lights and action.You really need to do your research and take advantage of the restaurants in the Hell's Kitchen area. Stay away from the garbage chain restaurants in Time Square.One thing to remember is this is Manhattan, and hotels in this area are completely different from different cities. Remember you are paying for location not size of the rooms. You will find many many hotels in NYC are small in room size. However, if you plan on coming to NYC to hang out in your hotel room than I suggest taking your family to St.Louis for the weekend, as you need to reevaluate your purpose.This place rocks....thanks again Jennifer and the GM Ms. Williams my fiance and friends of ours had a great time during NYE...all the best

I was very satisfied with my stay at the Hampton Inn this past weekend. When we arrived, we weren't able to check in (because we were early), but the gentleman at the front desk was quick to tag our bags so we could enjoy our day in the city. Each time I approached someone at the front desk with a question, or during check in/out, they were incredibly kind and helpful. The hotel was very clean and the room looked exactly as it did in the photographs on the website. We stayed in a king suite with a city view and it was a fantastic room. The bed was extremely comfortable. We also had control over the temperature, which was a major plus. We could see a beautiful view of the sunset over the river and the other direction, we could see the Empire State Building. The hotel was located within short walking distance to Times Square, as well as Penn Station, which is where we arrived and departed. We had a great experience staying at the Hampton Inn Times Square South and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to be close to Times Square.

I have stayed at many Hampton Inns, and this one was the worst in terms of service, but I guess considering the location and price paid, it wound up being a good value. Check in line was long, with no attempt to get another person to help. Just a quick "Sorry for the wait" with a smile was supposed to be enough to make me feel better. Got assigned a room, and headed up there. Turned out it had not been prepared! Bed unmade, bathroom dirty! Called the front desk, and I was assigned a new room. However it left a bad impression. They made it up to me by giving me free snacks.  New room. No bath mat for the floor one night, no face towels the other. Otherwise fine. As others have mentioned, the lines for the elevator are crazy at peak times. Request a low floor and walk, or just time everything right. The addition of free breakfast makes hotel a good value, however, coffee and oatmeal were watered down.

OK, what can you fit in a 10 x 12 room? How about two double beds, dresser, TV, bathroom and shower? The room was clean, the bed was comfy. Yes, it is tight, but why are you in the room anyway when you have the most expensive real estate and Broadway three blocks away?They have a popular and decent breakfast with eggs, sausage, potatoes, rolls, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal and homemade waffles. Add complimentary wifi and you have the ideal hotel for the budget traveler. We would come back.

Elevator seemed to be an issue, I felt I was always waiting a long time. Rooms were a bit small but super nice and the bathroom was amazing. I would recommend, but not sure I would stay again myself. You can walk to just about everything you need to.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel from Dec 29, 2014 to Jan 2, 2015. It was our first time in New York and we wanted to be where the action is and this hotel was the perfect choice. Free hot breakfast, free WIFI, walking distance to TimeSquare, Broadway, Macy's, Empire State Building, etc. The bed was really comfortable.The staff at the front desk has been extremely helpfull and we have to say a special "Thanks" to Chris who was at the front desk the morning we arrived and was instrumental in setting the high level of service we received over our stay.While being at the hearth of the action, New York being a lively city where action barely stops at night, the frequent sounds of sirens is part of the action and we could easily ear them, which sometime woke us up. But, this is a small price to pay to be this close to where the action is.Thank you for a great stay in New York.

Final stop on our road trip found us in this fairly small hotel in a very good location in New York. Convenient for shopping , subway, sight seeing and the all magical New Year's Eve celebrations in Times Square,Friendly and clean. Good breakfast included in our deal with hot drinks free of charge all day. Lifts are slightly annoying as it was very busy and could take ages to get to you. Room was small but four of us did ok as we had lots of luggage but we hadn't planned on staying in the room as we had to much to do and see. Would recommend for a short trip.

Spent Christmas Day and evening in NYC and stayed at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Time Square South. Very convenient location for my short stay (between Penn Station and Theater District in Time Square). The purpose of my visit was to see a show on Christmas evening. After the show, it was an enjoyable short walk to the hotel on 39th from 52nd. The main purpose of this review is to share a lost and found experience. I left some personal property at the hotel. When I contacted the hotel upon arrival back home, they promptly informed me that they did have possession of my property and then provided instructions as to how I should proceed to get my property back. Essentially it is up to the owner to arrange shipping and to inform the hotel as to when the pickup is scheduled. The hotel packaged the item and made sure it was available at the time of the sch pickup. In my case, the shipping company did not pick up on the sch day. The hotel was very kind to contact me via email and inform me of the situation. Otherwise, I may not have found out about the missed pickup for several days. After scheduling another pickup, the property was eventually shipped. I very much appreciated the effort from the housecleaning manager in this situation.

Crowds and crowds of excursion tourists coming in huge groups, raiding elevators and breakfast area like tsunamis. Elevator waits were up to 30 minutes for breakfast and checkout times, a real wowzer. The staff always scrambling to fill breakfast bar, the staff really worked hard to makeup for all the hotel's shortcomings. Small double beds with slippery covers drove me crazy, tiny rooms and bathroom, had to be careful moving in the shower and room so as not to hurt self or knock things. Small closet stunk of old socks and armpits....Dale was an amazing concierge, but all others were rude or aloof...people squabbling and fighting in the elevator due to overloading. 32 floors with only two small elevators! Watch out when leaving elevators as all corridors are only 2-people wide, if you turn left it goes to breakfast, right to front desk so if you turn in the wrong direction you are stuck in a crowd of upset people. Phew! Breakfast line could reach 30 people-long. Way overpriced.

It was visiting my parents in the NW suburbs of New York City. It was late Sunday night when I decided I wanted to spend Monday night in the city. I accessed the Hilton website and this property was listed for $134.10 a night. I jumped on it and reserved it right away. With tax the room was $157.38. This was a bargain for New York City and this time of year.Room - I was assigned a room with a king bed on the 31st floor. The room was bright, clean and comfortable. As expected for a city hotel, the room was very small. A comfortable mattress, soft linens, and plush pillows provided us with a great night sleep. The bathroom was also small. The stand-up shower with glass-sliding door was fine for me, but a taller or heavier person might have some challenges maneuvering around. It had an adjustable massage showerhead. The water temperature got very hot and the water pressure was excellent. The complimentary wi-fi (I am a HiltonHonors Gold member) in the room was fast all the time. The room had a flat screen television, safe, iron, hairdryer, small closet, etc. The placement of the electrical outlets could have been a little more convenient and there could have been more of them. The bathroom also only came with one bar of soap. Usually there is a bar for the sink and a bar for the shower. I could have asked for another one, but it was not a big deal. The wall-unit air conditioner made the room very comfortable. No refrigerator or microwave.Service - The staff I encountered were all great – smiling, patient, helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable. I arrived at 12:15pm to a very chaotic lobby. People and luggage were EVERYWHERE. The lobby is quite small, but the staff did a great job keeping everything in order. I was not able to check-in, so I just stored my luggage with the bellman and went on my way. I arrived back to the hotel at 3:30pm and was able to check-in at that time.  I did request a late check-out, but it was not granted.Hotel Information - The hotel has 184 rooms and 32 floors. The lobby is quite small and so is the breakfast area. The hot, complimentary breakfast buffet was fine, but also chaotic….lots of people, long lines, etc. Just be patient. The hallways are very small as well. I noticed a fitness center on the bottom floor, but did not use it.Area near Hotel - Good safe location (39th Street, Between 8th and 9th Avenue). It is located in the Garment District in Midtown West. It is a short walk to Hell’s Kitchen, Times Square, a subway station, the Port Authority Bus Terminal, etc. I like walking, so it was not a bad walk to Grand Central Terminal, Herald Square, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Empire State Building, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Saint Patrick’s Cathedral, etc.Overall I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The price, location, and staff were all great. I would stay here again next time I am in New York City!

Thank goodness for the flag outside this hotel--it was hard to spot with all the trucks doubleparked along the road. But once we got in, we found a warm welcome. We arrived at 10 a.m. and they stored our luggage while we went out exploring.Based here, in one day (from 10:30 to 8:30 p.m.) we saw: Grand Central Station, NY Public Library, Rockefeller Center, Lego store, Top of the Rock, mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral, Times Square, lunch with Hallal Guys, and best of all, 2.5 hours in Central Park (explored half of it, up to Belvedere Castle). Instead of using valet parking, we self-parked at the garage across the street. Up early next morning for breakfast and tour of 9/11 and Statue of Liberty. Great base! Room clean, breakfast great, luggage retrieved no problem. They even handed out bottles of water for breakfast, which came in handy later in the day. We got a great price because they seemed to drop their prices shortly before I booked in mid November. By going before Thanksgiving, we experienced both fall color AND winter decorations, without the holiday crowds!

This has to be the most busy Hampton Inn I have ever stayed at! All the staff have been so nice and pleasant through the maddness!! The location has been very good and convenient to things. The room and bathroom are small, but it has been nice, quiet, and clean. Thanks for the great week!

When you first arrive you may think where am I, but you are just off the beaten path. A short walk takes you into the action of Time Square and Broadway. The location makes it fairly quiet. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. Rooms are small but most are in NYC at this price range. My only complaint is the elevator was a nightmare. Waited 20 minutes for an elevator and had to end up walking down 14 flights with our bags!

I originally booked two rooms as my daughter was supposed to join my son and me. She cancelled and the hotel was willing to refund my money even though the deadline had expired. Typical Hampton service

When we got our car back from their parking service, the interior of the car was damaged, the back windows were opened (it was winter) and the music blasting. When asked to speak to the manager the staff declined and said that it was not their problem that the car was damaged, even though they sell this as a service apparently they only care about getting paid but not about the quality of service, which needles to say was horrible. At the very least when you park someones car DO NOT DAMAGE IT! We had someone from parking coming in but all they said is that there is nothing they can do and they gave the managers number which was conveniently turned off all day. I would not recommend this service, I would also not recommend this hotel due to the lack of service we've received.

We were here Christmas Eve & Christmas Day. Staff was pleasant and everything was clean. Breakfast on Christmas morning was a madhouse of people, but the workers were doing their utmost to keep up with the demand. They stored our luggage when we checked out so we didn't have to tote it around the rest of the day. Would stay here again. Close to the 42nd Street/Port Authority subway stop.

After a 5 hour drive getting to this hotel I arrived and check in was at 3PM. I arrived at 2PM and the room wasn't read yet (the suite), the front desk staff asked me to come back at 3PM which I did and they did not even start cleaning the room yet. I had a very important work event for the Z100 jingle ball. After 20 mins of arguing I had them give me another room just so I can shower and be ready which seemed to be a hassle. Then made me move all my stuff to my original suite and did not offer to help or offer any assistance knowing how late I was.

My daughter, granddaughter stayed at the hotel the weekend before Christmas and found it to be an excellent choice. The rooms were very clean but small. The breakfast buffet gave us a good start each morning. it was great not to have to find a restaurant. It was reasonably close to most sights but still on a fairly quiet street. We would recommend it.

Good location for the sites but for 2 people it's really tight, closet is extremely small, bathroom shower is incredibly narrow, I'm average size and could barely move in it. Only room really for one bag a second bag will have to sit on top of the 1 chair. - surroundings are great, good restaurants are very close. - Bus direct to the Newark airport ($16, one way) is only 2 blocks away.

Stayed four nights. Had booked a wheelchair accessible double room but this room was very small and impossible to move around in. When I mentioned this to the staff I were upgraded to a larger room. A good gesture from the hotel. However the toilet and shower were quite small for a wheelchair. The hotel is a bit run down and the breakfast was not that good. Good location but I would probably not stay there again.

We had a mini college roommate reunion weekend in NYC and this hotel was the best price and location. We arrived early and were able to leave our bags. We did not officially check in until after 6 and our bags were readily available. The front desk was helpful with reccommending places to see. Breakfast was better than most other Hampton Inns. We were able to check out and leave our bags again until we wanted to leave NYC. We did speak with a family from Deleware who waited almost 2 hours for their car to be delivered from the parking lot. I was glad we took mass transit.

Prompt service, great location to attractions, rooms a little small but very clean and comfortable. Free breakfast and menu was great, in NYC it can get a little pricey, so this really helped. Would stay here again, no problem.

It is above average hotel...well positioned, offering a good service...very friendly, helpful....nice american hospitality...Times square is some 10 minutes away by foot, legendary Hell's Kitchen neighborhood is near and it offers large number of small national restaurants, liquor stores and supermarkets.It's not big thing to take a walk from the hotel to Chelsea, Little Italy, China Town and Financial District.Also, Central Park is some 15-20 minutes walking...All in all, well positioned and quality hotel...

Jennifer on the front desk was really helpful... I had asked for info on finding a local NYC deli and she took it one step further asking me what I wanted and when I said a roast beef sandwich she immediately jumped onto phone to confirm they had it at Ben's Deli one street over... She was right too, great sandwich!!! All in all, I found an extraordinary good rate on HOTEL TONIGHT app for total of $255 for 2 nights... I was expecting not so great but was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel very clean, comfortable and fresh...oh, and they provided a complimentary breakfast and free WiFi... Very pleased with my experience and thanks to Jennifer with the Santa hat and her teammates for a memorable stay.... I will be back!!

This place is a home away from home. Tucked away on 39th but still close enough to all the major attractions and nightlife. The rooms are small but very comfortable and the bed was great! I was able to get a good night sleep in the city that never sleeps. The staff and concierge were helpful, courteous and personal. Efficiency and hospitality is what makes this hotel a keeper in my book.

When we booked the room I was skeptical about staying in noisy time square. But the hotel is actually in the garment district on a quiet street. The service was great. Everyone was very helpful. I appreciated the call room make sure everything was ok with the room. We were happy with the full breakfast. I highly recommend staying here.

The rooms were spacious modern and clean. The hotel was centrallylocated. The breakfast was extradonanory and the staff was very helpful. This hotel would be recommend to everyone. The beds we're realy comfortable.

This was the perfect price and location for a family of 4 during the holiday season. The staff was very friendly and efficient. We loved having the breakfast included and the warm cookies were a hit with my children. The valet service was super easy and our car was back when we needed it.

Stayed here recently for two nights and had an excellent stay. Had a room on the 30th floor with a view of downtown and The Empire State Building. Hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and multiple Subway lines. Staff is professional, friendly and helpful.

Loved the staff at this hotel! Everyone from the front desk clerk to the baggage boys were so incredibly nice!!Room was clean and comfortable. Only negative issue was sometimes it was a bit of a wait for an elevator.Great place!

my overall experience with the hotel was very good. Staff on the whole very helpful. Hotel small but clean & renovated recently. My reason for this review is to commend Indhira Rodriguez in the breakfast room. She could not do enough for you. Even made me my own oatmeal after they ran out. She is a real gem & should be appreciated & compensated appropriately.

This hotel is located just around the block from Times Square, so it's walking distance, so you do not have to have rental, taxi, or a bus to get to Times Square to go Shopping, Eating, or see one of their Broadway Shows. The Hotel itself is very nice & clean, very nice & professional staff to eager to help anytime day or night. One thing is that the back rooms are really small, but still acceptable, & the front rooms facing the street are the bigger rooms to stay in. They also offer free breakfast in the morning from 6a to 10a everyday. They have wonderful things to eat, but does differ everyday except for Waffles. You can have a Waffle 7 days a week. Drinks are Coffee, Tea, Hot Chocolate, Juice, or Milk. Coffee, Tea, or Hot Chocolate is available 7 days a week 24 hours a day.

All the staff with whom we had contact were excellent. Someone did an excellent job when they hired these individuals. Wellington stood out as a pleasant, caring employee. He was always smiling and helpful not only to us but with all the guests we observed Wellington interacting.

Hi, let me first clarify that I usually travel for business in the US, Asia and few other places. I've been in different hotels in the last couples of weeks, most of them in NYC area, since my business is in the city and I usually spend 6 months of a year in Manhattan. I'm a transplant New Yorker and since I'm getting my place next year and I needed a place to stay a few days in the city. One of those options was this Hampton Inn. I've stayed several times in the Hampton Inn hotels in the past, and I thought this was going to be a pleasant stayed as always but unfortunately, it wasn't. it's a simple hotel but comfy, good breakfast and good value. Usually trained staff and friendly people. I don't usually write reviews about my stays in hotels, I do read it on tripadvisor.com though, but I'm so pissed off with this situation that I had no choice. I had breakfast at 8AM and everything was perfect as always. Went back to my room to rest a little bit more since I didn't have much of sleep in the last few days, and at 9AM in the room one floor up from mine, they started to hammer badly something that literally felt in head... It was probably a minor repair I thought in that room but it felt inside mine very intense to the point I was on the phone and I couldn't listen to the person I was talking to and had to hang up. I thought it was ok and I patiently waited for 15 minutes but it kept going. After 30 minutes, they started to drill or something that felt like drilling and literally I couldn't speak and listen to myself. They stopped for a few minutes, and I thought they finished. Started another phone call that I had to make, and suddenly they were drilling inside my head again.... had to apologize with the person I was talking, and hang up. It kept going for 1 hour and half (I was very patient...) and I got upset. Called to reception and asked them to please stop that noise ASAP. I couldn't get rest nor make a few phone calls I needed. They told me they were going to handle the situation. After a few minutes, I spoke to Jennifer, and she told me they were going to stop, apologized to me and offer to check-out at 2pm. I was so pissed off and checking out at 8pm wouldn't have done any difference for me since I had meetings in the afternoon. Just needed them to stop whatever thing they were doing.... That was my precious time to relax, rest a bit, organize my day. After a few more minutes, they lower the noise a little bit but NEVER stopped. They probably stopped at 11.30AM. I decided to check-out at 12PM, they apologized again in my way out. I don't really understand how a hotel that belongs to a prestigious chain of hotels, that probably understand how to create a pleasant experience for guests and how to develop long-lasting relationships with customers, can ever even THINK of doing this heavy renovation the way it was being done. I'm not in the hotel industry but believe me I usually stay a lot in different hotels and I'm usually loyal to the ones that provides good value like this one. I would never, ever cross in my mind doing some work like this in a room close of other guests. It's all about creating a nice, relaxing, cozy and accommodating experience for guests... I suppose if have to do this kind of work, you need to clear some rooms that are going be directly affected by the noise, hummer, drilling, etc... Probably it wasn't the case since they didn't want to loose some $$ blocking a few rooms???? Anyway, it is an isolated situation that ruined my whole experience with the brand and not sure if I'm coming back again. Overall the hotel delivers what you expect, and if you are lucky enough (not like me...) you won't find an issue like this. For me, the simple fact that I had to go through all this, completely changed my perception of the hotel and how they handle a situation like this. Also the fact that this eventually may happen again in the future, will make me think twice of coming back. I probably won't.

Marlene, Chris, Liz, Jennifer, Nelson and the entire staff never fail to make us feel like family when we stay here. We have been loyal to this location at least twice a year for many years now. The location is perfect for the theater district, the breakfast is worth getting out of bed for and don't get me started on the freshly baked cookies offered in the afternoons. I really must give a very special thanks to Marlene and her entire housekeeping staff for going above and beyond. Mom and I are so very grateful for all you do to prepare for our stay and to make us truly feel we are in our "home away from home."Chris welcomes us so warmly every evening on our return from a day exploring the city. Thank you. Our stay is made that much more special because of all of you. Can't wait to see you all again, real soon!

We were 6 high school friends celebrating our 60th birthdays in NY. Hampton Inn provided a perfect location, an excellent staff, and small but workable rooms. We were more than pleased and having coffee, tea, and hot chocolate at any time was wonderful. The breakfast couldn't be beat either. In the lobby, I chatted with a woman who stated she always stays at Hampton Inns; I might do the same after this weekend.

For a NY hotel, this one has enough space in the rooms, close to Times Square and the price is good. Also they offer complimentary breakfast, not continental, this is a full breakfast with scrambled eggs and waffle machines. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable of the area with more than great tips on restaurants and stuff. I'll definitely use this hotel again.

I just came by from a holiday in this hotel, the position is very good, very close to Times Square.The service is excellent especially Jonathan at the reception and all the girls that work in the restaurant especially indhira...I will definitely go bk if I'll go to New York!

We both love NYC and have been regulars for forty years. This hotel has been the best value yet Close to the theaters nice comfortable bed , friendly staff, and a bonus breakfast. We particularly like the fact we could walk to TKTS as well the subway is close as well which can be more entertaining than the shows.

Great price Great staff Great location, close to the subway, Times Square and Penn Station. We even walked to the Empire State Building. The elevator was impossible to use during check out time Breakfast was crowded and food went quick I would definitely return especially for the price

We just left here from a quick little getaway to take the kids to the city for the first-time. Staff was awesome just got in and the kids were a little ramy from the drive said they were hungry and thirsty they handed us a little bag with water and snacks. Thank you. Rooms were clean but tight for a family of 4. But we weren't there to hang out in the room. That leads to location great we were able to walk a couple of blocks to really any of the major sights you want to see. All in all great spot great location great value great staff will stay again and will recommend.

Checked in on a Sunday at 530pm and room wasn't ready! Waited until 6pm before we could check in. Asked for a fridge in room because there wasn't one and was told there were only 3 in the whole hotel. Bathroom was dirty. No pay per view movies on TV like most other Hamptons have. Asked for late check out at 1pm next day and when I called down for car at 12:55 I was told by a very rude front desk woman that if I didn't get down there to check out in person in 5 minutes I would be charged another day! I grabbed my things and tried to get down in time but since the hotel workers use the guest elevators I was stalled over 10 minutes as the elevator went to every floor. Rude, rude front desk person and I will never stay there again!

I have mixed views...there were some great points about this hotel and some not so great!On the plus, location was great, 10 mins walk to Central Park, 5 mins to Times Sq, 8 stops to WTC. The bed was very comfy and the room was a very good size, especially for New York! Staff were friendly and helpful. But then there were some downsides. The rooms were noisy. We were on the front side of the hotel and the traffic and subway noise could be heard in the room. The walls are also thin, which means you hear the neighbours, and if they sit up until 2 in the morning chatting, you hear them! Having so said that, our daughter and boyfriend had a room on the front side, two floors lower down from us and the noise didn't bother them at all.And the free breakfast was a scrum every morning. The eating area is too small and the help-yourself buffet does not have enough room for the numbers of people. But the food was good, albeit limited, but then it was free and in NYC, that's a bonus.So, in summary - a good hotel and I'd stay there again, but ask for a room higher up and on the backside. I'd also set my alarm for an early breakfast before the hordes come down to eat.

Excellent hotel and very friendly staff. We stayed in a suite on the 32nd floor and it was very nice and accommodated of our guests that we also staying in the same hotel. Its a great location and we are happy that we decided to stay at the Hampton.

The Hampton Inn on 39th Street is certainly convenient to the theater district and not far from Penn Station. And, 42nd street is the nexus of several subway lines as well as the shuttle to Grand Central. Our room, which we assume was of the most common type in the hotel was much smaller than the typical Hampton Inn room, but up to Hampton's standards regarding cleanliness and amenities. If you need space in your room, this hotel is not for you. The biggest drawback (on the weekend before Thanksgiving at least) was the crowding that results from the layout of the hotel: 32 stories with 6 rooms on a floor and only two small elevators. Long waits for an elevator and a very crowded breakfast room result. There was also a long wait at the desk. At both check in and check out the single person on duty was almost overwhelmed with requests for bills, for checking luggage in before room check in and retrieving luggage after a return from time on the town after checking out, as well as having to answer questions. The 3 people we dealt with remained calm, cool and polite, but were clearly stressed. At peak times the management really should double the desk staff. Other tips. No need to have them call a taxi. There is a taxi stand a 5 minute walk away on 8th avenue. And no need to walk to 42nd to get underground to the subway. There are entrances on the corner of 40th and 8th ave. So for us, location trumped a very small room and a harried desk staff.

Staff stored our luggage before our check in and after check out before our late flight. Concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. Her tips made our stay much more entertaining and fun. Everything is within walking distance or a cheap cab ride. Don't take the bike taxi's, they are very expensive. Hotel even arranged for airport transport. Great stay but don't bank on the breakfast buffet, it's very crowded. The Paris Baguette is on 7th and is a great place to catch a meal!

Nice Hotel. Exactly what you would expect from the Hilton brand. Hotel is very close to Penn Station, Times Square and the Empire State Building but on a quieter street away from the action. Easy walk to major NYC attractions.

The room is ... OK. My king-bed room was pretty tight, even by NYC standards, and came with nothing more than a TV, a coffee-maker, and a small wardrobe. Oh, a chair too. The bathroom was totally renovated, but also very tight. There are other Times Square hotels with more spacious rooms, with refrigerators & microwaves in the room, etc.The location is ... OK. It's on 39th St. between 8th and 9th Avenues, but much closer to 9th--in other words, about the far edge of what can plausibly be called the Times Square area.The breakfast is ... OK. Typical Hampton Inn fare--in other words, prepackaged breakfast product. There are lots and lots of diners in the area, so there's no reason why you'd want to eat breakfast in the hotel unless you're in a rush. It's free though.Wi-Fi is free too. Weak signal, however: it was strong enough for my laptop, but my cell phone had trouble picking it up.Staff is cheerful! No complaints there.

Great location for our visit to NYC. This is a tall hotel with very small rooms. So small that it is not possible for 2 people to pass between the bottom of the bed and the TV stand. This is a room like we find in NYC and London and Paris; small but adequate. The front desk staff are very busy and don't have time for the normal niceties we expect at a Hampton Inn. The concierge was very helpful and the bellmen were great when we needed a cab to go to Penn Station on a rainy day. It is more expensive than a number of similar hotels in the same neighborhood so we were kind of annoyed when we asked for a couple of bottles of water and they made a big deal of giving us 2 small bottles. The housekeepers scheduled service to our room around our schedule. Breakfast was not the best for a Hampton - but it was OK. It was very crowded with a very active and loud group.

A great value in a clean, convenient, comfortable hotel! Location is perfect for traveling in/out of city & getting to major tourist attractions. Comfortable lobby to rest between shopping/sightseeing. Complimentary hot breakfast fantastic before starting your day!

Clean and comfortable. The building is 30+ floors with only 6 rooms per floor. No issue getting an elevator. Great front desk staff. Typical Hampton Inn amenities. Great location; convenient to the PABT and theater district without the theater district noise. Would definitely stay there again.

This was the perfect location for what we were in NYC to see and do. The accommodations were very good, the front desk and other staff were very pleasant and helpful and the lobby area was accessible. I utilized the fitness center and the business center, both with ease. My only negative comment would be that there was not enough fruit or variety of fresh fruit at breakfast. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to family and friends.

I chose this hotel because it was close to the Lincoln tunnel as I needed to head that way in the morning. I believe that is one of the reasons that the street the hotel is on was quite busy at 5pm when I checked in and had quite a backup. The hotel has a curb reserved directly in front of it for dropping off passengers or luggage. The hotel offers valet parking so all you have to do is park your car at the curb, go inside and check in and let them know you want to use the valet. They give you a form to fill out and take your key, give you a ticket and you are good go. They say when you want the car to call down about 1/2 hour and they will have it at the curb for you.The hotel was very quiet which is a good thing for NYC and I did not hear anything from outside the entire night. The breakfast area was quite large with plenty of seating room and was well stocked. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice. I had to contact the hotel for a reservation mistake that I made and I talked with Aneidy who was very friendly and was able to assist me with my reservation problem. When I checked in she remembered my name and was very friendly.In the morning I called down as requested 30 minutes before I was ready to leave and my car was parked at the curb earlier than I had asked for and I was able to leave on time.

I was in town for my 20th Reunion for Maritime College and absolutely loved staying here. The front desk staff, especially Nelson were all great and cheerful, friendly and helpful. The concierge was also very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was superb and better than I had expected! The room and bathroom were very clean and I had no trouble with the TV or Satellite. As soon as the weather cleared up my TV channels came in great. A short walk to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and the subway, Times Square and Carmine's Restaurant and Sardi's Bar and Restaurant. I plan to stay here again when I have to come back to NYC in January or February.

I always prefer branded - focussed serviced hotels when i travel to big world cities. Two simple reason - my needs are simple & i spend only the night and first hour in the hotel in such cities anyway. If this is your criteria too read ahead. This hotel checks all the boxes fully, excellent location for NYC (Underline excellent - i wouldn't want to live any closer to Times Square due to the 24 hr JAM thats always there), spanking NEAT rooms - including Bed, Furniture & Toilet, decent breakfast (i always prefer eating at a new cafe/deli in such cities). To illustrate the location, it is just 3-4 blocks from both the both the broadway, Times Square & Rockefeller Plaza. There is an Avis 5 blocks down & good asian/Arabian restaurants on the other side of hotel. My favourite Pizza Place (John Pizzeria - always touristy) is also very close. Mind You - 1. There is no F&B other than Breakfast in the hotel so please dont think you ll get any options for dinner or even drinks2. Since its a tall building with 6-7 rooms per floor accessed through only 2 lifts, it gets very very busy between 0800-0900 am (breakfast) and 1300-1400 (checkin&out). 3. The rooms are a little tight. Do think twice if a. you are couple with heavy (more than 2 large sized) luggage or you want to stay longer than 1 week. I recommend this hotel for all the above things. Ohh, and also very low noise (corridor or window).

Location was perfect. Close to everything. Our room was small but adequate for NY. I was so pleasantly surprised that the room was very quiet. Staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is very good, coffee and tea available 24 hours a day. Free wifi. I will definitely stay there again. Highly recommend.

I reiterate what other reviewers have said. I read all these reviews before booking the room for 3 nights. The rate was better here than at other hotels for this time of year. It was my first stay here so I was concerned. It was CLEAN (most important to me is a clean bed and bathroom), staff were so friendly and helpful (unlike some of the other hotels we've stayed at). It's 32 floors high with about 6 rooms per floor. Rooms are very small. we had 2 double beds in ours. Small, but everything you need is in there including room safe. Bathroom had a glass shower not tub, but we didn't need a tub. Hotel had free wifi (hardly any hotels offer this), free breakfast (bagels, waffle maker, muffins, cereals hot & cold, omlettes (heated), sausage, juices, yogurt) is basic and enough. There has to be something you like there and it helped keep the cost down for the trip. Coffee & tea available all day and night in their dining area. Choc chip cookies in the lobby in the afternoons. Ice machines/vending on several floors. There was nothing wrong with this hotel that I can cite, I would've given 5 stars except for the smaller rooms and the few blocks away from the subway at 42nd st. The general location is fine--great for walking to the theater area and restaurants. Chris at the front desk has a smile to greet you that's genuine, not forced and it's welcoming after a day of walking around the city.

I usually stay the Hampton Inn Times Square North, but the rate here one weekend was so much lower, so we elected to stay here instead. The staff was so friendly and welcoming I could have hugged them after every interaction. I mean NICE. Lovely folks. The hotel is, however, really small. The halls are very narrow, and there are only four (maybe six, I forget) rooms on each floor. And those rooms are the smallest I have ever stayed in. Clean, nicely appointed, but small. If the place wasn't so claustrophobic, I would have given it 5 stars. The following night we stayed at the Hilton Times Square and our room there was, honestly, three times the size of the room we had at the Hampton Inn. For about the same price (which is rare as prices are very fluid in response to season and demand.) Would I stay here again? Absolutely. Would I recommend it to my friends? yes, but only those value seekers who would not balk at the closing-in feeling of the halls and the small rooms -- or those who place staff friendliness and competence at the top of their list of preferences when booking a room (with the caveat that the place is really, really narrow.)

Stayed here over Columbus Day weekend. Hotel is nice with smaller rooms but not bad at all. We liked the location near Times Square. Comic con was in town so there was some good people watching. Overall a pleasant experience.

We came in for 5 nights to enjoy NYC and this years Marathon. Our package included "Free" parking ! Clean room, enough space, big enough bathroom & free wi-Fi. The hotel staff was fun, helpful & attentive. As it was Halloween, the staff was made up in costumes and created a fun atmosphere ! Unfortunately, the first 3 nights we stayed, the staff forgot to make Hilton's famous cookies for their guests. We will stay again !

Our vintage 1957 Chevy was carefully cared for by the excellent valets. Nelson, Wellington and Yesis were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful--we felt like family! Our room was on the 30th floor; we had a great view of the city! Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. It was good size for NYC with excellent lighting and lots of outlets. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to staying at this Hampton Inn again!

This hotel is the best. All staff friendly, helpful, smiling. Rooms small but clean modern beds were so comfortable. Breakfast is hot continental, very good selection. There is free 24hr hot drinks. Great location. 10/10. We'il be back.

Stayed at Times Square South for 3 weeks - my best friend and I loved it !!! Staff were so friendly and helpful - will definitely stay there again - so central to everything - the breakfast was great everyday and the free wifi access was a bonus - we even arrived super early on our check in day but there was dramas with checking us in early so we could shower and enjoy breakfast - can't fault it at all.

This Hampton is a nice, clean place to stay convenient to mid-town, at $249 it was also reasonably priced. The bed linens were clean and fresh and the room had been well prepared. Breakfast the next day was a complete array of options, coffee was fresh and tasty. This is my second stay at this Hilton and I will be returning.

I stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square October 2014 and was extremely pleased with the service and accomodation. The room and bathroom was very clean and fresh smelling. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bed linen clean, white and smelled fresh. The location was so conveniently close to all the theatres. I must also mention the free breakfast that included not just coffee and bagels but other healthy choices. JaiPaul was extremely helpful and provided much information about the local area.

The room I had was good. The bed was comfortable, the heating/cooling worked well and the shower had very good water pressure. There were two areas of disappointment, however. The biggest disappointment was the in-room wifi. It was exceptionally slow. So slow that I could not do any of the work I needed to do at night. It was maddening. The second disappointment was the breakfast. IT was not nearly as good as I have had at other hotel chains I have stayed at on other NY visits.

This is by far the worst Hampton Inn I have ever visited. It started when we arrived. When we arrived we could not locate a valet outside and so I sent my wife in to check on parking. 35 minutes later the valet finally showed up. In between while I sat in the car my wife talked to multiple individuals who were in no hurry to help or even tell her who could help. She finally had to raise her voice to get someone's attention. The lobby is cramped and was over full with people, luggage and a disorganized staff. Once we got to our rooms, they were tiny with a heating and cooling that didn't really work. You either had heat or cold, no in between. When we left for the evening, we were not offered help other than to say. Go up to the corner and you can probably get a cab there. Breakfast room is about as small as lobby and not sufficient for the number of guests. I will never go back to this hotel

Checked-in to the hotel today. Reached early, so couldn't check-in. My luggage was however stored, so I could come back and check-in when the room was ready. I've been in a few Hilton hotels in the past few days, but I'm truly impressed by the warm service and the nice room. Of particular mention are Nelson, who checked me in, and Alfonso at the Conceirge. The room is not large (then again, this is NYC), but sufficient and was prepared well. Hotel, the room and the street are a little old, but it's been maintained well by Hampton. The prices are great too. I'm quite impressed and will look to come back!

Just returned from our first time in New York City. Stayed at this hotel from Oct 22 until Oct 25. Everything about this hotel was perfect, from the free breakfast, to the cleanliness, rooms were great! We stayed on the 28th floor, beds were comfortable, view was nice and the room was very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful when needed. Could not go wrong with this hotel. Read a few complaints about the elevator wait, we never had an issue!

39th street location a bit run down, but that translates to lower prices. Internally, hotel is consistent with quality I expect from Hampton Inn. If you're a big guy, you will find shower cramped. Otherwise, room is great, you're just a few blocks from Times Square and the hotel is an excellent value.

This was my first time in New York in over 20 years. I was debating about where to stay. I found Hampton Inn and Holiday Inn nearly next to one another. I am extremely pleased that I chose Hampton Inn. I was pleasantly surprised and very impressed. I would "highly" recommend Hampton Inn to anybody/anyone.

I've enjoyed staying here. It's a good standard of hotel with comfortable rooms and wi-fi in the room (much needed, if you are trying to avoid roaming charges and also in New York, where the concept of providing wi-fi in cafes etc has yet to make the mark)… and great to have a free breakfast in the hotel, which has a good range of food to set you up for the day.Look it's in the Times Square area - it's not in Upper East Side, so adjust your expectations accordingly. The street is fairly quiet (for central NY and there is good sound insulation) and you can open the window if you want some fresh air!Really convenient for loads of transport links and lots of subway lines are easily accessible.

I love staying at this hotel. It was clean, Near shopping areas. Good staff.Very good breakfast. The room was a little small but we as a family didn't care about it. It was near Time square, and subways station. It was a good place for our family.

Room was on the small side, but very clean and up-to-date. Staff at this hotel were very pleasant and accommodating. Very convenient location just a block from Port Authority and the subway. Excellent breakfast.

The hotel is great for its location and proximity to subway, penn station and shopping.  Wonderful and spacious restaurant with good breakfast spread. Surely, worth the money for quality and convenience.

I like this hotel very much. Staff are polite, helpful and very friendly. It rpovides quality complimentary breakfast that saved me a lot of time of going out looking for food in the morning. So convenient. Room size is not bad. It is on a very comnevience location in NYC. Thumbs up.

Everyone was super helpful. Nelson made us feel very welcome when checking in. Concierge gave us lots of information. Breakfast food was great. Room was clean. Good location if you walk, but hard to get taxis. Consider uber or walking up a block to get a taxi.

The holtel is clean furniture is good, aircons in the room is very noisy and you wake up to paper cups plastic knifes and forks with paper plates at breakfast ...this at a rate that is higher or euqual to most of the 5 start hotels in the area. Only use this hotel as a last option.

Have stayed here twice now for overnight trips into NYC. I love the location, close to Times Square. Of course many food choices around area. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is always too busy so we never use this option. Staff is nice at check in, only had one snooty young lady last time we checked out. We have only stayed when the price was right, certain times can be expensive.

I had a lovely experience at the Hampton Inn when I stayed there for four nights in October 2014. All of the staff I dealt with were helpful and charming, especially Aneidy! My room was clean and comfortable with up-to-date furnishings. Breakfast was good and plentiful (and yes a little crowded, but it's good and it's free!). I arrived early and left late and they were happy to store my luggage so I didn't have to drag it around the city. I saw a comment about the safety of the area - I walked home alone (solo female) at almost 1 am and felt perfectly comfortable. The hotel is a short walk (10 mins) from Penn Station which was very convenient for me. I would happily stay here again!

Since my stay for one night which was about six weeks ago, I have had to contact the hotel on three separate occasions because they initially charged my credit card the incorrect amount. It took weeks to see a partial refund to get the correct amount charged, and now I log onto my credit card statement to see they have charged me, six weeks later, again for an entire stay - when I have already paid! I will NEVER return to this hotel.

Arrived early and checked my bag so I could walk to 9/11 memorial and museum. Jennifer at front desk reminded me what a long walk it would be and let me know of other options. When I opted to stick with walking, she pulled out a map, made sure I knew exactly where I was going and suggested I break up the walk a bit by walking the newly expanded high line. Great suggestion. Got back to the hotel around 8 and Chris checked me in. Very friendly and helpful letting me know about everything the hotel has to offer. Each of the bell men that helped me were very friendly as well but I don't recall their names. Room was incredibly clean including spotless bathroom. Hotel is in perfect location for anyone looking to take in Times Square and Central Park. I'll be returning mainly because of the staff though.

I was left with some profound advice from Aneidy at the front desk. She said, "To develop is to grow, not to change". This was one of the many great interactions I had with the staff in this location who were super attentive to help. The hotel itself was a typical Manhattan hotel... nice, tight on space, but overall delivered what I needed. If you're looking for a nice place, conveniently located and free breakfast, this is your ticket.

Lodging location was good and near Times Square. We walked several places! We walked to Empire State Building. Enjoyed good food in restaurants close by. We travel to NYC every 2 years. We take in a broad way shows etc. We ride hop on & hop off bus which takes us everywhere we desire to visit. It is fun to sit in Times Square, on Broadway, in mid afternoon to have a refreshment plus to see the many people who have dawned costumes for picture taking. Just watching people brings a joy of laughter. Also, on 42nd Street, while in Times Square, it is a must for everyone to have a CARICATURE done. I absolutely love mine. Then we boarded Carnival/Splendor cruise ship, (pier nearby) for a week of cruising in New England to enjoy shore tours and autumn colors. Had a wonderful time.

Stayed at this property on September 5. The guests were loud next door and smoking an illegal substance. Many TV stations were not working thru the cable and the response from the hotel engineer was oh well sometimes this happens. The agent was rude upon check-out when I asked for an invoice.Stay somewhere else.

We stayed 5 nights in this hotel and loved it ! Great, great location to use as a base to explore everything New York has to offer, Times Square, Empire State Building and Grand Central Station are all in walking distance from the hotel. Our room felt on the small side at first until we realised we had 2 double beds in it ! one King size would have give us more room but it was clean and quiet even though we were near the lift (only 6 rooms on each floor so it's hard not to be near the lift !). The negative reviews have mentioned how busy the lifts get but that can happen anywhere at peak times, at least they are not slow ones and the free breakfast can be a bit of a scramble during peak times but it is served from 6am til 10am (doors close sharply at 10) so you just have to go really early or wait til later. For a free breakfast we were pleasantly surprised how much choice there was, it is all help yourself and well stocked with a hot/cold buffet, waffle making machines as well as fruit and pastries. The free tea and coffee is constantly available in the lobby which is a nice touch and yes they do bring out free cookies at the front desk about 4pm. There are lots of restaurants nearby as you are around the corner from Hells Kitchen (right out of the hotel then first right and straight up), one review said the area outside the hotel may be unpleasant after dark as you are near the bus station, well you DON'T KNOW until you do ACTUALLY go out after dark ! and I can assure you my wife and I found the area outside of daylight hours absolutely fine, we ate out every night in the area and it was excellent. To recommend a couple of places,we found an excellent Thai restaurant called Aceluck (follow my earlier instructions as it's just around the corner in 9th Ave) and a great burger/bar restaurant on 46th Street between 8th and 9th Avenue ( great value lunch menu).This hotel was perfect for what we wanted for our break (nearly forgot to mention the free wi-fi which is essential for us while travelling) and we would not hesitate to go back again.

Our flight to NYC was cancelled and at the last minute we had to change our reservation. Called Hampton Inn and talked to Aneidy. She changed our reservation with no hassle. When we arrived at NY she was working the front desk. Again she was pleasant, efficient and helpful. It was the beginning of a great visit. Super employee!

This hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff was outstanding. For the price you cannot beat this Hampton Inn in New York. The complimentary breakfast has a nice variety and is great for getting you going in the morning. And they have fresh baked cookies every day!!

Great location ,few minutes walk to Times Square. Has great friendly staff especially the concierge Lilliana.Has good selection of hot and cold breakfast. The room is small but it's clean and beds are very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel is nice and clean, breakfast is average for Hampton Inn, but usually you do not get breakfast in an NY hotel. Other perks include free WiFi in the rooms. location is near the bus terminal so may be a bit unpleasant after-dark. Elevators may be problematic at rush hours. Do not expect for a check in before 15:00, so plan your first day ahead.

Not "luxury" per se, but very pleasant, clean, wonderful location, and wonderful staff. Small, quiet, not a bit of a glitch during our stay. Everyone was extremely helpful and seemed very happy and satisfied in their position. Front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and breakfast staff were all amazing. Comfy beds, nice desks in room, and immaculate bathrooms were a plus. We met lots of U.S. as well as international guests and they all seemed pleased. Excellent value and location. We will plan on staying at this venue in the future, without a doubt.

I spent three nights at the Hampton; excellent location close to Times Square - within walking distance of all I needed to get to. Very comfortable bedroom (note: hot water takes a while to come if you're showering at 6am - let the water run for a while). A really delightful Italian - Mercato – just over the road which the hotel staff directed me to and to which I returned twice.

I spent three nights here at the end of September for a theater weekend. It was very well-located, and (given the beautiful weather) it was a perfect point to start some long city walks.I took the bus up to NYC from Baltimore, and arrived at the hotel about 11am. Rooms weren't ready, but they held my bag behind the desk (separate from the corral of bags that were outgoing). When I got back to the room at 2pm, I was able to check into 2303, a high-floor room, "away from the elevator." That last line is a joke, really - there are six rooms per floor, and you're not more than six steps from the elevator, even at the "farthest" room. The room was small by any standard except NY or London. It had a king bed, writing desk and chair, and a wardrobe. Enough space for the weekend. Bathroom had a great shower.Staff were friendly enough. I didn't partake of the breakfast - it was mostly carbs. A couple weird things, though:-- One pre-theater shower took more than 3 minutes for hot water to make it to the room.-- The glass shelf in the bathroom isn't attached, so if you move things wrong, you can dislodge it.Given the location, and the price, I'd certainly stay again.

For a quick or overnight stay, this is an average accommodation. The rooms are small and tight, clean but only surface wise. The hotel is situated in close proximity to sites, but probably should have chosen the Hampton Inn North or closer to central park.

Was going to give this place 5 stars until check-out and confusion over price of room (partly my fault because we were totally exhausted when we checked in & in my exhaustion, I signed an absolutely unreadable--printer must have been out of ink!--sign-in form that had the pricing on it---would have objected then had I actually SEEN what was on the page---of course, used that signing/agreement against us when I produced a confirmation email that absolutely, clearly had a different price for the room we stayed in---I've been a lawyer for 35 years & worked with contract-type language that entire time---but my fault for not paying attention). Enough of that. Incredibly pricey week to be in Manhattan (bill was over $1700 total for 4 nights in tiny room)---the UN Climate Summit, Prez there for 2 days, etc., etc.----won't hold that against Hampton, though---still one of the cheapest decent places to stay those 4 nights (and I did a LOT of checking). Really a wonderful hotel in many ways. Our room, though very small, was new, well-taken-care-of, immaculately cleaned each day, as comfortable as a small room can be, very nice flat screen TV, decently-comfortable beds with lots of pillows, a desk with a comfy desk chair (really close to the bed, though---hard to get out of chair without a bit of maneuvering), nice bathroom with excellent shower (no bathtub), decent view (18th floor as I recall) of NYC & a bit of the Hudson River. So better than we expected by some margin. The breakfast was great (a bit crowded, but not more than expected based on reviews), with lots of great choices, all very fresh and nicely presented. And a terrifically friendly & helpful breakfast staff---just great! And the support staff throughout our visit was truly helpful, respectful, and friendly. And a very, very good location, with easy access to all of the wonderful places this area of Manhattan has to offer. Manhattan was pretty much of zoo that week (lots more folks on the streets than the usual "lots of folks on the street") and getting around in cabs was quite a chore (lots of blocked-off streets) so this hotel was a haven to come back to at night, especially with the expectation of a great breakfast in the morning---and a cheery staff! So an excellent place to stay overall. Was very disappointed about the price controversy (and the totally misleading email as well as the totally unreadable sign in sheet/contract for the stay), but I have myself to blame for some of this and totally accept that responsibility. Whatever, decent stay, great staff (including the marvelous woman who cleaned our room each day), great breakfast, outlandish price (but reasonable considering the location & the unusual week we were there, I guess?). Thumbs up.

Don't trust the housekeeping staff and keep your cash on you at all times. My friend and I made the mistake of leaving our purses in the room while we went and ate breakfast downstairs. In those 20 min. someone entered our room and took the cash from from our wallets. Other than my wallet being violated, the location and complimentary breakfast was good. Easy walking distance to the Blue Line subway on 8th Ave that take you to World Trade Center location.

Was initially a little apprehensive about this hotel after reading some reviews and being told that in NYC the hotel rooms are tiny and you don't get a lot for your money.We arrived around 9.30pm on the airport shuttle bus and had no problem finding the hotel on a side street just around the corner from Port Authority but station. The reception area was bright and clean and check in was smooth and efficient. I had emailed the hotel prior to leaving the UK requesting a room on a lower to mid floor. We were given a room on the 8th floor (which out of 32 floors met our request) but was next to the elevator. I did wonder if that would be a problem but I can honestly say we were not disturbed by it at all during our 6 nights. Also we never had to wait for one of the two elevators more than a couple of minutes.The room was compact but had everything we needed for our stay and I was really impressed with the standard of cleanliness (it was spotless every day) and the general decoration of both the bedroom and bathroom which looked like they had been quite recently refurbished. The bed was so comfortable with crisp cotton linens and big fluffy pillows. There were toiletries in the bathroom, always hot water and lots of clean white towels. Again, we weren't expecting much from the breakfast but once more we were impressed with the selection on offer and the cleanliness around the food areas. We were usually at breakfast round about 9am and never had a problem finding a table. The hot beverage machines were available 24 hours so was nice to take a hot drink up to our room after a long tiring day sight seeing.Situated a few minutes from Times Square it is in a great location for exploring, with both the bus terminal and subway station within a short walk. We also walked to the ESB, Rockerfeller Centre and the piers for the Circle Line boat trips.NYC had been on my holiday wish list for many years and certainly didn't disappoint and if I am lucky enough to visit again I would have absolutely no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.I have given an overall score of 5 not because it is a deluxe property but because I feel that for a 3 star hotel it is of a high standard. I would also like to thank all the staff, who were courteous, friendly and helpful and always had a smile, for making our stay so comfortable.

This hotel was in a perfect spot for us. It is minutes from Times Square, Broadway district, parks, restaurants and the subway. Great complimentary breakfast and in room Wi-Fi. Staff was attentive to our needs. For the number of guests, it was kept very clean and staff was friendly.

My recent stay here was a good value and a great location for everything we needed to do. The only fault that I had was that my room was close to the elevator and the room would vibrate everytime it went up and down. I would recommend the hotel just get a room away from the elevator.

Great place for the price. Super location. Convenient but not insane. Highly recommend. The only downside, which is minor, is the breakfast. I don't know what they do to the scrambled eggs. They are reconsituted somehow but I'd rather they just not offer eggs as they are horrible. The rest of the breakfast is basic but nice.

I was super lucky to find this hotel listed on hotels.com and got an extremely amazing deal on it. $100 a night and I was just a few short blocks from Times Square!!! The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was excellent...clean and all brand new state of the art. I was super happy!! Strongly recommend.

We stayed Saturday and Sunday night, left Monday morning. We were on the 25th floor, away from the elevator. It was probably the quietest hotel room I've stayed in, (you typically hear your neighbors, elevator, etc.). The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. The hotel toiletries were Neutrogena which was a nice surprise for us, (again, it's typical to get perfume-y soaps/shampoos that I don't personally care for). The hot breakfast was nice. Not fancy but not continental - something for everyone, and more than adequate - eggs, sausage or bacon, waffles, oatmeal, muffins, yogurt, fruit, toast, juice. Coffee station with coffee, tea, hot chocolate.The shower was nice too. NOT a "low water pressure / water saver" type of shower that just trickles out and it takes you 15 minutes to rinse out your hair. It wasn't as strong as my shower at home, but fine, no complaints. And really a relief to not get one of those water saver showers.As other reviews have noted the elevator can be an issue. There are 32 floors I think and 2 elevators that hold about 10 people each. Depending on your stay this can be no issue at all or more significant. For us since it was a "play" weekend it wasn't a huge inconvenience. Going up was always fine - got right on and went right up. Going down... well, we could get right on because we were near the top, then it would stop about 5-10 times on the way back down, (depending on time of day). For the first few stops not an issue - people got on. But the last few stops there just wasn't room for anyone else so you just kinda waved, shut the door and continued on... I can see how this might be an inconvenience for business travelers. If this is of concern I'd recommend either staying on a lower floor and using the stairs or staying at a higher floor and allowing for just a few more minutes to arrive at ground level.Small lobby - not really someplace to hang out, but we wouldn't have anyway.Staff was fine, friendly - we didn't need any help or have any requests so our interaction was minimal.Location was fabulous! Close to shopping and theatres, (Broadway!), plenty of places to eat. One last thing - I always research bed bug reports when traveling. I don't want to bring them home!! I did not find any recent, credible reports on any sightings at this hotel. And I did not see any evidence of them while staying here.This may very well be home base for us when we travel into the city for these long weekends :)

This hotel is just a stone's throw away from broadway so if that's your reason for visiting New York, this is a good base. There are also good affordable restaurants nearby (chinese and vietnamese, gotham pizza). Breakfast is free. The selection is not very many though but if you're not picky, it will do. Different main course is served every other day. But since it's free, human traffic is very thick and the floors get so dirty. The rooms are also not very new but I am giving them 4 stars because they provided me a fridge when I requested for one (for pumped breastmilk).

I normally stay at the Hampton Inn Empire State property but could not get a room there at a decent price so ended up at this property. The room was a typical hampton room at NYC, tiny but has everything one needs. The property is very close to time square and all the restaurants on 9th avenue. Late night the area around Port Authority terminal does feel less safe but there are plenty of people walking around so stick to well populated areas. The only downside with the hotel are the lifts. Only one lift was functional and it took almost 10 mts to find my way down from a high floor. I heard from other that even with both the lifts working, it can get very busy during peak hours. This is a hampton inn so don't expect to find a decent gym/pool etc. The hudson river park is a couple of blocks away and a great place to run.The wifi is decent and the breakfast is wholesome and included in the price.

Arrived around 11pm, receptionnist showing an extreme unwillingness to serve and please a guest arriving after a long trip.Good location, next day receptionnist was friendly and pointed out direction to pharmacy and specific shops.Room of acceptable size, free wifi, no mineral water available (contrary of other Hampton Inn)Street was very dirty but I believe the Hotel has limited impact and resolution on this....still front of the Hotel was not as clean as it's expected.

I usually love Hampton's and Hilton in general, but this was by far my least favorite. The staff were actually very nice and helpful, however, I came into a room that had nats all over the bathroom and almost empty shampoo and lotion bottles. I called the front desk and told them, they offered to bring me up new ones, but I didn't want anyone in my room that day. So, I said I'd get some later, after I returned from work...I even put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door. Well, I returned with the sign removed, room cleaned, and of course new bottles. Now, don't get me wrong, I love that they gave them to me...but what happend with not seeing the sign and still coming in?? That really bothered me and it has never happened in any other hotel. Besides that, one elevator door (there are 2) made a squealing noise every time it opened and shut. I could hear it on my floor and the ones above/below me...all. night. long. It was awful. I tried to drown it out by putting pillows on my head and leaving the bathroom fan on, but it didn't help. I guess the city that never sleeps, finally came to a rest around 3am, because that's when I was able to sleep too. I doubt I'd ever stay here again.

Perfect location in midtown. Very clean room and bathroom. Fantastic breakfast. Staff was helpful, though they would not permit early check-in. When I needed a shoe repair place, the concierge knew immediately where one was (right down the block).

We were very satisfied with our stay there! We just stopped buy and asked if they had a room available, they were very friendly! You can get free coffee and tea through out the whole day aswell as apples ! Our rooms very nice ,bathroom was old fashioned but really ok. Breakfast was crowded but also good. We really enjoyed our stay there!

Summary: We were disappointed to find not only by far the tiniest Manhattan hotel room we’ve ever seen (with little flying bugs and a clogged sink to boot), but to have the hotel’s manager tell me that Hampton Inn’s Satisfaction Guarantee simply did not apply to her hotel.I have stayed at roughly a dozen Manhattan hotels, including other Hampton Inns, over the past 7 years. I have never seen a Manhattan hotel room this tiny and cramped. We were told it could comfortably accommodate two adults and a teenager, but the two double beds leave little space in the small room for anything else. We couldn’t even lay more than one suitcase out at a time to open it without completely blocking the door. The room lacked an actual closet; it has instead a small cupboard compartment with hangers. There is little room to pull the desk chair back without hitting the bed. The minuscule bathroom had no sink counter space, and there isn't room to turn in the shower without hitting a grab bar. It didn’t help to find that the room had more than its share of little flying black bugs, nor that the bathroom sink was partly clogged. (See accompanying photos)When we arrived at the small lobby, it was overflowing with luggage apparently stored for incoming or outgoing guests. Only a small path to the front desk and back hallway remained clear. Bags also occupied most of the space behind the front desk, and least impressive of all, the front desk was separated from the office by a cheap shower curtain taped up inside a glass door. The lobby looked more like an airport baggage claim area or rundown hostel than a major hotel chain’s Manhattan outpost. (see photos) And processing all departures and arrivals had plainly overtaxed their resources. We tried to check in twice during the afternoon, were told both times to come back later, and didn’t actually get to check in until we came back in the evening. But nothing topped the response that we received at checkout from the Elizabeth Liriano, who identified herself as Hampton Inn’s Hotel Manager. After hearing our complaints, to our dismay, she told us that we simply should have understood that “all” Manhattan hotel rooms and hotels are this crowded and tiny, have their share of bugs and plumbing issues, and that paying over $400 for such an unpleasant night's stay there was unexceptional. I questioned her about the room’s cramped condition, the hotel’s puzzling assurance that the room was fine for 3 people (Ms. Liriano thought she was consoling us by noting that every one of the hotel’s rooms was exactly the same size), the bugs, the sink, the condition of the lobby, and the excessive cost. I pointed to - and read aloud to her - the Hampton Inn Satisfaction Guarantee that was literally embedded in an engraved plaque on the front counter: “100% Hampton Guarantee: If you’re not 100% satisfied, we don’t expect you to pay. That’s our promise and your guarantee. That’s 100% Hampton.” Mr. Liriano then assured us that the Hampton Guarantee didn’t apply to our complaints, or for that matter to her hotel, or perhaps even within Manhattan at all. These, she assured us, were concerns that lay outside of the Guarantee’s parameters; they were simply part and parcel of staying at any Manhattan hotel, and we should have understood that before booking the room. She did not care to do anything further to address our complaints. Needless to say, the hotel’s cramped and crowded feel (beyond any Manhattan hotel we’d experienced), and Ms. Liriano’s disavowal of Hampton’s Guarantee (which we had not understood to apply only at the discretion of each hotel’s manager), convinced us to avoid Hampton Inn’s Times Sq South hotel – and likely any other Hampton Inn – going forward. Be forewarned about what you can expect from this hotel, and its management. Epilogue: after filling out a “satisfaction” survey, Hampton Inn did contact us a week later and belatedly offered a full refund. We accepted only a partial refund, as we did expect to pay something for our stay. They also promised to follow up with us on Ms. Liriano’s sweeping dismissals of the Hampton Guarantee. We are still waiting to hear back.

When thinking of a New York City hotel room, I thought it would be cramped and tiny, but these rooms were very spacious. The rooms were neat and tidy like other Hampton inns and the service was good too. The only thing that was hard was that for parking you had to pay for in and out services. The breakfast was delicious, yet busy so if you wanted enough space for the whole family to eat together, I would recommend you go down early. The lobby was very comfortable and we always felt very safe inside the hotel.

This hotel was true to the Hampton Inn brand. Nice clean rooms in a modern building. Location is not on Times Square but is convenient 2-4 blocks from the heart of Times Square and Subways. On quiet street and is close to 9th Avenue restaurants. This is a new building next to Holiday Inn Express, Fairfield Inn and Westin Element. Breakfast is okay, but not as good as most Hamptons.

The staff was excellent. Jenifer Sanchez checked us in and out. She was absolutely wonderful. The breakfast staff was also great. They were all very nice, helpful, and started our day with smiles. The Concierges Joanna and Peter helped us so much and were really great. The hotel rooms and bathrooms are quite small but fine if you are only using then to sleep and are gone during the day.
