Be prepared for a slow and small elevator. The best part of this hotel is the staff. I cannot say enough great things about them. They truly made our stay a wonderful experience. Thank you!

We stayed here last week for 3N and we were pleased with our choice. Staff was very friendly. We had a few issues...rooms were not ready at check in time, tv kept going out but the staff were helpful. Stay on lower floors, elevators are an issue but no different than other NYC hotels

We loved our stay here. It was very close to times square, the staff was very friendly, it was clean, and the breakfast was great!!! We will definitely stay here on our next trip to NYC. Make sure you get to breakfast early because it does get a little crowded the later it gets.

We stayed for 3 nights in August and were well pleased with the hotel. We used the Amtrak from Philadelphia and the hotel was easy walking distance (5mins) from Penn Station. Check in was speedy and efficient despite it being a very busy reception area, seemingly it is that way all day long! There was complimentary WIFI and an adequate breakfast which is also complimentary. . Some complain about the plastic cutlery etc but if you want a luxury hotel near to Times Square it comes with a cost. There is also hot coffee available all day long with cookies available from the front desk if you are there at the right time. Staff are very attentive, no matter who you meet - in the lift or elsewhere, they are committed to ensuring that guests are always happy with the services provided. A big note of commendation to the housekeeping staff - they keep rooms immaculately clean and it must be difficult working in what is a small bedroom with a huge bed(ours was a king) and that together with cases etc. So the rooms are a bit small, but the same point apples, it is so well located, we were certainly quite happy to put up with that little inconvenience. I would definitely book this hotel again. As I said we were well pleased.

My husband and I visited New York in July 2014 and stayed at the Hampton Inn for 6 nights. The hotel is located very close to Times Square, roughly a 5 minute walk. The rooms are extremely small, hardly any room to move, there are only two lifts in the hotel with a minimum of 10 minute wait to catch the lift up or down and was extremely frustrating.The staff however were very friendly and accommodated us when we complained about a bad smell in the room and quickly organised for a room switch. If we were to ever travel to NYC again, we would look to stay elsewhere and pay the same amount of money paid for a more comfortable stay.

This hotel is exceptionally small, with only about 5 rooms on each floor. Elevators take a while, so be patient. Arrive extra early for your breakfast to avoid a ridiculous crowd. The hotel is convenient for the Fashion District and the river cruises, and thats about it. There is a Starbucks nearby, but he bus lines are 2-3 long blocks away. Showers are very narrow, A/C was troublesome and could stay consistent. No counter space for 2 people.The positive - the bed was very comfortable, the staff was very nice and efficient, getting a cab at the door was really easy, and the coffee station was clean and well stocked.

I would like to address the negatives from other reviewers. Yes, the room and bath was quite small, but for people visiting the city to sightsee and not spend much time in their room (as one would in a resort, for example) it was fine. As for being a distance from the subway, the port authority station is only a block away. We are in our 60's and did not feel times square or other attractions were far at all. And what sights were a distance away, we just hopped on a subway. The bed was VERY comfortable, a huge plus. Being able to grab a quick breakfast (which we thought was good for a continental-type: even with eggs, meat & potato choices daily) in the hotel left us more time for exploring. All the staff were friendly, helpful and accomodating. The rate was reasonable and we would definitely stay here again. Hampton Inns have been very dependable.

Stayed at Hampton Inn 337 west 39th street was a wonderful experience. Everything was great, couldn't believe there were 37 floors to this hotel coming from a Hampton Inn only having 98 room from where Im from thank you again and Breakfast was wonderful me and my sister had a great time. thanks again

Wow!! Totally blown away by the Hampton family love!! Very Very nice stay! Room and everything nice and clean. Breakfast was awesome! Room size typical for New York, but high quality furnishings. Love the pillows and mattresses! Great job for making us at home crew!!! I love you guys!!! W

I stayed here for a business trip and enjoyed the convenient location for both work and pleasure. I had a great rate considering the summer tourist season and was pleased with the service. I'd easily stay here again as the staff was very helpful in making arrangements on the fly.

Stayed two nights at this hotel and we weren't pleased with the facility itself. The location isn't bad if you don't mind a good walk to Times Square (hotel is actually in Hell's Kitchen, not Times Square) or to a subway stop. Changed rooms and each room we occupied had issues. The staff was extremely helpful from the point of the lost reservation through the room change. If they had a top notch facility, this review would have been 5 stars.

The front desk staff was very nice. The hotel was cute but I had some issues with the room. I got up in the middle of the night to use the restroom and I saw a roach on the wall. :/. The AC in our room constantly went from VERY cold to luke warm whenever you adjusted it 1 degree. I had a lot of valuable items in my room so didn't want my room cleaned...Upon my return I saw that the maid actually removed my tag and cleaned my bathroom anyway. I later found out they get paid by the room. I was pissed about that. Thankfully nothing came up missing. I guess for this price and location you get what you pay for. Also the rooms are TINY!!

First let's remember that for NYC this was budget friendly. NYC is one of the most fun cities I have been to in the world, but pretty pricey as well. They make good use of their space so don't be surprised by the sizes of rooms and places. Our Room was Tiny. We had two double beds and you could reach everything while sitting on either bed. Not for claustrophobic people! We didn't have much of a view but we weren't staying in the room anyway so not a big deal. Beds were comfortable and the place was clean. Elevator was tiny and often a long wait. We had the room across from the ice machine and had no noise issues at all. Breakfast was really good. Waffle's from batter, omelets and a few other choices were all good and plentiful. We went for breakfast at 9:30 AM (ends at 10AM) and plenty still left although there were no tables available. Staff did not interact weren't rude but not friendly either. Location was great. Only one block east and 1 block north and you are in the heart of Times Square. Parking was pricey $$$$ $90 for 27 hours. One great thing is that you can check out and leave your luggage with them. They will hold on to it while you are out and about for no charge. Not a glamourous location but budget friendly, clean and accessible to the Square.

I travelled with my family for a long weekend and stayed at Hampton Inn Times SQ. South from August 21st through 24th, we were warmly received as we arrived early by the front desk staff Ms. Jennifer S. Upon check-in our rooms exceeded my expectation in cleanliness-awesome. The housekeepers were friendly,breakfast was great for a non full service hotel. Short walk to Times Square and most attraction. For cookies Lovers catch it before 5pm it is hot and in demand.I will return and stay with you again.BE.

I give this hotel an average rating because it is a blended score of customer service (getting a 5) and accommodations (getting a 1-2). The staff, especially Chris, was fantastic. The problem is the small size of the rooms and the lack of adequate elevators and space. Two small elevators service the 30+ story hotel guests AND cleaning staff. And, the breakfast area was very crammed every morning during my 4 day stay. It is priced better than some surrounding hotels, most likely because it is smaller and borders Hell's Kitchen. On the positive side, low cost, delicious restaurants surround the hotel, especially on 9th Ave. If you are on a budget, go with this hotel. Otherwise, go with the Hampton Inn Time Square North, where I have also stayed in the past and loved.

This was our first trip to NYC. We Loved the Hampton Inn. Great breakfasts and very friendly staff. Rosa P. was amazing. She made a waffle for my daughter after someone had unplugged the waffle iron. She also was so nice when I had accidentally spilled coffee all over one morning.The location of this hotel was perfect. We were close to so many sights. I will definately be booking my next stay here again.Jan Hart

Stayed here for the second time and they have been consistant. I feel safe and the rates a r a affordable. One elevator was not working and that really makes things difficult when transporting luggage. We used the stairs when we had to. The breakfast line was really long so we did not partake. Recommend for safe and affordable with mostly comfortable beds. Just remember it is a very busy place.

My family of four stayed in this hotel on Aug 7 and Aug 8. We booked a 2 full beds room. Upon arriving the staff was very friendly and helpful, speedy check-in (with the crazy amount of ppl booking at the same time). Thought this is going to be another nice stay in a Hampton Inn. WRONG. After spending a busy day on the 7th in the Bronx for a Yankee game, we came back to the room to relax before dinner. We asked for a complimentary bottle of water (which they offered among other things such as nuts, etc.) We were told sorry we are out, go next door and grab one from our "sister property" Candlewood Suites. So we went next door and got charged nearly $5 for this one bottle of water. Mind you they didn't even have the "water stand/lemonade stand" stocked to offer that for their guests.Rooms are extremely small (200 sqft I think - w/ 2 full beds, 1 nightstand, 1 sitting bench, 1 dresser w/ TV and 1 table and chair - all crammed in one tiny room - not to mention the small bathroom - try not washing your hair because you will hit your elbows on the glass and shower wall)Thursday night, horrible sleep, the beds seemed to "teeter-totter" if you moved to far to either edge. It was awful. Yes the bed were also somewhat hard -so basically we were sleeping in the center of the bed. Same for our kids (12-8) small kids.Friday morning 8:30am, let's all go down and have breakfast, lets catch the elevator down - 4 mins later still nothing - fine lets all walk down 13 flights of stairs - so we did not sure if the elevator ever stopped at our floor.Breakfast - what a nightmare - let's all wait in a line 30 deep and finally grab our plates w/ nowhere to sit - so lets stand around holding our plates staring at everyone else eat - then quick grab someone's table with used food plates all over it - and we cleaned ourselves otherwise we would have never gotten that table.Friday nights sleep was the same in the awful beds, as well as Saturday mornings breakfast - yes we went down the stairs another 13 flights...yes and the first time we actually ended up in the staff basement area because we didn't know the floors.Saturday at check out we left our bags to head out for a bit more sightseeing. Came back around noon to grab the bags and needed to use the restroom. That's also in the basement area - yes and BIG line for ONE bathroom, so we WAIT and it was very hot down there. I have never written a bad review about a hotel facility before - this was bad. I spent $700 for 2 nights at a Hampton Inn - I sure DID NOT get what I paid for. I am very unhappy about this and more unhappy that I wasted my money here.

The Hampton Inn at Times Square is centrally located in NYC, close to all of the restaurants and shopping in NYC. The hotel is very updated and clean. Staff is very helpful. Valet parking is a little expensive $55 but probably on par with most NYC hotels. The valets do a great job of getting the car when you need it (give 30 min notice when going to pick up the car). Getting a breakfast (typical of Hampton Inns) is a great bonus for a hotel in NYC and can save you at least $10-20 per person--as well as the trouble of finding a place to eat early in the morning. Coffee/tea/hot chocolate available all day and night AND cookies were served at the front desk in the evening. Homey touches for Manhattan!

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and were throughly impressed. The location is close to all major attractions for walking distance or subway. The staff were so helpful. What we noticed the most was the cleanliness or the hotel and eating area. Our room was small but worked out fine and it was always clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was not continental it was a full breakfast with eggs, cereal, toast, muffins, waffles, fruit, bacon, potatoes, juice and coffee. It was delicious and the staff were always ensuring it was replenished. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and we would not hesitate to stay here again on our next visit. The summer rates are expensive but comparable to other New York hotels with a great location. Elevator was a bit slow in the morning but the stairwell is easy to access.

My daughter and I went to New York to see some Broadway shows. We found a good deal at the Hampdon Inn - Times Square South. Breakfast is included, which is important when you get up late. The breakfast room is very small but the food is good to keep you going for the day. The staff is very nice and the rooms are clean. The only bad thing is that the elevators are small and tend to stop at every floor when the hotel is full On check out day, we had to wait for a couple full elevators to pass before we could get on. Not much the hotel could do about that.  The location is between Penn Station and Times Square. It is not in the middle of the crazy crowds which we liked. You can walk to the Times Square/Broadway area ver easily.  The price varies a lot from week to week. Just have to find a non-loliday weekend.

A double room is only big enough for 2 people--the room is tight--smaller than the average size double room--traveling with a family--may want to get 2 rooms--AARP-members--late check is available only from the front desk--even if it's part of your room package!

It was a last minuate invitation to NYC with my cousin and I jumped at the opprotunity. I took the bus in to Port Authority and to my suprise the hotel was just around the corner! AMAZING location if you want to be touristy. Comfortable, clean, and a great value. I even made it to breakfast which was very generous.During my stay I encountered 2 noteworthy team members. Alexandria was most helpful and pleasant when I checked in and had trouble with my room and keys. She quickly fixed things and later recommened a great latin restaurant and was at the desk most of my stay. At check out we met Chris who had a great energy and helped store my bags and retrived them when I got back from spa. Although I tend to covet more upscale modern and trendy hotels this hotel reminded me sometimes its the simple things in travel that matter and service matters.

It's a skinny tower with only 6 rooms per floor and quite possibly the slowest elevators (2) for 30+ floors. It's full of families in town for the NY scene and full of kids. The breakfast area is tiny and each morning 100's of people are fighting over "horse food" grains, doughnuts, cereal, and a strange egg & sausage cheese thingy. I give it a "high" average Hampton, the sweet spot is it is dirt cheap for NYC and Times Square area. I paid $165 for King in the height of Summer on a Friday. The room was very small but comfortable and the A/C blew cold air all night so I slept like a grown person (babies don't sleep very well). It's certainly not the place to stretch out, and you will find out when you stand in the elevator hallway in the lobby waiting with 20 other people for the elevator and another 50 or so pass you but to but headed for the exit or breakfast nook. Otherwise, enjoy! It's 10 minutes to Times Square and Broadway with some pretty decent restaurants (Shake Shack, WolfGangs$$, Becco) and others in between this location and TS, 5 minutes to Penn Station Trains in the other direction. Sits between 8Th & 9th Ave, just outside the garment district.

Stayed here in February. The lobby is very small which is fine, but there is only one set of elevators in the hotel. That would be fine but it is in a very narrow hallway that leads from the lobby into the breakfast room so you get a bottleneck effect of people trying to get off the elevator, on the elevator, and into the breakfast room. I like the other HI at Times Square North a billion times better.

They very well located in the city center, public areas are clean and attractive, breakfast was quite expansive but mostly self-serve, rooms are generously sized, bathroom and shower very nice and basic WiFi is included with no password necessary.

Very clean and updated hotel. This hotel is in a great location. I did not use a taxi once. Walking distance to time square broadway shows, Central Park, broadway dance center and so much more. The rooms were updated and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was nice. They have breakfast and even have grab bags at the desk if you are on the run. Will definitely be staying here again.

We stayed here last weekend. The staff was wonderful in this hotel - everyone was extremely helpful. Yes, the rooms are very small but that is what you get in a reasonably priced hotel in NYC. It does take forever to get the elevator but there are 32 floors with only 6 rooms on each floor. It is probably better to walk when you are going down. The room was very clean and surprisingly quiet considering you are in the heart of NYC. The first floor is very small so it is tight getting around. Breakfast was a mad house but we expected that. We did get a table but we were prepared to take it back to the room. There were long lines for the food and the staff struggled to keep up (but they tried!) It was typical Hampton Inn breakfast fare. The location is good - a bit of a walk to theatres but not too bad. Overall, I thought this was a very good value.

Be ready to compete for elevator space with the garbage haulers and maids. There are two of them TOTAL for this thirty story building. All hotel services such as maids, garbage removal (No chutes) and bellman will use these elevators and will block them with their carts until they are done and ready to continue to the next floor. so they stop on every floor and spend some time. Not their fault really, they are just doing the only thing they can since they are not able (maids) or allowed (garbage service) to do so at night.

We were there during Christmas of 2013 after arriving from a week cruise to Bahamas. It was 5 minutes away from Manhattan cruise terminal. Hotel's locations is very convenient to go anywhere in Manhattan. Front desk and breakfast staff were very friendly and helpful. Valet parking works best and only option that I can suggest. Yes rooms are smaller than other Hamptons but that is result of scarce real estate which does not bother us. As some of the other reviewers mentioned, we also prefer our room to be away from elevator but hotel building is so small and narrow, therefore all rooms are almost surrounding the elevator so even if you ask you can not really be away from elevator. I am not sure how busy is the hotel during summer, but Christmas time when it was full, you can hardly find space to seat for breakfast, therefore some people were taking the breakfast to their compact rooms( reminded me one of the hotels I stayed in Osaka, Japan). Overall it was good, I may stay in the future because of the location. One other issue we found, waiting time for elevators. If you are in a rush, you better to call elevator at least half an hour before you intend to be in the reception area.

I had a great experience at this hotel. It is small - yes - but you can't beat the location. Very close to Times Square and lots of restaurants in Hells Kitchen. I didn't have any problems. The room smoke detector was beeping and some one immediately came to address it. Everyone was super helpful. The rooms were clean, the beds comfy. The breakfast was great. It gets crowded in the morning, but hey its NY and it's crowded, but it wasn't a problem. The elevators are busy are in the morning, but it's still not a problem. I loved staying here. The staff were so nice. We could keep our luggage in the hotel after checking out and they gave us bags for our ice to store our delicious treats from Magnolia Bakery! I would totally stay here again!

I was here 5 days and every morning was greeted in the dining area by a different team member. I read the reviews before we came and a common complaint was room size. We had a king and I have no complaints. I think this is probably par for must hotels as far as space goes. I'm sure it would be tighter with 2 queens. It's New York not the Western U.S. Anyways a great experience with Hampton Inn. Always consistent

I would suggest this hotel to anybody. The service was great the valet was quick and easy. There was a very delicious and free breakfast. The rooms where very nice and clean. And lastly the location was great. It was in walking distance of really anything (ECT: radio city music hall, theater district and more)

This hotel was in a good location, not far from Penn Station and Times Square etc. Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well maintained. I had asked for a room away from the elevator but was given a room right next door to the elevator - but I had no issues with that as there was not much noise. The King Size Bed was huge and comfortable. The bathroom was adequate. The complimentary breakfast was quite good and had quite a selection. There was Wi-Fi and PCs for use, which were also very useful. The complimentary lemon water in reception was handy after a hot day pounding the streets. It's a pity that I didn't get to try any of the cookies!The only thing missing was a refrigerator and a microwave, which would have made my stay even better.The only negative is the wait for the elevator. Might be best to get a lower floor.I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Pretty simple here folks, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable, nicely located place to stay this might just be the property for you. My rate was very attractive for this area of New York and I never have any unpleasant surprises with Hampton Inn (very consistent good hotel value). Close to Time Square, Port Authority bus and subway station. Some bargain places to eat near by. Friendly helpful staff. Just a nice place to stay in my opinion.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. They stored our luggage for the day as we arrived early. The rooms were clean, bed were very comfortable and breakfast was good. The size of the rooms were small, but expected for NYC. Overall a good value.

After reading reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor.com and taking into account the location, the complimentary breakfast and free wifi, it was a no-brainer to stay here. As a family of 4 staying for a whole week, having the complimentary breakfast and free Wifi was a big deal. I have to admit I am a little bit of a hotel snob too. We were not disappointed. The room (small, but that was expected) was very clean. The only thing that bugged me about our bathroom was the sink was really slow to drain. The first couple of mornings we were late to get up so breakfast was somewhat crowded and had to wait for a table, but the rest of the week we ate breakfast around 7:15-7:30 and had no problems getting our breakfast or a table. The food was more than I was expecting - cereal, waffles, yogurt, eggs, sausage, muffins, bagels, toast, etc. The eggs and sausage varied daily. The coffee bar was nice too with flavored creamer and different types of coffee. Apple juice, cranberry juice and orange juice was also offered. During busy morning times we did have to wait a little bit for the elevator, but it really wasn't a big deal. One morning we walked down the stairs. We liked the location of the hotel too. Very close to subway and walking distance to Times Square, Central Park (~1.3 miles) and other nearby sights. I would recommend this hotel to others and stay here again.

This is where Mia wanted to celebrate her 10th BD. An excellent hotel position to see all the major sites. This was a very popular hotel that included a lot of young people. The hotel provides breakfast so that you are ready to go. We were walkable to Rockerfeller Center, Central Park, Empire State Building, Radio City, Central Park, MOMA and of course, Time Square! We were close enough to enjoy Les Miserable and Newsies. After a week in NY, we were off to Philadelphia.

Our family's favorite part of our experience here was the complementary breakfast and full time coffee and hot water bar. The breakfast was a really convenient part of our trip and the staff was very friendly. Idrissa and Frances were very nice and accommodating when we asked for the miscellaneous items we needed. The people at the front desk were also very helpful. This Hampton was a bit smaller than the ones we were used to, but we figured that it was New York and everything is a tad squished together. For the minimal amount of time we spent there, it was a comfortable experience!

I was supposed to stay here for 10 nights (work). The hotel is in a small footprint and even though the it is not that old the rooms are very small (even by NYC standards). There are not enough elevators. Forget trying to wait for one in the morning. Take the stairs. The breakfast area was very small and overcrowded. Several mornings I had to wait 5 minutes to get near the food and there were no seats available. The public areas are just way too small. I checked out and went to another hotel.

The highlight was the front staff. They did an excellent job. They were great with my two kids. They went the extra mile in making us feel welcome in such a hectic city of New York. It was a piece of heaven walking in those front doors. A place where we could relax.

I thought when I booked my reservation, I was going to stay at a Hampton Inn. Instead, when I stepped into my room, I discovered I'd somehow booked the Crampton Inn! Imagine the size of your regular Hampton Inn room-now cut that in half to get the Crampton room! Crampton amenities include a closet-esque mini shower stacked next to a toilet & mini sink less than 2 inches apart. Whoa! But wait, this can only be beat by the AC not working! If you're a fan of super small spaces and also happen to be quite skinny then this is the place for you! If you don't meet this criteria, spare yourself and find somewhere else.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn after a show at MSG, just a few blocks away. Very clean hotel, with NYC sized rooms. Everything has been updated. Pleasant staff at check in and check out. Parking garage is available around the corner, and wasn't ridiculously expensive considering it's in the middle of Manhattan. Easy walk to MSG, Times Square and other tourist attractions. Would stay again when in the area.

The rooms are small in size but well equipped & very clean.This location is very convenient to Times Square, Hells Kitchen, Pier 51 & the Intrepid . Good subway , bus & taxi availability.Great breakfast room with the usual Hampton breakfast., fresh cookies after 4, apples, coffeee & water alll day. The staff is friendly & efficient. Considering the high cost of NYC hotels , this place is a great value. I really like that a fresh duvet cover is put on the bed for each guest rather than the gross spread that is reused. Walk in shower is somewhat small but very clean & a nice massaging shower head.

This hotel is tucked away, in a quiet area, an easy walking distance from the noise and excitement of Times Square. The pricing made it affordable to stay that close to the theater district. Every member of the staff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely choose this hotel when we go again to NYC.

Great location, great staff, great breakfast. The room was clean, modern and obviously taken care of by the staff. Decent iszwd room, loved the safe in the closet and the shower was fabulous too! Can't wait to come back!

I feel bad for people taking the tour that was offered at the hotel that could not speak the language, because they did not get the full experience of NYC. The bus dropped us off at the wrong place for the Statue of Liberty tour and we had to walk about 1.5 miles and stand in line at 3 different places before we got to the right stop.

Clean and comfortable rooms. Small lobby but friendly & helpful staff. Love the free coffee & tea 24/7. Nice breakfast options are included. There's only two elevators serving over 30 floors, so there can be a wait of several minutes during the mid-morning for breakfast & checkout.

Two years ago we stayed at this hotel, we are very happy that we came back.The location is great but the reason we will come back again and again is the people working in this hotel. They do everything to make your stay very pleasant. We requested a very early check-in and they found a room for us on Sunday morning (8:00 AM). We decided to stay an extra day and Neisha accommodated us to stay until Saturday. The people serving breakfast even cooked bacon for my son one day that was not in the menu. Esperanza would make some animals with the clean towels which my daughter loved. I cannot list all their names because of space, so I will just say that they all are GREAT.Everything in the hotel is modern and clean, and of course their cookies in the afternoon are always well received :)We cannot wait to come back and stay here for our next NY visit.

Great location, great staff. Breakfast was a little squishy, but square footage is a premium in NYC. Good sized rooms for the city. Amazing food nearby, and we hope to be back soon to enjoy it again!!

My experience in the hotel was the greatest. Service at entrance was excellent. I was treated with respect. The room was clean, bed and bathroom was in neat conditions. I had privacy at all times. I recommend everyone staying at this hotel.

Convenient location, just a few blocks to Times Square and theaters. Close to buses and subway. The rooms were clean and updated and the staff was friendly and helpful. The necessary amenities were provided including complimentary hot breakfast and WiFi.

First off, the hotel staff was AWESOME! They greet you every time you come in, everything is always clean and tidy. Free coffee, cookies, and tea at all hours. We never made it to the breakfast, but I'm sure it was great. They have somebody to bring your bags to and from your room for you. If you're there before check-in they will take your bags for you so that you don't have to haul them around. No hidden fees. Concierge and airport shuttle available. Rooms were spotless and always cleaned when we got back. Hotel was quiet. Only downfall was the elevator took forever (we were on the 27th floor). Hotel is only 2 blocks away from Times Square and one block away from 9th Street which is well known for the bars. Don't stay anywhere else but here!

Staff is exceptional! Great breakfasts and rooms! Location is nice for being so close to Times Square but off the strip enough to feel separate. Internet was free and a decent signal. In room safe and extremely comfortable bed! The elevators were constantly in use so that slowed things down a bit. But for a busy hotel that is to be expected. I will stay here again in the future!

Great location and hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. Very close from Time Square without all the noises ! The staff was helpfull and frendly. Would go back anytime ! The only desagrement was the concierge lady that was more interested playing with her iphone than answer my question...
user_location: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica

review_body: Torn about the stars - a 5 star experience in a 3-4 star category hotel. A better experience than several 5 star hotels at which I've stayed in NYC. Not a large room, but definitely bigger and cleaner than various 5 star hotels I was in, and at least same size as average NYC hotel room. Would feel cramped for more than 2, but again, no different than other NYC hotels. Very clean; room felt newly refurbished; water pressure, shower, toilet - all mechanical items in perfect working order. Quiet except for moderate noise from room AC (unavoidable, window units are rarely quiet). 30+ floors, but each floor only 6 rooms, was in room 1304, the, "04" rooms are away from elevator and ice machine. Customer service from EVERY single person (interacted with several) was absolutely outstanding - very warm and efficient. One reviewer said they need block-out curtains - they DO have them, but I for one couldn't figure them out so had to call for help (they're a bit hidden). Excellent location, close to Port Authority (bus and subway) and all transportation, as well as many activities around Times Square. Small gym. Brkfst included, a good value all around. If you want room service, a restaurant, a spa, or to be hanging out in a luxury hotel, this is not it. Otherwise, all those things are in walking distance, and this hotel was a great experience.

Location and service were amazing! Only a short walk to times square and Broadway we stayed in the heart of it all! Room was very clean, but on the small side, that is to be expected when traveling to a place like NYC though. The breakfast was always well prepared and quite delicious. The staff at this hotel were absolutely amazing! They were super friendly, knowledgeable, and were willing to help you in anyway possible. Alex Orteja was extremely helpful, he greeted us at the door and helped us with our luggage. He even remembered our names and always said hello any time he saw us throughout our entire trip. Also the gentleman that worked at the desk, Chris was absolutely fantastic. Very friendly, helpful and had great recommendations with restaurants and what to do in the beautiful city. We looked forward to seeing Alex and Chris every day. Overall, we had a wonderful trip, and would defiantly stay at this Hotel again.

Good location and good service. A little oasis in the bussle of NYC. Helpful front desk and concierge for travel destinations. Great air conditioning in a very humid time. Breakfast surprising good but be early as does get busy. Great touch with cookies available at front desk in early evening. Great breakfast staff. Walking distance to Times Square and Empire State Building and easy walking distance to subway

One of the worst Hilton experiences I have ever had. I would not recommend anyone stay at this hotel. The front desk staff were a bunch of young kids who did not care about customer service. I arrived at the hotel at 2:30pm (check-in is at 3pm) and as a Gold Hilton Honor's member, I couldn't check in early. The problem was I had to leave immediately for a conference thatI started at 3:30pm. I was hoping to refresh in my room and change clothes. Instead, I had to change in the dingy bathroom downstairs and leave my luggage at the front desk. When I arrived back at the hotel 3 hours later, Chris (at the front desk) made it sounds like he was doing a HUGE favor for me by giving me a room key because the Hilton Honor's number was in my husband's name (even though my husband was staying at the hotel with me). When I commented that he wasn't doing me a HUGE favor because the reservation was in my name, he then started "loudly" saying, "I'm so sorry I offended you" over and over and then went into this long monologue about the internet service. All I wanted was to get my room key, go the room and cool down, but instead Chris held my room key hostage while he finished his speech.Once I was in my room and preparing to go to bed, I wanted to close the drapes to block out the light from the street. Much to my surprise, their drapes do not close, so if you are sensitive to light when trying to sleep, good luck! You will also find in their king-size rooms, the bed sheet is was too short and only comes up about half-way up your body. In order for you to be fully under the sheet, you have to untuck it front the foot of the bed.There are also only two elevators in this hotel, in the middle of a cramped hallway. I waited almost 10 minutes for an elevator. I don't know if their training is lacking, or if they don't properly screen their prospective employees, but I will never stay at this hotel again!

My family of 4 with two young boys stayed at this hotel for our first trip to NYC. The reception staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast staff were efficient and helped with our peanut allergy son to get food that was safe to eat. The cleaning staff were thorough and provided nice touches with towel art! The hotel has 6 rooms per floor with 2 elevators to service 32 floors. While the elevators were busy during breakfast and check out times, you usually only had to wait for one or two elevators for your turn. I recommend packing your family in tightly with the other guests and just ride it out. The hotel stored luggage if your check out time was prior to your next destination. I liked that they still took care of you even after check out. The boys missed the cookies often, but the evening staff had a stash of gummie bears that were quite popular with my kids. The rooms were clean, but small. The double beds were comfortable, but the pillows were on the less supportive side. The location to Times Square was 2 blocks away and close to the Metro and many other attractions. We used the hop on hop off bus - Greyline - which had stops nearby so we never really needed to use taxis or public transit.

Service was great! People were friendly and helpful. Room was great too! Location was great between 9th Ave with great restaurants and the theaters (the reason we were in NY) Still amazed at how expensive NY is, but this hotel was within our budget. We used the fitness room twice while there. We booked two rooms and we did wish there had been a bathtub for soaking after our long days of walking.

overall the hotel was great, very small but that is to be expected in NY. the staff was great very friendly & accommodating. breakfast area is too small for as many people that are in the hotel and the elevator has a very long wait. area on 1st floor too small for the amount of people getting on and off of the elevator to go to lobby or breakfast area

The staff are very helpful and friendly ando the hotel is very well kept and breakfast is out of this world so I recommend this hotel to anyone by the way new york is amazing make sure you get a skyline bus tour pass

The location could not have been any more ideal - only steps away from Times Square, Broadway theatres and also the metro station if you want to go downtown. Luckily my room was on the 30th floor and facing another hotel so I virtually had no street noise. The staff were absolutely fantastic and would go out of their way to make sure everyone had a good stay. The free breakfast was great (including cereals, pastries, eggs, bacon, sausages, juice...etc) and free coffee, tea and hot chocolate was available 24/7 which is a very nice touch. The room itself is smaller than your average hotel (it is NYC after all!) but still comfortably able to move around with 2 bags.There are only 2 lifts, however it was only a long wait during busy times (breakfast, check-in/out times).

I stayed here with my family with a four day reservation and on the day before we had to check out we had to leave to go home because of an emergency and they charged us for the day we were not here because of the reservation. If you qant to leave early from a reservation you have to pay for the days you are not here!

We were pleasantly surprised by our stay at this hotel. The room was a good size and everything was clean and fresh. Great continental breakfast with very helpful staff. We were committed to using the trains as much as possible and this location was perfect for that. We had no problems and enjoyed our stay.

This was our 1st time to NYC & this hotel surpassed our expectations! We were greeted by Alexandria at the front desk----she made us feel so at home. First impressions count and she was just great! All of the employees were very friendly. The breakfast buffet was more than anything we have seen....omelets, sausage, bacon, etc. We have stayed at a lot of hotels & had never seen a buffet like that. The ladies who worked in the breakfast area were very sweet. Now onto the location.......great! Another nice touch is that they keep coffee, tea, and hot water out at all times. After a day of walking around all day, it was nice to go back to the hotel and fix a cup of flavored hot tea. And did I mention the cookies.....warm baked cookies are put out in the lobby everyday. I'm not making this up! The location was ideal, very safe, quiet and close to shops/restaurants. Very close to the subway, which was great for newbies like us. Our room was much more than we expected....the bed was very comfortable, furnishings were top notch and the bathroom was beautiful with marble countertops. My husband, myself and our 11 year old son decided that this is the only hotel we will ever stay while visiting- no need to look further. Listen to the reviews like I did, don't pass this one up.

Nice place, small but very clean rooms. Staff was very courteous and professional. Breakfast was very good and the staff kept everything well stocked. The location was very convenient to the shows and sightseeing my wife planned for us. We walked to everything except the 911 Memorial which was a 15 dollar cab ride for the 4 of us. I would definitely stay there again.

We were very impressed with the staff at this hotel. Customer service was amazing. Great breakfast and they walk around passing out water and snacks to take with you. Front desk was great with directions. Would definitely stay here again!

We arrived well before check in and were still able to check in early. The front desk staff offered us an area map and told us about afternoon cookies in the lobby and the free continental breakfast in the morning. I thought the times were good and could suit everyone. Although the room was small, it was clean, comfy and modern. The bathroom had a standup shower, which was small, but everything was in working order and that is important. There were snack machines and ice available when we needed it. The breakfast had a good sampling of food, as is always the case with Hampton Inn. Fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, cereal and hot items were offered along with coffee, tea, cocoa, milk and juices. The only down side of the stay was the check out in the morning. Trying to get an elevator was nearly impossible that we ended up walking down from floor 15. The hotel checked our bags for the day as we took off for another day in The Big Apple. They do share hotel staff with the two new nearby hotels, so if someone was not available, they could call someone right over to help. I would stay here again and recommend them to others.

We had a great stay at the hotel. Chris at the front desk was fabulous! He gave us great recommendations on restaurants and helped us figure out the subway! He was friendly every time we saw him, and treated us as if we were old friends. I went out of my way to tell his supervisor he deserved a star! We paid more for the view, but were not in our rooms that much to really take advantage of it (wouldn't pay for it again). The breakfast was good and things were replenished. Beds were comfortable. Everything was great, until we called to get our van out of the valet. Then it all went down hill. After calling ahead (as I was told to do) to have my van returned, we waited an hour to discover items were taken out of the middle console (obviously who ever drove my van helped themselves to looking through our things as the items were not in site and required some digging to find). When we told the front desk supervisor he said he would have to call the parking company as they were subcontractors working with, not for, the hotel. The manager of the parking company came to the hotel, after another 1/2 hour wait, made us fill out some lengthy paperwork (took 15 minutes) and then proceeded to tell us there wasn't anything he could do about it. Neither the hotel or the parking company (impark on W 42nd St) wanted to take responsibility for hiring thieves. If they stole from us and no one was accountable, the thieves more than likely still have their job and they will steal from you too! It was such a disappointing way to end a fun trip to the city, but I got to use it as a good teaching moment for my kids. Don't let it happen to you!!

I usually don't stay at Hampton Inn; in fact my first experience with this chain was in North Carolina for business. I was pleased with the amenities then and had a good stay. When an AARP travel site had a choice of places to stay over the July 4th holiday, I chose Hampton Inn based on my previous experience and also because they offered a good AARP discount. It is on my list for repeat stays

I picked the hotel because of its proximity to my son's apartment. Hotel was clean, furnishings were new, staff was polite and eager to help. The clientele was mostly family group, but that was okay. Would stay again.

I was extremely surprised at my stay at this Hampton Inn. The staff--all of them were extremely nice, helpful and respectful. The place was clean and breakfast was very good and had a great variety. Also used the exercise room, which was small, but nice and met my needs for an active lifestyle.

It's a good place to stay in Manhattan. Rooms are very small as well as bathrooms. I didn't have a feeling rooms were super clean - carpet felt somewhat wet and dirty. Dust was everywhere too. Apparently the top of the furniture was never dusted. Looks like this hotel has no view. Even though elevators (2) are fast, it might takes time to get down during breakfast hours. We had to skip 3 full elevators and waited 20 minutes once... People who lived above 10th floor were mostly rude and comments like "everyone who stay below 10th floor should use stairs" was in the air during our entire stay (4 days). We lived above 10th floor, but I got annoyed by these comments.Concierge had no coupons, so don't count on getting anything there. The shower was super small, but clean with no mold. We had to problem with hot water. We had a towel with big hole in it. Not something I would expect from Hilton brand property.Breakfast was great, but the area where they served it was always very cold (wear your jacket!) and busy.The location is OK. It's not that far from the closest subway stop, but also not just few steps away. You have to pass some night male strip dance club and piles of garbage (smell was killing us) in order to get to the hotel. We get this hotel as a package deal with airline tickets and I feel like we overpaid big time, so I am not happy with the quality of service we paid for (not Hampton's fault). Next time in NY we will find hotel closer to subway stop.

Thank you for a great visit! My son and I enjoyed a quick trip to the city to celebrate his birthday and take in a Broadway show. From the moment we arrived, we were well-treated by the excellent staff. Chris, front desk at check-in, should be commended. He was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. The baggage check and parking garage guys were great too. The room was clean and we had a nice view of the Empire State building. We stored our luggage on check-out day in order to enjoy a little more time in the city. We were so pleased with the added care that Alex provided as we had a special centerpiece which he stored separately in the office so no harm would come to it :) We were always greeted with a smile. Location was great too! We highly recommend and would stay here again.

This hotel was great value. Compared to the other acceptable hotels in NYC, the price was great. When my friend and I booked we were unsure of what to expect. But we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, modern and had everything we needed. It was a little cramped for two persons with luggage but that's to be expected in NYC. The free breakfast was just good enough, nothing special. The hotel was walking distance to most places we wanted to visit. Will definitely stay here again on my next visit to nyc. BTW we stayed here in February 2013.

This was my second trip to NY...First time I brought my oldest daughter when she graduated grade 12 and we stayed at the Rossevelt Hotel..this time I took my youngest for her graduation and we stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square West 39th st. I can not say enough about what a wonderful stay we had...the staff were amazing...from the front desk...the cleaners...the breakfast staff...the handimen...each and every employee in that hotel was kind..friendly..courteous...helpful and made our visit special...the room was clean and spacious...the bed was so comfortable...the breakfast was delicious...I was expecting a continental breakfast...but they had bacon, eggs, sausage, waffles, french toast, fresh fruit, cereal, bagels, muffins...etc...which was all included...they also provide fresh baked cookies through out the day...I will so go back...and plan my trip accordingly...amazing experience at the Hampton...thank you to all the staffKim MacKay and MacKayla Jollimore Eastern Passage Nova Scotia Canada

I stayed at this hotel for several nights in April 2014. I was looking for a hotel within walking distance of Penn Station and the Broadway theaters at a price that was affordable. This hotel worked out perfectly. The room was clean and neat and the staff very friendly. Jennifer was exceptionally helpful with allowing me a very late check out since my flight was not until evening.I was even able to snag a room refrigerator. The breakfast was the usual fare for Hampton Inn and very crowded. No surprises there and the food was brought back to my room without difficulty. There are only 2 elevators and they can become crowded so allow extra time. The room cost wasn't cheap but decent for NYC prices. It was one of the cheaper hotels at that time for a Times Square location. As a solo traveler, I felt safe. I would highly recommend this hotel to NYC travelers.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square South for four nights - June 23-27, 2014. As everyone else has said the rooms are "New York sized" so the fit can be a bit tight, but the rooms are clean and updated! The staff was exceptionally helpful, especially Christopher and Victor who went out of their way to help us out. If you want to stay under $250 per night in NYC it's a challenge to find something this conveniently located (just a couple blocks to TSQ) that also includes FREE breakfast and FREE Wi/Fi (which would cost you an additional $30-$50 per night in other hotels). And there is a Starbucks on the corner at the end of the street for those who MUST have their coffee there each morning.I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for cleanliness, friendliness and location an affordable rate!!!

Hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful. Rooms are small but this is to be expected in NY. Rooms are a bit pricey, but location is nice for the tourist crowd. Breakfast being included probably makes up for the price if you are a family of 3 or more.

Our family (myself, husband, and 2 boys ages 15 and 13) really enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn TS South. It is walking distance close or a simple subway ride to anything you could want to see. It is a couple of blocks off of Times Square. We liked to have a little distance from the glitz yet best lose at the same time. We always felt completely safe walking to/from the hotel, even at night.The staff was always friendly and helpful. We would especially like to thank Chris at the front desk. My 13 year old was always looking for the free cookies in the afternoon. Chris always remembered him and was very accommodating. Our last night we arrived back too late for the cookies. Chris apologized for not saving any (so sweet!) and gave him a bag of gummi bears instead! He went out of his way every day to remember us and I know my son will remember that. That's not something we experience too often anymore!Thank you Chris!Yes, the rooms are small, there are only 2 small elevators, and breakfast gets crowded. We did not care. We were so happy to have a clean and friendly, cheaper hotel to stay in that we didn't let the small things bother us. We were barely in the room anyway. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I am coming back to NYC next summer for a Broadway girls' trip ant this will be the first hotel I check out.Highly recommend!

This is a great location to Times Square. Staff was very friendly. Valet parking for hotel is available if you drive in for $55 a day. The rooms are small as expected for NYC so don't plan to have a lot of extras like cribs and pack and plays. We were in a double bed room. Price was very affordable.

Our family stay was very nice overall. The staff at the hotel was always friendly and helpful. The room was clean and beds were extremely comfortable. Times Square was close by, and we were able to walk to many other places we wanted to visit. Only downside was small size of room, crowded breakfast area and long wait for elevator at times. Also, our view from the window was of the hotel wall next door. Despite those things, I think we received a good value for our money and would not hesitate to stay there again. Since we spent most of our days out sightseeing, the most important part of the hotel to us was eating a good breakfast, getting friendly help and having a clean, quite room to sleep in. The hotel provided all of these things!

This was my first trip to NYC, and I wanted a hotel fairly central to Manhattan, where you can walk to most of the areas you are interested in, and close to a subway entrance if travelling further. This hotel is perfect for that. The rooms have very little walking space, so they are mostly good for just sleeping, which was fine for this trip since we spent all day being tourists! If you need space, this place isn't for you. The beds were comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping.The breakfast selection was very good and rotating the hot items was a treat! It can get crowded during peak times, but they do have an overflow area. Also, they have coffee, tea and hot chocolate at all times, which is nice to take a break and have a cup at the end of an event filled day.We had a slight problem checking in; apparently the hotel was very full and the cleaning staff could not keep up with cleaning the rooms for the next people coming in (and the lobby was full of us trying to check in). However, we were able to drop off our luggage, grab a bite to eat at a nearby restaurant for lunch, then come back to check in without a problem. It would have been nice to have been offered some kind of compensation for not being able to check into our rooms on time, but that didn't happen.The fitness center was also unavailable for most of my visit. I was in training for a half marathon and needed to log in some miles on the treadmill; they were re-tiling the floor while I was there. One day shutdown turned into two days, turned into three days, and finally I gave up and just walked more miles in the city!In summary, a great place to stay and within walking distance to shopping, Broadway plays, Rockefeller center, etc. However, the rooms are small and not good for those needing a lot of space.

Excellent hotel for the money. Corridors were small and a bit cumbersome to get around other guests with luggage. Rooms were big and very clean. Would not mind coming back again. Two Elevators in building and they do get busy during check in and check out and also during free breakfast time. In spite of all that I would return because the staff was excellent providing anything we needed.

Overall, the quality of this hotel was excellent. Great service, great breakfast. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Only issue I had were the long elevator waits because I was on the 24th floor, so that is to be expected.

I stayed at the hotel from 14-20, total of 6 nights. Pros- Location was good, easily accessible to Times Square, port authority, subway and hell kitchen's restaurants.- Best part of the hotel is the free breakfast which serves a good selection with yogurt, pastries, main and juices. Helps to save some money in the expensive city.- free coffee and tea throughout the day and water points on certain levels.- Hotel room is small but ok for couples and we had 4 luggages. Clean and neat room Some cons:- Airconditioning unit is in the room and it was noisy for a light sleeper. When switched to >20 degrees, there was hot air instead with a stench so there were times we were freezing. -Wifi signal in the room was weak and unstable. - unfriendly staff upon check in. We arrived early and was tired after a long flight. No greetings from the staff, and when I asked if we could check in, only response was "after 3pm". No help or more explanation offered. Rest of the staff we encountered during our stay were good though, esp the bellman.Will consider to stay in next trip again.

Simply fabulous! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Terrific location. Loved every minute. Definitely going back. Wonderful Italian restaurant, Mercato, located diagonally across the street.

Nice hotel with a perfect location. Rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable. Breakfast is easy and to take away as well which is great. For the location and its services a reasonable choice. Staff excellent and extremely helpful !

I stayed at the Hampton Inn times Sq South for 3 nights Mon June 2-4. I have no complaints. As stated in other reviews the hotel is a little on the smaller side, which was no problem for us. The room was clean and although small it was comfortable. We never had a problem getting the elevators even during busy mornings. The complimentary breakfast was a great perk, and I liked that the main selection changed daily. One early morning @ 7am we had the breakfast area almost all to our selves. Another day around 9 am it was so packed we ended up taking the food back to our room to eat. So if you want to grab a table to eat, earlier would probably be better. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Location was great. We walked just a couple blocks up to times square and caught the subway there. We also walked back to the hotel several times late at night and never felt unsafe doing so. I would stay here again on a future trip.

Employees were friendly & courteous; sound deadening in room kept us from being disturbed by street noise, which can be an issue in NYC hotels. Breakfasts were OK, but the fruit selection would have been improved by having some navel oranges. Business-center computers took care of my needs just fine. Location was great for our activities in Manhattan & elsewhere in the greater NYC area.

Stayed here 3 nights, found this to be one of the better priced hotels in the area. Nice room and great location, a few minutes to Times Square and subway. Only downside is my daughter had a gluten allergy and really couldn't eat anything (usually hampton inn's have yoplait versus dannon and a few other options), perhaps a few allergy friendly options would be nice. Other than that, no complaints, great staff.

My family and I stayed at the hotel in June. Even though it is in Times Square and we were on the second floor, we couldn't hear any street noise. The breakfast was great!! We felt it was a great value.

I very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I arrived and there was a small hiccup with my reservation(due to a third party site, not the hotel). The Staff was very helpful in ensuring the problem was worked out quickly and efficiently. I would like to mention a specific employee, Jennifer. She not only helped me to resolve my issues on the first night, but she continued to provide excellent advice through out the trip. Though she was by no means the only member of the staff that helped to provide a superior experience, her repeated help was memorable. Many hotels offer similar accommodations, but this hotel can also rely upon its wonderful staff members, such as Jennifer. I will be sure to book at this hotel anytime I am in New York in the future.

This property is but a few in the city that offers 2 beds in a handicap accessible room. Great location if you want to be in the heart of the theater district. Rooms are clean and quiet. Great free breakfast. Amazing staff!

I only stayed one night this time but the room was nice and well appointed, clean and although not much of a view by the 13th floor there was virtually no street noise. The internet is spotty and was not working for some of the night. The breakfast was typical Hampton Inn fare - same as every other Hampton Inn. The staff was fine, check-in and out were efficient; although the cleaning people were a little pushy. The car valet was fine and at $55 for 24 hours is actually fair by NYC prices. I did like the 24 hr coffee/tea. As others have mentioned the elevators are a pain and very slow. Also if you plan on checking out between 8-9 be prepared to wait, the lobby is small and gets packed as people try to check out. Lastly, and its not really the hotels fault but 39th is commonly a parking lot. You can get into your car and then sit for 1/2 hour (something to do with the buses at the bottom of the street blocking); I've noticed this several times but again its not the hotels fault.

Clean, well appointed well located hotel with helpful staff. Other than the lady at the reception who refused us more than 2 bottles of water the first day, all other staff members were very helpful. There was a very kind man from Bangladesh who helped us with water. The concierge was really really helpful. I got my Victoria's Secret stuff thanks to her ! Breakfast could do with some improvement. But overall a throughly enjoyable stay for myself and the entire family

The hotel location is definitely great and right downtown and close to where you need to go for business. It is budget hotel, so don't expect much. Having said that you are paying 200 just for location and not luxury or service. Staff are friendly. Cannot fault on the interior. Bed and room are functional. They are not made of the finest quality so do expect noise and all. Breakfast is fair. Self service and probably not environmental friendly with all the plastic and styrofoam. But overall it's ok. Not that bad.

This is the worst Hilton property we ever stayed in. The rooms are small, dirty noisy and the staff is rude. We did not get the room we paid for an nothing was done to accommodate the difference. I had a problem with a left item and the staff refused to do anything about it. Our room was not clean, the bath amenities were empty house keeping came so late we did not get a clean room during the entire stay. The location to Javits center seemed great but the hotel is horrible. Try another property in the area.

My teenage daughter and I stayed for a short vacation to see the sites of New York City. The room was very comfortable, though on the small side as many NYC hotel rooms would be. In room free wifi was useful and worked well. Excellent hot breakfast each morning - very popular so I would suggest you show up early if possible. Also, can't beat the freshly baked cookies available each evening and 24-hr coffee/tea/hot chocolate. This is a tall narrow building with only two elevators, so if you aren't a patient person, beware.

Location is excellent. Staff exceptional as they helped out in anyway they possibly could to make our stay a pleasure. Breakfast was a hot and cold mix, very well done.Very clean and I would stay in this hotel at any time I was back in New York.They have a person in the hotel that sells theater tickets and our seats were"the best".Terrific job everyone.This was June 2, 2014.

We had a great time during our stay at this hotel. Staff very good & helpful. Breakfast with two teenagers was a bonus. Rooms small (this is NYC!) but always clean & comfortable. You only need some where to sleep as so much to do in this city ( Suits all tastes)

I have such mixed feelings about this hotel. Pros: The location is great, the staff is nice, free wifi is great, and the breakfast/coffee is great. Cons: The walls are super thin so it gets noisy, the elevators are often being used by the housekeeping staff (there are only 2 elevators, so often only 1 elevator is available) and the cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired (toilet was filthy upon checkin and had to call down to have someone come up and clean it, the shower was also very dirty). The rest of the room was clean, however. Also, make sure you watch your confirmation and the room they give you carefully. I reserved (and received a confirmation for) a room with a king bed and city view. They tried to give me a room with 2 double beds and without a city view. It took some wrangling to get them to give me what I had reserved.

The Hampton Inn is a few blocks north of Times Square and close to Broadway making it a great location. Here are the pros: 1. Location, 2. Buffet breakfast with a variety of choices (actually I was amazed at how much food was offered), 3. Free wifi, 4. Nice staff. Unfortunately, the great disappointment was our room which was behind the elevator and you could hear their movement all night. Someone should have ordered extra soundproofing before they closed the drywall. Also, our bathroom had the faint smell of urine which meant that no one mopped the floor or didn't use bleach. The rest of the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I would stay again, but ask for a room away from the elevator. The manager needs to remind housekeeping to mop around the toilet.

This was a great hotel to stay at, it was located just steps away from Time Square. I also really appreciated how friendly and helpful the staff was. They were professional and attentive. The rooms were neat and clean as was the entire facility. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Nice Hotel, rooms were clean, but only two elevators, which are slow. Both housekeeping and guests use the same elevator. Not that it is a problem, but the design of the hotel should have taken this into account.Breakfast was good, but the area is very small, either get there when they open or closere to the closing time . Otherwise, you will be standing or taking your food back to your room, on the slow elevator.

This place was excellent value, in a great central location. Perfect if you are coming into NYC by train and arriving at Penn Station (a few blocks walk). The hotel itself was welcoming, and staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean, mostly well maintained (nothing worth complaining about), but small (this is NYC!). Not a lot of room to move about, and best if both people don't try to navigate at once. But this is NYC and how much time are you going to spend in your room anyway. Would I return? If the price was still right, absolutely.

The cost of the hotel was cheaper in comparison to other hotels in New York City and in Times Square. Free breakfast was the best and complimentary beverages as soon as we arrived back in the hotel. I would reccomend this hotel and come back and stay again when I am in New York.

We were welcomed like old friends. The staff helped us find our way around town to anything from the Hop-On Hop Off Bus tour ticket office to finding the Majestic Theater. They drew us maps and were waiting for us at the door if we were late returning from our adventures! The hotel room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was served in a delightful "sun room" and it was delicious food, lots of variety and the price was FREE. We want to thank Christopher, Alexandria, Jennifer, Sue-Ellen and Aneidy, the great staff. The location was close to shopping, Times Square, and Theaters. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Great Hotel & location, nice clean rooms, nice bed & clean linen, nice shower with always hot water, friendly staff & very helpful,good breakfast ,wifi good signal, overall a fantastic experience. This hotel is highly recommended. Thank you Hampton Inn/Time Square South management & staff for the pleasant stay.

We stayed here for 3 nights, and absolutely loved this hotel. Every staff member we came into contact with was friendly, courteous and helpful. The front desk personnel held our luggage for us when we arrived too early to check in, and upgraded us to the 23rd floor - nice view. The room was spotless, the bed comfy, and the bathroom shiny clean. One of the days we came back in the evening and noticed we only had one bath sized towel, called down, and within minutes someone was at our door with a whole set of towels! We found the breakfast to be very good, with enough variety, that we could have something different each morning. I love the idea that I can come in anytime of day and make a cup of tea or hot chocolate to take up to the room (we don't drink coffee, so the in room coffeemaker got a break while we were there). I noticed they had a few board games under the hot drink station, and newspapers. In the afternoons, there was always a ice-cold water (with lemons in it) dispenser by the front desk, which we made use of after all our touring and walking. I think cookies were served every afternoon, we just never were around at that time, but it's a nice touch. Definitely a good stay, and we were once again made to feel Hampton Inn Loyal!

The hotel was clean and the price was good for the location. It was a couple of blocks walk to Times Square or the subway. Our room was on the west side of the hotel and only had a view of the hotel next door. Our kids room was on the east side of the hotel and had a decent view. The free breakfast was good, but things can get really busy at the hotel in the morning. Our room was quiet and we slept well.

Just returned from four nights at this Hampton Inn with my two daughters. It was awesome! The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was good and free. The room was small, of course, but we managed with three women and three big suitcases plus various other bags and purchases we made. Our room was on the 27th floor and we never had issues with the elevator. We were within a 10 minute walk to Times Square. The Port Authority was a block away, so very convenient to catch the subway. There are several little restuarants and shops close by. The area was good - never felt unsafe walking around at any time. I would highly recommend this hotel for a trip to NYC!

This hotel was a typical Hampton Inn...basic and clean. It's in a very good location...only 3 blocks to the 42nd St subway station. Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.

This is a really nice hotel. Very clean, great hot breakfast, and friendly and helpful staff. Good price for being so close to Times Square. The elevators are small and do take some time getting on one. Rooms are small but adequate. Towels and sheets were new and crisp.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn/Times Square South in April 2014. It was clean and comfortable, but very, very busy. The two elevators are not enough to keep up with morning traffic, and the breakfast was so crowded that a line formed 10 people deep waiting for the staff to refill hot water, eggs, coffee, everything. You can combat this, of course, by arriving at breakfast quite early. Great location, friendly staff. We typically retire to our room mid-afternoon to rest, change clothes, and regroup before our dinner and evening adventures. On all three days our room was the absolute last one on the hall to be serviced -- and so we had to skip it altogether in order to get in our rest period. I'm sure we could have asked for service earlier or later if it was super important to us.

This hotel has an amazing location for sight seeing. It is right off of 8th Avenue and 39th Street. About a block and a half from the 42nd Street Port Authority Subway Stop/Bus Terminal. It is also a short walk to pretty much any Broadway show as well as Times Square. Really there is no better location for sight seeing in New York City. The hotel itself is extremely tall like all the other reviews stated. There are only 6 rooms per floor and it is 32 floors. We had room number 01 on the floor and I could hear the elevator all night. Every time it stopped I could hear it beep. I realized after a couple nights I could hear it stop on the floors below and above us as well. Although the people on our floor were pretty quiet one night they did wake us up. If the people in the room next to us were talking at normal voices I could hear them. The walls are extremely thin. I would hate to have a floor with the Ice Machine on it. Those machines were extremely loud when getting ice. The only other negative was the size of the rooms. They are extremely small for American standards. Not a huge issue but our room had two queen beds (I thought they might have been full) and we didn't have any room for our suit cases except in-between the beds. The staff was helpful. They always seemed busy though so when we did have questions they weren't overly accessible. The one time we needed help from the concierge he was pretty rude though and I was waiting at the stand while he was walking around talking to staff and cleaning up the lobby. He looked at me multiple times and just ignored me. Okayyy. The cookies in the evenings were delicious. Delicious! I wish I could have made sure to be there every evening to get one. Breakfast every morning was standard Hampton Inn breakfast. Usually Sausage or Bacon and Omlettes, eggs or something similar. One morning they had Biscuits, Gravy, Sausage and Scrambled Eggs. Day was made! Also I love the Waffles. Always one of my favorites. They always have Yogurt, Warm Fresh Oatmeal, Toast, Bread, Bagels etc, pastries, and other items. It is a pretty good spread included. Not just a continental breakfast. I would probably stay here again for the simple fact that it is a very clean, nice hotel with decent staff and in a great location. Price is affordable for NYC. I wish the walls were a bit thicker and the staff was a bit more accessible.

Great hotel: not too fancy but very comfortable with nice staff always respectful and helpful.The bedroom is not very big but that's not easy to find in NYC anyway - especially for that price. We booked a King Size with City View so we were up on 21st floor. 6 rooms per floor so quiet environnement (although for someone from the country, the noise of the city was still too much - ear-plugs do nicely). Comfy bed although sheets and bed covers only OK (a few stains even though you can tell it's clean). No bed-bugs. Two elevators only so can get a bit busy around breakfast time but that's not too much of a trouble really. Breakfast had plenty to offer and quite good. Possibility of printing vouchers or e-tickets in "business center" (actually a small room with 2 computers). In room: safe, hair-dryer, ironing board + iron.Ideal location next to Port Authority Bus Terminal (round the corner) and a 10min walk to Times Square so the subway is really close and gives access to whole of Manhattan (lots of different lines available). Lots of restaurants around obviously but 39th street is rather quiet there.Thanks to the staff for their help and smiles. Will probably choose Hampton inn Manhattan Times Square South again if we come back to NYC.

Excellent location (39th Street between the 8th and 9th Avenues), close to Port Authority Bus Terminal and Times Square. I had a very QUIET room on the 12th floor (didn't hear anyone day or night). The room was very clean and comfortable, with plenty of space. The wireless Internet in the room was free and connection was excellent. Breakfast was surprisingly good and slightly different each day, with an unexpected variety (hot and cold options, cereals and sweets, fruit, bagel, juice, even waffle). Overall, I was very, very satisfied, and the hotel felt like an oasis of peace in the madness of Manhattan.

We stayed here for one night. The hotel is in a nice location. The rooms are extremely tiny, so if you have never stayed in NYC this could be a shocker! The staff was very nice and the breakfast was done well.

Staff is friendly. Comfy beds. Clean. Its $55 from lga. 9th ave has great eats. They have a great breakfast 6-10am. Free wifi. Free business center. Free afternoon cookies. Free tea coffee and hot chocolate. Tiny shower.

I am a pretty good traveler. I spend over 100 nights a year on the road so I try to be accommodating and understanding of the staff. I can roll with things pretty easily but really had a hard time trying to understand why the staff was just rude. I had a one night stay as I needed to overnight in NY because of my flight. Got to the hotel and asked them in help in resolving a small issue which any other hotel would have done without a problem, especially being a Hilton Diamond Member. Of course, the help they gave was non existent and when I asked for a manager a lady came out and pretty much yelled at me. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. I should have picked the other hotel on my list but thought the $20 savings would be worth it. Same on me. Never again.

This is a great hotel close enough to everything but far enough away (2 blocks) that you are not bothered by too much noise at night. The team is friendly and always willing to help with suggestions. It was very busy when we were there but you would not expect differently in a NYC Hotel. Would recommend this facility to consider for traveling to the city.

This location is excellent. We were close to most NYC attractions and public transportation. The lobby is very small. They store luggage, but unfortunately it is is in the lobby for the most part. The rooms are also small. However, we had a corner room on almost the top floor. The views were great. We could see the Empire State Building at night from our room, which was beautiful. We also very much appreciated the little extra shown by the staff. On Easter, the Easter bunny came with a basketful of goodies for all the people eating breakfast, that although crowded, was tasty. Overall, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. This, the value, and the location is why we are giving it an excellent rating!

Hotel is in a safe and convenient location to all Times Square attractions. The breakfast is good. A great variety of cold and hot foods. The staff was quick to replenish the items on the buffet. Beds are uncomfortable. The noise from the elevators can be annoying at times. The room size is appropriate for two people. Heating did not work very well. It was either too hot or too cold. No happy medium. Housekeeping is slow to respond (if they ever do). I had to ask three times for clean towels and still had to go track down staff.
