Recently we spent two nights ( Apr. 12 -14th) in NYC on our way to Miami, and this hotel was perfect for our purpose, within walking distance of central park, theatres, the Rockefeller centre etc. Located centrally and at the right price it served us well. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and well maintained, unfortunately as we only had two nights we were not able to use all its facilities. This was our first visit to the USA and this initial impression was positive for the remainder of our holiday in the States.! If we do return to NYC then the Hampton will be our first choice.

We had the pleasure of working with Lidio during our stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square South, NYC. He was friendly, funny and informative. He not only stored our bags for us, he offered to make a reservation for a car to take us to the airport. It turned out to be much cheaper then taking a cab. He always had a smile on his face and was eager to help in any way!

Everything was really great--service, friendliness, cleanliness of room; however, we were up on the 32nd floor and the hotel itself is rather compact. We had a great view, but I would definitely request a room closer to the ground floor.

Came by for a 3 night stay and the experience was mediocre at best.My Yelp check-in was supposed to get me an upgrade...but the front desk agent said that they were sold out that night...Arrived into my room at 72F...set it to 70F and went to dinner. Came back to a 72F room. 4 separate visits by maintenance came in from 11 pm - 2 am to finally resolve the issue by replacing the thermostat...Con:- There are only 2 elevators at this property and the elevator jams up at peak hours...stopping at every other floor.- "Warm" water take a good 5 minutes from the really small shower...- Face towels were missing on the first night- Part of the housekeeper rubber glove was found on top of my bath towel...- Elevator sounds woke me up in the morning...- The mattress is very basic (bonnell springs) which means that the mattress is only good for 1 person (no motion separation)- ...the mattress was pretty stained and there was no mattress topper...Complimentary breakfast was helpful and the items changed daily. They also had a station with FREE hot beverages throughout the day.Wifi was complimentary but slow...tough to upload pics on Yelp!

The hotel is quite nice - rooms are nice, good location. Actually seems better at night - it is well lit and there are lots of people about. Internet service is good as are morning breakfasts. Only two small elevators which present a problem at peak traffic times. great location.

My stay at the Hampton Inn was sensational! The staff was amazing. I wish I could have brought Sue-Ellen and Christopher back to Canada with me! When I arrived there was a group of students checking-out and my room wasn't ready. I had driven in from Montreal, Canada. I asked if my luggage could be stored until it was ready. Christopher took care of this while I used the gym facilities to freshen up a bit. By the time I arrived back at the lobby my room was ready. This was amazing!! The staff new me by name by the end of the first night. It's a smaller hotel. 6 rooms per floor which makes it unique. It's a tall building though. I The only downsides of this stay was the lack of mini-fridge in the room. I would have liked to be able to store food. I however bought a small cooler and used ice to keep things cool. Perhaps it's not standard for Hampton Inn to furnish a fridge. also, the housekeeper slammed the doors all day. If you decide to stay out all night and sleep all day, not the best choice. Overall, my experience was amazing. I usually stay at a Hilton but the fact that breakfast is included makes this hotel a definite steal in Time Square! The parking across the street is $45 per night. It's open 24hrs. I believe Groupon has a special out right now for $25/night with ICON. Worth a shot if you can nab that deal.

We have just returned from a 4 night break here and I cannot fault this hotel. Very central, clean and the complimentary breakfast set us up well for the day. Staff were very helpful and courteous and nothing was to much to ask. Rooms were serviced daily with new bedding and towels. I must mention that we asked for a car to take us back to the airport and were told this would be no problem and indeed it wasn't.......needless to say the white stretch limo was not what we were expecting!! Thank you Alex...you made one ten year old girl very happy!!We would certainly stay here again.

We moved to this hotel after a bad experience with one of those "hip" hotels in another part of town. So relieved to find a normal sized room, king sized bed, in room coffee/tea service, and free breakfast for $169/nt. This hotel was very clean. Front desk staff and concierge were very friendly, responsive and helpful.This hotel is within walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building.

Room was very clean, though compact. Great complimentary breakfast with lots of options. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Close to all the theaters. The only complaint was the price and the NY state taxes. Our room with a king-sized bed was $350/d.

This is a good pick if you want to be within walking distance to both Times Square and the Javitz Center. The complimentary breakfast is very extensive. They also provide valet parking services, bell desk, business center, and a ticket counter for NYC shows and events. The room was small but it was all we needed for one quick night in the city to attend a trade show.

We came to NYC for a couple nights to celebrate a friend's bday. Chris at the front desk was so kind, accommodating, funny, ummm the list could go on. He was helpful but more than that, really listened to what we needed. He even called a restaurant to see if they could keep the kitchen open since we got in late and were still hungry. Nelson was also at the front desk. He was very friendly and welcoming. I know it seems like that comment is plain but the thing is, I haven't had a customer service level from the front desk of any hotel like this in the past 10 years. Again, we felt listened to and cared for.As a matter of fact, everyone that we came into contact with was friendly and smiling. The rooms were clean and space efficient (it is always small in NYC) and easy access to a lot of great stuff. I was surprised as to all the restaurants available right on 9th Ave.I would definitely go back here again because of the service, cleanliness and location. Oh, and breakfast was free!Thank you to the staff for making our stay memorable. We felt well taken care of.Best wishes,Julie and Lauren

If you are a smart shopper and can wait till the last minute, deals can be had. I waited to the day of arriving in NYC to pick a hotel.. Two great sources are Kayak and if you like Hiltons, use HHonors. I booked my two night stay using the HHonors app the morning of arrival. My first pick was the Hilton Garden Inn (time square) but it was sold out. My 2nd choice at $139 for the first night and $149 for the second night was the Hampton South Time Square. Great location between 8th and 9th. 9th is a great place to eat at a reasonable cost. The staff was very friendly and our check-in could not of been easier. We stayed on the 12th floor. The elevators are very fast. The rooms are what you expect in the big city (small). The only issue is with the elevator, I could here it at night (my wife did not). The breakfast (free) is a nice way to start the morning off. Also, the room and hotel was very clean.

Stayed here for 4 nights and the location was excellent! Short walk to all the sites we wanted to see. And, at $130/night, it was an excellent value that also included breakfast. Highly recommend it for anyone wanting to stay out of the middle of Times Square, but just a short walk away.

I stayed here with a friend for a week. It was her first time in NYC so the location was great for her to see the main sites. I would also suggest a place called Capizzi to eat, its really close by, and a great meal for a cheap price. (this was recommended to us by hotel staff) Overall the price of the hotel was a great deal, we had breakfast included, just your basics but enough. Or during the week you can also grab a to-go bag. I would say the concierge one day was a little irrigant. He stood out from the other staff who were always friendly and helpful. The elevator is slow...just try to be downstairs before 9:30, beat the rush! It was a little hard to get cabs sometimes in the area so allow for this. If you want to get a bus to the woodbury commons, don;t fall into the trap of buying it at the hotel. It may be 5$ cheaper but you have to come back a lot earlier if you just go to port authority. The hotel tried to tell us we could;t get tickets at port authority anymore, which is not true at all. But I guess everyone is out to make a dollar somehow. I would stay here again if I was looking in this location.

I spent 6 nights with a group of students and we had an amazing experience. We felt very welcomed and got to know some of the friendly staff. They have a great complimentary breakfast with a variety of items (warm: eggs, sausage, waffles, etc) cereal, yogurt, fruit. There is 24 hour tea and coffee available. The rooms are small (NYC small) but a clean and quality hotel.

I chose this place because of the reviews and was not disappointed! Good breakfast selections, easy location with close proximity to all major places we went....including subway. Very nice staff and overall great place! Price good, too. No complaints from this picky hotel person! Thank you!!!!

Nice hotel for what I needed (to be within walking distance to a meeting destination) If you are staying for pleasure, I would head over to Times Square. This place is nice, but not "where the action is" Hotel staff is amazing. They do everything possible to make sure you have everything you need.

Add this to the list of many hotels we've stayed in for overnight trips to NYC.Check in was a little slow as they had computer problems(the people in front of us in line indicated they had been waiting nearly an hour), but the staff was courteous and tried to move things a long as quickly as possible. It took us about 30 minutes to get checked in. Only two elevators for lots of floors here so it can take a little longer than you might be used to to get up/down from your room. Rooms were clean and modern. Beds were comfortable. It's in a good location and was very competitively priced. No issues or problems to report. We would definitely stay here again.

It is a good Hampton inn hotel within 4-5 blocks of many theaters, 3 blocks from subway, next to many decent restaurants. The price of 270 dollars is steep for my taste but it is New York after all. This includes very good breakfast which can be significant expense for a family of four. They also change food a bit every day. You can also get a "to go "pack with water and snacks in the morning at the frond desk. Our special thanks to Chris and Alexandria, two wonderful friendly people who showed great hospitality and always saved a few cookies for our boys. They have recommended a little sushi place Aya Sushi across the road which we enjoyed a lot. The hotel is clean, we did lot have problems with elevators noted in other reviews although we stayed at the top floor. Thank you guys, we will be back

My son and I stayed here from March 16th- March 19th 2014. The location is 2 blocks from Time Square. Endless shopping, restaurants, sights and the Port Authority (bus station) are at your fingertips. The Empire State Building is a few blocks away but not far for walking. We jumped on the 34th street subway and had a straight shot to Lady Liberty. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. Mrs. Wanda the concierge made sure we had a map and great instructions and directions so we did not get lost in the city. The rooms are up to date and very clean. Yes you do have to wait a while sometimes on the elevator but we took the stairs for additional exercise from all the good eating we did. The complimentary breakfast is very good, you have a variety of options and they change what they serve daily. You have coffee in your room and free tea, hot chocolate and coffee in the lobby 24 hours a day. Free fresh baked cookies are available from 4pm to 10 pm. The money we spent on the room was well spent. If I am ever blessed to go back to Manhattan I will be a repeat customer. Book your stay here and try it you won’t be disappointed. GOD Bless...

The rooms in the hotel were a little bit small, but hey, what do you expect in NY city. The staff was friendly and the rooms were kept clean very well! We got new towels when we asked and the staff at the desk was friendly. The breakfast was really good! There was a lot of choice and we had a big pile of fresh fruit every morning. Only the elevator was really really slow. I was on the 15th floor and I could walk faster to my room then with the elevator. But overall a good stay!

Very comfy beds! Free internet which worked well!! Decent location (within walking distance of Port Authority Subway stop....and Cake Boss on 8th st!!!). We were able to walk to the hotel from Broadway shows. Hotel staff was good about suggesting things and helping us figure out return trip to JFK. Would highly recommend.

Terrific, accommodating staff, good breakfast. Great location, down the street from MSG and Penn Station. Within walking distance from most attractions in NYC. Reasonable rates. We have stayed here many times in the past and continue to come back. This Hampton continues to be among the best.

Front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The room size is okay and very clean and location of this hotel is excellent....walking distance to Times Square and the shopping areas, near empire state, Madam Tussaud's and public transportation. The quality of breakfast is also very good and it's complimentary!! I will definitely stay here again if I do get a chance.

After a fantastic experience in Hampton Inn Times Square NORTH in 2005 (they have a great breakfast!) we decided to try the Hampton Inn Times Square SOUTH. The rooms were clean and no complaints there.But the breakfast was of a standard any hotel unworthy.Brown plastic plates, substandard food and very morning a scrimmage to get it.But what flabbergasted me the most is one day I came back to the hotel late morning to find the Red Cross taking blood from people in.....the Breakfast area!! How disgusting! Although I sympathize with the thought behind it,I believe a hotel is not a place for these kind of things and of all places never do this in a room where people will eat their breakfast the next morning.After that day I decided to have breakfast somewhere else in New York City.Also long waits for the 2 elevators.32 floors and 2 elevators.No,this is my first and only stay at this hotel.Next time back to Hampton Inn Times Square North.

I stayed here 3 nights. Generally, it was a pleasant stay.Pros• Location is good. Hotel is located South of Times Square which is about a 10 minute walk away only. • The room is comfortable – bed is comfortable, has the usual LCD TV, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. But it lacks a refrigerator.• Breakfast provided is adequate. It is the usual ‘Hampton Inn’ breakfast – sausages, waffle, and the usual bread and croissant, cereals, yoghurt and fruits. This is a nice addition, if you want to eat something before heading out.• There is a small health centre at the basement, but I did not use it.• Complimentary wifi is provided.• Service at the counter and porter is very friendly. If you need to ask for directions, where the nearest restaurant is and so on, they will be more than willing to help.Join the Hiltons Honor on the spot, and you earn points, plus some goodies given right away as well.Cons• Not much con, but given what you pay, it is reasonable and value for money.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn from March 14-18 and had a wonderful experience. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small but very clean. The beds were also very comfortable. The only complaint was that the elevators were too small and sometimes there wasn't enough room to sit for breakfast. Overall, a great place to stay and we would definitely stay there again!

During my stay at the Hampton Inn in Manhattan I was impressed with how friendly and helpful the staff was. We didn't necessarily need too much from them, but what caught my eye was that all of them smiled and addressed us in a polite and friendly manner. We all know that New York City can be expensive and having a huge complimentary breakfast was so convenient. It was a meal we didn't have to worry about. It was not just fruit and dry cereal, it was a hot fresh breakfast on both days. The location was great and surprising low rates. Three blocks down wanted more than $200 more for the same type of room. If and when I return to NYC there is not another hotel that I would even consider.

The elevator issue mentioned in previous comments was no problem for us. We were on the 29th floor and did not have any noticeable delays.We had a bit of an issue with a reservation for an excursion which was privately booked, our reservation on the ticket was not the same as we discussed with the person at the external booking office. Since English is not my main language, I asked at the reception if they could help me out. Front desk employee Aneidy Moreno did not hesitate to help us and called to verify our reservation. Thank you Aneidy for your friendly help.

Stayed here Friday Feb 28 and checked out Sunday March 2nd. Had initially reserved the Double Tree by Hilton Times Square but they didnt have any room when we got there late friday night. So as expected I was very upset by the time I got to the Hampton Inn and went there expecting the worst. However my fury dissipated when I found this great hotel. Room- We got a room with 2 queen beds. For me the bathroom makes or breaks a hotel's ratings so I checked the bathroom first and it passed muster. It was very clean , great shower, with strong stream and clean commode. The room was tiny as can be expected in the city but it had enough room for 3 grown ups to move around. Our room was right accross from the ice machine 31st floor and very near the elevator and we expected noise from all the traffic but it was very quiet Location: great location, walking distance to Times Square and the shopping areas. near empire state and public transportation.  Breakfast- Loved the breakfast bar, its included in the room rate. They have hot and cold items such as sausage, scrambled eggs, bagels, croissants, yorghurt, fruits, cereal, waffles, juices, tea and coffe. It was awesome, good quality brands - not the cheap big box brands- real great value for your $. Parking- there are different options for fees ranging from 38$-50$ per 24hrs, the hotel has Valet parking and there are several public parking garages around or if you are daring you can park on the street. We arrived friday night and were lucky to find street parking on the right side (same side as hotel ) of the street were we parked for free. Do not park on the left side of the street on friday nights because at 2am the street cleaning crew comes and will tow. The hotel clerk did try so hard to get us to use Valet parking and gave me horror stories about being towed. Im glad I didnt listen to her . Elevator- The elevator is the only reason why I didnt give this property an Excellent rating. They have 2 elevators and 31 floors. During breakfast rush and check out rush its a nightmare. Other ammenities I didnt use but are available- business center with computers, fitness roomOverall, I was quite pleased with this hotel and am glad I didnt stay at the Doubletree as they were more expensive. Will definitely stay here again if Im in the city

My family and I stayed here from March 8th to the 13th. The staff at this hotel is so amazing. They really care about customer service and make it their priority. Sue Ellen greeted us when we arrived and she was so sweet and very helpful. She made us feel at home immediately. The room, though small, was always very clean and stocked. The breakfast each morning was very good and there was a good variety of hot and cold foods to choose from. The hotel is so convenient to the subway station and for walking to various attractions such as Times Square and the Empire State Building. We will definitely stay here again when in NYC.

Centrally located between Times Square and 5th Avenue Walking distance to public transportation, theaters and shopping Consistent Hampton amenities and beds, quiet rooms though smaller than most Hampton bathrooms Very friendly and helpful staff, concierge services

We plan to go to NYC on my birthday and one of our good friend recommended this to us and I DIDN'T REGRET IT ONE BIT! :) The hotel is very clean! the bed is really comfortable! Great location! the Frontdesk Staff especially to Chris & Nelson who is very friendly and very helpful during our stay! Good choices of food for breakfast! Really amaze on how fast the elevator can go up. haha. Time Square & Hells Kitchen flea market is just walking distance! Free coffee 24/7! overall GREAT STAY. I WILL BE BACK AGAIN FOR SURE! :) Hope to see the friendly frontdesk again! Thanks for the pleasant welcome! Hope to be back soon!

I am an avid traveler, been to many cheap hotels, many hotels in NY and never leave a review. Not this time. WONDERFUL hotel location and the customer service is impeccable. Easy access to the Port Authority which means easy access to anywhere in the city, easy access to Times Square and local restaurants. I did not rent a car, I took a shuttle from LaGuardia to the Port Authority and walked the two/three blocks to the hotels. Easy walk. Aneidi was great at check in and throughout my visit when I needed assistance with anything. Very clean hotel and quiet. I will not stay anywhere else any more. This will be my only stop when visiting NYC from now on.

When I instally booked the hotel, I requested for early check in and early check out.. but when I went to the hotel it was disappointing. . Aneidy said the room is not ready and we can give the room only by 3.. Then wats the point me requested over the phone for early check in? Please check with call operator who booked my reservation or aneidy on why I refused for early check in..Review about the hotel. .This hotel is greatly located near the times square. . room were very clean.. breakfast was complimentary which was really good. . Wifi was working good.. near to sub way stations. . Comparatively cheap than other hotels.. Broadway shows are very near.. Yesis!! Need to tell about him.. he offered me the 31st floor room which had a great view.. he also called me and ensured things are good and do I need any help? Which was really a good customer suppprt I saw in him.. thanks Yesis for your support. .Overall though it initially started with problem, it ended very nicely. . I would surely come back here.. but definitely wont request for early check in ;)

Location: The hotel is on 39th Street a little closer to 9th Avenue than 8th Avenue. This puts it within walking distance of Penn Station, the Port Authority Bus Terminal, subway stops at 42nd St. or 34th street and a lot more. It's near plenty of restaurants as well and the area is safe, though a little dead at night.Hotel: The hotel is in a 32 story high rise that's shared with an Holiday Inn Express and another hotel. The lobby is small and cramped as is the breakfast area (though thankfully there weren't many people there at 6 AM). There's a business center of two computers off the lobby. The worst issue is there are only two elevators and the area in the lobby where you wait for them is tiny. I had no issues getting elevators to go down but I frequently waited to go up.Check In: I arrived at 1:30 and check in time is 3:00. The couple in front of me were told they'd have to wait on a room but mine was ready Nice recognition of HHonors Gold. The agent also confirmed I wanted points instead of snacks, offered to explain to me how the internet worked and told me how North Carolina is dear to his heart. Really good experience.Room: In a word, small. Sitting at the desk was almost impossible because of how close the bed was to the chair. Thankfully, the bed was comfortable, the wifi good and they had four outlets next to the bed. The bathroom and shower were also really small but at least everything was in good shape.Breakfast/Other: I came down at 6 AM when breakfast starts and they were just putting out the hot dishes. I was in a hurry so I just grabbed a banana. I saw them putting out sausage patties to go along with the cereal, breads (the bagels looked good), fruit, yogurt etc. There's also coffee, hot tea and hot chocolate available 24 hours and they had a little table set up with cider and cookies at night.My rate was $119 and I'd gladly stay again, the location and service make this hotel worthwhile.

We stayed here for 4 nights whilst in New York. Very clean hotel. Breakfast were great, but very busy. Coffee on tap 24/7. The hotel is a perfect base for vis ing all in New York. A must stay. The hotel is position just a few minutes from Times Square. ATimes Square is absolutely amazing. Blew our minds.

My brother and I stayed here from Feb 20-23. The hotel location was close to times square and the surrounding attractions. Clean hotel, and the staff were really nice. The complimentary breakfast was great. The hot breakfast items varied each day, which was a plus. The room was a reasonable size and the beds were really comfy. The only downside to the room was that it didn't have a fridge. Overall it was a great stay. This will be my go to hotel whenever I am in NYC.

The moment I walked in I was greeted by Aneidy who was outstanding. She met all my needs. The room was super and had everything we needed. Will definetly be returning. The complimentary breakfast was great. Overall the staffing made it all worthwhile... thank you aneidy and yesis. will definetly be back again!

This hotel is just OK. I've stayed at other Hilton properties in NYC and had nicer accomodations. This hotel is a basic Hampton. Not much of a lobby. The "business center" is open off the lobby and guests get a "1 time use for an hour" on the computer. After that, it's a room charge. I did not partake of the free breakfast. There are too many other places to eat breakfast in the city. The room was clean and fine for a traveler alone or a couple. I would not recommend it for a family as the rooms are small.The price was great considering the location. You are within walking distance of Times Square and other main attractions. Subway is a block away to pretty much anywhere.The front desk staff was nice and accommodating. My room was not ready even though I requested early check-in and my husband is platinum with Hilton. That was frustrating. Also, my second night there, there was a loud group in the rooms surrounding me. I called down to the front desk to handle it and nothing happened. The group was older adults celebrating someone's birthday and they had no regard for those around them. The walls are paper thin. Pretty disappointing. I won't be back.

I'm happy with the accommodation and my stay there while we are on vacation with my friends. The room is awesome, the food in breakfast was excellent! I would like also to thank the front desk named cris and the other guy i forgot his name but, I appreciate there efforts in helping us throughout our stay there in new york.. I recommend this hotel to all the tourist because their location is nice and easy to find the places to see in new york city.. I will stay again here on my next vacation.

The hotel staff was amazing front the time we checked in until we checked out. We spent 5 nights here at the end of January and anytime we asked for assistance we were graciously helped. The rooms were small but very clean. The breakfast was always great. We were given suggestions on dinner as well as directions around the city. My husband loves the complimentary cookies and we even received a phone call one night when more cookies were available! Thanks for a great stay!

The hotel is very nice, the staff are great and couldn't ask for a better location. Also, there's parking right across the street. Very convenient if you're driving in. I will definitely stay here again.

We took a trip to NY the week of February 18th. After doing much research and going crazy with all the hotel options we settled on this hotel. We were so pleased with the service, location and accommodations at this hotel. It worked out so well for us. We were a 5 minute walk to Madison Square Garden and Times Square. There is a Duane Reade right around the corner. It is very convenient to everything. Only issue we had was with maintaining a comfortable temperature in the room. We opened the window which caused all the NYC noises to come in. I guess it added to the experience since the city never sleeps!

Good location, clean rooms, seemed newer. Elevator was good. Front desk staff very pleasant. Rooms are small, but I've stayed in several other hotels in the area and for the most part are all small. We were 2 persons in a two bed room. That would be the max. But fine for the amount of time spent in room during our stay. I will be back in the area in 6 months and wouldn't hesitate at all about staying here again.

Spent a weekend in New york with teens. We arrived around 10 pm on the Friday night. Check in was quick and easy and front desk staff were helpful and pleasant. We had a minor issue with temperature control in room 301. They sent someone up to check out the problem right away. They replaced the battery on the thermostat and all was good. The continental breakfast buffet is served on the main floor just past the front desk and the elevators. The dining area is a little cool in some spots as the insulation seems to be lacking around the door to the garden. The self serve breakfast is fairly good and they offer a selection of hard boiled eggs, self serve waffles, cereals, toast, bagels, yoghurt, fruit, coffee etc. Eggs, sausages, hash browns were available both Saturday and Sunday. I was not a fan of the eggs, tried them both days and both days they were rubbery. Not a big issue as there are other items to choose from.Can't say enough about the staff at this hotel. Always cheerful, very helpful and just a pleasure to deal with. Definitely planning to go back!

We could not have asked for more. The room was immaculate and very comfortable. The breakfast was good with a variety of offerings. The staff was polite and efficient. We only stayed one night but the location was so good (within walking distance of Port Authority and near many restaurants) that we will book here later this Spring.

First stay at the Hampton Inn in Manhattan. This was a very enjoyable stay as the staff was very accommodating and the location was convenient. The room was comfortable and clean and the breakfast was very enjoyable. The nice thing was that instead of having the same breakfast every day the facility varied the main course each day. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC or the Times Square area.

I cannot say enough good things about the entire staff at this location. From check in to check out and everyone in between, we were greeted with smiles and help and guidance. The concierge was most helpful in finding restaurants and telling us what subways to take, etc. The front desk staff was always smiling and helpful, even when they were dealing with a dissatisfied customer. The security staff went out of their way to open a door for me when I was carrying breakfast back to my room. Our car was brought from valet in a timely manner with a smiling valet. The breakfast buffet attendants went out of their way to get condiments and offered us bottled water. The location of the hotel was perfect for our needs those days. I have never stayed at a Hampton, but was totally impressed by your customer service. I work in the hospitality industry and wonder how we could get our employees so inspired! Thank you for the great experience.

My family and I loved this place!! Friendly staff, clean facilities, delicious complimentary breakfast, excellent location, terrific rates!! You can't ask for more!! No parking (valet parking available, though), but who needs car anyways when everything is so close? One of the best things was the unexpected room upgrade! My daughter loved to be able to see the top of the Empire State Building from our window on the 21st floor. I recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a really nice hotel experience in Manhattan! We will be back, Hampton!!

I am blown away by this hotel. I stayed 3 nights in January. I cannot begin to express how impressed with this hotel. The hotel has the best staff I've ever experienced in Manhattan. I arrived early (around 11AM). The staff checked me in early with a smile on their face. After a long flight and getting thru Times Square, it was so nice to have a warm smile at check in. After Alexandria checked me in, she remembered me by name the entire time she was there. Very, very, very impressive! Nelson was working the front desk in the evenings. He also remembered me by name and made sure there was a leftover cookie for me (they are amazing!!). Nelson then gave me some great recommendations for dinner in the area. I had the pleasure of talking to SuEllen (spelling?) one of the evenings I was there. This lady takes the 100% satisfaction guarantee to heart. Her kindness definitely could be felt while interacting with her. Next, onto Monica. There is a bar next door (Tir na nOg). I went there and had a few more drinks than I probably should have. When I arrived at the hotel, Monica was so kind. She called me once I got to my room "to make sure I made it". We shared a few laughs and I got a great night sleep. The rooms were spotless! Yes they are on the smaller side, but we are in the middle of Manhattan...what do you expect?! I was on the 28th floor and had some great water pressure, as well as hot water right away. I was impressed for being that far up.Overall, this review is just the tip of the iceberg. I will do everything I can to stay here the next time I am in Manhattan. Thank you all for making my stay amazing!Cordially,T.J. FosterOmaha, NE

Great experience all around. The entire staff couldn't have been friendlier, delicious complementary breakfast each morning, varied content, coffee, tea, cocoa, hot cider all day long, cookies in the evening. Very handy location close to everything yet quiet during the night. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived and we were upgraded to a "view room" which made us the envy of our group. This after a wait of about 5 minutes. Our room was spotless, linens smelled like a spring day and although being on the 31st floor we never waited for an elevator. We will certainly use this great spot on our next trip to NYC.

Alex, the Bellman went overboard making me feel like a true welcomed guest. The Front Desk personell were equally as helpful and cordial. I will definetly stay there again. Clean, simple rooms, better than average breakfast and a staff that's extremely attentive and friendly!

This hotel is perfect if you have to attend or exhibit at Javits. You can walk to and from the show very easily, no more than 5 blocks. This makes it great to avoid taking cabs everywhere. The breakfast is adequate and stocked very well. The rooms were extremely neat and clean although small (NYC obviously). It's also a close walk to Times Square. Prices were decent for Manhattan.

My son (he works a block away) recommended the Hampton Inn to my daughter and I. We were there for Westminster, meet up with family from Ct. and of course spend time with my son.Check in was great! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the breakfast the first morning but missed it the rest of the time due to not getting up early enough. It was everything we wanted. The location was perfect for us being able to walk to Times Square but not stay in the middle of it was just what we wanted. The room was fine although small but it is NYC and free Wifi was perfect! We highly recommend this property and would pick it again for our next trip!

Very close to the theater District and MegaBus. Vegetarian and Kosher Restaurants just a few blocks away. even though it was very cold, below 20 degrees, location made it easy to walk everywhere. Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms were small, but not tiny. It was perfect for my wife's and my overnight trip to NYC. We already looking for dates for next February.

We visited New York many times but this was our first experience at the Hampton Inn. We were greeted by Chris who checked us in. He was so kind and explained everything Hampton had to offer. His smile was a warm welcome to us after a 4 1/2 trip from Boston. The location, the amenities which included a lovely breakfast with many assortments and the close proximity to the Port Authority helped to make my decision to stay there. It definitely was the right one. I highly recommend this Hotel.

We loved this botique style hotel for a Christmas get away. It was close to everything and you could easily walk to anywhere you might want to experience. The rooms are new and nicely furnished. The hotel staff was very courteous and friendly. When you want a nice place with an included breakfast, you just cannot beat it for New York City. It was easy to get around for the staff was very helpful in suggesting how to get where we wanted to go. If the walk was too far it was an easy walk to a main street to catch a cab. We thoroughly enjoyed our room looking out over the city with a view of the Empire State Building. A perfect respite after a tiring day of sight seeing or shopping. It was we could have hoped for and more. Did I mention quiet and reasonable!

I had an outstanding stay at the Hampton Inn on 39th St. I wanted to escape the snow storm in Philadelphia and found a rate (on their site) for $109 (with AAA). I was shocked to find out that the price included a full breakfast. I have never ever seen anything like this in an American hotel and was so happy that I had stayed at the hotel. The room was perfect-very clean and included a safe(a must for me) and an easy chair. The INTERNET was included (unlike many four-star hotels) and worked beautifully. I was very pleased with the extremely friendly staff, including kitchen help and maintenance staff( say hello to ESMERALDA!). They were wonderful. At the exit of the hotel, there was a concierge, not normal for this size hotel. I cannot say enough about this hotel and will look forward to staying there in the future. Mr. Frank Raffa --- frankraffa@aol.com

I chose this place mostly for value since Manhattan can be super expensive. I believe my total bill was around $150 for a weekend night. But if you like Midtown, the location couldn't be better! It felt safe and yet we were only a block from the middle of Times Square. Parking a car in Manhattan is usually a major headache and major expense. In this case was neither. For my entire stay I was able to find street parking directly across from the hotel front door, and could see my car from the hotel window. It's not a super busy street, and the hotel has a small valet area where I was able to pull up and float the car just during check-in. Also the front desk people were very nice, helpful and cordial. The rooms were nothing super fancy, but they were clean and very nice.

I'm rating the stay average because the good and bad seemed to balance each other out. I arrived at the hotel and was immediately greeted by a staff person who, all though very polite and attentive, was sick and proceeded to cough all over the envelope containing my room key while she gave me a drawn out description of the hotel's amenities which frankly, I could've done without. That said, I recognize that this is actually something more hotels should do -- explain the available amenities -- because I've often left hotels not realizing that I had never made use of amenities because I was unaware of them. that said, I'm a frequent business traveler and Hampton is my 1st choice (because of changing duvet covers) and it was late and I just wanted to eat and go to bed. Plus, obviously, the sick part was offputing because I cannot afford to get sick and shouldn't be getting sick from the front desk staff! But as for the explanation of amenities, I would have preferred to have been asked if I wanted to hear about it...no biggie though.The hotel seems well cared for, albeit poorly designed. The hotel is tall (32 floors I believe) but narrow (only 6 rooms/floor) and it only has 2 elevators...well 1 died during my stay. So it was slow getting down to the lobby and up to the room. These things happen and I don't fault the hotel for this except that they have 32 floors and only 2 elevators. To that end, the elevators have a slick tile on the floor and I almost fell getting into it because there was water from snow and whatnot on the floor of the elevator. I DO fault the hotel for that. I was pleased with the room and found it to be very comfortable except that the shower (not a tub) is so narrow and with the handicap bar, it's almost impossible to stand comfortably. I am a woman of average size but I can imagine this would be very difficult for a man or larger person. The biggest issue I had - and this is a BIG one to me and will result in me NEVER STAYING HERE AGAIN - is that the water pressure in the bathroom is TOTALLY INADEQUETE. There's really nothing more to say about that but that's a deal killer for me.

Hotel was clean, the staff was courteous. Made wonderful recommendations for dinners. This hotel was conveniently located to Time Square without the Time Square price. Rooms were what I would expect as far as size in NYC. They were clean, comfortable and bathroom was as well.

Front desk girls were awesome, so was the manager! Great location and fairly nice accommodations, a lot better than the five star hotel we had previously stayed in that week. Let's not forget the free breakfast and unlimited coffee, hot chocolate and fruit at the lobby at all times. We will come back again.

I was very happy with the staff they were sooooo helpful and friendly I really appreciated it! Although my heating and cooling system was not working properly they did their best to fix the issue. Breakfast was pretty good as well. It would have been better if they stayed open later. The staff cleared the areas very fast.

Stayed with a colleague here on a recent business trip to NYC. We picked the hotel due to the location since it was 2 blocks from our meeting. Free wifi and free breakfast were extra bonuses! We also appreciated the helpful dinner suggestion from concierge (Jacob?) for the little Italian place on 38th! Rooms are small and there was some noise from the street even up on the 27th floor but you can't beat the location!

Hotel is convenient to Time Square & Hells Kitchen for restaurants. Went for a trade show and it was close to the convention center. Rooms are small but that is typical of NYC. The shower was very small, only 2 x 3 Ft. Hard to wash and not keep knocking the shower door which was very annoying. The spray was adjustable but not to any setting I would have liked.The breakfast was ok. It was nice to be able to go down and have breakfast ready and saved $$ that way. They served different dishes everyday so not boring.

I spent one night here with my girlfriend. It was her first time to the big city and I wanted to show her what it had to offer. With that being said, the Hampton Inn is close to port authority so it made it very easy to locate. We had a very expedited check in experience. The room was quite small, but hey it's NYC. I really enjoyed the free hot breakfast in the morning and the helpfulness of the concierge staff in helping me figure out which subways to take.

that would never be my first choice but I had to choose it because of its location. very close to Javits center and many restaurants and shopping. not very clean, terrible elevator system. Yet the staff was very helpful and friendly. Beds are clean but the floors not. Bathroom cleaning questionable. Get in and out.

With only six rooms per floor it was pretty quite in the room, especially on the upper levels. There are 32 floors! It's a great value and a good location. I've stayed at other Hampton Inns and they all are clean and well maintained. I like to workout and the facilities were top notch for a property this size.

This hotel is a good place to lay your head down for a bit. Price was good for the area. However didnt quite meet my expectations. I guess I'm spoiled from the Hampton in Ft Myers FL on Executive Dr. Now that hotel is the best hotel I ever stayed in!!!

All of my families plans had to change and we had to build in time waiting for an elevator to either get to the room or depart the hotel. One elevator working during Super Bowl week is unacceptable!!!

We chose this hotel because of price, location and quality of other reviews. It was even better than expected. I will check this hotel first, next time I plan on visiting the Times Square area. It was important to have two beds in the room and other hotels were much more expensive. The breakfast was a surprise, but a welcome perk! The lobby was cute and although our room wasn't ready, there was a cute Irish Pub just two doors down. Just show them your room key, and they'll give you 10% off.

This is a narrow high rise hotel, about 32 floors, located on a section of W.39th street next to two other similarly constructed hotels owned by the same entity but managed under different brands. It's value is its location just south and west of Times Square. There's also a 2 Bros. $1 slice pizza spot just around the corner. Otherwise, I found this hotel just mediocre. It serves a free hot breakfast each morning and gives away copies of the USA Today. But this is NYC. They should give away NYC newspapers. Also, The juice at the breakfast bar is not real juice, just a flavored drink. I only took a couple of small sips before giving up on it. Also, I didn't like the way my toilet refilled. it was slow and noisy to the point I thought it might overflow (it didn't). There are only 2 small elevators to serve this building. Bad if you are wanting to go up or down during a busy period, but O.K. if you're using them after midnight when most customers are in their rooms and you can zoom up and down quite rapidly with no stops (I often came back late so it was no problem for me; but at 5PM there's likely to be a long queue). Ice and soda vending is not on every floor. Candy can be found only in the cellar next to the fitness machines. I was here during a cold period and they locked the front door during the day to keep the inside lobby area warm for the employees. So I had to knock. That was until they borrowed a space heater from the Candlewood next door. Then they opened up the door again for easier access. if you're going to want to print a boarding card for your return flight, make sure the computer program is set at the correct printer default. It often prints to a printer that they no longer have. So nothing comes out until you reset the directive. I don't think I should have to do this. Someone should fix it. So should you stay here? Well, I say at a fair price for a few days maybe yes. But for longer term or at a price above $150 I would search for better service. Even another Hilton brand at a different location.

First and foremost, this is the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed. Two adults maximum. We arrived early and was told the room wasn't ready. No problem. It was very, bitter cold so we didn't follow through with plans to walk the city. We ended up at a FANTASTIC Irish pub down the street, called Tir Na Nog. I highly recommend! Wonderful, heavy, filling lunch at a very reasonable price for NYC. They even offered a free bloody mary, mimosa, or screw driver with our lunch entree! We enjoyed the warmth and atmosphere and returned to the hotel at 3:20. Room wasn't ready and wouldn't be ready until 3:45. The hotel graciously compensated by extending checkout until 1:00 as opposed to 12. Staff was very friendly. Valet parking was very efficient and fast and car was returned to us with no damage even with slushy streets. Breakfast was above average with hot food available. Great coffee & tea bar available throughout the day. Would not hesitate to stay there again. This hotel is conveniently located just off the Lincoln Tunnel. Absolutely no problems navigating to get there.

This hotel is very close to Times Square. Very clean, reasonably priced, coffee/tea/hot chocolate around the clock, fairly good breakfast free of charge, all the amenities of the larger hotels, free wi-fi service that actually works. Only negative is that the double rooms are very small and cramped. However, all of the other positive things make-up for the small rooms.

I found the location to be the best feature—just a few blocks walk to Times Square, the Garden and very convenient to the Intrepid, subways, “everything.”This Hampton Inn was also priced quite well by New York Standards.I was pleasantly surprised that this section of 39th St. is pretty quiet. We were on an upper floor, but kept the window open a crack and there was no noticeable taxi horns or sirens.Check-in was quick and easy. The gentleman at the front desk was polite and very helpful.This is a very well maintained hotel. Due to a very early arrival (and then a late departure)The bellmen held our bags.We found House-keeping to be very fast responding to our request for extra towels and a blanket. Breakfast was okay. Two thumbs up for excellent coffee. The only real downside, which cannot be helped due to the size and configuration of the rooms, is the rooms are *very* small. We are a family of 4 and had great difficulty storing luggage, maneuvering, etc. comfortably. It was family bonding Hampton Inn styleTwo people would be no problem, 3 would be okay, 4 was tricky. Parking was $55 for 24 hours which was okay; however, I was told if I exceed 24 hours,I’d be charged another $55.Instead, I used the ICON Garage at 310 W. 39th Street (between 8th and 9th) a half block before you reach the Hampton Inn. The price was $47 for 24 hours and the extra time came to another $18. A Bargain!Try the website: nyc.bestparking.com to located parking throughout the city and get guaranteed discounted rates.Remember to tip the bellmen appropriately for handling/storing your bags.I would consider returning if we were traveling just as a couple.

This was a nice hotel in a great location for our stay in NYC. If you haven't been in a NYC hotel before prepare yourself for tight quarters. Check in was a breeze. This facility is clean and had everything we needed. We were on the 29th floor but didn't have much of a view but I knew this ahead of time, I didn't choose the room for the view-it was an amazing bargain!! The elevators were very fast so no waiting. Beds were comfy, bathroom very clean and had plenty of towels and extra shampoo, soap and lotion. Wifi was good, safe was handy and plenty of room to stash our stuff. Breakfast was very good and had a variety between the two days we were there. The employees, who were cheerful and friendly, worked non-stop to keep everything stocked and fresh. Fantastic location!! While in the city we walked everywhere from our hotel we wanted to go and my daughter and I felt perfectly safe. As an added bonus, they hotel will store your bags after you check out if you are not leaving the city until later on. This was invaluable to us since we checked out at 11:00 am and didn't have to be leave for the airport until 3:30. The concierge was also available to help with anything we needed including transportation. I would definitely stay here again!

My stay was very comfortable. I appreciate the warmth i received from Aneidy Moreno and Chris. I would not hesitate to stay there again. They made me feel like we were old friends. I will recommend this place to anyone. Patricia B.H

This would be our home for 10 days in New York The rooms were clean and wonderfully warm from the cold outside. Free breakfast everyday - hot or cold - plus ready to go breakfast packs when you are on the run. Free tea and coffee and hot chocolate all day. No meals apart from breakfast. Rooms are serviced everyday. Coffee making facility in your room - no fridge. Very comfortable beds with nice soft pillows. On the 6th floor we could hear the odd sirens from police cars below. So go higher if you are a light sleeper. We were very close to everything - such as Times Square - Theatres - markets etc Bus stops for the Hop On Hop Off bus were close by on 8th - nice restaurants nearby.

My sister and I stayed here for one night on a quick trip to the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived before check-in and needed to leave, so we were able to change our clothes in the bathroom and they stored our luggage for us until we came back. The location was great! It was only a short walk to Times Square, Broadway and Rockefeller Center. The room was very clean and comfortable but did not have a fridge, which would have been useful. The hotel was easy to get to, and the valet parked the car for us which made driving a breeze.

First of all the location is perfect! We were nice and close to the subway and it wasn't too far of a walk to get to times square.The check in process was fast and quick. The customer service was awesome! I came in a little early, soaking wet, hoping they would check me in early and they had no problem with it. They put us on the 29th floor. I must say the views were incredible. The rooms yes, are a little small, but the size didn't really impact my stay. The beds were incredibly comfy, and the bathrooms were clean.The staff was also very helpful with any questions I asked, and in my request for late checkout. Very polite and I was quite impressed. The morning breakfast was nice, although I went really early so we beat the crowds.The only downside was when we turned the air conditioner off the room started to have a bit of a smoker smell to it. Once we turned the air back on it disappeared within minutes.I love visiting NYC and I'm glad Hampton was able to contribute to making my stay so enjoyable. I will be staying here in the future! Thanks!

Value for money in the Heart of Manhatten, you will enjoy the proximity when walking and sight seeing. Nice and cuddly :-). We enjoyed the stay in the Hotel, it was clean, staff was friendly, services was good and very reliable. Walking distance from Time Square, the underground can be reached with a very short walk. Clean and worth the expense. Rate was good when compared to neighbouring accomodation. At least this way you know what you get, Hampton is a good name in the business.

This is just around the corner from Times Square, and is exactly what you would expect from a Hampton Inn in New York city - good, clean, rooms a little small, but not riduculously small. Rooms at the side and back are reasonably quiet, the work out room small.

The greatest asset of this hotel is the staff. They are friendly and respond quickly to requests. Rooms are clean and convenient but the kingsize bed means that space is a little tight but this is not a problem if you are out and about during the day. Bathrooms are clean and new but the shower is quite small and the taps are placed under the rose and can only be reached by standing in the shower. This means you have to tolerate a cold start until the correct temperature is reached. The hotel boasts about its sustainability program but uses disposable cups plates and cutlery in the rooms and for breakfast. Breakfast is included in room rate and is OK and includes hot food options. The location is excellent and close to the subway and Times Square.

If your visit to New York City is for Business or Leisure, this Hampton Inn hotel offers a great location, very friendly staff and a reasonable breakfast buffet to experience an Affordable Manhattan visit. And most importantly, all of this happens with the Quality Seal of Hilton.

We stayed here with two college age kids from December 27 to 30. Front desk staff were very friendly. Concierge was on the phone every time we needed her, she never acknowledged us so we gave up. Room was not cleaned when we returned the first day having been gone from 8:30 am to 5:30 pm! The breakfast was fine and a nice money-saver, but the eating area is simply too small for the hotel and other guests insisted on taking tables for four when there were just two people. Elevators were very slow during rush times and the hotel NEEDS a separate elevator for housekeeping staff who used up the entire space with their carts during peak periods. Surely they should wait and give guests priority!The very small lobby was jammed with bags every day of our stay for guests who presumably were departing after check out time. There needs to be a separate area for bags to be stored because the lobby is already tiny without them! Room was small but very modern and clean. Our view was terrible despite being Hilton Honors members. Great location, close to tourist attractions, subway and Penn Station Amtrak Line. Would not stay here again, didn't have much choice as it was a very busy time of year.

We moved from the Hilton Time Square (Broadway & 48th) when our flight was cancelled due to the snow - there wasn't any space available where we were. So...we packed up and made the trek The room was very small - but the staff was so friendly & wonderful! It MORE than made up for the lack of space! The bigger hotel has lovely rooms - but the staff didn't show us nearly as much care and consideration. Breakfast was the standard Hampton type - but it was good and included!! *Note - we are "Diamond" members and do a great deal of traveling. This was easily one of the most wonderful staff members we have ever had the pleasure to work with us. Every single person went out of their way to make the stay pleasant. Can't say enough good things about them!!!!

Liked our stay so much that I am taking the time to do this review. Check in and out was fast and easy. Staff were friendly and helpful. Accommodations nice and clean. Handy location, reasonable price and free breakfast. Also discovered our new favorite Irish pub just a few doors up the street. Would definitely stay here again.

We booked this hotel after reading all the reviews and weren't disappointed.The location is great - close to Times Square, and the subway not too far away. Our room was a reasonable size for 4 of us.As has been mentioned the only issues where the elevators in the mornings, but we usually got up quite early for breakfast and avoided the crowds.

I have had wonderful experiences with all the staff members at all the Hilton Hotels I have stayed at. The staff at this Manhattan Hampton Inn on 39th Street surpassed every previous experience hands down. The attention to detail, the customer service, and the actual caring for my well being was far better than I have ever received before. I just returned from Afghanistan the day prior, and staying here was a well deserved treat. The big problem I now have, is I expect the same friendly high quality experience at all my future stays at any hotel. My best to the staff at the Hampton Inn...

The Hampton Inn brand is usually reliable. I choose Hampton when I can. When I find a Hampton that does not measure up, I want them to know. The elevators were always packed and so slow. Half the time I had to let the first elevator go by because our family could not fit in. At breakfast there were fifteen people waiting in line to get the standard cold sausage patties. I had to juggle the food in the crowded elevator back up to my room because there wasn't a prayer of finding a place to sit down and eat.We had a room with two beds. One of them had hairs in it and had apparently not been changed.This is the unusual Hampton that has too few public facilities for too many rooms. I would not stay there again.

We stayed as a couple for one night in early January 2014. Ove, our stay was great. We were worried about a few things after reading reviews, and our experience is the exact reason why to take reviews into consideration but also judge for yourself. First, we read about the checking-in hassle. We gotInto town very early, and Nelson was amazing, set us up in our room so early which was such a welcomed delight after traveling so early. Second, the elevator situation- yes there aren't many (2) for the size of the hotel but we never waited longer than three minutes, and that was on the high end. Most times we didn't wait at all. Lastly, we read mixed reviews about the breakfast. Seriously people, it was both hot and cold options, clean and well-stocked....oh, and FREE! Considering this is nyc, it saved us easily $30, and that was just the two of us. The rooms were clean and had enough space...remember you are in nyc! The location was great, and the service was more than accommodating. Will definitely be back!!!

Stayed here with two teenage kids from December 27 to Jan 1st. Great location, front desk staff are very friendly and try to accomodate requests. We were there when the hotel was extremely busy. Chris Gerdes was excellent when after a long day we come back to a room which has not been cleaned. The breakfast was fair, elevators were slow during rush times, but fast during slower times. One thing the hotel needs a separate elevator for it's housekeeping staff as they were using the small elevators during peak traffic periods. Room were small but up to date and clean. The washroom door would not lock and a maintenance fixed that right away. I would stay here again due it good service, location and nice rooms.

Coming from MS we did not know what to expect. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Did not wait long for elevators and the breakfast choices were great. Close to subway and we were able to check in a little early. Front desk staff is incredibly helpful. We would come back.

This Hampton Inn was very nice.It was clean & the rooms were nice size. Was within walking distance to Times square & Bryant Park. The subway was not very conveinent, you had to walk to get to it. It was located in the garment district & it was fun to see all the fabric stores.

Hotel was small and very crowded, but it was the Christmas season in NY city. the accommodations seemed small, but again I am used to Midwestern Hamptons! Room was always clean and neat. Elevators were often a long wait to get on. Staff was good, but the breakfast was often over crowded and long waits. I went to room to eat the one time I tried to have breakfast! Still don't know if that is common with NY hotels or just this time.

The location of this hotel was idea to the places we visited, however, this hotel is not very spacious. What can I expect in the middle of NYC. Waiting to check-in wasn't pleasant. Further, my last stay at the hotel it seems the housekeeper smoked in my room and tried to cover it up. They also didn't leave wash cloths.

The staff was top-notch in terms of being helpful, courteous and knowledge - by this I mean the people at the front desk and the concierge. The complimentary breakfast was outstanding. Also, the proximity to the theatre district was a plus. The rooms were comfortable and it was easy to get a good night's sleep. Being able to get a variety of television stations on the room's TV set was an added bonus.

We loved the location of this hotel, just a block from the subway and on the edge of the Hells Kitchen neighborhood with lots of restaurant options. It's also decently close to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Bryant Park, etc. We walked to the hotel easily from Penn Station with our luggage. The staff were extremely friendly and the lobby was warm. The rooms were decently sized for a NYC hotel and we slept comfortably. One complaint is that there are 2 elevators and 30+ floors -- so leave extra time or take the stairs when you're going down in the morning. Really this has to do with stupid guests staying on floors 2-9 who clog the elevators trying to go down when they could just take the stairs. But, be patient, the elevator will come. The breakfast was good and there are warm cookies for people returning from their day out in the late afternoons.

The hotel would not allow anyone to check in before 3pm so when we arrived at 2:20 there was a large crowd in the lobby waiting to check in. I was shocked when we found another large group in the back also waiting to check in. I cannot believe that at 3pm all of a sudden all the rooms were now available creating quite a mess with everyone now trying to check in at the same time. The food was average but available, they had a knowledgeable concierge. The location was within walking distance of times square and many restaurants. The rooms were clean but extremely small, staff was friendly and polite.

Nice hotel a little below on the room size. Only 2 elevators for a 32 floor hotel. Location near subway, walking distance to many attractions. Good deal for your money. The breakfast is average but good service by the staff. The heating system didn´t work well. The room was at 68 degrees and sometimes at 75. There are many small restaurants at walking distance. They keep hot coffee and chocolate 24 hours. You get your cookies at night when you return.

This hotel was very nice since it was entrails located and easy to get to the main touristy places. The only compliant I have regarding the hotel is that our room was very cold, the heater was not working the entire stay and staff didn't really do anything to resolve it. The breakfast was bountiful, but ho hum. Overall a nice place, I just wish it would have been warmer.
user_location: Silver City, New Mexico, United States

review_body: Clean, courteous, cost effective. Pretty much sums it up. Great location if you are attending a trade show at the Javits or if you just want to stroll Times Square.  I'd definitely stay here again. Also, the Irish pub down the block was much better this time around.

I choose this hotel because of his location, just couple blocks away from time square. Very clean room, perfect for spend the night and keep going on the discovering of New York. I definitly will pick this hotel for my next stay at the big apple.

I would estimate that this hotel has about 200 rooms. I know for a fact that it has one check-in counter and two elevators. Getting checked-in and onwards to your room takes about as much time to hail a cab in New York during a snow storm. The rooms are on the smaller side, the interior is ok except for the smell, which reminded me about the locker room in high school. Calling this a Time Square Hotel is a bit of a stretch. If you where 0.6 miles away from the beach, would you call that beachfront property?

My wife and I stayed here for an anniversary getaway and found this to be an outstanding hotel. Location was great, walking distance to major attractions and subway. Staff was extremely helpful and attentive. Great value and great price - highly recommended.

Check in was delayed for almost 45 minutes after we arrived at 3:30 PM. Safety and security were breached because the entrance door to the room would not latch and after repair would not open. Room had to be broken into by maintenance personnel.

Staff were very friendly and helpful, room was clean and comfortable, breakfast was excellent with a good selection. Could have done with a mini-fridge in the room but I have this criticism for many hotels and it's a minor detail. Wifi worked well and was easy to log into. Will definitely consider this hotel again next time I'm in New York.

Our family stayed at Thanksgiving and everything was great, as is often the case with Hampton Inn. We had two rooms and they were comfortable. Clean, modern. No noise from the street.... Bathrooms were very nice, which is not always the case in New York, even in more expensive hotels. Staff was friendly, even though the place was packed. Breakfast had plenty of choices and was in a very pleasant room with sunlight. I am always grateful for the access to tea/coffee/cookies during the rest of the day. And I can't do without the Business center. So easy to print boarding passes and quickly check e-mails, without having to drag the laptop for a couple days. Do we wish the 20 something youths in the bedroom next to ours had partied a bit less.... Yes but then, it was Thanksgiving!!We will certainly come back. The place is wonderfully located next to the bus/train stations and near Macy's and Broadway. We highly recommend.

This was my first trip to NYC -(Me, my sister, my daughter and niece)-- I want to start off by saying Chris (works at the front desk ) was fantastic. We had to reschedule our flight and come in a night early- Chris was so helpful - we had a room with 2 double beds-- the room was small--but very clean- up to date - and adequate. We stayed on the 6th floor. The breakfast was fine- a nice way to start our day. Plenty of choices - we all found something we wanted everyday. We spent most of our time exploring the city we left early and came back late. It was nice to know we where in a safe and clean place every night. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great place to stay while enjoying the city. I am already thinking of returning to NYC and will be staying with Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Times Square South again

Very high marks for helpful, pleasant staff. They made our stay a lovely, pre-holiday experience. Thank you, Evangeline, and everyone at the front desk, for your smiles and service. Room was compact, but clean, quiet, and with a view of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was very good, and we appreciated the hot beverages after walking in the cold rain. And the cookies. Would definitely return and recommend this to friends.

I love this hotel! Helpful & friendly staff, clean hotel, comfortable beds, free breakfast, free Wi-Fi, within walking distance to Times Square & other attractions...what more could you want? I'll be back again and again.

This hotel is very nice! As we checked in, they provided complimentary homemade cookies...yum! There is also complimentary coffee/hot chocolate bar! (On chilly November stays, it was much appreciated!) We checked in very quickly. The room is a typical hotel room. The linens have extremely high thread count, very luxurious! The free breakfast is great! There is lots of variety.The location is great! It is one short block away from Broadway, and then down four blocks and you are on Time Square! The service was great, too. We appreciated the friendly, helpful service.

I visited NYC during the the thanksgiving week and shared a room with my daughter and her son, my 2 year old grandson. Needless to say, cheerios were crushed on the carpet and the whole room was filled with 3 layers of clothing. Every morning we would go out and when we came back to the room, it was fresh smelling and immaculate. The bed was comfy and large enough for all three of us to sleep comfortably. The free breakfast was pretty crazy because nearly every person took advantage of it and the table were filled to capacity.

My daughter and I went to the city for a daughter/mom trip. Our room was small, but comfortable and clean. We did have a problem with the temperature in the breakfast room It was extremely cold and uncomfortable. The food cooled very quickly. Staff told me it was due to the glass roof and the cold temperatures outside. Would you not think that somehow they could bring in some alternative heating. Breakfast was not enjoyable.

Very comfortable, very clean rooms. GREAT STAFF! Always felt important. Staff bent over backwards to accommodate us with any matter. Location was ideal to the many hot spots near Times Square and Macy's and Thanksgiving Day Parade. My hat off to the Front Desk Clerks, Yesis and Evangeline...they deserve medals for great service!! Wireless service worked great. Safes in rooms that accommodate laptops. We will be back. Thanks.

I've enjoyed this Hampton several times, and each time is a pleasure. It's close to the E line, downtown business locations, theatre and shopping. An easy trip to JFK, and safe when traveling alone at 5am to the subway. Thank you!

We just left from our 2-night stay in NYC for the Thanksgiving Day parade. This hotel is in the Garment District so we walked past all these great fabric and notion shops. Perfectly convenient to Bryant Park, Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. The room was tiny but we did have 5 people in a two-double room. Wr managed. Service was good, helpful when we realized we had left a bag in the car that was valet parked three streets north. Plus, how can you beat breakfast and hot chocolate and coffee any time!? Probably would not stay here again but that is because of my personal preference on location.

I visit NYC every year and have stayed at many hotels in the city. I will say all around, this hotel was very nice. From check in to check out, everyone was very pleasant and VERY friendly. The room was very clean. Bed was very comfortable, hence why I own one personally at home. I was on the 31st/ 32 floor and was nervous at first because the hotel only has 2 elevators, but they were VERY quick! Never waited more then a few minutes for them. I did ask for a later check out because my partner was working for the Macy's Parade and didn't get off work till 1pm. I only got an additional 30 minutes which was a little upsetting, but I understand that I was checking out on Thanksgiving and I'm sure many people were asking for them as well. But for a New York hotel, everything was very clean! Great job Hampton Inn Manhattan South! I will for sure stay with you guys again and highly recommend this to all my friends who travel in and out of the city throughout the year!

This was a great hotel for being a little off the main area, but close enough to get to places quickly. Just a few blocks from Times Square. Easy access to the subway to get where you're going. Hotel was in a quite area. Nelson and Chris at the front desk were great. They answered our questions and helped us get a shuttle back to the airport. This is the hotel for hospitalitiy!

The complimentary breakfast certainly exceeded my expectations. I enjoyed the variety and would certainly come back, as the breakfast was great! It was definitely better than your basic continental breakfast. Bravo Hampton!

Nice family friendly hotel within 15 minutes walking distance of Times Square, Fifth Avenue Shopping, Theatre, Sightseeing Tours, Water Taxi, etc. Friendly Staff provided excellent customer service with immediate attention to two small matters. Very good hot breakfast buffet with variety provided daily utilizing three or four breakfast attendants. Our room offered clean and comfortable bedding. The Lobby offers complimentary coffee, tea and fresh fruit to guests 24/7. Complimentary Wi-Fi was another nice amenity. Rooms are small, but are typical for New York City.

Stayed for one night for a show at MSG. If you want a convenient location, great rate, clean room, and very friendly staff- and who doesn't- this is the place for you. Even the morning breakfast, while certainly not fine dining, was good, with a nice selection of fresh fruit, cereal, and yogurts. Skip the eggs and sausage. The dining room was well looked after; it's evident the staff is well trained and attentive. Congratulations to the team and management on a job well done.

Stayed here in September on a Saturday night before leaving for Bermuda. Hotel is convenient to most of the nightlife and action on Times Square. Rooms are a bit small but normal for NYC. No issues with room or service although we did leave an item in the room that was never recovered (art supplies). Hotel did call back while we were in Bermuda. Would most likely stay here again.

I don't know that I've ever encountered a staff more friendly. Smiles on everyone, not one person we interacted with was the least bit negative. The location was minutes away from Times Square and all the action. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again next trip to NYC.

The hotel was fabulous. Great location, safe area for walking to everywhere, helpful and friendly staff, breakfast great and tea/coffee available 24/7. Room small but adequate, tastefully decorated and clean. Would stay here again in a heart beat. Actually planning my next trip to City and staying here.

Fun location with a terrific view. Hotel staff was very nice and friendly and very helpful with all the information we needed about the surrounding around. The only gripe that I have is the pillows and bedding in the hotel room was kinda stiff and hard. The location that we were in was also noisy due to it being in downtown manhattan. Overall a great stay!

This hotel is in a great location - easily accessible to virtually everything NYC. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The staff was AWESOME! They were super busy the two days we were there and the staff always took time to help us. Thank you for a great stay!

I spent one night here and it was wonderful! The hotel room was spotless and looked like it was totally redone. The king size bed was comfortable. The room had a hairdryer, iron and ironing board and flat screen TV. The bathroom was clean and well stocked with towels. The room was very quiet. It is not a large room but you are there to sleep and relax, not dance! the breakfast was included in the price. It wasn't your typical breakfast it was a full hot or cold breakfast. They had eggs, waffles, fresh oatmeal, home fries, bagels, toast, variety of muffins and cereals. you probably would pay $20.00 for this somewhere else. Coffee, tea hot choc. The service was excellent. I am not sure why some reviews were neg. I am very fussy when I travel and where I stay and this place was excellent. I would recommend it to anyone and will stay there again when in the city.

The lobby is tiny and very congested. Not helped by the fact that one of the elevators was out of service and the other one was being controlled manually. You think that the front desk would have mentioned that you needed to dial guest services and request an elevator when you wanted to leave your room. But they didnt, so after just checking in and going to our room, we waited some 20 minutes for an elevator to go back down. Luckily another guest told us we needed to request an elevator. But lets put it in persective - one 'working' elevator that holds maybe 10 people max for a hotel with 30 floors and you can imagine the backlog in the lobby. This was New York marathon weekend and it was one partially working elevator from Friday to Monday.The concierge I spoke to was very patronizing. When asking for directions for the subway, it means I dont know the details, otherwise I wouldnt be asking a concierge. I found strangers on the street that were more helpful.Then the printer in the business center wasnt working. In order to print anything off you had the go to the front desk and get them to do it all for you.At the price you would expect the basics to be working.
