I have stayed at this location before since my east coast office is a few blocks away. The first time I stayed here I was surprised how small the shower was, I could not stand properly. Not that this solely their fault as I am 6'-5" and 270 lbs but really, another foot would afford me enough room while not impeding into the bathroom. I arrived for my second stay (was there a few weeks prior) on 10/29/13. I was given a room on the 12th floor. This hotel offers free breakfast but due to just two elevators, you have to wait in the mornings going up and down since there is approx. 25 floors. On 10/31/2013, I pressed the button to go down to go to my office. I waited a few minutes and noticed the down light went off. I pressed the button again and it would not come on. Another couple came out of their room with their bags and they said they had a problem earlier when they went down for breakfast. I continued to press the down button but it would not come on. I went back to my room and called the front desk. They said they were having a problem with the elevators and would send the elevator up to us. I left for the day and figured they would have it resolved by the time I returned from work. That night, I saw a "bear with us" sign on elevator that did not work earlier in the day. I went up to my room. I decided to go out to dinner and had the same problem as I did in the morning, button light went off and I had to call for service. The next day, 11/1/2013, I had to wait for the elevator and once again I called downstairs. The only elevator worked opened twice, both were full. I had to get to work so I walked down the 12 flights of stairs so I would not be late for an appointment. This time I went to speak with the manager and she said they were hoping to have it fixed nlt 11/2/2013. If you were in the lobby, the wait could be very long due to the amount of people waiting to go up. This was told to me and other guests daily. I would have gone to another hotel but believed the manager's word. What I don't understand is that the staff became more irritated every day I had to call down. I was never given any call or note in my room apologizing about the problem nor told of the timeline to resolve the problem. But they were able to put a letter (11/2/2013) on my bed telling me about the time change and a little poem.....really? I have stayed at Hilton properties over the past 7-8 years for business and personal travel and have never experienced this poor of a performance. In this day and age, especially in NYC I cant believe that you cannot fix an elevator in a day or two.....but 7? (it was still down when I checked out 11/5)I have spent almost $2000 to stay in this sub par facility and I wanted satisfaction. The employee running the elevator on the last day responded to another guest who said he was going to call his credit card company and charge back his stay. He suggested we look up their "Guarantee". I read through and contacted Hilton customer service and asked for my money back or a voucher for future stay. I received no confirmation nor did any one contact me after I submitted my request. Two days ago I received an envelope from Hilton that had a voucher for ONE stay....nothing else, no letter, no communication at all. Their Guarantee:100% Hampton Guarantee®Friendly Service, clean rooms, comfortable surroundings, every time. If you’re not satisfied, we don’t expect you to pay. That’s our commitment & your guarantee. That’s 100% Hampton.Our 100% Hampton Guarantee® is boldly etched on our front desk so that it is constantly visible to our employees and our guests. Our guarantee epitomizes the pride we take in our brand, our hotels, and our service to you, our guest. We'll do whatever it takes to make our guests feel welcome, relaxed, and completely comfortable.I was not satisfied but still had to pay! Their Guarantee is bogus and almost fraudulent!

This hotel is suitable for business and specifically a close walk to the Javits convention center. The biggest problem is the extended wait time just to get to your room. I've stayed here on 5 occasions and I always request a low floor but a few times I was stuck with a high floor and this hotel is notorious for long elevator waits. I typically wait an additional 10 minutes just for the elevator to arrive so if you are pressed for time you need to factor in the elevator wait time every morning and evenings as well. The main room is small but the guest bathrooms and specifically the shower are extremely small. If you are over 6'2'' and/or weigh more than 230lbs you probably will not fit in their shower stall. The staff is very pleasant and take pride in their quaint hotel

Stayed here twice and find it to be clean with a hard working staff. Great option if you're on a budget. The location is great and the breakfast buffet is better than most Hamptons. On my first stay, I had a minor issue and they invoked the 100% satisfaction guarantee and it was free. I only wish it had been for pleasure and not business...

room with 2 bed was incredibly/ uncomfortably tight. could not walk on onside of bed. assuming king room is same size, that should be ok. bizarre front desk did not have change for a $10 bill (!) and took 30 minutes for them to reach the valet service by phone to ask for my car to be brought around.

The lobby of this hotel is about as wide as my suburban home and there are over 30 floors. It was very unfortunate that one of the two elevators was broken during my one night stay. Elevator waits were close to 20 minutes. The staff was nice and the room and common areas were very clean. The breakfast was free and just enough to get you started for the day. Coffee and tea were served all day and warm cookies were offered in the early evening. The room was clean and extremely tiny which was fine since I spent most of my time out and about in the city. The hotel is only about a 20 minute walk from Penn Station. I would stay here again.

Thank you to all the staff!! From the front desk to housekeeping and everything in between! Everyone was so helpful and personable. The breakfast was amazing and fresh. The concerige was so nice and help us plan our short first time stay in New York.

There must be a few American travelers out there that haven't stayed at a Hampton Inn. About as many as need guidance in buckling their seat belt on a plane. Hampton Inns are nearly ubiquitous around the country and even beginning to grow overseas. In Manhattan, alone, there are at least 9 of them and plans for more in the pipeline. i have stayed at 4 others in the city, and while this would not be the favorite, it generally delivers what we were looking for.The reason is obvious: they offer good value, cleanliness, friendly service, most of the amenities built into the price (including a hot breakfast, wifi, broadband, a business center, etc). Even though the layout is fairly predictable, the big city versions are not quite as cookie cutter as those out in the burbs and along the highways.The location of this one is convenient for some things (Penn Station, Port Authority, the Theater District, the Javits Center and most especially the Garment District), and less so for other neighborhoods and attractions. Still, it is surprisingly quiet for a near midtown address, and while 9th Avenue won't inspire many, 8th has a certain vitality and vibe worth exploring.Hampton Inns are usually the Accounting Department's favorite, undercutting many of their competitors by a few bucks, and still being respectable places to stay. The front desk personnel are genuinely welcoming and no doubt can provide some useful information when called upon.I had two annoying problems on this trip, one which just affected our room, the second just about everyone in the hotel. While the bathroom was spotless and made fairly good use of tight quarters, the plastic shower head needed to be replaced or repaired-it spewed water in every direction except where it was wanted. The marble under mounted sink was good quality, but so small it reminded me of those on a Pullman car. No place to put a kit except on the toilet seat. There was barely any clearance from the door. Besides the tad thin white towels, and the tiny generic soaps, everything else worked fine and there was ample lighting.The big problem of the day, and from what we heard from other guests, for the week, was that one of the two elevators was out of commission. In a 33 or 34 story high rise building, with only a handful of rooms on each floor (184 in total), the normally long wait for an elevator could climb to half an hour. As we were leaving, a busload of teenagers arrived. We left before bedlam ensured.New York hotel rates are like the stock market. They go up with supply and demand. When big events, such as the NYC Marathon, trade shows, the general press of holiday shopping are in the mix, the rates can jump a third or more. We paid a tad under $300 a night, and that was at a purportedly Seniors/AAA rate. Normally, this hotel should be closer to $200/night. Of course these rates include a big bite of local taxes.Hampton Inn breakfast are drearily predictable. But if you are just looking for some juice, coffee, a roll and maybe some form of egg and sausage, serving yourself and putting up with the hot tables will save you $20-40 and a half an hour or more over the full service hotel alternative. I have stayed at 50 or 60 hotels in Manhattan. This is not a favorite. But it does offer relatively good value and was in an ideal location for my business objective. Would I stay here again? Yes, but not as a first choice. I prefer a little more character in my hotels. Still, there is a place for consistency and reliability too-once the elevator is fixed! As we were leaving, we learned they have had the part for a day or two-and were waiting for it to be installed. The lobby of this hotel has a few sofas, a check in desk and a concierge desk. There isn't much room to lounge, and the corridor back to the elevators and the breakfast room in nearly claustrophobic. Of course, people don't come to NYC to stay in their hotel rooms. The flat screen televisions, mini desk, coffee service, iron and ironing board and small closet will meet most transients needs. Hampton Inn beds are quite comfortable and they offer a generous selection of pillows.

We stayed 5 nights in the Hampton Inn Manhattan for a congress and sightseeing. It was way too expensive for what the hotel and our room offered. It was clean, but the rooms are not modern or very nice, just standard.The breakfast was not really tasty. Dishes and glasses were all in plastic (not at all eco-friendly or nice looking). Unacceptable for that price, I would be fine with such a breakfast in a hostel.Positive: the hotel is in the center close to times square.

I have stayed at many hotels in the city, but the staff here is really the best I've encountered and why I'll be coming back again and again. The location is also great on 39th, between 8th & 9th. It's close to the action, but extremely quiet. In fact, it's the first hotel I've stayed at in Mid-town where I didn't need ear plugs. But back to the main reason to stay here, the staff. I arrived at almost 8pm after a long day at work. I was tired and not feeling all that great. I received a very warm welcome when I arrived and the check in process was super fast. They had ran out of fresh baked cookies, but made some and had them brought up to my room in about 5 minutes. There is a beverage bar off the lobby where you can get complimentary hot chocolate, coffee or hot tea pretty much round the clock. The tea I really needed, since I was loosing my voice due to some allergies. The front desk staff recommended a fantasic ramen noodle place around the corner, which is just what my aching head and throat needed. It was called Tabata, and it's fantastic! When I arrived back from having the BEST noodle soup ever, the staff seemed genuinely concerend and asked how I was feeeling and if I needed anything. They truly made me feel right at home and cared for. The complimentary hot breakfast the next morning, which is served until 10am, is so filling and a great way to start your day. They had eggs, bacon, sausage, hot oatmeal, Belgin waffles, toast, bagels, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit and three kinds of juices. This saves you on average about $20 a day in food alone, plus all the free hot beverages you want. To be hoest, I won't be staying anywhere else when I come back because the staff is so amazing and friendly and really makes you feel cared for and appreciated. I cannot recommend this place enough!

For my first overnight stay in NYC in Times Square, I was very pleased with the location and the cleanliness of the hotel as well as the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. The rooms are a bit small for more than 2 people but definitely workable for a short visit. Overall, I was extremely pleased.

I'm now retired, but during my working life I stayed in some fantastic first-class hotels all around the world - paid for by my employer, of course! This hotel is certainly not the fanciest I've stayed in but in terms of customer service, value and cleanliness it is among the very best. I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel where the staff are so efficient, attentive and pleasant. This is a great credit to the management who run a very efficient hotel and ensure that their staff are well selected and trained in the art of hospitality.Our room was smallish but spotlessly clean and well furnished. The bedding is changed every day, which seems a bit excessive (we stayed for a week) but demonstrates how much effort they put in.The breakfast, which is included in the price, is very good. The dining room is small but the excellent staff in this area do a fantastic job in keeping the buffet food topped up and clearing the tables. Very well done!The only negative issue (as mentioned in other reviews) are the lifts. During our stay one of them was out of order twice which did cause some frustration. However, full marks to the hotel for installing a temporary lift attendant during these occasions to try and keep things moving.The free coffee in the lobby and complimentary cookies on return to the hotel each late afternoon is a great touch and demonstrates again the desire to provide the best service to customers.Overall, a very good hotel in a perfect location - I'd be happy to return anytime.

This is our fourth time staying here with a group of Broadway theater tourists from Wisconsin. Staff is exceptional, rooms are large by Manhattan standards, concierge sincerely seems to want everyone to have a good time.The hotel is very well located--close to theaters, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, and the complimentary breakfast is a great bargain in mid-town.We will be back again next year!

This hotel is very well located for midtown, garment district and Theater District activities, with easy access to subways. As other reviews have noted, it's the skinniest hotel I've ever stayed in; six rooms on each floor. However, we didn't have problems with the elevator access as others have mentioned, even though the hotel seemed busy. We only waited a bit longer on Tuesday evening after theater, and at checkout time. This even though our room was on the 23d floor.The staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful at all times--that included front desk, breakfast attendants, maintenance staff and everyone I encountered. We did have a couple of issues with housekeeping; one was solved right away, the other was not, but the staff made good on their 100% satisfaction guarantee for that one, very quickly with no hesitation.The entrance is a bit hard to find, as three hotel entrances are right next to each other. Just look sharp. The doors are closer to 9th Ave.Breakfast time is very busy, it's hard to get (or keep) a table, and the serving area is poorly laid out and crowded--terrible traffic flow for people trying to serve themselves. But for a free hot breakfast in NYC, I can't complain. The coffee is better than average for hotel buffet coffee.I'd stay here again and recommend it to friends. It was a bargain for the location. Our floor was very quiet; we faced away from "the view" which was just fine. Although it's convenient to Times Sq, it's not on the Square so you don't get the bustle and glare. The theater district was an easy short walk. If you're walking back from theater, stay on 8th Ave even though it's quite crowded. If you return via 9th Ave; it's more deserted and feels a little sketchy at night.And yes, the rooms are teensy, it's New York.

I booked this hotel mainly because with breakfast included it made it a good value for the Time Square area. On the plus side, the breakfast was very good! The kids loved the choc muffins which they said were better than Starbucks. Unfortunately on the last day, we went down late, and there were no more choc muffins, but there we many other options of bread, bagels, cereal, fruit, yogurt. I don't know if the hotel was full, but while the breakfast area seemed small, we found a table very easily each day. Really, the breakfast was a big positive point for this hotel, as I had a bad experience with an overally small breakfast area in a similar hotel in the area. The desk service was very good as well and our room and bathroom were clean and comfortable.The main negative points are that while the location is convenient, the the area around the Port Authority is not great. That said, it's a quick walk to get to the main streets, metro, Times Square so this wasn't really a problem (just don't be surprised!), and the other negative was that the room was very small. We were 4 in 2 double beds - and while this is clearly what I booked, we could hardly move around the beds, and there is not enough room for luggage and all. Again, it was manageable but I've had larger rooms with 2 bed in other hotels.All in all, a good value, and I would return there again if going there with kids! It's a good option for families or anyone who wants breakfast included.

Stayed for two nights on a business trip with the hubby who needed to be in the Times Square area. Having stayed in NYC before in the midtown area and as recently as April, I am not new to the NYC hotel scene. However, this is one tiny hotel! There are only four rooms to a floor. The rooms are very small and it is hard not to trip over each other as there is not room to maneuver around the bed or bathroom. Obviously square footage in a hotel room is at a premium in NYC and this is a moderately priced hotel for the area. It is in the Times Square area but still a number of blocks away so don't let the name deceive you.It was a decent basic hotel but it was full and there were waits for the elevator and the breakfast stops on the stroke of the hour. It was a typical hotel continental breakfast. Not bad overall but I have paid the same for nicer rooms with more square footage and more centrally located and would probably not opt for this particular property again. There are just too many other choices.

On our recent visit to Manhattan we had to complain about the condition of our room. We noticed that a duvet was stained and in the morning we asked housekeeping to replace the duvet. Upon our arrival late that night we discovered the bare duvet on the bed! After 2 calls to the main desk a duvet cover was brought to us and we had to put it on ourselves - we were not pleased, especially as one guest suffers from asthma! The next morning management apologized and offered us a credit. To this day our stay has not been credited, even after many letters to the hotel and head office. I would not recommend this hotel.

Stayed with my family, location was very convenient as it was a block from a subway station, and walking distance to Times Square. The complementary breakfast is a plus, you save a good couple of bucks when traveling with two kids. Overall a nice place to stay, but don´t expect any luxuries (it´s a Hampton Inn, doooh)

We spend two nights prior to our cruise and were delighted with this hotel. The location was excellent. We were within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square and the subway. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast selection was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel.

I wanted to give the Hampton Inn chain in NYC another chance after having a prior bad experience at the Times Square North property, so thought I would give the Times Square South property a try, and SO glad I did. I was greeted right away at the desk by Chris who proceeded to be very helpful in checking me in and explaining the property to me. He next offered both my kids a pack of gummy bears. Next, since the bellman was busy, the front desk manager went and got my bag. She was extremely helpful the whole stay, as was her whole team.The room was small, but hey, it's NYC. My family and I just needed a place to sleep. The room was VERY clean, aesthetically pleasing, and comfortable. The free breakfast was one of the best I had, but the news about that must be widespread, because it was quite busy :)If I had one tiny complaint about this hotel, it was the elevator. We were on the 31st floor and it took a while for the elevator on most occasions. You can't miss with this centrally located gem with a staff ready to please!

after a terrible airbnb.com experience I had to move to a hotel. It was great and I must say one person went out of his way to make the experience extremely good. Nelson at the desk was professional and kind. He made sure every aspect of my room and stay was a good experience. He is a gem to the staff. I would most certainly hope the company acknowledges ,respects and rewards this employee. He went above and beyond to give excellent service. The rooms were clean and the hotel was acceptable. Nelson made this hotel exceptional. I was in NY for business 9/30/13 - 10/10/7/13.

Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South is clean, convenient to the convention centre, has a pretty substantial breakfast and a wonderful front desk staff. The kudos have to end there. The remainder of the amenities are cramped, minimalistic, just simply functional. The location is good if you don't go in the wrong direction. I would not recommend for a single professional woman traveling on her own. This is a back up option only if everything else is booked.

We added a day to our trip, but couldn't get a room at the Garden Hilton on 35th, so Kelly helped us find a room at this Hampton. She did a great job, and set us up with an incredible room, that was quiet, up high away from the noise, and perfect for our trips that day.While it was inconvenient to move hotels, we still enjoyed the experience. The free breakfast was great to start us off. The location was close to several great places to eat for the rest of the day. We were able to visit what we wanted to visit and rest in a comfortable bed for the night. Kelly had the hotel give us a bottle of wine and chocolates for our 25th anniversary. That was a fun treat-even if we don't drink :)-we gave it to some friends, but enjoyed the thought and the chocolates! That gesture left a very good impression about the Hilton product. We felt spoiled an at $400 a night, this couple from the Midwest appreciated it :)

If you are one of my regular readers you know I am usually on business no different and I needed to be in the City for a couple of days. The usual places I stay at are sold out or priced out of reach, due to the marathon coming in, and who knows what else. So, I fall back on an old standard a Hilton Brand. Well this one is on 39th Street in the Hell's Kitchen area, HK is one of the up and coming areas. The management company there owns two other hotels right next to the Hampton, but the Hampton is the best. I was greeted by the staff and made to feel like I was at a European Boutique Hotel. The rooms were European style and very comfortable. Ask for a high floor to get a view.Breakfast is included in the price and well worth it as everything is freshly made. They also have coffee that you can take with you.Coming back at the end of the day they offered freshly baked cookies, take as many as you want, said the concierge, but please leave the basket, she said jokingly. Not what you expect in New York.This is a great place and you are one block off of some of the most interesting restaurants in the city on 9th avenue.

The room was over priced. The hallways where so small, I felt trapped, don't get me started about the size of the room it was like a doll house. Over rated, the comforter had unknown stains, called front desk to complain it took 4 hours to get assistance. However, shout out to the housekeeping he was really nice once he got there. The elevator situation was horrible, it took a lifetime to get it, than when you did people jumped on like a herd of cows smashing you up against the wall...It felt like everything was super small, I felt like so overwhelmed....I enjoyed NY overall...

Friendly staff, good location, nice amenities for a NYC hotel...I do not think you will be disappointed...some good restaurants in the area and the breakfast will save you money while in the city to spend on other things...

A group of us stayed at the Hampton Inn for a convention at the Javitz Convention Center. The rooms are small, but modern and clean. There was an issue with the elevators that had some of my coworkers going up and down 18 flights of stairs, but that's hopefully rare.The hotel is convenient to many attractions, with several restaurants and a drug store nearby.

We stayed here 4 nights and it was a great location! The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was adequate but did get crowded after 9am. Our room faced the street but the noise did not bother me . I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Situated close to Times Sq. and close to Metro, free breakfast with food variation during the week. Daily special service concerning theater/musicals etc. Free coffe (choose regular or robust) and tea 24 hrs. Kind and helpful personell. Clean and fresh rooms. Gym available for all guests. Strongly recommended.

Very close to many main attractions-Times Square just a block or two away. Extremely helpful and friendly staff during check-in, check-out, and great breakfast staff. The breakwast was very great-especially the omelet. Appreciate that they hold your luggage even after you check-out so you can tour the city without the hassle of rolling your suitcase around.

We recently stayed here for a 5 night visit to NYC. Our hotel room on the 19th floor was clean and the beds great. The room size was small but typical for NYC. We couldn't believe how quiet it was for sleeping. The two elevators are busiest around check out time and we had to wait one morning before we got on the 4th one to come by. Breakfast room was always clean and food supplies were constantly replenished by the staff. A great location for catching the subway a couple blocks away and plenty of tourist attractions nearby. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. We like the consistency of the Hampton Inns.

I stayed two nights at this hotel in a double roon in September. The location is good, but like most New York hotels rooms were small. However, the great service provided by the staff made this hotel a winner. All the staff members were friendly and professional. They went out of their way to assist people and anticipate visitors' needs. If you appreciate excellent service, this is the hotel for you.

This is the 2nd time I've stayed at the Hotel. It is the best place to stay since it is so close to Broadway, Times Square, and Rockefeller Ctr.Beds were comfortable. The breakfast is very good, free, and bountiful.

Wonderful experience. I went to NYC for my one year wedding anniversary and the staff could not have been more helpful with not only all my hotel needs but also with my NYC visit. Every suggestion the concierge made was incredible and the rest of the hotel staff cold not have made our stay any better. I would and have recommended this hotel to many. Thank you Thank you thank you.

We stayed for seven nights in a standard double room in October. Location: If you're looking for a central Midtown location that is close to Times Square, then this is it. You are a 5-8 minute walk from Times Square and close to 42nd St Port Authority Bus Terminal subway station and 42nd St Times Square subway station. Between the two, you have good access to most places in Manhattan. Room: The room was small, but clean. The hotel advertises that they wash and replace the duvet every day, but ours clearly wasn't for multiple days as there was a stain in the same spot every day. This is barely an issue though. Service: Reception was friendly, informative and greeted you when you came back to the hotel. No complaints. The hotel provides freshly baked cookies between 4-7pm which is a nice little afternoon treat. Other: The reception area is small and often gets crowded, especially for those waiting for the elevator. Breakfast was included in the price and was adequate, however it can get busy, especially on the weekend. Lastly, the wifi is terrible. Ours only worked if you were standing next to the door. This isn't good enough. Hotels need to understand that wifi is no longer a luxury, it is a necessity. It should be quick and reliable. No excuses, especially for the room price.

there were constant tour groups, long waits for elevator, printer to get boarding passes did not work, staff did not advise fix would not occur, could not get into room and had to wait for elevators to get to front desk to fix

We (two adults and two kids) arrived in the middle of the night in 'emergency circumstances'. The staff member on duty was brilliant and really went out of her way to make things as easy for us as possible. To me, this means a lot. The room was clean and well appointed this made out previous stressful experience elsewhere fade into a memory. While smallish (but this is usual in NYC) the room was clean and surprisingly luxurious and well appointed. The lobby and common areas were clean and we were warmly greeted by every staff member we met. Really wish we'd known about this hotel sooner and I feel it is a great find and one we'll consider on our next trip to NYC.

Great location, Free Breakfast, Wifi, Hot Drinks AND Cookies included what more could you want.:-):-):-) We stayed at the Hampton Inn for 4 nights and we were REALLY pleased with this hotel, the staff were lovely,behind the desk, the breakfast staff, the porters, couriers, etc. Anything that you needed help with was no problem. I had read that breakfast time was hectic but to be fair it wasnt too bad, we always found somewhere to sit and there was a good variety of food available like yogurts, cereal, fruit, muffins and hot food and drinks which was more than id expected, i loved it as alot of the hotels id looked into didn't provide breakfast at all let alone the free wifi and cookies, they go down a treat after a good days walking around New York and its just great that you can download all of your days pictures whilst you're there relaxing in your room. The room size was average but i dont think iv ever had a big spacious room in any hotel anyway unless your willing to pay for it. They were cleaned daily, tidy and had a ironing board, iron, coffee machine, and some complimentary soaps and face cleanser and cream in the bathroom which i also thought was a nice touch. Location wise it was 5-10 mins walk away from times square (depending on how fast you walk) and theres plenty of bus tours that start near by.Overall would highly recommend.

This is a great place to stay. It was inexpensive by New York standards and in an excellent location. Clean rooms and common areas. Complimentary breakfast was definitely a cost saver. Small rooms but that is typical of New York. Great service. Would definitely stay here again.

A friend and I had never been to New York before and were greeted with smiles and much help in how to get around New York, how to use the subway, where to eat, etc. The room as small but clean and quiet with comfortable beds and pillows. The complimentary breakfast was great. It had a lot of different choices from breakfast cereal to waffles to omelets. We were very impressed and would definitely stay there again. This hotel was within walking distance of the theater district, restaurants, Times Square. We never had to take a taxi.

Spent 4 nights at this Hampton Inn. The service was great especially Fred Lewis. He glad us the best places to eat, best directions to all of the sites that we wanted to visit. The location was really good. Everything was close by. The room decor was somewhat outdated. The breakfast was delicious. I especially liked having cookies and apples and coffee or tea available. When I return to NYC, I would seriously consider staying here again.

We stayed here for the first two weeks of our honeymoon. We had never been to NYC before and after a several long flights we were hoping we wouldn't encounter any problems.From the moment we arrived to the morning we left the staff were terrific. They were happy to provide directions and advice on getting around/restaurants etc. The location of this hotel is great, a short walk to all the times square attractions.Rooms aren't too small, beds were really comfy.We stayed during Hurricane Sandy, during this time we found staff so calm and helpful.The breakfast was pretty good and all fresh, hot drink supplies were sometimes out of stock towards the evening but that didn't really bother us.Would love to stay again.

We arrived on a red eye flight from San Francisco and found this option through a mobile app. It was a great find and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay, whether you are planning or it is a last minute situation.We lucked out in that there was a room available, and they allowed us to check into our room early in the morning, rather than waiting until mid afternoon. This allowed us to take advantage of the breakfast as well as settling into a nice, clean, calm place in a busy city like NYC.The staff was super friendly and helpful, from the moment we arrived to holding our luggage when we checked out two days later. Based on staying in many other hotels in Manhattan over the years, I would highly recommend this hotel as it was clean, quiet (in comparison to many others in manhattan), less chaotic area to walk to/from and excellent breakfast for something complimentary!

Spent 3 nights at Hampton Inn. This is an older hotel. The decor is somewhat dated. The service is great!! Everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. Most impressive was the honesty of the employee who cleaned my room. I had left my purse laying on the bed while going to breakfast. We did not expect the housekeeper that early in the day. Much to my relief none of the cash, credit cards and IDs were missing! Aside from excellent service this hotel offers a great location with many of NYC attractions at walking distance. I would definitely stay there again.

4 of us stayed here for 3 nights this past weekend. Great service, good breakfast, very helpful fast service if and when needed. We had an issue with our room lock, within 10 minutes it was fixed. We had two rooms on the 18th floor. Rooms are a bit small but so is every room in new york, most of the time is spent out of the hotel anyway so we didn't mind. Free wifi was nice. Concierge, bell boy and front desk were very friendly. Coffee & Tea available 24/7, just wished they had milk available instead of carnation, although when I asked they got me some :)

Stayed here for one night before our cruise out of New York. It was a standard room with 2 queen beds overlooking 39th Street a noisy street making it difficult to sleep . It seemed and felt like a older hotel. It was nice having the free breakfast in the morning with options for all. They also have coffee, tea or hot chocolate available 24 hours a day. The hotel is close to Times Square and plenty of sights and stores. We paid over $300 for the night for an average hotel. It is within walking distance to the port or a $10 cab ride which included the tip. Just so-so.

Traveling a lot for business I say in various hotels across the US and in NYC. This was in a good location. Staff was friendly. Room was very small. I know rooms tend to be smaller in NYC but there wasn't a lot of room to walk or move in my room. The room was clean and I couldn't hear any outside noise at night eventhough my room was facing a main road. Breakfast was nice and hot with good choices. I would say based on the room size it was not worth $400/night.

Very good location near the heart of Times Square. The staff was very friendly and provided excellent service. Enjoyed having coffee and tea available 24-hours. The room was quite small however expected it based on other reviews. Be prepared to wait for the elevator during peak times.

Rooms in NYC are small everywhere but this place did not make me feel that way. We stayed 5 nights and were treated so well by the people working there that we still talk about them. The breakfasts were free and had such variety that everyone should have been happy. There was a drink station that often had apples available too and warm cookies every evening. Down side is the price of parking your car, but that again is everywhere. We were within walking distance of Times Square and had public transportation a block away. Thought this would be our one and only trip to NYC but had such a great time we are already planning our next trip and have this Hampton as our place to stay.

My mother and I stayed here for a girls weekend. We booked it for the fair rate and proximity to Times Square. We were pleased with the modern look of the hotel and pleasantly surprised to find it was a 5 minute walk from Times Square. The breakfast buffet quality was a pleasant surprise. It was fresh and hot daily and there was always something I could find to fill my belly. I am a big meat and egg eater but they offered plenty of healthy options like oatmeal and skim milk too. The coffee could have been better, but I am an admitted snob. The service was perhaps the happiest surprise. Every single staff member was friendly and helpful-and we saw someone new every day!Some warnings: this is New York. This hotel is in a skinny building with two elevators. The elevators are slow, but worked. The hallways are small. Our king bed room was small. I was comfortable sharing with my mom, but we had to manuever around each other a couple of times. I heard some people in the hallway early one morning. I am a heavy sleeper and very annoyed at the disruption. It was the only time I heard noise at night, but again- narrow hallways=more noise.Some tips: Explore the neighborhood. There is a $1 a slice pizza place 1 block over, a delicious italian joint on the same street, a tasty Irish pub 3 doors down and hot dog stands at the end of the block. Everything we wanted was so close! The drug store, the theater (we saw Newsies-Great show!), times square. It was even quiet at night, which is more than I can say about my last NY hotel.

I stayed here for two nights with my family. We got two double beds. The room and washroom are a bit small but overall I think it was a good hotel for the price we paid. The best is it has free breakfast and unlimited drinks station on the main floor (hot water, tea, hot chocolate). The location is fabulous - walking distance to main attractions and it's only one or two small blocks away from subway station.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights. We arrived late on the first night and were greeted very well by the front staff. After the second night we discovered that our door did not lock. We notified the front desk and someone came to fix it. We had to stay for about 15 minutes and then he said we could leave while he finished. When we returned at 9:00 that evening we discovered that we had had no maid service. We notified the front desk to get fresh towels and they were sent up. However when we asked about the lack of maid service we were asked if we had left the DND sign on our door. We had not. We really felt that they did not care about the lack of maid service and that somehow it had been our fault. For the price we were disappointed and would not stay here again. We have tried to contact the hotel directly but cannot find any email for them so have resorted to posting this review. There are many hotels in Times Square and we would suggest finding another one.

Great hotel, good location, great staff, wonderful accessibility!!!! It is often very difficult to find an accessible room, with a roll-in shower and 2 beds. This hotel has it all. The concierge was very helpful as we looked for wheelchair accessible transportation.

The Hampton Inn had comfortable rooms and furniture, was clean and the heating/cooling system worked well, the complimentary breakfast was very nice and the staff was helpful. The location is convenient for anyone wishing to spend time in Midtown Manhattan and is right down the street from the Hell's Kitchen Flea Market on weekends!

Stayed here for 2 nights. Convenient location relative to Penn Station, Times Square, Garment District, and easy access to Lincoln Tunnel-- a big plus if you’re flying in/out of Newark Airport; your cab or super shuttle would avoid much traffic not having to go deep into the city. This hotel is really more in the Garment district neighborhood than Times Square. It’s not the prettiest area but seems safe. The hotel itself is very “basic” Hampton Inn, nothing flashy aesthetically. However, it seems like it’s been recently remodeled or built; so it’s very clean, well maintained. It’s a narrow building, so the hallways are pretty tight, rooms are generally small, just what you’d expect in any big city hotel especially NYC. We had a room on the very top floor (32nd Floor) but only had a view of another equally tall building next door. Bathrooms are roomy enough but have a small-ish sink, no counters, no bath tubs, shower stall only. One large closet and a small one. Other amenities: iron/ironing board, basic toiletries, small refrigerator, flat screen TV.Other things to note:Pretty good wi-fi/internet access.Business Center—a cramped space with two old PC’s and a printer.Fitness Center- in the basement, small space.Lobby- small, can get cramped especially when may guests are checking in/out. Dining Room/Free breakfast: room also gets crowded but pretty good quality and selection of food especially for being “free”. Good coffee!Bottom line, this is a good basic hotel in the middle of Manhattan. I can't say it's a great value cost-wise but average for the price point. Again, its clean, offers good amenities, and most noteworthy: excellent, responsive service from the friendly and professional staff!

Stayed here for 6 nights in september 13 for a sight seeing holiday..Very clean ,comfortable and friendly hotel, reasonable breakfast everyday........,our room didnt have a view but i understand some do.....tho you may have to pay more for this pleasure.Slightly shabby looking location.....a lot of scaffolding about when we were there didnt help, however you are only minutes away from all the action 5 mins from time square ,broadway ect. all in all, its good value for money and we would have no hesitation in booking again.

Very nice and helpful staff. Different breakfast every morning; not amazing but definitely satisfying. They give you water bottles and/or mints in the morning and cookies at night. Close to Port Authority. Comfortable beds and they clean the duvet covers too! Go to breakfast earlier, as there isn't much left closer to 10:00 am.

This hotel was by far the best I have stayed at in NYC The lobby was so inviting, the staff so friendly and accomodating, the room so clean and the breakfast fresh and inviting. The rooms were so quiet, especially for NYC we heard no outside noise what so ever.

stayed here 7 nights and found the location ideal for getting around NY. Room although small was typical of hotel rooms in city,it was very clean and all bed linens were changed each day. The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. I would bertainly stay here again.

The hotel is in a good location for everywhere, 10-15 mins to Times Square, 2minutes to a vast array of resturants, and shops. Room was clean and tidy , bath room plenty of soap shampoo etc. Bed very comfortable. we had a view of Empire State Building and the Hudson (upper floors at front)Only 2 lifts so patience is required at "rush hours " eg checking in and breakfast. Hot breakfast to start day , for early risers and sleeper inners. break fast is hot n cold cereals, fruit juices, fruit, toast bagels, cheese toast etc. + muffins. hot stuff sausages, meat patties bacon. omelletes scrambled eggs, but not all on same day. All of the staff are extremely friendly, I wish I could name them all,Sam in the breakfast room was always busy along with the staff cooking the food. Reception was especially nice so very friendly. So thank you all @ the Hampton,for making our vacation (13 nights in all ) so special. Sorry I cant remember all your names, but I will certainly remember all your smiles. Goog luck to you all. Mr & Mrs Farr, Manchester UK.

Hilton is my brand for corporate travel and the Hampton inn is usually clean reliable and comfortable when a full service Hilton is unavailable but the size of this room is laughable. For one person it is tight. For a family this would be impossible.

Very clean room with shower, no tub. There was hairdryer and safe in the room. The room was tight with kingsize bed. The "city views" side of the building was not worth paying extra for, but was the sunset side. The elevators are "make you late" SLOW! The breakfast was included and was better than continental. All in all a great value for a location that puts you in the heart of NYC.

Stayed this past weekend (September 5 - 8) with family members. I had my own King bedded room on the 12th floor (I had room 1204...they had 1201 which had 2 double beds). The rooms were small but it's kind of what we're used to in big cities and that's just simply something that doesn't bother me. Beds were very comfy and bathrooms also small but very efficient! There were 32 floors...each floor just had about 4- 6 rooms on them. The main reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because of the elevators. There were times when you had to wait forever and then it seemed to stop on every floor. If you can do it and are on one of the lower floors...take the stairs! The service was great...staff was all very friendly. The.breakfast was adequate for us (but we're not big breakfast eaters) and had cereal, juice, coffee, tea, several hot dishes which varied on each day (sausage patties, bacon etc...) a waffle maker, yogurt, different bread choices (English muffins, bagels, muffins and plain bread) with a toaster oven and some type of eggs...scrambled and hard boiled. I think they could definitely use another toaster oven...this kind of clogged up the small area each morning at certain times. The location was great....very close to Times Square and a parking garage across the street if you're driving in. Overall a great place to stay!

The staff here are very nice, but this isn't up to normal Hampton Inn standards. My room (with 2 double beds) was tiny - so small two people can't walk past each other at the foot of the beds. The tiny ice machines are also frequently out of ice, which is inconvenient since they are only on 15% of the floors and the elevators are somewhat slow. The breakfast area was very slow due to it being absurdly cramped. Lastly, this isn't very near Times Square - the neighborhood isn't very nice and out of the way. I suggest the Times Square North Hampton Inn instead - much nicer.

My now-spouse and I stayed here the first week of August 2013 when we went to New York to be legally married after 14 years together. It was perfect for us in every way. I was agog at how stylish it was, from the lobby on up. Our room was small, as most NYC hotel rooms are, yet the furnishings and decor were very attractive and comfortable. It reminded me of a W or Kimpton. Every inch of the space was maximized, too. Our room's location at the front of the building on the 32nd floor afforded us good views of the Empire State Building and the Hudson River. It was also extremely quiet. We didn't hear any street, hallway, or elevator noise. The complimentary breakfast was much better than those things often are and the coffee was better than decent. That dining area was well done, too, with innovative measures to introduce natural-looking light into a windowless space. The lobby was very pretty, with big windows overlooking the street and nice decorative touches. Above all, the staff was just outstanding. There was not a concierge desk per se; however, the front-desk personnel gave the sorts of tips and recommendations that concierges usually offer. One of them even remembered that I'd injured my foot, and she asked about it. We were completely open about our reason for being in New York--to be married (and to catch a show or two, of course)--and the staff semmed genuinely excited for us. The location is very good, with lots of great restaurant choices just around the corner, and of course the proximity to all the theatres and the subway station makes it ever so convenient. We'd definitely stay here again.

Small hotel by New York standards but ideal location just a short 3-4 minute walk from central Times Square but down a quiet street away from the hustle. 6 rooms on each floor (of about 32 floors) which are served by just two lifts so be prepared to wait for the lift. We were on a lower floor so tended to walk down and lift up. Difficult on exit day with all our cases when we had to wait ages. Nice clean room and bathroom although we did have to wait a couple of days as the room hadn't been serviced when returned about 5pm to change for dinner, which was disappointing. Good breakfast facilities although not enough seating for the number of people wanting to eat but only had to wait a few minutes for a table. Concierge was not overly helpful but Bellman and receptionist were fantastic helping sort out transport and offering advice on places to visit / eat etc. All in all a good hotel. We would stay there again.

If you want to be near times square, the subway, great restaurants and the theatre district, this is the hotel for you! The room was clean and spacious. The shower is a little small, but that is typical for a NYC hotel. It is a great central location, but on a side street so the noise isn't terrible. You can walk anywhere near times square. The beds are VERY comfortable and the linens were nice. They also offer a complimentary breakfast until 10:00 and free coffee and lemon water all day. The staff was friendly and helpful and will share with you many tips that will help you get the most out of your stay.

Not much to add to the majority of the reviews on this location. Traveled with family of 4, although small rooms as described, our room was adequate for a two night stay. Parking garage located on same street. Utilized the garage vs valet parking. Cost for 3 days avg $27 per day. Garage attendants were very helpful, and I felt my vechicle was very safe in their hands. Allowed us to ride elevator to our vechicle a couple of times to get items. You get the same quality service and breakfast you except from a Hampton Inn.

The room was so small they could not fit a roll away be. My teenage boys were crowded in the double size bed. the hair dryer was not working and was not repaired/replaced until after we had left for dinner. Too late for me to dry my hair. The room had an odor which we reported. We were told they would send someone up with air freshener. they never came and we just fell asleep. Okay for an over nighter but not worth 60,000 points.

The only complaint we had was the frustrating wait for the lift. The hotel has two small lifts that were always busy. We waited for it for 15 minutes. However this is a small complaint as the rooms are clean, staff friendly and the complimentary breakfast was very good. For the price, its a an affordable option for a decent hotel in the middle of New York. Will be back.

Hotel is located so close to Times Square, subway, Broadway shows yet the street is quiet enough. My room was on the 7th floor and street noise was minimal. Hotel staff extremely friendly, attentive to your needs. Continental breakfast was good, with hot items and waffle maker. Room was small, expected for NYC, modern decor and very clean. Bed a little too springy, but I slept well nonetheless.3 kinds of pillows on the bed, loved that!Would definitely return and recommend this property!

Wow! What a great hotel. Breakfast free with every room. Unbelievable what is served and a wonderful staff to make certain everything is ready and replenished. Everything I would want for a hot breakfast or the oatmeal/ fresh fruit that I love. The coverlet and linens are washed everyday. The room is immaculate and tastefully decorated. I cannot say enough about ow accommodating the staff is to meet every need.Wow! Can't believe I found this place and at a reasonable rate.

clean, convenient to theaters, restaurants, and transportation. The breakfast was fair, the coffee very good. The rooms are extremely small and the bathrooms are tiny. OK for sleeping but not to hang our in.

Convenient to Penn Station and Times Square, but on a quiet street along with two other very narrow hotels. I like the iced water in the lobby, the cookie treats, good coffee all day long, the friendly and efficient staff, and the breakfast! The rooms are on the small side, of course, but updated and very clean. Best of all, however, was the bed. Super comfy and clean, crisp sheets and bedding. Would definitely stay there again.

Feels like a small town hotel, as I have been staying there sine the first year it opened. Staff is mostly the same, meaning it is a good place to work. Everything is nice and clean, free WiFi. I usually have a lot of packages waiting for me when I arrive. No charge for this. The neighborhood is quiet, just off the crazy human rush hour walk. I will be back.

This very clean, ver appointed hotel is a few steps off of Times Square. Excellent walking distance to everything. Great breakfast, nice workout facility, rooms are small but welcome to NYC! They were very clean and very well furnished. Staff was AMAZING!!! Chris is a great source of information for food, shows and shopping!! Hampton should make this guy a tour guide for the city. I would definately stay again.

Very good location. Helpful Staff. Very good breakfast. Negative: Housekeeping came at 6pm to do the room. At that time we were getting ready for dinner so we didn't get the service. I would really have appreciated if they would have done it earlier during the day.

Staff was very nice and accomadating. We asked for a low floor which they did. for us. Hotel was clean and the location was just off the busy area of times square which was great. We were just a few blocks from the on off bus which was very nice. Would definitely stay here again.

This is a really good hotel to stay at, it is near enough to Times Square to walk easily but far enough to be away from the crowds. There are plenty of restaurants around the area and close enough to walk to subway, buses and shops. The room was not huge but this is a big city and space is a premium. The shower was too narrow though and we had to wash ourselves sideways. The room and furnishings are clean and we could see the top of the Empire State Building from our window. As previous people have mentioned, there are only 2 elevators and waiting time can be long as the cleaning staff use them as we'll. it is quite an effort to find a place to sit for breakfast on busy days but the food for breakfast is good and plentiful. It would be better if the waffle makers were at a different location because they clog the line. All in all though we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to all.

... This property is very clean and nicely renovated. Great staff and breakfast is a nice treat. Nice location; within a few blocks from Times Square. I will be back for sure. Excellent place for casual travellers who need a bed and breakfast style accommodation. Price is reasonable, so you will save some $$ for fun too. Go for it!!!

After a one night stay before we boarded our cruise on the 21st March we were very much looking forward to our return stay for 5 nights whilst we explored NYC and we were not disappointed. 5 minutes walk from the heart of Times Square so a great location for a kick off. We booked a 3 day bus pass but once we had been on it once we were able to walk to the sites as the hotel was so central, if you like walking, like us save yourself some money and don't bother with the bus tours. Central park was only a 15 minute walk one way and Macys a 10 minute walk the other. The tours were ok if you want background information but we had more fun exploring ourselves.The hotel staff were so friendly that not only did they give my daughter an Easter gift but they even gave me one too! Hotel was spotless and this is coming from a clean freak.The breakfast was plentiful, you could eat as healthy or as naughty as you wanted, only downside was the breakfast area was on the small side but we only had to wait one morning for a table to become free. The gym was ample for a workout. Lifts....well lets say we waited and waited and found being on floor 14 a bit of a pain. Other than this the hotel was well worth the money we paid and would 100% recommend it. Thank you to all at The Hampton for making our NYC trip such a pleasure.

This is a very clean and comfortable hotel near Time Square. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. It's also a good value and a great place to stay if you're on a budget. Free breakfast is a plus. We would definitely stay here again.

From the moment I checked in, I was treated with a friendly, warm welcome. Located right in the heart of the city. Clean, and Brilliant! Breakfast just amazing and tasty!will come back to this hotel only!

Room was typical New York City size, clean and adequate. Hotel front desk staff very friendly and helpful. This hotel shares a concierge. The breakfast area is very small and cramped in the morning unless you arrive early. There are only two small elevators and again the wait time can be lengthy as there is not a seperate service elevator. This hotel is a short distance from a main road to get a cab and a little dark at night. Price was resonable; noise level was very good!

Wonderful experience and extra kudos to the front desk and breakfast staff for the extra effort they put into their jobs and hospitality! There are obviously many choices for hotels in the Manhattan area, we liked the location, the safety of the area and found the location to be easily accessible to most anything.

We stayed at the Hampton for four days and found our experience overall to be very good. Rooms were clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The location was absolutely perfect.....close to to Times Square, theaters , and many fine restaurants. The price was also very reasonable....no need to stay at expensive and fancy hotels as there is so much to see and do in NYC and this location allowed easy access to many attractions and events. Also is within walking distance to Central Park! We loved this place and will definitely stay here again when returning to NYC.

Our room was great, good size and very comfy bed. Bath was a little small but good hot water and clean towels. The hotel staff were attentive and helpful with recommendations regarding restaurants . Great location to all things, Broadway, Central Park, waterfront & Times Square. We walked to everything except the two times when my feet were hurting so bad we jumped into a taxi fora $5 ride. The temperature was in the high 90's to 100+ and the air conditioner ran all nite but our room was nice and cool. The breakfast was nice, nothing fancy but usual breakfast food and the breakfast lady was nice and friendly. We stayed at Hilton Times Square in December and although it was lively this hotel was more convenient for walking and sightseeing. Great experience and would definitely stay in this hotel on our next visit.

This hotel is located near everything. You are two blocks away from Times Square and Broadway and the bus terminal is on the corner. The room is small but when you are in NYC you just use it to sleep, take a bath and keep your luggage, so the space it's more than enough and also the room is very clean and confortable. The breakfast is simple, without a great diversity of food, but everything is fresh and tasty. The hotel staff is very attentive and polite. Next time I'll go to New York, I'll definetely stay in this hotel.

cute hotel with limited rooms, hotel staff awesome, but needed to change rooms between days, had to check out of one and the other room was very late getting ready. Staff gave us a little goody bag to help but we all really wanted our room.

This hotel has too many maintenance issues, especially in the bathroom. The hotel staff is slow to respond. The housekeeping area must be understaffed because the room was not cleaned until late afternoon or early evening.

This hotel has an excellent location and is a great value for the area. It is convenient to tourist attractions,airport restaurants,etc. The rooms are rather small,but this is NYC.But, the room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice and pleasant. Would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

This was our first trip to New York City and we stayed for 7 nights at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. We had a wonderful stay and the staff was extremely polite & professional. We stayed with our 2 children & the double bed room fit us just fine. The breakfast buffet was wonderful & we even received a bag with muffins, apples, & water at our last morning breakfast. The average wait for the elevator was 2-3 minutes. I had mentioned our son's birthday & when we returned from our day of touring, there were some treats & a Happy Birthday note for him. We felt very safe in the hotel & on the street. Close to Times Square & the subway. The staff was great about answering the many questions we had about the city. When we asked for non-feather pillows, they were delivered to our room promptly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again & I have already recommended it to a friend heading to NYC!

Great location, easy walk to subway, Staff at the Hampton Inn were VERY accommodating!! As always the hampton inn is known for it's comfortable bedding and clean rooms. A BIG Thank You to Chris at the front desk who's smile lights up the entrance. He was very helpful with getting around the city too! Breakfast was great, coffee even better!! Cold water and fresh baked cookies awaiting our return from a long hot day in the city.We are planning our next trip and we will stay here again!Thank You Hampon Inn!

As we walked into the hotel, the front desk staff greeted us with smiling faces. We checked in (about 2 hours early) and the staff was more than willing to get us into a room as fast as possible. After reviewing on the computer for a few moments, they were able to get us in a room (which was actually an upgrade) immediately for no additional cost. We took the elevator ride and arrived at our room on the19th floor (I think 19th, possibly 17th). The room was small, but well decorated and the beds were comfortable. It was just my mom and I, so it was plenty of space for two of us. Once we got a little rest, we went down stairs to head to our first stop. After an afternoon and evening out and about in the city, we headed back to the hotel. We arrived back and were greeted with the same amount of enthusiasm as before. Our 3 day stay in this hotel was definitely a positive one. On our last day, we were all packed and ready to go, but had a late flight. The front desk was more than happy to hold our bags for us while we spent the day in the city. The only place where there could be improvement is the set up of the breakfast. The toaster and waffle irons were right next to each other and it created quite the traffic jam in the morning. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit to the city. Thank you for a great stay!

enjoyed staying at the hotel. the front desk staff in the evening were awesome!! the double beds room were extremely tight-no walking area between the beds and the dressers. We (sister, my best friend) did go to NYC to stay in the room, so it served its pupose. enjoy...

Good value for the excellent location and good service. The room was cozy -- typical New York -- and a tiny bit smaller than we are used to which is why I rated it 4. Special kudos to Chris who was so helpful and nice.

All of the front desk and breakfast staff was wonderful. The breakfast attendants were all over keeping the buffet stock with a very crowded room of guest. Elizabeth was so helpful during my entire stay and she has helped me get my bill straight after I left keeping in touch with me by email. She is GREAT!!

We stayed here for 4 days at the start of our holiday, the rooms are compact but very clean and modern. Breakfast is wonderful in the morning with a selection of waffles, pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereal, juices etc. Staff very friendly and obliging. Only 3 block walk to the bright lights of Times Square.

I found a last minute deal that included a full breakfast. Hotel was clean, comfortable and an incredibly convenient location. Staff were helpful and courteous. Will definitely return soon. Close to theaters and delicious restaurants.

Our family enjoyed staying at this hotel in July 2013. Best things are the friendly, helpful staff, comfortable beds/linens and quiet room (even in the midst of the city). Variety of breakfast food was pretty good, although the American cheese in the omelettes should have been substituted for a better-quality cheese. There is very little floor space in the room (we had 2 doubles) and nowhere to put luggage for 4 people. This is Manhattan, however, so floor space is a premium! Overall, a great location (walk 2 blocks to Times Square and subway, 1 block to Port Authority, many small restaurants) and we recommend to families on a budget.

This was my second stay here. This hotel is extremely clean all the way through. No complaints whatsoever with the staffing. The staff is very knowledgeable with local restaurants and where to catch cabs during peak hours. It took an hour longer to get in our room on a Friday due to housekeeping being a little behind. Front desk staff was genuinely aplogetic for this. Breakfast is very nice. My only suggestion is to make sure both elevators are always working for guests. Great value for business or vacation.

The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The ease of getting in and out of the city was great. A great find in New York City. I would definitely come back and recommend to family and friends.

Hotel is clean and decent. No complaints about room. Was able to walk to Times Square and conveniently take subway to other areas. Customer service was less than par. Front desk clerk, Chris, was absolutely awesome!! He provided step-by-step directions to get places and always seemed eager to help. Another front desk clerk, by the name of Hatanachi, was not friendly at all. It seemed as if this clerk was purposely ignoring us and had an attitude when we asked a question. Hotel area/street is dark at night but wasn't a problem. Overall, I was pleased with the stay here. Customer service prevented a higher rating.

Convenient hotel to Times Square. Desk Staff extremely friendly. Rooms have been recently renovated and are very functional. Breakfast area seems small, in relation to the number of rooms on property.

This hotel on a map, seems central (Times Square is, after all a few blocks away), BUT if you like to travel by subway it is a bit off the beaten path. This is my third time in NYC in the past year, and the other hotels I stayed at this year and in previous years were much closer to subways. For example, taking the green line up to the Met isn't too easy from there...if you can't walk long distances, the blocks are long going East-West to the Times Square station, for example. This is definitely a tourist hotel and you won't be in a neighborhood with quainter boutiques and restaurants, or bump into as many local New Yorkers, compared to the upper east or west sides, etc.However, the actual hotel was a typical Hampton with friendly staff. At breakfast the staff went out of the way to greet me and I sensed a lot of camaraderie amongst themselves, saying hello or good morning to each other. I loved that the hotel had a business center and a modern, smallish gym. I wouldn't say it was outstanding, but have no complaints either. The rooms were smaller but extremely quiet and clean.

My first night here at Hampton Inn Times Square South. I must say I already regret booking my stay here for seven nights. The rooms are smaller than small. I come to NYC every year for vacation. I can deal with a small room, but what I can't deal with is the rude customer service that I have already received. To be specific from a supervisor. My carpet is torn in my room in two places and my bedspreads are covered with lint balls all over it. The elevators are like snails. You wait forever to get one. They say they have hot coffee and tea 24 hours a day. Not true! It's 11:00 p. m. and there is coffee, but ice cold. Yuck!I am paying for two rooms and trust me it's not cheap. I at the least expect good customer service and a room without torn carpet and a bed without hair in it.Sadly we are here for seven nights.when we return next year it will not be here.

Other than the incredible amount of time spent waiting for an elevator during breakfast hours or when you have luggage to transport, I have no complaints about this hotel. Typical, smaller NY rooms, but very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is one of the best I've had in a hotel. However, it gets very crowded and I wondered if people were just walking in off the streets to partake in it. The free laundry available at Comfort Suites next door is a great service.

I was there recently for work. I have no complaints about my stay. The front desk personnel was excellent, especially Chris from the evening crew. He pointed out places on the map to see,, gave suggestions on where to eat, and was just very helpful in every way. I wouldn't let this worker get away. The rooms were clean and big enough to serve their purpose. The hotel breakfasts were excellent. Getting there before the crowds would be best though. I noticed it started to get busy by 7:30.

Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was good, the place was clean. Close enough to walk to Empire State building. However, next time I would book at the Hampton Inn Times Square North--instead of South. I realize we're in New York, but I have never stayed in a smaller hotel room. The staff explained that the "North" hotel was older and therefore had larger rooms. For four people with two double beds, we were a little cramped. But no real complaints, just a little short on space.

This hotel was just off the main path around Times Square and was quiet and comfortable. The staff was excellent and offered several suggestions regarding dining, sites and directions. The subways and several restaurants were a short walk. Times square was just three blocks away and yet our area was quiet and a little less trafficked. We enjoyed the breakfast and location however the only drawback was the elevators which were a bit crowded and busier times of the day.

Our family of 7 stayed for one night - Saturday, 6 July. We booked 3 rooms. I would definitely come back and stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful with things to see and do in Times Square and 911 Memorial. Looking at the photos of the rooms, the rooms were actually better than expected. It was very clean and comfy. Even though the room space was a bit small, but it's a high rise building and in perfect location of Times Square. One small complaint, the elevator was very slow and small. There were only 2 elevators for a tall building which means a waiting line with everyone coming down for breakfast, checking-in and out. Coming in from Time Square around 1am, we felt pretty safe. We did find a parking spot down the street which saved us garage fee for parking a SUV. Besides the garage was closed. For NY garage parking, be expected to pay extra for an oversized vehicle (SUVs). But the hotel was in walking distance to Time Square 8th & 9th to 42nd street. Also, lots of shopping on 34th (midtown).

I love this property! Very good location. Due to the fact that there were 75 teenage girls staying that same night the hot water was severely taxes for the morning shower. Nothing the staff could have done. Really nice staff. The only thing I would ask for would be another elevator.

The lobby construction is complete. Just the art work needs to be approved and hung. Very clean and very busy. Our party of 3 was able to get a table every morning but the breakfast area is small so plan for an alternate some mornings you may have to wait. As said else where the rooms are small. 30th Floor views to the south are very good unlike the Conrad Hilton in Chicago where you may be looking at a wall. Pleasant staff willing to help. Elizabeth thank you for keeping my phone alive. Excellent location for Javits Center if you are going to the theater consider using the Hampton Inn Times Square North closer to the action. Good Italian and Irish Pub on the block,

We got back last night after a 5 day trip with our teenage grand daughters. The hotel was perfect for our needs, just a few blocks from Time Square, around the corner from 8th &9th st. lots of restaurants to choose from, felt like a safe neighborhood,& easy to catch of cab from. Our room had 2 double beds, 3 large suitcases fit too,was tight but we managed to get ready & out the door everyday ok. Rooms always felt clean plenty of linens, room was very quiet from street noise, air conditioner was on a little noisy, but worked well. It was nice having breakfast available, girls didn't always make the 10am cutoff (they're teenagers)10:30 would have been better. I liked having coffee in the room, not many hotels provide that. Staff was always helpful with directions, restaurants, general info. with very friendly attitudes. We would stay here again for sure!

We stayed at Hampton Inn South and it was a great stay. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and up to date. The breakfast was awesome, with lots of different options hot and cold and tasted terrific. There was always hot coffee and tea available. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. They went out of their way to get us what we needed. We were close to everything, Times Square, shopping, Starbucks etc. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to go to New York City.

This property is definitely for those who just need a bed and not too much time in your room. It is located in the garment district.Breakfast was great, and the breakfast staff very helpful, and busy at the *8:45-9:30 - quite crowded. Plan accordingly. We used the concierge and bellman at the next door hotel for coordinating taxis, limo, and show tickets.We had 6 rooms for our family trip and had 2 full size beds. Wish I could have had the king, but ah well next time.

Very nice hotel and stayed for 5 nights on our 1st trip to NYC. The room was a sufficient size, clean and fresh. The bathroom was very nice too. There are only 6 rooms to each floor and we were next to the lift, but did not get any disturbance from other guests. Breakfast was included in the price and there was plenty of choice. Tea and coffee were available all day, if required. We found the location of the hotel very good and did plenty of walking. The staff were very friendly and helpful and were always there if needed. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

We enjoyed our trip to NYC and were on the run 100% of the time. Our room was tiny, compared to others around the country, but I completely understand that space in NYC is not something that is come by easily. That being said, the bathroom was small but very comfortable and up to date. Overall, this was a nice hotel and the staff was very eager to help.

I just came back from a two night stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square South, whilst attending an expo at the Javits Center.As a regular guest at Hampton Inns on road trips, I knew generally what to expect from the place, with some added NYC realities. Firstly, the hotel is clean, the staf are very welcoming and the place feels modern and unpretentious. The whole building is quite narrow and sits right next to two other hotels on 39th Street (between 8th and 9th Avenues). There are only I think five or six rooms per floor, which makes it relatively quiet and does not have that stuffy feeling with alot of NYC hotels. The elevators were fast, but there was alot of waiting around at some of the busier times.I was traveling alone and had a king room with a view, although the view was a bit crappy really (could only see the top ten feet of the Empire State Building and a glimse of the Hudson River in the distance - I was on the 20th floor.). Although the room was much smaller than Hampton Inns found in many other areas of the country, they did make great use of the space available and I did not feel cramped in any way. The room was spotless, the water pressure was great (FYI no bath, just a nice shower). I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and this compares favourably to most. The majority of NYC hotels have small rooms, even at the top end, but this is no different in London, Paris etc. where space is at a huge premium. This hotel had a reasonably sized room whihc was perfect for one, would be OK for two, but not so sure for a larger family. The breakfast area in the morning was very busy, but I found a place to sit each time, no problem. The food was standard Hampton Inn, with a relatively good selection and was kept topped up throughout the service. The hotel was well located for me, being only a ten to fifteen minute walk to the Javits Center. It is also the same to Times Square proper and Penn Station. Overall a good location in the area of Hell's Kitchen.There is an excellent Irish pub one minute from the hotel (Tir Na Nog) which has great staff and good food.The staff were friendly throughout my stay and helped to arrange a private car to the airport for a reasonable rate and they also store luggage downstairs.Finally, and I cannot stress this enough, the free WiFi internet was excellent. This is a major problem across many hotels that offer the service for free with horrible connection speeds, but this hotel came up trumps - thank you!!!Overall, a very good stay and I would definately stay here again.

We took a group of high school seniors to New York for their senior trip & stayed at the Hampton Inn - Times Square South. It was a terrific location for all our planned events.
