It's only a block from the Times Square subway station, the breakfast was much more substantial than I had ever expected & the staff was very friendly.

The staff made it a pleasure to stay in NYC. They are extremely helpful and resourceful. Always with a smile and knew where to send us, making sure we took the right trains and recommending places plus giving us tips on what to do and not do in NYC.

We stayed for 7 nights in room with city views. This was on 24th floor and considering the views would prefer a quicker journey in lift or easy walk down the stairs and should I return would request lower level. Overall experience is pleasant one and would return to hotel.First thing first is need to know that blocks are not very big and only take couple of minutes. The hotel is located a block from Port Authority (where take bus to Woodbury Commons so not far to carry purchases) with a subway next to it and water taxi piers to the back. It is also a couple of blocks from Time Square and also all the shows. My husband and I walked to the overhead garden park A few blocks away, then made our way to downtown through Greenwich, Little Italy, Chinatown..tired at the end but worth it.The hotel is compact with 32 floors but only 5 or 6 rooms per floor. Rooms are not overly large mostly when trying to squeeze an ironing board in there But are clean and fresh. There are only 2 lifts used by guests and staff so depending on the time it can be long wait. There is complimentary breakfast which was plentiful for us but may not be if you are the type of person who expects buffet hot food variety as usually 1 egg dish (omelets or funny looking scrambled), bacon, sausages, oatmeal. There is juices, yoghurts, cereals, plenty varieties of bagels, bread, Croissants, Cup cakes, English muffins and you can make your own waffles. Once again breakfast area Is compact so gets cramped in serving area if people don't move out of the way whilst waiting for toaster or waffles and same goes for tables, Can be hard to find one if there at wrong time so some guests take tray back to room.There is 24 hour free coffee, Tea and hot chocolate with cookies in afternoon if you get there at right time. Staff are all friendly and accommodating HOWEVER I wish we had been told at start that there is free access to laundry room at hotel next door. Machine and dryers are free just need to buy powder. As it is we spent $20 getting laundry done at cleaners on the corner before we made use of laundry next door.

We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square for our first visit to NYC. All staff was pleasant and helpful. We arrived hours before check in and our luggage was tagged and stored and we were given directions. Every afternoon upon arrival we were greeted with a smile and warm cookies. The room was very comfortable with a spectacular view (we were on the 26th floor). The rooms are small, but that's NYC.The breakfast area was clean and neat and the food was plentiful and delicious. The location was great--we were able to walk to Times Square, restaurants, the theatre, the Circle Boat Ride, Macys and the Empire State Building. The subway station was also convenient We would highly recommend this hotel -great experience.

Just came back for a 6 night stay with four girl, had a great time, hotel nice clean staff friendley brekky was plenty :)) close to time square, done helicopter ride price was over the top but glade we done it, I would defo recommend this hotel :)))

I don't often come on and put my comments but I just had to this time. This was probably the best stay in a hotel I have ever had. The staff were so accommodating (holding our luggage while we wandered through New York City), friendly, clean, neat. Breakfast was fantastic with lots of options & always clean & filled. They even walked around and offered us a complimentary bottle of water to take with us. The rooms, as with all Hampton Inns, were modern, super clean and comfortable. This hotel was centrally located to everything. It was easy to walk to all major attractions. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel!

I organized a bachelorette party for 8 girls in NYC and we stayed at this Hampton Inn in several different rooms. It is a fairly basic hotel, but it was perfect for our group. The location was perfect for getting in/around Manhattan, the free breakfast was good and the hotel staff were very helpful at check in and if we ever needed anything (putting us all on the same floor, which was very convenient). I would definitely stay here again.

Wonderful service. Great home away from home in the city. Great front staff. Very clean rooms. Good housekeeping. Good sized rooms for the city. The breakfast is a good way to start the day. Great cookies at night. Nice foyer to hang out. Wonderful view from our room 3105. Fast elevators. Would stay here again

Stayed at this hotel last week during our visit of New York City. The staff were amazing, very helpful, and courteous. The room was typical size for NYC but extremely clean and fresh. Times Square location is excellent. Hotel was finishing some remolding of the lobby which should be done by now so done fret over reviews that we complaining of being inconvienced in the lobby area. The free breakfast was great with many choices. I highly recommend this hotel for a stay near Times Square.

This hotel has a great location, just a couple of blocks from the subway and Times Square. We purchased a tour bus ticket for two days and were able to hop off and walk all over Manhattan. Our room was exceptionally clean and comfortable.

We were most impressed with the Hampton Inn, the hotel was conveniently located within walking distance to many of the famous attractions in NY, Time Square, Central Park, Rockerfella Centre and the famous shopping on 5th and Madison Avenues. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The self service coffee and hot chocolate behind the foyer was very welcome when returning from a busy day exploring the city. We enjoyed being able to grab a bite of breakfast to start the day in the breakfast room. Would recommend Hampton Inn to other travellers wanting a nice clean hotel to stay in NY.

We stayed for two nights whilst passing through NY on our way up to Canada. The hotel is very well located for mid-town Manhattan being close to the subway and walking distance to plenty of tourist attractions. We had a city view room that turned out to be on the top floor. We had a lovely view of a lot of the mid-town building and the Hudson. The room seemed a little dated but was clean and comfortable.Breakfast was quite reasonable although I can imagine the breakfast room getting very crowded when the hotel is busy. We were up early both days so this was not a problem for us. The hotel staff were very friendly and quick to sort us out when we arrived and when we left.

We very much enjoyed our stay at the HI. Evangeline at the front desk was amazing. Great recommendation for food and sites. The rest of the front staff was ok. The room was quite large for NYC standards with a great view and super clean. Breakfast and cookies are meet the HI standards. The location is quite central in many ways. Walk to Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, Empire State Building, MOMA, and Central Park easily. For everything else, the subway was less than a block away. An excellent value.

This is a big hotel, comfortable rooms with good size. Location is perfect , very close to Central Park and easy walk for all New York spots. I went walk for all places I want. Subway is 50 meters.Breakfast is reasonable, little confuse as a lot people at same time, but fine for a few days. There is shops close to the hotel and Times Square.

had two city view rooms on adjacent floors..Empire state & hudson river views. Stayed 4 nights, loved the breakfasts - especially make your own waffles :)What an amazing trip. Definitely planning to come back & for the price can't imagine a better hotel or location!

For the second time we stayed at this hotel, for 6 days and just like 2 years ago, we liked it very much.The breakfast is excellent, they keep a place open 24hs with coffee, chocolate and tea.It is near to quite everything, specially if you like to walk.We don´t like to stay right near to Times Square, because it is Always very crowded.The people who wokk there are nice, friendly and helpful.The rooms with double queen beds are small, with a small bathroom and as a suggestion, they should just change the 2 beds for twin bed.The room would be much bigger.But we don´t stay much in the room, so...

Only 2 elevators and no service elevator caused a very frustrating experience and every guest was complaining. Close to check out time it was worse than a subway station at commuter time. Breakfast was ok but on plastic plates and cutlery - not a luxury touch!

I stayed here for 5 nights in the Spring . It was a very busy place with a number of tour groups and busing coming and going. Here are some items I really liked:1. The free breakfast was really good 2. The had laundry facilities in the hotel3. the location was close to the 42nd street subway station4. the staff were friendly and helpfulA few warnings:1. the evaluators were brutally slow2. the lobby is small with no place to sitOverall I would stay here again.

I just left this hotel and it is not only in a dark street with almost no lighting, the staff is not that friendly. Rooms don't get clean at all. Bath shower was disgusting with mold, hairs, and, other dirt that you don't even want to know where it came from. One of the days I left the AC off and when I got back, the room smelled really bad. It is almost in the corner of the 9th Ave and the rooms are extremely noisy. Staff even denied a bottle of water because it was only for HH members, but they give them away with breakfast! If you really need to stay at a Hampton Inn go to the one that is at 35th street.

I like staying at Hampton Inn's. this one at Time Square south provided a wonderful experience. The entire staff is helpful and friendly. The front desk supervisor "Chris" really went over the top to take care of our needs. I highly recommend this property and will stay here again when I find myself in New York.

I have always stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square North when I come to NYC for my trade convention and LOVED the hotel, the staff, and the neighborhood as I have in all the Hilton system properties. This hotel is an exception. I know that they were fixing, but the entrance/lobby leave a lot to be desired, but MOST IMPORTANT is that I did not feel safr in the neighborhood and as a single woman, someone should have told me. There were many other properties, I've stayed at the Hampton near Penn Center, which has a store frint, but I felt comfortable and safe.

The customer-focused staff made our stay special. From Brittany who upgraded our room when she learned this was a birthday surprise trip to Jennifer and the other desk clerk on staff on 6/1 who assisted us with printing out tickets, all our needs were met graciously. At breakfast, the staff handed out water bottles, fruit, and mints to take with while touring the sights. Our room on the 24th floor was quiet and had a view of the river. No problem with the air conditioner even though there was a heat wave outside. We never had a long wait at the elevator like in other hotels. The shared concierge staff at the Holiday Inn Express were extremely helpful. The rooms are small, but clean. Restaurant Row, Times Square, theater district, Hell's Kitchen are close by as is Port Authority (with all the freaks) and the subway.

We love Hampton Inn Hotels, and this by far exceeds many that we have stayed in with the fantastic staff you have. Jennifer, Chris, and Brittany at the front desk were amazing! Not only friendly, but they were so helpful with one of our guests who had a motorized scooter. They went out of their way to help accommodate our group and I can say that they definitely helped make our trip to NYC the amazing trip it was! Thank you so much and best of luck to you Jennifer when your baby gets here! What a lucky baby!

All the staff gave us excellent service. Rooms and bathrooms were clean. Great breakfast variety every morning. Helpful staff. Great location. Walking distance to the middle of Timesquare, 34th street shopping meca and subway stations. Love it.

What we loved most about this hotel was the location, quiet but within walking distance of Times Square and the subway. The rooms with kingbed are clean and well decorated but small. The complimentary breakfast is good, with eggs and waffles.During our stay there was also al large group of teenagers, which was very disturbing because the noice they made kept us awake. The hotel only has 2 small elevators that were always occupied when the group was around. They shouldn't mix those large groups with families staying.

We stayed here with two children for 1 week during April, it is in a great location with the subway not too far away. The reception staff here are fantastic, they are very helpful, we were also here during my wife's birthday and they really went the extra mile to make it a memorable stay for her and giving her a nice surprise :))))) The restaurant was closed for construction work and the buffet breakfast was not available during our stay, instead they delivered a crossiant and yogurt with fruit to the room and there is a little congestion on the lifts during busy periods but overall I would have to say we were more than happy with our stay and would use this hotel again, I would recommend this hotel for the money,Thanks again to the reception staff, you made our visit very pleasant

King bed comfortable - took up whole room. Air conditioner could not be regulated - hot air or very cold always blowing in your face due to small room. Neighborhood uncomfortable, especially at night. Nice full breakfast included daily. Clean, comfortable only to sleep - no room to relax. Very disappointing - would not return.

The redeeming feature of this venue is its location: A short walk from the Times Square subway station and past the Port Authority bus terminal we come upon it which has a very small footprint. Our room on the 11the floor with a king bed was cramped but was just fine considering that it's Manhattan. There are 6 rooms on each floor of this 32-floor hotel. The room has a wardrobe in which also resides a room safe, a chest of drawers, a desk and chair but it is a snug fit. The flat screen TV has all the necessary channels. The bed sheets were fine and so were the soft and hard pillows for each person. Nice! The bed is just so but the duvet was welcome on a chilly night in May. The furniture and carpet appeared to be in fine shape and very clean. The bathroom is small with a walk-in shower. The toiletries are standard issue Hampton Inn. We were awakened by noisy teenagers (must have been a high school field trip) chatting loudly in the hallway. We could even hear them through the walls. Not a nice night.Breakfast in the morning was held downstairs and the offerings are again standard issue Hampton Inn but I really liked the bagels. Bottom line: at $280 including tax this may not be a bargain deal but the location is its saving grace. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

I've beneficio in USA some times and don't remember being treated so well as this hotel. The hotel staff is always ready to help and receiving you with a smile. It's very well located in Manhattan,with clean rooms and facilities.I recommend this hotel for all Trip Advisor customers.

Great location - couple blocks from some wonderful restaurants and from Times Square. Chris at the front desk was absolutely helpful and gave great recommendations during our stay (May 2013). Clean, modern rooms, hot breakfast. The room was smaller than I anticipated, but for the price was more than needed. Would definitely recommend to friends and family in the future. Since I had a flight later in the day, I also appreciated that I could leave my bag at the front desk (after I checked out). That was a great perk. Renovations were happening within the hotel, but only to the main part of the lobby while I was there.

I stayed at the Hampton Inn recently while travelling on business. I wanted to write a review because it seems they have had some negative press because of renovations in the lobby. I found that it did not interfere with our enjoyment of the hotel at all. The hotel staff are incredibly welcoming, the rooms were simple, but clean, and very quiet. The best part is the free breakfast included in the price of the room. I can't say enough about the very generous buffet style breakfast!... belgian waffles, fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereal, a full hot breakfast that changed daily, it was endless. The hotel is well located, a 5 minute walk to Penn Station, walking distance to The Central Library, and Theatre district, there's a computer room, gym, excellent amenities for a 'standard' hotel. And keep in mind, this is indeed a standard hotel, not the Ritz, but very comfortable.

This was my 1st trip to NYC & i went with my dad & sister they had been 5 times before so they were looking forward to showing me all the sights & sounds of this fab city ! When we arrived there was building work going on which my sister had not been told about, so it was fare enough as we were up on the 27th floor & there was no noise. The 1st night i went to get into bed & pulled back the duvet cover & there was blood stains/fresh blood (not sure which) on the underside of the duvet, we rang down to the front desk & somebody did come up & they changed it straight away & were very sorry, but on a whole the house keeping wasnt very good as there was 1 day we didnt get fresh towels or our beds made as house keeping didnt come round till 4.30 in the afternoon which was a bit late in the day to be sorting bedding etc out.Thats the negative side of the hotel....The positive side is the breakfast was excellent the staff were very helpful & there's a young man called Nelson who works at the hotel who was very helpful & chatty & the young man who worked in the breakfast room giving out mints as you went out the door was lovely also & the kitchen staff were very helpful as well.There's tea & coffee 24/7 in the lobby & from 4pm till 7pm there's fresh cookies which are to die for but we only managed to get them on 2 nights as they had gone by the time we got there the other 2 nights. So on a whole the hotel staff are fab but the house keeping needs to be sorted ASAP. (My dad did get a refund for 1 nights stay because of the house keeping). The hotel location is great for Times Square & the buses etc.

My daughter and I stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square and were very impressed with the location, cleanliness, and most of all the attentive and courteous staff. The hotel is located convenient to Penn station, the Port Authority, Times Square and the Garment District. We had an early train and arrived at 7am. Of course, our room wasn't ready, however, we were invited to relax and enjoy complimentary breakfast and it was delicious. Our luggage was safely stored while we went out into the city. A remodel is nearing completion and the room and bathroom are small in true NY fashion, but nicely done. Duvets were freshly washed. There is a little wait for the elevator, but that is a small inconvenience considering everything else. We would certainly return!

We went to Hampton Inn in may 2013 during our honeymoon. During this week there were some men at work who restructured the common area (breakfast room, hall.. ) into the hotel but there was not noise in the early hours (during the day we were out to visit the city) and the employees were sorry for the inconvenience, they were very kind with the guests.The room was very nice even if it was so small but adequate for a couple. The position is wonderful: we never took public transport!I suggest this hotel to visit NYC for the good position/price/services.

Location was awesome and the breakfast pretty good, but crowded. You have to be there early and elbow everybody to get your waffle in the waffle maker and the seating are is limited so you have to wait to seat.Everything was good till the last day, the Sunday when we ere checking out. Main desk employees were nice but too busy to even ask my questions and inquires for transportation to the airport when checking out. In particular there was one employee who was not busy at the front desk, who keep on wondering around doing nothing. I approached him and he didn't wanted to help me with the transportation inquire, he was rude to me and very ugly. after everybody stop and stared at us talking, nobody approached me later to help me. We had to sit outside the hotel and try to figure it out looking on our phones and rush to get the bus at Central station.... That was extremely unkind on their side!!!

Yes the lobby was being renovated and that wasn't mentioned anywhere. But you don't really use your time in the hotel lobby when you are in NYC. The staff was really nice and the rooms were clean and great! Breakfast was included, which was fantastic! Great location!I would definitely stay here again!

Good and clean hotel with a good location for exploring NYC. Close to several transport links, and with a good number of sights in walking distance, the hotel served us well for our week-long stay. As other reviewers have mentioned, the breakfast area is a bit crowded at times. The complimentary breakfast is no gourmet experience, but a good option when you don't want to spend time going to a breakfast place. Helpful staff and knowledgable concierge makes the hotel a good option in midtown.

I felt that I was I a building site when I first walked in. The reception area was being ripped out and renovated. This was never mentioned during booking - a little unfair. The room was rather dull and cramped but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. There was no fridge but there was an ice machine. The location is very good and the staff pleasant. I probably wouldn't go back as there were other hotels in the same area offering bigger more modern rooms for comparable prices.

The lobby is tiny, renovation work was being done without proper planning for the many guest going throught that small area. The elevator system and size needs to be greatly increased. It took almost 10 minutes to get to the ground floor since no one could get on the elevator which stopped at every floor.

Lobby construction made for crowding to and from elevators. Hair dryer in our room burned out on first use. Fortunately we had two rooms.Front desk was quick to have it replaced.This is a very narrow hotel 6 rooms on floor and only two elevators available,extremely long wait to get downstairs in the morning, over 30 minutes.

Totally surprised by the hot breakfast which included Belgian waffles. A great experience over all. My husband and I were in NY taking in shows and having dinner with friends to celebrate our anniversary and wanted a nice clean space to crash in Manhattan. We found street parking easily and found the hotel nicely appointed and very clean.

Hotel Rooms in Times Square are small, know that, going in. The room was small, but clean, and had an updated decor and spacious shower. The breakfast area was being renovated so each evening we filled out a menu form for breakfast which was delivered to our room the next morning, which we LOVED! The front desk personnel were very friendly, professional and helpful every time we needed advice or a car service called. They treated us like friends which can be rare in NYC. The coffee and tea station in lobby was delicious. I would recommend this for anyone visiting NYC. It is a short walk from the crazy busy hub of Times Square which I actually enjoy because the noise and clammer can be difficult to shake, when I need peace and quite to rest and wind down. The only down side is at certain times the elevator was so busy there was a line in the lobby. I would book again any day!

This is the third Hampton Inn in Manhattan at which I've stayed. I liked the other two, but not this one. My original room had a musty smell, the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor, and I was kept up by constant street noise. Staff, who were uniformly nice and helpful, moved me to a better room, which was an improvement, but then there was construction in the breakfast room, the message light on the phone malfunctioned, the elevators were very slow (the second room was on a higher floor), and one night only one of the two elevators was working. The noise and the musty smell in the original room I consider serious. The rest were annoyances, but there were so many of them, I wouldn't stay here again despite the staff (who were excellent).Room hint: the floors are very small with just six rooms to a floor. If you don't want to be near an elevator or near the street front, the only room you want is one ending in 03.

fix the elevators, redo breakfast area and it would rate much higher. Staff great. Breakfast delivery clumsy and awkward. Bunch of kids stayed at hotel jamming elevators. work out area small. budget hotel but nice bed, clean room, and in good location. not in time square, but close and close to javitz center.

My boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights. The experience was great. Small room, but thats NYC baby! Friendly staff,good price and fab location! They even brought the breakfast to the room. Highly reccomend!

I am a frequent business traveler to Manhattan and usually stay in the Times Square area because of the location. This was my first and last stay at this hotel. Small rooms, stained carpet, dirty bathroom floor, slow elevators, sub standard breakfast and the room required cleaning. I know hotel rooms are small in Manhattan but the rooms at this Hampton Inn were the size of a shoe box.

I enjoyed this hotel and the amenities that it has to offer. The free breakfast and cookies were a great addition to my stay. The customer service was really, really wonderful! Good Job. I felt really good when the gentleman at the front desk offered me a free bag of trailmix when I mentioned that I was hungry (and we'd just gotten off the plane). This hotel was clean, in a great location and right on time. I would stay here again without a doubt!

There is too little help available at the desk and with luggage which is held being located. Getting our stored bags took almost 30 minutes. The breakfast boxes we ordered (3) were all wrong. But they were on time! Staff failed to inform us that choices of continental breakfast were available in lobby.

...if you want to be right in the middle of it but no too close to busy and noisy streets. Only few minutes from Times Square and several other major attractions (Top of the Rock, Central Park, Empire State Building etc.) are close by. We stayed for 8 nights and besides some others guests who didn´t know how to behave, there was no reason for complaints at all! Staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast - the Hampton Inn usual, nothing fancy but sufficient! I´d recommend a room higher up and you´ll even get a glimpse of the Empire State Building. Will definitely choose this hotel again on our next trip to NYC!

We stayed in this hotel for two nights in July 2012. The hotel is in a great position: really close to Times Square and 1-2 blocks from A-C-E underground. Our room was tiny but functional and both the room and the bathroom were clean. We had some troubles with the air-conditioner, which wasn't easy to set. The hotel was very crowded (it was high season) and we had to wait for a long time to get the lift. Breakfast was included and with a good choice of food and beverages. The staff was very kind and helpful: we asked for a car to go to Newark Airport and they gave us a limousine!

I have stayed here on business several times over the last 4 years. Its location is walking distance to Javits and in the other direction, Times Square, Empire State and lots of other attractions. I find that the rooms in the back of the hotel are the quietist, no view of the city but I now prefer quiet to views since I am in the room to sleep basically. The staff here is always VERY welcoming and the front desk gives you the complete lowdown on check in. For my stay this time they were renovating the breakfast room but they provided breakfast order checklists to fill out the night before and they were VERY busy delivering breakfasts in the morning. The workout room is just adequate but better than nothing and everything was in working order.I am looking forward to staying here next year when I come to the city for trade shows at Javits!PS. I really like the new Irish pub just up the street!

We booked four rooms at this hotel several months ago and asked that they all be together. They were not together. Hotel is really small. They are renovating the restaurant area so we had to go to another hotel for breakfast each morning. The elevators worked about half of the time. Most of the staff was nice, however, I did have one staff who told me and my kids that we couldnt get on the elevator because he was delivering food. I will never stay there again.

We had a great stay stay... The staff (Brittany and a gentleman in glass at HHonors desk) was OUTSTANDING... Rooms small but served its purpose. Breakfast was delivered as they are renovating. Limits your choices but worked.... Thank you!!!

The Hampton Inn-Manhatten Times Square - South is in a perfect locationonly 2-blocks from Times Square. The front desk staff was very helpful ingiving suggestions to things to see, do and places to dine. The rooms werevery comfortable in size and the beds were very nice. I would definitely stayhere again

I don't usually bother with reviews but I wanted to on this occasion because the staff in the hotel were so friendly and helpful. We had a very thorough introduction when we arrived and lots of useful advice when needed. The breakfast was really good in setting us up for the day an it represented excellent value with my wife and 2 children sharing a room. The location is quiet but in easy distance of the subway and many of the attractions. We even hired a car for the day from National which is only a block away. It's actually very convenient for escaping onto the New Jersey turnpike via the Midtown Tunnel. We found the Hell's Kitchen area a bit daunting on the first night but you soon get used to the colourful vibe plus the restaurants are more reasonably priced than many parts of manhattan. If you get the chance, try the High Line walk, it's a really unique perspective on the city - and even better, it's free !

I personally enjoyed the city, but the extraordinary service was above and beyond. Brittany was extremely helpful with the check in process and also in suggesting the hotspots of the city. With her going above and beyond what I expected really helped to make my visit to the city much more pleasurable. Hotel is in a great location and would definitely consider returning here if available.

We were travelling with children and very much enjoyed staying at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. It is very central to all shopping streets and sightseeing locations. Very good value for your money. Hotel is clean and staff is very friendly and helpful. In particular Yesis, who made sure we had an excellent breakfast every morning. We will surely be coming back to this hotel.

I made sure to come back to this hotel because of the staff. I have no idea how they know and remember my name. They greeted me with sincere smiles as I came in and when I left for the day. The location is great. the rooms are NY small but there is enough room to accommodate the necessities. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast room is pleasant and bright.

I stayed at this location on April 12th and I must say I was not impressed. The lobby area has been updated however, that is the extent of the upgrades. Pros: Nice Staff, good locationCons: Small rooms, stained couch, slow elevators, old carpet, sub standard breakfast and the room required cleaning.I would not stay here again, nor would I recommend this hotel to family or friends.

I stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square mostly because I was traveling with my children and wanted to have the convenience of an early starting breakfast at the hotel. The room was lovely with an amazing view. The location is right near the E and C trains, which was incredibly convenient for getting around the city. We were within walking distance of many fun things. There were many breakfast items available, which was wonderful, and breakfast ran from 6-10 (I believe). This was very important given we had a 7am train to catch on our last day, and we still had time to grab some breakfast before we headed out.My only complaint was that the space for the breakfast (food in particular) was small and challenging to navigate with many people. The hotel posted signs letting you know that breakfast will be "boisterous" if you come late. We were not at the boisterous time but it still felt a bit too bustling in part because of the small space in which we were trying to get the food. Overall, this did not dampen our experience, and we would definitely stay here again!

We had a fantastic 5 days at this hotel, staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel very clean, beds very comfortable and plenty of hot water. The area where we were was in the heart of Mahattan, which was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, we will definitely be going back.

My daughter and I recently visited NYC for her 18th birthday during her Spring Break. We loved our stay at Hampton Inn Times Square South! Pros:The STAFF! Everyone who worked there was always pleasant and helpful. Especially Chris and Brittany at the front desk who were honestly one of the highlights of our trip! It was great to come in after a day/evening of touring to see their smiling faces. We had a great time chatting with them and we were very sad to say goodbye to them. We hope we have the chance to run into them again one day!The rooms were great. Very comfortable beds and pillows.The free breakfast was nice. They had a variety of breakfast items each day and they also had hot items such as eggs and sausages which varied from day to day. We took turns going down in the morning and brought our food back up to out rooms. They had trays available to do this.We somehow forgot to bring deodorant with us, and when we asked Chris if there was anywhere near by that we could buy some he gave us a couple of travel sized Lady Speed Sticks they had behind the counter. Apparently they have almost anything you can possibly forget to bring available "just in case". Free wireless Internet!Free warm cookies in the early evening!The subway was close and convenient and we had no problems catching a cab out front either.Cons:The elevators of course. We only had a couple long waits though so it wasn't too bad. The rest of the time it was fine. (and we were there when the hotel was sold out)The shower really was tiny. It was the smallest shower stall I've ever been in and that includes cruise ships!The lack of black out curtains as someone else mentioned. I thought it was strange, I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel that didn't have black out curtains. It wasn't the end of the world, but it is nice to sleep in on vacation. That's all I can think of for cons and none of those would keep me from coming back if/when we ever return to New York.As much as I like to try out different hotels when I return to cities I have already visited, I think I would have a hard time not returning to the Hampton Inn Times Square South!Please say hi to Chris and Brittany from "The Canadians"!Karen & Carly

This is my second stay at this hotel. The closeness to times square, the Port Authority around the corner to bring your loads of shopping back from Woodbury Common are only a few plus points for this hotel. The room was clean and good for two adults. The Price was also very reasonable. Learnt from past experiences to try to save money on a cheaper hotel. It was great to get back to the room at night, have a hot shower and a huge bed to sleep in. The breakfast was enormous. As much hot food as you could eat. A great start to the day. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Will stay there again and have recommended the hotel to my friends. You will not regret choosing this hotel.

I thought this property was in a prime location and close to all of the attractions you could want for a theater weekend. During my visit, I thought the property was well done and quite what I would expect of the Hampton name. I would recommend this property and consider it on a future visit.Free breakfast, quick access to Times Square, Broadway theaters, shopping, restaurants and public transportation.

My friend and I visited NYC to attend the NIT at Madison Square Garden. We thought it was a great location! Walked to Madison Square Garden and farther into Town Square, etc. Nice staff! Good continental breakfast. We had a great visit!

Rooms are very small but they are very clean, the elevators are very slow especially at check out times, they should have a maintenance elevator. The location is very walkable to most of the New York points of interest but the 39 th street is kind of alone to walk at nights so we took a taxi in the night. It is a good option for the price, the staff was always very eager to help, I lost my nook but they found it.

We had a great stay here, very friendly & welcoming - homemade cookies in the afternoon were to die for!!! Well located in the city centre, for restaurants, metro & sightseeing....rooms were a little on the small side. The breakfast had a good selection of cereals, cooked food & fresh fruit. Bakery items were a good choice, in fact something for everyone.

We went into New York to view a show at Radio City Music Hall, and stayed at the Hampton Inn Time Square South. Hatanachi Lugo was most helpful in room accommodations with my family and I, and was very knowledgeable about the area. She was kid friendly with my son and my friends son. If we had to rate her personally we would rate her ten out of ten stars, not to mention the whole staff was great! The hotel room was clean and comfortable for a New York City hotel. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Just right for restaurants and shops, felt very safe and reasonably near to subway. Every member of staff that we spoke too was friendly and welcoming. Comfortable room though small. Would definitely stay again.

I usually love Hampton properties, but this one didn't quite work for me. Too many little concerns kept me from giving it the 4 or 5 stars Hampton usually deserves. The value is pretty good for a midtown location--though probably a bit downtown from where you'd like to be. Very close to the Port Authority station which means you can get almost anywhere you'd like pretty efficiently. Rooms are small--but hey, it's NYC, what do you expect? Beds are Hampton great. Here's what bothered me. Our TV didn't work until the fourth day of our five night stay. Now I honestly don't care that much about TV, and we wouldn't have watched it for more than a combined 30 minutes over the course of our trip, but the fact that I reported it as broken, not once, but twice before it was fixed suggests that this operation isn't really on the ball with customer service. Another thing that baffled me was the absence of blackout curtains in the room. Finally, though I had arranged airport transportation with the bellman on the night before our departure (I watched him dutifully write our reservation in his book) it was clear at 3:30 a.m. when we were to head out that no one had bothered to call for the driver. The receptionist made the call that morning, and we waited nearly 1/2 hour for the driver to arrive. Not sure that I'd return to this Hampton.

The hotel's location is exceptional-within walking distance of many attractions and close to bus and subway lines. Unprepossessing from the outside, it is clean on the inside. A little crowded at the elevators and the room was small but the location made up for the minor inconveniences.

We used points, but this place is also a good value. Vy clean and spacious rooms and nice breakfast with real NY bagels! Downside is there isnt much "common space", only 2 elevators and and cramped ( but NOT in the rooms) like an old city hotel, which it is, but with nice modern conveniences. Staff is helpful, but they are still New Yorkers..... Location is terrific. We saw Wicked, which was only a half block away. Stay here..

We have stayed here before and it's always nice. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate your needs and it's always quiet. The rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are comfortable. I've booked through priceline twice and spent less than $115 each time before taxes. Excellent price for NYC!!

This hotel was conveniently close to Times Square. The hotel was clean and the free breakfast was a nice way to start the day. It's a great location when spending a few days in Manhattan. There are many places to visit within walking distance and you can always get on the subway to further explore the area.

Great hotel, good location, near the New York port authority and Times Square subway station.You can walk to Times Square from this Hotel it is a number of blocks but is manageable.Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast in the morning, better than typical Hampton Inn breakfast, had the usual make your own waffles, each morning had either scrambled eggs or cheese omlets, also had breakfast sausage and fried potatoes. Bagels were fabulous. They aslo had freshly made oatmeal with choice of dried fruit or nuts to add. They had coffee and hot water available all day.Rooms were compact but very nice. The Room had two comfortable double beds, dresser, and small closet (cabinet). Bathroom is also compact, shower was nice but european in scale not typical american size, but it works.I would stay here again.

When the school travel agent booked us at the Hampton Inn TSQ South, I wasn't sure it was going to suit our needs. I was traveling with a group of high school students from San Francisco for a publications conference at Columbia University and we arrived at the hotel after taking a red eye at 7am. We were tired, excited, punchy and bleary-eyed. We knew we would probably have to store our bags and then go to our conference. But after a short wait, our superhero guest service agent, Hatanachi Lugo found us rooms so we were able to check in right away. Getting the 11 teens into their rooms after flying all night was a miracle. On top of it we also had breakfast. It turned out this intimate hotel with only 6 rooms per floor worked out perfectly. It was safe for my students (which made me happy). The staff were all very nice (from housekeeping to the people in the dining room) and the location was excellent (that was great for the teens). The rooms were very clean (great for everyone). The Wi-Fi also worked well . The only drawback of this hotel is the elevators can take too long when things are busy. I would highly recommend the Hampton Inn Times Square South to families, students, etc. for its location, cleanliness, safety and excellent staff.

Hotel is spotless and check in was fast. Room on the small side but have two double beds in. The free breakfast was plentiful and lots of choice. We have only stayed one night but are going on a cruise today and have booked to come back here straight after for another 5 nights, looking forward to our return stay!

We arrived before 3pm & our room wasnt ready,no problem though,Chris at reception gave us 10% discount cards for Tir na nOg Irish Bar a few doors down from Hotel,positive 1st impression of staff & this continued for our entire stay. Rooms were cleaned every day & the breakfast was excellent,our room was on the 7th floor next to the lift but we had an uninterrupted sleep every night,long wait for lifts but this is to be expected at breakfast/checkout times,the location is perfect for exploring New York City & on your return after a long day if you're lucky you get a friendly welcome back from Luis the legend at the front desk! Would definately return to this hotel,the welcome & the attendance from staff was more than excellent.

I was in town for business and chose this hotel. The price, for NYC, was reasonable, the location, only 12 blocks from my event, was perfect and it was within walking distance of both Times Square and Penn Station. The rooms were of average size for a NYC hotel, very clean, and very comfortable. We felt safe on the streets, being located on the edge of both Hell's Kitchen and Time Square there are a ton of entertainment options that we enjoyed. I would definitely stay here again.

We arrived at the hotel early and it was no problem to check-in early which we really appreciated. There was a good variety of breakfast items, although it was hard to find a place to sit- very crowded. The elevators are slow in the morning during breakfast/checkout, but it's not too long of a wait- maybe 5-10 minutes. Other times during the day getting an elevator is no problem.Our room on the 28th floor was very quiet and clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable.All in all a pleasant stay! I would stay here again!

small rooms but excellent location staff is really great; good breakfasthow many selections to choose from. Convenient 2 major attractions so close to Broadway and major shows. parking is easy loved the convenience. everyone is so friendly.

We found the staff very welcoming and friendly. Times Square is about a 10 minute walk away. There where plenty of restaurants close by. We lucked out and got a room on the top floor overlooking Manhatten. The room was smaller but i am sure that this is the norm for New York. We did not feel cramped at all in the room. Found the room to be very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Never had a problem with waiting for an elevator as some people have complained in the past. The breakfast had a wide variery of selections. We would stay here again for sure.

I have traveled extensively, but I have never seen such a friendly staff. To a person--bellmen, receptionist, housekeepers, food service, etc.--were exceptionally helpful. There were a lot of foreign patrons and they bent over backwards to provide superior service. Many large groups arrived at once, demanding a great deal of attention. The receptionists continued to apologize for not immediately servicing us, but they really did not keep us waiting long. This hotel is very near the Port Authority. It is an easy walk (about four blocks) to Time Square and most of the places we wanted to go.

Stayed here with my 2 boys age 9 and 12 in February half term. A regular to NY I needed somewhere affordable, clean and central. On arrival we were welcomed by the receptionist and given a high floor room. There was free tea, coffee and hot chocolate available on the ground floor. The room itself was very small but clean and comfortable. There was a coffee maker and iron in the room. The tv had a good selection of channels and beds were comfortable. We had breakfast included. There were waffles, bagels, bread and pastries. There was also cereal, yogurts, scrambled eggs, potatoes and sausages. It was a good quality breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to others. For the price you pay, it's very reasonable. The location is one block from the subway and its definitely worth considering.

Recent visit for business; nice clean hotel for a great price. Room is on the small side but not bad for NYC. Very comfy bed. Bathroom was very nice and the shower had the best water pressure I've ever encountered in a hotel... anywhere! Not only that, the bathroom has a vent fan! One detraction: the safety grab bar is positioned in exactly the worst place possible; makes it very hard to use the shower.Breakfast is adaquate but it is complimentary, as is wifi (and the wifi works!).All in all a good choice if you want to stay in this part of town.

This hotel was great, especially for our first visit. Great location for walking to Times Square, subway, restaurants. Staff could not had been more helpful in arranging theater tickets, transportation, restaurant recommendations, deliveries, toiletries,etc. Free breakfast was hot and delicious. Free wifi was fast and dependable.

For a small hotel in a less than perfect block in New York, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a clean, full service facility for a great price! Great front desk staff & very friendly & knowledgable Conciege. The rooms are extremely clean & new. The free coffee bar was a nice place to hang out & relax after a busy day in the city. Great location if you're planning on seeing a show. The block is a little dingy but new fantastic Irish pub just opened a few doors down. My only complaint was we had to wait long for our valet parked vehicle but bell staff warned us in advance. Will definitely go back!

In the middle of Hell's Kitchen, staff is friendly and accommodating. Quiet street close to Times Square, good restaurants. Easy cab ride from midtown business district and worth being away from the hubbub for a $7 cab ride.Hotel is clean, quiet with fast elevators and good breakfast. Staff is very nice and eager to serve. Will definitely return on future business trips.

the hotel was very clean, staff very helpful room very nice although a little small, clean bedding and towels daily. breakfast was included it was a little basic and didnt like the plastic plates and cutlery. had jet lag the 1st night there so was up at 4am coffee etc available all day and night. there was quite a lot of construction going on in the same street so a little noisy in the morning. excellent location walking distance to all major attractions

We stayed here for 3 days before going to Isreal. We were treated well. Breakfast was very good and the people that served breakfast worked hard to keep the food replenished. The elevators are fast but in high demand. We did have someone smoking near our room the entire weekend. We complained and they sprayed febreeze to get rid of the smell. It worked some but they did not throw the perps out for smoking in a non-smoking area.

Small room with minimal amenities. Location is convenient for Javits Center. Hotel has about 5 or 6 rooms on each floor. It takes time for the elevator so be prepared to take the stairs. A nice breakfast is included, but in order to get a table you must be a vulture during the rush hour.

My family and I have just returned from Manhattan. We have 2 teenagers. The Hampton Inn was brilliant, the rooms had plenty of space, clean and quite modern. The staff were really polite and helpful, I cannot fault it. The hotel has wifi and computers in the lobby with printing facilities, I also noticed a sign which said they had iPads available! The best thing however were the free breakfasts, my kids took great delight in making their own (huge) waffles, and then smothering them in maple syrup. There was a large choice and although not top hotel standard, there was something for everyone, bagels,muffins cereal, yogurt, fruit porridge etc. they also have free tea,coffee and hot chocolate at all times in the lobby, great in the cold February weather. Some days their were even free cookies! You could also take a bag out with you in the morning with water, apple and a muffin! Amazing! The location is great, very near Times Square, and theatre district, and the subway round the corner. Very near to Ellen's Stardust diner (check it out). We also walked to several good restaurants nearby. Opposite is an authentic Diner and A Mexican takeaway. The only problem we had was a blocked loo a couple of times which they fixed straight away. This hotel will save you time and money in the mornings, I cannot recommend it enough. Your in New York to go out, not stay in your hotel, but we always looked forward to going back there.

I went with a group of friends for a fun-filled weekend. I secured a great rate early on...some in our party got a higher rate booking later on so their value perception was a little different than mine. Positives: - Location was central to our needs (dining, sightseeing, partying, shopping). Easy to get to Subway, groceries, quick food, etc. -Modern rooms. -Friendly helpful staff. (Evangeline was exceptional) Concierge availability and help was consistent for all 3 I spoke to. Front desk staff very courteous and accommodating. Easy check-in and check out. -Breakfast is a solid feature! - Gym was small but had what I needed...was empty. -Quiet. Negatives: Small rooms, small bathrooms, 2 elevators. All of these I already knew to expect by reading previous reviews so I had no problem with it.Overall great experience. I would stay there again if traveling with no more than 1 other person.

The hotel and the rooms themselves are pretty average. The elevator is slow as others have pointed out. The rooms are clean, and the complementary breakfast is pretty standard (bad) for hotel chains.But I'm giving it a four for the following reasons. Every interaction I had with the staff and management was fantastic, the location was good for what we had planned on the trip, and the price is good value for the money for a midtown hotel. We wren't looking for a fancy hotel because we weren't going to spend any time in it anyway.

I stayed at the Hampton on Business in December (when New York hotels are sky high) and found it to be the best hotel in the area in the price range I wanted. The rooms were large and clean. There was free wifi and free fruit and hot beverages. The best part was the location. I walked to Times Square and enjoyed the sights around midnight! There was a great police presence and I felt safe doing so. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We booked this Hotel for a 5 day break from 15th to 20th February as we had stayed previously at Hampton Inn Times Square North and knew the standard of the Hotel suited our needs. Check in was quick and efficient and room was ready even though we arrived before check in time. The room was immaculately clean and the bed sheets changed each day. The beds as always so comfy and the bathroom had plenty of fluffy towels and a great shower. Situation of Hotel was perfect for us, 10 minutes to Times Square and 2 minutes to Port Authority Bus Terminal. We needed extra pillows and they were delivered in minutes. The complimentary breakfast was great ( although not everyone likes to eat off plastic plates and cutlery or sit in a busy area).The staff in the dining area were always very pleasant and quick to replenish items. Although the brakfast area was always busy no matter what time we arrived, we always found a seat and got plenty to set us up for the day. The kids loved making their own waffles..In a city that is so expensive, not having to pay for breakfast meant more money for shopping!!! There were also complimentary freshly baked cookies which were available around 4 each day and free tea, coffee and hot chocolate all day. After sight seeing in -10 degrees this was much appreciated. All in all the Hotel was as expected and a great value Hotel for Central Manhattan. Keep up the good work Hampton Inn

Staff courteous and friendly, facility clean, breakfast adequate, fitness center has too few pieces of workout equipment in it, Building has too few elevators to serve too many floors. Rooms quiet. The engineer showed up within 10 minutes when I reported the thermostat wasn't working properly. Changed batteries, solved problem.

It was our first trip to NYC and the hotel made it an excellent visit. We stayed two nights and the room was clean, the fitness area was good and not crowded and there is a lovely sandwich/bagel/coffee shop next door when we were too tired to go out. Thank you.

I booked this hotel by bidding $110 a night for a 2.5 star via Priceline. Even though I got a great price I felt like my hotel stay could have been better. The staff was friendly and very helpful upon check in and most of the stay...they were definitely the highlight of my hotel stay. My main issue with the hotel was the very slow and busy two elevators. This had to be my worse experience ever when it comes to the amount of time we spent waiting for the elevator to arrive. Oh, and when the elevator finally arrive hopefully there was some space for us to get on it, otherwise we had to start the waiting process all over. A crossword puzzle would have been handy for the time spent waiting. My second issue was the shower. Who designed this? What for and why? If you are under 6 feet, no worries you will be fine. However, if you are taller, you have to duck under the shower doors before entering and exiting the shower. Oh and yes I hit my head on this major safety hazard and design flaw. I should have showered in a hardhat.The hotel was very clean and the room size was pretty standard for a hotel in New York City. The hotel offers an expanded hot breakfast that was good but most days it was so busy and tons of people in a small space we decided to eat out. The Wi-Fi worked very well and was free on multiple devices. The hotel is nice and brand new but I think the two major issues to me will keep me from returning. I recommend this hotel to travelers under 6 feet and who don't mind waiting 5-10 minutes for an elevator. I will not be returning unless Priceline puts me there again for a really great price.

We stay here for 2 nights before our cruise. The hotel needs up dating our room was clean but some of the other areas looked as if they needed a good clean.We had no cold water for the first day and needed to report it twice before it was fixed.

Stayed here instead of Hilton Times Square and found a good value. Breakfast from 6 - 10am with lots to choose from. Tea and coffee anytime which was a blessing because it was 5 degrees outside with the wind chill. Rooms were tight; we felt like we were in Europe, but everything modern including free WiFi. President's weekend was extremely busy so elevators were slow and crowded but friendly, helpful staff made up for the hassle. We'd definitely return with our large family, but when it is just the two of us we'll stay at the Hilton Times Square.

Stayed in NYC for the first time and I highly recommend choosing a high floor if you want a nice view of the city. Near everything from restaurants, bars, and stores. If I stay in Manhattan again I will definitely stay here.

I had a great experience with Hampton Inn Time Square South. The staff was always friendly and professional. Room was comfortable and clean. Of course the room was small, but this is NYC! It was clean and comforable and that is the most important thing.

DO NOT make the mistake of believing you are staying on, or for that matter, really anywhere near Times Square. Don't expect to look out your window and see the "glitz and the glamor of flashing neon signs". You're not in the right neighborhood. From a Hampton Inn perspective this hotel is adequate. Rooms clean and "no nonsense. The hotel was generally quiet and the bed's comfortable. Rooms are small and typical of a Manhattan hotel. I've definitely had bigger and seen a few smaller. Bathrooms are even smaller. I could barely turn around in the shower. I was "upgraded" as a Diamond member to a room on 27 with a view. It was nice, because I didn't have to pay for it. If, however, you are considering paying for a view. Pass and save the money. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and freshly made. Not much in the near neighborhood to speak of. Taxis did not appear to be plentiful, so you might have to have one called or walk up/down a block or two to find a cab.

When you stay at a hotel in Manhattan there are two things you can be sure of. It will be expensive and the rooms will be small. On my last visit I chose this hotel because I had business in the Times Square neighborhood (which is easily accessed from this location) and because I like the consistency of the experience I have at Hampton Inns around the country (and, of course, because I like my Hilton points). Also, although the room was, as expected, expensive, for Manhattan it was not overly so (I spent $270 - which, by the way, inflated to $312 by the time NYC and New York State took their tax bites). However, even expecting the room to be small I was surprised at just how small it was. I had a room with 2 double beds on the 11th floor. I could barely turn around in the room - literally! I can not imagine what it would have been like if 4 people had actually tried to fit in that room at one time. The bathroom was equally small with no counter space on which to put toiletries. If small doesn't bother you, this hotel otherwise was very nice. It had a very gracious staff and all the amenities you expect from Hampton Inns. Just be prepared for very small rooms.

Rooms are small, but staff is friendly and complimentary breakfast was great. They also had complimentary cookies and hot apple cider one of the nights. They probably had it every evening, but we were always out and about. We got a great deal on our hotel. It's about 3 blocks from Times Square and about 3 blocks to the subway system. Close enough to get around, but a small walk from anything. We would stay here again if the price is right. I would pay a little more to stay right in Times Square, but only a little more, since it's not far, either.

Booked this hotel for my niece who turned 21 and two friends. Cozy rooms great location. I had previously stayed there and every morning they provided breakfast in or a sack to take with you. Would head to Central Park and enjoy our muffin granola and banana. Located within walking distance of Times Square. Felt safe and loved the local store being close for supplies. Bed comfortable rooms small but nice clean and everything we needed.

The hotel was in a great location. Easy to get the subway or go to a local bar, restaurant. This is a dependable hotel that was very clean. The breakfast was very good too. We were there with 3 other couples and had a great time.

I picked this property because of the Hampton Inn brand and price point for a recent family stay in NYC. Compared to the higher-priced properties in Times Square, this place is a gem. The front desk staff was great - even with a check-in policy at 3 PM, the staff actually got us checked in early even though we only stopped to leave our bags with the bellman.The room was virtually spotless, clean and comfortable. Standard NYC-sized room (smallish) but it actually felt pretty spacious. Internet and WiFi were fast and responsive. The upper floors provide a decent view of the area.If you're looking for convenience to Broadway, Times Square, look no further. Macy's? The Empire State Building? MSG? It's all right here. Going to the WTC area is a short subway ride on the E line. I recommend going for the local places to eat rather than the chain joints. 2 slices NY-style and a cold soda for under $3 right around the corner. This place is on my "stay here unless it's sold out" list.Great job to the staff and management of this property.

NYC can be a minefield - lots of hotels to choose from with some mega high prices and mega low standardsThe Hampton Inn was everything I hoped it would be. Well located, affordable, clean and friendly and with a surprising level of facilities.Free breakfast was very good.Kelvin on front desk and jamal from maintenance were incredibly friendly and helpful.I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York!

Overall I liked this hotel. Room was very small but that is common in NYC. Hotel was clean. Breakfast was a nice bonus since breakfast in the city can be expensive! The location was good, though it did take sone walking to get places.

Recent 7day (Jan 2013) holiday stay proved better then anticipated for my wife and myself. All staff very friendly and professional from check in through to checkout. Good breakfast for cost of room. Handy location between Times Square, shopping area and Restaurant row. Room small as expected in NYC, but clean, everything worked and very comfortable bed. Loved the complimentary hot cider in evenings. Excellent value hotel which is highly recommended. In this class of hotel it rates as one of best we have ever stayed in.

Really enjoy the hotel and location where we had to go to the Javitz Center. Great Staff! We were early for checking in. They took care of the car and our baggage. Quiet room, Close to shopping and places to eat. Very good hotel for your budget!

I was booked here for work, and I was a little nervous--could it really be as nice as the reviews say? But, I was pleasantly surprised and in fact it's probably the nicest "cheap" hotel I've stayed in during my dozens of stays in New York. I'd definitely stay again if I'm traveling on a budget!LOCATION: The location is central, and walking distance to Penn Station, Port Authority, and Times Square. It's actually a few blocks from the mania of Times Square, which I prefer. There are plenty of delis and quick bites nearby, and it's easy to walk to your destinations or the subway. Though convenient, the neighborhood directly surrounding the hotel is definitely one of the more dirty, sleazy-looking parts of town I've been in, but I walked around in the evening alone without any problems so I guess it's not too bad!ROOMS: The rooms are no frills but still exceptional for a budget-friendly hotel. The standard room was definitely more spacious than some of the luxury or trendy hotels I've stayed in New York. It had a large, comfortable bed, clean sheets, plenty of closet space, and a desk. The bathroom seemed like it had been recently re-done, with marble and steel finishing and more than enough towels. The room was also exceptionally clean!SERVICE: From the moment I walked in the door, the service was friendly. I was provided with free wifi (because the room was booked by a Hilton HHonors member) and a bottle of water before bed. The housekeeping did a fine job, and I never saw them or heard them during my stay. The front desk staff was helpful with check out and getting me a taxi. The hotel also provides free breakfast, which seemed like a nice spread although I didn't have time to try it.OVERALL: While it wouldn't necessarily be my first-choice hotel, it's a great option if you're traveling for business or on a budget. I'd recommend it to friends who don't want to cram multiple people in a room, too.

We had a room with two beds, so the room was a bit on the crowded side. On the plus side, it was clean and the shower was decent sized. Breakfast was good, coffee available throughout the day. Location is excellent - right by port authority and Times Square.

My daughters and I have stayed in many averagePriced hotels in and around Manhatten over the years and thisWas hands down the best for the money. Very clean and comfortable With a decent complimentary breakfast. Close to shopping and the subway.

Me and a friend stayed here for leisure. The hotel rooms were super small, but clean. The staff was extra friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. The hotel was close enough to Times Square though not in Times Square and It was convenient to the subway. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. And it wasn't a bad deal for the money.

During our 3 week tour of USA, we stayed in 7 hotels and this was by far my favorite.PROS- amazing team of staff all over the place. Friendly, humble, helpful, knowledgeable and make u feel like family rather than a foreign guest.- high speed wifi in room. Easy, hassle free.- very generous free breakfasts.- free hot drinks all day.- perfect location, everything a short walk away yet still reasonably quiet.- two comfortable chairs in standard room.- lots of storage space in room.- feels safe and secure.- very accomodating. Allowed us late check out, extra pillows, blankets and toiletries provided with a smile upon request.CONS- air con bit noisy, specially at night in 20F.- no bath or bar fridge in roomCONCLUSION: Great value, highly recommended, would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here on our first trip to New York City and we were not disappointed in any way. Hotel was clean and nice. The complimentary breakfast is certainly not gourmet but we did not expect it to be...the breakfast was hearty and plentiful and always freshly stocked. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and attentive. The location was perfect for us! Literally only yards from many of the top Broadway shows. We will most definitely stay here again when we return to New York. It not only met our expectations...it exceeded them! And it was also a GREAT value for New York City!

Close to Jacob Javits Center, the Highline Park, and a pleasant walk to town. It is not a fancy area, at the beginning of Hell's Kitchen with some amazing Italian restaurants that are very reasonably priced. Excellent service and if you don't care for their "main course" at breakfast there are waffles and fresh fruit. The kitchen help is outstanding.

Multo bene; sehr gut; mui bien; very, very good. Super competent staff. Very clean rooms (we inspected very carefully as we always do when travelling to NYC). Great deal b/c of breakfast inclusion. I really don't have anything more to say but there's a 200 character minimum.

We came to Hampton inn for our honeymoon at the end of December. We stayed for 10 nights, so we can be in NY during Christmas and new year's eve. The Hampton inn was the only hotel at the vecinety of times square at a sane price. When we arrived we encounterd wonderful staff, clean rooms, nice breakfast and most of all, it was so close to everything. Thank you so much for everything :)

The hotel is a strange combination of a hostel and a hotel.The rooms are very comfortable, but let down by a cheap bathroom - the shower door kept falling off. The "restaurant" only serves breakfast, and whilst the food is good, you eat with plastic knives and forks and polystyrene plates!There is usually a good selection of teas and coffee throughout the day.Wifi was very patchy - fine in the lobby, but poor or non-existent in the room. The wired connection was better though.They make a big deal of changing sheets on a daily basis, but mine were not!

We had a great 1-night stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. The staff are extremely friendly and quite helpful! One front-desk worker actually printed out walking and subway directions for our destination and gave us bottles of water for the trip. Although the rooms are a bit snug and the bathroom only has a shower, I think that's the norm in many NYC hotels. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean- I love that they change ALL of the bed linens for each guest!! The free breakfast was mediocre, but this is a definite stay for our next NYC visit!

The hot breakfast is really nice. 24 hr coffee... Only three years old.. Nice and clean... Room on the small side... But functional... Only thing missing is a small fridge... Great value and location. Will definitely come back.

2 of us stayed January 2013. It's not that close to Times Square - adjacent to Hells Kitchen if you look on a map, between 8th/9th on W39th. However it's a reasonable location and some of the higher rooms have city views south and across the Hudson. We were on 31st floor and it was a fantastic view. Rooms small but normal for Manhattan. Accommodation is well equipped and the beds and pillows are comfy. Only the clumpy/lumpy duvet let it down - although they changed it, apparently they were all like that - so they need to get new ones. The staff are exceptionally friendly and go out of their way to look after you. They have complimentary cookies/cakes (and hot apple cider one day) which was nice. Coffee/tea facilities on ground floor as well as in rooms. Basic gym in basement.

There's just no getting around it: New York is an expensive city. I was sticker-shocked when I began researching hotels for our weekend get-away. I knew we wouldn't be spending lots of time in the room on such a quick trip, so I didn't want to put lots of money into a place to stay. I searched for a centrally-located, reasonably-priced hotel and came across this property. I usually find Hamptons to be good values and consistently clean with comfortable beds, hot breakfast, and good customer service. This Hampton was no exception. The rooms are by far the smallest I have ever seen in a Hampton, and if you have lots of luggage, you may have trouble stowing it in such a small space. Still, small is to be expected in Manhattan. The location wasn't quite as convenient to things as I thought it would be, but we still managed to walk to plenty of sights. A few times, we ended up cabbing it back to the hotel just because it was late, dark and freezing-cold. The side street this property is located on is nothing to write home about, but walk a block and you get to other streets that have restaurants, coffee shops, shopping. The bus station is just around the corner, but we took the subway to get to the destinations that were further away (Statue of Liberty; Chinatown). Overall, a decent value for a place to rest your head.

There were 4 of us that stayed Dec. 19-23. It was great! The room and property was super clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Their customer service skills are excellent. Yes, the rooms are small (that's Manhattan) but we were very comfortable. The location is great. Lots of restaurants nearby. Only one or two minor waits for an elevator. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. I can't say enough good things about the staff. Wow!

Very nice room, everything was clean and modern. Staff was extremely friendly; they let us store our bags for several days before arrival. Breakfast won't impress anyone used to European or Asian hotels, but for a reasonably priced US hotel, it was perfectly fine.

booked this hotel as thought it was on times square for New year's eve but it is a good ten fifteen minute walk away. on arrival the reception staff were not very friendly and as it was my friends 50th I did think they could have been nicer. no mention of an upgrade or anything special until James the fantastic concierge had a word with the manager and we got a city view room. that said the room was lovely with a big bed and a great bathroom. air conditioning and great to have a coffee maker tv and hair dryer. the breakfast was adequate although by day 6 I was fed up of bagels and muffins. the hotel staff are generally friendly although I feel the reception staff could do with learning service with a smile. it is in a great central location for touring but not on times square itself. brilliant having tea coffee when you get back from walking about. got lost a few times and noticed a few blue movie shops and adult shops so felt you had to be careful later at night. James the concierge is great just so helpful and a mind of information. nice touches in the room at New year. overall a great place fir a base for most of the main attractions.

The Hampton is a great place to stay in NYC. Great location--close to everything--easy walk to subway & buses. Walked to Broadway and lots of restaurants. The rooms were surprisingly roomy and nicely decorated. The free breakfast was of good quality, and there was always plenty of food. The breakfast room was great in the evening after a long day in the city to relax and play cards with friends. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Always had the answer how to get somewhere--even giving us some money saving tips for transportation. We had purchased a subway pass--one of the bellmen was able to tell us how to get to LaGuardia with our pass so we did not have to spend anymore to get to the airport! The staff was so friendly we always felt they were making sure we "got home" safely every nite!

If you are wanting to explore Manhattan then this is a superb location. It has so much nearby. It is walking distance to the rockefeller center, Time Square and right accross the road from the subway entrance. Room was clean and spacious and complimentary breakfast was ample and with enough variety to satify the whole family. Staff very helful and pleasant.

This as our base in New York which turned out to be a wise decision as far as the positioning to the major sights was concerned. Situated a few easy blocks walk from Times Square. Our room was most comfortable and clean.One downside to this Hotel is that the breakfast area is on the small side but we found that early was best and around 08h30 was too late to avoid the crowd. Breakfast was good and there is a good variety to choose from. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Great stay!

good location. friendly staff.rooms are not big but very cosy. the air condition was a bit noisy. no safe deposit box or refrigerator, but coffee maker +free tea and coffee. 32 floors only 2 elevators that serve the staff as the guests.free breakfast and internet wi-fi. 27\7 free tea' coffee hot chocolate. to conclude it has more pro than con.price very reasonable.

This hotel was absolutely amazing! The staff go above and beyond for their guests and are so friendly and helpful. Loved the cookies in the lobby and the breakfast was delicious (lots of choices.) The location is perfect to get to Times Square and the Hell's Kitchen flea market is just down the street on Saturday (not sure if it is there on Sunday too.) Was very surprised at how friendly and helpful New Yorkers were when we looked lost (several times while holding a map and looking around, people stopped and offered assistance.) Will definitely be staying here again. I don't know why people complain about the size of the room though (there were four women and our suitcases in there and we were fine.) Besides, are you really going to NYC and staying in your room?!?!?

Had booked into this hotel at the last minute due to the recent hurricane. Tucked away in a side street we didn’t really get an opportunity to explore as we came in late and were moving out the next morning. The room was adequate and very clean, for an NY hotel room it was an ok size. The buffet for breakfast was fine, though the room where it was served looked as if it could do with a good clean. Otherwise an ideal hotel for sight seeing, and the hotel management were very on the ball with updates for residents on the impending storm. Staff also very friendly and helpful

We stayed for six nights/seven days. Hotel is very close to the major train stations. As other reviewers stated the rooms are small (European sizing). We stayed on the thirteenth floor and if I stayed again I would request a lower floor. Sometimes the elevators were so packed we had to wait for another one. Usually only an issue in the morning rush to make breakfast. Breakfast was awesome for my kids. Had a lot of selections and it's buffet style which they loved. They keep coffee, tea and hot chocolate going all day! Hot cookies in the afternoon. The staff are awesome!!! Super nice and friendly. Our floor had only six rooms in a "U" shaped pattern. It was so quiet I thought we were the only ones on the floor even though it was Christmas week. They arranged a car for us to take us to the airport. They must use the safest driver service ever. I get very nervous as a passenger when people tailgate, etc. If you're looking for a nice place to stay in the theater district this is a great choice.
