Also, we saw three broadway shows, all at different theaters and were able to walk to/from each of them. So convenient.

It has been a while since we visited this Hampton Inn(November 2010), but I couldn't discard the business card until I sent a comment about Hatonochi. I had an online course that started Saturday morning and I couldn't seem to get connected. I panicked! She went out of her way to assist me and to make sure I didn't miss my class. Thank you for the personal attention even when the lobby was flowing with people. She made sure we ALL were getting the attention we needed.Thanks!Sampty

Hotel in a good, central location to most of the must see areas of Manhattan and it is very close to the A and E subway lines which provides easy access to the entire region. The room was clean, but small (as expected in NYC). Service was good and attentive, although a little understaffed at times. The free breakfast was nice, typical for a Hampton Inn although a little subpar compared to others I've stayed in. Note the breakfast area was crowed each morning we were there and was cold in spots. We took a taxi from LGA to the hotel, 50 bucks with tips and tolls(two of us). We set up a private car with the concierge for the return trip, 45 bucks and that included tips and tolls-definitely recommend that instead of the taxi. This hotel is worth considering, but at this price range, there are many to choose from (Hilton Garden Inn just down the street for example which like just a touch more) and would probably try a different on next time.

Visited during Christmas 2012, Stayed Sunday - Wednesday 12/23-25. We are a family of 5: 2 parents, Sons ages 21, 23, daughter 18. Stayed in rooms 405 and 401. Both have 2 double beds Given this is Manhattan, the rooms were tight but ok in size. Room 405 looks out on West 39th St. Not much to see, but they charge an additional fee for the view. As we were not there on a regular weekday, I can't gauge the normal weekday noise from the street. Boys room was in back without a "view" and was a bit cheaper. We also had a charge for a "Sunday night" stay Location is on West 39th street, nearer to 9th Ave. Heat was fine.There is a great Starbucks on 8th and 39th that has an expansive upstairs room with lots of tables and chairs. Very easy walks to Times Square (intersection for subways) and Herald Square. There is a passable free breakfast that is open until 10am.

Just wanted to say some nice things about this hotel:The hotel is located at West 39th St @ 8th Ave...It's about 3-4 block walk to get into Times Square, which is not a long walk anyhow, you are only 2 blocks to Port Authority Bus Terminal and multiple subways go through that station...The hotel has 6 rooms to a floor, some face the back of the hotel (with no view) 3 rooms face the city (with a nice view) (the lower you are the more street noise or construction traffic that you will hear)We were in Rooms 2701 and 2702 (there are 32 floors total)The GM of the hotel Mimi and the Front Desk Manager (Danielle) went out of their way to make sure that myself and my family were having a great stay and went out of their way to say the least...The breakfast was very busy at times (granted it's the holidays), if you get there after 8:30 a.m. you will be greeted by a lot of people...the attendants in that room were absolutely the best I've ever seen with service, being friendly and helping out...they worked their butts off to say the least...The rooms yes are on a bit of the smaller side, but it's the little details that make a big difference, service with a smile and the going the extra effort...They also have a concierge desk that is staffed each day, and they were all very knowledgeable...Will definately return next time, as I always stay here each time I come to New York...Thanks again Hampton Inn....

This was my 2nd visit to New York. the first time I'm stayed at The Novotel on Broadway which was nice but I much preferred the Hampton Inn. In the Fashion District and only a few blocks away from Times Square it was ideally situated. My room was at the back of the hotel facing another hotel so there was no traffic noise and very quiet in general.I booked a kingsize room for me and my sister for the week leading up to Christmas week. The room was lovely very clean (the shower was AMAZING). Check in at 3pm check put at 12pm. Room included large TV, Iron and ironing board, hair dryer and coffee making facilities ample storage as well alarm and phone-where local calls were free. There was also free Wi-Fi for all guests too which was brilliant as the last hotel I stayed in you had to pay......also in the lobby they had a room with 2computers for internet access as well as access to printers.The floor i stayed on had an ice machine and vending machine. The ice machine was my only fault with the hotel as fab as it was having this facility it was a little noisy at times more noticable at nights but not enough to disturb sleep too much. They had two lifts and a stair case. Neither I found any problems with.Buffet breakfast was served 6-10am adequate seating and lots of choice from hot, cold and fresh fruit yoghurts etc. They had a tea/coffee/hot chocolate facilities in the dining area acessable 24hrs which was fab as well as coffee machine in the room.Staff were very helpful with any questions we had, and on a few occasions guests were treat to a cookie or muffin as compliments from the hotel which was a lovely gesture. Nothing was ever too much bother for them really friendly and approachable.Apart from a nosiy ice machine which wasnt actually all that bad I cannot find fault with this hotel. It is defo somewhere I would stay if I was to visit again and somewhere I would reccomend to others to stay. Ideally placed great facilities and brilliant friendly staff.Thanks Hampton Inn :-)

Just finished a five night stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. I was very pleased with my stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel room in Midtown New York.There are many pros about the hotel, first of which is the level of service. I found every hotel staff member I encountered to be genuinely warm, friendly, and helpful. Check in time is at 3 p.m. and I arrived a little after 9 am. I went to the hotel on the off-chance that they might have a room available. I have found that early check-in can be hit or miss with the Hampton Inn chain. Some are willing to let you check in if they have a room available and others stay strict to the check in time. There was a room available for me and the Front Desk person graciously let me check in. I was even more surprised and impressed that when I tried to tip the staff member for her kindness, she wouldn't accept it and insisted she was happy to do it. The location is great. You are essentially in the Fashion District and not more than 4 blocks to Times Square and the Theatre District in one direction and Madison Square Garden is about another 8 blocks in the opposite direction. You are one block from Port Authority Bus Terminal and have a plethora of subway options available to you. Additionally, as you are essentially right next to Times Square, there are a plethora of food options nearby.The hotel room itself can feel a little on the small side, but in comparison to most New York Hotels, the room is closer to a standard Hampton Inn room than not... meaning, it actually feels spacious compared to other hotel rooms in the area. The hotel is small and only has what seems to be about 4 - 5 rooms on each floor. This means that each room is near the elevator, which, if you are a light sleeper or sensitive to sound, you may have a difficult time with hearing the elevator running and chiming at all hours. Additionally, as you're in a pretty busy area, you can also hear street noise and while I was there, it sounded like construction was going on close by which seemed to provide constant noise at all hours. If you are sensitive to noise, I might also offer the following tip, request a room that is not on a floor with an ice machine. As I mentioned, the floors are small and the ice machines are loud. I was not on a floor with one, but I can't imagine it being very quiet. Also, I was in a room without a view, facing the back of the hotel. If you face street, I imagine that you'll get even more traffic noise. One other con about the hotel is the elevator. They only have two which seem to run very slowly. If possible, you might want to request a room on one of the lower floors so that you cam walk up to your room if necessary. With the number of guests and the number of floors, coupled with the fact that the staff and cleaning service also use those elevators, you might be waiting up to 10 minutes for one to even arrive to you. Breakfast is standard Hampton Inn fare. Breakfast is served between 6 - 10 am, but if you do not arrive before 830, it gets very crowded with limited seating and food running out quickly. The staff handling the food did their best, but often seemed slow to replenish the hot items (or more accurately, did not seem to be anticipating when food would run out and therefore it seemed did not prepare new trays of hot items until everything ran out). On a couple of days, I found empty trays and had to wait 10 minutes for it to be replaced. Overall, though this is a great hotel with a great staff in a very convenient location. The rates seem pretty fair and I think most people would be pleased with a stay here.

Usually we stay at the Inter-Continental or the Sheraton, when we want to see a Broadway show, but this time, following a great Hampton Inn experience in California, we decided to give this property a try. What a great choice! Rooms were small but had everything: remodeled showers, super-comfy beds, ironing board, dryers, coffee pot, free wi-fi. The heating unit was very quiet, not like at some other, pricier hotels. Buffet breakfast was free and available until 10 a.m., and since there were four of us in two rooms, all with different wake-up hours, it really helped. We were able to stagger the breakfast without inconveniencing anyone. The business center (free) enabled me to leave my laptop at home (Amen). Free hot tea/coffee and warm cookies is great after a blustery day. The staff was helpful and friendly, the maids did not try to enter the rooms at 9 am, as has happened to us elsewhere in Manhattan. Floor very quiet and no noise from the street. And check-out time was 12 , not 11 am, so we were able to go out and shop much more leisurely before hitting the road the last day. Overall, a GREAT EXPERIENCE!!! WE'LL BE BACK FOR SURE. Location is divine, three blocks to Macy's and huge number of shops, within walking distance to Broadway, one block to Subway... can't ask for more....

My daughter and I spent Dec 14 - 17 at The Hampton Inn and it was the perfect hotel for our recent stay. Daily included breakfast was good with a variety of choices - but the scrambled eggs were not fresh (powder maybe?) Rooms were clean and service was great. We had a problem with our toilet and hair blower but they were fixed within minutes of a call to the front desk. It was nice to have a business center to use the computer and print information and boarding passes for flights. Hotel is located about 7 blocks(easy walking distance) from Time Square and with the Holiday travelers and tourists it was the perfect distance away from the traffic. It was one of the cheaper hotels and was a great value. I had read previous read reviews about slow elevators, they were sold out and we had no issues with the elevators at all. We would stay here again.

My wife and I stayed at the Hampton on 8 December for 5 nights. The check in was very quick, Thanks Kelvin.I've read reviews regarding the lifts. During our whole stay we didn't have to wait anytime for lifts.Breakfast was really good and plentiful. The ladies in the kitchen are lovely. I had a shock of one of the appliances literally causing a bang and sparks flew. That certainly woke me up!!!The rooms were fantastic, very clean and whilst we were out shopping the maid looked after our room.We enjoyed our stay with Hampton and will stay here again and let my friends know too. Thank you xxx

Great location for this hotel. Better yet - the service and attitude of all the associates at the hotel. From the check-in to the housekeepers - everyone had a smile and all were focused on the guest. I would highly recommend this hotel based on location, value and service.

This hotel gave us everything we were looking for,from the location 10 min walk to Times sq, Bryant park,ESB,Macy,s,water taxi to battery park.Free breakfast was a great start to the day (hot and cold items available ).Rooms clean annd comfy,bit small but no problem,2 beds,shower,tv and free wi/fi.Staff very helpful and friendly.

First the good points: The front desk staff were exceptional and the breakfast, other than the watered down apple juice, was better than most Hamptons. Now the BAD. I am used to small hotel rooms in NY but this took the cake. The room was about 10X10. With our 2 beds there was about 1 ft of space between the beds with none on the outside of the beds. There was also about 1 ft of space between the end of the beds and the dresser/desk/closet. The bathroom was also super small with a shower that measured 1 1/2 ft by 4 ft. There are NO rooms with bathtubs in the hotel, probably cause they cant fit them in.

Great hotel, great location, easy access to the subway/ bus station, you can walk around times square at any time. As a Hampton standard breakfast it's included which is great, that saves you around $10 per person everyday you stay in NYC. The rooms are kind of small but hey , it's New York, you don't want to sleep! Front desk and concierge very helpful. Totally satisfied !! thank you Hampton

My husband and I recently spent 11 nights at the Hampton Inn Times Square South during our first visit to NYC and were extremely pleased with the hotel location (central to access all parts of the city but on a relatively quiet street). In addition, all hotel staff that we encountered were extremely pleasant and helpful. Special shout-out to Calvin at the front desk who was kind enough to offer use of his workstation when I needed to print out local attraction tickets purchased online and all workstations in the business center were in use. Overall, an outstanding experience .. would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting NYC!

We return time and again to the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square North. The property is very well run - comfortable, pretty, fastidiously clean, not too large. Most important, the staff are wonderful at every level. We always feel so welcome and taken care of, so uncommon in this big, bustling city. Though this is not the "fancy" Hilton, it is the best in value and service.

This was our first time in New York and we stayed for 6 days and I can honestly say I have NEVER met so many people so willing to help and genuine smiling as they go about their tasks to make all of us feel welcome, the room was more than adequate and cleaned every day with fresh towels, We also had the superviser calling late each afternoon to ask if we were satisfied with the cleanliness, more than happy was our answer each time.The breakfasts were great with most tastes catered for and the staff in the breakfast room were every bit as brilliant as the rest of the staff, I cannot praise this hotel and it staff highly enough and would definitely return and recommend it to anyone I knew who was looking to go to New York. Again the staff were unbeatable and they should be commended for their dedication and hard work

My friends and I were booted out of the Hampton Inn Chelsea which was VERY VERY upsetting due to our rooms being given away. This was the hotel we were booked into. We came with a bvery bad attitude but by the end of our four night stay we were very, very happy with the hotel.Rooms were small but very clean and comfortable.Front desk staff helpful. Would give us bottled water anytime we asked.Breakfast was excellent and YESIS and his smiling face and service oriented attitude made it even better,. Wonderful young man with a smile on his face all the time.Elevators very slow. Needed to start early in am to avoid long wait to get to ground floor.Quiet area. Location excellent for folk who want to got to Time Square area.

Located off the main path of 7th Ave. Easy 2 blocks to Broadway. 3 blocks toTimes Square. Rooms are ok size for NYC. Imagine London hotel and you get the idea. Bathrooms are clean. Staff friendly. Easy check in and checkout. The neighborhood is very much a working street. By that I mean working store fronts. Look like warehouses turned into stores. I guess it's a New York thing. If you are OK with that, no reason I would hesitate to stay here if you want to be near TS. One previous commenter said its rough after dark. I did not get the feeling it was dangerous, just people working. But then I'm not a late night person. For tourists, there are LOTS of tour buses, including the hop-on hop-off kind, loading up near by- just go to Broadway and head north for a block or two. If you can do subway, it's interesting for a short trip, like to Wall Street. Take the 2/3 train. ($2.50 per trip.) That's "two three". If not, a cab ride cost me $20 to go from 42nd & 7th to Wall Street & Broadway. For a great black car ride (more luxury than yellow cab, Lincoln Town Car or GMC Denali) call Julio's Limo Service. Very nice father/son team will get you from airport to hotel and back. I called with an hours notice and they were 15 min early, ready to go when I was. That's great service. The rooms were clean and well maintained too.

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left our stay has been nothing less than exceptional. The rooms are clean, pleasant and well presented with a great view of the Empire State Building if you get a city view. The free breakfast was surprisingly good and tasty, with no limits on what you eat from toast your own waffles to yoghurt and cooked food. Where this hotel surpasses itself is the staff, they are extremely curteous and always willing to help no matter what the time or query. One member of staff who stands out is Luis, always smiling, greeting you on entry or exit from the hotel with a nice comment and ensuring you get your warm complimentary cookie. I can fully recommend this hotel to anyone

Had a 2 night stay booked. We arrived at 9am and headed straight to the hotel. We were able to check in right away and they offered us breakfast too!! Rooms are small but we weren't in the room too much anyways! Beds were super comfy!Staff was fabulous!!!!

Everyone goes out of their way to make sure that you have an incredible stay. The staff was so helpful and kind. Every night we would ask there for advice on what restaurant to hit for our specific preferences and they went above and beyond by looking into detail for places they felt would accommodate us most an ad handled any and all issues perfectly and in a timely manner. They weren't fake either, they joked around and were blunt and honest about a few places to stay away from and things to do and try nearby. They had great complimentary breakfast that was different every day, they had a cellar that had a guest bathroom, nice gym and vending machines. My only down was how small the rooms were compared to those that I am used to in Florida, but that is expected, being New York. So I give them 5 stars! Definitely would love to stay here again.

Arrived late at night due to flight delays and had a room on the 20th floor was a bit disappointed that we had no views of the city only windows of the hotel next door the room was clean it was rather small for three adults but we did not spend that much time in there it was cleaned every day throughout our stay and the only problem with it was the size. This hotel is in a convenient location for sightseeing not far from Times Square we caught the tour bus from there and seen all the sights throughout our five day stay.Did not realise our first day there was 'Black Friday' the biggest sale day of the year not a good idea to try and do any shopping as all the shops were totally crammed!! The hotel provided a hot buffet breakfast every morning which was very welcome to set you up for the day. The staff were very helpful and friendly all through our stay.

I have to say a really enjoyed staying here, it is the perfect location for getting around either on foot, by bus, by subway or taxi..I stayed here with my teenage son & my parents so a mixture of ages, We was on the 28th floor with city views.. and have to say I have no complaints, the service, the staff, rooms, breakfast were all spot on.. From free wifi, complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate, gym, use of computer room, fresh cookies every day, overall a very nice stay in New York...The Irish bar on this road serves lovely food, definitely a good place to eatOn a Sat & Sun a little flea market is held down the end of the road, had a nice browse round this.

I just returned from my post-divorce, single-woman, 'imma doit on my own' vacation to New York, which included a 5 night stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. Travelling on my own was not without its challenges as I have a disability that renders me 'no longer built for distance'. (I have a back problem & use a funky scooter to get me where I'm going.)Before I arrived, the staff at this hotel was already acquainted with me because of several phone calls & already extremely helpful in assisting me with questions about what I might encounter upon arrival. In particular, Sue Ellen was tremendous! I wanted to be certain it was wise to travel so soon post-Sandy. And, I'd read some reviews about the elevators & some past service troubles. I prefer a higher floor, but can't imagine anyone would wanna piggyback me up the stairs in case of an outage! We arranged for me to be on the 2nd floor. *Be prepared, that low down, on the side closest to 8th, your view is down into the happy, sunshiny faces of folks in the breakfast room!No worries, there are blackout curtains if you don't wanna spoil the surprise about what's for brekkie! Also, the hotel is skinny. All the rooms are 'near the elevator', you don't have to specially request one as I usually do. There are only 6 rooms on each floor. It's a newer hotel build in New York & the setup and rooms are much the same as others I've encountered. Rooms are small - if you are comparing them to a regular, suburban hotel room. But compared to similar, skinny, newer New York hotels, I actually found my room quite spacious. (I didn't need to fold up & put away my scooter as I did in my last NY hotel.) Yes, the shower IS small. But I'm a big girl & I figured out a way to shave my legs, so you've got nothing to complain about! And I'd already read about the elevators & the showers here before I booked the hotel. I didn't go in blind, so it makes no sense to me to mark the hotel down for something I was aware of. The breakfast room is pleasant & well lit. When I made it in for more than a rushed glass of orange juice, the food was really good! And afternoon cookies! I loved that this hotel had both breakfast and wi-fi included. That saved a lot. And when the plug for my iPad gave out, it was terrific to discover a port beside the TV, so I didn't need to get gouged on 8th st. buying a new one!Kelvin checked me into the hotel & he was terrific as my first friendly face. It was evening & I had a super early morning of fun planned, so he gave a great suggestion for dinner delivery & I had soup and a sandwich delivered from a local place for dinner. They had terrific shakes - real egg creams, black & whites, etc. Yum!My first calamity struck the next morning, when the belt on my scooter snapped in half! It's not a run-of-the mill part, but luckily it was Thursday & I was able to have something overnighted to the hotel. The front desk staff were amazing & all so concerned that I might not be able to have the holiday I'd imagined. Luckily, the next morning, Hatanachi was eager to give me the good news that the part had arrived & I could get back on my way. At some point while 'scooting' through, Sue Ellen put the voice & the scooter to the face and came over to introduce herself. This. Tiny things like this make all the difference in the world!Later on day 2 came the 'Super Calamity'. Evidently my belt breaking was only an appetizer! I was on my was to my evening activity & someone ahead of me was texting & walking. (Why is that a thing now?) She zigged in front of me & I couldn't zag fast enough to keep up with her change, so my front wheel hit a rut in the pavement & I literally flipped over my handlebars & smashed onto the pavement. Sitting stunned for a moment, I looked at my scooter & saw that the whole front wheel frame was twisted & bent. I figured my vacation was over at that point. Some awesome New Yorkers got me into a cab & sent me back to the hotel where Brito, the Bellman, was waiting. I don't know if he just saw my face getting out of the cab or if he saw the scooter when he lifted it out of the trunk, but the next thing I knew I was sitting in the lobby and he was working on it with all his might. He managed to use brute force (Brito force?) to twist it back into proper position and once I'd rested a bit, I was able to carry on that night. He literally saved my vacation! I don't know how to thank him. Those are but a few of the positive experiences I encountered with the staff at the hotel. Louis took my picture for me when I was all dressed up for the theatre. (Not being in the picture is the only bummer of solo travel!) I'd love to say personal things about the amazing housekeeping staff, but the truth is they were so unobtrusive, I never saw them! I've been fortunate enough in my life to have stayed at some very fine hotels, as well as my share of no-tell motels & everything in-between. But the level of service with this team was unmatched. There is a chemistry with this group that should be bottled & sold, for it is a very rare thing. Thank you so much for taking such good care of me! I hope to return in the New Year.I would highly recommend this hotel for the service. Just read the reviews & know what to expect in terms of room size, etc. and you'll have a wonderful stay!

The rooms are a bit small but typical of a NYC hotel. The breakfast is decent, not great. Try to get down there early to get a seat otherwise you'll end up waiting for a spot or have to go back to your room to eat. The elevators run slow because they are small and only hold so many guests. And during peak times, they are quite often too full to board. The beds are comfy and clean, as is the room. Shower only (no bath) that is very small.

We had a great 3 nights at the Hampton. Good location. Clean comfy rooms (though small). Good breakfast. The staff was wonderful: friendly, helpful and offerred great dining suggestions. They even had freshly baked cookies when we came in after sightseeing. And the 24 hour coffee/hot chocolate lounge was a great place for our group of 8 to plan the next days activities. Will highly recommend this hotel to friends.

the best staff everi had the best experience with the hotel staff ,very helpful,understanding and above all they will do anything they can to help youthe hotel is sufficient for a business trip very close to most of the shopping areasvery close to good eating placesafter all this is mid town Manhattan.

Background:On our Honeymoon From Perth AustraliaI would like to begin by stating that we did give the Hotel the opportunity to rectify our disappointing experience but sadly they didn’t provide any solutions or even offer a simple apology.In fact, while we were checking out - they asked us how we enjoyed our stay - we then proceeded to remind them of our disappointing experience along with examples of the poor communication and the well below average assistance from the Hotel staff.At that point we were told that WE were wrong and the Hotel staff would not acted in that particular way OR advised us in that manner...As always, there is a long and short story - i will attempt to deliver the sort story (for my own sanity).Location:It’s not an overly bad location. Not really “Times Square, SOUTH” as they call it but about a 10-15min walk to “Times Square”. The location could get a little rough at night, as it’s surrounded by one or two strip clubs/peep shows. Overall the location isn’t too bad and didn’t form any part of our poor overall rating of this Hotel Rooms:Small! Even being in NY these rooms are small. Couldn’t even place two “check-in” bags on the floor. The shower/toilet combination is the smallest i have ever seen. That said, the shower size isn’t a problem unless you want to turn around at any point.We had requested a view as we were told they had rooms available with decent views of the city. We received a view of a brick wall/lane way.In our room there we no real curtains. The only window coverings were white lace and see through that in no way blocked out lights or sun. We did inquire with reception if there were any rooms in the Hotel that had block out curtains etc but were told no and then advised to hang up towels and use clothes hangers to try and block out the morning sun or night lights.On more than one occasion after a long day exploring the city (by the way is everything you imagine and more) my wife and i return to a room that has yet to be made up/cleaned. In fact, two days in a row we left the room at 8am and returned around 5pm with the room still been unattended to. We were then the ones who had to contact reception to request housekeeping service. Unacceptable! Twice!!Out side of the rooms you will find the Hotel lift. Take the stairs unless you are happy to wait... and wait... It’s 2012 how can these lifts be this slow.Once your lift arrives, take it down to the complementary breakfast area. Overall the breakfast isn’t too bad but the day we went for breakfast they had no bacon. Now not the end of the world but one would have thought that bacon is somewhat of a fundamental. Finally, the most disappointing element was that not one staff member took any responsibility for our experience. I’m sure the Hotel will most likely reply with some generic customer service response but i’m really not sure what they could say or do to right these wrongs. Not happy!!!

Lovely hotel - friendly and helpful staff - great location - and breakfast was nice too with lots of variety, we were on the 21st floor and never had a problem with the lifts.would recommend to family's and couples. would defiantly go back - thank you.

My husband booked a surprise trip to New York, United Airlines direct from Glasgow, good flight, but my suitcase got trashed! The staff at the Hampton Inn couldn't have been friendlier. Small room but clean and a comfy bed. Surprised at the quality of the complimentary FREE breakfast. Have already recommended to friends. Would definitely stay there again. Half a block away from Hells Kitchen. ate there most nights after going to shows, good food, good bars, good value for money. Also make time to go to Eatily across from the Flat Iron Building, food to die for and great waiting staff. Don't be afraid to ask a New York cop for help / directions, they were fabulous. New Yorkers get bad press about being rude, not at all, we found them friendly.

I recently booked 4 rooms at this Hampton Inn and found it to be very satisfactory. I would return if the opportunity occurs. Like all medium priced hotels in Midtown Manhattan, the rooms were smaller than the typical Hampton Inns, but very clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were of particular assistance with regards to directions to local tourist events, arrangements for parking of our cars and working through the securing of our rooms on one of the busiest days of the year. The two I'm referring to are Hatanachi Lugo and Macda Cooke. Kudos for their efforts. By the way it's an outstanding location for theatre, great restaurants and easy on and easy off from the Lincoln tunnel. I will return.

My husband and I stayed here in Nov, 2012. We were on the 28th floor. The floors are very small as the hotel is more vertical than horizontal...ice machine was 10 steps away, and elevators. We had a room next to the elevators but never heard anything ever. The room was beige/cream, and was very small, but for NYC and this price it was to be expected. However it was tastefully decorated, almost euro style, but very comfortable and Clean.Each morning there was a full breakfast in the room in back of the lobby entrance, and the food was great; eggs, sausage, muffins, toast, fruit, juice etc. I made a plate and went upstairs to eat it, although there was ample dining room.The employees were busy but always helpful and nice. Location is between 8th and 7th, which was good. I didn't hear any noise up on the 28th floor. Plenty of hot water, great water pressure and there was a little coffee maker in the room. I recommend this hotel based on cleanliness, service and location.

I love love Hampton Inn hotels! I've never been disappointed.This one is in a great location, close enough to Times Square so you have plenty of restaurants and entertainment nearby but away enough so it's not noisy.The room was small (but it's New York!) but clean and comfortable.The hot breakfast is included and you have a lot of different items to choose. It can be a bit crowded so come as early as possible!Our room was very quiet, the only issue was the very noisy a/c but if you don't use it at night you should be fine.Be careful to ask for a room on a low floor if you don't want to wait 10 minutes for the elevator (only 2 of them so it can be crazy during the rush hour).We left our luggages at the front desk on our last day and one of our suitcases was missing when we came back 5 hours later.The front desk manager did a great job and we finally found it but it was a very stressful situation (we almost missed our flight!).I will be back at this hotel on my next trip to new York!

Just got back from a 5 night stay at the Hampton inn, first impressions the hotel from the outside does not look that impressive compared to other hotels in New York but that's where the disappointment ends, the rooms are spotless and spacious, the staff pleasant and cannot do enough for you, they seemed to have thought of everything from the complimentary breakfast and 24 hour drinks availability to Alexander the bellman weighing our cases for us before we left for the airport. Location is great in the heart of New York. Thanks to all at the Hampton for a lovely stress free city break we will be seeing you all again soon.

From the moment I arrived I was impressed with the staff who welcomed me and went out of their way to provide me with the room location and special amenities I had requested. From check-in to check-out, the staff went above and beyond to make me feel at home and ensure I enjoyed the property throughout my stay. Day and night front desk clerks, front desk supervisor Luis Santiago, bellmen, housekeeping, breakfast room staff truly could not have been friendlier and more helpful! As a woman traveling alone on business, I appreciate this special attention to me and to the little details, which truly do matter. My room was very clean and updated. LOVE Hampton Inn's "Clean and Fresh Bed" concept. Hotel location is ideal: near Times Square subway station and Port Authority so very easy to get around the city via subway. Close to the Lincoln Tunnel so easy to get out of the city. Near Times Square; eateries and restaurants etc plentiful in the area. All in all, a perfect place to stay when in NYC! I'll be back!

We came in on a Friday afternoon to see a show and left about noon on Saturday. When I first got to the front door, I wondered how the hotel could possibly be that small. There are about 31 floors of six rooms per floor, but everything was really nice inside. We arrived a minute or two past the 3pm check-in time and the friendly front desk staff took about 15 minutes to get us a room.The rooms are a bit small, but very nice and clean. We had a pretty nice view and noise was not a problem at all. There's a great Irish bar about 75 yards down the street. While not as close to the theater as the other Times Square Hampton, it is a LOT cheaper and the theater was just an inexpensive cab ride away. We even ended up walking back from the Gershwin theater.In the morning, Starbucks was about a block away and we enjoyed a great breakfast spread in the hotel. After that, we went for a pleasant walk and then checked out. Overall, we enjoyed our visit and would definitely come back here again.

We came to NYC in April to see Newsies. We were in town for 3 nights. From the moment we came in the door, the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. They checked our bags in early so my wife and I could start enjoying the city before check-in time. A lot of reviewers on here have complained about the elevators. We were on one of the top floors, and we never seemed to have to wait very long for an elevator. It was also very quiet and the room was bigger than I expected considering some of the reviews. The breakfast was also an added bonus, and every bit as good as all the other Hampton Inns we've stayed at.

My company runs student trips, primarily to New York, and the Hampton Inn Times Square South is undoubtedly the best option. We had 100 high school students running around New York, and the hotel's staff played a pivotal role in making the trip such a resounding success. They had room keys at the ready when we arrived, were ready for the swarm, and never once seemed overwhelmed or annoyed. Every morning the staff treated us like we were truly a special group. I recall everyone, from the desk attendants to the bell desk, to the concierge, to the maids...all with a smile on their faces and truly interested in how our stay in New York was. If you are a large group, I recommend speaking with Julie Brach in the sales office, she is always so understanding and accommodating. Their unbelievable service and willingness to cooperate with large groups is the reason I absolutely insist on using their hotel for all of my trips. The rooms are pristine, with some of the most comfortable bedding you'll ever rest on. The showers are hot and run like a dream after a long day of corralling 100 high school students! The breakfast is ridiculous and such a great start to your day, and a welcome break (free) on the old wallet for a city that can be expensive at times. The wi-fi is a tremendous asset for someone who is working while there and a god send for the age group I work with! It's reliable and fast. The bottom line is that this hotel is incredibly affordable for it's location (skip the subway passes, odds are you won't need it) and the quality of the rooms, the little extras (cookies, wi-fi, breakfast), and most importantly...the wonderful smiles, gratitude, and genuine care you'll receive from their staff at both ends of your booking. Hats off to this hotel, it's a truly great one. Jake Pfeiffer

So centrally located to Times Square & the Theater District. A 15 minute easy and safe walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Surrounded by restaurants, the only difficulty will be choosing the type of food you want. The room was very clean & comfortable, albeit on the small side(normal for N.Y.) and very quiet. Free wi-fi & internet connectivity AND a free and excellent breakfast(& USA Today).The staff is most accommodating and so very friendly. I'd recommend it to family and friends. Priced right too!

We stayed at this Hampton Inn the weekend that Superstorm Sandy arrived. We were there from Friday until we were lucky enough to rent a car and drive home on Monday. The hotel location is wonderful, very handy to many spots we wanted to visit. The breakfasts were terrific and when the storm was imminent, we were assured that we had a place to stay and given boxes to carry extra food back to our rooms. Whe I had to pack in a hurry, the housekeeping staff helped me get our luggage down to the lobby to make our "escape from New York".Thank you for a great stay and when we come back to see the Broadway show (my first ever) that was cancelled on us, we will definitely plan to stay there again.

This hotel is in a great location with friendly staff. The room is small, and the carpet was damp when I checked in, But the delicious buffet breakfast and central location more than makes up for it. I wasn't used to the thin walls, so the noise from the hallway did bother me a bit.

This hotel is conveniently located close to Time Sq and 10 min walk from Penn Station, it is a blockaway from Port Authority terminal. The clean are a little small -we are in NY anyway - but clean, good bathroom. Service included a good breakfast and coffee/tea are available all the day. Wifi connection is working everywhere in the hotel. The personnel is nice and professional. I recommend this hotel given its price/quality ratio and its perfect location.

Stayed here for a couple of nights when our power / water went out due to Hurricane Sandy. Overall pretty good stay. Would recommend for out of town guests. Positives:- Rooms are clean- Good free continental breakfast! (had bagels, eggs, waffle maker, etc.)- Free coffee / tea available all day. - Close to Times Square, good if you are a touristNegatives:- Rooms are a bit small / cozy (as to be expected in NYC)- Air conditioner / heater was very noisy in our room

Yes, the room is small, typical on Manhattan, but is is well designed, comfortable, and actually less expensive than some airport area hotels (LGA or JFK). This makes it a good choice for locating in midtown prior to a morning meeting. It's walking distance from Penn Station as well. Typically, Hampton, there was free breakfast and internet. The staff was friendly and very helpful making suggestions for local dining at all price ranges. This should be high on your list of places to stay in Manhattan.There is a small fitness center with enough hand weights and cardio machines to get the job done.

I thought the hotel was great. The bed was very comfortable and the room was extremely clean. The location was just a short walk away from all the major tourist sites. We would recommend this hotel. The free breakfast was great each morning and we enjoyed the free coffee, tea and cookies during the day.

We stayed here in room 1304 for 3 nights, 4th, 5th and 6th Oct. I confess I was concerned at the prices for hotels in NYC, but after assurances from our Canadian travelling friends and a huge amount of research we joined HH and booked direct. Wonderful stay, huge quiet, clean comfortable rooms. We walked to and from Penn station with our suitcase. Easy walk to Times Sqare and a comfortable area. A great Value hotel in the thick of it. Nice breakfast for the money.Friendly efficient staff.

We booked here during Hurricane Sandy, two downtown New Yorkers in search of a shower and heat. They were just great: marathon weekend, tons of displaced New Yorkers, and they never missed a beat. Hot breakfast, clean rooms, apologies when linens delayed, lovely front desk staff that stayed calm and cool; full house in a unprecedented pressured week and they were just great. I live in NYC and never even knew that this hotel existed; would highly recommend to anyone in need of a respite. Despite the busy location, double paned windows blocked out the noise...yet you could even open them, if needed!!! Rooms seemed a bit small, but who cared: hot shower, good beds and great pillow....good wireless. I was sad to leave, but home beckoned.

We were impressed with this hotel from the greeting during check in to the cleanliness of the room. In between the concierge was top notch, breakfast was great, and the afternoon cookies plentiful. The location was super close to most everything we wanted to do. Our stay ended the Monday Hurricane Sandy hit. The entire hotel was in ready mode making sure everyone's needs were met and accomodating as many people as possible. I will be forever grateful to the management and staff here.

I am a frequent business traveller and have stayed in many NYC hotels including the Hampton Inns and related Hilton properties. Very courteous front desk. Rooms are spacious (for NYC) clean with friendly and welcoming staff. Mix of tourists and business folks. One minor issue was the AC unit needed adjustment from the engineering staff...very quick and good humored. And, there was a minor flood at my front door...the carpet was soaked - I do hope it was water!!Other than that I would stay again and recommend the hotel.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square South for 6 nights. There are only 2 elevators on the property so we knew that from our room on the 26th floor that we were likely going to have to wait for an elevator. However, one of the elevators broke down for 4 days. The first day was a nightmare but the staff quickly figured out that it was best to manually run the elevator and get people from their floors. We simply needed to call the front desk and they sent someone up to get us. While only one elevator was not the ideal situation, it showed guests how much the staff cared. The staff were apologetic for the inconvenience and yet extremely courteous under what appeared to be a stressful situation. I applaud the staff for how they dealt with the elevator issue. We were refunded for one night of our stay for the inconvenience and I greatly appreciated this gesture. All in all, this was a clean, well-run hotel. The breakfast was good and we even had fresh baked cookies on a few nights. It was a busy hotel but there was plenty of staff around to assist guests and that stood out. We would definetly stay again.

Rooms are small, but this IS NYC. Location is convenient, ample breakfast (eggs, ham, sausage, cereal, oatmeal, muffins, juice, coffee, etc.), cookies in afternoon. Friendly staff. Only downside, 2 elevators for 32 floors. Room was ready sooner than check-in. Very clean.

Hampton Inn Times Square south was clean and a relatively easy walk to Times Square, subway station, and Empire State Building. The breakfast was nice with daily eggs, sausage/bacon, waffles, muffins, cereal, yogurt, coffee and juice. As in other reviews, very small elevators and in fact one was out of order so we waited 30 minutes for an elevator., gave up and walked down 18 flights. Very slow check in as rooms were not ready at 3 because cleaning staff were unable to get to all of the rooms with the elevators out of order. We also stood at front desk with our bags for 20 minutes waiting for bellman to put them in storage as our room was not ready. We asked again and found out the desk staff had forgot to call the bellman. We left and came back 4 hours later and our bags were still sitting at the front desk(they never were put in storage) which made us a little nervous about the security of our bags. Once the elevators were up and running, things were better. Not sure if I would stay there again, adequate hotel but enough hassles that it didn't make it "5" stay for us.

I believe it is very hard for the average person to rate a Hotel when paying over $350.00 a night. I know NYC hotels bring this rate all the time, it's just we do not stay in NYC that often. Let me start by saying we were there this past Wed. Night, and thank goodness we were only on the 3 rd floor, because only one elevator was working, so we walked to our room most of the time. The room was small, but very clean, and had everything we needed. The " best " part of our stay was the staff. From the bell persons, the front desk personnel, to Bob the man at the concierge desk, everyone was very friendly and very helpful. We parked our car with the hotel, checked our baggage in early, and out late the night we left. All were very prompt and courteous every time we asked a question or advice, not something you see to often in NYC. The hotel was centrally located for all f the things we wanted to see, so bottom line, I would return, mainly because of how friendly the staff treated us ! Breakfast was included also.

I m currently staying at the Hampton inn hotel and I can say we are not satisfied. The (only) two elevators that this hotel has are not working. And we are stuck in our room for a long time during the day cause we re staying in a high floor and my wife has mobility issues. The stuff isn't helping either.

Friendly staff greet you upon arrival. Late in the afternoon, warm cookies are individually wrapped for guests at the Front Desk. House Staff are pleasant and rooms are fresh and clean.Morning coffee and a light selection are available .... No charge.There was an elevator issue during my stay, and the staff worked diligently to meet the needs of the guests, including operation of an elevator to move things along so guests were not held up.

This was a girls trip to NYC for a 4 night stay. From the moment we checked in to the time we left, we were amazed at the customer service we experienced. Louis? was amazing and coordinated our photo sessions we had every night before we headed out for the night! They were very accommodating from putting a mini fridge in the room to bringing us extra towels to the room. The room had everything you would need and most importantly was clean! Bathroom wasn't the biggest but uses space efficiently. Location was convenient to Times Square. Even serves warm cookies at night to guests! Love that they go the extra mile!! Compared to other hotels in the area, this is a great value! Would definately stay here again next time I'm in town!

I really enjoy staying at this hotel. It is always clean and the service is excellent. The hot breakfast's are alway delicious too. We used room service and it was on point. Thank you so much for your hospitality.

I had a GREAT experience. Staff was friendly. Room size was typical for Manhattan; it was smaller but comfortable. The room was clean and updated. This is a fantastic location. It is only a few blocks off Times Square. Which means you can easily walk there but don't have as much noise and light disturbing you. An easy walk (maybe 3 blocks? LESS than a quarter mile) to a couple different subway stations. Location near Times Square means you can quickly get to Central Park, upper west side, west village, financial district...really anywhere on manhattan. My wife and I felt very safe, even later at night. We chose this hotel because they had fewer rooms than other hotels. So we were thinking there would be fewer people fighting for elevators. We were rights. We stayed Thursday through Monday, and the worst wait time was about 6 minutes on Sunday during peak time.

I was thinking of 4 stars because of the room size, but this may be typical for Manhattan. With nothing else wrong, I went with 5.Staff: Very nice and professional at both the front desk and conciergeRate: I searched the area for quality and price. I was shocked at the cost of rooms in Manhattan. Somehow I stumbled upon this Hampton, a brand I always trust. The rate was much lower than other hotels. Nice!Cleanliness: fine -- a few hairs on the wall of the shower but that's it. Just like their elevator ads about cleanliness -- it was very clean and modern -- no worries. In other hotels I throw the bedspread on the floor because I don't think they get washed every time. Here the duvet cover is washed every day. I love the pillows, too.Noise: We could hear rowdy people in the hall. Otherwise, we heard nothing from the elevator, neighboring rooms, or the exterior/street.Elevator: we had no trouble and we were on the 26th floor. I thought it was really fast.Location: Easy walk from Penn Station and subway stops. Safe enough neighborhood.Breakfast: One of the more varied free hotel breakfasts. I've stayed in other chains with half as many items. The coffee was very good and available when I wanted an afternoon cup. Yes, they have the traditional cookie service.Wi-Fi: It was fast in our room and since I have an AT&T cell phone, there was no login on the AT&T router.Everything about this hotel is compact. We approached it as good practice for the cabin on our upcoming cruise. Small but completely functional. Let's be positive and say "intimate."I don't know what else to say. We were very happy with our choice and would go back without hesitation.

Price was about average for the time and location.Pros:No bed bugs.Room price includes hot breakfast, computer and printer, gym, mini fridge.Friendly staff.Room isn't cramped. Enough room to lounge.Double widows keep out much of the noise. Still heard jackhammers at 11pm and 7 am on 20+ floor.Shower has pressure and hot water.Cons:Two elevators. During busy times the hotel can't handle traffic.Breakfast room too small for busy times."Business center" has one dismal computer which has trouble with basic websites. Could not print boarding pass because computer didn't handle PDFs.Sink was full of previous occupant's hair. Yuck.TV channel selection was limited. Local channels, sports channels, Discovery, and Showtime.

I booked 3 rooms at this hotel and when I got there they said they only had 2 booked and their pricing was higher than guaranteed as well. The desk person was not able to do much and there was no manager on duty. Finally I got my room but at a higher price. Well when my other guests came they went to check in and what do you know--their room price was higher than mine. Again over the guaranteed pricing. Then my room was not really clean. Manager was suppose to come up and look--never showed up.Then I had a do not disturb sign on door--they still knocked.Just be careful with this hotel. Location is good; breakfast is adequate but where is the management to serve customers. There are better Hiltons in NYC than this property.

Stayed at the hotel from 10th to 18th Sept. 2012. The staff in all areas are very helpful and pleasant. The hotel location is convenient for the likes of Times Square (naturally), Madison Square Garden, Macy's, Empire State Building. A little further away you have Central Park, 5th Avenue, Chrysler Building, Grand Central Terminal, etc, etc,. Transportation connections include the Port Authority (Buses) - just around the corner; and NY Penn Station - five streets away. The hotel is very clean and tidy. Rooms are immaculate and comfortable, decent size with good facilities. The hotel has a computer room, gym, concierge, etc. The breakfast area is nice and clean with a good selection of hot and cold food, and drinks; all of a high quality. Can gladly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit New York, and would be happy to stay here again.

We Stayed for 3 nights (2 adults and 2 kids). Location wise this hotel is great. Within a walking distance from all the major attractions in mid town Manhattan. The staf are very helpful and friendly.As said in previous reviews of this hotel, the room size is ok by NY standards and also relative to the price. But...It might be ok if you are in a single bed room. We ordered and got a double queen room. I guess the room size is similar to the single bed room which makes it tiny for a double bed. This is just too small for 4 people (and at this point I must say I don't really care about NY room sizes. I want to get a decent that I can comfortably stay in). I understand Hampton's need to sell double bed rooms to families, but this room is just too small by any standard. One of the beds was 5-6 inches from the wall and the other bed was located 2 inches from the A/C. This poses an issue where the person that sleeps on that side of the bed can't get out of the bed in a normal way, there is just not enough room and when the A/C is working it is 2 inches away which makes you freeze. It is time to go to a central A/C system in these rooms if you want to maximize the space.The entire size of the room should be a bit bigger and we also didn't have the refrigerator and microwave which is standard at every other Hampton.The shower is also not that great. The water flow is just too weak.On the flip side the view from the 32nd street of the Empire State Building is great.Bottom line, with a few minor adjustments to rooms such as ours, this could be a great hotel. Currently it is still very good with most of the Hampton advantages, but it is the little things that can make it great and are currently not in place.We did enjoy our stay and would recommend this hotel but only for single bed rooms.

Probably if they gave the location as "Hell's Kitchen" it would hurt business. This hotel is a hike from Times Square, but the price is fairly reasonable for NYC and we always enjoy Hampton Inns when we travel for leisure. Our room overlooked 39th St. It was decently sized by NY standards, very clean and comfortable. Although it was New Years Day, things were kept relatively quiet and only one or two street persons came into the lobby looking for snacks. Everything we wanted to visit was walkable from here. If you are a Hampton fan and want a decently priced room in New York, consider this as one of your better options. Don't let the location turn you off.

Rooms were clean & comfortable with a nice view from our 31st floor room. Smaller than I'm used to but expected for NYC. Staff were all friendly and very helpful. Free breakfast was excellent. Free wifi too! Not a single complaint! Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights because of its great location, within walking distance to train station, bus terminal and subway. Also, convenient walk to Times Square and Central Park. The rooms at this hotel are smaller than we are familiar with at other Hampton Inns (not a problem though). Real estate is at a premium in NYC so the only way is up - 32 floors. The front of the hotel is narrow at street level, so it was a little hard to locate at first since a delivery truck was blocking the front of the hotel. The two elevators were a bit slow, we were on the 21st floor. Breakfast was great. Lots of delicious selections to pick from. Breakfast at 8:30 worked great for us. No waiting. The hotel rates were a little cheaper than other locations in the city which is a definite plus. Wonderful, friendly, helpful staff. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and enjoyed our stay. The free breakfast was great and if we were leaving earlier the takeaway breakfast was a wonderful idea. Great location, handy to Times Square and Port Authority building. The lifts became busy at rush hour but this is the only negative. Wonderful friendly heplful staff, nothing was a problem.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and booked 2 rooms with 2 double beds (8 of us). The rooms were very small and with 4 ladies and 4+ suitcases it was very cosy! I have to say I was disappointed with the size of the rooms but then if you want a good location in the heart of Manhattan then you would have to pay over the odds.The breakfast was included and it was very good, great choice of food, hot and cold. Tea and coffee available all day. The only thing is you do have to get down to breakfast early otherwise it gets very very busy and you end up having to wait for a table.Location - perfect. Only a 5 mins walk to Tims Square where you have access to all the other transport systems available to you. Port Authority Bus Terminal is only 5 minutes from the hotel, this is where we caught the bus to go to Woodbury Common - premium outlet store (1.5 hours away). Subway was a 5 min walk too.The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and more than adequate for a few nights so the size of the room was not a huge issue.Lifts are a little slow if you are on a high floor, they should have more than 2 lifts for the number of floors in this hotel (I think there were 30+ floors)Recommend this hotel purely on price as its great value and a great location.

I was realty surprised for all what I got for such a fair price and in New York City, were most hotels are terribly expensive with not such great service, and they charge you for breakfast, for Internet in your room, and all this was included in the hotel fair. Besides that, all the personel was extremely nice and gave a very good service. I stayed here because the hotel I normally go to (three times more expensive) didn't have rooms. Well, the Hampton Inn will be my hotel from now on when I am in NY, I highly recommend it.Rachel

I've just got back from spending 4 nights at the Hampton Inn during my first time in New York. The hotel was faultless and the level of customer service was excellent. The location was perfect as it was around a 5 minute walk to Times Square. We had a king room on the 4th floor which was perfect as I had informed the hotel about my fear of heights. We had booked the king sized room as we wanted to make sure that we have enough room to unpack and for our shopping. The room was a perfect size for us to relax in after a busy day sightseeing. The breakfast was very good and there was a very good choice of food, cereal, fruit. yoghurts, omlettes, waffles, croissants, muffins, bagels etc. The hotel will also give you bottled water if you ask for this. My favourite touch must have been the warm cookies that the hotel have on their front desk once you've been out all day. You can also help yourselves to tea and coffee at all times. The concierge service was excellent and arranged our transfer to the airport as we were unsure what time were being collected. The hotel also arranged for our cases to be stored securely all day on our last day.In terms of sightseeing the Empire State building is a must. We only queued for about 5 minutes so dont be fooled by the tour guides outside who will try to sell you a ticket to queue jump. If you are going to Central Park then it's worth considering whether you do want to hire bikes as you are not allowed to cycle around most of the park and there are some hills. The boat hire for the lake is great fun and only costs 12 dollars for an hour with 20 dollar refundable deposit. We ate at L'Ecole (see separate review) pne evening which is the french culinary institute. We had the 3 course meal with matching wine which was only 66 dollars each. The food was incredible and we had a lovely evening. You would need to book a table beforehand. I would recommend the tour buses as they are good value for money and can be used as a means of transport. We paid 50 dollars for a 48 hour pass which included tours of the north and south, a night tour and a boat tour passed Statue of Liberty, The company also put on a free transfer back to Times Square.We would come back to this hotel without a shadow of a doubt.

This hotel is representative of any Hampton Inn, but what stands out is the service. The fitness bike that I usually use was broken. Instead of just saying, "there is nothing we can do," the engineer took his time to adjust the bike until I could ride it. Each representative that I met went out of their way to make sure I was happy. The only improvement I would recommend is to improve the timeliness of the cleaning team. I had to wait twice for service after very long heads up to housekeeping. You won't go wrong by staying at this centrally located hotel.

We got a really great rate on this hotel through Priceline and couldn't have been happier. The location is EXCELLENT. you are within walking distance (2 big blocks) of Times Square. You have the Subway within 5 blocks in all directions which makes it very easy to get around Manhattan. We were welcomed by a friendly face at our late arrival and provided great service through check in. The rooms were small but very clean and the lobby smells great!! The breakfast was awesome with hot and cold choices and a big variety including biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, yogurt, etc. Upon departure the front desk arranged a car to the airport for us and that went smoothly. Overall, excellent place to stay!

I'm a regular to the city; sometimes I have to book last minute as I did on this trip. It's what you'd expect from an HI in Manhattan. Expensive last minute fall back. OK place but nothing special. Small but comfortable.

We had an great stay at the Hampton Inn while traveling to Manhattan for our wedding. My (now) husband and I stayed at the hotel, along with a couple of friends that stayed on the same floor. Rooms were small (as are all rooms in the city), but were a great price, very clean, and surprisingly able to accommodate a lot of luggage! Bathroom was updated/modern, but had some problems with the shower fixture (the different shower head options didn't work, and when I tried adjusting the dial, the shower head fell off and had to be screwed back on). Continental breakfast had a nice selection of fruits, breads, hot food, yogurts, and cereals. Front desk staff were exceptional, and Jose was incredibly helpful with all our transportation needs! He arranged for transportation for our entire wedding party (which included some family/friends staying at neighboring hotels) from our hotel to Central Park for the ceremony. That was one less thing we had to worry about on our wedding day, and it made a world of difference (especially since we were "out-of-towners" and traveling with aging parents, one of whom had a physical disability). Location was great -- within walking distance to Times Square and all the restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. Also very easily accessible by cab, since its near the corner of 9th. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Manhattan!

Great location. Very nice staff,helpful and friendly, including the housekeeping staff. I will stay here again! We stayed here during the US open. The breakfast is not good,but there are plenty of resturants in the area. Just ask the front desk and they will guide you.

The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are comfortable and very clean.The breakfast is excellent and the cookies with hot coffee in the lobby are a plus. Awesome!The staff is very kind, helpful and friendly. They are really worried in making our stay the best ever. Our group (24 persons) really appreciated the entire stay and we are looking forward to come back next year.
user_location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: This was a family trip for 5 nights over the Labor Day weekend. The location is very central and very busy. For those familiar with London, it is the equivalent of staying in Leicester Square! The staff were helpful, polite and always on hand to go the extra mile to ensure that our stay was enjoyable. In particular, a huge thank you to Sue Ellen and Brigette who were amazing!!! The complimentary buffet breakfast was fantastic, as there was a great deal of choice for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. The facilities on site include free wi-fi within each room and a small computer room , free local calls, a fitness centre and complimentary drinks at any time of the day. The room was a good size and very peaceful and comfortable. Both the hotel and the room were clean.

We stayed here in June 2012 for our first trip to New York! It was a wonderful hotel!! The employees were very very friendly, helpful and truly wanted us to have a great trip. The breakfast is a full breakfast with lots of options including waffles, eggs, biscuits and gravy. The hotel is located close to the bus station (not a negative like in most cities), the subway and a nice walk to Times Square! We walked almost everywhere and it was a 10 minute walk at most to see most of Manhattan. We did take a cab to certain tourist attractions, but the cab prices were reasonable and not a long trip. The room was on the small side, but they had done a great job making it feel cozy not crowded! There were 3 of us and none of us felt cramped or confined. We asked for extra towels on the first day and they made sure that every day after that we had extra towels. The beds were comfortable and the room was very very clean. No complaints at all!!I cannot say enough about the employees who were very very accommodating and willing to go the extra mile to make our stay the best! I would definitely stay here again if we return to New York. Thanks for a great visit!

The staff at this hotel were really helpful particularly the reception staff. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. We were a family of four with two small kids but had plenty of space in our room which had two queen beds. The breakfast wasn't great though that could have been more to do with our UK tastes as the other guests seemed to enjoy it. We are not into waffles and the eggs were grim but there were plenty of other options with cereal, yoghurt, fruit etc. The hotel was also very central being close to both Times Square and Central Park.I would have no problem going there again.

We stayed in NYC aprx. 7 nights and this hotel was great choice. Very close to all you need, subway, city center, Time Square, bus stops etc. Hotel services was perfect, from reception to concierge. Breakfasts are average, but contains everythig for good breakfast in sufficient quality and quantity. Room and bathroom was clean and not so small as I awaited. In general highly recomended.

This place was perfect for our needs. It was walkable to Penn Station and had a big breakfast selection. The room felt modern and very clean. The only complaint was the air conditioner was very loud when it came on throughout the night. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

The staff and the service is wonderful. The location is perfect you can walk to most of the attractions in Manhattan. Subway station is very close as are places to eat.Very nice breakfast in the morning (big selection and plenty of food), fresh baked cokies in the afternoon and cold limonade in the lobby were a big hit with the family. Looking forward to return and stay again in this hotel the next time we visit NYC.Thanks to everybody for your wonderful job!!Robert

Don't usually do reviews, but we really enjoyed our stay! Hotel was short walk to times square and all the action. Everything looked fresh and new. The continental breakfast was the best I've ever seen at any hotel chain. The staff was extremely friendly and always helpful. We used valet parking service and vehicle was safe and brought to use quickly. Yes, the elevators were busy in the mornings, but wasn't that bad of a wait really. We stayed on the 26th floor. The beds were extremely comfortable.My friend used the gym, some equipment didnt work properly, but she was able to have a good workout. Overall everything at the hotel and the whole NYC experience was greater than any of us could have imagined! I will definately use Hampton inn in the future.

Courteous and Reasonable with closeness to all. No charge to have them hold the bags while waiting for room or after checkout. Great Breakfast included and a huge dining area. Highly recommend this facility. Within walking distance and they could not have been more helpful. Knowledgeable about the city and how to get there.

Perfect location, shopping, sightseeing, it's all in walking distance. The rooms are small but very clean and confortable. Free wifi in the rooms. The breakfast is good and plenty. All the staff and the service was excellent. Ask Nicole the conciege for advice, she's fun and she knows everything. We will stay there again next year, no doubt.

I was a little nervous about staying at the Hampton Inn South Time Square, but I was pleasantly suprised. We had a generous room and it was fairly clean. The free breakfast was very good and there was plenty of food. The elevator situation was alittle annoying as there are only two elevators and it was quite busy in the morning hours. Overall I was pleased with my stay. Thank you Hampton Inn.

Even though we had a couple issues (room not available and temporary inoperable elevator, our room was on the 26th floor), the customer service at this Hampton Inn was great! Certainly once things were fixed it was even better but the kindness, understanding and compassion of the staff made it much easier!

Where to start. My wife and I were warmly welcomed by Jennifer who along with all the other staff have been really nice. The rooms are spacious enough and the beds are massive. The heat in NYC at the minute is a killer but the rooms are air conditioned. The free breakfasts are bountiful but get there early as the dining area is smallish. Not a complaint though as the breakfast is free and bottled water is provided as are cookies. We Love the city and the Hampton which by the way is a ten minute walk to times square is really handy. Loving the hotel coming back next year and bringing the kids.

Stayed here recently just for one night before heading out to the airport. The rooms are a bit smaller than average, so was a bit cozy for a family of four with two teenagers, but OK for one night.The hotel is within easy walking distance of Times Square and shops and facilities nearby, wouldn't want to spend more than a day or two here, but convenient and good value for money for short stay.We had to leave early just before breakfast started, but when we asked the hotel front desk, they organised for breakfast to open 15 minutes early just for us - thanks guys - much appreciated

Just returned from 8 nights at the hotel and was disappointed. Now I'll preface this review by saying I travel a lot ad stay at Hampton inn quite frequently and normally I'm very happy with the service and quality. Cleanliness - twice our room was not cleaned when we returned at 4 pm. Pnce they came back later and did it, the second time, even tho we aske them to return in an hr, we were my so lucky. Rooms - Don't get me started on room size!!! Perhaps my standards are not calibrated for NYC but this room was tiny even by London standards!!!!! There wasn't room for two people plus luggage in this room and the halls, corridors, elevators were no better!!!Maintenance - First thing we did upon checkin was try to take showers. Well after one the bathroom almost flooded because he shower wouldn't drain!!! Got that fixed, only to return the next day to the same problem!!! We also had he smoke alarm go off on our room, while I was showering!!! It took almost 30 mons to get someone to rescue or poor ears from the deafening alarm!!! Ad the elevators....all two of them, we're almost always running on just one due to maintenance, using them for cleaning, whatever!Location - if you eat times square, this is not quite it, but it's close, about 3 blocks away. And just one block from the subway and port authority, which is both very convenient, and annoying as rush hot subway traffic is awful going to the port authority! However, the alley this hotel is on is also shared w street vendor cart storage, so be prepared for the stench! And I also noted there was a police officer standing on guard on the corner every night....made me wonder why! Service - Finally, the front desk staff was great but beware f he concierge! One guy sent us to a subway to get to our football game, only to find out the subway didn't even go there!!! And another lady quoted us $50 over internet rates for off broadway theatre tickets!!!To summarize, this was an average Hampton Inn in a poor location. Look outside of the times square area for better quality at better pricing!!!

We stayed at this hotel in August 2012 and it served our purpose perfectly.The staff wee helpful and friendly, the rooms were super clean although a bit small but that's NYC I guess!!All guests were treated to complimentary buffet breakfast each day and the selection of hot and cold food was great. The location was excellent for the price paid, only two blocks from Times Square so with small children it was very conveniently located for us. If we ever needed a cab there was pretty much always one waiting out front. The hotel is also across from the Port Authority.

The hotel was small, but Sue Ellen and the morning manager of the breakfast place were why I would stay at the hotel again. The trip wasn't going well at first, but Sue Ellen helped us get food and turn the day around. The manager in the morning took pride in his work and was amazing to us. I really appreciated him.

We spent two nights at at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South in mid-May and were quite pleased with our stay. Although we were initially surprised to encounter such a small hotel lobby, only two clerks working the reception desk (check-in/check-out lines can form), typical New York micro-sized rooms (but highly efficient), and two slower-than-molasses antiquated elevators servicing 32 floors (which seemed to stop at every floor), we found everything else much to our liking. Our immaculate and blissfully quiet room included all the superb amenities that Hampton Inns are known for including fabulously comfortable beds, wifi, use of an exercise room, and a high quality, abundant, and varied complimentary hot breakfast in the morning. Our concierge was attentive, informative, and hospitable--he took plenty of time with us to make sure we understood directions to sights, was eager to store our luggage when the need arose, and handed out freshly-baked cookies when he felt we needed a pick-me-up after a long day of trekking about the town. I can't say enough about the location--the hotel is located on W. 39th Street between 8th and 9th, is two blocks from Penn Station, and four blocks from Time Square and the main subway line 1. From our hotel, we could walk to our Broadway show in the evening and return to our room afterwards on a fully lit and seemingly safe street. The room rates are competitively priced and well worth the luxury of being able to walk to main attractions, shopping, shows, and subway lines. We will definitely return next time we need a place to stay in Manhattan.

My family and myself came here in August, the hotel provided us with everything. From an amazing breakfast to a good location, this hotel had it all. The staff was really friendly and were always in a great mood. The staff was always trying to help you. The breakfast was buffet and there was different food every day; the breakfast helped because then you wouldn't have to go searching around the town for good breakfast. The room was good. If we were to come back again we would stay at this hotel. We have no complaints.

Second year we've stayed at this hotel and both times thoroughly enjoyed our stay. You will be hard pressed to find a sub $300 per night room which offers such hospitality, cleanliness, free wifi and free breakfast. We arrived at a busy time and pulled up front to find no valet staff, but the moment we got to the front desk, people rushed to get us checked in and took care of our car. It was literally less than 5 minutes by the time we unloaded our bags and were standing by the elevator with our room keys. The hotel is typical for a NYC renovated studio apartment building gone hotel with only 2 elevators, very small rooms and small lobby, but we chose to stay at this hotel again because of the staff and the cleanliness of the the rooms. I can't say enough about the staff. They are very friendly and always hard working. I asked about the ingredients in one of the breakfast foods (due to a food allergy) and am usually greeted with the "it's fine or I don't know", but was pleasantly surprised when a staff member on her own initiative went online to locate the ingredient list from the distributor and handed me a printed sheet.
