Location was very good, traveled with young kids and the walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Ctr wasn't too bad, anything beyond that we cabbed it. If this is your first time to NYC don't expect the glamor of being right off Central Park, this hotel's between 8th and 9th ave, with 9th ave seemingly a bit more deserted at night being near the entrance to the Lincoln tunnel. However, we felt safe at all times and the kids enjoyed the convenience of being near their favorite shops and restaurants. Thanks Hampton.

I had a business trip in Manhattan, and being a Hilton Diamond member, but also being on a business trip budget, I chose the Hampton Inn Manhattan Time Square South hotel. I orginally wanted the Times Square North location, because it had better reviews, but the south location was $40 less a night, closer to the train station, so I figured how bad could it be?Pro'sClose to the train stationClean roomsFriendly StaffCon'sTwo elevators for 32 floors - ONE WAS OUT OF SERVICETiny hallwaysOnly two check in/out clerks at the desk - One was working when I checked inSo, only 3 Cons - not bad, right? WRONG. My check in was over 30 minutes since one check in clerk was not at the desk. The line was to the door. The elevator situation, if both are working is an issue. When one was out of service (per the front desk clerk), it can take more than 20 minutes to get to/from your room. And I was lucky - my floor was a high one, so I could sqeeze in to get down to the lobby. The elevator stopped at almost every floor, and many unlucky guests couldnt fit on. I will NOT stay here again

This was my first stay at this NYC hotel (August 03 - 06, 2012), and I was impressed! There is a culture of hospitality and service that is often only seen in select five-star hotels. Every hotel employee (and I mean absolutely everyone) seemed to go out of his/her way to make my stay enjoyable. The room had modern decor and was furnished well. It was of typical NYC size but still comfortable. The morning breakfast was good with the hot item options changing each morning of my stay. Many have previously commented about the wait time on elevators which did seem to be an issue for hotel guests. I stayed on the the third floor and used the stairs instead.If you are looking for a clean modern hotel in a great location with 5-star service for a much lower price, then consider staying at the Hampton Inn Manhattan - Times Square South. I doubt you will be disappointed!

Everyone at this hotel should be praised. Everyone was extremely attentive and nice. The Conseiger were very helpful and really versed. I would definitely use this hotel again if I were to travel to NYC.

We stayed here for 3 nights with 2 kids ages 12 & 15 and despite small rooms found it to be very comfortable. I have to say the front desk staff were very friendly. Greeted us coming and going. The breakfast was ample and I saw staff always cleaning up. We, too, felt very safe. Was great central location with easy access to subway. Didn't utilize the concierge more than a couple quick questions but he didn't seem very friendly and didn't seem to want to go out of his way. . We did have to wait for elevators at peak times on the weekend but really no issues midweek. It did take until late in the day for our room to be cleaned and one day they had run out of washcloths. Despite small issues we would definitely stay here again.

We read some reviews on this hotel before booking; it was between the HI Times Square North and South. The HI North was much more expensive, and this hotel was a bit smaller. We read reviews about bad breakfasts and slow elevators, but when we arrived, we were VERY pleasantly surprised! The staff was very friendly and helpful! We arrived much earlier than check in and checked out with several hours before our taxi arrived, and they were glad to store our luggage for us. We NEVER had to wait on an elevator. The room was quiet and restful after our busy days in the city, and the breakfasts were nothing less than the great breakfasts we always enjoy at Hampton Inns! There is a great little Italian restaurant across the street as well.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn. It's located on 39th between 8th and 9th. There are several other hotels on the block. Comfort Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Westin. There are 32 floors with only like 6 rooms on each floor. Rooms are very small but we did have 4 people. I felt very safe and would let my 12 yr old son go to the breakfast room or to the work out room along with no worries. There is a nice little deli/store 2 doors down for snacks and drinks. Breakfast was very good with a very big selection. Luis the Front Desk manager was VERY helpful. We could usually get a taxi in the morning but in the evenings they were scarce. You are a 4 block walk from Times Square and the main subway line 1. Would for sure stay there again. It's pricey but so is every other hotel in NYC. oh and P.S. The beds are awesome!!!!!

My son and I had the pleasure of staying one night at this hotel. Not only is the location very convenient (two small blocks from Penn Station and right in Times Square), the rooms are clean and quiet, the staff is very friendly, helpful, and professional. The breakfast was fantastic-tons of choices from hot foods to cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit. A plus is the ability to stash your bags if you arrive too early for check-in. I am already booking another stay at this hotel for my upcoming visit to the big apple!

My wife and 2 kids stayed 5 days/4 nights at this exceptional hotel just 2 blocks away from Penn station and the subway, and middle of Times Square. The location is excellent but what is better is the top notch staff. For 5 days, every single staff (from the front desk to the folks serving the breakfast) were friendly and make us feel welcome. The New York size rooms are similar to other hotels - compact but very efficient. Awesome breakfast buffet and enjoy the freshly baked cookies. You cannot go wrong by selecting this hotel and we will certainly stay there again.

My daughter and I stayed there this weekend Aug 2nd, 2012 and had her passport and my wallet, credit cards etc stolen right out of our room! Be WARE of housekeeping staff bc when I looked up "stolen wallet at Hampton Inn" on google I could not believe all the reviews. This Hampton Inn apparently contracts out their housekeeping staff so they're are even their employees. Who knows if this hired firm does solid background checks on staff? The idiot used my Amex at a gas station in Queens so I am obtaining the surveilance cameras to catch him/her and turn into the police but overall I am very disappointed. The GM of the hotel hasn't even contacted me to apologize. Terriable way to end our girls trip to NY. Don't stay here.

I stayed here for one night while traveling on business. It was exactly what I needed - clean, comfortable room. Every staff member I encountered was just as friendly as could be. Special thanks to Front Desk Agent Brittany for her warm welcome and handy information upon my arrival. As others have noted, the free (hot!) breakfast is an incredible value. Keep it up, Hampton Inn Times Square South! You have a beautiful property, and I will gladly recommend you to friends and colleagues!

Front desk staff was professional and helpful at check late on a Saturday afternoon. Room was on 25th floor. Very quiet and very clean. The bedspread was freshly laundered which is a real plus compared to other hotels. Breakfast included authentic NY bagels along with standard Hampton Inn breakfast choices. Concierge was extremely helpful in obtaining great seats for a Saturday night Broadway show. I will return to this hotel during my next NYC trip.

I have nothing but awesome things to say about this hotel. Close to Times Square and subways. Despite other reviews we had no problem with elevators, noise, room size, etc. Front desk staff was awesome. I am pretty picky about hotel rooms and I think this place was clean, well mantained, etc. Would definitely stay there again.

We Visited NY for vacation and stayed 1 week in the Hampton Inn Times Square South.The hotel is right in the Center of Manhattan and a perfect location to start your sightseeing trips.The staff is very friendly and courteous.Breakfast is typically American with Bagels, Toasts, a lot of sweet stuff, omelette, waffles etc.Nothing special but way enough.We would always recommend the hotel.

Great service from all staff. Stayed 3 nights this week. Location is 5 mins walk to times square and 3 mins to subway to WTC. Complimentary breakfast is great. Complimentary cookies in reception made my kids smile. Personally I was hooked on the again..complimentary fresh lemonade in lobby in the late afternoons - brilliant. To balance this review... Rooms are exceptionally tiny and lifts take forever. But would not let that deter me from staying again.

We booked two rooms for our two families. We arrived late and Jennifer at the front desk was great about getting our rooms close together. Unfortunately the rooms are very small and honestly it felt like only one person could be up and moving around at a time. We came back to our room late one day at 430 and housekeeping still hadnt been there yet. Terribly long waits for elevators. Not usually one to complain but if it weren't for Jennifer stay would have been awful.

All I had to go on were the reviews and its location. I needed to be somewhere within a easy walk of Times Square, close to Javits Convention center and within a tight budget. The Hampton Inn Manhattan South was this and more of what I forgot I needed like a good nights sleep and a friendly staff. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by the manager. He said we have the room type you requested waiting. My only request was a quiet room and in New York, I know this is a tought request. The room was very quiet. I was not on the street side so that may have helped. It was a perfect location for my needs. I heard some complaints about the elevators but I found that it was not that much of a problem. The room itself was plenty roomy for a New York Hotel. The breakfast was good enough and the staff kept things clean and had a good attitude. I wouldnt hesitate a bit to stay at this hotel again.

Our family of 4 stayed here during Memorial Day weekend 2012. We were very pleased.The staff is top rate. It seems as though the human resources office takes great care to hire friendly, caring, happy staff. Everyone was very friendly, helpful, and always smiling and seeking to help. I can't say enough good things about how the staff of this hotel does a great great job. This makes this hotel top rate. The room rate was reasonable. There is a concierge at the front and the free cookies in the evening are delicious. The room is rather small...but who cares. You don't stay in Times Square to sit in your room. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is only a short walk to Penn Station, Times Square, the Empire State Bldg, Madison Square Garden and other attractions. There are a number of subway stops close by...in particular, the 42nd street station is great for getting around Manhattan as well as taking the 7 train to Queens/New York Mets stadium. New York is easy to get around...all you need is a subway map.And speaking of New York...the Big Apple has some of the friendliest people in the world. What a town. I don't know why this city has the reputation for having cold people. Not true AT ALL. New York makes you want to visit over and over again. There are a gazillion things to see and do. The energy and excitement in the air gave us the fortitude to walk from 34th street all the way to 88th street and we never got tired. As an aside - the line at the Empire State Building can be ridiculously long and the view at the top, while nice, isn't really worth that super long wait. There are no chairs, benches or anything to sit on while you wait. And it is a looooong wait. There are air conditioner units that are tempting to sit on, but they have these ragged edges that seem to have been put there so you won't sit down and rest. That's cruel.I can't find a bad thing to say about this hotel.

We had a wonderful fourth of July stay! The staff was extremely helpful with our bags and reading the subway maps. We loved the variety at the breakfast buffet. We were in a perfect location for Times Square, the theatres and Central Park and a straight line on the subway to all the sites! We will definitely be back.

Hotel was excellent in NYC. The king room is a little small compared to other Hampton Inns across the US, but that is expected in NYC. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Upon arriving before check-in was allowed and after checking out, the hotel was very accommodating in storing our bags for us and did not charge a fee for doing so. I was asked if a computer was in one bag (it was) and they locked that bag up).Review is based upon staying in room 1303.The bathroom was very clean. No mold or stuff pealing off anywhere. The entire room was clean and no dirt or signs of wear were showing.The breakfast was fully stocked, even during the rush periods. It is a little cramped, but there was a table always available.The only downside of this hotel was the elevators. The lobby is small (again expected in NYC in hotels like this) and often during rush periods (check-in, check-out), you would wait for the elevator for a while. Upon checking in, we waited about 8 minutes to get in the elevators. The elevators are not terribly slow, but there are only two and lots of people and thus there can easily be a wait. The hotel seemed to only have 6 rooms per floor with about 32 floors. (It's tall but narrow). This seemed to contribute to the elevator problems (had to stop at many floors). There is a stairwell though, so doing down is usually easier via the stairs.Overall, a great hotel. I would definitely stay again and have zero hesitations about recommending it.

Great price considering the very convenient location to Times Square. The continental breakfast selection was exceptional.The room was clean and had all necessities including WiFi.Certainly would return.

We were alittle conservative about our expectations. But we are an advocate for the Hilton chain so we decided to try them out. I enjoyed my stay. The room was clean, neat and recently updated. The staff were courteous,very helpful and attentive. It was a pleasure to stay there. It was centrally located to everything. The heart of Times Sqaure was just a few blocks over. Would I stay here again?!? Highly likely... I highly reccomend it. It doesn't come with alot of bells and whistles and there is room for improvements. However it is clean, infact cleaner than one of the world renowned 5 stars hotels I have stayed. The staff members are very friendly, so what more could you ask for when you're on vacation in the greatest city ever.Drawbacks the elevators are slow and they only have 1 elevator bay that services the entire 32 floors.

The hotel was perfect for a 4 day city break. It's clean, the staff was very attentive and one day we had a problem with the air conditioning which was solved immediately. Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but the beds are big and comfy and the bathroom is nice. The only downside was that our room was close to the ice machine and we kept on hearing people coming to get ice during the night.The breakfast was full of choices and they made changes every day in the menu so that you don't get bored if staying longer. Plus they have freshly baked cookies every day at the reception :). We had a late flight when we left, so they stored our luggage for us and they offered to help us with transportation to the airport, but we decided that we would use the public transportation system which was more than convenient.The location is as good as it gets: a subway station right around the corner (with a direct line to the train for the airport) to get anywhere in the city, including during the night. The hotel was situated in a small street (very quiet for that area of the city), but it was a max 10 min walk to Times Square, plus it is very close to all the theaters.Tip: there was a very good Italian restaurant (Carbone) with excellent food and very decent prices right on W 38th street.

This was a great hotel for the location and the price. Very convenient to subway. The room was comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast was very nice and had a well-varied spread. Check-out was surprisingly late - 12 pm, which is unusual for most hotels especially NYC. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the elevators. There were 2 that serviced the entire 39 floors and we were on the top floor. This would be helped by service elevators because guest and personnel share the same elevators.

We moved here from the Holiday Inn Express next door after experiencing problems with their elevators and wished that we had stayed here from the start. It was the usual Hampton Inn excellent standard and given that it was within walking distance of Times Square and 42nd Street, it was excellent value for money and we got a great rate just by walking in and asking. Breakfast was busy but not too crowded and the air conditioning was great especially as we hit New York during that heatwave. Fully recommended for an inexpensive stay in central NYC in comfort. A special note of thanks to the reception staff who gave great assistance in our move from the Holiday Inn Express (I believe that these are sister hotels).

My husband & I stayed here with our son during a heat wave in June! The hotel was a cool haven from the oven we left behind as we walked through the door! The cookies and iced drinks were just what we needed after a day of sightseeing.Reception & concierge staff were friendly & helpful. The hotel is tall & narrow - just 6 rooms on each floor. We were on the 27th floor. The room was compact for the 3 of us - but you get that in a lot of New York hotels. The room was spotless and the bedding & towels changed every day. Nice & quiet outside the room. A bit of a wait at busy times for the lift, but not a problem. The free breakfast was adequate for setting us up for the day.Highly recommended.

This is a very busy hotel- Staff was always nice and rooms were very clean. Breakfast was just a little above average and very crowded at times. It seems that you are in competition with the cleaning staff for the elevators- not their fault with only two elevators for guests and staff. Close to all the fun things down town. I don't know if it was just my room or all rooms are very small. Difficult to pass a person sitting at the desk without climbing over the bed.

We stayed 7 nights at the Hampton Inn,The first impression was very good, a quick check in with a pleasant desk staff member, The room was very clean,and the beds were firm. Breakfast was ok but not special,and at times very busy !The Location of the hotel is perfect for visiting New York,a few blocks from Time square, the Metro at 150 meters , a lot of restaurants in the neighborhood.Very pleasant the fresh flowers and the apples in the lobby.
Me and my husband stayed there for 2 nights five stars clean,great staff and even hot cookies from 4-7 pm we loved it and we will stay again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was a clean, well run hotel. The location could not have been better for tourists who wanted easy access to Times Square. The free breakfast was completely adequate and far exceeded the standard fare of danishes and bagels found at most chain hotels. Rooms were smalls, but could accommodate a family of four. The staff was friendly and polite. We were on the 12th floor and had no problem with street noise, however the elevator service is limited and slow (it's a small hotel, with even smaller elevators.)

We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and chose this hotel for location and price. We thoroughly read the reviews and it helped us make a decision to stay here. Upon arrival the check in process was effecient and our room was in excellent shape. The place appears new and everything mechanically is spot on. The A/C worked perfectly during the heat wave. Bathroom shower hot and excellent pressure. Room was tight for 3 adults and a child. The breakfast was awesome and if you don't wait until 10 minutes before closing time you will not find it hard to get a seat. The only negative and the reason why I did not give this a 5 is because of the room service. Since there were 4 of us, towels were at a premium. (no extras) We took showers in the morning, placed towels on floor because we were to see a show that evening. We wanted to take a second shower after being in the heat all day. At 4pm no room service yet. At 5 we asked for towels and finally at 530 had to go downstairs to get them ourselves. The room did not get cleaned until after 7 as we left for the show and came back and it had been somewhat organized. (not really cleaned). The next night the room did not get cleaned until after 5pm. (again marginally). The room was cleaned nicely on our last night. The rooms are small and I am sure it is difficult to clean these rooms when there are 4 people staying in them. Would I stay here again? Definitely. Would I stay here again and have 4 of us in the same room? No. Rooms too small.

My wife and I stayed here for a quick weekend stay.Our goal was to do some sightseeing in the City during the day and see a Broadway show at night. The Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square South is a nice clean and friendly boutique hotel. The service was good and the free breakfast buffet was very nice too. The rooms are a but small, but typical for a boutique hotel. Our only complaint was we had a hard time catching an elevator going down during peak hours, as the hotel was fully booked the weekend we stayed. Luckily we were on the 6th floor and took the stairs. The hotel location is close to the Port Authority bus terminal and not to far from Times Square.
Great service, pleasant staff, clean rooms and a great breakfast. We were surprised at how quiet the room was and everything was perfect.

I read some regular and bad reviews before booking and was hesitating about it. Despite what I read, I booked and i am so happy I did it!!! The service was great, specially from Joan. She is so gentle and made us feel very welcomed.The room was clean, the location awesome and breakfast good too. I have been several times on 5 star hotels and found this one a very good option to stay in Manhattan for next time.Thank you Joan!

The rooms were small (like most hotels in NYC), BUT the beds were super clean and comfy! The front desk staff is exceptional! Calvin and Brittany at the front desk could not be nicer or more helpful. The breakfast was great- every day there were different egg dishes (omelettes or scrambled aggs) and hot waffles you could make yourself with a waffle press (my kids loved using this!) Fruit, baked goods, fresh oatmeal, juice- great selection and lots of seating for guests. Having access to coffee all daynd fresh baked cookies in the afternoon in the lobby was also great. Very nice (small) fitness center. Great location- we were able to walk all over the city and get to the most popular areas by foot, including Times Square, Broadway, and the Circle Line Cruise. I would try and book a room with queen beds next timeI believe the Hampton Times Square North has them), but this was a nice little spot to stay in.

My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for a long weekend about a week ago. We were totally impressed by the total staff's commitment to customer service. Mimi was absolutely amazing along with Kelvyn, Brdgett, Evalgeline and Jose. They were always accommodating to our every request from answering our questions about local restaurants, asking for travel directions, to giving us water bottles for our day trips. Everything was done with a smile. The hotel had a great location to mid-town and Times Square. The hotel room was roomy for New York standards. It was very clean and everything was in perfect working order. We really appreciated the location, the friendly greeting every time we came back from a fun day in the Big Apple and our comfortable room. The Breakfast crew should also get mentioned here. They were very accommodating as well to any request. They were very friendly and asked how we were enjoying NYC. They added to our total experience at this hotel. This is one of the Best Hampton experiences I have ever had. My wife will return here in the future. I am a raving fan of this hotel and their staff.

Hampton inn times square south was great value for money. The staff were helpful and friendly and the rooms were always spotless. The free breakfast, whilst quite simple, was convenient. I would stay there again.

Phenomenal staff -- so accommodating and friendly! Entire hotel was well appointed and very clean. Huge breakfast (including hot items) which was unexpected but very much appreciated. (I stayed in the Hampton Inn Times Square North a couple years ago, and the free breakfast was very basic.)

What a great hotel! The staff makes the difference. Front desk folks extremely friendly and always helpful. Same for lovely ladies in the breakfast area, always with a smile, greeting, and friendly hand. Housekeeping is excellent - although we left Do Not Disturb on door, they left extra towels and sundries in a plastic bag at our door. Small rooms, but theis is because they are maximizing the building space, and hey - it's NYC. Excellent location, short walk to Time Square. Oh - did I mention how perfect the friendly staff folks are? They don't seem like New Yorkers to me.. Maybe just well trained due to the excellent management at this superior hotel. thanks, and please - keep up the good work.

We found ourselves in NYC for 1 Saturday night with no reservations. We called the DoubleTree which was sold out. They offered to book us at the Hampton Inn Times Sq South. A quick check of trip advisor showed good ratings and the price was under $200. I was skeptical but so pleasantly surprised. We were greeted promptly and pleasantly at the front desk where they informed us that we had been upgraded to a room w. a view (a glimpse of the river). The room was small but as I understand large by NYC standards. It appeared to have been newly renovated. Granite countertop in the bathroom, a great walk-in shower with glass doors. The room had a king size bed with fresh, crisp linens. Flat screen tv ( just a few channels) and free wi-fi!! Continental breakfast was included. I will definitely stay here the next time I am in the Big Apple!!

I have stayed at this location numerous times for expos at the Javits Center and it's always been great. But I was disappointed with my recent stay.I had booked a king size bed and had the confirmation to prove it, but they said they were out and gave me two double beds. Not a huge deal, but it's disappointing when you don't get what you paid for.One night during my stay, I returned to my room at 4:30 and housekeeping still hadn't been through. Again, not a huge deal, but disappointing. I needed to work in my room until 6pm so I called down, let them know I'd be in the room until then and asked for them to ensure they'd service the room by the time I returned. I began my conference call and housekeeping came. They said they left at 6pm so if I wanted to get my room cleaned, it had to be now.While the hotel is clean and the rooms are a decent size, as a business traveler, I expect certain things. Like receiving the room type I paid for and having my room cleaned at a decent hour.

We stayed here or four consecutive nights. You couldn't ask for a more accommodating staff than the workers at this hotel! Polite, efficient, catering to your requests, always wearing smiles, they are a well trained group. From the front desk, to the breakfast kitchen staff, to the young men who were there to carry luggage, etc, -- all were great! The hotel is well situated for a brief 15 minute walk to Times Square. The facility itself is clean and neat but sometimes getting up and down on two elevators may require a wait. But overall this is a nice place for the price and we would stay there gain.

Stayed here to go to a show which was close by. The location for sightseeing and theater is great. The hotel was clean, quiet, and the morning brunch was plentiful and tasty. The concierge was very helpful, and the bellman was superb. Would definitely stay again.

I was eating breakfast when I happened to mention to my wife that there were no cookies last night because a tour of teenagers hit check-in and wiped them out. It was a tongue-in-cheek comment. A few minutes later one of the staff, Louis, come by our table and dropped off an aluminum foil wrapped package and left without a word. Inside were four cookies! I was floored. Louis had overheard my comment and was attentive enough to correct the situation and discreet enough to leave the cookies quietly. Five Stars to Louis and the staff that trained him. Thank you.

We often stay outside the city when we come to town for a theater trip, but this was a special occasion and we wanted to stay in town. We got a decent rate with parking, and thought we would give this property a try. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and allowed us to drop off the car and our luggage early so that we could make it to a matinee. The room was a typical, small Manhattan double-double, with a bit of a musty smell, but we found the location convenient and the room generally clean and pleasant, and would return.

Very handy to The Square, Broadway stages, subway, and Restaurant Row. Staff were very helpful. Rooms a bit small, but typical for NYC. Fair amount of construction across the street, but did not distract from the stay. Elevator wait time was not near the problem that has been mentioned in the other reviews.We stayed for 5 nights.

We stayed for 5 nights and have nothing but positive comments about this Hampton.The location is excellent--central & secure. Our 6th floor room on the the back side was more than adequate - very clean & quiet with a fairly nice view & lots of light (the windows actually open!). The comfortable king bed allowed for more floor space in the room. Breakfast was better than we expected from earlier reviews. It can get crowded but it is very well managed and the plentiful bar is always well stocked. The old fashioned hot oatmeal was our favorite each day. Best of all---the helpful, friendly & competent staff. When we arrived before check-in time we were welcomed to relax & enjoy breakfast. Our luggage was safely stored so we were free to explore nearby until a room was ready. Jaipaul at the front desk was particularly courteous and always helpful.We were happy taking the subway & walking but were surprised to see a parking garage. All and all, for the theater & NYC sightseeing this Hampton is an excellent property and value.

A little west side gem a few blocks from Times Square. Spotless rooms, maybe a bit small but adequate, free wi-fi, comfortable bed, nice room amenities, quiet and relaxing, business center, and a gym. Friendly, super-helpful concierge and staff. I have stayed in some of the ritziest, very pricey hotels in NYC and by far, the staff at this little Hampton Inn could teach the Fifth Avenue lah-de-dahs a few things!! Plus-they include a full breakfast buffet! Not just coffee and muffins-omelets, waffles, fruits, oatmeal, pastries-really a wonderful breakfast spread, with the coffee/tea bar with fruit and yogurt available all day. I was really impressed! The location was convenient, a great parking garage was right across the street, subways nearby, all in all, a very pleasant stay. Hampton Inn will be my first go-to hotel choice when I need to spend a few days again in Manhattan.

I just stayed here for 6 nights, for a convention at the Javits Center. There are pros and cons, but overall, I enjoyed my stay here, and would stay here again.Pros:- Convenient to a lot of subway stations, and you can walk to the Javits Center in under 10 minutes. I thought this was a great benefit as you know you can arrive there on time without having to deal with traffic. The Javits shuttle also stops right outside of the door, and it's the last stop before getting to the center (so you may have to stand, but it's nonstop from here to the Javits). This came in handy one day when it was pouring rain.- Decently sized room. I had a king bed room. Only crowded part was working at the desk, as the chair was wedged in between the bed and the desk. Bathroom is smaller than normal, with not a lot of space to put things around the sink, but I put up the ironing board as extra "shelf" space.- Breakfast is very plentiful, with a rotating cast of hot menu items (eggs, ham/sausage, etc.) along with some standards like hot oatmeal (not instant), really good muffins, fresh fruit- Friendly staff- Quiet - I was on the side facing away from street, and couldn't really hear any major noise, just maybe white noise from other air conditioning units.- Complimentary wi-fi and wired internet access that was of good speed, plus business center with printer in the lobby.- Coffee always available. I thought there would be fruit available outside of breakfast, but there wasn't. Also I only saw fresh baked cookies one day - chocolate chocolate chip Otis Spunkmeyer, even though it was mentioned in the letter I got as Gold (see below).- No upgrade as HHonors Gold because the hotel was fully booked, but got a water bottle and package of cookies plus a letter in a gift bag, even though I selected 250 points as my amenity.- Really comfortable bed - a Hampton Inn standard.Cons:- The wait for elevators can be really bad sometimes. The reviews here are true - there are 32 floors but only 6 rooms per floor, and only 2 elevators. I found wait times were worst in the afternoon after check-in time. In this case, having a lower floor might be better since you don't have to stop as many times go get to your floor.- The hot water in the shower seemed a bit lukewarm sometimes at night, but would turn up to full temp after 5 minutes or so.- No in-room safe- Natural light not so great when facing away from street (the building across the way, a virtually identical 4-pack hotel building like the 3-pack that the Hampton is in, is a good distance away, but there just isn't enough space for good natural light).

I stayed here on a weekend stay with another girlfriend and all I can say is this was one of my BEST experiences EVER in NYC. Not only was the hotel clean, well located and had all we needed in terms of amenities (Gym, business center, Wi-FI all over) The thing that stood out the most was the how f friendly, courteous and helpful the staff was THROUGHOUT our stay. I would go back anytime and plan to!

We were guests at this location last weekend, and were overall very pleased with our stay. The room was a nice size, and the bathroom was fairly large. We were especially pleased with the size of the shower.Usually in the price range of this hotel you don't really get much service, but the desk staff were very helpful, and they even had a concierge on staff to assist you if needed. I can't comment on the breakfast, as we didn't take advantage of that. With all the restaurants in New York, we decided to take advantage of those! We did have a warm cookie one afternoon, though.My only negative comment was the way the room was cleaned the second day. It looked as though it was a rush job, and they really only pulled the covers up on the bed and put clean towels in the bathroom. Not a big deal, but they did a much more thorough job the first day.I'd stay here again....the location is great and the rooms are a good size for Manhattan.

Couldn't find a better location for our purposes - right in the theatre district. Good selection to eat at breakfast buffet, but be there EARLY since it is busy and chaos reigns once everyone is up and hungry.

This is a great hotel for the price. The staff is courteous, the rooms are clean, and they also offer great breakfast. Some of the reviews say the hallways are small, which is true, but this is a New York hotel. The spaces are going to be small.The location is superb. I recommend this hotel!

A friend and I stayed @ the Hampton Inn Time Square South 5-6-12 / 5-10-12. It was my 1st stay @this hotel. It was a wonderful stay! The staff was so friendly and professional. I can't say enough about what great people they are!The hotel and rooms are clean and it's the perfect location in my opionion. Breakfast was great and there was plenty of it. The beds are so comfortable. I normally stay @ the Double Tree @ 47th &7th.. But this Hampton Inn is my new and only 1st choice!

My husband and I visited New York for the first time and as business travelers this hotel was recommended.Pros;Location(close to Times Square and restaurant row)CleanlinessGreat staff(kelvin and Luis at front desk were really helpful!)Coffee always onFree wifi,breakfast,bottled water and cookies!Cons;Small shower and bath towelsVending machines are in the basement rather than in lobby

This was our first trip to the Big Apple. We found that the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. Our thermostat had a malfunction and the maintiance person was there within 5 minutes to repair. The breakfast was very tastey with many choices.

In summation, this is a five-star experience in a two/three star hotel! And when it comes right down to it, I've had two-star experiences in some five-star hotels in NYC which can't match Hampton Inn TS South. The outstanding, friendly staff and the spotlessly clean and fully refurbished property are a fantastic value. For me, the best reason to stay here was its close location to both the bus terminal and the subway. Being able to walk to Times Square is a big bonus if you are in tourist mode. I know others may have had problem with elevator wait times but I personally didn't. Free breakfast and afternoon cookies were a nice touch. They will hold your bags pre and post check-in so you can get some last-minute shopping in. I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again. I went solo this trip and had no problems walking around the area at night.

This hotel has all the basics you will need. Very clean, eager to please staff, and great breakfast (oatmeal, eggs, yogurt, breads, good coffee) to start your day. The location is on a dingy part of 39th St., but is a short walk to many attractions. Room was clean, but very small for 4 people. Staff was extremely friendly, but not always correct with information they handed out. They did recommend a nice little authentic Italian restaurant across the street (Mercato) which was outstanding!! We were concerned when leaving for the airport we would not be able to get a taxi as it was raining very hard. Jose Cuello (bellman) said he would arrange a hotel car for us which was cheaper than the taxi!! It would have been nice to know this was an option earlier so we wouldn't have wasted so much time worrying about it. If you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced place to lay your head - this fits the bill. Daily newspaper arrived only 1 day out of 3.

I loved staying at the Hampton Inn-Times Square South! The first thing I noticed when I walked into the lobby was how CLEAN it was! It also smelled like freshly baked cookies (which are free by the way!) The staff was all very friendly. Every time we came in, they said hello. Every time we left they told us to have a good day/evening.I've read a ton of reviews about how "tiny" the rooms are. I tend to get claustrophobic so I was a bit worried. I was pleasantly surprised! We had four people staying in our room with 2 double beds and it wasn't uncomfortable at all! It was fine for sleeping and showering.I've stayed in different NYC hotels and this room was by far the nicest and cleanest. The decor was beautiful too. There was a free hot breakfast, which was amazing!! Eggs, bacon, ham, bagels, etc. The breakfast attendants were so nice too!The only downside was the elevators are really slow (we waited 15 minutes to get one Friday night). The area outside looks a little sketchy, but was certainly not scary at all. We came back after midnight and there were lots of "normal" people just walking around.I would definitely stay in this hotel again!!

First time staying in this hotel, and I will return. Very friendly and welcoming staff, clean rooms that felt fine for size, especially by Manhattan standards, comfy bed and nice bathroom. Great location for midtown/Times Square activities. All New York hotels are pricey, but this is a good deal by Manhattan comparisons. I'll be back in November :-)

We recently spent 6 nights in NYC and enjoyed our stay at Hampton Inn. The staff was the best I have encountered anywhere (world wide), from the front desk to cleaning staff, breakfast staff and concierge. Quick and convenient luggage storage is provided for early check in or late check out. They allowed us extra room time at no charge on the day of check out as we had an evening flight home. I could not have asked for a better place to stay. Rooms are small (expected in NYC) but very comfortable and clean with only 8 rooms on each floor. This made it quiet and private. Breakfast was good, well stocked and well tended but crowded. The line could be more efficient by providing a better toaster (or two!) and moving the waffle maker to a less congested corner but the convenience and value overshadowed any small congestion issues. This hotel will top my list of where to stay on return trips. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

I've stayed at this Hampton for 2 conferences at the Javitz. The walk to/from is very easy. It is also close enough to walk to Times Square, Central Park, and Chelsea. It is a very nice hotel with a very attentive staff. Top to bottom they do a great job with cleanliness, breakfast, etc. They welcome you with some treat every evening. The elevators can be slow during the rush hours. The hotel offers no view at all. Both years my view was the building out back through a grey alleyway.
My family and I stayed for three nights and had a wonderful time. Rooms were small (as expected) but very clean and the staff was so nice . We would stay again in a heartbeat!

Stayed here for a last minute trip to NY, the location is great and service was good as well, in general everybody was super friendly.Breakfast was a truly mad house, but the staff try to maintained the area clean but the space didn't help much, so the earliest you can go down the better.After being on line to get the food, and having rude people reaching over my tray went to sit and a hair(not mine) was in my scramble eggs. Other than that the location is great and I definitely will stay there again.

My husband and I were in NYC for the NFL draft and really this was a perfect hotel for us. We were a little further than ideal for Radio City Music Hall, but I knew this upon booking. The staff was incredible and helpful and being 4 1/2 months pregnant on the first night we arrived my husband called to ask about vending machines and they sent up 2 bottles of water for us, no charge! They helped us when it came to directions and getting around town. The room was small but really we didn't come to NYC to hang out in our hotel the whole time so as long as we had a bed and shower we were satisfied. The bed and the sheets were so comfortable and my husband and I slept like babies! The hotel was close to Times Square and Broadway and provided a nice walk to really see a lot of the city. The breakfast was fantastic! It was more than just bagels and cereal and the staff really kept up with the amount of food and the people. Anyone who had previous comments about the breakfast being insuffiecient is crazy. I don't know where you eat that is included in the price that you get this amount of breakfast, we really didn't need to eat lunch! My husband and I agreed when we come back to NYC this is the hotel we will stay at.

This place is great. The room was clean, good size for NYC and good location. Close to theaters and time square. Good subway connections. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. And, the prices are very reasonable for NYC.

This hotel is within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Central Park. It is well-kept and has an amazing breakfast every morning included! Everyone on the staff was friendly, helpful, and welcoming. We walked everywhere we wanted to go from here and always felt safe even at 11 p.m. at night! I highly recommend staying here!
exteremely friendly and helpful front lobby staff, as always a good breakfast as the staff continued to maintain it until closing

This was a Birthday treat for my hubby and as we checked in he was wished a Happy Birthday from the staff. There was a huge cup cake and a card relaying a Birthday wish for him so that was a lovely start to our holiday here. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the Hotel nice and clean and the rooms very comfortable. I think we could have slept 4 in our bed it was so big!! Breakfast is pretty good with quite a nice selection of hot & cold foods and drinks etc. As said in another review it is best to get to breakfast early, to avoid the crowds and get back in the lifts with no hold up. The paper cups and plates etc are not really a problem, although plastic knives & forks aren't so good but generally you just accept this. A glass each in the room would have been nice though as we do tend to have a drink before and after going out in the evenings. The location of the Hotel is brilliant. Between 8th and 9th it was central for everywhere. 9th Ave is good for finding restaurants etc, Times square and Broadway, beyond for Central Park, Grand Central, Rockerfellas, and Empire State were all within 20 mins or less to walk. We walked down to the river, and it wasn't too much longer. (The aircraft carrier museum is good to see there, much more than it looks from outside including a submarine visit and concorde too (at an extra cost)) It is very easy to take the underground downtown to the ferries and boats. Pier 17 is a good place to catch the hop on hop off tour which takes you up the river and back and you get a good look at the Statue of Liberty etc. Remember to ask for tickets to see the 9/11 memorial, you can get off and view the pools put up in memory of all that died. A very nice way to remember them. We didn't see any options for getting tickets at the site.Talking of ease. From the Airport, we took the air train from JFK terminal 8 (the train stops at all terminals) just 2 stops, and then took the long island train which took us to block 33/34. (Depending on where you come out!) We were staying at block 42 so just 10 - 15 mins, if that, easy walk and you are at your Hotel. We had thought about a transport bus, although reviews were not good with them, or getting the Hotel to arrange transport, but as it was SO easy and less expensive, we opted for the same going back. Considering it was rush hour when we did so, it was still remarkably good. There are helpful staff at the stations too if you come unstuck. If buying you tickets for the air train on your return from a machine, beware some of them only give a max $6 change. We needed 2 $5 dollar tickets and only had a $20 so it would have effectively cost us $14!! If there is a staff member there selling what appear to be tout tickets, as long as he has the official jacket on he is official. We got out tickets from him no problem. It only takes 25/30 mins to do the whole train journeys, the courtesy bus can take up to 1 1/2 hrs in traffic.Back to the Hotel, we would stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Don't forget to grab a cookie of the desk when you are checking in, they are cool.

I stayed for 7 nights on a business trip. Staff are great, room is comfortable. The area is ok but you can do better location wise. Water pressure in the shower was terrible. There is no service elevator - which means 30 floors share 2 elevators with staff. I'm back in the area often and won't stay here again. I think it would be ok on a pleasure trip with specific interest in Times Square. I'd rather a better hotel in a better neighborhood.

Thanks again for a wonderful stay. The hotel is conveniently walking distance to Times Square. It was perfect for a trip to New York. Romm was clean and the beds are so comfortable, I missed them when I returned home!! :-) Staff are very friendly and professional and always available to answer questions or make recommendations. Tip for seeing a show on Broadway- check at 10 am day of show for sell off seats!!!! Double decker bus tour was great and Times Square at night is amazing. Truly New York is the city that never sleeps!!! Looking forward to going back and we will definetly stay at the Hampton Inn again!!!

This is a great hotel to stay in - it's clean, comfortable, with very friendly and helpful staff and is in a perfect location for seeing New York. It's just round the corner from Times Square, but is in a quiet location. It's in easy walking distance of Broadway and 5th and 6th Avenues, and close to MoMA. It's also very close to a subway to reach all areas of New York. It provides a good (free) breakfast, and the only reason I've given it 4 stars is because it uses awful paper cups, plates and plastic cutlery for breakfast. A hotel of this quality really should have proper crockery and cutlery, and it really cheapens what is otherwise an excellent hotel. There are only two lifts, which can be a bit of a pain at peak times, but mostly they're OK.

We stayed 3 nights in April with our 2 boys in a room with 2 double beds. It was a small room as expected in New York - really designed for one double or Queen bed but had 2 doubles crammed in however it makes a stay affordable for a family and we really only slept and rested there, The bathroom was a good size and had a spacious and good strong shower. The room was clean and the air con was good and not quiet. Towels were refreshed daily and beds made etc There were only 2 lifts in a 30 story building so at times there was a long wait and you had to make an effort to go down to breakfast early to have a more comfortable / calm meal.The location is great with Time Square itself a 5 minute walk and Rockefeller , Empire State, Grand Central Station all 15 to 20 mins walk. The area felt pretty safe although there was a homeless person on a nearby street shouting on our way there and one who had to be removed from hotel reception one day which the children saw whilst waiting in the lobby for us and found a bit upsetting. I guess that's the big city for you!Breakfast was complementary and there was a good selection of bread, muffins, bagels, croissants, cereals and hot food,. They also had 2 waffle makers which was fun (and one reason we booked!) The hot food changed daily though I don't rate the hot food in hotels generally as the egg is usually not fresh and being English we don't understand the biscuits and gravy thing! One day there was french toast which was quite nice and my son praised the cheese omelettes. The reception staff and bell boy were great - helpful and friendly. We were able to leave our passports in the safe and deposit our computer with the reception during the day. On our last day we had a while to wait before leaving for our flight and left our luggage with them while we had our last morning out. On our return they helped us get a taxi to our airport transport. We used the liberty airport express which you catch on 41st and would have walked (10 mins only) if all our bags had had wheels but one didn't and my husband had a knee injury so the bellboy got us a taxi.Overall a great stay - I would return and recommend to others.

Great friendly staff and one of the cleanest I have stayed. Service is awesome. Rooms are small even by NY standards but I would stay again. Good location for my business meetings. The only bad thing can be the wait for elevators in the afternoon during trash and laundry removal. They should just use one elevator on independent and let one elevator run free instead of tying up both.
The rooms are small, the breakfast is descent, the location is ideal , the staff is courteous and helpful - My score, 9 Alcapurrias out a 10 !!!!

we recently spent 4 days at this hampton inn near times square. very convenient location near times square and if your not too picky about walking everywhere. the young staff were tremendously welcoming, friendly and helpful, except for one concierge on duty who thought it was more important to take a personal phone call rather than assist a paying guest! the hotel lobby and common areas were very clean and bright. surprised the hotel only had two-two! - elevators to serve 32 floors, which caused serious waiitng times in the mornings during breakfast hours. the biggest negative for us was getting our room cleaned on a daily basis - it was like pulling teeth without anesthetic - painful!!!!!

We stayed here in February 2011 around Valentine's Day, there was snow on the ground and a bite in the air but we were well wrapped up and it was great fun walking through Central Park in the snow.The hotel was 2 star but our room was on the top floor and was like a mini suite. It was fantastic. Plenty of room and a huge bed. Nice simple decor and clean.The bathroom was like a wet room and enormous.My now husband had contacted the hotel before our visit to tell them he was planning to propose and while we were there they sent up a bottle of champagne and glasses with a note wishing us well. How fantastic!The hotel was a little way out of the centre but the walk wasn't too bad. Not sure if we'd stay there again purely because of the location. The hotel was great. They provided a buffet breakfast on site which was included in the price. It was great to grab a coffee to take out on the cold mornings.For travellers on a budget or if it's your first trip to New York this is an ideal hotel.

Staff bend over backwards to help you, rooms are clean and large for NYC. breakfast is excellent and hotel is in a great location. Best hotel I have stayed in for a long time. If i had to find something to say that is not excellent, the lifts are a bit slow but only a small point AND FREE WIFI in rooms!!!!!.

We came to NY for a quick trip to look at colleges and see some sites while in the city. The Hampton Inn was very centrally located in Times Square and a quick walk to several subway lines. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the rooms, although very small, were clean. The breakfast came in handy, saving us time and $ in the mornings when we were trying to get out the door. I would definitely stay there again.
Here for business so not a lot of time at the hotel but staff was friendly, helpful, room was quiet and clean (and small).

Stayed here as part of tour group for New York Marathon. When we arrived at 10.30 pm thought area looked a bit dodgy. Arrival at reception was OK. Only one staff member on with about 30 checking in. Had read previous reviews and knew the lifts were slow and had to wait a while for them. Only two lifts in building. Found the rooms much better than I expected, lovely and clean. Really liked the white duvet covers. Nice and fresh and clean. Rooms small but as you expect in NY. Bathrooms clean. I shared room with a friend, so was fine. Only two suitcases, two double beds. We had thought about sharing room with 2 others to save money, that would not have been good. Too cramped. Didn't think much of restaurant. Plastic plates! Food - OK, but that all, not wonderful. Hated throw away plates, cutlery etc. Staff - OK, not wonderful, not helpful at tour desk. Just came to collect her pay I think. Close to Times Square. Dodgy club at end of street, we used to walk other way, along a block and up next straight to avoid that dodgy area.

In the evening of our arrival date, the customer service manager, Evangeline Sanchez, called to let us know that our two dbl/sofa bed suite was not available due to a plumbing problem. She offered different solutions to accommodate our family. Even thought I used my Hilton Honor points for our stay, we were treated respectfully as regular paying customers. We got two rooms side by side with a perfect Empire building view, as well as discount parking. I appreciate her effort because the whole building was sold out during our stay.We stayed at the Element at an unbeatable Travel Zoo rate before we moved into the Hampton Inn(they are next to each other on the same street). The Element was newer with a kitchen, but only offered one King-size bed so the primary customers are adults. Hampton Inn, in the other hand, is more family-friendly. The breakfast at Hampton Inn is better and has more variety than the one at Element. We did not have a problem finding seating as we had at the Element. My only complaint is that the elevator opens to narrow hallways which, caused traffic jams in the morning as the all the guests were either heading for the breakfast or checking out. Although it is located at the city center, it is quiet day and night.You can trust the customer service at Hampton Inn Times Square South the next time you choose the New York Manhattan hotels.

We really liked this hotel. Room,bathroom very very clean (and we are pickey).We were on a high floor and never had a problem with the elevators. We were there during the week for 5 nights. Coffee,tea,hot chocolate available in the lobby for free 24 hours a day. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room. Alwaysfriendly when you would see them in the halls. The elevator would stop and ifthey would see you on they would wait and let you go. No need to do that. Let them on so they can get their work day completed. We always leave a few dollarseveryday for them...they deserve it! Breakfast was good....something for everyone....they breakfast ladies were so nice always filling the food items for you to choose from and cleaning the tables always with a smile.Yogurt,apples, bananas,muffins,english muffins,eggs,sausage, ham (rotating),milk,ceral(fruit loops,raisin bran, and cornflakes i believe), orange juice & cranberry juice,peanut butter, jam,1 waffle machine. Filled you up before the start to your busy day...and it's Free! A nice little room off to the side in the lobby with 2 computers and a printer no charge. Everyone was very friendly to us. They have a safety deposit box at the front desk that you can use. They booked a shuttle van for us to the airport...saved about 25 dollars to Newark airport. Everything was very very clean. Next door is the holiday inn and comfort inn I believe. Across the street they are building expensive apartments. The street doesn't look like the best area when you arrive but it save. Close by to the theater district and times square. They are about a 15 minute walk. Mary Poppins theater is close by the hotel. We really enjoyed our first visit to New York...yes the rooms are small but if you don't have alot of luggage they really aren't that bad at all. We would stay here again.

Excellent location, warm welcome, staff are always smiling and can't do enough for you!Breakfast decent quality and variety- perfect for filling up and getting out to see the sights of NYC. Rooms compact, clean and new bedding n towels daily. Secure rooms, we left phones and money out and came back to them untouched. Brilliant location to see the sights, short walk from Macy's, empire state and Rockefeller. We walked to battery park it took about 90 minutes and to central park about 30. Times square and empire about ten minutes. Only downside was garbage truck outside at 3:30 am. Floor 11 not high enough, ask for room higher than 20 and at the back!! However, that's not enough to detract from the excellent welcome, service and comfort of this great hotel. Thank you Hampton for a great first trip to NYC :)

We stayed here recently for five nights. In most respects this is a typical Hampton Inn, however there are a few exceptions. First; there are only two elevators for a 32 story hotel. Our average wait for an elevator was approximately 10 minutes, one time we waited over twenty minutes. We found it faster to walk down 21 floors!!!! The elevators were not malfunctioning, these are very small elevators and they were usually full when one did stop at our floor. One time during our stay the elevator did come quickly and we could get on the first one..that was the only time!!!! Second; The room was small, very, very small...it was almost impossible for both of us to move around in there at the same time. Third, the bathroom is tiny but the shower is beyond small, it is microscopic....impossible for me to stand sideways and I'm 6 foot 190 lbs!!!! Fourth; it was next to impossible to find a place to sit for breakfast as the breakfast seating area was also very small. If you are a smaller than average person and like small places then this would probably be a great place to stay if almost no one else is there!! A positive: the hotel was clean and the staff seemed very helpful and aplogized quite often!

The hotel fulfilled expectations.The room was small, but well equipped and clean. We highly recommended for jewish religious people as breakfast has many things kosher and is served in disposable items. The hotel also is located close to synagogues for Shabbat.Staff service excellent, very friendly.

A three star hotel equivalent to four. Refitted building, excellent staff that startet supporting before our check in, such as shuttle information, hold internet purchased items before our arrival w/o any cost. During our stay, a wonderful breakfast included in the price, free wifi and corded hi speed internet in the room and free business room and printing in the hall. HVAC was good (a little bit noisy), silent room and high speed elevators, although in some morning times you could get some traffic and wait a llittle, but not enough to bother you.The Front Desk Staff speaks English and some of them Spanish and they are very nice. Most of Times Square Area's hotels are near of everything, but this one is near of Port Transit Authority where you can get the bus to Jersey Gardens Outlet and near of the Subway entrances.Among the guests there were businessmen, group of students and a lot of US and foreign tourists.I recommend.

I stayed at this hotel and left an important item behind worth almost $400.- the next day I called to find out about it and they took a message which was never returned. The next 5 days I left meaasges to no avail with the front desk, descibing over and over the item and how I wanted a call back after they checked the lost and found. WHen I finally got a call back it was not favorable, no machine...I filed a claim only to be ignored and called by an insurance representative of the hotel, who sounded like a teenager and basically called me a liar. I stay at Hilton hotels every other weekend in NYC for business and they tell me there is no proof I left the item behind (obviously not because it is illegal to have cameras in the rooms) and do I really think if I say I left something expensive behind that I would really get the benefit of the doubt. Well I think staying there and spending more on the hotel bill each weekend, twice a month, than the claim was worth, for a year now and for the next year to come, should render me some benefit. Do not stay at this hotel if you ever leave anything behind- it will be gone forever and they will tell you that there is no proof and that they are not responsible- I guess there is no honor code towards their customers and just like the street you might have a better chance recovering your items if left in a McDonalds than in their hotel...needless to say I will never stay there again.I recommend staying somewhere where they won't snatch up your things with impunity after you have spent hundreds/thousands of dollars staying there.

This hotel was surprisingly great! We weren't sure what to expect on our first trip to NYC, but we were pleasantly surprised with the Hampton Inn/South!! The lobby smelled SO CLEAN everytime we walked in, and the staff was VERY helpful. Everything in NYC is small, so that wasn't an issue. The rooms are small, but I think larger than a lot of NYC hotel rooms, and it wasn't a problem for us. Our room was clean, well-stocked, and the continental breakfast was perfect each morning. The hotel is in a GREAT spot for visiting the city. Just a couple blocks walk to Times Square, theatres, and the city is packed with restaurants. We will definitely return to this hotel!! Loved it!!

Using AAA, this rate was less than $200 during Spring Break 2012. We were given two double or queen beds. Room wasn't overly small by NY standards. We had room to walk around -- unless someone was sitting at the desk with the chair in the walkway -- then had to either move the chair or climb over the bed. Bathroom was very clean (and I'm fairly picky). Two teenage girls used the business center to watch a TV show, as well as to print out boarding pass. Front desk VERY sweet and accommodating. Front lobby staff / door men gave wonderful directions to subway for trip to Chelsea. We were a little concerned walking to the hotel late at night, but overall - no issues whatsoever. Very convenient little store either next door or within a door or two. The breakfast was great. It does get crowded, but we were able to find a table and we arrived close to closing time. One lady even commented to the staff that her little girls didn't really like what was left (since it was closing in 5 minutes), and within minutes the staff returned with donuts for the girls. VERY NICE since they weren't asked to accommodate the family - the lady did it on her own. We missed the cookies - so disappointed, as we could still smell them when we arrived later that evening. We brought back Pizza from John's Pizza nearby (great pizza!) and sat in their breakfast area to eat vs. taking to the room. Free tea, coffee, and hot chocolate available 24/7 in the breakfast area. We would definitely stay again - was a little far from the main area of Times Square, but fast walk and convenient to buses and subways. (We bought the week pass for the subway even though we were only there 4-5 days - pays for itself quickly with transfers.)

I selected this hotel for our first overnight trip to NYC after reading many reviews and it was just as described. The hotel staff were very friendly and really helpful. I could not have asked for any more. Yes, the room was smaller than most rooms found elsewhere in the country, but it was kind of what I expected for NYC. No more than we stayed in the room, it worked for three of us. Six rooms per floor and ours was neat and clean. Breakfast was great, with lots of choices. The hotel is not in a high pedestrian area, but I never felt unsafe. Just a short walk to Broadway and Times Square. Not a bad walk to the Emipre State Building and Macy's either. There was some construction along the street outside, but there seemed no shortage of that anywhere in the city. I would stay there again if I ever get the chance to go back.

We were able to find this Hampton at $204/night for a week in March, which is a bargain in the Times Square area. My daugher and I were given a room on the 25h floor facing the wall of Candlewood Suites next door, but when I asked to change rooms to something with a city view, Ha ta nachi (sorry I massacred your name) and Jennifer at the front desk went out of their way to find us the room we wanted for the next night. The staff is exceptional, from the breakfast ladies, to the front desk folks, to the bellmen. Everyone went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Good breakfast, but come before 8 if you can, as the small space gets crowded quickly when the hotel is full. Rooms are cruise ship size, so be prepared or upgrade to a junior suite. You shouldn't be in your room too often, so it shouldn't be a problem. WIth more than 3 people in a room, however, it will be uncomfortably tight as there is no place to really sit other than the beds. Free internet worked quickly and flawlessly and was much appreciated. The business center was convenient and had a good working printer and two computers. This is a unique property in that it is 32 floors, very skinny, and positioned next to a Holiday Inn Express and a Candlewood Inn. You can use the laundry facilities at the Candlewood per management arrangements, and that was very convenient since we were staying a full 7 nights and could do a little laundry mid stay. The hotel is well-located within a short walk to Times Square, Macys, Empire State Building, the Circle Line pier and Intrepid Air and Sea Museum and a great neighborhood of cool ethnic restaurants, a weekend flea market, and other local haunts. Very clean and impeccably managed. We will stay here again.

my husband and I stayed fro 3 night in March 2012 and we enjoyed our stay.Location: The hotel is ideally locted in walking distance of main attarctions of Manhattan.You don't need to take a taxi at all, time sqr is 10 min walk, broad way Ave, fashion district, Empire state bldg... are all at max 15 min walking distance.ROOM and STAFF:Our room was clean not very spacious but enough for our loggage !!( we had 8 loggage in total !!!!). bed was comfortable, the breakfast was very good. BUT one of the issues is the lift, the hotel has two lifts which is used by guests as well as the house keping staff so in specially in morning time you should expect longer waiting time.The front desk staff (all shifts) and concierge, bellman,... were all friendly and ready to assist you at all tiem.MUST do: take a hop on hop off tour to go around manhattan and central park , BUT the tour that was available in hotel concierge was not good, the waiting time in each stop exceeds 1 hr in that breezy weather and wasted our time alot while the other tour was always on time and frequent , therefore I informed the lady at concierge and told her it would be more convenient for hotel guests if they can work with the other tour.A HINT: you may expect some noise if your room is located close to ice maker machine.

Great location to Time Square..Hotel staff was exceptional..couldn't have been more helpful...Great breakfast..again staff was very friendly and helpful...small rooms but very clean..Loved the warm cookies served in the afternoon...always asked if I wanted a bottled water when I came into the lobby...would stay there again....
Very friendly staff, especially the breakfast ladies. Good location if you want the bustle of the Times square Area.

All of the front desk people were wonderful, especially Jennifer. They remembered my Name as I wandered in and our of the hotel. The room was clean but cramped. They served warm cookies every afternoon and served a full breakfast every morning. My stay was wonderful! I did not expect this in NYC.

Rug dirtyHVAC slow to respond, poor controlBathroom floor dirtyUsed facecloth on shower rod - they blew it on the cleaningRoom tight for 2 Queen bedsRoom tired but stylishElevator slow$179+ taxes/fees, mid-weekDoesn't hold a candle to the Hilton Gardens next door if you see price proximity

The first thing to notice when first arriving at this hotel is that it's adjacent to two other hotels. That said, it was extremely good at competing with the other two. Room service was helpful, carrying suitcases, which I understand to be standard procedure, but it was done quickly and efficiently. The hotel attendants were very kind, and made small talk with me when we met, on the elevator or in the lobby. The complementary breakfast also had really good quality, although the juice seemed to be a combination of water and juice, and was diluted, but the actual food and drink were diverse and tasty. Everything about the place was neat and organized. In fact, the only thing that I felt disappointed about was that the rooms were small. However, I feel that this is exceedingly common in New York City, and so for the price, it was incredibly good.

Our room was on the 29th floor, fabulous views of the Empire State Building and Hudson River. We stayed for four nights, and the continental breakfast featured varying selections of hot foods with meats/eggs/potatoes, cooked differently each day in addition to waffles, bagles, etc. Coffee (also tea, hot chocolate) is available 24 hours, and was well-stocked at all times I stopped by. The beds were extremely comfortable. To be in NYC, the rooms were reasonable in size. There were only two elevators, but I'd only experienced considerable wait times during the breakfast hours. As for the negative...while we were touring the city, my daughter's purchases (including the store bags) were removed from our room the day before our return home. We wasted our final half day in NYC for the hotel to investigate, to work out reimbursement arrangements with the hotel, and then to head all the way across town to repurchase the same gift items she'd bought two days before. The hotel was accommodating, but the time lost caused us to miss out on our plans for the last day entirely. I was crushed.

7 blocks north of Penn Station and 3 blocks south of 42nd street/Times Square area; it is very convenient. I found it to be extremely clean and neat; the staff totally attentive, polite and effective. Much quieter, and less expensive, than staying up in the Times Square area itself. The breakfast was delicious; many offerings. No pool or spa; but there is an exercise room.

I was there 4 nights with my daughter, can only say, absolutely satisfied!!! The staff very pleasant,breakfast was OK too. Rooms small,but also OK. Small problem with elavators, only 2 for 32 stocks, but with a littel bit of patience without problems. After a long trip from Europe can ithis hotel only recommended. Next time,when i am in New York, is my choice clear.Thanks again.

We have nothing but good things to say about our recent experience at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and the hotel is modern and very clean. The stay included breakfast which was wonderful and a bonus of its own. Hot eggs, potatoes, fresh waffles, fruit, oatmeal, baked goods, etc. The topper was also the freshly baked cookies they bring out to the lobby at 4:00 p.m. We were a 5 minute walk from the main part of Times Square and close to our Megabus departure site.

Since I've stayed here the last two years and based on where my conference is at the Javits Convention Center, this hotel is a prime location.Located at W 39th St at 8th Avenue, it's a mere 5 minute walk to Times Square, the subway (A,C,E) train station is a mere block up the street...Rooms are small, however the staff is what made the whole experience that much better..They were very good at helping with recommendations, numbers and with getting our 3 rooms on the same floor..Granted there are 6 rooms to a floor and we had half of them on the 23rd floor...My view from my room 2306 was nice and rarely did we hear any noise in the hallway, the cleaning staff were very friendly and the bed always comfortable..Next time in New York we will stay here again...Thanks again...

Fabulous hotel! The staff were so pleasant, we were always greeted with a smile not just from desk staff but maintenance and breakfast staff as well. The rooms are small as others have posted but that is NYC. They were clean and the beds were very comfortable. It was so quiet too, we never heard anyone in the halls and no traffic outside. Elevators do take a while during peak times - we found the weekday mornings a little less crowded than weekends. The breakfast had an excellent variety and the warm cookies at night and coffee, hot chocolate, and fruit available all day was wonderful. Young woman at concierge was very helpful. A couple minor issues in the room and maintenance was there immediately. Free wi-fi and business center. Only a few blocks from times square and one block to nearest subway station. Overall, we could not believe the courteous staff, quietness, and little extras this hotel offerred! Without a doubt, we would stay again! A huge thanks to the staff at this hotel!

We loved our stay here. The staff is top notch--very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to store our bags before check in and after check out and to get us a cab back to the airport, always with a smile. Our room was the perfect size for two people with plenty of storage space, and was very comfortable and immaculately clean. The showers are great-LOTS of water pressure. The elevators were busy on Sunday morning, but the front desk staff warned us of this, and it was never a really long wait. The hotel is also conveniently located close to Times Square and the subway. This is now our first choice for an NYC stay.

My husband and I recently stayed at this property and were very pleased. This was our first time to NYC so we really didn't know what to expect. We were able to check in early in a matter of minutes and our room was just as I asked for. We had a nice view from the 25th floor, very clean and the staff was VERY nice. The hotel is in a great location to many of the shows and Times Square. We were able to walk to most everything we did while we were there. Also, the breakfast was very tasty and plentiful. I also wanted to comment about the elevators. WE DID NOT HAVE TO WAIT ON AN ELEVATOR OUR ENTIRE STAY!!! I was so impressed and relieved. We would definitely stay again.
Free breakfast buffet was hearty and delicious. Perfect location for walking to theaters and Times Square.

They have a top level staff, friendly, helpful and professional. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The place is located in a very convenient place. You can walk to several famous destinations in the city, it is close to the Port Authority terminal, the Penn Station and several subway lines. Grand central is just a few more steps away, and to catch a cab you just have to turn the corner on the 8th ave. Ther are also good restaurants nearby, if you do not fell like going far for dinner or lunch.The business center is small, just a little room, but well equipped. And you can use their excellent free WiFi service everywere in the hotel.
Staff was super nice and went out of their way to make me feel welcome. Only a couple of blocks from times square and the hotel rooms are really nice. Granite sinks and the beds are sooo soft!

Staff and the service provided was excellent throughout. Rooms were cleaned daily and were comfortable and provided everything you needed. Breakfast was a great way to start the day, and the complimentary afternoon cookies were amazing. Location was good for Times Square and subways, although we chose to walk everywhere, even down to Battery Park, a 2 hour walk , a great way to watch the city wake up. We were really pleased with our choice of hotel, and the overall attentiveness of the staff made it for us.

We arrived early and although the staff was not able to immediately check us into a room, they were very helpful in storing our bags, offering us bottled water and showing us where the breakfast room was. As many other reviewers have stated, I found this staff to be very friendly and they seemed to welcome the guests coming back into the hotel with genuine enthusiasm. The rooms were extremely clean as well as all the public spaces. The location is terrific for walking to your destination, catching a cab or getting the subway.
