Small lobby and business center, but they are well equipped.

This is a very clean hotel. It seems to be pretty new. It is very convenient and within walking distance to the Jacob Javits Convention Center. There are several restaurants within walking distance as well. It is close to the A, C, and E train station on 40th St. This hotel is a great value for the money. It is very reasonably priced for NYC. The complimentary breakfast was great. While some of the hot food was mediocre, it had everything from cereal, bagels, and oatmeal. They offer fresh coffee and tea all day long. My only complaint is that there are only 2 elevators. With 32 floors and a booked hotel, this causes some delays in the morning. Request to be on a lower floor and take the stairs. The rooms are a little small (but what hotel in NY isn't). There is really only enough room for 2 big suitcases and a few small bags. For non-family stays, I would recommend only 2 people to a room.

loved the staff...rooms on the small side but the location and condition of hotel were all great. with the hurricane they were wonderful in making sure we were all ok, had what we needed (even when they gave staff the night off) and i felt very safe and well-taken care of!room was clean but nyc size :)

My friends and I had a Friday night party on the west side and this was the closest hotel in the HIlton family. We pre-paid $127 and had a small but nice room on the 23rd floor. We checked right in and had the car valet parked for the night. This location can be a little iffy after dark but honestly it was fine - we also cabbed it back which is the smartest way to go after midnight. I would stay here again.

This hotel is a little gem and I'm almost afraid to write this review, lest others discover my little piece of Mid-Town heaven. I stayed at this hotel summer of 2010 with my family and returned last week when I was in NY for business purposes. The location can't be beat with easy access to MTA (42nd and 7th) and a stone's throw from Times Square. The fitness center was "down" when I first arrived and management apologized and provided a pass to use the fitness center of the hotel next door. (Remember, it's not about the problem but what someone does with it). Staff, from Jose out front to the front desk to housekeeping is friendly and engaging. The garment district provides that "just gritty enough but not dangerous" feeling that I so love about NYC. Rooms are small but with all there is to do in NYC, who spends much time in their room? Internet worked fine, business center was great. All in all, I can't wait to return to this hotel later this year.

At $149/night in Manhattan - I was frankly not expecting much - but was I wrong! The location is perfect - walking distance to buses, the subway and of course, Times Square attractions. Arriving in the dark, the street seemed a bit seedy, but there was always plenty of foot traffic and at no time was I uncomfortable walking back and forth. The rooms were smaller than most Hampton Inns in which I have stayed, but perfectly comfortable and very clean. I peaked in on a great looking fitness center. At the complementary (tasty) breakfast, the staff milled around to refill drinks and clear used plates. The only complaint that I might offer is that with only two elevators for such a tall building - we did have to wait a bit to get onto one.
Great location for us on a weekend trio into the city. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was outstanding.

My family stayed at this Hampton for a Saturday night so we could enjoy dinner and a show in NYC. We arrviced at 2pm, but had to wait till after 3pm to get our room. Which was fine, we checked our one bag and went for a walk. When we returned, we had no problems checking-in but the bell staff was having some trouble finding our bag. After maybe 15 minutes of searching they found the bag and we were set to go.The room (2901) was very clean and cute, but soooo tiny. Oh my was it small. We have stayed in NYC several times, and this was the smallest room I have ever seen; especially with double beds! For the room rate, I was surprised. Looking past the teeeny-tiny room and teeny-tiny shower, we were happy with the amenities though. Comfy bed, nice TV, quick elevator -- really no complaints for our comfort on a single night stay.After a short break in the room, we headed out to dinner and the show. On the way out, the desk stopped us to ask where our car key was. This was very alarming, since we had given the key to the valet at check-in! My wife went a little crazy, but they assured us they would find it and we left for our evening out. Within 20 minutes they had called me and confirmed they did find the keys and all was okay. They also 100%'d us the room (no charge) since we were not happy with the valet and bell staff. It was nice to see the staff take action immediately.Overall the hotel was very good. Staff was very friendly and worked quickly to fix the small problems we had. The room was just right for our one night rest. Breakfast in the morning was good for a free meal and we had no problems with check-out. If I was back in that part of town for a couple or business trip, I would consider them again. But not for a family trip...On the walk back to the hotel that night, down 39th street from 8th, we passed the line for Hunkamania. It is an adult male dance show. While the club did not disturb our rest in any way, I did not like walking my 8yr old past it that night. So for family trips, I will likely go back to the hotels that are within Times Square.

I stayed for one night only, but the staff was very helpful and attentive. My room (stayed at 606) was clean and despite not being very large, had enough space. There are 20+ floors, but since the elevators (only 2 cars) are brand new and fast the guests don’t have to wait too much. They have a 24h business center and free wireless internet in all rooms, at least during my stay. The complimentary breakfast is good too. I would recommend this hotel to any friend of mine.

Fantastic value.....fantastic....friendly and caring staff. We come to nyc often and have found our hotel now.....breakfast and strong coffee are the bonus on this nice hotel.....you should not be disappointed.....ask for hatanachi or jennifer at front desk....super nice...

Great location to everything! It was great to have breakfast included every morning. Staff were friendly. The elevators during peak times took forever. We ended up getting into an elevator if we wanted to get down by squeezing into a lift going up (if we could fit as the lifts were crowded) so we could actually get down or otherwise each lift we waited for to go down we couldn't fit in. The rooms were RIDICULOUSLY SMALL!! Would only recommend for 2 people maximum, any more & it's a very tight squeeze!

We are huge fans of Hampton Inn in general and have stayed in them all over the country. We used to stay in Times Square when we came to town, but it can be noisy and crazy even in the best hotels. We have started staying here. Very convenient, quiet and the staff is wonderful, especially Mimi. Great free breakfast, free wifi and everyone is very pleasant. The rooms are small, but clean and the beds are great.
Hotel is very nice. Clean and comfy. Staff is there to take care of us and make sure we have everything we need. Perfect location.
Clean, confortable room and beds, friendly staff, very good breakfast included, prices are a little high (but we stayed just on New Year's week), and excellent location.

We did the red eye flight from Vancouver, landed at 6 am , got to the hotel about 8:30 and was going to see if we could leave our luggage and go exploring, but to our amazement the hotel said our room was ready so we could check-in. We went for a short nap and headed out to explore.The location is perfect so close to everything, the staff very helpful. Will definitely stay again when in the NYC.
Very clean room. Very comfortable bed. NYC-sized room (about 4' space around a king bed) I'd stay again.

Right from the moment I came in, I was lied to by the Hampton inn SOUTH location on 39th street. I was first given a room with a cigarette or mildew odor. For fear that they might charge me a fine in case they suspected I smoked in the room, I left my bag on the bed and went to the front desk right away. The staff at the front desk told me they can move me, but then she whispered to me and asked me if I can do her a favor. My immediate response was of course. She then proceeded to ask me if I can "tidy up" the original room before moving to another room since she will be putting another guest in it!!!!!At first I thought okay, she did change my room after all. But now thinking about, I am disgusted and angry. First of all there were two staff members at the front desk, I am sure one of them could have gone to the room and "tidy up" themselves. Second and most important, I cannot believe that they gave it to someone else without checking cleansiness and other things (in the bathroom and around the bed area). I am now disgusted to think that at any time, because of laziness, any of these rooms were not checked and cleaned properly but rather left to the guests themselves to clean them. Additionally, I repeatedly asked for a room with a view. When I checked at around 1 pm, the front desk staff ( a different one) told me there will be one available 3 pm. I decided to leave and come back in order to get the desired room. Once I came back, I was told the room promised was not available. Around midnight, out of curiosity, I called the front desk to ask if there was one available and I was told there are a couple available and they have been available all day. Why the lies??? Why the laziness??? they are in the customer service industry but this hotel's staff are lazy liars. I would NEVER stay here and would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Pros:1) Friendly staff.2) Prime location - Times Square is a close walk away.3) The breakfast was delicious. The hotel had almost anything you could think of for breakfast, except for hash browns for some reason.4) Free Wi-Fi and free business center with free printing.5) The rooms were spotless and look new or recently remodeled.6) Free warm cookies every late afternoon.Cons (mostly nit-picky things, but enough to bump from a 5- to a 4-star review, in my opinion):1) Went out to eat and when we came back, there was no refrigerator in the room to put your leftover food, so we had to toss it.2) The hotel mentions that the sheets and duvets are washed every day but that was not my experience. A duvet with the same stain in the same spot appeared two days in a row.3) The breakfast room was extremely cold, especially when staff kept opening the doors to go outside while guests were eating.4) We were over charged by nearly $400, but the staff fixed it after we showed them our online reservation printout.5) The rooms were tiny.6) The motel needs another elevator or some kind of express button. The elevator was jam-packed on the way to breakfast each morning (with no more room), yet it still stopped at every floor.Like I said, a few nit-picky things, but overall, we had a great stay!

Stayed at this Hampton Inn a couple of days before Christmas. Great location, close to Times Square. Pretty much close to everything. Hotel and room were clean. Stayed on the like 27th floor and got the "City View" room. View from the room was amazing. Only problem was the room was so small that you literally couldn't get to the window to see the view because the bed was right up against the window. I expected the room to be small because of the location and I was fine with that but I had to open the window and stick my head out to actually be able to view the skyline and Empire State building. Typical Hampton Inn breakfast. They did a good job keeping the dining area clean. Wasn't overcrowded like I thought it would be which was nice. My issue with this Hampton Inn was the service when I went to check in. There were two people at the desk waiting on one gentleman. I waited at the desk not knowing what the situation with this other gentleman was. Had no problem with that. Stood around a bit longer. Was never even acknowledged as being there or told they would be right with me. The guy at the desk kept talking to the other girl even after the gentleman they were helping left. I was the only one there left to check in. They both started doing other things and still didn't acknowledge I was standing there, they just kept talking and laughing with each other. Finally after standing there a while the guy asked for my name and told the girl to print my paperwork up. Good thing I checked the price because I guess they were so distracted that they gave me someone elses paperwork to sign with a room costing over $100 more than I was supposed to pay. When I made him aware he didn't really seem to care, just kind of nonchalantly told her it wasn't my paperwork , to which she didn't really seem to care either. No apologies for the wait or mistake and not very welcoming. I would have fully understood if it was chaotic and busy but I was the only one there! I am pretty big on customer service and this was the only thing I really found wrong with this Hampton Inn. It is unfortunate, since this is really unlike Hampton Inn. All my experiences with them have been pretty great. I think as long as you don't get these two when you check in you should be fine.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this establishment recently. We paid $116 per night which was one of the lower priced rooms I could find. Our room was small but it was clean. The Lobby was nice and the free breakfast was an added touch. I would definately stay here again and recommend it. It isn't a luxurious spot but you can't beat the location to Times Square and Hells Kitchen.

Our family of four (part of a family group of 15) stayed at the Hampton Inn South Dec. 24-26 and were very pleased. Front Desk staff and Bellmen were always friendly and helpful. Rooms weren't ready until after 3pm but front desk held our luggage. Ladies in the breakfast room, despite the fact that they were leaving for the day, let us use their kitchen microwave to heat up leftovers for lunch one day. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast room very crowded but convenient. Prior to booking, I was concerned about the southern location but it was both convenient and safe. Don't miss the charming Italian restaurant across the street.Hampton Inn South- Excellent value, would stay here again!
Reasonable for NYC and close to the Javits Center nd Times Square...

We just came back from a 5 day trip in Manhattan and stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan\Times Square South. Staff at the front desk were always available to help and answer every single question from every single guest and kept a smile on their face whether it was morning, afternoon or evening. The rooms are OK but small. The breakfasts were generous and pretty good. We had read a review prior to departing concerning the elevators. True, there is only 2 and when the hotel is full of guests who want to use them at the same time there is a little waiting time but for us, that was not an issue. We has a great experience at this hotel and we definitely recommand it to anyone ! Claude from Québec city.

I stayed here for 3 nights Dec 1-4th with my 18 yr old daughter and 8 yr old son--we all loved the Hampton Inn--Times Square. Room was modern and clean. The breakfast included was fantastic and the staff were excellent--very helpful and friendly. Excellent location to Times Square--especially when walking with an 8 yr old around the city. We ALL totally recommend this hotel and when we visit NY we will be staying there again. Keep up the good work!!

We stayed here in dec 2011 for 4 nights. Not a great price but this is NYC at xmas. We were give a room on the 14th floor on the same side of the building as the front entrance. There wasn't much of a view from our room.....a building site!Hotel is an easy walk to Times Square, Madison Sq Gdn, Macys etc. Subway a short walk. Coffee shops and restaurants everywhere, the hotel is v central.The hotel isn't on the nicest street to look at but absolutely no safety issues. There are 4 hotels in a row (almost) so people always about. Breakfast was good. plentiful and hot and yes, it can get busy. It all depends on the time. we ate at 620am and surprisingly it was empty but breakie good. We ate at 730 and 830 and although busier, seats available and breakie still good, all you need to start the day. Wi-Fi worked okay and they had two computers and a printer down in the lobby to use. Only problem we encountered with the hotel is nothing they can change. The lifts are slow when busy. We had a 15 minute wait on one day and walked down!. Other than that, usually a few minutes.The shower is also quite small but adequate. The bed is superb, v comfy. The rooms are quite small but it is NYC. Ours was a king room which also had a chair beside the bed but adequate storage and a good tv.The front of house staff are all v good, professional and polite, as are the breakfast staff and all staff we encountered. The concierge guys arranged a town car to return to JFK and we ended up with a huge white limo, just for the 2 of us!! WOW!!! (for the same low price too)We have been fortunate enough to stay in NY 8 times, in a few hotels. This wasn't awful and we would stay here again for a good deal. It was quite expensive for 4 nights.
Stayed just last week at this property. Three blocks from the 42nd st subway station. Clean rooms, nice staff, great location and priced will. I would definitely stay here again,

Business / Fun trip (brought my family). This place is about location, location, location. Just close enough to Broadway and Times Square to be fun, but not super convenient for business. Rooms were not super clean is my only complaint. Overall a good value for Manhattan.

Stayed here for 3 days. It's in a great location if you want to be in the city. It is very clean. Worst elevator service I have ever seen. Small restaurant for breakfast. You have take the breakfast in your room.

This Hampton Inn was very clean and the staff amazing. The doorman, John Leyton, was extremely helpful and made excellent recommendations for dining and sights to see during my business trip. Everyone at the hotel was professional, the rooms were very clean and the linens changed daily. I would stay here again on my next business trip to this area. The neighborhood is good, the service impeccable and the hotel very nice.

Decided to go up to NYC for my birthday kind of last minute. Booked online through the hilton website and mentioned in the comments I was coming up for my birthday. When I checked in and got to my room, they had cupcakes and a hand written birthday card waiting for me. Very nice touch. I had booked a room with a city view. We were give a room on the 22nd floor on the same side of the building as the front entrance. There wasn't much of a view from our room.....Hotel is an easy walk to Times Square. There is an entrance to the subway one block up, and several restaurants right by there. There's also a starbucks at the end of the block as well as a drug store with in a block. The hotel isn't on the nicest street, but we had no issues walking back to the hotel after 2 am one late night. Breakfast was fine, typical Hampton Inn style. Wi-Fi worked just fine and they had two computers and a printer down in the lobby to use. My biggest complaints with the hotel are nothing they can really change. The elevators are slow, but we never had a 12 minute wait. It did take us 5-6 minutes one time, but most of the time, it's just a slightly more than average wait. The shower is also very small. Standing in it, my shoulders almost touched the door and wall, and the handle bar in the shower is very annoying since it is so tight. The rooms are also small, but it is NYC. Ours was a king room which also had a chair beside the bed. It would be very tight to have two doubles in that room. And that's something to note - all the rooms are the same size. So if you're a Hhonors gold/diamond member looking for an upgraded room, it's not going to happen here. They did provide free wi-fi and a welcome bag as well as bottled water. Overall a good stay. We got a decent deal online, but I wouldn't say it was great. I would stay here again though for a good deal.

Stayed here for business Dec 7-9. Walked right past it in the rain, signage hard to see and my GPS told me the wrong side of the street. But front desk was gracious and very nice. The room was small but extremely clean and comfortable. Nice big breakfast area. I had wanted to stay longer but the room prices went up to include the weekend (probably because SantaCon was in town). The street this hotel is on (in the garment district) looked slightly sketchy, not sure I'd feel comfortable really late at night walking back to this hotel unless I were in a large group or in a cab. Great location in walking distance to Times Square. Would stay there again.

Stayed here with a friend. It's in a great location if you want to be in the city. I've stayed in many NYC hotels and this is by far one of the smaller rooms I've stayed in. It was just right for my friend and I, but any more people in the room and it would have been crowded. The breakfast was a plus which helps save on a morning meal. Also the coffee, tea, apple cider and cookies in the afternoon in the lobby area is great! The only negative I would have to say is that my friend had a couple of stains on her bedding sheets otherwise good stay.

On the phone reservation they gave us one quote but when we were about to check out, they charged us more!! They raised the price and we didn't have our confirmation to prove them wrong since they never sent one..

Positives - Hotel is in a great locationIt is very clean and has HD TVMimi I believe, who works at front desk is awesome. She is GREAT at her jobFree Breakfast and bag checkNegativesWe had to wait for hot water, very annoying, but it came and stayed after initial waitThe radiator was making horrible noises throughout night, had to get up 3 times to stop itThe elevators are an absolute nightmareWe had a good stay, these weren't deal breaking for us, we know things happen in old buildings and most of these hotels have to live with what they are given. But the key in this stay is how receptive, helpful, courteous and understanding the front desk staff is. They truly care for their guests and it is evident. We are a points customer for Hilton and we were given back a nights stay. This is a decent place to stay for a weekend. We would stay here again if needed. The cleanliness, staff and location outweigh all the negatives.

The are several Hampton Inns in Manhattan. We recently stayed at the one on West 39th. The breakfast offerings and room appointments were the normal Hampton standard. The rooms were small as is typical for this part of New York City. The rooms were very clean. One positive standout point that should be mentioned is that the staff, to a person, where very, very, attentive, responsive, helpful and friendly.We were there with a moderately large group of high school students. The lobby of the hotel is fairly small...too small to comfortably use as a staging area when the group was getting ready to go somewhere.

Staff is very nice and went out of their way when a package arrived late to the hotel. Rooms are clean, but typically cramped without much desk space if you're working much. Easy access to Penn Station and Midtown. Breakfast a step above the usual Hampton fare.
Nice hotel for a quick trip. Rooms were very small, but it was a great location.

This hotel is in a decent location. Tiny rooms. Worst elevator service I have ever seen. As previously mentioned, the hotel staff has to use the same elevators as everyone else. 32 floors and 2 elevators. I timed it and it took me 12 minutes to go downstairs!

I spent 8 days at the hotel over Thanksgiving with my friend. I could not have had a more positive experience. The entire staff was exceptional! Mimi Cooke and the other front desk staff were accommodating and pleasant. In fact, I didn't encounter an unpleasant employee during my entire stay. The staff appears to work very well together and takes great pride in the property. My daughter was in the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade and we stopped in the lobby for coffee. The women who were working invited us in to the dining area to get a little breakfast before we left. They even went in the back to get the unopened boxes of muffins for us. It may sound like a little thing but it was 5:30 a.m., half an hour before they had to be ready to greet guests and they were cheerful and excited for us. The location of this hotel is fabulous. I was able to meet a few out-of-town visitors traveling into Port Authority (one block away), shop at Hell's Kitchen Flea Market (across one Ave), eat at a wonderful Italian Restaurant - Mercato- literally across the street. An absolutely wonderful experience!

I spent 4 nights here with my husband, two little girls, and parents over Thanksgiving, and overall had a great experience. The hotel staff was fantastic, especially Mimi Cooke. Even during this incredibly busy time, she was able to find us a double (I had misbooked a king) and put us in the room right next to my parents. She truly went above and beyond. We also loved the 4PM fresh baked cookies, the vast array of breakfast options, cleanliness of the hotel, and the great location in the city. I would have given a 5 for a value hotel had the rooms been bigger and had the elevators not been a nightmare. People were waiting 30 minutes at times to get the elevator and often ended up walking up or down 20+ flights. Didn't seem like there was a separate service elevator so with only 2 elevators and 150+ rooms, taking one elevator out for service was a killer for the guests. Despite this, I would stay here again for all the other ++++ that I mentioned.

I was here for 6 days on business. Hampton is smack up against a Holiday Inn and a Candlewood so there's lots of travellers in the area. Location is great - there's plenty of restaurants in walking distance and you can walk to Javits Center in about 10 minutes. The front desk welcomed us and was very efficient without being impersonal - just what I like. Self-serve breakfast each morning is croweded, but well stocked and makes mornings that much easier. Warm cookies when you get back each day are a very nice touch and much appreciated. Concierge and front desk staff were EXCELLENT in communications on minor engineering jobs that needed attention. Couldn't have asked for more, even at a 5 star property.The one area that brought this back down to 'averge' was the housekeeping routine. Being NYC and how much a premium there is for space, there are only 2 elevators serving the 32 floors. With only 6 rooms per floor, this shouldn't be a problem - and most of the time it wasn't. The breakdown happened each day as the housekeeping staff would monopolize one of the elevators and keep it locked on floors as they did room checks (yes, I watched this happen). There is no reason staff that is only walking around with a clipboard cannot release an elevator when they have to step out (however briefly) to check on their staff. Even more infuriating was the fact that they would stop at multiple floors that are close together instead of taking stairs. And yes this happened while guests waited in the elevator and on various floors to use the elevator for it's intended purpose - getting out. I would wait 5-10 minutes on average while this was happening - very frustrating.

My family and I arrived on October 23 very early but couldn't check in. The front desk member called a bellman and two actually came!! They were so welcoming and helpful and told us different places we could go and see while our room was being made. The two bellman were mostly always together and helped us throughout the week we was there. I was very thankful of Lido and Willy helping us in almost everything starting from the valet to up to the luggage and city attractions. The front desk manager or supervisor( not sure which one) was very kind and also welcoming. I would definitely be staying here again and would recommend it to all!! Breakfast and wifi was terrific and the location is perfect to go almost anywhere. My family enjoyed our first stay and more to come in this marvelous hotel. P.S. Very small rooms but very clean and comfortable.

Every one was most pleasant especially Mimi and Kevin. Kevin never forgot my name the entire trip .From check in to check out the will do a bag hold price line got a great price and the location in right around the corner form the Port Authority and a five min walk to Times Square. Also it was my birthday was that day and upon check I was greeted with balloons in my room, thanks you guys

This Hampton Inn was very clean and very comfortable. Room with two double beds was very small, but comforable. Bath had shower, but no tub. Free in-room wireless access is nice; we're so tired of hotels that charge for internet access. Breakfast is included in room price and it was plentiful and served in a very clean breakfast room. Front desk staff were extremely courteous and helpful. This hotel is convenient to the subway and a short walk to Times Square. This block of W. 39th was dirty and bedraggled when we were there, but did not have any security issues.

My husband and I stayed at this property over the Veteran's Day weekend. Our adult daughter surprised us by joining us and we needed a 2-bed room as a result, and the hotel was very full. Mimi Cooke, the Guest Service Manager, was incredibly helpful and somehow pulled a 2-bed room out of her hat, I have no idea how.Every member of the staff was amazing, but Mimi was exceptional, and we will be back in the future. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The rooms are small, but very clean, and we enjoyed out visit tremendously.

My rating has nothing to do with the quality of the hotel or the level of service. Everyone there was terrific. It's just acknowledging that the hotel which is on the Southwest side of the Port Authority bus terminal, just isn't the best place if you're traveling with your kids. Like all city bus stations, there are lots of sketchy people around at all hours. Definitely convenient for business trips, and it's super close to Times Square. But for people who aren't comfortable in the city, or have kids with them, you probably want to get something at least one avenue closer to the action, and one avenue further from Port Authority.

A one night business stay couldn't have been any easier or more comfortable anywhere else thanks to the amazingly friendly, helpful staff and the immaculate, comfortable room. The beds are extremely pleasant, the rooms are exceptionally clean & quiet and the staff is far more personable & helpful than any of the big luxury hotels in the city. The location was easy to move in & out of the area quickly, yet very close to the theatre district and attractions.

The hotel overall was great. A great breakfast was available both mornings. The front desk agent (i believe it was kelvin? Calvin?) was very nice and polite. We needed to check our bags when we arrived and when we were leaving and they were more than happy to do so. That was a great touch. The only problem I had was the small rooms. Nothing you can do about that in New York though. The hotel is also within walking distance of the times square and everything else.

We stayed over the Veterans Day weekend, arriving late in the evening of the 10th. We were met with a smile and a second floor room that was probably one of the smallest Hampton Inn rooms I've ever seen. It was a bit cramped and not a lot of surface space to spread out in. However, the room was clean and the beds are very comfortable. The bathroom had very little counterspace was was also very clean. There was a shower stall and no tub.Breakfast was the usual Hampton Inn fare. Nothing special but there is hot food, make your own waffles and a selection of fresh fruit and pastries. As always coffee and tea are available all day and we even got a cookie on Friday afternoon. The breakfast staff are friendly and efficiently clear away garbage and clean the mess that people make.Front desk staff, and there were always a few around the lobby, were friendly and knowledgeable. They welcomed us every time we came in and when I came looking for some cardboard to prevent something I was taking home from bending, the young man behind the desk was very helpful. He emptied out a box and gave it to me. It was the perfect solution.Location was great if you arrived at the Port Authority. We flew in to Newark and took the Newark Airport Express bus to the Port Authority. It lets you off at 42nd and 8th. We walked 2 blocks to 39th and then half a block up 8th to find our hotel. Going back to Newark, the bus picks you up on 41st and 8th. Very convenient. Location for the rest of Times Square is ok but this hotel is on the southern edge of Times Square. Personally, I prefer the Hampton Inn Times Square North location but some will say that's the north fringe of Times Square. All in all, the location was not a problem. There is a LOT of construction occurring across the street but we were there on the weekend so it didn't seem to bother us very much. At night there's a strip club at the corner of 39th and 8th but it didn't feel unsafe. The hotel is next to a bunch of hotels. The Hells Kitchen Flea Market is up half a block at 9th on the weekends so if you enjoy flea markets, it's a nice stroll in morning.We'd stay here again.

My husband & I have just returned from 5 night stay at this hotel. On arrival we were greeted with friendly & helpful staff who advised us that our room was being inspected....after a little wait (with free tea & coffee) we were allocated our room on 22nd floor. The room was lovely & clean, not massive but big enough for the 2 of us, nice shower & bathroom area and very comfortable bed! Rooms very also inspected by housekeeping each day which we thought showed that staff were making sure standards were being met & each time we were asked if we were happy with the room.Yes, as other reviews will say there is construction work across from the hotel but this does not generally start til 8am and as you are going out and about in New York during the day by the time we got back it was either finished or finishing so it never bothered us and our room was opposite it! Street noise is also at a minimum due to how high up we were.Hotel is in a good location to times sq, port authority bus terminal and times sq subway Stn. Times sq is only 3 blocks & 1ave away and could be walked in just over 5 mins Full breakfast served everyday which is a bonus and saves you $ in terms of food bills....hot and cold options for all and nothing is too much trouble for breakfast girls who were polite and accommodating to our requests. Weekends were busier esp as we were guests over NYC marathon weekend but we were still able to get seats in dining area.Reception were always on hand if we had any questions or requests and Jennifer was always particularly helpful and friendly, welcoming us back to the hotel every evening with a smile asking us if we had had a nice day & where we had been.We will definitely go back to both NYC and this hotel! Thanks Hampton Inn!

I stayed here in April 2011. My bottle of perfume ( Big bottle of a French fragrance and limited edition) disappeared from my room. I have advised the front office. They told me housekeeping would have the item but we couldn’t reach them at the end of the day. After having asked 3 times a feedback,my stay was over, I was asked to fill in a paper which would be submitted threw insurance. Upon my return in Europe, I had to chase for a feedback as I was never contacted by this FAMOUS insurance. There was an exchange of e-mail between myself and front office, I was really convinced they wanted to solve my issue and reimburse me. Since June , they do not answer to my emails, I even contacted headquarters in Texas.No answer , it’s is clear may claim is not taken seriously and there is no willingness to solve those type of problems.It happened 8 MONTHS ago and no resolution. It’s a pitty for such a big group as Hilton no covering those incidents by their insurance. Client service is unfortunately not existent.

This was the first time that I have stayed in this hotel or in this neighbourhood. It is near the Port Authority Bus Terminal on the west side and near many of the ethnic westside restos. Unfortunately we were caught in the freak Saturday storm but the hotel weathered this very well and the breakfasts were very welcome as it was nice possible to stray to far outside wothout being soaked. Excellent service and not too big - only 6 rooms per floor.

A group of six ladies stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square South earlier this month. The hotel has 32 floors, with only 6 rooms per floor. We reserved three rooms at a pretty good rate for this time of year. Hoped, but didn't expect for all three rooms to be on the same floor. We arrived around noon, but couldn't check in. The hotel kept our bags and when we came back later we were happy to find that all rooms were on the same floor! Two rooms faced the back of the building, but one faced the street. Unfortunately for the two in that room, there was a lot of night noise - street and construction in the building across the street. Per other postings, the elevators are a bit slow, but most of the time we were fine. Breakfast was the usual Hampton Inn fare - not great, but included and a way to start the morning without having to find a restaurant/coffee shop. The staff were very pleasant and always asked how our stay was going. (We were there for four nights.) We did use the concierge service and they were also very helpful.

Obviously caters to one timer tourists who come to the theater district. Lousy value for the price unless you consider that close to $400 a night entitles you to paper plates and cups and absolutely no service.

Being first-timers and staying only one night we didn't have many expectations. The main draw was the location, near Times Square, and the free breakfast.For the most part it was a very nice place, with pleasant and extremely helpful front desk staff. The free space in the room was limited. The 2 queen beds were extremely comfortable but took up the majority of the space. The bathroom was spacious. Overall it was very clean and maintained.The free breakfast was just like every other Hampton Inn out there. Plenty of seating and the staff did a nice job of clearing the tables after guests left. The waffles were definitely the best choice.The front desk staff were friendly and contacted a car agency to get us to LaGuardia with a set fee which included tip. The driver was waiting for us at the exact time we requested.The main problem was the elevators. 2 smaller elevators in a 34 floor hotel where baggage is common just doesn't work. The wait for a family and their bags to get on was approximately 15 minutes about an hour before checkout.About an 8 (short) block walk up to some amazing restaurants and to Al Hirschfeld Theatre. Walked to Times Square, 30 Rockefeller/NBC Studios, Empire State Building - all very accessible.

I spent a Saturday and Sunday night here recently, on leisure travel with my husband. We took the bus to the city and were easily able to walk to the hotel from where we were dropped off. The hotel is right near Times Square and Hells Kitchen. On Sunday morning we ran to Central Park, which was a little bit over a mile north. There are several underground stops within walking distance. Basically, the hotel is in a great location. We walked everywhere except when we went to Brooklyn to visit friends. Lots of restaurants and fun shops around too.The property itself was average at best. We checked in at 2:30 and were told our room wasn't ready yet. Fine, since check in isn't until 3:00 officially. We left our luggage, and returned at 4:30, needing to shower and get ready for an early dinner before a broadway show. The room was still not ready. I thought this was unacceptable. It was about 10 more minutes until we were given our keys, but the room really should have been ready earlier, especially since we checked in at 2:30. Service was pleasant even though not overly competent.The room is tiny, it's the smallest hotel room I think I've been in! I live in a city so I understand space demands, and it's really not a big deal, but don't expect to fit an extra person in your room or have space to sprawl. There was a child sitting in the hallway for several hours playing video games, and I'm sure it's because there was not enough space for him and his parents in his room!There are only 2 small elevators in the hotel, and there does not appear to be a freight elevator. This is probably why our room wasn't ready; it takes forever to get from one floor to the next. Expect long waits and crowded conditions getting to and from your floor. We budgeted and extra 20 minutes to get our luggage out when we were checking out.Breakfast is standard for a Hampton Inn. The dining room, however, was very crowded, and we had to wait for a free table. Service again was above average, and when things ran out they were usually refilled quickly. Overall it's impressive for the limited space and amount of people passing through, but it's a bit frustrating for a traveller. I used the gym only to fill my water bottle. When I went it all the machines were in use. Again, it's a small space, so nothing fantastic.I might stay here again, there was nothing glaringly wrong with the property, just be preapred to be crowded and herded throughout your stay. I should also add that we are Hilton Diamond members, and there weren't any perks to our loyalty.

Let me make this as simple as I can and highlight the good and the bad.The good:- location- decent breakfast for New York (I would not like to compare it with Asia hotels though)- free internet wireless- did I mention location?The not so good:- even if location is great, Hotel (Inn?) entrance is on a side street and has a huge construction just in front. Wasn't so clean and just a little noisy.- as mentioned by many other reviewers, the Inn has 2 elevators and do get very crowded at peak times;- no fridge in the room;- room very very small (again this seems to be usual in Manhattan) especially for a family;In conclusion if the target is to have a Hotel on a lower price (not so low though) in middle Manhattan this is a good choice, just keep in mind the downsides.

I have stayed many Hampton Inn, but first time I was provided a room with used soaps at bathroom, shower room, someone's hair at the bed, stink, and less towels. My booking was through Expedia, booked standard room but was assigned accessible room first. Staff was not friendly at all. Will never stay here again.
Great staff, hot breakfast included, comfy bed, good location

I stayed here for 5 nights with my bf during early September. We are from Australia and were touring around the East side of America. The location of the hotel was fantastic, you were very close to time square and Broadway. Most things were walkable or a short taxi ride. Also we were very close to the hells kitchen area which is a street full of restaurants and bars. The only problem about the location was that we were across the road from construction that went all hours of the night! The staff were great and helpful but there was no room service. The room was small but that is all you need. The cleaners kept things very clean and always gave us fresh towels. Only one elevator in the hotel that was always pretty full and peak times. One things we loved about the hotel was that we had free wi-fi internet from our room :-). Also breakfast was free but the food is fairly average. Overall I would stay here again if I knew there wasnt construction going on.

This hotel is in a very good location, just around the corner from Hell's Kitchen and only a few blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The neighborhood has a bit of an industrial feel, but also very safe, with a couple other hotels in line there, and a good mix of restaurant options. And pretty close to the 42nd street subway station where you can catch the D Train up to 161st (Yankee Stadium).As stated in other reviews, the rooms are on the smaller size, but we had a room with two beds, and it was workable. Call it a European (or big city) feel, and get out the door and enjoy the city. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were quiet. Yes, the two elevators can be slow at busier times, but budget an extra five minutes and you'll be fine.As usual, the breakfast was excellent, and we had plenty of room at 8:00 AM. Staff were great, and there is a concierge who can help with local things. Also, I have to note that twice I rode the elevator with "engineering/maintenance" staff, and both those fellows took the time to greet me and ask if the room's OK. That was very much appreciated.We enjoyed our stay here, and when I return to NYC will look at this property as my first option.

This was a great 2 night Stay in Manhattan. The staff there were very nice, helpful and friendly. They gave us free bottles of water whenever we asked even after someone had told me "nothing is free in New York"Great location, close to Penn station, subways, times square and Theaters.I would stay here again.Only downside is that the wait for an elevator can be very very long, so just add that to your time when trying to get somewhere.

Arriving by train to Penn Station, this hotel is ideally situated between Madison Square Garden and Times Square. The staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. On our way out, it was pouring rain. In addition to the front desk calling us a cab, a young man escorted us to it with an umbrella and put our bags in the trunk. The breakfast was more than adequate and the cookies in the lobby in the afternoon were a welcome snack! Yes, the rooms are small - we had two double beds - but they're really just a place to sleep and shower. They were clean and the beds were comfy. The shower had great water pressure. We didn't hear any traffic noise but did hear the elevator bell when it stopped on our floor. The only thing I really missed was being able to catch CNBC. (I would have appreciated seeing what's going on during the global financial volatility.) I was also surprised that there was no phone on the nightstand between the beds - only on the desk. Nonetheless, if we return to NYC next year, we'll try to stay here.

Small but lovely room and all the usual Hampton things I like. I stayed for three nights in September with a bus tour. I would have given this place a five rating but for two minor things. They only had one kind of bagel at breakfast which had raisins in it and not everyone likes raisins. The other thing was the cold water was hot when I went to brush my teeth. The staff was very friendly and helpful tho and I actually thought that there was plenty of room in the breakfast area. This hotel is in a great area where you can walk to everything and that means a lot to someone like me with walking issues. I would definitely go here again.

We chose this hotel due to the location and the complimentary breakfast, plus the reviews and we weren't disappointed. The best thing about this hotel is that it's so close to everything AND it's quiet. Not bad in the hustle and bustle of NYC with Times Square a few blocks away. Yes the room was small (probably not for NY standards) but it was adequate and the breakfasts were a bonus (I finally got around to working out how to make waffles on the second day). The business centre was very handy for catching up on work emails, and the afternoon snacks and 24 hour coffee were much appreciated. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. The location was perfect for sightseeing: two blocks from just about everything. The Garment District is close, the subways and bus station were a short walk from the hotel and the NY Pass Blue Hop On Hop Off bus was 2 blocks away. The Westway Diner only a short walk away in Hells Kitchen at 614 Ninth Avenue, was really cheap with good food (voted best diner in Manhattan). We've recommended this hotel to friends and they've been as happy as we were with the level of accommodation and the excellent location.

Great Location - Midtown South - with helpful staff. Hotel is situated in Midtown South with easy Subway Access - short walk to Times Square and just steps away from Hells Kitchen - (lots of great dining options very close by too)

Perfect location to sightsee in NYC! One block from GrayLine bus tour starting routes. Two blocks from Times Square. In the heart of the theater district. We went to Wicked, which is right around the corner. Right next to Dollar-Rent-A-Car. Three blocks from Central Park. We had a wonderful trip. Front desk was helpful in rescheduling. Rooms were clean and neat. Great breakfast in the morning! Will definately book here again!

The smallest breakfast room I've ever ran from hungry. Friendly staff (he was small too, now that I think of it). Do not attempt to sit in the desk chair, wedged between the desk and the bed. It's hopeless. Folks, be honest that the rooms are tiny and just put a queen size bed in the room, not two doubles. It's ridiculous. I do travel to NYC often, so I know that ALL the hotel rooms are comparatively small, but I'd like to warn fellow travelers that this place takes it to the extreme. The room was very clean.

We have been here for the past 4 nights and are leaving tomorrow. Our stay has been great and the staff very friendly. We are traveling with our two year old and the place had decent space for New York and I suspect without spending a lot more money it would be tough to find more space in the city. Breakfast has been different most days and way above most hotel breakfasts. Location is right near everything and lots of restaurants just up 9th around 46th.

We go to NYC about once a year and usually stay closer to Central Park. We decided to try staying here and really liked the area. It was a 3 block walk to Port Authority and very close to the theaters and Times Square. The breakfast buffet was well stocked and had 2 waffle makers and fresh fruit. The only complaint was the elevators..there were 2 small ones and during the breakfast hour there was a long wait for one and often it was already full. The sfaff was great - friendly and knowledgeable.

As someone who has worked in the hospitality industry for a long time, I was taken back at how bad the service was at this hotel. Especially, since it is situated in a popular area such as Midtown Manhattan. I could not believe at how unfriendly the front desk staff was, including the manager on duty, Anthony. Several mishaps occurred during my stay and not once did I receive an apology. In fact, when i came to the front desk to get the problem resolved it seemed as if trying to solve this matter (that they originally created themselves) was a burden to them. I will definitely not return to this hotel considering the fact that I have stayed in several other hotels in Manhattan that had excellent service.

This is a very well located hotel that delivers very good value for money. If you are looking for a clean, friendly, reasonably priced and well located hotel in the centre of Manhattan, then this hotel fits the bill perfectly.If you are using the double rooms for three or four people you may find them a little on the small side, but this is New York so how much time are spending in your room!Breakfast is included in the room rate as are locall calls and internet access, which makes it an even better deal.The staff were without exception really helpful and friendly. It is worth a mention on the day we checked the hotel was able to store our luggage, which was really handy. New York also suffered from a torrential downpour that afternoon, so we and several other guests came back to collect our luggage like drowned rats and there were stacks of towels available in the lobby for us to dry off with, which I found really helpful especially as we had already checked out. The only real drawback are the lifts. There are only two and they can get really busy around the morning breakfast period. However this is really a minor grumble and overall this is a really good place to stay in New York.

The hotel is in an excelent location, walking distance from Times Square. The price is very decent comparing to other NYC hotels, and it included a great breaksfast (which might be rare for NY!). We were in 3 in a 2 bed room and although small in was confy. But there were some negatives: there are just 2 small elevators for all 30+ floors, we had to wait 10 or 15 min to find an empty spot during "rush hour" (morning mainly). The same street has a "stripper club" that attracts some "bad neighborhood" late at night - we came back walking after midnight and felt unsafe (although nothing actually happenend, but we felt unconfortable). But besides that, I'd recommend and would stay over again.

We were booked to go to this hotel but had to reschedule our trip thanks to Hurricane Irene disrupting flights. Now trying desperately to get in touch with hotel to check our booking has been rescheduled for 2nd - 9th Sept (spoke to someone mid-storm and she confirmed it'd be ok, but said she'd need to wait for the manager to change the booking and we should phone back), but phone lines now look like they're down with storm damage. If the manager is reading this, please get in touch! Really looking forward to going and hoping it'll all be ok. Will add a proper review once we've been.

The room that I had was small and located on the 10th floor. It was very clean, neat and met my standards. The beds were comfortable. I arrived first and my friends arrived after I did. I like that the staff called me to ask if my guest could have a key to the room so that I did not have to travel down to greet them. Thank goodness- the elevator would have taken a while as I soon learned (2 elevators for 32 floors). The next morning we sent off for our day in the city, came back to a clean room but they took our towels and didn't replace them or the bathmat. Kinda of odd but we managed. We are a no hassle type of crowd. The next morning for check out was a nightmare. We tried to catch the elevator to leave at 11 but every time was full or had to wait more than 20 minutes. We ended up just carrying out luggage down the stairs to make sure that some of us could make our trains out of the city. I adored the hotel and the proximity to everything but the elevators to get down to the lobby were another thing.

Whilst planning our third trip to NYC, we shortlisted a couple of hotels based on price, reviews, and previous stays. From our final shortlist of three hotels, all centrally located and at similar prices, we chose the Hampton Inn because of the ‘extras’ included in the price – the free WiFi and the breakfast.On arrival at the hotel, check-in was friendly and efficient, and we were helped to our room by a friendly doorman. All of the staff we had dealings with were friendly, efficient, and always greeted you with a smile.Our room was spacious, clean, and well equipped, with everything we needed for our three night stay. Air conditioning was effective and not too noisy, coffee maker was very handy, and Wi-Fi worked well.You can also access the internet at the ‘Business Centre’ – a very small room with a couple of PCs and a printer – ideal for checking in for a flight and printing boarding passes.There was sometimes a wait for the lift/elevator, but never too long, and certainly no worse than we’ve experienced in other hotels.We’d read reviews saying the breakfast wasn’t much more than a pastry/muffin and a coffee, so we weren’t expecting too much, and thought that was at least something to get us started for the day. Breakfast turned out to be far better than we expected, with a selection of fruit juices, cereals, muffins, bagels, toast (self-service toaster), two different hot items daily, and a self service waffle-maker. Tea, coffee, and hot chocolate were always available, with lidded paper cups so you could take your drink away with you.The breakfast room is quite small, so did get busy, although we always found a table.The cookies on the front desk in the afternoon are as good as everyone says!We were very happy with this hotel and will certainly stay there again.

stayed one night on the 21st floor & was pleasantly pleased. valet parking, clean hotel. quiet room, comfortable firm bed, shampoos, lotion, coffee maker & a window with a nice skyline/river view. buffet breakfast was included in the price & was quite substantial, including hot & cold items. unfortunately, the elevators are small & only one elevator was working. the cleaning staff used the same elevator, so room was sparse & patience was low. on the up side, i would recommend this hotel especially if you are venturing in the Times Square/theater area.

My son and I stayed here a few years ago over Easter weekend and we loved it. The staff was very friendly and our bellman was top notch. The location was great as we walked to just about everything, the price was right. I have recommended this place to several people as the place to stay in NYC. We will be back!
Close to times square, elevators are very slow. Funny smell in hotel but not in rooms.Concierge was awesome!! No safe in room.
Great room. Close to everything. Great value. Breakfast every morning. Quiet rooms. And for all the floors and guest in the building elevators were extremely fast. Plus cookies at check-in :-)

I stayed at the Hampton Inn TQS as a follow to a business trip for a couple days. New York hotel rooms are notoriously a) expensive and b) small, however this hotel delivered pretty good value all round. The location is not perhaps the best...It's on the edge of Hells Kitchen and sits between 8th (the ironically named "fashion ave") and 9th and W39th is frankly shoddy, especially approaching from 8th (which most guests will do if coming on foot from the subway or Penn Stn)The rooms are decently kitted out and God bless Hampton Inns, there is free wifi!!! Take note other hotel chains! I had just one issue with my room - no closing drapes, which is interesting since I looked straight into another hotel room opposite. Other than that, the rooms are fine and newly decorated. The Fitness Room is perfectly adequate and in my three days I went every day and saw just one other person, more than three people in there and things may get a little too close for comfort. Don't get too excited by the buffet breakfast - it's simple fare but for a family who are budget conscious - it's perfectly fine! The hot selection was frankly, limited, but for the room cost, who cares?I found all staff very helpful and polite - which makes a pleasant change in NYC!My only gripe with this hotel is the elevators. The hotel is tall and (very) narrow - 5 rooms per floor and 32 floors. It's serviced by two small elevators. Luckily I was on the 5th floor and virtually every day I took the walk option after waiting 5 minutes for the lift. Not sure how I would have felt if I was on the 25th floor. On a similar vien, the reception space is very cramped and really no more than one person can wait in the space available for the lifts and for poor staff manouvering luggage etc, it must be a nightmare!All that said - there are many many worse and more expensive hotels in NYC. If value for money drives your decision, put this hotel on your list!

We looked a lot for reasonably priced hotels, and we are glad we chose this one. The staff was very helpful - always bringing us extra coffee for the coffee maker. The rooms were very, very clean. (Small, but clean). We chose a room with a view (higher floor), and it was nice to see the rest of the city - did not buy much, except we did not have to look at another building when we were there (not much). The one complaint I would have is the breakfast - everyone in the hotel must come down late for breakfast and it was crazy busy with people! We ended up skipping breakfast due to the crazy line and because we ate so much from the night before. Would definiteily stay here again.

New York City may have a reputation for indifferent (or downright rude) service, but not at this hotel. Every member of this always-smiling, friendly staff went out of his or her way to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Example: We were sitting in the little dining area after enjoying the breakfast buffet, getting ready to hit the streets, when a staff member came up to us and asked if we'd like some bottled water to take with us. Another example: My iPhone charger broke and the woman at the front-desk used her personal charger to help me. There's complimentary coffee available 24/7 and tasty cookies constantly being served up. Our room was more than adequate. The only negative: just two elevators serving 23 floors, so plan to wait (although once you board you'll be happy at how FAST they get you to your destination).
Closed to many restaurants, cafes and short distance from many tourist atracctions.

This Hampton Inn is truly a hidden gem in the concrete jungle! The immaculately clean and quiet interior was a rare find, not to mention the reasonable price for our last minute reservation. I would recommend this hotel for both business and family trips, as it caters nicely to both. The rooms were very small, with little floorspace, yet it was modern, clean, and well-equipped. The rooms don't offer sweeping views of the city skyline, yet it's in a safe, convenient area that's bustling at night. A continental breakfast in the morning was another added treat! The staff was incredibly friendly, and held our bags at the front desk after check out while we city-hopped. The business center and gym were both added bonuses. Overall, this hotel was the icing on the cake to our New York trip!

We just spent 5 nights in NYC on vacation. The youngest of my two teenage son's got a "stomaach bug" and was sick for two days. I was franticly tring to aid one son while entertaining the other. Kudos to Evangeline, Erica, Jesus, Brian, Kevin, Ameila (housekeeping) and so many other individuals whose names I may have forgotten, the entire staff provided my family with exceptional customer service.I travel quite a bit for business purposes and therefore usually stay in a full-service hotel. Though this hotel is extremely busy, the staff goes out of their way to make guests feel welcome.The staff at this Hampton Inn location was much more courteous to me than the Hilton Honors Reservation personnel that assisted me in making the reservation.However, the elevators are very slow...especially in the morning between 8 - 10 AM.

Our room with king-sized bed on the 25th floor, although small, had everything we needed, was very clean and surprisingly quiet. The hotel staff were always helpful and courteous. One staff member on duty our last night saw us waiting to use the computer room to get boarding passes, and suggested we use the computer at the check-in desk to save time. We were most appreciative. The full buffet breakfasts provided at no extra charge are a real bonus. We did not need to eat lunch any of the days during our visit. Also, coffee and tea are available throughout the day, and cookies later in the day. Although 39th Street between 8th and 9th Avenues tends to be sketchy, the location is great because of its proximity to the Port Authority, restaurants and theaters. It was easy taking the express bus to and from Newark Airport. It's also an easy walk to 9th Avenue and "restaurant row", where you will find a variety of ethnic restaurants and diners offering good food and service at reasonable prices. We were also able to walk to all four of the theaters we attended. We will definitely stay at this Hampton Inn again.

Stayed here one night in early July 2011. I got it for less than a $100, and for that alone, it's worth it. I challenge you to try and find a good chain hotel in Manhattan for that price.It's nothing fancy, however. I wouldn't bring a date here, since it's not romantic. If you're a solo traveler, or just staying with friends, it's ok.One word of warning: I'm a young traveler and had no issue with it, but I wouldn't bring my senior parents here. The reason: the elevators are limited, and they are SUPER SLOW. Tiny, too. Do not come here if your parents or a loved ones uses a walker. The rooms are too cramped to accommodate a walker, as well. I saw some older people checking in, and I felt sorry for them.But if you're young and single like me, this is a good place to come to if you get a good deal on it, and want to stay in a safe part of Manhattan.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square South last August and enjoyed our stay very much.The hotel is quite new and rooms are modern and clean. They are a bit smaller than the usual Hampton Inn rooms but this is NYC. Location is great - Times Square and Port Authority are only a few minutes away. The street in which the hotel is located is not noisy. Others mentioned that is looks a bit desolate but we never felt unsafe and next to the Hmapton Inn there is also a Holiday Inn Express and I think a Fairfield Inn. Breakfast is good, though the breakfast area is indeed a bit small. However, we never had problems finding a table. The only minus is the elevators which are slow and not enough for a hotel this size.
Excellent location, good service and huge breakfast included. There is even a free access to the laundry!Rates are very correct for the service

I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It was clean, staff was polite and friendly and location was great. We had nice doubleroom on 18th floor with king bed and window facing to the street. It was very quiet (we had nice room neighbours) and because room was so high there wasn't any noise from the street. Elevator was very slow when the hotel was full (Memorial Day) but on the other days waiting time was tolerable. For two person room and bathroom was big enough to sleep and go shower. Bed was actually huge! Breakfast was ok. Coffee was great and it was available during the day. I would have liked to put some tomatoes or cucumber or salad (anything green) to my bread, almost anything else but jelly or syrup. For my taste breakfast was bit too heavy and greasy but if you like to eat donuts, muffins and waffles for breakfast it would be nice.Location was great because Times Square was just around the corner and Port Authority bus station was also very near. From JFK there comes a Airpoirt Shuttle and there is also metro station (42nd steet) where stops many good lines for a tourist. In the 9th avenue there was nice restaurants and one very good italian (Mercato) was almost across the street Hamton Inn. (I recommend to avoid those tourist robbing restaurants on Times Square and go to some little place. You will save money and have better food.)

I recently went to NY to see a show and had the absolute pleasure of staying here. It was walking distance to Times Square, and the theatre district. The rate was extremely reasonable. Even on short notice. I used the website and it was very user friendly. There is parking on site which, was reasonable for hotel guest as well. The room was very clean. The staff was exceptional upon arrival and throughout our stay. And,the breakfast served each morning was very nice. We had left something in the room after checking out and I was contacted by the house keeping/lost and found immediately. Luckily I was still in the city and was able to go and pick it up but, they were accommodating and polite when I returned to retrieve it. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Stayed one night and had breakfast. They kept our luggage before check-in (we arrived before noon but didn't check in until 11pm) and after check-out (kept our bags until 5:30pm). No problems. The breakfast was convenient - (make your own belgium waffles, yogurt, cereal, toast, muffins, bagel toppers (a bagel with egg, cheese and some kind of meat). Excellent coffee station. Not great, not bad - i just eat yogurt but the girls loved the waffles and fresh fruit). Even when crowded, they didn't run out of food.The location was convenient to theater, times square and the mega bus busstop. The concierge was helpful with reservations and provided a nice map. We brought pizza back at the end of the day and ate in the breakfast area. Also, plenty of comfortable seats in the lobby, with newspapers and coffee while waiting for the rest of my family to rise. There are many choices when staying in NYC. I've stayed at Marriott Marquis and Crown Plaza (both much nicer but twice the price). For about the same price, I prefer the Best Western Hospitality Suites - but it's a different location, so really depends on what you are planning to do. The hampton inn is very convenient for theater and close to the mega bus busstop. True that elevator is slow and sheets are noisy. Bedspread is lumpy. I really didn't sleep well- but the rest of the family did. I wouldn't stay for a long trip, but for a convenient overnight at a great price, this was fine.

The hotel is on the cheap end of the range for NYC. And the location, while not great, is a few blocks from nice places. The rooms are clean, and like all NYC hotels, small.But the staff made us wait long after check in time to get a room. On a hot, hot day. We weren't the only ones, and other guests from the prior day had the same experience. Many of the staff seemed nice, but the operations here are frustratingly bad. The elevator is very slow. Waits of five minutes aren't uncommon.Wish I had spent $50 more for a better place...

My two friends and I stayed at this hotel for three nights from July 12-16th. We arrived in NYC early, and the hotel held our luggage until we checked in later in the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful.and gave us maps of the city, and answered any questions we had! The warm cookies weren't ready when we checked in, but we got some the next day. The hotel rooms are small, but very clean and modern. The hotel offers a hot breakfast in the morning from 6am-10am. They had hot waffles, eggs and sausage, bagels, muffins, croissants, cereals, fruits, yogurts, juices, coffee, and tea. It was great but a bit busy during 8-9am. There is also hot chocolate, tea and coffee in the lobby 24/7, which was convenient when we came back after a long day of tourning the city.

The location of the hotel is excellent, short walking distance from Time Square, Rockefeller center etc. Staff was friendly, room was clean (although small) and quiet. I can recommend this hotel for someone looking for a smart place to stay near to the attractions. If you're going to spend a lot of time in the hotel you might find it a bit cramped. Also the view is not amazing, unless perhaps if you get a room on the upper floors (32 floors total, ours was on the 12th).Breakfast was a mild shock though. The food itself was OK, but the use of disposable cups, plates and cutlery was totally incomprihensible to me and my wife. Maybe this is the "American way", but for a hotel that touts environmental values all over the place (big notice in elevator, ads on the paper cups themselves...) this is pretty ironic. It's also not a good idea to advertise that the paper cups are recyclable and then not offer any kind of recycling anywhere...

My sister and I stayed 1 night. After reading trip advisor reviews of similarly priced properties in manhattan that sounded awful we were glad to find that the Hampton lived up to its good reviews. All we wanted was a nice clean place in this location which we got plus the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more accommodating.

When my friend and I checked in we discovered we couldn't have the room with 2 beds that we'd requested, because the hotel had a flood. However, to accommodate us, they had put us in TWO rooms (for the same price as one) so that we could still have two beds. So we were off to an impressive start! The room itself was clean, the bed quite comfortable. The free wifi worked extremely well, complimentary breakfast was decent, and I was very happy that they had coffee and tea available in the lobby at all hours.And then there was the staff -- everyone I interacted with was very pleasant and efficient. The only drawback to this hotel is its layout: two very small elevators in a tall building, and a narrow corridor where there was sometimes a wait for the elevator. But I would gladly stay there again.

I chose this hotel after reading many reviews on other hotels in this area. This hotel had many many great reviews and the last thing I wanted to happen is end up in some dive hotel. The staff at this hotel were so nice and more than helpful! My room was very clean and also very modernized, not like other generic hotels. They had a large continental breakfast with many different options. They even baked fresh cookies for their guests up at the front desk! Nothing better than walking into your hotel and smelling fresh cookies!! One of the best parts about them was the fact that they will hold on to your luggage even after you check out so you don't have to carry it all over the city!! They are amazing!

This hotel is located on 8th ave between West 51st and 52nd. It is one block from Time Square and near most plays. A 10 min walk to Columbus Circle and Central Park. The rooms were in very good condition and the beds were comfortable. For a NYC hotel the rooms seemed spacious. The bath tub however, was a little worn. The Comforter and sheets were clean and fresh as Hampton markets; -cleaned fresh for each guest. No signs on bed bugs and we did check. The hotel offers complimentary coffe, tea and hot chocolate 24hrs a day. There is no fridge or microwave in a king standard room. Ice and soda machine on each floor.The breakfast was very decent, eggs, ham, bagels, fruit, and cereals. The lines seemed to move fast. There is a parking garage next door of which the hotel offers a discount, provided that you have your parking ticket stamped at the desk. We paid $30 for 24hrs for an SUV. Most garages up charge parking fees on SUV's. Tip: to avoid the 12 noon check-out rush, have the bell desk hold your luggage and go out to lunch. By that time the lines shouldn't be an issue.Since this hotel is not exactly on Time Square there is no heavy foot traffic in front of the building. A 24 hour Rite Aid store is a few steps away should you need to buy soda, snacks, etc.Cosmic Diner is across the street and is opened 24hrs. The hotel is family friendly. I would stay here again.

I went with my family to New York and stayed here from July 3-8 (today), and the hotel was great!! The staff was very friendly, there was free breakfast and Wi-fi, and we weren't too far from times sq. Or broadway… this was my first time ever in new York and I loved it!! Thanks for helping make my first time in New York a great 1!!

Located between 8th & 9th Av, an easy walk from Penn Station and subway, pleasant 32-story hotel, very responsive staff (and plenty of them), 6 rooms per floor, comfortable,room, air conditioning easy to control, mostly tourists, nice free breakfast with plenty of seating, free wi-fi. Area used to be iffy but now several hotels are in this block, very safe-feeling. Easy walk to theatres. Lots of restaurants on 9th Av.

Great site. Good location (about 2 blocks from Times Square) and clean and comfortable. Rooms were as expected, no micro nor pool but who's looking for that at Times Square ? Internet was included, a bit slow (384 kb average) both wired and wireless. Valet parking for $55 per day but right behind the hotel you get a parking on your own for $38. We would return for sure :)

Arrived at Hampton Inn on July 1. The picture shown in advertisement is accurate, however, the view directly across the street is total opposite. Upon arrival i was a little leary of the location. We booked the Hampton South because there was no availability for Hampton North. Once inside the hotel I was relieved. It was small, but clean. Staff was friendly. We checked in a little early and this was a big help as we arrived to the city a little early. We reserved a room with 2 double beds. The rooms are very small but clean. The restroom was especially small but again, clean. The hotel is recently renovated and upgraded to more modern flair. I was traveling with my husband and 2 small children and we have stayed in rooms with 2 double beds before but this room was very very small and i felt like we were cramped and on top of each other. The location is close to Times Square. We actually walked to the Minske theatre and I enjoyed the walk and exploring the different stores and being a part of the NY city night life. The best part about the hotel stay was the complimentary breakfast. I enjoyed the large selection of hot foods and muffins and cereals and make your own waffles and juice, etc. The food was good but I have to warn you to go early, before 8am. The breakfast is between 6 - 10am but after 8am it is very crowded. I am an early riser and I visited the food area early and enjoyed my breakfast and the quiet space. However, my husband and the kids slept till 8am and was very disappointed at the crowd when they went down. But overall, the complimentary breakfast was the best part of the stay. Overall, the hotel was okay. The new renovations help to erase the ugly view directly across the street and the one block walk to the main streets. I would stay here again ONLY if it is just myself and my husband. A little too small for the entire family. But a good clean hotel in NY city close to Times Square. Valet parking was more expensive than usual but convenient. Oh, the one thing that bothered my husband the most is the long long wait for the very slow elevators. I am more patient than my husband so it didnt bother me, but the wait is very long and the area to wait for the elevator is just a small small hallway leading to the food area. It was always congested in this area.

We booked 2 double bed room for 5 nights but after checked in,we found that it is very small for family of four. we have been free upgraded to junior suite without any issue. Location- on 39th street - every thing is near by walkable distance of 5 mins. Metro, Port authority Terminal station for greyhound and Train, Hop On Off Buss Station, 42nd Street Time Square, garment and theater District.Staff is very helpful in all the way.Breakfast is normal with some hot and cold items.Evening after 4 pm they keep delicious cookies in lobby with lemonade.also free high speed internet is plus.

the rooms are quite small. the service was nice. you get a great view from your room. the breakfast is good. you also get a carry on breakfast. the hotel also provides you cookies and lemonade in a specific time. the location of the hotel is very good. it is very near to the times square. this is quite a good place to relax.
