i stayed in this hotel recently........previously they had given us small rooms...bt afta a request for a upgrade..they upgraded our room to a bigger size for free...as we wer an hilton honor memebers.........the new room was quite big.....the hotel staff is friendly.......i would recommend this hotel if u wanna stay longer in new york as prices are jst right if compared to others.....they also give free cookies between 3 to 8...wich are awsome..

We stayed here from June 22-26, overall it was a great stay. The rooms are small but typical for Manhattan. Very clean, nice bedding, shower only in our king room, which was fine with us. We were on the 26th floor and had a view of the Empire St. building one way and the Hudson River the other way! Our room was next to the elevator but we didn't hear any noise, only 6 rooms per floor. Staff was helpful whenever we had questions, good coffee, cookies in the afternoon. Breakfast was good, though I only took advantage of fruit & yogurt! Only 2 elevators and 1 was broken for 2 days of our stay, so we did have some waits for the elevator. And our in-room coffee maker was broken - we asked housekeeping 3 days for a new one, never got one. But those are my only 2 complaints and they're pretty minor. The hotel is close to the 40th St. subway, walking distance to Times Square. The street had some construction and isn't the prettiest street in the City, but again, great price for a clean room with free breakfast & wifi!! We'll come again.

I just finished staying here, and it was an OK experience. The free breakfast was nice, but not exactly an appetizing selection each morning. What I did like was that there was an infinite supply of free coffee in the lobby. One of the two elevators in the hotel was out of service, and I was on the 11th floor. It was a real pain to wait for the elevator, and the stairs were not only narrow but steep. They were an acceptable access point up until about the 15th floor. If I needed to go any higher, it was a long and tedious wait for the elevator. The rooms were alright. We had four people in one of the rooms, and were were somewhat cramped. The beds were alright, but the pillows are extremely soft, so if you need a firm pillow, I suggest bringing your own. It's a great location though. I'd give my stay a three for what we paid.

There were 9 women who were on a bowling trip to Sycracuse from Illinois and took two days to go to New York City. We stayed at the Hampton Inn in Times Square. It was super. The people at the hotel were super to us. We were going to the Today Show at 5:00 am and the chef fixed us a sack breakfast to take with us and told us he would feed us when we got back a hot breakfast. When we asked questions, there was always someone around to answer us. They aslo kept our luggage locked up after we checked out until it was time for us to leave. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. This is one hotel I would highly recommend if you are planning on staying in New York City.

Clean rooms and helpful staff. Rooms are typical size for Manhattan (read: small) but the rooms are comfortable and functional. Single complaint is that the rooms aren't very soundproof. You can hear people getting off the elevator at all hours of the day and night. The breakfasts were a pleasant surprise to the expected rock hard bagels, mushy fruit and some yogurt. Selection and quality of breakfast offerings was good. The fitness room is like the rest of the hotel: small but functional. Hotel location is walking distance to most Manhattan sights, especially Times Square, but it may be too far a walk to Central Park for some (20+ blocks North) But, several subway entries are within a couple of blocks. This hotel is never more than a couple of subway stops away from wherever you want to be...

Hello, First time in NYC so i was a bit sketchy and nervous of what to expect after reading the good and bad feedback. My sister, 17yr old niece and I stayed at the the Hampton this past June 2nd - 7th the hotel itself is just fine if your traveling without children! the hotel has 32 floors, great view of the city (some parts), the rooms are quite small with modern decor, flat screen tv. we had a double room and barely any room left to move along, comfy beds, clean linen and towels each day the restrooms were small, small showers but well kept and clean! reminded me of european hotels small rooms and bathrooms. Friendly and courteous staff, complimentary breakfast and WiFi (not many hotels offer this), don't have any major complaints, other than small rooms. Otherwise the size didn't matter that much since the entire trip we were out sight-seening so we were rarely in the hotel besides to sleep and freshen up.. The best part of the Hotel is it's location! right on the 39th St & 8th Ave. literally 10-15 min walk to Time Square and Central Park many Other Major sights, streets, restaurants, subway station and stores that can easily be reached walking. for First time travelers to NYC and not knowing what to expect this hotel made our trip just perfect! saved us money from not catching transportation all the time.. the streets are safe to walk around late at night, few minor old rusty buildings around the block other then that, that's it!!! DO Recommend!

Staff went out of their way to make us feel good. Salena was wonderful to us during breakfast.Rooms are quite small, but that is expected in a city like New York. Hotel looks like it's been recently remodeled and staff keeps it ultra clean. Did not really expect a Hampton Inn to be this nice.Chocolate chip cookies at the front desk are awesome.

My daughter and I stayed for three nights and the hotel was great. The breakfast was awesome and the staff went over and above for us in every way. When we got there it was too early to check in yet so they stored our bags for us until later in the day which was very nice so we didn't have to lug around our bags all day. They also gave us a bottled water for free to take with us as we headed out the door. When we got back they had fresh baked cookies at the desk while we checked in. The room was very clean and newly renovated and wonderful mattress. It was a bit small but was perfect for us. They helped us with taxis and bus schedules and even gave us a map and marked it especially for stores we wanted to visit. One even called the store we wanted to visit and asked what time they opened up for us!!! They gave us snack bags with water and a cereal bar and apple in them to take with us when we left in the mornings so we could have provisions before lunch for the kids.....it was great!!! I would highly recommend this hotel for the great location and cleanliness, but also for the nice attitude with which you were treated for your whole stay by everyone there....it made it a much more pleasurable trip. I would definitely stay there again!!!

Received excellent service, the staff couldn't do enough for you!.The rooms were very clean and tidy, coffee making facility was available, which is good to have when you have been walking around shopping all day!. Big TV etcThe gym looked well equipped and new, the business centre was a small room with 2 PC's and a printer in it. This was essential for us as we had to book-in online the day before we left, and were able to print off our E tickets and boarding passes to take with us to JFK.. The hotel also has Wi Fi which is excellent for anyone with an IPOD or Laptop! Reminder>>> if staying more than a couple of days you will have to get a new pin no for wifi from reception as they expire regularly. (probably for security reasons)Everything you would expect from an excellent hotel. The location was perfect, i.e. nice and quiet at night but only 5 mins walk to Times Square, Broadway or Macy'sLoved the whole experience. Only minor negative thing we noticed was the general rubbish in the street we were in and lots of scaffolding as they appear to be always building. To be fair there was scaffolding all over the city.Overall 5 out of 5 !!! The small negative did not affect our experience at all, and was more of an observation at the time.

Easy walk to Javitts conv center. Not a bad walk to Times Sqr either. Clean and typical practical Hampton free breakfast. I stayed on second floor which allows easy stairwell access to avoid the elevator waits. Was there during a heat wave and AC kept room very cool. Pass on the basement gym and head west and run along the Hudson which is very scenic at daybreak.

I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and had booked a King Room. When I got to the room, I expected the room to be slightly larger than a normal room. Instead it was a standard room with a King sized bed. I found the room to be very small indeed and the bathroom even smaller. The only way I could fit in the shower with the door closed was to stand sideways. Also with only 2 lifts servicing 32 floors, there were sometimes a very long wait for them especially if a lot of people are checking in at the same time. I guess this is a New York norm though as this was my first trip to NY. There were also two days in a row that room service hadn't made up my room. For $380 per night, I would've expected something slightly bigger.The staff were wonderful and helpful. A number of them were chatting with me while we were waiting for the lift.The hotel is in a great location though with just 10 mins walk to Times Square and 5 mins to the subway. There's also lots of great restaurants and shops nearby as well.Overall I found the hotel nice, but the rooms very small for the price.

First time I've travelled with my little girls alone and we chose NYC and chose a Hampton Inn because of it's reputation (cost effective, clean and great brand) and breakfasts! My girls are 6 & 7 and we went to do the Mary Poppins, American Girl thing. It was fantastic.... we felt safe, everyone was so helpful and all the staff went beyond the call of duty to help. And i mean beyond ... always a smile, a hello and a 'can we help you?' i will definately be back. Been at the other Hampton Inn on 35th and same - FANTASTIC. Will come again for sure !!

This hotel is fairly new and well maintained. It's in a very good location two blocks from subway station and about 3 or 4 blocks from heart of Times Square. The rooms were nice, a little small for two double beds, but it's NYC. My friends had a King room and it was fine. Service was great, anything you asked for you got quickly. They were happy to store our luggage for us on the day we left until we came back and went to airport. Breakfast was very good, (and free!) Loved the Waffles and Donuts. Don't know where those donuts came from but glad I can't get them where I live. I'd be 400 pounds in no time. Coffee was always available and decent.Elevators were slow to arrive sometimes but not excrutiatingly slow. There are only about 6 rooms per floor and 32 floors, so sometimes they have to make a lot of stops. Only knock I can say is the neighborhood is a little scary late at night. Not Freddy Kruger scary, more Monsters inc scary. Once a guy was sleeping on side walk near hotel. He didn't bother us but he was there. There was one homeless person who seems to live in a telephone booth on the corner. Again he didn't harrass us or even talk to us. Just shook his cup and muttered. I didn't feel threatened, maybe just uncomfortable. These weren't right in front of hotel but on the corner down the street on the walk from the train station. I would recommend the hotel as the staff, cleanliness and location were great. It was the cheapest room for 2 adults and two children I could find near times square. It also included free WiFi and a business center, Nice fitness equipment too. Cookies at 4pm but they don't last long.

Great location- 3 blocks south of Times square. No bed bugs, no bugs of any kind. 6 rooms on each floor, 30 floors. Elevators can be a bit slow as there were only 2 of them, but we didn't have any major issues. Rooms are small- new york small but very clean. Great breakfast from 6-10 every morning. Very family friendly. Quick & easy check in and out. Delicious cookies after 4pm- my kids loved them.

I stayed two nights at this Hampton Inn in May 2011 while in town for a conference at the Javits Center. It's a tall skinny building, with about 5 rooms per floor. The staff was excellent, check in was quick. I had asked for a high floor, to get away from the street noise, and they gave me the top floor (32). It was indeed quiet, apart from the occasional siren that you'll find in any city. The room was a bit small, but reasonable for NYC standards, and it was clean. When I discovered there were only two elevators which the cleaning staff also needs to use, I was a bit concerned, but though some have noted the slow elevator, the wait was never notably longer than any other high rise hotel. I also had no trouble finding a table at breakfast around 8:30 am either morning. The free breakfast was the same as at any Hampton (self-made waffles, breads and pastries, fruit, cereal, coffee/tea/juice, a few hot items, etc.) I easily walked to Times Square and the Javits Center, so the location was great.There were only a few minor negatives for me. The hallway where the elevators are is narrow, connecting the small lobby to the dining area, which made it hard to get on and off the elevator when people were waiting (which they generally were). It was several blocks to the nearest sit-down restaurant, and the hotel (like all Hampton Inns) doesn't offer room service and only had snack machines on a few floors. The air conditioner, controlled by thermostat, blew a strong current of cold air clear across the room--though Hampton Inn beds are always comfortable, they only provide a sheet and duvet, which meant a choice from being too hot, or sleeping in a cold draft. Finally, there was no bottled water provided in the room (again, not unusual for a Hampton Inn), but they offered complimentary water at the front desk on request. I think this is a great hotel for business travellers or anyone in town for an event at the Javits. However, the rooms would probably prove a bit cramped for a family with kids.

We stayed here for a week on our first trip to New York and could not have picked a better location or hotel. The staff really went out of their way to help us especially the front desk, even when we had a slight problem and had to change rooms, they were very efficient and it all went smoothly. We were moved to room 3005 which gave us a fantastic view with the Empire State building to the left and the Hudson River to the right. The room was more than adequate and the free WiFi really came in handy.The breakfast each morning had enough of a selection to provide something for everyone and kept you going well into the afternoon.The location, just 10 minutes or so away from Times square and with the subway connections for all lines just as near it was the perfect location.We will certainly book up here again when we return to NY for another visit.

Stayed here 2 nights ago. It was a short trip but I had a great time. I was able to check in at 10am which was unexpected. The room was large comparatively and was furnished nicely. I was in room 301 which is at the back of the hotel and quieter than the front (construction across the street). Also, the AC was ice cold. But the staff I met along the way were fantastic - very friendly and accommodating. I did also enjoy the free breakfast and there was alot of selection.

The headline really says it all. We had four quiet and comfortable nights here. The staff were very kind and helpful. The room whilst a little small was clean throughout the stay and the bed was superb with fresh linen daily. The location couldn't have been bettered for the price. We would recommend this hotel to all.

We chose Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square South hotel with all the positive reviews posted in mind. Even the negative comments did not seem that bad and the follow-up posts from the hotel management seemed like they really cared about your stay. The hotel boosts a 100% satisfaction guarantee. While reading my post keep in mind that the customer is not always right.Go ahead and pull up any travel site and you can see that there are hundreds of hotels in the Times Square area to choose from. Hopefully you will find another hotel that cares about your stay and about there hotel reputation. The Manhattan/ Times Square South Hotel WAS NOT a pleasant experience for us. The staff had no clue how to treat guests or to find solutions to problems. Strive to provide exemplary pleasant service? Not during our stay. I made our reservation six weeks prior to our arrival with the Hilton 800 number reservation center. The next day I opened our confirmation email and found that our request for a room with two queen beds was not correct. The confirmation had us for a king bed. After noticing this error, I called back the Hilton reservation center to make the correction. Hilton sent me a new email confirmation with my request for a room with two queens. You would think that with a correction made you would be all set. Not in our case! During my conversation both times with Hilton, I wrote down all the information including the room type confirmation number and room rate.We arrived for our three night stay and upon check-in we had been given a room with a king bed. I then was told that that the hotel was sold out and there were only king rooms available. I told them that our reservation was for a room with two queens. The clerk said that they only had king rooms left and would I like the room or not. I was taken by this response and told the front desk clerk of the emails with Hilton the parent company of Hampton Inn’s. I went to show him my reservation from my Blackberry and he said that showing him would not matter that THERE system showed us having a king room and that THEY had upgraded us to a king room with a view. I never asked for an upgrade to a city view or a king room. He went on to tell me that I never made the correction to the room type with the hotel directly and that the Hilton 800 number reservation system is different from there system. This still makes no sense to me. The 800 call center must have control over the hotels inventory….With two adults and two kids a king was not going to work. The clerk said that other guests behind me in line are waiting to talk to him. Was I going to take the room? I asked for the manager. Anthony the manager told me the same story that I did not make the change with the hotel and they would not honor my request. My request for a room with a king was made well over six weeks prior to check in. I had the email with me electronically. Anthony the manager did spend over 20 minutes looking at his computer and then told me that the hotel had two other hotels run by them in the area and he was now going to see if they could accommodate us. I mentioned to him that we had two other families that have already checked in that we are traveling with. He asked if either of them would take our kids for the stay or change rooms with us. I’m still appalled with this question. We ended up settling with a king bed with the hotel providing a single blow up air mattress with the promises that we would be switched to a two queen room in the morning. We headed up to our room and started to settle in. A young hotel staff member knocked on the door and handed me a bag that contained an air mattress. I inquired if the bag had sheets and a pillow. He responded by asking if we needed sheets. What was he thinking? I then called the housekeeping and asked them to make up the blow up air mattress. Don’t be surprised during your stay if you call housekeeping and they tell you that it will be at least an hour and a half for them to come to service your room. That all three hotels are sold out and they are busy taking care of other guests. Wait a minute, I’m a guest too!The next morning getting ready to head out of the hotel around 8:00 am for the day, I stopped by the front desk to see if we should bring our bags down or should we leave them in the room. I different clerk checked our file and then stated that the hotel was sold out and nothing could be done to switch us. I made mention that the manager Anthony promised to move us and he even told us to bring our bags down or to leave them packed in our current room before heading out for the day. This clerk continued to tell us that the hotel was sold out and that nothing in our file indicated that we were going to be moved. I again told her that the manager told us that he was going to move us. She stated that if any changes for guests would be noted in the computer. Nothing was noted of our change and nothing was going to be done. I again told her of the promises. She said that she doubted that anything could be down that the hotel was actually overbooked. I told her forget it that we would stay in the current room and I would talk with the manager when we returned around 3pm. I also told her that I did not what to be room less for the entire day hoping that a room would become open for us. I was thinking that what if a room did not open and we would have be a whole day paying for a room that we could not use. Why continue paying for a room that you don’t have access to during the day. Upon are arrival back to the hotel we headed back to our room. The keys did not work. We went downstairs and the clerk from last night was there. I told him that our keys did not work. He told us that the manager changed our room and that our bags and belongings needed to be moved from our old room. I told him what happened this morning and that I told the morning clerk that we would stay and not to move our things. I made mention to him that the clerk this morning could not find any notes in our file of our room change. He said that it must have been in oversight. This clerk said that our unpacked bags had not been moved that the doorman would go up and help me move our things. I went up to the room with the doorman to move our bags. The doorman used his key to open the door. Opening the door on the other side was a women getting changed! Needless to say, the clerk had no clue that our belongings had been packed up by housekeeping and moved to the new room. This clerk just got done telling us that the hotel policy is only to move packed bags and not to move a room when the guest had not packed things up by themselves. Guess what? This same clerk found an email from the manager to the housekeeping staff from 8:30 am that the manager stated that he had called me and got my permission to move my unpacked belongings to a new room. Remember nothing in our file to move us. The manager never called me. And according to this clerk our belongings were still in the old room waiting for us to pack and move are things.The doorman accompanied me to our new room. Our bags had been packed and moved to the new room. We looked around and several $2.00 bottles of NYC bought water had not been packed and moved. The cord to my cell phone and a ¾ bottle of wine was missing. Also, my 12 year old son’s library book that was left on the room desk on top of the day’s newspaper was missing. I went downstairs and asked about the book and the cell phone cord. I was told that housekeeping would look into this for me. Again, an hour and half later there was a knock at the door and it was the housekeeping supervisor asking what was missing. I told her about the book and the electric cord. She said she would check with her staff and get back to me. I asked her who moved our things. She said she did not know that usually it was one member of her staff and that each room is inspected after it is made up by her or another supervisor to ensure quality standards. The items left in the room drawers and the bath room was thrown into plastic bags and moved to our new room. Our suitcase was closed and zippered up. We felt so violated with our things being touch by someone. I DID MAKE IT CLEAR THAT WE WOULD STAY IN OUR CURRENT ROOM AND NOT TO MOVE US!We heard nothing at all from the hotel staff. I imagine the book and cord was thrown away when they cleaned the room. Just tell me that the items had been thrown away and we can move on. Telling me that the staff was going to look into this matter for us has us thinking that the hotel staff is out back searching in the garbage for our belongings.We went out and upon our return the clerk asked us how our new room was. This was the same clerk that told us that nothing was in the system in regards to our room change. I asked her if she remembered me telling her that we no longer wanted to be moved. She did remembered and told me that the manager took it upon himself to move us even after she told him that we wished to stay in our room. I asked her how the search was going for the book and cord. She looked puzzled and said that every time a guest is moved the supervisor from housekeeping and a housekeeper moves the guest’s items. This is not what the housekeeper supervisor told me.To end, I asked to speak to the manager on duty. I was told that he would call me when he returned to the front desk. No call ever came in. Upon check out I was asked by the same clerk who checked us in, told us that we have a new room and out stuff was still in the old room for us to move how our stay was. I asked if he could recall the problems we had. He said yes that the manager had left me several voice mails. I did not get one voice mail from him. I did get other voice mails but nothing from the hotel staff. Oh.. There was a note in the hotel computer to comp me one night stay. I would have settled for an apology.

We just returned from a week stay at this Hampton Inn, and we were pleased overall. Pros: Excellent location. Walking distance to many attractions and public transport. Rooms are clean. Beds are very comfortable. Free breakfast and hot drinks throughout the day. For breakfast, there is always something hot, and they rotate the menu a bit, so that helps. The mainstays are bread, bagels, English muffins, make-your-own waffles, cereals, yogurts, and sometimes fresh fruit. There are freshly baked cookies (if you get there early enough) in the evening. Free wi-fi. Free access to business center with 2 computers and a printer.Cons: Rooms are tiny. It's hard to walk around the beds. We had 2 full beds, but I think the sheets used were twins because the fitted sheet kept popping up. No bath tubs. The elevators, like everyone mentioned, are SLOW, especially in the morning. The free breakfasts are only served from 6 am - 10 am, so there is a mad rush at 9 am. Definitely not enough seating for everyone. And the "eggs" are not from chickens, so use your imagination. The Business Center is tiny, so if you're claustrophobic, you'll have a problem.

We checked into our hotel for a 5 day stay. As there are many Hampton Inn properties we were unsure where we were going to be or what o expect. As thus is our last evening in NYC I felt I had to let you all know that I HIGHLY recommend this property to you all, rooms are very clean and comfortable, breakfast is excellent though can be a battle some days. The staff are very accommodating and the free coffee/tea and hot chocolate on tap 24/7 were unexpected. Only down side to this hotel is no where to get water or keep bottled water cool in your roomThe location of the hotel is close enough to times square without being in the noise and hubbub of the crowds, took less than 5 minutes to walk to the centre of times square, 15/20 minutes walk to circle line pier for cruise and 20 minute subway ride to Brooklyn.Give it a try you won't be dissatisfied or disappointed, I wasn't and I am a self confessed hotel snob!!!!

I've stayed at numerous Hilton properties in nyc, this one was small. That is to be expected in the city, but the flow of traffic in front of elevators is way too crowded. Breakfast was just eh. The Hampton located in Times Square North was nicer and better location.

I arrived at the hotel at around 11am expecting to wait or leave bags and explore. Immediately upon arrival I was checked in very quickly. I was given a high room in the corner at the back. It was a great room and very quiet. The decor of the room was fresh and modern. The bed was a king size and was extremely comfortable. The TV was HD and was a large LCD. There was a coffee machine in the room too. The air conditioning worked very well.The breakfast area was nice and clean and the food was great. Go for the Robust coffee, it will wake you up and tastes great.There is a small business centre which has great modern PCs, a printer, stationery and a phone for local free calls.There are ice machines on most floors. There was one near my room which was really handy. It has a chilled water outlet too.The staff were great. About 30 mins after check in I received a call in the room asking if everything was OK and whether there was anything I needed. Can't beat this hotel for great service and really caring for their guests.

I'm staying here as I type this review. It's between 9am and 10am in the morning and the housekeeping staff is SO loud! They are talking loudly in the hallways and banging around in the room next to ours - literally shaking the walls. Really? I get that you have a job to do, but recognize that this is a hotel and that there are guests in these rooms.

The rooms are small but who spends a whole day there when your in new York.. The hotel is clean, the service is great, wifi is awesome. A little street noise but nothing headphones can't fix. A little wait on elevators but it didn't bother us. Street is a little suss at night but in general great location! Check in and out was fast. No dramas. Great hotel.

Hampton Inns are always reliable, and this location is no exception! Just a few blocks from Times Square and near both Times Square Station and Penn Station, it's super easy to hop on a subway and go nearly anywhere you want in NYC. Staff were friendly, and were very accommodating when I asked for a late checkout on the day we left. Breakfast was good, and actually varied a bit from day to day. It was nice to not have exactly the same items each morning. Good coffee also. Rooms are small, but it's NYC! I doubt you'll find other similarly priced hotels nearby that are any bigger. Besides, you should be out on the town, not hanging out in your room all day and night! If you're looking for a reliable mid-level hotel near times square, I'd highly recommend the Hampton Inn Times Square South - I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

We stayed here on a girls' weekend the beginning of December. I left behind three articles of clothing in the VERY small closet of my room. Upon getting to the airport, I immediately remembered and called the hotel. They ASSURED me NO ONE had checked in to my room (meaning the only ones with access to my room was housekeeping and/or an employee with a master key) and that HouseKeeping surely had my items, but they were closed for the afternoon. I left a message and then called again the next morning....only to leave another message. After leaving my THIRD message, called the front desk back and had them put someone from housekeeping on the phone. Of course, my items were no where to be found. The front desk staff tried to help, to no avail, but assured me they could handle the situation without me contacting the GM. DON'T trust that line! FOUR months later, many, many voicemails, emails, etc....the insurance company has told me that I do not have enough "proof" for a reimbursement. Please DO NOT stay here......I'm fairly sure someone on the staff is walking around in some BEAUTIFUL clothes that belongED to me!!!

This hotel is great if you are driving into the city, via the Lincoln Tunnel. Valet was right there,and there was no wait at the front desk. Was able to check in early, and they even called me to ask if the room was acceptable.....a first! Times Square is walkable. Cabs were easy to get by walking up the street. Not a ton of nicer restaurants right by the hotel. Breakfast was average at best.

Good location, decent breakfast, friendly staff, free internet. We were in a front room and had noisy neighbours and there was noise from the worksite across the hotel all night. Both things which can't be helped by the hotel. When we asked for another room we were promptly offered a quiet room at the back. We slept very well in the comfortable beds and indeed the rooms aren't very big but this is New York and for NY standards the rooms are very adequate. We'd happily stay there again! Thanks !!!

Was scared away by some of the reviews, but as always I felt it was best for me to experience it myself. We stayed for 4 days. Check in was quick and easy, we were even greeted with warm cookies. No problems any of the 4 nights we were there. Room was decently sized provided more than enough room for 2 people, but didn't spend much time in my room minus the day it rained. Room was clean upon arrival. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous Great selection for breakfast each morning, especially the waffles. In a great location on a busy street, centrally located to everything. As a Hilton Honors member, I always enjoy staying at a Hampton Inn, and this one was no exception. Will definitely stay again next year for my annual trip. The one downside we experienced which was not an individual account was the hotel only having 2 elevators for 20+ floor building

Our first time in New York and after reading some pretty bad hotel reviews wasnt sure what do expect, but we got to this hotel and it was great! The room was just the right size and the bathroom was lovely. Room was only on 2nd floor but we got no street noise as we were to the side. The included breakfast was great and there was plenty of choice, also got free wi-fi which again was great. Would definately stay in this hotel again!

Only superlatives for this hotel, and commendations for the staff. It would be too long to write or read, but if you need a hotel in a great part of Manhattan, close to Times Square - this is it!! Only 2 blocks away form the subway, and a block away from buses, spotless rooms, great (complimentary) breakfast, free internet - but the gem was the staff. Nothing was too hard and they answered every question and request positively and courteously.

Stayed here for 3 nights with friends. Location is great, a couple of blocks from Time Square and price is brilliant. Location (great) + price (great) which means that there are some compromises. The rooms are small, but if you are there to see the city, it's not a big deal. Each floor has 6 rooms, so if you are a light sleeper, ask for room not adjacent to lifts. Rooms are clean and bathrooms are very clean.Staff are wonderful, really haven't seen a hotel with more accommodating staff, from check in to late check out to organising issues.Honestly, for it's class, it's well above average. If room size isn't an issue for you, this is a great place to stay. Will definitely stay here again if on city break to NYC.

When i say small i really mean it, just a little bigger than a shoe box. There s only two elevator in the hotel so if you are in an elevated floor be ready for a very long wait to be able to reach the ground... During breakfast time it took us around ten minutes to get to the breakfast room room from the 25 th floor. the breakfast was ok and the room are overall clean execet for the bed cover which was stained, beuhhhh. The staff was always very nice and helpfull during our four days stays. One more thing that i found very annoying was the elevator bell which was loud enough to be heard from the room and waking me up...

Friend and I went up to NYC for a couple days of free TV and cheap Broadway shows, spending as little as possible. Found this Hampton Inn using Hilton points as handy to Madison Sq. Garden, where our bus came in and Times Square area. Located on 39th between 8th and 9th, it is in the middle of the Garment District. Several new, skinny hotels were built by one company and more are being constructed across the street. We were warmly welcomed on a snowy day with warm cookies and pleasant front desk. We dropped off our bags as we were early and headed out. Upon our return, retrieved bags and went to our double bed room on the front of the hotel. Small but nicely appointed room - closet near the window a bit tricky. OK for 2 overnight bags, but it is NYC. The bathroom was also small, but well done for the space and NEW, clean and functional. Not the greatest of towels, but ok. Comfortable beds without 25 pillows, which I appreciated. TV worked, coffeepot available. We were across from the vending machines, but no bother. However, our wakeup call came at the wrong time, several hours early, which was not appreciated. We approved of the 2 room breakfast rooms, with plenty of coffee with to go cups, fruits, juices, bagels, eggs (fabricated) and other foods. Happily, hot coffee and tea was available all day. Several tour groups appeared to be staying at the hotel. The two elevators worked without too much of a wait. Locationwise, it is handy to the Port Authority and Times Square. In hindsight, the other Hampton Inn up on 46th or so might have been handier, but it worked for us.

I had a bad experience at this hotel, but as someone that reads and writes a lot of TA reviews its important for me to explain that while I left early and switched hotels, this hotel is still a great bargain for NYC and way nicer than a lot of other hotels I've stayed in in the same area. People that just leave ratings of 1 because of a bad experience don't really help any other travelers out so let me try to explain.The hotel itself is one of the tall skinny ones on w 39th. There are a lot of newer hotels like the Element popping up on this street which used to be nothing but fabric shops. Its close to everything, Penn Station, Times Square, Port Authority etc. The fact that its a Hampton Inn makes it affordable, adds the free Internet and Breakfast etc etc so no problems there. I booked it because at the time because the Hilton's had big conferences at them so the rates were too high.So onto my problem. I checked in and used the bathroom (just #1) and it didn't flush...clearly clogged from the previous guests. I called, they quickly sent someone with a plunger and he plunged, tested it and we moved on. I went out enjoyed NY and came back late at night. Sure enough first time I use the bathroom it clogs again. I call again and ask them to send someone, tell them its the second time that it happened, and ask if they can leave a plunger this time (obviously if it happened a 3rd time that would be a bigger problem, but at least having a plunger helps avoid some embarassment). A guy comes, we explain its the 2nd time and that it might need more than a plunge and he should leave a plunger, but he just plunges it, tests it and leaves. This left me uncomfortable but it was late and I just went to bed. Sure enough, I wake up the next morning, use the toilet and once again it clogs. At this point I figure its the 3rd call and either I'm going to do this the whole weekend or they'll tell me they'll give me a new room which probably won't be ready at 10 a.m. so either way I'm probably going to have to pack my bags, so I decide that if any of the other hotel rates had come down I'd check in. Sure enough the Hilton New York had dropped price so I walked downstairs, explained my story and checked out early. The people at the front desk were apologetic enough and allowed me to check out early with no extra fees or anything.I guess the point of my story is that its a nice hotel, much nicer for the price than most in the area and if I hadn't gotten a room with a clogging toilet it probably would've been great, but the fact that I couldn't get it resolved in 2 calls left me impatient for a 3rd. I also just want readers to be aware that someone had a plumbing issue in case they find themselves in the same situation. It could be a building problems, or it could just be a freak problem caused by whoever stayed in my particular room before me. Either way, its newer and a good location I just had a bad stay that I made a decision to cut short out of fear of it recurring my whole trip. When I come to NYC i'm extra impatient because my schedule is so full and I don't have time to deal with these types of issues multiple times. I probably didn't give the morning staff a chance to resolve the situation fully from what happened the night before, but at the same time I consider them listening and letting me check out early resolution enough, so I'd still say this hotel is something like a 4/5 for NYC assuming my problem wasn't something a lot of people have.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was decent. Within walking distance from Time Square. I will stay here again.

Having stayed at Hampton Inns in New York, I wasn't aware of this hotel until I found it on Hilton's website. Great location, only a block and a half from a subway stop. The staff was outstanding, and made me feel welcome from the moment I arrived. Even having to leave during a snowstorm, the bellman was able to get me a cab on a weekday morning without hesitation. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Great place to stay! The size of the room and bathroom was a pleasant surprise because most hotels in NYC are tiny. We were very happy with our stay (incl: check in and out, customer service, cleanliness of room, breakfast, location, and price). We'll definitely be back!

This place rocks!! The best service I ever imagined. Even got us a limo to the airport. Meme at the front desk was the best--I have nothing but good things to say about this place--clean--good location---great breakfast bar---awesome staff--I cannot say enough--will stay there again when visiting--Sean Dixon

On relatively short notice, made plans to meet friends in NYC for the weekend. Had stayed in the Hampton Times Square North before, and stayed in South instead. Staff was very attentive, more so than I would normally expect from this type of hotel. Rooms and common areas very clean. Good selections for breakfast. Location only 5 blocks from Penn Station, very close to Times Square and Broadway - and many dining options on 9th St. a half-block away. An excellent value that makes us want to do the NYC weekend more often!

Small friendly hotel with a great breakfast (lots of variety). About a 15 minute walk to Times Square.Would advise to take full address with you as taxi driver did not know where it was and took us to the one North Times Square instead (which also looked nice!).Staff were friendly and helpful and recommended a great takeaway pizza place on the corner!Although the room was compact it was modern and clean and quiet at night.

This is NYC, the sky is the limit, but didn't come here to drop all my money on a hotel room. More than adequate for shopping and sightseeing. Hotel is compact, but the rooms are more than adequate and fresh. Nothing luxurious, including the breakfast, but a great value for a clean hotel.

Walking distance to Radio City, Times Square, shopping and subway. Breakfast is hectic and crowded, but Cosmic Diner across the street is wonderful. Staff was very helpful with any questions. Stored our luggage on arrival until check in at 3:00 so we got to shop while we waited. Room was clean and spacious for four people. Would definitely return to this hotel. Definitely see the Rocketts and after the show go to Top of the Rock for the most incredible view at night time. Worth the $21.00 any day.

The hotel stay was nice. We loved the all-day coffee bar, as it was pretty cold there. The room was a little small, but that's to be expected. The breakfast was okay, and the front desk and concierge were helpful. A bit of a warning: Do not leave any credit cards in your room. A friend did, meaning he did not use that card at all on our trip, and he miraculously had $1600 worth of in-store charges at a NY Target a few days after we left. He still has his card, so someone must have gotten his number and made a counterfeit. When he called the hotel to tell them, they didn't want to hear it.

Good location only a short walk from the major sites. The hotel staff was wonderful and very helpful. You could tell the staff loved NYC and wanted their guests to enjoy it, too. The beds were very comfortable and the free Wi-Fi was a nice plus. The free breakfast buffet was very well stocked with a number of fresh fruits, yogurts, cereal , waffles and such. A gem of a hotel in NYC.

This is our first time at this eleven story hotel, but it will not be our last. The hotel is very clean. The service is excellent (guest services left a message on our phone making sure we were satisfied with the room). There is a free breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, etc. Nice to avoid the price of at least one NYC meal each day. What really sold us was the great location. Easy walks to Times Square, sits in the middle of the Broadway Theatres, great restaurants to walk to, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Central Park, etc. We have been here three days and have not had to set foot in a taxi. Besides everything else, it is much more economical than the other major chain hotels in the same vicinity. Would highly recommend. If you have to have a bar in your hotel and a major restaurant, then this is not for you. My view is that there are plenty of those throughout NYC and did not miss (or need) at all.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel which is near Times Square, but not right in the middle of the action, which we consider perfect. Staying in the heart of Times Square can be frustrating, but this hotel is close enough the everything in mid-town is a quick walk, but it's also down a quiet (for NYC) street. We had a "king room with a view" on the 32nd and top floor, and the view was nice. We faced south and could see from the Hudson River to the Empire State Building. The room was smaller than you would find at a Hampton in a suburban or rural location, but it was reasonable enough by NYC hotel standards. The common areas are crowded and cramped, but again, not unusually so for the city. The room was spotlessly clean, as we expect from a Hampton. Only minor negative is that the computers in the business center had a habit of freezing. I assume they could some I/T TLC. The cost of the hotel is almost certainly higher than you would pay for any Hampton not on the island of Manhattan, but the cost is competitive for the location.We plan to return.

Stayed 4 nights on rewards program. First time at this location, Had stayed twice at 51st/ 8th st . The Times sq location is small rooms. Can not sit at desk and still pass behind chair and King bed. Elevators were not adequate. Two to service 32 floors at six rooms each. Had to wait for elevator Also hard to pass to the breakfast area when people waiting to enter breakfast area.in the Morning. I can not see how the NY Fire dept can allow this elevator arrangement. There was some work being done on one elevator several days. Waited 20 minutes for elevator. Have stayed at many , many Hampton Inn and this one had the most problems. The employees in the breakfast kitchen could not replenish food items quick enough. Twice when we came in from the cold I had to ask for more Hot Water to be refilled. The staff did respond when you complained but they should not have to be told. I asked for an extra hr on checkout for 1:00pm When we came back to the room from the parade the key code had beenchanged at 12PM and had to go back down to front desk to get new key code.My wife and I love Hampton's and have stayed all over the USA. I really like the Am Express rewards program for Hilton Hhonors.. All in All our experience at this location has a lot to be desired. The breakfast menu needs a lot of improvements. There weremore food choices at most locations we have stayed at for the last 7 yrs.
very good location (2 mins from TS)... rooms a little small but that's all, very clean hotel and awesome price-location ratio

This was the Hampton Inn Times Square South on 39th St in NYC. Sorry for not being more specific.  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Re.staff at Hampton Inn South Times Square Upon our departure 11/8, my granddaughter 11, realized she left her prized possession Scampi (a worn stuffed kitten) that she had since she was 3 in the room. We called the hotel, and they said they would look for it. We checked out at 10am, and it was now 3:30. We had to turn around, and after finding a place to park (no parking zone) my daughter in law went in the hotel, came out 10 minutes later, and said they have not found anything, but were still looking!!! She went back in, and 15 minutes later appeared with very smelly Scampi. They had gone through all of the laundry to find him, and he had obviously been pre treated. I can not tell you how happy our trip back home to Delaware was, if not a bit over powering with Scampi's scent. Thank your wonderful staff, who from the moment we arrived was pleasant, and helpful. They were all wonderful, from the front desk and everyone we came in contact with. Thank you!!

Stayed here one night with my mom while on a girls' getaway to the city. I've stayed here before and have always enjoyed this hotel. But I was initially disappointed at check in when they put me on a low floor of the hotel with a view of a wall and the roof top air conditioners. Also near the on-floor vending and ice-dispensing room. This, in spite of requesting a "high floor away from elevators." I attributed this to a full booking and didn't complain until I washed my hands in the bathroom sink and the sink did not drain, quickly filling with water even though the drain plug was open. Not off to a good start!To their credit, they immediately re-assigned me a new room when I called and complained. Then I was given a higher floor with a fantastic view of 8th Avenue. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. This hotel is well-located within blocks of several subway lines, Times Square, and near many great restaurants. Staff was helpful; I left an item in the first room with the clogged sink and a member of the housekeeping staff brought the item to our new room within minutes of my phone call to the front desk. Overall, good, just wish that the check-in staff had been more on the ball at first encounter.

We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or to recommend this hotel to anyone. It was a great stay. The staff was always friendly and helpful, and extremely respectful. The lobby, elevators, halls and room were always extremely clean. There was a full, hot breakfast included every morning which had two kinds of eggs, and either ham, bacon or sausage. They offered two kinds of milk, several kinds of juice, coffees and teas, plus hot or cold cereal, waffles, several types of bakery, and many kinds of fresh fruit. It was good food and there was plenty of it. Servers kept everything full. The coffee and tea were available all day.The room was the biggest surprise. It was roughly 16x23 including the 6x9 bathroom. We had a very comfortable king size bed, a closet, a desk with rolling chair, free internet, a clock and a coffee (or tea) maker, an ironing board with iron, a hair dryer, a flat panel tv above the dresser, and two side tables, and there was still room to move around. This is not your typical, teeny New York room.The elevators were fast and smooth, and in the five days we were there, twice we waited five minutes for a ride. Otherwise it was there in a couple of minutes. Several different people manned the concierge desk and all were friendly and very helpful, providing hints and ideas and city maps. The hotel has a business center, free to all, that has two computers and a printer, great for getting flight tickets printed before heading to the airport. This hotel is on West 39th, just off 8th Ave, so it was easy walking to all the sites.. We loved our time in NYC and the Hampton added to the enjoyment.

it was our first time to NYC and we were happy with the hotel, but it was definitely average. the continental left a lot to the imagination and we were dissappointed that there was only one toaster for all the guests trying to toast bread and bagels. the neighborhood felt safe and it was very convenient to Times Square, also close to the subway. It was very small, but i guess that's pretty standard for NYC. The fresh baked cookies were really good.

Awesome hotel with great FREE breakfast. The bed was very comfortable and their front desk was polite and helpful. The room is a bit small, but I think that is everywhere in NYC. The only down side is that the elevators were slow. It wasn't a big deal, but it took at about 5 minutes to get an elevator. We were on the 22nd floor so we didn't have a choice, but to wait for it. It is blocks from Times Square! We really enjoyed our stay and had no problems.

This Hampton Inn like all 3 I've stayed at this year lives up to the company's reputation of great service and cleanliness. Rooms are, of course, NYC-style small, but they're nice enough with no wasted space and enough room to walk around. There's free breakfast every morning - the full kind, not the continental type. The hotel's in a great location close to Times Square but remember, not AT Times Square as other reviewers have pointed out. It doesn't really matter because it's a short walk to Times Square and all the other things you want to see in that area. I know a lot of travelers are wary of New York at night, so I will say that the immediate area around the hotel is safe at night. Just don't venture too far west if you're not familiar with the city. I would highly recommend this place! Compliments to all the great employees!

My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights with her teenage daughter. The room was VERY clean (we checked for bed bugs before putting our luggage down)... great housekeeping and super friendly service...room was modern, clean and comfy. We were very impressed with this hotel. Breakfast was busy but well attended by the staff. Highly recommend to those traveling to NYC who want to be near Times Square...special thanks to Anthony and Evangeline for their excellent customer service!

My 2 adult daughters & I traveled to Manhattan for pleasure & theater. We stayed in one room with 2 double beds on the 6th floor. This is a rarity in Manhattan to find 2 beds for the price of one room - add the free breakfast buffet for 3 & you've got a great value. The room was small but standard for Manhattan. Immaculately clean - no problems with bedbugs at this hotel! Mimi, the guest manager, was at the reception desk at check-in & just went out of her way to please us. After check-in the front desk called our room to inquire if everything was satisfactory. Each time we went in/out of the small lobby the desk clerks made us feel welcome.The best part of this tiny lobby was the spacious breakfast bar dining area in the rear. Every time we ate there were plenty of seats in the large double rooms. The b'fast was excellent with more choices than I expected (waffle maker, etc). The free breakfast (load up!) makes it a great value for families.

We stayed here for a week and were extremely happy with our choice! We could walk to Times Square, the theatres, Rockefeller plaza and many other places within minutes! The staff was very friendly and helpful too and we could get on the subway nearby. Breakfast was great but got a little busy after 8. They also have queen size beds which was hard to find in other hotels we looked at. We would definitely stay again!

Room - the room wasn't spotlessly clean, which is kind of gross, but it didn't look dirty. Size-wise, it was an OK size. Not big, but hotel rooms never are in NYC. The bed was free of bed bugs (as far as I can tell) so I was thrilled about that. The decoration of the room is good - blonde wood and white duvet. Weirdly, the curtains didn't seem to close (or I couldn't figure out how to close them). Although there were sheers, I like it pitch dark when I sleep so I didn't like that. Also, there was no clock in the room, which is annoying. Nice LCD TV.Breakfast -- the breakfast is just fine, despite what other reviewers have said. The cereal selections are limited (there are 3 -- corn flakes, apple jacks and plain cheerios) but they had bagels and fruit and bread for toast. And croissants. I didn't try any of the hot options but was happy with the "continental" choices. I thought it was adequate, and definitely enjoyed saving $$ on breakfast!Bed -- the bed was pretty comfy, actually, but not worth saving up to buy one (as another reviewer mentioned). Ironing board - really annoying to only have the little table-top one. They should update those.Garbage in halls -- I didn't notice this problem (mentioned by other reviewers) so I think the hotel may have resolved this issue.Elevator -- I also didn't notice having to wait an excessively long time for the elevator. Yes, there are only two, but I never had to wait longer than a minute or two. I'm not sure how the Inn fixed the issue, but I'd say they have.Location -- definitely not in Times Square, although it is relatively close.The area is a little sketchy. I am a former NYCer, and I felt perfectly safe during the day, but took a cab at night. Better to be safe than sorry.Staff -- the staff were very friendly. They were great!Gym -- a decent hotel gym. Small -- 2 treadmills, one bike, one elliptical. But nice. They provided towels and small cups with a water cooler. It helped that when I used it, it wasn't crowded, so I hope it's that way for everyone else!

Great location. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The bathroom was updated and very clean. The view from our room was excellent. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Triple A discount was appreciated. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed one night here so we could go to two Broadway shows. The location is great. Quick walk to Times Square and all that has to offer. The price is high, but it's New York, after all. $55/night to park. Free internet is nice.The room was tiny, but clean. Same for the bathroom. The food was the classic Hampton Inn food - rubber eggs and cheap sausage, but if you go for the bagels, yogurt, cereal, etc., it's fine.The biggest problem and why I rated this 3 out of 5 is that the hotel only has 2 elevators...and 30-something floors (6 rooms per floor). We were on the 27th floor and when lots of people are coming or going, it takes an inordinate amount of time to catch an elevator. And there is NO service elevator. So the poor working staff have to stand in the hallways with their cleaning equipment and garbage and wait for an empty or mostly empty car. This slows everything down too, as often they don't get on because they don't want to overcrowd the elevator car...so they let the doors close without getting on, push the button again...and stop the car again soon thereafter. You get the picture. And often there are bags of garbage just left in the halls outside the elevators. Ick. Probably not much Hampton can do about this, though.So, we decided to use the stairs (yes, from the 27th floor!). We went down to the first floor in Stairs A and found the stairway BLOCKED on the botoom floor! It was blocked with the cleaning staff's multiple carts. I wonder what would have happened if there had been a fire alarm? It's possible we could have pushed the carts away, but who knows? We climbed back up to the 2nd floor and went to stairs B, which were clear to the first floor. I did report this to management. I assume it was fixed, but again, who knows?So, the lack of enough elevators and the dangerous blocked stairway make me reticent to recommend this place. The staff was very nice. It was clean, but beware. I'll recommend it, but hesitantly.

Location was convenient to theatre & restaurants; across the street from a parking garage; and offered a decent breakfast, saving time & money. The most notable thing was the bed. Most comfortable I have ever slept on. Found out Hampton Inn beds are specially made but can be ordered through the hotel. I am now saving up for one. I would stay there again just for the bed! Other comments regarding the slow elevator and cramped housekeeping work areas are true. Also have to go to other floors to get ice; but if you expect these things then you are okay, or can just not stay there if you prefer. Things I did not like: I understand small, but bathroom could use a shelf... bags of trash left in cramped hallways... and the breakfast eggs & the sausage, which both should be eliminated in my opinion. Eggs are powdered and tasteless, sausage is flat and unappetizing. Do it right or not at all. The breakfast coffee is WONDERFUL, however, and there were several selections. The rest of the breakfast is fine, with lots of variety (muffins, cereal, yogurt, fruit, bagels, and waffles.) There is a lot of seating although we seemed to go when everyone else did so had to search for a table.Staff was pleasant and professional and always were busy at work. I would definitely stay here again for the convenience & the bed, and the reasonable price for the area.

Stayed here with my boyfriend for at the beginning of June and was impressed from the moment we checked in until our reluctant check-out a week later. We arrived quite early in the day before check-in time so dropped our bags at the hotel so we could wander round the area and staff were more than happy to accomodate this - nothing was a problem for them. When we later got into our room we found it to be spotlessly clean and because the hotel is fairly new all furnishings looked modern and fresh. I also felt that there had been a lot of thought and effort put into the artwork choices as there were some fab pictures which I felt made the room seem a little less generic and bland than the usual chain hotel rooms. The bed was very spacious and comfortable and due to the fact that our room was at the back of the hotel there seemed to be absolutely no traffic noise which we both found to be quite amazing considering the decibel levels of honking horns and various sirens you can hear when you're outside. The hotel itself is on a fairly quiet part of W39th street anyway though so I'm sure even at the front noise level would be low. Room size was small but we were perfectly comfortable and I'm sure you would struggle to find anything bigger in a central NYC location. The free wireless was extremely useful also as it allowed us to check out restaurant reviews, opening times, directions etc on our laptop before heading out for the day. The bathroom was also clean and modern with a spacious shower with fairly decent water pressure and plenty of fresh towels which were replaced daily. The small footprint size of the hotel means that there are only six rooms per floor so there was very little noise from other guests going to and from their rooms and we heard nothing from the neighbouring rooms in terms of voices or TV noise. Breakfast in the morning was a huge bonus as we saved so much money by not having to eat out and there always seemed to be a generous selection with cereals, toast, fruit and a couple of choices of hot food, waffles etc. The complimentary tea/coffee provided in the lobby throughout the day was also a great extra as a quick cup was really appreciated after a busy day of sightseeing before heading out for dinner. The location was good, just a five minute walk to the nearest subway and a few extra minutes onwards to Times Square. W39th is in the heart of the garment district so most buildings along the street are fabric stores so at night it did look a tad rundown although we never felt uneasy. We did find the lift problem mentioned in other reviews a bit of a hassle as there was generally quite a long wait but as we were on the 6th floor, we could easily take the stairs - however if you were much higher I could see this becoming a problem. When we wanted to check out with our heavy bags we had to wait about 20 minutes for a lift empty enough to sqeeze in but there is nothing hotel staff can do about it so this is really a minor niggle. Overall we were extremely satisfyed with our stay in terms of value, cleanliness, service and most of all exceptional sleep quality and would absolutely recommend this hotel to others - hopefully we will be lucky enough to return ourselves!

Paid $200/night for a musty smelling 10' x 10' room (seriously) with a toilet that didn't flush and a broken bathroom door lock. At least the staff was friendly while logging all the problems. Oh, and Times Square South isn't anywhere near Times Square.

I travelled with 3 other adults who had not been to NYC before, so I was anxious to find a hotel that was in a good location, was clean, and not loud at night. This was definately it! All four of us were so pleased with everthing. First, absolutely everyone on staff was amazing! It was easily the friendliest bunch of hotel staff that I have ever seen. Various staff members were always asking if everything was Ok with our stay, and seemed to be concerned with our well-being. Second, the complimentary breakfast each morning was a welcome change to all of the takeout that we were eating, and a good alternative for people who want to get a quick start to their day. Third, the complimentary tea/coffee, cookies and lemonade were a wonderful refresher in the afternoon. Finally, the room itself was very modern, and very clean. Of course, it is a Manhattan hotel, so it was small, but this was certainly to be expected! It was a slightly crowded room for four adults, but, if we were staying in pairs, there would be more than enough space! Whenever we needed anything extra in the room, we called the front desk, and there was someone up within a few minutes to help us out with our requests. I have noticed reviews in the past that comment on the lack of elevators, yet we did not find this to be a problem - in fact, I have had to wait for elevators much longer in hotel that have six of them! Thanks to the staff of Hampton Inn Times Square South for making this such a wonderful stay! We would most certainly come back and stay again!!

Enough can't be said about the wonderful and energetic staff at the front desk. They tried to please, and tried to solve any problem(room had a musty/mildew odor that Fabreeze could not mask). Weekdays were no problem with the elevators, but given the sunday morning rush to check out, waiting for a ride to the lobby proved to be more than a 20 minute challenge. Wish the room had not had the odor,it wold have made this review a 4 star rating.

had a brilliant stay in this hotel, rooms although small still had plenty of room for me and three friends that i travelled with, comfy beds and clean bathroom were all we were asking for and got so much more by staying here! Check in staff on arrival were friendly and helpful, we arrived slightly early and the room wasn't quite ready so they offered us to store our luggage so we could go and grab a coffee and something to eat. Very easy to book transport back to the airport too and again were able to store our luggage until it was time to leave as had an evening flight.Breafast was lovely and had a wide selection to choose from both hot and cold. Location was very central and close to many of the attractions and places we wanted see like the empire state building, macys and times square. Also in walking distance was a good selection of restaurants and the theatre we had a show booked at.If i'm lucky enough to go back to new york i would look to stay here again before looking at any other hotels!!

Perfect hotel for a short stay in NY with most interesting places and/or connections within walking distance (We even went on foot with our luggage to Penn Station, would have taken us longer with a cab... an experience on it's own). Rooms aren't that big, but very clean and very good beds. Noisy airco (tip : leave it on all day, shut it down at night). Mostly recommended : very good breakfast with choice of everything to keep you going until late afternoon ! And if you have a problem : very friendly staff to help you out. Also the only hotel on our East Coast tour with free internet. Only one minor thing : try to stay away from the elevator(s) around checkout time... traffic is almost as heavy as on Broadway ;-) . We will definitely recommend this hotel to other people and the agency that booked our trip(s).

Booked this hotel through New York New York Tours and having now been there and experienced it, this is the only hotel i will go back to when the time comes. The location was better than fantastic, the staff were always happy which made the NY environment even better. The breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day. The Hampton Inn is right in the Theater District. can't say enough as I went from being a skeptic about this whole trip to being a raving fan of everything NYC offered. After a busy day, to come "home" to the comforts of the Hampton Inn was almost like coming home. Thanks for the outstanding EVERYTHING!

This hotel was a great stay for the price. The lobby was clean & well kept, the staff was very friendly & helpful. When I arrived I was able to store my bags until check-in. Free breakfast was a great way to start the day. I am planning to return to the city in 3 weeks & would love to stay here however the rate sky rockets in August. I'm upset I have to find another hotel. Otherwise it was a great stay.

We arrived via Port Authority and were pleased to find the hotel one block south of the station. Well situated in the Garment District. Convenient walk to Times Square attractions and most of the midtown touristy stuff.I've never stayed in a tri-branded hotel before. What you get here is a 32 story hotel split up into 3 different hotels, the Hampton, a Holiday Inn Express and a Candlewood Suites. Each segment has its own interior design and lobbies, breakfast rooms, etc. Brand new and fresh looking, but I think the building is a few years old. The cramming in of 3 hotels makes for some VERY compact spaces. The hotel room floors have only 6 rooms on each, which was weird as the entire floor felt smaller than my house, but cool in that our room was literally four steps away from the elevators, and going to the ice machine (with a water button!) was like running to the fridge from my living room when I'm home.Now, the room we had up on a mid-20s floor was ultra-compact. I measured it to be approx. 200 sq. ft. It felt quite small, but everything was there and in new-ish condition. Hampton added some nice touches like a bud vase with faux-flower in it on the desk, and TV with HD channels (which made watching the World Cup especially good). The bathroom was tight and useful vanity space was limited. There was only a shower unit in the room (fine by us) and it was decent, except for being quite narrow to the point that an average sized person WILL bang his/her elbow on the wall at least once during your shower.We had a good view of midtown south, featuring the Hudson River, NJ and the Empire State Building. I thought that was very cool. The staff was awesome. Super friendly and playful even...a young bunch of professionals that seem to really enjoy their jobs. It was fun interacting with them.Breakfast was good with a wide selection of quick foods.The title of my review....Not an inch of space is wasted here...can refer to an experience I had on the lower level of the hotel. The level below the lobby features a weight/exercise room, public unisex restroom and a couple of vending machines. That same tiny footprint of the hotel room floors comes into play here as this compact area also is home to the laundry facility, staff rooms and various other hotel functions. Waiting for the elevator to take me back up to the lobby, I shared the tight hallway with two large laundry carts, a housekeeping employee and maintenance worker moving back and forth around the carts, and although I'm not a claustrophobic person, I felt uncomfortable and in the way. The employees were friendly and had a smile, but I couldn't help thinking it is a pain in the butt for them to try to do their jobs literally inches from the general public spaces. Just seemed weirdly intrusive.Oh well, I guess that's life in New York. The Comfort Inn down the block was equally as slim and tight, so I'm sure that's not as unusual as it seemed to me.

We stayed here for 2 weeks after getting a great deal on priceline. Given the price we paid for such a good location in Manhattan (short walk to subways, moderate walk to times square) I'd have pretty much been delighted with a broom closet. That the hotel was pleasant, light and clean was a huge bonus.Breakfast was fairly standard, but a welcome addition nonetheless, and had a "takeaway" option. Free internet was handy. There is no business centre for printing stuff out, but you are allowed to pop into the hotel next door for that.We walked everywhere and found the walk to theatres and the zillions of nearby restaurants very easy. We also walked down to Chelsea which is quite nice, although takes a bit longer. Otherwise, the subway awaits to whisk you anywhere you like and is a short walk. No idea about parking, but you'd have to be barking mad to drive in NYC anyway.The room was smallish, but that was fully expected in such a good NYC location. It was very clean, modern and comfortable, no complaints at all in the two week stay. Considering my only other hotel options remotely in the pricerange I paid were shared bathrooms or way out of the way, this was tremendous value, and if I could get the room for the same price again, I'd stay here in a flash.

This hotel is not geared for people on holiday but more for business people looking for a short stopover in new york. There is no bar area or lounge to relax in or restaurant. Nothing to keep children amused. The room we stayed in was very small although the shower room was adequate but no bath to soak in after a day walking the streets of New York. There is a breakfast room and a hot breakfast was provided but it is eaten using paper plates and cups and plastic cutlery! This hotel boasts that it is part of the Hilton family. I think it must be the black sheep of the family. On the plus side I must say that the hotel staff were excellent and most courteous. Nothing was a problem to them and were most helpful.

Visited NYC Memorial Day Weekend 5/2010 - stayed at the West 39th Street Hampton Inn - I began to wonder if there is a tier system in the Hampton Inn chain - were some Hampton Inns "better" than others because this one was a disappointment - it was just OK but I would not go there again - The Hampton Inn on 8th Ave & 51st St. is much nicer.

The location was good - everything was clean and the staff was friendly. There were 4 of us with 2 beds - the room was extremely small (which I guess is standard for NYC). Breakfast was good. The elevators were an issue and there was all kinds of housekeeping items in the stairwells. Restaurant across the street - Mercato - was really great.

great hotel great location for ny city.rooms comfortable and clean.hotel staff very friendly and obliging.good choice for breakfast free wifi.free safe.free extension on the room.free gym on the basement.couldnt fault anything would recomend this hotel to any one.would stay here again

I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay within walking distance to Times Square. It is a quick 4 block walk to Penn Station or Times Square. The hotel staff was exceptional and the hot/cold breakfast each morning was delicious. There is reasonable parking across the street from the hotel without having to valet park. The rooms were a good size for the city, clean, updated, and the bed was very comfortable. I will be staying here in the future for my NYC trips.

The hotel is centrally located on 39th Street W.-For those visiting NYC for leisure everything is at your fingertips-you are about 5 minutes from Times Square and 10 minutes from R. Center. The rooms are small-and tight but typical size for NYC. I was surprised that there was no fridge in the room.The staff at the breakfast nook were quite helpful-I needed my own breakfast to be heated each morning and they were more than willing to do this. There is a coffee/tea bar set up all day.However it is the little things that kept me from giving this hotel a very good. The hotel only has two elevators. It is ridiculous that in the morning hours when people are having breakfast/leaving housekeeping is using the elevators. Waits for the elevator could be quite long-I have no patience and chose to take the stairs most mornings. Even during the off hours you needed to wait for the elevator. When my colleague was leaving she waited 30 minutes for an empty elevator and in fear of missing her flight dragged her luggage down the stairs. Having used the stairs I was not impressed that I needed to step over housekeepings garbage bags in the stairwell.One of my biggest peeves with hotels are missing amenities that should be checked on by housekeeping. Do not leave me with 1/4 roll of toilet paper and an almost empty kleenex box-Not impressed to be using the bathroom only to realize there is no more tp. Also, replace my cups daily-there is a reason I am using them. I do not feel like walking downstairs to get more cups. The room had a coffee maker-but no glass container for the water to drip into. Once again, not as important as the tp-but when I wake up and want to make coffee/tea I expect to be able to. These are the little things that housekeeping should be checking on and replacing.My colleague and I extended our trip-she booked part of it and I booked the latter part. I contacted the hotel a month in advance to ensure we could stay in the same room. Likewise I confirmed this when I checked in. Shocking the night before the rsvp changed from hers to mine I was told we would have to move. To pack up a hotel room just to switch is quite annoying and more important time consuming.The concierge service is not that great-they gave me the wrong address for Bloomingdales and could not answer basic questions about popular events in NY.The public restroom is in the basement away from the breakfast nook. Would I stay here again-for the location yes. The hotel was clean and convenient. Someone mentioned the shower head being high-that is an understatement it was almost too high for me to adjust.I am not sure what is going on with the suggestions on the taxi service. I was told the hotel could not call a taxi for me only a private car.

We went for a short NYC vacation and chose this hotel due to the price and proximity to Times Square. The value for the price was excellent. The complimentary breakfast was adequate and a nice perk to help start our days. The room was small but clean and very adequate, particularly since we went to NYC to experience the city and not necessarily the hotel. The only real drawback was that the hot water in the shower wasn't consistent. The customer service was very good. While the hotel isn't right on Times Square, it's just off the beaten path and within very reasonable walking distance. The proximity to the subway was great too. We would stay here again as it was a great value.
